Meat was usually reserved for special occasions like Hearth\xe2\x80\x99s Warming Eve, and the rest of the time the ponies of Equestria made due with enhanced fruits and vegetables.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0It took Twilight a few moments to realize that she was no longer just watching the Princess work. Time and again Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were drawn to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s seemingly natural beauty. Princess Luna was only a stretch or two taller than Twilight, but the Princess still had legs that gave the impression of being miles long. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s backside was so smooth, rippling and coiling as the ruler of Equestria moved about. And her wings! They fanned the air gently every now and then as Luna stirred and mixed, full of downy tenderness and strong energy. \xc2\xa0Twilight felt her cheeks heat furiously and quickly averted her eyes, scolding herself for ogling the Princess so! Thankfully, by the time Princess Luna turned bearing a tray of food in her obsidian magic, Twilight had managed to wrest her blush under control. And her wandering eyes.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna plunked down a turkey and sunflower sandwich in front of her new student and set the salad aside for the moment. She gestured to the food. \xe2\x80\x9cEat, Twilight. I find it easier to learn new things on a full stomach.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Hesitating slightly (she was still in the presence of <i>the</i> Princess!) Twilight took a nibble from her sandwich. She immediately began eating with gusto, moaning slightly. It had been far too long since she had been able to have any meat at all. Princess Luna grinned, clearly pleased.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight swallowed. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, Princess\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d came the swift correction, and Twilight smiled slightly.</p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0</p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried again. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy exactly are you going to teach me about all ten branches of magic?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Princess Luna actually arched an eyebrow. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you not wish to learn more about magic?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was quick to assure her mentor. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course I do, Princess. But no other mage would accept an apprentice who wanted to study a branch of magic outside what they taught.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Princess Luna frowned briefly at the renewed use of her title before she spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cI am also no mere mage, Twilight Sparkle. You have not escaped my notice, living in the palace. I\xe2\x80\x99ve seen you diving into your studies, determined to learn everything you could about magic in general. Most other students are simply content to follow one path. Even from an early age, however, you were seeking knowledge on as many branches of magic as you could. Some magic, you discovered, are not exactly talked about in any depth in any of the books you\xe2\x80\x99ve studied. Friendship and Animosity are examples of this, as those two do not always manifest in the clearest ways possible. Others, like Necromancy, are not talked about at all, merely glossed over with a hurried explanation. Yet no matter what you managed to read, no book at the Canterlot Archives actually taught you the proper techniques for magic, did they?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight took another bite of her sandwich before answering. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. What little I do know about magic I taught myself. It was enough that I could impress any Master I wanted. But that plan didn\xe2\x80\x99t go over well. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t see a single mage at the time of my Choosing.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cBecause I warned them to stay away, Twilight,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna spoke gently. \xe2\x80\x9cI told them, under no circumstances, were any Mage to appear at your Choosing. I had chosen you to be my next prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9e long before any of those fools had their eyes on you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight looked up at this revelation, eyes wide. \xe2\x80\x9cBut why, Princess? I am naught but a curious unicorn filly who loves to read. What if I don\xe2\x80\x99t live up to your expectations?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Princess Luna chuckled a tiny bit, finally understanding what was eating away at her new student. \xe2\x80\x9cI chose you because I can see your potential, Twilight Sparkle. And I shall leave it at that. But know this: If you do not live up to my expectations, then I will keep trying until you get it right. I know you will always put forth your best effort, but not every pony can just automatically be good at everything. I want to help guide you upon your journey, and I cannot do that if I abandon you over a small mistake. Now, come. I see that you have finished your lunch, as have I. I\xe2\x80\x99ve got some books I\xe2\x80\x99d like you to read a few passages from. After that, I believe I can find some other stuff for you to work on.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna stood up, clearing the small table with a pulse from her horn. In the same pulse, she levitated two thick tomes over to Twilight. Tilting her head sideways, Twilight read the titles: <i>Military Equestria</i> and <i>Basic Guide to Magic</i>.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cThese two books will become your primary sources of information for the time being. A good deal of your initial studies will revolve around these two. I\xe2\x80\x99ve already marked the pages I would like you to read from. Start with <i>Military Equestria</i> and go from there. I must take care of a small bit of business, and then I will return.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0With that, Princess Luna was gone. Frowning a bit at her teacher\xe2\x80\x99s sudden disappearance, Twilight cracked open the first book she had been told to read. The unicorn rifled through the pages until she found the pages marked by a magical bookmark and began to read.</p><p class="double"><center><u><b>Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s Military Forces.</b></u></center></p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<center><i><b> Equestrian Rangers</b> \xe2\x80\x93The Rangers very rarely fight off of Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s soil. This branch of the military acts as a \xe2\x80\x9cnational guard\xe2\x80\x9d of sorts, mobilizing in the event Equestria becomes invaded. In times of relative peace, the Rangers comprise about sixty percent of Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s food sources, farming land in addition to performing regular military exercises. If Equestria is ever besieged, only forty percent of the Ranger\xe2\x80\x99s full might are ever engaged at one time, allowing the nation to continue to produce enough food to withstand an invasion that may last years.</i></p><p></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0That was certainly interesting. Twilight had known that Equestrian Rangers were designed to protect the Crown, but she had no idea that their deployment was so intricate. With a good portion of the Rangers still helping produce food, Equestria would prove to be a difficult nation to take by direct force. Twilight read on.</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<center><i><b> The Wonderbolts</b> \xe2\x80\x93\xe2\x80\x9cFaster, Swifter, Stronger\xe2\x80\x9d is the motto of the Wonderbolts, and it is a motto they strive to uphold each and every night. The Bolts are hands down the best aerial force Sol has ever seen, the first deployed to an engagement and the last to leave. Ancient pegasi magic combined with aerial moves introduced by the iconic Commander Hurricane has given the Bolts a reputation well deserved. Undying loyalty to the Crown they serve and to each other leaves the Wonderbolts as Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s oldest military force.</i></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0So <i>that</i> was what Rainbow Dash was getting herself into. It sounded like the Wonderbolts strived to be the very best, all the time. It seemed rather unrealistic to Twilight, and the studious mare wondered if Dash would be up to the challenge.</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<center><i><b> Medic Corps</b> \xe2\x80\x93The Medic Corps have been around as long as the Wonderbolts. Comprised of animal Whisperers and the best doctors Equestria can provide, the Corps is the singular force that keeps Equestria breathing. From combating sickness in Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s many cities and towns, to practicing their art upon the field of battle, the Corps provide the muscle behind recovery.</i></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Well, that certainly sounded right up Fluttershy\xe2\x80\x99s alley, if she could get over her intense shyness. Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t know any other pony that would care so much for a complete stranger.</p><p class="indented double"><center><i><b> Canterlot Guard </b>--The Canterlot Guard is one of the last lines of defense for the Equestrian Crown. They mainly police the palace and the grounds itself, although it has been known for Canterlot Guards to sign contracts with other nobility.</i></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0That was what Shining Armor was, a Canterlot Guard. Nothing made her brother happier than to be defending the Princess.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0</p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<center><i><b> Equestrian Intelligence </b> \xe2\x80\x93EI knows everything. A vast spy network comprised of undercover agents everywhere, Equestrian Intelligence ensures the nation they serve is prepared for anything. Every major plan, every notable event usually revolves around an EI combat agent. They operate from the shadows, usually shaping Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s future more than any other military force.</i></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Equestrian Intelligence had Pinkie Pie written all over it. That pony knew things about other ponies she had no business knowing about. It didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter if it was a thought never spoken aloud. Pinkie Pie would still know about it.</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<center><i><b> Arcane Brigade</b> \xe2\x80\x93If there is one thing the enemies of Equestria fear, it is Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Arcane Brigade. Comprised of the most deadly spell casters ever born, the Brigade only enters a conflict when the need is dire. The Brigade guards their magical secrets jealously, ensuring that enemies know next to nothing about them. The Brigade is also responsible for Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s advancements with magic.</i></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The Arcane Brigade. The name sent pleasing shivers down Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s spine. She had always dreamed that she would have a chance to join the Brigade, after learning all she could from a Master Mage. The Brigade solved <i>everything</i>, and Twilight would love nothing more than to be that part of Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s forces. Perhaps Luna would allow her to join the Brigade after Twilight completed her training.</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<center><i><b> The Valkyrie</b> \xe2\x80\x93If the Arcane Brigade brings fear to Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s enemies, then Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Valkyrie brings unbridled terror. Throughout Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s history, the Valkyrie has been a mare every bit as powerful as Princess Luna herself. Records show that victory is guaranteed when the Valkyrie takes to the battlefield. Mastering every branch of magic known to Sol, the Valkyrie is Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s right hoof, meting out justice where she sees fit. The other branches of military also directly answer to the Valkyrie, rather than Princess Luna. </i></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<i>This </i> was a name that brought back foalhood memories. Everypony knew who the Valkyrie had been. Respected, feared, and loved as much as the Princess herself, the last Valkyrie vanished sometime during the giant War almost a thousand years ago. To the best of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s knowledge, there has not been one since.</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<center><i><b> Princess Luna </b> \xe2\x80\x93There has only been one instance where the Princess of Equestria has entered combat personally. This was back during the War of the Sun and Moon decades ago, when the usurper Corona Flare attempted to claim the throne of Equestria. The details of this war are vague at best, but it is a testament of Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s prowess that Corona Flare is no more.</i></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight remembered reading vague details about this war. All anypony remembered was that Corona Flare attempted to usurp Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s position, to bring about never-ending day. After a vicious war, Princess Luna emerged victorious, and supposedly banished Flare into the Sun. At the time, Twilight had thought the tale was simply something to entertain young foals. After seeing Princess Luna up close, and <i>feeling </i> her majestic power, Twilight was starting to think that perhaps there was a grain of truth to this story. With a thoughtful expression, Twilight opened the second text.</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<b><u><center>Magical Basics</center></u></b></p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<center><i>Magic is a part of everything. From the visible and flashy magic of unicorns and other casters, to the more subtle passive magic of ground and fliers, magic is everywhere. Over the years, magic has branched out into ten different categories, each with their own counterpart. They are as follows:</i></p><p></center></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0</p><p><center><img src="//fc05.deviantart.net/fs71/f/2013/163/4/d/untitled_by_songsaga-d68q0e7.png" class="user_image" /></center></p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0<i><center>There have been numerous disputes when categorizing magic as we know it. For example, a good many scholars and mages feel that Light and Night should be their own counterparts and that a new Accord Magic should be created for Destruction. However, this idea is not entirely sound and has been thus far ignored; Light magic focuses on strength, courage, and </i> creating<i> new things, while Destruction does the exact opposite.</i></center></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight knew all of this already. But Princess Luna undoubtedly had some reason to bring this to the forefront of the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s mind. Twilight was interrupted from her thoughts by the reappearance of Luna, who had a strange gleam in her eye.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cGood, you are finished reading! Now, let us set you up with some chores.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cChores?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight echoed, confused. This was not what she had expected when Luna had said there she was going to teach Twilight magic.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cYes, chores. Take a look around, Twilight. Are there any servants here?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cNo, Princess.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was confusion layered her voice, but she did have a small inkling of where this was going.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cOf course there is not! Servants rarely ever approach my study and its hallway; it is the one place they are forbidden from!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0This made sense. Twilight had noticed a distinct lack of servants on her walk here, despite the haze over her mind at the time. \xe2\x80\x9cSo then I am going to perform the cleaning they are unable to do?\xe2\x80\x9d Try as she might, Twilight could not hide the disappointment coloring her words.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna finally had mercy on her student. \xe2\x80\x9cRelax, Twilight. You are not in trouble. This is my way of gauging your magical aptitude. I don\xe2\x80\x99t want you to do anything overly fancy to accomplish what I ask of you. All you should need to do is some levitation and a few other minor spells. I want to test your control and see how you go about completing everynight tasks. Firstly, I would like you to clean up after our lunch. After that, the fireplace needs cleaning out and the mantle dusted. The rugs need to be dirt free. Then you can start on my bookshelves. Dust them and clean them. Make sure my books are all categorized. Once you are finished, then I can get a better idea of where to start you in your training.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight perked up a bit. Housework was nothing new to her, despite being of noble birth; growing up in the palace instead of a foster home meant she had to clean her own room on numerous occasions. The fact that the Princess wanted Twilight use magic made the work more bearable. Humming a faint tune, Twilight got started. Horn shimmering with a low key magenta glow, she attacked the stuff left over from lunch. A single horn wave removed leftover foodstuffs from utensils and surfaces, and then a further wave sent the implements sailing back to their proper place in the kitchenette. At the same time the purple unicorn attacked the fireplace, Vanishing the ash left over from its last use and whitening the bricks a bit. She then produced a small duster and proceeded to buff the mantle. By that time she had finished the lunch mess and moved onto the books and bookshelves.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Princess Luna watched her student with interest. She was using and maintaining spells constantly, without conscious effort. Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn didn\xe2\x80\x99t even shine any brighter than it had at first, signaling a record low power usage despite all the magic the unicorn was using. It was starting to look like taking Twilight as her personal prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9 was a very good decision. As Luna watched her student, her eyes started to wander. Twilight was young, certainly, but no less an appealing mare. Her legs were sturdy and strong, a testimony to an active pony despite Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s love for books. The fact that Twilight was not some fat, lazy scholar was a very good thing, in Luna\xe2\x80\x99s book. While Twilight was nowhere near as glossy and graceful as Luna, there was a certain symphony about her movements, as the unicorn turned slightly to keep an eye on her spells. And besides, gracefulness would come in time. All in all, she was confident that she had chosen well. Twilight would make a good Valkyrie.</p><p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0</p><p class="double"></p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 104188], 'parent_story_id': 104188, 'txt': '//------------------------------//\n// Chapter 3// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\tTwilight watched in slight fascination as Luna went about the task of preparing a simple meal. At first, Twilight had wanted to question why on Equestria Princess Luna had a small kitchenette in her study of all places. Then Twilight reminded herself that Luna was a Princess, and therefore could have a kitchen anywhere she chose to. After that, Twilight became distracted just watching Luna. The Alicorn moved about the appliances with gentle grace, never once hurrying as she chopped some greens for a simple salad and sliced some fresh turkey meat for sandwiches. The latter was what Twilight was really looking forward to; Meat was quite rare in Equestria, as they could never grow it fast enough to feed an entire nation. Meat was usually reserved for special occasions like Hearth\xe2\x80\x99s Warming Eve, and the rest of the time the ponies of Equestria made due with enhanced fruits and vegetables.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0It took Twilight a few moments to realize that she was no longer just watching the Princess work. Time and again Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were drawn to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s seemingly natural beauty. Princess Luna was only a stretch or two taller than Twilight, but the Princess still had legs that gave the impression of being miles long. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s backside was so smooth, rippling and coiling as the ruler of Equestria moved about. And her wings! They fanned the air gently every now and then as Luna stirred and mixed, full of downy tenderness and strong energy. \xc2\xa0Twilight felt her cheeks heat furiously and quickly averted her eyes, scolding herself for ogling the Princess so! Thankfully, by the time Princess Luna turned bearing a tray of food in her obsidian magic, Twilight had managed to wrest her blush under control. And her wandering eyes.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna plunked down a turkey and sunflower sandwich in front of her new student and set the salad aside for the moment. She gestured to the food. \xe2\x80\x9cEat, Twilight. I find it easier to learn new things on a full stomach.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Hesitating slightly (she was still in the presence of the Princess!) Twilight took a nibble from her sandwich. She immediately began eating with gusto, moaning slightly. It had been far too long since she had been able to have any meat at all. Princess Luna grinned, clearly pleased.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight swallowed. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, Princess\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d came the swift correction, and Twilight smiled slightly.\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried again. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy exactly are you going to teach me about all ten branches of magic?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Princess Luna actually arched an eyebrow. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you not wish to learn more about magic?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was quick to assure her mentor. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course I do, Princess. But no other mage would accept an apprentice who wanted to study a branch of magic outside what they taught.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Princess Luna frowned briefly at the renewed use of her title before she spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cI am also no mere mage, Twilight Sparkle. You have not escaped my notice, living in the palace. I\xe2\x80\x99ve seen you diving into your studies, determined to learn everything you could about magic in general. Most other students are simply content to follow one path. Even from an early age, however, you were seeking knowledge on as many branches of magic as you could. Some magic, you discovered, are not exactly talked about in any depth in any of the books you\xe2\x80\x99ve studied. Friendship and Animosity are examples of this, as those two do not always manifest in the clearest ways possible. Others, like Necromancy, are not talked about at all, merely glossed over with a hurried explanation. Yet no matter what you managed to read, no book at the Canterlot Archives actually taught you the proper techniques for magic, did they?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight took another bite of her sandwich before answering. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. What little I do know about magic I taught myself. It was enough that I could impress any Master I wanted. But that plan didn\xe2\x80\x99t go over well. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t see a single mage at the time of my Choosing.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cBecause I warned them to stay away, Twilight,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna spoke gently. \xe2\x80\x9cI told them, under no circumstances, were any Mage to appear at your Choosing. I had chosen you to be my next prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9e long before any of those fools had their eyes on you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight looked up at this revelation, eyes wide. \xe2\x80\x9cBut why, Princess? I am naught but a curious unicorn filly who loves to read. What if I don\xe2\x80\x99t live up to your expectations?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Princess Luna chuckled a tiny bit, finally understanding what was eating away at her new student. \xe2\x80\x9cI chose you because I can see your potential, Twilight Sparkle. And I shall leave it at that. But know this: If you do not live up to my expectations, then I will keep trying until you get it right. I know you will always put forth your best effort, but not every pony can just automatically be good at everything. I want to help guide you upon your journey, and I cannot do that if I abandon you over a small mistake. Now, come. I see that you have finished your lunch, as have I. I\xe2\x80\x99ve got some books I\xe2\x80\x99d like you to read a few passages from. After that, I believe I can find some other stuff for you to work on.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna stood up, clearing the small table with a pulse from her horn. In the same pulse, she levitated two thick tomes over to Twilight. Tilting her head sideways, Twilight read the titles: Military Equestria and Basic Guide to Magic.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cThese two books will become your primary sources of information for the time being. A good deal of your initial studies will revolve around these two. I\xe2\x80\x99ve already marked the pages I would like you to read from. Start with Military Equestria and go from there. I must take care of a small bit of business, and then I will return.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0With that, Princess Luna was gone. Frowning a bit at her teacher\xe2\x80\x99s sudden disappearance, Twilight cracked open the first book she had been told to read. The unicorn rifled through the pages until she found the pages marked by a magical bookmark and began to read.\r\n\r\nEquestria\xe2\x80\x99s Military Forces.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Equestrian Rangers \xe2\x80\x93The Rangers very rarely fight off of Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s soil. This branch of the military acts as a \xe2\x80\x9cnational guard\xe2\x80\x9d of sorts, mobilizing in the event Equestria becomes invaded. In times of relative peace, the Rangers comprise about sixty percent of Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s food sources, farming land in addition to performing regular military exercises. If Equestria is ever besieged, only forty percent of the Ranger\xe2\x80\x99s full might are ever engaged at one time, allowing the nation to continue to produce enough food to withstand an invasion that may last years.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0That was certainly interesting. Twilight had known that Equestrian Rangers were designed to protect the Crown, but she had no idea that their deployment was so intricate. With a good portion of the Rangers still helping produce food, Equestria would prove to be a difficult nation to take by direct force. Twilight read on.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 The Wonderbolts \xe2\x80\x93\xe2\x80\x9cFaster, Swifter, Stronger\xe2\x80\x9d is the motto of the Wonderbolts, and it is a motto they strive to uphold each and every night. The Bolts are hands down the best aerial force Sol has ever seen, the first deployed to an engagement and the last to leave. Ancient pegasi magic combined with aerial moves introduced by the iconic Commander Hurricane has given the Bolts a reputation well deserved. Undying loyalty to the Crown they serve and to each other leaves the Wonderbolts as Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s oldest military force.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0So that was what Rainbow Dash was getting herself into. It sounded like the Wonderbolts strived to be the very best, all the time. It seemed rather unrealistic to Twilight, and the studious mare wondered if Dash would be up to the challenge.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Medic Corps \xe2\x80\x93The Medic Corps have been around as long as the Wonderbolts. Comprised of animal Whisperers and the best doctors Equestria can provide, the Corps is the singular force that keeps Equestria breathing. From combating sickness in Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s many cities and towns, to practicing their art upon the field of battle, the Corps provide the muscle behind recovery.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Well, that certainly sounded right up Fluttershy\xe2\x80\x99s alley, if she could get over her intense shyness. Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t know any other pony that would care so much for a complete stranger.\r\n\r\n\t Canterlot Guard --The Canterlot Guard is one of the last lines of defense for the Equestrian Crown. They mainly police the palace and the grounds itself, although it has been known for Canterlot Guards to sign contracts with other nobility.\r\n\t\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0That was what Shining Armor was, a Canterlot Guard. Nothing made her brother happier than to be defending the Princess.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Equestrian Intelligence  \xe2\x80\x93EI knows everything. A vast spy network comprised of undercover agents everywhere, Equestrian Intelligence ensures the nation they serve is prepared for anything. Every major plan, every notable event usually revolves around an EI combat agent. They operate from the shadows, usually shaping Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s future more than any other military force.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Equestrian Intelligence had Pinkie Pie written all over it. That pony knew things about other ponies she had no business knowing about. It didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter if it was a thought never spoken aloud. Pinkie Pie would still know about it.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Arcane Brigade \xe2\x80\x93If there is one thing the enemies of Equestria fear, it is Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Arcane Brigade. Comprised of the most deadly spell casters ever born, the Brigade only enters a conflict when the need is dire. The Brigade guards their magical secrets jealously, ensuring that enemies know next to nothing about them. The Brigade is also responsible for Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s advancements with magic.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The Arcane Brigade. The name sent pleasing shivers down Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s spine. She had always dreamed that she would have a chance to join the Brigade, after learning all she could from a Master Mage. The Brigade solved everything, and Twilight would love nothing more than to be that part of Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s forces. Perhaps Luna would allow her to join the Brigade after Twilight completed her training.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 The Valkyrie \xe2\x80\x93If the Arcane Brigade brings fear to Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s enemies, then Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Valkyrie brings unbridled terror. Throughout Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s history, the Valkyrie has been a mare every bit as powerful as Princess Luna herself. Records show that victory is guaranteed when the Valkyrie takes to the battlefield. Mastering every branch of magic known to Sol, the Valkyrie is Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s right hoof, meting out justice where she sees fit. The other branches of military also directly answer to the Valkyrie, rather than Princess Luna. \r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0This  was a name that brought back foalhood memories. Everypony knew who the Valkyrie had been. Respected, feared, and loved as much as the Princess herself, the last Valkyrie vanished sometime during the giant War almost a thousand years ago. To the best of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s knowledge, there has not been one since.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Princess Luna  \xe2\x80\x93There has only been one instance where the Princess of Equestria has entered combat personally. This was back during the War of the Sun and Moon decades ago, when the usurper Corona Flare attempted to claim the throne of Equestria. The details of this war are vague at best, but it is a testament of Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s prowess that Corona Flare is no more.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight remembered reading vague details about this war. All anypony remembered was that Corona Flare attempted to usurp Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s position, to bring about never-ending day. After a vicious war, Princess Luna emerged victorious, and supposedly banished Flare into the Sun. At the time, Twilight had thought the tale was simply something to entertain young foals. After seeing Princess Luna up close, and feeling  her majestic power, Twilight was starting to think that perhaps there was a grain of truth to this story. With a thoughtful expression, Twilight opened the second text.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Magical Basics\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Magic is a part of everything. From the visible and flashy magic of unicorns and other casters, to the more subtle passive magic of ground and fliers, magic is everywhere. Over the years, magic has branched out into ten different categories, each with their own counterpart. They are as follows:\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0There have been numerous disputes when categorizing magic as we know it. For example, a good many scholars and mages feel that Light and Night should be their own counterparts and that a new Accord Magic should be created for Destruction. However, this idea is not entirely sound and has been thus far ignored; Light magic focuses on strength, courage, and  creating new things, while Destruction does the exact opposite.\r\n\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight knew all of this already. But Princess Luna undoubtedly had some reason to bring this to the forefront of the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s mind. Twilight was interrupted from her thoughts by the reappearance of Luna, who had a strange gleam in her eye.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cGood, you are finished reading! Now, let us set you up with some chores.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cChores?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight echoed, confused. This was not what she had expected when Luna had said there she was going to teach Twilight magic.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cYes, chores. Take a look around, Twilight. Are there any servants here?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cNo, Princess.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was confusion layered her voice, but she did have a small inkling of where this was going.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cOf course there is not! Servants rarely ever approach my study and its hallway; it is the one place they are forbidden from!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0This made sense. Twilight had noticed a distinct lack of servants on her walk here, despite the haze over her mind at the time. \xe2\x80\x9cSo then I am going to perform the cleaning they are unable to do?\xe2\x80\x9d Try as she might, Twilight could not hide the disappointment coloring her words.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna finally had mercy on her student. \xe2\x80\x9cRelax, Twilight. You are not in trouble. This is my way of gauging your magical aptitude. I don\xe2\x80\x99t want you to do anything overly fancy to accomplish what I ask of you. All you should need to do is some levitation and a few other minor spells. I want to test your control and see how you go about completing everynight tasks. Firstly, I would like you to clean up after our lunch. After that, the fireplace needs cleaning out and the mantle dusted. The rugs need to be dirt free. Then you can start on my bookshelves. Dust them and clean them. Make sure my books are all categorized. Once you are finished, then I can get a better idea of where to start you in your training.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight perked up a bit. Housework was nothing new to her, despite being of noble birth; growing up in the palace instead of a foster home meant she had to clean her own room on numerous occasions. The fact that the Princess wanted Twilight use magic made the work more bearable. Humming a faint tune, Twilight got started. Horn shimmering with a low key magenta glow, she attacked the stuff left over from lunch. A single horn wave removed leftover foodstuffs from utensils and surfaces, and then a further wave sent the implements sailing back to their proper place in the kitchenette. At the same time the purple unicorn attacked the fireplace, Vanishing the ash left over from its last use and whitening the bricks a bit. She then produced a small duster and proceeded to buff the mantle. By that time she had finished the lunch mess and moved onto the books and bookshelves.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Princess Luna watched her student with interest. She was using and maintaining spells constantly, without conscious effort. Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn didn\xe2\x80\x99t even shine any brighter than it had at first, signaling a record low power usage despite all the magic the unicorn was using. It was starting to look like taking Twilight as her personal prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9 was a very good decision. As Luna watched her student, her eyes started to wander. Twilight was young, certainly, but no less an appealing mare. Her legs were sturdy and strong, a testimony to an active pony despite Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s love for books. The fact that Twilight was not some fat, lazy scholar was a very good thing, in Luna\xe2\x80\x99s book. While Twilight was nowhere near as glossy and graceful as Luna, there was a certain symphony about her movements, as the unicorn turned slightly to keep an eye on her spells. And besides, gracefulness would come in time. All in all, she was confident that she had chosen well. Twilight would make a good Valkyrie.\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\r\n\r\n\r\n', 'epub': None}

2015-02-23 12:03:08,506 - DEBUG - {'version': 1, 'chapter_number': 4, 'fields': ['chapter_text', 'chapter_number', 'parent_chapter_id', 'chapter_html', 'version', 'parent_story_id'], 'chapter_to_insert': {'chapter_text': '//------------------------------//\n// Chapter 4// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\tTwilight Sparkle lay there, staring up at the ceiling above her. The bed was softer and more comfortable than anything she had ever slept on. Her personal quarters were far bigger than she was used to, and yet none of that mattered at the moment. All that mattered were her slow breaths and her own thoughts. In just a few short hours, she will have been Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s personal student for a full night. The full implications daunted her as much as they thrilled her. Nopony else in years has ever been in the position she found herself in. She had asked, curious as to why she was different from the other apprentices Luna had. Luna had told her, quite simply, that Twilight was in an entirely different league just because of her drive for knowledge and her own formidable power. Most apprentices, like Rarity, were content with choosing one branch of magic and studying every bit of magic that branch held. Twilight had become different just because she wanted to know more.\r\n\r\n\tIt was almost too much to take in. This time yesternight, she had been a young unicorn, an orphan, who had no idea exactly what was going to happen with her future. In hindsight, narrowing it down to finding a Master or a Mate was a bit foolish of her. Foolish or not, however, Twilight knew that if she had decided to do anything but become an apprentice, the Nobles of Canterlot would not have rested until they had added her to one of their own families. Twilight had spent enough time in Canterlot to know that was just how the nobles worked. They only looked out for themselves, first and foremost, and nothing else mattered. With the near decimation of the Twinkle House, there was now only one, maybe two Houses still completely dedicated solely to the Crown. The rest of them were utterly worthless for anything.\r\n\r\n\tThe thought of House Twinkle\xe2\x80\x99s plight brought a slight frown to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s lips as she thought. Now that she was out of the shadow of other greedy nobles, perhaps she could begin to rebuild House Twinkle? She wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have to marry if she did not want to; it would be easy enough to find deserving ponies and turn them into lesser nobles. Twilight even doubted that Princess Luna would have a problem with this idea. Other nobles would be incensed; bringing in outside blood to dilute the pure blood of nobility was an unthinkable crime. But Twilight had never really cared for their self-imposed ideals. It was a pony\xe2\x80\x99s actions and contributions to society that made a pony worthy of being a noble, not the blood that ran through their veins. Or, maybe she could go one better: She could see what would be needed to turn House Twinkle into a clan.\r\n\r\n\tA clan was a massive group of several nobles united under a single banner, or even the same set of ideals. The last clan recorded in the Equestrian Annals was way back in ancient times, when Princess Platinum led the unicorn faction with an iron fist. The only problem was, the Twinkle House didn\xe2\x80\x99t have much in the way to offer other nobles as an incentive to form a clan. Twilight was not about to offer herself or her brother. Maybe she could ask Princess Luna for aid. She was sure her new mentor could come up with something; Twilight very much doubted Luna would want to lose the most loyal Equestrian House to the Crown. Resolving to broach the subject sometime later, Twilight Sparkle finally rolled out of her too soft bed and onto her hooves. Judging by the lightening of the sky outside her windows, she had perhaps an hour and a half before Princess Luna would brighten the moon, signalling a new night.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight then began a routine she has partaken in for as long as she remembered. Every year, the day after her birthday, Twilight and Shining Armor would meet in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s favorite garden, and then proceed to the site of their parent\xe2\x80\x99s grave. Twilight knew that the graves were empty; the bodies of her mother and father had never been recovered from their last Equestrian Intelligence field mission. But this fact never deterred the Sparkle siblings. The memory and spirit of their parents were enough. Truth be told, it was all they had, aside from each other. This ritual was what helped both of the young ponies cope with the fact that their parents were long since gone. Unlike Shining Armor, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s recollection of both Twilight Velvet and Night Light were vague at best. She had been barely more than four years old at their passing, and the most she could recall were their voices. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t explain why, but she knew their voices as well as she knew her own.\r\n\r\n\tShining had it a bit more roughly than his baby sister. He had been six when the unexpected news was brought to them. Undoubtedly he could remember every detail of that fateful day, although he never talked about it. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even sure he could talk about it. He never once recounted that day to his sister, as if he wanted to spare her those terrifying memories. Twilight really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t fault his logic, either: he was doing his best to protect his little Twilight. And that was extended to ensuring a particular memory was left unspoken of. Twilight sighed to herself softly before gently easing out of her quarters, gently treading past Rarity\xe2\x80\x99s door.\r\n\r\n\tLike usual, she found Shining Armor already waiting for her at the entrance to the gardens. Also like usual, he was in full guard uniform.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTwiley!\xe2\x80\x9d Shining Armor exclaimed upon sighting the young unicorn. He pulled her into a firm hug. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s so good to see you again, little sis. I\xe2\x80\x99d heard about your Career Day, but the Commander refused to let me take leave.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cShiny!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nuzzled her brother affectionately, as soon as she had a moment to speak. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s good to see you too, big brother.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tShining laughed and roughed his sibling\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cCome on, then. Let\xe2\x80\x99s go visit mom and dad. We can catch up later.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight led the way from the gardens to the palace cemetery, picking a few flowers on her way. It was a short walk, and Twilight enjoyed the peaceful silence with her brother. Shining was one of the only ponies she ever felt at ease with. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have to worry about unwanted advances, or anything. It was just her and Shining, like it always has been. She really wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have it any other way, either. He brother knew her, the real her, the unicorn who preferred books over real friends (the other Orphans didn\xe2\x80\x99t really count). She could even feel the extra spring in her step, one that Shining noticed and chuckled over. Twilight kept up her carefree manner until, threading their way through many tombstones, the two siblings stood before the two graves that meant more to them than anything at that moment.\r\n\r\n\tAs always, Shining went first. He knelt down upon his forehooves and gently brushed away a stray vine from the first tombstone. It read:\r\n\r\n Night Light Sparkle\r\nHusband and father, may he never be forgotten\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cBe faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWell, pops,\xe2\x80\x9d Shining began. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve done it. I\xe2\x80\x99m Captain of the Canterlot Guard. I\xe2\x80\x99m even poised to become the next Commander, as soon as Shattered Wing retires. Against the odds, I\xe2\x80\x99ve done it. I hope that wherever you are now, you can look down on me and be proud to call me your son.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight knelt at the face of the tombstone next to her father\xe2\x80\x99s, arranging her flowers as she did so. This one read:\r\n\r\n Twilight Velvet\r\nWife and mother, may she never be forgotten.\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cIt is the mark of an educated mind to entertain a thought without accepting it.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGuess what mother? I\xe2\x80\x99m the personal prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9e to Princess Luna now. Can you believe it? She saw my eagerness to learn, not just a single branch of magic, but all magic. She promised to start teaching me, and guiding me. I think I\xe2\x80\x99ve done you proud, mother. I\xe2\x80\x99m living a dream I never thought would come true.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tSilence then reigned over the cemetery. Twilight and Shining sat there next to each other, sharing warmth. Neither spoke a word, but they didn\xe2\x80\x99t need to. Both knew that they had more than lived up to the expectations of their parents. The last of the Twinkle line they may be, but that did not mean they were unworthy to carry on their House name. If anything, they were more determined than ever to become exceptional ponies in their respective fields. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just about their parent\xe2\x80\x99s memory. It was about showing the rest of Equestria that they were worthy of being a part of the Twinkle heritage. The first step was to prove they had what it takes. Then, as the sun began to peek over the horizon, Shining finally spoke.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAre you angry with me, Twiley?\xe2\x80\x9d Shining\xe2\x80\x99s voice was soft, laced with hidden grief.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight turned to her brother in surprise. \xe2\x80\x9cAngry? Why would I be angry at you, big brother? You\xe2\x80\x99re the only family I have.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s why you should hate me, Twilight. I abandoned you, left to fend for yourself while I followed my dream of becoming a Canterlot Guard.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight nearly groaned aloud. Her brother was still beating this around the bush? \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m not mad at you, Shining, nor do I hate you. I know you wanted to follow your dream, and that\xe2\x80\x99s okay. I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have wanted you to do otherwise.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cNo buts, big brother. Okay? What\xe2\x80\x99s it going to take for you to understand you\xe2\x80\x99re being silly? I didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind being accepted as an Orphan. You were still there for me through the thick and the thin. You were still my rock, my pillar of support when I needed it. Hay, I was the one who told you to follow your dream. So why do you still beat yourself up over this?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI just\xe2\x80\xa6 feel like a horrible brother. I should have found a job with easily accessible pay. I should have bought us a house to live in. I shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have let me sister live on her own.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cShining, you\xe2\x80\x99re being retarded. Forgive me my language, but you are. There was no reason for you to give up your dreams to \xe2\x80\x98take care\xe2\x80\x99 of a sister who\xe2\x80\x99s perfectly capable of living on her own. Or have you forgotten the fact that my foster families learned the hard way not to mess with me? And besides, you\xe2\x80\x99re still missing one detail: Seeing as you are off in the Guard, I\xe2\x80\x99m next in line to inherit the Twinkle assets. And I just turned of age yesterday.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tShining Armor stared at his sister for a full thirty seconds before a grin stretched across his muzzle. \xe2\x80\x9cI had forgotten the inheritance.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cPrecisely,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight answered a trifle smugly. \xe2\x80\x9cNow, not only am I still receiving a stipend from the Crown (which has probably doubled now that I am Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s personal student), I\xe2\x80\x99m inheriting everything our parents left us. And in case you have forgotten this too, our parents left a lot\xe2\x80\x94As soon as I talk to Princess Luna and get it cleared with the realtors and lawyers, I\xe2\x80\x99m probably going to be the second richest pony in Equestria, after Princess Luna. And if I honestly wanted to, I could start living in the Twinkle mansion. Now, will you please stop beating yourself up over this nonsense?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tShining grinned ruefully. \xe2\x80\x9cOkay, okay, you win!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight laughed at that, then began to lead the way out of the cemetery. \xe2\x80\x9cCome on, big brother!  We\xe2\x80\x99ve got our own duties to return to!"\r\n\r\n<<((*))>>\r\n\r\n\tRainbow Dash shrugged off her bulging saddlebags and sprawled across her cloud bed, whimpering with relief. Every muscle in her body felt like it was on fire; she had no idea that she could feel this sore, this exhausted. She was already starting to wonder if she\xe2\x80\x99d even make it through her four years of the Wonderbolt Academy. She had been a cadet for barely a day and she was already feeling like she had been a cadet for a year. When Rainbow had applied for the Wonderbolts, Rainbow had an interesting notion of sleek pegasi screaming through the sky, while lesser ponies stared on with awed admiration. To her, the Wonderbolts had been the epitome of adventure and carefree flying, and Wonderbolt Cadets were pegasi to be envied.\r\n\r\n\tIt seemed that reality had a harsh wake up call. So far, Wonderbolt Cadets were pegasi who rose before the light of dawn and spent the hour before breakfast partaking in a rigorous course of physical training: galloping, using their wings to lift weights, and balancing upon their hind hooves and walking that way. Already tired from all of this, they had a chance to take a minute, then return to their dormitories, shower with cold water, and then make sure their dormitories were completely spotless. If there was so much as a misplaced speck of dust upon the floor, Soarin\xe2\x80\x99, Wonderbolt second-in-command, would dump the contents of their kits onto the floor, upend their beds, and force them to do it all over again\xe2\x80\x94during the time they should be having breakfast.\r\n\r\n\tBreakfast, naturally, was nothing special\xe2\x80\x94completely basic and barely filling. But Rainbow Dash was used to little breakfast during her personal training days, and so never complained even if she missed breakfast. The other new cadets weren\xe2\x80\x99t so lucky, and if they missed breakfast, it as a long hard morning until lunch at mid afternoon. And even lunch was only about half an hour long. After breakfast there came three hours of classes for military history, tactical advantages, and so on; these classes were certainly not Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s strong suit. She hated anything to do with sitting still for an extended period of time or reading. But she soldiered through them, knowing that she would never become a Wonderbolt if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t learn all of this important stuff.\r\n\r\n\tThen after these classes, the cadets were required to run an obstacle course before they were allowed to head to lunch. The course was littered with rogue thunderclouds, shifting winds, and freezing patches of water. It also had to be completed in three minutes, and if somepony failed to complete it within that time, they were sent back to the start to try again\xe2\x80\x94often resulting in lost time for lunch. While Rainbow as familiar with sometimes skipping breakfast, or having a sparse one, going without lunch was torture for the mare; as a result, she quickly learned to not make mistakes during the obstacle course.\r\n\r\n\tThen after lunch came even more classes that bored the chromatic pegasus to tears, then a series of aerial challenges designed to put your wings to the test\xe2\x80\x94and even though Rainbow knew she exceeded well here, the challenges were still grueling and always varying. After those exercises, the cadets would form ranks and perform combat drills until the end of the school day, where they had two hours to themselves to unwind a tiny bit, repair gear and prepare for classes the next day\xe2\x80\x94unless somepony earned a demerit during the day. If somepony earned a demerit, all of the cadets were punished. They were ordered to load their saddlebags full of rocks, and then had to complete the obstacle course five times in a row without stopping.\r\n\r\n\tRainbow had just finished one such run. Earlier in the day, one of Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s classmates was caught passing a note in Aerodynamics 1, and the instructor, Fleetfoot, confiscated it and read it out to the class: Apparently the pegasus stallion in question was attempting to set up a place for a little\xe2\x80\xa6 tryst\xe2\x80\xa6 with his marefriend after lights out and everypony else was supposed to be asleep. After assuring that there will never be any such activates allowed at the Academy, Fleetfoot had shredded the note and invited the entire class to fill their saddlebags and get to flying. After several snubs directed at the pegasus, the class did as they had been bid.\r\n\r\n\tRainbow Dash had eventually felt herself pulling away from the rest of them as she rounded the first bend of the course. Even after a single day the strict regime to the Academy was doing wonders for her. Not only was she feeling fitter than she ever had before, but her natural ability as an athlete also came into play. While others had issues with the hairpin turns, dodging rouge clouds and avoiding the water, Rainbow flitted by them with apparent ease, muscles burning for a respite. And in all honesty, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind being in front of the proverbial pack. So far, she\xe2\x80\x99s never really gotten a chance to know her classmates really well. She shared classes with them and sweat with them, but still had never really interacted with them. But still, she had shown them. None of the others were even back yet.\r\n\r\n\tNo sooner had she completed this thought that the door at the end of the dormitory crashed open. She propped herself on her elbow and inwardly groaned. Dumbbell, Fast Hoop, and Calamity strode up the rows between the perfectly made beds. They were second year cadets and had decided it was their calling in life to make Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s life as miserable as possible. The rainbow flier scrambled quickly to their hooves, but nowhere near fast enough.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you doing in bed, Rainbow Crash? Dumbbell sneered. \xe2\x80\x9cYou should be on the course with the rest of your loser classmates. Who do you think you are, that you can just skip instructor\xe2\x80\x99s orders?\xe2\x80\x9d Fast Hoop and Calamity laughed. They weren\xe2\x80\x99t overly bright, but certainly made up for it with brawn.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve already finished,\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow replied tonelessly. \xe2\x80\x9cMy time is my own before dinner.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOh yea?\xe2\x80\x9d Dumbbell got a wicked glint in his eyes. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, I call you a liar! Get up from there and give me fifty wing-ups to make me forget about this and not report you to an instructor!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tRainbow hesitated for a moment. Technically, she was stronger than these three goons. And she knew she was faster, without a doubt. If there was ever a confrontation, she knew she could beat them. But, there was also three of them and one of her. She was not about to take on all three of them at once. Nor was she about to report them to an instructor. If this was how first year cadets were supposed to be treated by higher cadets, then so be it. She\xe2\x80\x99d just have to deal with whatever they threw at her and move on. However, Dumbbell must have seen the light of rebellion in Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes for a moment.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOne hundred wing-ups!\xe2\x80\x9d He ordered. \xe2\x80\x9cNow!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tWith a grunt of aching muscles, Rainbow dropped to the floor and began doing push-ups with just her wings. As she began to rise up, she felt a hoof in the small of her back: Calamity had stepped forward, and was exerting just the right amount of pressure to ensure that Rainbow found it hard to complete her assigned task. She grunted again, and Dumbbell yelled at her.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cStop your whimpering, Crash! Move faster!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tRainbow gritted her teeth. She wanted nothing more than to knock Calamity back and jump in with hooves swinging. But the last thing she needed was to be kicked from the Academy. So she soldiered on, determined to do what she was ordered. But it was on her sixth exercise that her wings spasmed, causing her to crash to the floor, stunned. Calamity raised his hoof as though to strike her unprotected back, but was interrupted by a new voice.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cLeave her be!\xe2\x80\x9d The voice was every bit as tomboyish has Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s, but still definitely feminine. Rainbow and her three tormentors whirled around at the newcomer: a sea green pegasus mare with a two-toned mustard yellow mane. Her topaz eyes surveyed the scene before her disgustedly.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99d better get out of here if you know what\xe2\x80\x99s good for you,\xe2\x80\x9d Dumbbell swaggered. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is between me and Crash here.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWell, I\xe2\x80\x99m now making it about me. And if you think you can take on a third year cadet who\xe2\x80\x99s been doing this longer than you, be my guest. Don\xe2\x80\x99t go crying to your mommies when I put you in the hospital.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tRainbow could see the three bullies hesitating. Then, with one last contemptuous look at Rainbow Dash, they stomped out, making sure to give the third year cadet a wide birth. The cadet then approached Dash, who still had not risen. She held out a hoof, with the chromatic flier accepted. \r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m Lightning Dust,\xe2\x80\x9d the newcomer said. \xe2\x80\x9cTop of my class. You\xe2\x80\x99re the one they call Rainbow Dash, aren\xe2\x80\x99t you?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tDash stretched her aching wings. \xe2\x80\x9cYea, that\xe2\x80\x99s me. Thanks for that, by the way.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cNot a problem. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been looking to have those three expelled for a while now, but they\xe2\x80\x99ve never done anything serious enough to warrant it. Come on. Let\xe2\x80\x99s go get dinner and see what happens from there.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\r\n', 'chapter_number': 4, 'parent_chapter_id': 337428, 'chapter_html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'4\'></a><h3>Chapter 4</h3>\n<p class=\'indented\'>Twilight Sparkle lay there, staring up at the ceiling above her. The bed was softer and more comfortable than anything she had ever slept on. Her personal quarters were far bigger than she was used to, and yet none of that mattered at the moment. All that mattered were her slow breaths and her own thoughts. In just a few short hours, she will have been Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s personal student for a full night. The full implications daunted her as much as they thrilled her. Nopony else in years has ever been in the position she found herself in. She had asked, curious as to why she was different from the other apprentices Luna had. Luna had told her, quite simply, that Twilight was in an entirely different league just because of her drive for knowledge and her own formidable power. Most apprentices, like Rarity, were content with choosing one branch of magic and studying every bit of magic that branch held. Twilight had become different just because she wanted to know more.</p><p class="indented double">It was almost too much to take in. This time yesternight, she had been a young unicorn, an orphan, who had no idea exactly what was going to happen with her future. In hindsight, narrowing it down to finding a Master or a Mate was a bit foolish of her. Foolish or not, however, Twilight knew that if she had decided to do anything but become an apprentice, the Nobles of Canterlot would not have rested until they had added her to one of their own families. Twilight had spent enough time in Canterlot to know that was just how the nobles worked. They only looked out for themselves, first and foremost, and nothing else mattered. With the near decimation of the Twinkle House, there was now only one, maybe two Houses still completely dedicated solely to the Crown. The rest of them were utterly worthless for anything.</p><p class="indented double">The thought of House Twinkle\xe2\x80\x99s plight brought a slight frown to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s lips as she thought. Now that she was out of the shadow of other greedy nobles, perhaps she could begin to rebuild House Twinkle? She wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have to marry if she did not want to; it would be easy enough to find deserving ponies and turn them into lesser nobles. Twilight even doubted that Princess Luna would have a problem with this idea. Other nobles would be incensed; bringing in outside blood to dilute the pure blood of nobility was an unthinkable crime. But Twilight had never really cared for their self-imposed ideals. It was a pony\xe2\x80\x99s actions and contributions to society that made a pony worthy of being a noble, not the blood that ran through their veins. Or, maybe she could go one better: She could see what would be needed to turn House Twinkle into a clan.</p><p class="indented double">A clan was a massive group of several nobles united under a single banner, or even the same set of ideals. The last clan recorded in the Equestrian Annals was way back in ancient times, when Princess Platinum led the unicorn faction with an iron fist. The only problem was, the Twinkle House didn\xe2\x80\x99t have much in the way to offer other nobles as an incentive to form a clan. Twilight was not about to offer herself or her brother. Maybe she could ask Princess Luna for aid. She was sure her new mentor could come up with something; Twilight very much doubted Luna would want to lose the most loyal Equestrian House to the Crown. Resolving to broach the subject sometime later, Twilight Sparkle finally rolled out of her too soft bed and onto her hooves. Judging by the lightening of the sky outside her windows, she had perhaps an hour and a half before Princess Luna would brighten the moon, signalling a new night.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight then began a routine she has partaken in for as long as she remembered. Every year, the day after her birthday, Twilight and Shining Armor would meet in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s favorite garden, and then proceed to the site of their parent\xe2\x80\x99s grave. Twilight knew that the graves were empty; the bodies of her mother and father had never been recovered from their last Equestrian Intelligence field mission. But this fact never deterred the Sparkle siblings. The memory and spirit of their parents were enough. Truth be told, it was all they had, aside from each other. This ritual was what helped both of the young ponies cope with the fact that their parents were long since gone. Unlike Shining Armor, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s recollection of both Twilight Velvet and Night Light were vague at best. She had been barely more than four years old at their passing, and the most she could recall were their voices. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t explain why, but she knew their voices as well as she knew her own.</p><p class="indented double">Shining had it a bit more roughly than his baby sister. He had been six when the unexpected news was brought to them. Undoubtedly he could remember every detail of that fateful day, although he never talked about it. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even sure he <i>could</i> talk about it. He never once recounted that day to his sister, as if he wanted to spare her those terrifying memories. Twilight really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t fault his logic, either: he was doing his best to protect his little Twilight. And that was extended to ensuring a particular memory was left unspoken of. Twilight sighed to herself softly before gently easing out of her quarters, gently treading past Rarity\xe2\x80\x99s door.</p><p class="indented double">Like usual, she found Shining Armor already waiting for her at the entrance to the gardens. Also like usual, he was in full guard uniform.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwiley!\xe2\x80\x9d Shining Armor exclaimed upon sighting the young unicorn. He pulled her into a firm hug. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s so good to see you again, little sis. I\xe2\x80\x99d heard about your Career Day, but the Commander refused to let me take leave.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cShiny!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nuzzled her brother affectionately, as soon as she had a moment to speak. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s good to see you too, big brother.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Shining laughed and roughed his sibling\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cCome on, then. Let\xe2\x80\x99s go visit mom and dad. We can catch up later.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight led the way from the gardens to the palace cemetery, picking a few flowers on her way. It was a short walk, and Twilight enjoyed the peaceful silence with her brother. Shining was one of the only ponies she ever felt at ease with. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have to worry about unwanted advances, or anything. It was just her and Shining, like it always has been. She really wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have it any other way, either. He brother knew her, the real her, the unicorn who preferred books over real friends (the other Orphans didn\xe2\x80\x99t really count). She could even feel the extra spring in her step, one that Shining noticed and chuckled over. Twilight kept up her carefree manner until, threading their way through many tombstones, the two siblings stood before the two graves that meant more to them than anything at that moment.</p><p class="indented double">As always, Shining went first. He knelt down upon his forehooves and gently brushed away a stray vine from the first tombstone. It read:</p><p class="double"><center><i> Night Light Sparkle</p><p>Husband and father, may he never be forgotten</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cBe faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.\xe2\x80\x9d</i></center></p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, pops,\xe2\x80\x9d Shining began. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve done it. I\xe2\x80\x99m Captain of the Canterlot Guard. I\xe2\x80\x99m even poised to become the next Commander, as soon as Shattered Wing retires. Against the odds, I\xe2\x80\x99ve done it. I hope that wherever you are now, you can look down on me and be proud to call me your son.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight knelt at the face of the tombstone next to her father\xe2\x80\x99s, arranging her flowers as she did so. This one read:</p><p class="double"><center><i> Twilight Velvet</p><p>Wife and mother, may she never be forgotten.</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cIt is the mark of an educated mind to entertain a thought without accepting it.\xe2\x80\x9d</i></center></p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cGuess what mother? I\xe2\x80\x99m the personal prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9e to Princess Luna now. Can you believe it? She saw my eagerness to learn, not just a single branch of magic, but <i>all</i> magic. She promised to start teaching me, and guiding me. I think I\xe2\x80\x99ve done you proud, mother. I\xe2\x80\x99m living a dream I never thought would come true.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Silence then reigned over the cemetery. Twilight and Shining sat there next to each other, sharing warmth. Neither spoke a word, but they didn\xe2\x80\x99t need to. Both knew that they had more than lived up to the expectations of their parents. The last of the Twinkle line they may be, but that did not mean they were unworthy to carry on their House name. If anything, they were more determined than ever to become exceptional ponies in their respective fields. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just about their parent\xe2\x80\x99s memory. It was about showing the rest of Equestria that they were worthy of being a part of the Twinkle heritage. The first step was to prove they had what it takes. Then, as the sun began to peek over the horizon, Shining finally spoke.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAre you angry with me, Twiley?\xe2\x80\x9d Shining\xe2\x80\x99s voice was soft, laced with hidden grief.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight turned to her brother in surprise. \xe2\x80\x9cAngry? Why would I be angry at you, big brother? You\xe2\x80\x99re the only family I have.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s why you should hate me, Twilight. I abandoned you, left to fend for yourself while I followed my dream of becoming a Canterlot Guard.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight nearly groaned aloud. Her brother was <i>still</i> beating this around the bush? \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m not mad at you, Shining, nor do I hate you. I know you wanted to follow your dream, and that\xe2\x80\x99s okay. I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have wanted you to do otherwise.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cNo buts, big brother. Okay? What\xe2\x80\x99s it going to take for you to understand you\xe2\x80\x99re being silly? I didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind being accepted as an Orphan. You were still there for me through the thick and the thin. You were still my rock, my pillar of support when I needed it. Hay, I was the one who <i>told</i> you to follow your dream. So why do you still beat yourself up over this?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI just\xe2\x80\xa6 feel like a horrible brother. I should have found a job with easily accessible pay. I should have bought us a house to live in. I shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have let me sister live on her own.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cShining, you\xe2\x80\x99re being retarded. Forgive me my language, but you are. There was no reason for you to give up your dreams to \xe2\x80\x98take care\xe2\x80\x99 of a sister who\xe2\x80\x99s perfectly capable of living on her own. Or have you forgotten the fact that my foster families learned the hard way not to mess with me? And besides, you\xe2\x80\x99re still missing one detail: Seeing as you are off in the Guard, I\xe2\x80\x99m next in line to inherit the Twinkle assets. And I just turned of age yesterday.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Shining Armor stared at his sister for a full thirty seconds before a grin stretched across his muzzle. \xe2\x80\x9cI had forgotten the inheritance.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cPrecisely,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight answered a trifle smugly. \xe2\x80\x9cNow, not only am I still receiving a stipend from the Crown (which has probably doubled now that I am Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s personal student), I\xe2\x80\x99m inheriting everything our parents left us. And in case you have forgotten this too, our parents left a lot\xe2\x80\x94As soon as I talk to Princess Luna and get it cleared with the realtors and lawyers, I\xe2\x80\x99m probably going to be the second richest pony in Equestria, after Princess Luna. And if I honestly wanted to, I could start living in the Twinkle mansion. Now, will you <i>please</i> stop beating yourself up over this nonsense?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Shining grinned ruefully. \xe2\x80\x9cOkay, okay, you win!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight laughed at that, then began to lead the way out of the cemetery. \xe2\x80\x9cCome on, big brother!&nbsp;&nbsp;We\xe2\x80\x99ve got our own duties to return to!&quot;</p><p class="double"><center>&lt;&lt;((*))&gt;&gt;</center></p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash shrugged off her bulging saddlebags and sprawled across her cloud bed, whimpering with relief. Every muscle in her body felt like it was on fire; she had no idea that she could feel this sore, this exhausted. She was already starting to wonder if she\xe2\x80\x99d even make it through her four years of the Wonderbolt Academy. She had been a cadet for barely a day and she was already feeling like she had been a cadet for a year. When Rainbow had applied for the Wonderbolts, Rainbow had an interesting notion of sleek pegasi screaming through the sky, while lesser ponies stared on with awed admiration. To her, the Wonderbolts had been the epitome of adventure and carefree flying, and Wonderbolt Cadets were pegasi to be envied.</p><p class="indented double">It seemed that reality had a harsh wake up call. So far, Wonderbolt Cadets were pegasi who rose before the light of dawn and spent the hour before breakfast partaking in a rigorous course of physical training: galloping, using their wings to lift weights, and balancing upon their hind hooves and walking that way. Already tired from all of this, they had a chance to take a minute, then return to their dormitories, shower with cold water, and then make sure their dormitories were completely spotless.
