Let\xe2\x80\x99s go get dinner and see what happens from there.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double"></p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 104188], 'parent_story_id': 104188, 'txt': '//------------------------------//\n// Chapter 4// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\tTwilight Sparkle lay there, staring up at the ceiling above her. The bed was softer and more comfortable than anything she had ever slept on. Her personal quarters were far bigger than she was used to, and yet none of that mattered at the moment. All that mattered were her slow breaths and her own thoughts. In just a few short hours, she will have been Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s personal student for a full night. The full implications daunted her as much as they thrilled her. Nopony else in years has ever been in the position she found herself in. She had asked, curious as to why she was different from the other apprentices Luna had. Luna had told her, quite simply, that Twilight was in an entirely different league just because of her drive for knowledge and her own formidable power. Most apprentices, like Rarity, were content with choosing one branch of magic and studying every bit of magic that branch held. Twilight had become different just because she wanted to know more.\r\n\r\n\tIt was almost too much to take in. This time yesternight, she had been a young unicorn, an orphan, who had no idea exactly what was going to happen with her future. In hindsight, narrowing it down to finding a Master or a Mate was a bit foolish of her. Foolish or not, however, Twilight knew that if she had decided to do anything but become an apprentice, the Nobles of Canterlot would not have rested until they had added her to one of their own families. Twilight had spent enough time in Canterlot to know that was just how the nobles worked. They only looked out for themselves, first and foremost, and nothing else mattered. With the near decimation of the Twinkle House, there was now only one, maybe two Houses still completely dedicated solely to the Crown. The rest of them were utterly worthless for anything.\r\n\r\n\tThe thought of House Twinkle\xe2\x80\x99s plight brought a slight frown to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s lips as she thought. Now that she was out of the shadow of other greedy nobles, perhaps she could begin to rebuild House Twinkle? She wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have to marry if she did not want to; it would be easy enough to find deserving ponies and turn them into lesser nobles. Twilight even doubted that Princess Luna would have a problem with this idea. Other nobles would be incensed; bringing in outside blood to dilute the pure blood of nobility was an unthinkable crime. But Twilight had never really cared for their self-imposed ideals. It was a pony\xe2\x80\x99s actions and contributions to society that made a pony worthy of being a noble, not the blood that ran through their veins. Or, maybe she could go one better: She could see what would be needed to turn House Twinkle into a clan.\r\n\r\n\tA clan was a massive group of several nobles united under a single banner, or even the same set of ideals. The last clan recorded in the Equestrian Annals was way back in ancient times, when Princess Platinum led the unicorn faction with an iron fist. The only problem was, the Twinkle House didn\xe2\x80\x99t have much in the way to offer other nobles as an incentive to form a clan. Twilight was not about to offer herself or her brother. Maybe she could ask Princess Luna for aid. She was sure her new mentor could come up with something; Twilight very much doubted Luna would want to lose the most loyal Equestrian House to the Crown. Resolving to broach the subject sometime later, Twilight Sparkle finally rolled out of her too soft bed and onto her hooves. Judging by the lightening of the sky outside her windows, she had perhaps an hour and a half before Princess Luna would brighten the moon, signalling a new night.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight then began a routine she has partaken in for as long as she remembered. Every year, the day after her birthday, Twilight and Shining Armor would meet in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s favorite garden, and then proceed to the site of their parent\xe2\x80\x99s grave. Twilight knew that the graves were empty; the bodies of her mother and father had never been recovered from their last Equestrian Intelligence field mission. But this fact never deterred the Sparkle siblings. The memory and spirit of their parents were enough. Truth be told, it was all they had, aside from each other. This ritual was what helped both of the young ponies cope with the fact that their parents were long since gone. Unlike Shining Armor, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s recollection of both Twilight Velvet and Night Light were vague at best. She had been barely more than four years old at their passing, and the most she could recall were their voices. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t explain why, but she knew their voices as well as she knew her own.\r\n\r\n\tShining had it a bit more roughly than his baby sister. He had been six when the unexpected news was brought to them. Undoubtedly he could remember every detail of that fateful day, although he never talked about it. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even sure he could talk about it. He never once recounted that day to his sister, as if he wanted to spare her those terrifying memories. Twilight really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t fault his logic, either: he was doing his best to protect his little Twilight. And that was extended to ensuring a particular memory was left unspoken of. Twilight sighed to herself softly before gently easing out of her quarters, gently treading past Rarity\xe2\x80\x99s door.\r\n\r\n\tLike usual, she found Shining Armor already waiting for her at the entrance to the gardens. Also like usual, he was in full guard uniform.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTwiley!\xe2\x80\x9d Shining Armor exclaimed upon sighting the young unicorn. He pulled her into a firm hug. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s so good to see you again, little sis. I\xe2\x80\x99d heard about your Career Day, but the Commander refused to let me take leave.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cShiny!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nuzzled her brother affectionately, as soon as she had a moment to speak. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s good to see you too, big brother.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tShining laughed and roughed his sibling\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cCome on, then. Let\xe2\x80\x99s go visit mom and dad. We can catch up later.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight led the way from the gardens to the palace cemetery, picking a few flowers on her way. It was a short walk, and Twilight enjoyed the peaceful silence with her brother. Shining was one of the only ponies she ever felt at ease with. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have to worry about unwanted advances, or anything. It was just her and Shining, like it always has been. She really wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have it any other way, either. He brother knew her, the real her, the unicorn who preferred books over real friends (the other Orphans didn\xe2\x80\x99t really count). She could even feel the extra spring in her step, one that Shining noticed and chuckled over. Twilight kept up her carefree manner until, threading their way through many tombstones, the two siblings stood before the two graves that meant more to them than anything at that moment.\r\n\r\n\tAs always, Shining went first. He knelt down upon his forehooves and gently brushed away a stray vine from the first tombstone. It read:\r\n\r\n Night Light Sparkle\r\nHusband and father, may he never be forgotten\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cBe faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWell, pops,\xe2\x80\x9d Shining began. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve done it. I\xe2\x80\x99m Captain of the Canterlot Guard. I\xe2\x80\x99m even poised to become the next Commander, as soon as Shattered Wing retires. Against the odds, I\xe2\x80\x99ve done it. I hope that wherever you are now, you can look down on me and be proud to call me your son.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight knelt at the face of the tombstone next to her father\xe2\x80\x99s, arranging her flowers as she did so. This one read:\r\n\r\n Twilight Velvet\r\nWife and mother, may she never be forgotten.\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cIt is the mark of an educated mind to entertain a thought without accepting it.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGuess what mother? I\xe2\x80\x99m the personal prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9e to Princess Luna now. Can you believe it? She saw my eagerness to learn, not just a single branch of magic, but all magic. She promised to start teaching me, and guiding me. I think I\xe2\x80\x99ve done you proud, mother. I\xe2\x80\x99m living a dream I never thought would come true.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tSilence then reigned over the cemetery. Twilight and Shining sat there next to each other, sharing warmth. Neither spoke a word, but they didn\xe2\x80\x99t need to. Both knew that they had more than lived up to the expectations of their parents. The last of the Twinkle line they may be, but that did not mean they were unworthy to carry on their House name. If anything, they were more determined than ever to become exceptional ponies in their respective fields. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just about their parent\xe2\x80\x99s memory. It was about showing the rest of Equestria that they were worthy of being a part of the Twinkle heritage. The first step was to prove they had what it takes. Then, as the sun began to peek over the horizon, Shining finally spoke.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAre you angry with me, Twiley?\xe2\x80\x9d Shining\xe2\x80\x99s voice was soft, laced with hidden grief.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight turned to her brother in surprise. \xe2\x80\x9cAngry? Why would I be angry at you, big brother? You\xe2\x80\x99re the only family I have.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s why you should hate me, Twilight. I abandoned you, left to fend for yourself while I followed my dream of becoming a Canterlot Guard.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight nearly groaned aloud. Her brother was still beating this around the bush? \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m not mad at you, Shining, nor do I hate you. I know you wanted to follow your dream, and that\xe2\x80\x99s okay. I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have wanted you to do otherwise.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cNo buts, big brother. Okay? What\xe2\x80\x99s it going to take for you to understand you\xe2\x80\x99re being silly? I didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind being accepted as an Orphan. You were still there for me through the thick and the thin. You were still my rock, my pillar of support when I needed it. Hay, I was the one who told you to follow your dream. So why do you still beat yourself up over this?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI just\xe2\x80\xa6 feel like a horrible brother. I should have found a job with easily accessible pay. I should have bought us a house to live in. I shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have let me sister live on her own.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cShining, you\xe2\x80\x99re being retarded. Forgive me my language, but you are. There was no reason for you to give up your dreams to \xe2\x80\x98take care\xe2\x80\x99 of a sister who\xe2\x80\x99s perfectly capable of living on her own. Or have you forgotten the fact that my foster families learned the hard way not to mess with me? And besides, you\xe2\x80\x99re still missing one detail: Seeing as you are off in the Guard, I\xe2\x80\x99m next in line to inherit the Twinkle assets. And I just turned of age yesterday.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tShining Armor stared at his sister for a full thirty seconds before a grin stretched across his muzzle. \xe2\x80\x9cI had forgotten the inheritance.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cPrecisely,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight answered a trifle smugly. \xe2\x80\x9cNow, not only am I still receiving a stipend from the Crown (which has probably doubled now that I am Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s personal student), I\xe2\x80\x99m inheriting everything our parents left us. And in case you have forgotten this too, our parents left a lot\xe2\x80\x94As soon as I talk to Princess Luna and get it cleared with the realtors and lawyers, I\xe2\x80\x99m probably going to be the second richest pony in Equestria, after Princess Luna. And if I honestly wanted to, I could start living in the Twinkle mansion. Now, will you please stop beating yourself up over this nonsense?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tShining grinned ruefully. \xe2\x80\x9cOkay, okay, you win!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight laughed at that, then began to lead the way out of the cemetery. \xe2\x80\x9cCome on, big brother!  We\xe2\x80\x99ve got our own duties to return to!"\r\n\r\n<<((*))>>\r\n\r\n\tRainbow Dash shrugged off her bulging saddlebags and sprawled across her cloud bed, whimpering with relief. Every muscle in her body felt like it was on fire; she had no idea that she could feel this sore, this exhausted. She was already starting to wonder if she\xe2\x80\x99d even make it through her four years of the Wonderbolt Academy. She had been a cadet for barely a day and she was already feeling like she had been a cadet for a year. When Rainbow had applied for the Wonderbolts, Rainbow had an interesting notion of sleek pegasi screaming through the sky, while lesser ponies stared on with awed admiration. To her, the Wonderbolts had been the epitome of adventure and carefree flying, and Wonderbolt Cadets were pegasi to be envied.\r\n\r\n\tIt seemed that reality had a harsh wake up call. So far, Wonderbolt Cadets were pegasi who rose before the light of dawn and spent the hour before breakfast partaking in a rigorous course of physical training: galloping, using their wings to lift weights, and balancing upon their hind hooves and walking that way. Already tired from all of this, they had a chance to take a minute, then return to their dormitories, shower with cold water, and then make sure their dormitories were completely spotless. If there was so much as a misplaced speck of dust upon the floor, Soarin\xe2\x80\x99, Wonderbolt second-in-command, would dump the contents of their kits onto the floor, upend their beds, and force them to do it all over again\xe2\x80\x94during the time they should be having breakfast.\r\n\r\n\tBreakfast, naturally, was nothing special\xe2\x80\x94completely basic and barely filling. But Rainbow Dash was used to little breakfast during her personal training days, and so never complained even if she missed breakfast. The other new cadets weren\xe2\x80\x99t so lucky, and if they missed breakfast, it as a long hard morning until lunch at mid afternoon. And even lunch was only about half an hour long. After breakfast there came three hours of classes for military history, tactical advantages, and so on; these classes were certainly not Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s strong suit. She hated anything to do with sitting still for an extended period of time or reading. But she soldiered through them, knowing that she would never become a Wonderbolt if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t learn all of this important stuff.\r\n\r\n\tThen after these classes, the cadets were required to run an obstacle course before they were allowed to head to lunch. The course was littered with rogue thunderclouds, shifting winds, and freezing patches of water. It also had to be completed in three minutes, and if somepony failed to complete it within that time, they were sent back to the start to try again\xe2\x80\x94often resulting in lost time for lunch. While Rainbow as familiar with sometimes skipping breakfast, or having a sparse one, going without lunch was torture for the mare; as a result, she quickly learned to not make mistakes during the obstacle course.\r\n\r\n\tThen after lunch came even more classes that bored the chromatic pegasus to tears, then a series of aerial challenges designed to put your wings to the test\xe2\x80\x94and even though Rainbow knew she exceeded well here, the challenges were still grueling and always varying. After those exercises, the cadets would form ranks and perform combat drills until the end of the school day, where they had two hours to themselves to unwind a tiny bit, repair gear and prepare for classes the next day\xe2\x80\x94unless somepony earned a demerit during the day. If somepony earned a demerit, all of the cadets were punished. They were ordered to load their saddlebags full of rocks, and then had to complete the obstacle course five times in a row without stopping.\r\n\r\n\tRainbow had just finished one such run. Earlier in the day, one of Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s classmates was caught passing a note in Aerodynamics 1, and the instructor, Fleetfoot, confiscated it and read it out to the class: Apparently the pegasus stallion in question was attempting to set up a place for a little\xe2\x80\xa6 tryst\xe2\x80\xa6 with his marefriend after lights out and everypony else was supposed to be asleep. After assuring that there will never be any such activates allowed at the Academy, Fleetfoot had shredded the note and invited the entire class to fill their saddlebags and get to flying. After several snubs directed at the pegasus, the class did as they had been bid.\r\n\r\n\tRainbow Dash had eventually felt herself pulling away from the rest of them as she rounded the first bend of the course. Even after a single day the strict regime to the Academy was doing wonders for her. Not only was she feeling fitter than she ever had before, but her natural ability as an athlete also came into play. While others had issues with the hairpin turns, dodging rouge clouds and avoiding the water, Rainbow flitted by them with apparent ease, muscles burning for a respite. And in all honesty, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind being in front of the proverbial pack. So far, she\xe2\x80\x99s never really gotten a chance to know her classmates really well. She shared classes with them and sweat with them, but still had never really interacted with them. But still, she had shown them. None of the others were even back yet.\r\n\r\n\tNo sooner had she completed this thought that the door at the end of the dormitory crashed open. She propped herself on her elbow and inwardly groaned. Dumbbell, Fast Hoop, and Calamity strode up the rows between the perfectly made beds. They were second year cadets and had decided it was their calling in life to make Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s life as miserable as possible. The rainbow flier scrambled quickly to their hooves, but nowhere near fast enough.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you doing in bed, Rainbow Crash? Dumbbell sneered. \xe2\x80\x9cYou should be on the course with the rest of your loser classmates. Who do you think you are, that you can just skip instructor\xe2\x80\x99s orders?\xe2\x80\x9d Fast Hoop and Calamity laughed. They weren\xe2\x80\x99t overly bright, but certainly made up for it with brawn.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve already finished,\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow replied tonelessly. \xe2\x80\x9cMy time is my own before dinner.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOh yea?\xe2\x80\x9d Dumbbell got a wicked glint in his eyes. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, I call you a liar! Get up from there and give me fifty wing-ups to make me forget about this and not report you to an instructor!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tRainbow hesitated for a moment. Technically, she was stronger than these three goons. And she knew she was faster, without a doubt. If there was ever a confrontation, she knew she could beat them. But, there was also three of them and one of her. She was not about to take on all three of them at once. Nor was she about to report them to an instructor. If this was how first year cadets were supposed to be treated by higher cadets, then so be it. She\xe2\x80\x99d just have to deal with whatever they threw at her and move on. However, Dumbbell must have seen the light of rebellion in Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes for a moment.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOne hundred wing-ups!\xe2\x80\x9d He ordered. \xe2\x80\x9cNow!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tWith a grunt of aching muscles, Rainbow dropped to the floor and began doing push-ups with just her wings. As she began to rise up, she felt a hoof in the small of her back: Calamity had stepped forward, and was exerting just the right amount of pressure to ensure that Rainbow found it hard to complete her assigned task. She grunted again, and Dumbbell yelled at her.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cStop your whimpering, Crash! Move faster!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tRainbow gritted her teeth. She wanted nothing more than to knock Calamity back and jump in with hooves swinging. But the last thing she needed was to be kicked from the Academy. So she soldiered on, determined to do what she was ordered. But it was on her sixth exercise that her wings spasmed, causing her to crash to the floor, stunned. Calamity raised his hoof as though to strike her unprotected back, but was interrupted by a new voice.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cLeave her be!\xe2\x80\x9d The voice was every bit as tomboyish has Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s, but still definitely feminine. Rainbow and her three tormentors whirled around at the newcomer: a sea green pegasus mare with a two-toned mustard yellow mane. Her topaz eyes surveyed the scene before her disgustedly.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99d better get out of here if you know what\xe2\x80\x99s good for you,\xe2\x80\x9d Dumbbell swaggered. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is between me and Crash here.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWell, I\xe2\x80\x99m now making it about me. And if you think you can take on a third year cadet who\xe2\x80\x99s been doing this longer than you, be my guest. Don\xe2\x80\x99t go crying to your mommies when I put you in the hospital.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tRainbow could see the three bullies hesitating. Then, with one last contemptuous look at Rainbow Dash, they stomped out, making sure to give the third year cadet a wide birth. The cadet then approached Dash, who still had not risen. She held out a hoof, with the chromatic flier accepted. \r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m Lightning Dust,\xe2\x80\x9d the newcomer said. \xe2\x80\x9cTop of my class. You\xe2\x80\x99re the one they call Rainbow Dash, aren\xe2\x80\x99t you?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tDash stretched her aching wings. \xe2\x80\x9cYea, that\xe2\x80\x99s me. Thanks for that, by the way.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cNot a problem. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been looking to have those three expelled for a while now, but they\xe2\x80\x99ve never done anything serious enough to warrant it. Come on. Let\xe2\x80\x99s go get dinner and see what happens from there.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\r\n', 'epub': None}

Tonight was going to be the first real night of her apprenticeship. The young unicorn had barely returned to her own quarters after the outing with Shining before a page had arrived, telling her to meet Princess Luna in her private study. Hardly able to contain her glee, Twilight had hurriedly made herself presentable and took off back down the corridor. She wondered which branch of magic Luna would teach her first. Each and every branch was important, of course, but she was secretly hoping that Luna would start with Light. Everything about that branch fascinated the bookish mare, from the extremely useful healing spells down to the simplest lighting spell. Or maybe they would start with Nature first, the magic that caused things to grow. Twilight has always wanted a small garden of her own, and maybe Luna would  start with the magic that would make growing one easier. But a small part of her mind whispered that Luna would want to start with Discord magic, throwing a slight damper upon her enthusiasm.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure she would be able to handle that. A great many uneducated folk insisted that Discord-based magic was evil. Twilight scoffed at the idea, but it was true that Discord magic was\xe2\x80\xa6 well\xe2\x80\xa6 not very nice. Animosity, of course, was the opposite of Friendship. The most Twilight knew about it was that it focused on manipulating your foes, deceiving them and preventing them from becoming too attached to you. Animosity was a valued tool for unicorns in Equestria Intelligence, as it was perfect for making sure a spy kept their cover even if enemies knew they were there. Then came Destruction, a magic that took everything Light stood for and obliterated it. Destruction was probably the only branch of magic with so much raw, pure power. Then there was Chaos, a magic that focused on turning reality upside down, and Hatred, which turned your most personal feelings into a tangible weapon. Lastly\xe2\x80\xa6 there was Necromancy.\r\n\r\n\tTo be honest, this was the branch of Discord magic Twilight was afraid of the most. There was so little actually published on the subject. Very few unicorns ever practiced Necromancy, and the ones who did were always closely watched by Princess Luna. It was rumored that bringing the dead back to life was impossible, but if it was, Necromancy would not be able to exist. Twilight was so wrapped up in her own thoughts and worries that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t even notice she had passed the hallway leading to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s study. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until she ran smack into a suit of armor she didn\xe2\x80\x99t recall being there previously that she realized her mistake. The unicorn backtracked to the correct hallway and proceeded down it, struggling to calm her nerves. Princess Luna knew what she was doing. If she wanted to teach Twilight Necromancy, everything was going to be all right. Twilight knocked gently upon the door to the study.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cEnter,\xe2\x80\x9d came the call.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight nudged open the door with a hoof and walked into the spacious room. Princess Luna was seated at the table they had eaten at yesterday, smiling gently at her newest apprentice. For a brief moment, Twilight thought she saw something else in the princess' eyes. But just as quickly it was gone again, leaving Twilight unsure if she had seen it or not. Twilight bowed slightly to the princess.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, waiting for be acknowledged.\r\n\r\n\tThe princess was quick to do so, beckoning her student forward and gesturing to a chair opposite her. \xe2\x80\x9cCome, Twilight. We have much to start on. I trust that your morning with your brother was satisfactory?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight jumped a little, surprised at the question. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, eh, yes, it was.\xe2\x80\x9d She stammered. \xe2\x80\x9cHow did you know about that?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna smiled. \xe2\x80\x9cI know all about your yearly excursions to the graves of your parents. It is one of the things that helps keep you going.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight was quiet a moment, slightly saddened. \xe2\x80\x9cIt does. I only wish they could be here to see me now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna reached a hoof out to ruffle Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure they can see you now, wherever they are. And I know they would be proud of their only daughter, my faithful student.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight stared up at Luna, before smiling weakly. \xe2\x80\x9cThank you, princess. I\xe2\x80\x99m going to make sure I do my best. For them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cA wise choice. As you may have surmised, today we are going to properly start your training. However, I must warn you that you must also start learning to properly wield a weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight looked to her mentor, surprised. \xe2\x80\x9cA weapon? What does a weapon have to do with learning magic?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSeveral things, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna admonished. \xe2\x80\x9cUnfortunately, seeing as I do not want to spoil so many of your lessons, I can\xe2\x80\x99t really give you a whole lot of details. But you should know, every branch of magic requires the caster to have some form of weapon. It can be something as simple as a quarterstaff, or as elegant as a glaive. Most mages settle for something small, like a dagger or swortshord, as they only study one particular branch of magic. You are, of course, free to make your decision on what type of weapon you use., yet I would suggest something capable of holding your magic potential. Now, come. We head to my personal armory.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tMore than a little confused by Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words, the unsure unicorn followed her mentor right back out of the study. They set off down a corridor with a brief pacing, barely even glancing at the guards and servants they passed. Twilight, naturally, was lost in thought. She had never heard of any branch of magic requiring a weapon before. As far as she knew, you just said an incantation aloud (if there was one) and cast the spell. But apparently this was not the case. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t overly concerned about being subpar with weaponry, however. Growing up with a brother in the guard had meant that Twilight often sparred with him whenever he came to visit, and even sometimes by herself when she was really bored and even her books couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep her company. While she has by no means mastered any one weapon, Twilight felt confident she could at least hold her own no matter what she was using.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight hadn't even noticed that she had followed Luna right out of Canterlot castle and into the nearby training grounds, situated almost right smack in the middle of the giant courtyard. She was even more surprised when Shining Armor trotted up in his full guard armor, helmet tucked under one arm. He sketched a quick bow. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna, Twilight. How can I help you two today?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m actually here to pick up a weapon for my student here, Captain Armor. We will be heading to my armory, and I must request that we do not be interrupted.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\nShining Armor saluted smartly. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, my princess!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe stallion turned to resume his duties, and Luna led Twilight over to a nondescript building a small distance away. The princess tapped the door with her horn, and the door glowed for a moment before unlocking itself and permitting the two ponies to enter. As they did so, lights flared to life, supplementing the moonlight filtering in through the ajar door. The room itself was rather small, and looked to be more of an arena than anything else. Against the far wall rested a weapons rack that held a wide assortment of weapons. The center space was dominated by a roped off rectangle, while the west and east walls held practice dummies and weapon care utensils. Luna skirted the fighting ring and approached the weapons rack, Twilight following close behind.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThis is where I store my most powerful and magical weapons. A few of them I have crafted and imbued myself. Others, I have found in my travels throughout the world. I would like to see if any of these weapons suit you. If they do not, then we\xe2\x80\x99ll return to your brother and see about having a weapon custom made for you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight approached the wall in slight awe. She could feel the magic radiating off these artifacts. There were a handful of swords of all shapes and sizes. Some quite possibly entirely too big for her, others so small they could probably pass themselves off as knives. A twin pair of axes rested on the lower left corner, while a giant longbow took up the entire right side of the rack. However, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s vision was soon dominated by a weapon that ran through the center of the rack, in all of its beautiful and deadly glory: A glaive. It was easily as long as she was tall while standing on her rear hooves, about four feet. The pole was made of ash and colored lavender, and if one looked closely, they could see the strengthening and durability enchantments upon the wood. The blade was just as impressive, one and a half feet of gleaming Nightsteel, straight and deadly. Near the end of the pole, two scarlet phoenix feathers were attached.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight breathed. That right there was what caught Luna\xe2\x80\x99s attention. Her student was very impressed.\r\n\r\n\tLuna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop a half-smirk from forming upon her lips as she stepped closer to the majestic weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was the very first weapon I even came close to mastering. I was tired of my sparring partners whacking me repeatedly when we sparred, because I just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find a weapon I was comfortable with. So I had this forged. I enjoyed the feel of a spear, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t like having to stab. I liked the idea of the cutting prowess of a short sword, but it simply didn\xe2\x80\x99t have the reach I wanted. So, I combined the two and came up with\xe2\x80\xa6 Grace.\xe2\x80\x9d As Luna spoke the name, the glaive rose gently into the air and floated over to the alicorn. It came to a hover directly over Luna\xe2\x80\x99s flat raised right hoof and remained there.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight stepped closer, examining the glaive more closely. Even going by everything that Shining had taught her, Twilight could tell this was a beautiful weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is some very expert craftsmanship. Even the enchantments protecting and making it more powerful meld seamlessly with it.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cIts name is Grace. Is this the weapon you wish to start with?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe unicorn stared at the weapon longingly. For whatever strange reason, the weapon seemed to speak to her. The entire thing seemed to have been specifically tailored towards Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too big, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too small, and she was willing to bet it would be perfectly weighted. The pole was even the same color as he fur, for Luna\xe2\x80\x99s sake!\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYes,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight whispered. She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure if she could muster up a higher volume. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, please.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tMore than happy to oblige, Luna breathed a slight word to Grace. The glaive left her hoof and meandered over to a specially designed harness, where it fit itself snugly. Smiling slightly, Luna picked the harness up in a flare of obsidian. Grace\xe2\x80\x99s holster came to a rest on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s right side while straps wound themselves gently around her barrel, keeping the weapon and harness in place. It fit like a hoof glove, completely perfect. Twilight then turned to follow her mentor, who had already left the armory. Behind them, the door clicked shut and locked itself. Then right back up to the castle the pair went, and it was not until they were past the front guards did Twilight realize they had not asked her to relinquish her weapon.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Prin--Luna? Should I really be carrying a weapon inside the castle?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna glanced back at her student for the briefest of moments. \xe2\x80\x9cAs one of my apprentices, you will find that there are certain regulations that will no longer apply to you. Being armed while in my presence is one of them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 we\xe2\x80\x99re not going to be attacked out of nowhere, are we? Is that why I\xe2\x80\x99m allowed to carry Grace?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna laughed warmly. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course we are not going to be attacked. But if we are, it would help if you were already prepared. And besides, remember that you\xe2\x80\x99re going to use your weapon in some of the magical teachings.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna entered her study again and sat down at the desk once more, waiting for Twilight to get comfortable.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIt took me a great deal of time to decide what branch of magic to start you out with,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna began. \xe2\x80\x9cI know you want to master each of them, but we can still only do one at a time. However, I recalled something that occurred the other day: You seem to be nervous about Necromancy. And so, that is what we are going to start with today.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight almost felt herself deflate a little at those words. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you sure, princess? I mean\xe2\x80\xa6 Necromancy should be reserved for unicorns with more practice with magic in general. I--I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99m ready.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTrust me my faithful student, you are more than ready. I will still be here to guide you, and will help you if it actually turns out you require aid. But the sooner we get this out of the way, the sooner we can focus on other branches, branches that you don\xe2\x80\x99t naturally fear.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried to stop her voice from shaking. \xe2\x80\x9cWhere do we start?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou start by listening to me,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna responded with a twinkle in her eye. \xe2\x80\x9cNecromancy has the potential to be the most complex branch of magic you\xe2\x80\x99ll ever explore. There are a few rules and regulations that need to be followed at all times, which you will quickly discover on your own. Since hardly anypony actually studies this type of magic, and those who do are not allowed to talk about it, Necromancy is naturally steeped in superstitions. I can assure you right now, all of those superstitions you have heard are wholly incorrect.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight went wide eyed at this. \xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6?\xe2\x80\x9d She let the sentence trail off into a question.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAnything you might have heard of Necromancy is likely to be wrong, Twilight Sparkle. When ponies do not understand something, they make up things. They create reasons, excuses as to why something is evil, or something is bad, because it is easier than simply not knowing at all.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\xa6 guess that makes sense.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight frowned dangerously. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I don\xe2\x80\x99t like making stuff up. I\xe2\x80\x99d rather learn about something, instead of just taking guesses at it.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cVery good, Twilight, and that is what makes you different from a great deal of my ponies. Now, Necromancy is very hands on. There are no special incantations, like some of other branches of magic. There are only two majorly important things in Necromancy. The willpower of the summoner, and the soul of the summoned. Since you are just now taking your first steps into this magic, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be the one summoning the soul, so that you can see how it is done.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tDespite herself, Twilight was curious. Right now it didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter if it was Necromancy or not. She was learning, and that was all that was important. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat happens then?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThen we will find out if a Link will be formed, or not.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA Link?\xe2\x80\x9d Now Twilight was just plain confused. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Link?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna only smiled mischievously. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll find out soon enough, my most faithful student. Now, watch me.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tAnd watch Twilight did. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn suddenly blazed to life, a sickly green tinged with black. As Twilight watched, Luna spoke some more. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is rather easy for me. I\xe2\x80\x99ve studied Necromancy for a long, long time, thus enabling me to summon any soul I wish, even the one I\xe2\x80\x99m not Linked to. What you are about to see will probably startle you, but I implore you to not freak out.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, transfixed by the display. Little motes of energy began falling from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn, faster and faster. The princess\xe2\x80\x99 face remained calm, collected. There was no visible strain on her face at all. Twilight marvelled at that fact. She had never seen anypony with so much control over their magic before. Quite soon, however, and Twilight was now preoccupied with something else. A dark mist began to form from thin air, taking on a vaguely pony shape. The mist began to solidify, and just was Twilight began to wonder at its purpose, the mist disappeared. In its place\xe2\x80\xa6 Was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s doppelganger. Twilight fought back a panicked scream. Her pupils dilated and her breathing began to come faster. It was taking all of her concentration to not just flip out.\r\n\r\n\tDespite her near hyperventilating state, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was doing what it did best: analyzing. The clone of Twilight Sparkle before her was the same, yet completely different. She was lighter, for starters, several shades lighter than Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s own coat and mane coloration. The lookalike also had overly bright eyes, almost shining like a lamp. The figure had started out almost insubstantial, like a ghost, but even as Twilight stared her twin seemed to further solidify, becoming more and more real every moment it stood there. But the thing that stood out the most was the fact that this clone of the original Twilight Sparkle had wings. They were perfectly serviceable, like any other pegasus--or Alicorn.\r\n\r\n\tPrincess Luna finally spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cWell met, Twilight Starshard. I\xe2\x80\x99ve not seen you in a long time.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe twin turned, her face lighting up in an easy grin. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna! I thought that was you summoning me!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIndeed. I am teaching my newest apprentice the art of Necromancy.\xe2\x80\x9d The new Twilight turned to glance back at the old one. For the briefest of moments, something flitted across her face. It was like a look of longing. The same look Twilight had thought she saw in Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes as she entered the study. In the next instant however, Starshard was grinning again, eyes alight with wonder.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo this is the one meant to be Linked to me! I wondered when somepony would show up. Twilight Starshard, at your service.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUm\xe2\x80\xa6 Twilight Sparkle. Pleased to meet you.\xe2\x80\x9d Then, unable to help herself, a veritable flood of questions came pouring from her mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cWho exactly are you? Why do you look like me? Why do you have wings?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard and Luna shared a glance. There was amusement there, but also\xe2\x80\xa6 slight hesitation? Twilight Sparkle wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure. Reading other ponies was not her strong suit.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cFirstly, I\xe2\x80\x99m Twilight Starshard. As to who I actually am\xe2\x80\xa6 I guess you could call me a physical representation of you, Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA physical representation of me?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYes. The study of life and death is full of intricacies, and even the most learned Necromancers don\xe2\x80\x99t always pretend to know all of its secrets. Basically\xe2\x80\xa6 I\xe2\x80\x99m an Alicorn who died about a thousand years ago. When Princess Luna summoned me with the intent of Linking me to you, my appearance altered to match your physical makeup.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo then,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice became very soft. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re dead?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard\xe2\x80\x99s shoulders slumped a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cI am. I have been for a great many years, now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 you\xe2\x80\x99re standing right there. You look so real!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThat got a warm chuckle from Starshard. \xe2\x80\x9cThat is because I am real. There is one part of the circle of life that is constant: Decision. When a pony dies, he or she has three choices: Rebirth, Revive, Restore. Some call them the three \xe2\x80\x98R\xe2\x80\x99s. Rebirth is a pony who does just that: The are Reborn into some form of undead. This choice is normally taken by ponies who still have unfinished business among the living. Ponies who choose to Revive are reborn into the world of the living from another womb. And ponies who choose Restore cross to the other side, to paradise. I am a pony who chose Rebirth. I came back to life as a Lich Queen, and even though my business within the living world has long been completed, once I became undead, there was no turning back.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was practically running at a thousand miles a minute. She absorbed just enough information to respond: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry that you are stuck where you are.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t mind it. I can still help out in the world of the living.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight already had another question. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Lich Queen?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA Lich Queen is an undead who controls other undead. Namely, zombies and skeletons. Those guys aren\xe2\x80\x99t usually very smart, so Lich Queens (or Kings) guide them and direct them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou mean\xe2\x80\xa6 some ponies are Rebirthed as a zombie? That sounds awful.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard shook her head. \xe2\x80\x9cMost sentient creatures rarely Rebirth into something so unpleasant. You see, those types of creatures are the result of a Necromancer breaking the number one rule of this branch of magic. There are two rules a Necromancer must always follow. The first, is that you must never, ever, force an undead being to follow your will. You ask us, and it will be up to the individual undead to decide whether or not to help you in your endeavors. If you try to bend us to your will, not only will we ignore the directive, the Necromancer will degrade into the living dead; what you just called a zombie. If a Necromancer cannot follow this rule, then they do not need to be seeking the aid of unliving. Thousands of years ago, Necromancers made this mistake in droves. They were cocky, overconfident, thinking that all of their vaunted power could not be beaten. They paid the price. But these days, there aren\xe2\x80\x99t so many. I\xe2\x80\x99m sure Princess Luna has something to do with that.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cIndeed I do. Even the staunchest of ponies can give in to the lure of power, so I try to keep them away from such a fate as much as I can.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were the size of dinner plates. She had never expected something this momentous \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s the second rule of Necromancy?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link. When its been formed, it cannot be broken for any reason. If a Necromancer tries to remove the Link, the sharing of souls, then they\xe2\x80\x99ll enter the Void. They\xe2\x80\x99ll just cease to exist. No paradise, no Rebirth, no second or third life. Just\xe2\x80\xa6 gone.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight snorted softly. \xe2\x80\x9cBut what exactly is this Link you both are talking about? You\xe2\x80\x99ve mentioned it countless times now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link is a bond shared between the Necromancer and a Soul. When a Necromacner first begins to summon, the first soul he or she summons will be one closest to their genetic makeup. Once that summoning is complete, the undead summoned and the Necromancer will have a choice: They can either form a Link, or they can continue their separate ways and the Necromancer will never try that magic again.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat does it do? Is it just for cosmetic purposes, or what?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard was already shaking her head before the words even left Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cI cannot tell you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean, you can\xe2\x80\x99t tell me?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUntil you make the decision for yourself, I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you. I\xe2\x80\x99m not really allowed to. But now that we are at this proverbial crossroads, I must ask, Friherrinna Twilena Star Sparkle av Twinkle: Do you wish to complete the Link? Do you wish to take the very first step in your training as a Necromancer of the Crown?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight was conflicted. On one hoof, this was everything she had feared about the subject laid bare before her. All of the superstitions she had heard were wrong. There was really nothing to be afraid of. But, now an undead Lich Queen was asking her to practically share her soul, if Twilight was hearing that correctly. Her life would never be the same if she accepted. Eventually, however, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s thirst for knowledge easily overpowered her fears of the unknown.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll accept,\xe2\x80\x9d she said proudly, struggling to keep her voice in check.\r\n\r\n\tStarshard, in turn, grinned slightly, like she knew Twilight was going to make this decision sooner or later. Rather than responding to the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s announcement, Starshard moved closer to Twilight. The suddenly nervous apprentice eyed the Lich Queen warily, but stood her ground. Whatever was going to happen next, Twilight was going to accept it proudly. Starshard stepped even closer, and the finally brought the length of her long, slender horn to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s smaller and stubbier one. The effect was immediate. Both let out loud gasps as a strange, unknown energy coursed through their bodies like an electric current. The power grew, and grew, swirling around the pair as they stood there, horns locked. Just as Twilight thought she would burst, the alien power suddenly changed direction--and flowed directly into Grace.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight nearly collapsed as the energy left her, Starshard supporting her gently. They were both panting like they had just ran a marathon. A distant part of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind noted that Starshard was rather warm, instead of the cold feeling she would have expected from an undead. As Twilight recovered, she felt an odd vibrating at her side. It was her glaive. The weapon slide out of its sheath and hovered right before Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, turning so that its owner could see the odd rune in the middle of the staff that had not been there previously.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\tStill partially staring at the rune in wonderment, Twilight turned to Luna, silently asking for an explanation.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIts a Necromancer Rune, Twilight. Its designed to enhance your spellcasting abilities with this branch of magic. Its why I had you obtain your weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo\xe2\x80\xa6 that\xe2\x80\x99s it? I\xe2\x80\x99m a Necromancer now?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tWell, yes and no.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGah!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight yelped as she heard a familiar voice echoing around her mind. Luna was grinning. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat was that? Some form of telepathy?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard answered her. \xe2\x80\x9cIn a nutshell, yes. Its a part of the Link. Our minds are connected, allowing us to speak no matter how far apart we are. We also have a shared aether pool. Haven\xe2\x80\x99t you felt it yet?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tNow that Starshard mentioned it, Twilight did feel\xe2\x80\xa6 Stronger. More alive. She could feel the power coursing just below her horn, ready to be unleashed. A small smile began to play across her lips. \xe2\x80\x9cSo in other words, I\xe2\x80\x99m more magically powerful?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou are,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied. \xe2\x80\x9cBut, I\xe2\x80\x99m afraid your studies in Necromancy are far from over, my faithful student. You have a Link now, that is true. But there is still a great deal to learn. Summoning and controlling lesser undead and a whole host of over things. For now, however, we may call it quits. It is far past lunchtime, and I\xe2\x80\x99m sure you\xe2\x80\x99d like to grab a bite to eat before continuing.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tNow that Luna mentioned it, Twilight was feeling hungry. Ravenous, even. But there was something still bothering her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat about you, Starshard? I mean, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re here now, but what's going to happen from here?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard chuckled. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, now that I\xe2\x80\x99m Summoned and Linked, I\xe2\x80\x99ll stay in the world of the living for as long as I want, until my Summoner sends me back for whatever reason. Right now, however, I would like the opportunity to catch up to Luna.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nodded almost absently, her curiosity sated at the moment. With a small wave of her hoof, the lavender unicorn departed.\r\n\r\n\tStarshard waited until the door was closed and she could no longer hear Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoofsteps before turning to Princess Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you think she suspects anything? Or knows?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna was already shaking her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. She\xe2\x80\x99s still in the dark. But she won\xe2\x80\x99t be for long. Twilight is incredibly smart and resourceful. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never met another pony with her drive for knowledge. She even surpasses the last Valkyrie in that regard. She\xe2\x80\x99ll figure out the truth eventually. And by then, I hope that we will have prepared her as best we can.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cI sure do hope so. I almost couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep my expression clear when I first saw her. I\xe2\x80\x99ve missed her for a very long time.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna echoed Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s sigh. \xe2\x80\x9cI know, Starshard. I have too.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n", 'chapter_number': 5, 'parent_chapter_id': 406273, 'chapter_html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'5\'></a><h3>Chapter 5 (*)</h3>\n<p class=\'indented\'>\t\tTwilight was excited. Tonight was going to be the first real night of her apprenticeship. The young unicorn had barely returned to her own quarters after the outing with Shining before a page had arrived, telling her to meet Princess Luna in her private study. Hardly able to contain her glee, Twilight had hurriedly made herself presentable and took off back down the corridor. She wondered which branch of magic Luna would teach her first. Each and every branch was important, of course, but she was secretly hoping that Luna would start with Light. Everything about that branch fascinated the bookish mare, from the extremely useful healing spells down to the simplest lighting spell. Or maybe they would start with Nature first, the magic that caused things to grow. Twilight has always wanted a small garden of her own, and maybe Luna would&nbsp;&nbsp;start with the magic that would make growing one easier. But a small part of her mind whispered that Luna would want to start with Discord magic, throwing a slight damper upon her enthusiasm.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure she would be able to handle that. A great many uneducated folk insisted that Discord-based magic was evil. Twilight scoffed at the idea, but it was true that Discord magic was\xe2\x80\xa6 well\xe2\x80\xa6 not very nice. Animosity, of course, was the opposite of Friendship. The most Twilight knew about it was that it focused on manipulating your foes, deceiving them and preventing them from becoming too attached to you. Animosity was a valued tool for unicorns in Equestria Intelligence, as it was perfect for making sure a spy kept their cover even if enemies knew they were there. Then came Destruction, a magic that took everything Light stood for and obliterated it. Destruction was probably the only branch of magic with so much raw, pure power. Then there was Chaos, a magic that focused on turning reality upside down, and Hatred, which turned your most personal feelings into a tangible weapon. Lastly\xe2\x80\xa6 there was Necromancy.</p><p class="indented double">To be honest, this was the branch of Discord magic Twilight was afraid of the most. There was so little actually published on the subject. <i>Very</i> few unicorns ever practiced Necromancy, and the ones who did were always closely watched by Princess Luna. It was rumored that bringing the dead back to life was impossible, but if it was, Necromancy would not be able to exist. Twilight was so wrapped up in her own thoughts and worries that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t even notice she had passed the hallway leading to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s study. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until she ran smack into a suit of armor she didn\xe2\x80\x99t recall being there previously that she realized her mistake. The unicorn backtracked to the correct hallway and proceeded down it, struggling to calm her nerves. Princess Luna knew what she was doing. If she wanted to teach Twilight Necromancy, everything was going to be all right. Twilight knocked gently upon the door to the study.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cEnter,\xe2\x80\x9d came the call.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight nudged open the door with a hoof and walked into the spacious room. Princess Luna was seated at the table they had eaten at yesterday, smiling gently at her newest apprentice. For a brief moment, Twilight thought she saw something else in the princess&#039; eyes. But just as quickly it was gone again, leaving Twilight unsure if she had seen it or not. Twilight bowed slightly to the princess.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, waiting for be acknowledged.</p><p class="indented double">The princess was quick to do so, beckoning her student forward and gesturing to a chair opposite her. \xe2\x80\x9cCome, Twilight. We have much to start on. I trust that your morning with your brother was satisfactory?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight jumped a little, surprised at the question. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, eh, yes, it was.\xe2\x80\x9d She stammered. \xe2\x80\x9cHow did you know about that?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna smiled. \xe2\x80\x9cI know all about your yearly excursions to the graves of your parents. It is one of the things that helps keep you going.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight was quiet a moment, slightly saddened. \xe2\x80\x9cIt does. I only wish they could be here to see me now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna reached a hoof out to ruffle Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure they <i>can</i> see you now, wherever they are. And I know they would be proud of their only daughter, my faithful student.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight stared up at Luna, before smiling weakly. \xe2\x80\x9cThank you, princess. I\xe2\x80\x99m going to make sure I do my best. For them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cA wise choice. As you may have surmised, today we are going to properly start your training. However, I must warn you that you must also start learning to properly wield a weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight looked to her mentor, surprised. \xe2\x80\x9cA weapon? What does a weapon have to do with learning magic?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSeveral things, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna admonished. \xe2\x80\x9cUnfortunately, seeing as I do not want to spoil so many of your lessons, I can\xe2\x80\x99t really give you a whole lot of details. But you should know, every branch of magic requires the caster to have some form of weapon. It can be something as simple as a quarterstaff, or as elegant as a glaive. Most mages settle for something small, like a dagger or swortshord, as they only study one particular branch of magic. You are, of course, free to make your decision on <i>what</i> type of weapon you use., yet I would suggest something capable of holding your magic potential. Now, come. We head to my personal armory.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More than a little confused by Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words, the unsure unicorn followed her mentor right back out of the study. They set off down a corridor with a brief pacing, barely even glancing at the guards and servants they passed. Twilight, naturally, was lost in thought. She had never heard of any branch of magic <i>requiring</i> a weapon before. As far as she knew, you just said an incantation aloud (if there was one) and cast the spell. But apparently this was not the case. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t overly concerned about being subpar with weaponry, however. Growing up with a brother in the guard had meant that Twilight often sparred with him whenever he came to visit, and even sometimes by herself when she was really bored and even her books couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep her company. While she has by no means mastered any one weapon, Twilight felt confident she could at least hold her own no matter what she was using.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight hadn&#039;t even noticed that she had followed Luna right out of Canterlot castle and into the nearby training grounds, situated almost right smack in the middle of the giant courtyard. She was even more surprised when Shining Armor trotted up in his full guard armor, helmet tucked under one arm. He sketched a quick bow. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna, Twilight. How can I help you two today?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m actually here to pick up a weapon for my student here, Captain Armor. We will be heading to my armory, and I must request that we do not be interrupted.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Shining Armor saluted smartly. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, my princess!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The stallion turned to resume his duties, and Luna led Twilight over to a nondescript building a small distance away. The princess tapped the door with her horn, and the door glowed for a moment before unlocking itself and permitting the two ponies to enter. As they did so, lights flared to life, supplementing the moonlight filtering in through the ajar door. The room itself was rather small, and looked to be more of an arena than anything else. Against the far wall rested a weapons rack that held a wide assortment of weapons. The center space was dominated by a roped off rectangle, while the west and east walls held practice dummies and weapon care utensils. Luna skirted the fighting ring and approached the weapons rack, Twilight following close behind.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThis is where I store my most powerful and magical weapons. A few of them I have crafted and imbued myself. Others, I have found in my travels throughout the world. I would like to see if any of these weapons suit you. If they do not, then we\xe2\x80\x99ll return to your brother and see about having a weapon custom made for you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight approached the wall in slight awe. She could <i>feel</i> the magic radiating off these artifacts. There were a handful of swords of all shapes and sizes. Some quite possibly entirely too big for her, others so small they could probably pass themselves off as knives. A twin pair of axes rested on the lower left corner, while a giant longbow took up the entire right side of the rack. However, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s vision was soon dominated by a weapon that ran through the center of the rack, in all of its beautiful and deadly glory: A glaive. It was easily as long as she was tall while standing on her rear hooves, about four feet. The pole was made of ash and colored lavender, and if one looked closely, they could see the strengthening and durability enchantments upon the wood. The blade was just as impressive, one and a half feet of gleaming <i>Nightsteel</i>, straight and deadly. Near the end of the pole, two scarlet phoenix feathers were attached.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight breathed. That right there was what caught Luna\xe2\x80\x99s attention. Her student was very impressed.</p><p class="indented double">Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop a half-smirk from forming upon her lips as she stepped closer to the majestic weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was the very first weapon I even came close to mastering. I was tired of my sparring partners whacking me repeatedly when we sparred, because I just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find a weapon I was comfortable with. So I had this forged. I enjoyed the feel of a spear, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t like having to stab. I liked the idea of the cutting prowess of a short sword, but it simply didn\xe2\x80\x99t have the reach I wanted. So, I combined the two and came up with\xe2\x80\xa6 <i>Grace</i>.\xe2\x80\x9d As Luna spoke the name, the glaive rose gently into the air and floated over to the alicorn. It came to a hover directly over Luna\xe2\x80\x99s flat raised right hoof and remained there.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight stepped closer, examining the glaive more closely. Even going by everything that Shining had taught her, Twilight could tell this was a beautiful weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is some very expert craftsmanship. Even the enchantments protecting and making it more powerful meld seamlessly with it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cIts name is <i>Grace</i>. Is this the weapon you wish to start with?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The unicorn stared at the weapon longingly. For whatever strange reason, the weapon seemed to speak to her. The entire thing seemed to have been specifically tailored towards Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too big, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too small, and she was willing to bet it would be perfectly weighted. The pole was even the same color as he fur, for Luna\xe2\x80\x99s sake!</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight whispered. She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure if she could muster up a higher volume. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, please.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More than happy to oblige, Luna breathed a slight word to <i>Grace</i>. The glaive left her hoof and meandered over to a specially designed harness, where it fit itself snugly. Smiling slightly, Luna picked the harness up in a flare of obsidian. <i>Grace</i>\xe2\x80\x99s holster came to a rest on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s right side while straps wound themselves gently around her barrel, keeping the weapon and harness in place. It fit like a hoof glove, completely perfect. Twilight then turned to follow her mentor, who had already left the armory. Behind them, the door clicked shut and locked itself. Then right back up to the castle the pair went, and it was not until they were past the front guards did Twilight realize they had not asked her to relinquish her weapon.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Prin--Luna? Should I really be carrying a weapon inside the castle?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna glanced back at her student for the briefest of moments. \xe2\x80\x9cAs one of my apprentices, you will find that there are certain regulations that will no longer apply to you. Being armed while in my presence is one of them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 we\xe2\x80\x99re not going to be attacked out of nowhere, are we? Is that why I\xe2\x80\x99m allowed to carry <i>Grace</i>?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna laughed warmly. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course we are not going to be attacked. But if we are, it would help if you were already prepared. And besides, remember that you\xe2\x80\x99re going to use your weapon in some of the magical teachings.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna entered her study again and sat down at the desk once more, waiting for Twilight to get comfortable.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt took me a great deal of time to decide what branch of magic to start you out with,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna began. \xe2\x80\x9cI know you want to master each of them, but we can still only do one at a time. However, I recalled something that occurred the other day: You seem to be nervous about Necromancy. And so, that is what we are going to start with today.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight almost felt herself deflate a little at those words. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you sure, princess? I mean\xe2\x80\xa6 Necromancy should be reserved for unicorns with more practice with magic in general. I--I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99m ready.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cTrust me my faithful student, you are more than ready. I will still be here to guide you, and will help you if it actually turns out you require aid. But the sooner we get this out of the way, the sooner we can focus on other branches, branches that you don\xe2\x80\x99t naturally fear.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried to stop her voice from shaking. \xe2\x80\x9cWhere do we start?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou start by listening to me,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna responded with a twinkle in her eye. \xe2\x80\x9cNecromancy has the potential to be the most complex branch of magic you\xe2\x80\x99ll ever explore. There are a few rules and regulations that need to be followed at all times, which you will quickly discover on your own. Since hardly anypony actually studies this type of magic, and those who do are not allowed to talk about it, Necromancy is naturally steeped in superstitions. I can assure you right now, all of those superstitions you have heard are wholly incorrect.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight went wide eyed at this. \xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6?\xe2\x80\x9d She let the sentence trail off into a question.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnything you might have heard of Necromancy is likely to be wrong, Twilight Sparkle. When ponies do not understand something, they make up things. They create reasons, excuses as to why something is evil, or something is bad, because it is easier than simply not knowing at all.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\xa6 guess that makes sense.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight frowned dangerously. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I don\xe2\x80\x99t like making stuff up. I\xe2\x80\x99d rather learn about something, instead of just taking guesses at it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cVery good, Twilight, and that is what makes you different from a great deal of my ponies. Now, Necromancy is very hands on. There are no special incantations, like some of other branches of magic. There are only two majorly important things in Necromancy. The willpower of the summoner, and the soul of the summoned. Since you are just now taking your first steps into this magic, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be the one summoning the soul, so that you can see how it is done.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Despite herself, Twilight was curious. Right now it didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter if it was Necromancy or not. She was learning, and that was all that was important. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat happens then?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThen we will find out if a Link will be formed, or not.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA Link?\xe2\x80\x9d Now Twilight was just plain confused. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Link?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna only smiled mischievously. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll find out soon enough, my most faithful student. Now, watch me.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">And watch Twilight did. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn suddenly blazed to life, a sickly green tinged with black. As Twilight watched, Luna spoke some more. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is rather easy for me. I\xe2\x80\x99ve studied Necromancy for a long, long time, thus enabling me to summon any soul I wish, even the one I\xe2\x80\x99m not Linked to. What you are about to see will probably startle you, but I implore you to not freak out.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, transfixed by the display. Little motes of energy began falling from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn, faster and faster. The princess\xe2\x80\x99 face remained calm, collected. There was no visible strain on her face at all. Twilight marvelled at that fact. She had never seen anypony with so much control over their magic before. Quite soon, however, and Twilight was now preoccupied with something else. A dark mist began to form from thin air, taking on a vaguely pony shape. The mist began to solidify, and just was Twilight began to wonder at its purpose, the mist disappeared. In its place\xe2\x80\xa6 Was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s doppelganger. Twilight fought back a panicked scream. Her pupils dilated and her breathing began to come faster. It was taking all of her concentration to not just flip out.</p><p class="indented double">Despite her near hyperventilating state, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was doing what it did best: analyzing. The clone of Twilight Sparkle before her was the same, yet completely different. She was lighter, for starters, several shades lighter than Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s own coat and mane coloration. The lookalike also had overly bright eyes, almost shining like a lamp. The figure had started out almost insubstantial, like a ghost, but even as Twilight stared her twin seemed to further solidify, becoming more and more real every moment it stood there. But the thing that stood out the most was the fact that this clone of the original Twilight Sparkle had <i>wings</i>. They were perfectly serviceable, like any other pegasus--or Alicorn.</p><p class="indented double">Princess Luna finally spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cWell met, Twilight Starshard. I\xe2\x80\x99ve not seen you in a long time.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The twin turned, her face lighting up in an easy grin. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna! I thought that was <i>you</i> summoning me!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIndeed. I am teaching my newest apprentice the art of Necromancy.\xe2\x80\x9d The new Twilight turned to glance back at the old one. For the briefest of moments, something flitted across her face. It was like a look of longing. The same look Twilight had thought she saw in Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes as she entered the study. In the next instant however, Starshard was grinning again, eyes alight with wonder.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo <i>this</i> is the one meant to be Linked to me! I wondered when somepony would show up. Twilight Starshard, at your service.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUm\xe2\x80\xa6 Twilight Sparkle. Pleased to meet you.\xe2\x80\x9d Then, unable to help herself, a veritable flood of questions came pouring from her mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cWho exactly are you? Why do you look like me? Why do you have <i>wings</i>?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard and Luna shared a glance. There was amusement there, but also\xe2\x80\xa6 slight hesitation? Twilight Sparkle wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure. Reading other ponies was not her strong suit.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cFirstly, I\xe2\x80\x99m Twilight Starshard. As to who I actually am\xe2\x80\xa6 I guess you could call me a physical representation of you, Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA physical representation of me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes. The study of life and death is full of intricacies, and even the most learned Necromancers don\xe2\x80\x99t always pretend to know all of its secrets. Basically\xe2\x80\xa6 I\xe2\x80\x99m an Alicorn who died about a thousand years ago. When Princess Luna summoned me with the intent of Linking me to you, my appearance altered to match your physical makeup.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo then,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice became very soft. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re dead?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s shoulders slumped a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cI am. I have been for a great many years, now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 you\xe2\x80\x99re standing right there. You look so real!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">That got a warm chuckle from Starshard. \xe2\x80\x9cThat is because I <i>am</i> real. There is one part of the circle of life that is constant: Decision. When a pony dies, he or she has three choices: Rebirth, Revive, Restore. Some call them the three \xe2\x80\x98R\xe2\x80\x99s. Rebirth is a pony who does just that: The are Reborn into some form of undead. This choice is normally taken by ponies who still have unfinished business among the living. Ponies who choose to Revive are reborn into the world of the living from another womb. And ponies who choose Restore cross to the other side, to paradise. I am a pony who chose Rebirth. I came back to life as a Lich Queen, and even though my business within the living world has long been completed, once I became undead, there was no turning back.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was practically running at a thousand miles a minute. She absorbed just enough information to respond: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry that you are stuck where you are.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t mind it. I can still help out in the world of the living.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight already had another question. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Lich Queen?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA Lich Queen is an undead who controls other undead. Namely, zombies and skeletons. Those guys aren\xe2\x80\x99t usually very smart, so Lich Queens (or Kings) guide them and direct them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou mean\xe2\x80\xa6 some ponies are Rebirthed as a zombie? That sounds awful.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard shook her head. \xe2\x80\x9cMost sentient creatures rarely Rebirth into something so unpleasant. You see, those types of creatures are the result of a Necromancer breaking the number one rule of this branch of magic. There are two rules a Necromancer must always follow. The first, is that you must never, ever, <i>force</i> an undead being to follow your will. You ask us, and it will be up to the individual undead to decide whether or not to help you in your endeavors. If you try to bend us to your will, not only will we ignore the directive, the Necromancer will degrade into the living dead; what you just called a zombie. If a Necromancer cannot follow this rule, then they do not need to be seeking the aid of unliving. Thousands of years ago, Necromancers made this mistake in droves. They were cocky, overconfident, thinking that all of their vaunted power could not be beaten. They paid the price. But these days, there aren\xe2\x80\x99t so many. I\xe2\x80\x99m sure Princess Luna has something to do with that.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cIndeed I do. Even the staunchest of ponies can give in to the lure of power, so I try to keep them away from such a fate as much as I can.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were the size of dinner plates. She had never expected something this momentous \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s the second rule of Necromancy?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link. When its been formed, it cannot be broken for any reason. If a Necromancer tries to remove the Link, the sharing of souls, then they\xe2\x80\x99ll enter the Void. They\xe2\x80\x99ll just cease to exist. No paradise, no Rebirth, no second or third life.
