Just\xe2\x80\xa6 gone.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight snorted softly. \xe2\x80\x9cBut what exactly <i>is</i> this Link you both are talking about? You\xe2\x80\x99ve mentioned it countless times now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link is a bond shared between the Necromancer and a Soul. When a Necromacner first begins to summon, the first soul he or she summons will be one closest to their genetic makeup. Once that summoning is complete, the undead summoned and the Necromancer will have a choice: They can either form a Link, or they can continue their separate ways and the Necromancer will never try that magic again.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat does it do? Is it just for cosmetic purposes, or what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard was already shaking her head before the words even left Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cI cannot tell you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean, you can\xe2\x80\x99t tell me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUntil you make the decision for yourself, I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you. I\xe2\x80\x99m not really allowed to. But now that we are at this proverbial crossroads, I must ask, Friherrinna Twilena Star Sparkle av Twinkle: Do you wish to complete the Link? Do you wish to take the very first step in your training as a Necromancer of the Crown?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight was conflicted. On one hoof, this was everything she had feared about the subject laid bare before her. All of the superstitions she had heard were wrong. There was really nothing to be afraid of. But, now an undead Lich Queen was asking her to practically share her soul, if Twilight was hearing that correctly. Her life would never be the same if she accepted. Eventually, however, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s thirst for knowledge easily overpowered her fears of the unknown.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll accept,\xe2\x80\x9d she said proudly, struggling to keep her voice in check.</p><p class="indented double">Starshard, in turn, grinned slightly, like she knew Twilight was going to make this decision sooner or later. Rather than responding to the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s announcement, Starshard moved closer to Twilight. The suddenly nervous apprentice eyed the Lich Queen warily, but stood her ground. Whatever was going to happen next, Twilight was going to accept it proudly. Starshard stepped even closer, and the finally brought the length of her long, slender horn to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s smaller and stubbier one. The effect was immediate. Both let out loud gasps as a strange, unknown energy coursed through their bodies like an electric current. The power grew, and grew, swirling around the pair as they stood there, horns locked. Just as Twilight thought she would burst, the alien power suddenly changed direction--and flowed directly into <i>Grace</i>.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight nearly collapsed as the energy left her, Starshard supporting her gently. They were both panting like they had just ran a marathon. A distant part of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind noted that Starshard was rather warm, instead of the cold feeling she would have expected from an undead. As Twilight recovered, she felt an odd vibrating at her side. It was her glaive. The weapon slide out of its sheath and hovered right before Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, turning so that its owner could see the odd rune in the middle of the staff that had not been there previously.</p><p class="double"><img src="http://pvpgamer.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/necromancer.png" class="user_image" /></p><p class="indented double">Still partially staring at the rune in wonderment, Twilight turned to Luna, silently asking for an explanation.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIts a Necromancer Rune, Twilight. Its designed to enhance your spellcasting abilities with this branch of magic. Its why I had you obtain your weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo\xe2\x80\xa6 that\xe2\x80\x99s it? I\xe2\x80\x99m a Necromancer now?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double"><i>Well, yes and no.</i></p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cGah!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight yelped as she heard a familiar voice echoing around her mind. Luna was grinning. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat was that? Some form of telepathy?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard answered her. \xe2\x80\x9cIn a nutshell, yes. Its a part of the Link. Our minds are connected, allowing us to speak no matter how far apart we are. We also have a shared aether pool. Haven\xe2\x80\x99t you felt it yet?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Now that Starshard mentioned it, Twilight did feel\xe2\x80\xa6 Stronger. More alive. She could feel the power coursing just below her horn, ready to be unleashed. A small smile began to play across her lips. \xe2\x80\x9cSo in other words, I\xe2\x80\x99m more magically powerful?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou are,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied. \xe2\x80\x9cBut, I\xe2\x80\x99m afraid your studies in Necromancy are far from over, my faithful student. You have a Link now, that is true. But there is still a great deal to learn. Summoning and controlling lesser undead and a whole host of over things. For now, however, we may call it quits. It is far past lunchtime, and I\xe2\x80\x99m sure you\xe2\x80\x99d like to grab a bite to eat before continuing.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Now that Luna mentioned it, Twilight was feeling hungry. Ravenous, even. But there was something still bothering her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat about you, Starshard? I mean, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re here now, but what&#039;s going to happen from here?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard chuckled. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, now that I\xe2\x80\x99m Summoned and Linked, I\xe2\x80\x99ll stay in the world of the living for as long as I want, until my Summoner sends me back for whatever reason. Right now, however, I would like the opportunity to catch up to Luna.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nodded almost absently, her curiosity sated at the moment. With a small wave of her hoof, the lavender unicorn departed.</p><p class="indented double">Starshard waited until the door was closed and she could no longer hear Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoofsteps before turning to Princess Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you think she suspects anything? Or knows?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna was already shaking her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. She\xe2\x80\x99s still in the dark. But she won\xe2\x80\x99t be for long. Twilight is incredibly smart and resourceful. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never met another pony with her drive for knowledge. She even surpasses the last Valkyrie in that regard. She\xe2\x80\x99ll figure out the truth eventually. And by then, I hope that we will have prepared her as best we can.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cI sure do hope so. I almost couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep my expression clear when I first saw her. I\xe2\x80\x99ve missed her for a very long time.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna echoed Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s sigh. \xe2\x80\x9cI know, Starshard. I have too.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'version': 1, 'parent_story_id': 104188}, 'chapter_id': 406273, 'cursor': <mysql.connector.cursor.MySQLCursor object at 0x02E29D50>, 'connection': <mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection object at 0x02E01A70>, 'html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'5\'></a><h3>Chapter 5 (*)</h3>\n<p class=\'indented\'>\t\tTwilight was excited. Tonight was going to be the first real night of her apprenticeship. The young unicorn had barely returned to her own quarters after the outing with Shining before a page had arrived, telling her to meet Princess Luna in her private study. Hardly able to contain her glee, Twilight had hurriedly made herself presentable and took off back down the corridor. She wondered which branch of magic Luna would teach her first. Each and every branch was important, of course, but she was secretly hoping that Luna would start with Light. Everything about that branch fascinated the bookish mare, from the extremely useful healing spells down to the simplest lighting spell. Or maybe they would start with Nature first, the magic that caused things to grow. Twilight has always wanted a small garden of her own, and maybe Luna would&nbsp;&nbsp;start with the magic that would make growing one easier. But a small part of her mind whispered that Luna would want to start with Discord magic, throwing a slight damper upon her enthusiasm.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure she would be able to handle that. A great many uneducated folk insisted that Discord-based magic was evil. Twilight scoffed at the idea, but it was true that Discord magic was\xe2\x80\xa6 well\xe2\x80\xa6 not very nice. Animosity, of course, was the opposite of Friendship. The most Twilight knew about it was that it focused on manipulating your foes, deceiving them and preventing them from becoming too attached to you. Animosity was a valued tool for unicorns in Equestria Intelligence, as it was perfect for making sure a spy kept their cover even if enemies knew they were there. Then came Destruction, a magic that took everything Light stood for and obliterated it. Destruction was probably the only branch of magic with so much raw, pure power. Then there was Chaos, a magic that focused on turning reality upside down, and Hatred, which turned your most personal feelings into a tangible weapon. Lastly\xe2\x80\xa6 there was Necromancy.</p><p class="indented double">To be honest, this was the branch of Discord magic Twilight was afraid of the most. There was so little actually published on the subject. <i>Very</i> few unicorns ever practiced Necromancy, and the ones who did were always closely watched by Princess Luna. It was rumored that bringing the dead back to life was impossible, but if it was, Necromancy would not be able to exist. Twilight was so wrapped up in her own thoughts and worries that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t even notice she had passed the hallway leading to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s study. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until she ran smack into a suit of armor she didn\xe2\x80\x99t recall being there previously that she realized her mistake. The unicorn backtracked to the correct hallway and proceeded down it, struggling to calm her nerves. Princess Luna knew what she was doing. If she wanted to teach Twilight Necromancy, everything was going to be all right. Twilight knocked gently upon the door to the study.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cEnter,\xe2\x80\x9d came the call.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight nudged open the door with a hoof and walked into the spacious room. Princess Luna was seated at the table they had eaten at yesterday, smiling gently at her newest apprentice. For a brief moment, Twilight thought she saw something else in the princess&#039; eyes. But just as quickly it was gone again, leaving Twilight unsure if she had seen it or not. Twilight bowed slightly to the princess.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, waiting for be acknowledged.</p><p class="indented double">The princess was quick to do so, beckoning her student forward and gesturing to a chair opposite her. \xe2\x80\x9cCome, Twilight. We have much to start on. I trust that your morning with your brother was satisfactory?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight jumped a little, surprised at the question. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, eh, yes, it was.\xe2\x80\x9d She stammered. \xe2\x80\x9cHow did you know about that?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna smiled. \xe2\x80\x9cI know all about your yearly excursions to the graves of your parents. It is one of the things that helps keep you going.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight was quiet a moment, slightly saddened. \xe2\x80\x9cIt does. I only wish they could be here to see me now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna reached a hoof out to ruffle Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure they <i>can</i> see you now, wherever they are. And I know they would be proud of their only daughter, my faithful student.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight stared up at Luna, before smiling weakly. \xe2\x80\x9cThank you, princess. I\xe2\x80\x99m going to make sure I do my best. For them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cA wise choice. As you may have surmised, today we are going to properly start your training. However, I must warn you that you must also start learning to properly wield a weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight looked to her mentor, surprised. \xe2\x80\x9cA weapon? What does a weapon have to do with learning magic?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSeveral things, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna admonished. \xe2\x80\x9cUnfortunately, seeing as I do not want to spoil so many of your lessons, I can\xe2\x80\x99t really give you a whole lot of details. But you should know, every branch of magic requires the caster to have some form of weapon. It can be something as simple as a quarterstaff, or as elegant as a glaive. Most mages settle for something small, like a dagger or swortshord, as they only study one particular branch of magic. You are, of course, free to make your decision on <i>what</i> type of weapon you use., yet I would suggest something capable of holding your magic potential. Now, come. We head to my personal armory.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More than a little confused by Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words, the unsure unicorn followed her mentor right back out of the study. They set off down a corridor with a brief pacing, barely even glancing at the guards and servants they passed. Twilight, naturally, was lost in thought. She had never heard of any branch of magic <i>requiring</i> a weapon before. As far as she knew, you just said an incantation aloud (if there was one) and cast the spell. But apparently this was not the case. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t overly concerned about being subpar with weaponry, however. Growing up with a brother in the guard had meant that Twilight often sparred with him whenever he came to visit, and even sometimes by herself when she was really bored and even her books couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep her company. While she has by no means mastered any one weapon, Twilight felt confident she could at least hold her own no matter what she was using.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight hadn&#039;t even noticed that she had followed Luna right out of Canterlot castle and into the nearby training grounds, situated almost right smack in the middle of the giant courtyard. She was even more surprised when Shining Armor trotted up in his full guard armor, helmet tucked under one arm. He sketched a quick bow. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna, Twilight. How can I help you two today?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m actually here to pick up a weapon for my student here, Captain Armor. We will be heading to my armory, and I must request that we do not be interrupted.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Shining Armor saluted smartly. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, my princess!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The stallion turned to resume his duties, and Luna led Twilight over to a nondescript building a small distance away. The princess tapped the door with her horn, and the door glowed for a moment before unlocking itself and permitting the two ponies to enter. As they did so, lights flared to life, supplementing the moonlight filtering in through the ajar door. The room itself was rather small, and looked to be more of an arena than anything else. Against the far wall rested a weapons rack that held a wide assortment of weapons. The center space was dominated by a roped off rectangle, while the west and east walls held practice dummies and weapon care utensils. Luna skirted the fighting ring and approached the weapons rack, Twilight following close behind.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThis is where I store my most powerful and magical weapons. A few of them I have crafted and imbued myself. Others, I have found in my travels throughout the world. I would like to see if any of these weapons suit you. If they do not, then we\xe2\x80\x99ll return to your brother and see about having a weapon custom made for you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight approached the wall in slight awe. She could <i>feel</i> the magic radiating off these artifacts. There were a handful of swords of all shapes and sizes. Some quite possibly entirely too big for her, others so small they could probably pass themselves off as knives. A twin pair of axes rested on the lower left corner, while a giant longbow took up the entire right side of the rack. However, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s vision was soon dominated by a weapon that ran through the center of the rack, in all of its beautiful and deadly glory: A glaive. It was easily as long as she was tall while standing on her rear hooves, about four feet. The pole was made of ash and colored lavender, and if one looked closely, they could see the strengthening and durability enchantments upon the wood. The blade was just as impressive, one and a half feet of gleaming <i>Nightsteel</i>, straight and deadly. Near the end of the pole, two scarlet phoenix feathers were attached.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight breathed. That right there was what caught Luna\xe2\x80\x99s attention. Her student was very impressed.</p><p class="indented double">Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop a half-smirk from forming upon her lips as she stepped closer to the majestic weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was the very first weapon I even came close to mastering. I was tired of my sparring partners whacking me repeatedly when we sparred, because I just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find a weapon I was comfortable with. So I had this forged. I enjoyed the feel of a spear, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t like having to stab. I liked the idea of the cutting prowess of a short sword, but it simply didn\xe2\x80\x99t have the reach I wanted. So, I combined the two and came up with\xe2\x80\xa6 <i>Grace</i>.\xe2\x80\x9d As Luna spoke the name, the glaive rose gently into the air and floated over to the alicorn. It came to a hover directly over Luna\xe2\x80\x99s flat raised right hoof and remained there.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight stepped closer, examining the glaive more closely. Even going by everything that Shining had taught her, Twilight could tell this was a beautiful weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is some very expert craftsmanship. Even the enchantments protecting and making it more powerful meld seamlessly with it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cIts name is <i>Grace</i>. Is this the weapon you wish to start with?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The unicorn stared at the weapon longingly. For whatever strange reason, the weapon seemed to speak to her. The entire thing seemed to have been specifically tailored towards Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too big, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too small, and she was willing to bet it would be perfectly weighted. The pole was even the same color as he fur, for Luna\xe2\x80\x99s sake!</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight whispered. She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure if she could muster up a higher volume. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, please.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More than happy to oblige, Luna breathed a slight word to <i>Grace</i>. The glaive left her hoof and meandered over to a specially designed harness, where it fit itself snugly. Smiling slightly, Luna picked the harness up in a flare of obsidian. <i>Grace</i>\xe2\x80\x99s holster came to a rest on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s right side while straps wound themselves gently around her barrel, keeping the weapon and harness in place. It fit like a hoof glove, completely perfect. Twilight then turned to follow her mentor, who had already left the armory. Behind them, the door clicked shut and locked itself. Then right back up to the castle the pair went, and it was not until they were past the front guards did Twilight realize they had not asked her to relinquish her weapon.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Prin--Luna? Should I really be carrying a weapon inside the castle?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna glanced back at her student for the briefest of moments. \xe2\x80\x9cAs one of my apprentices, you will find that there are certain regulations that will no longer apply to you. Being armed while in my presence is one of them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 we\xe2\x80\x99re not going to be attacked out of nowhere, are we? Is that why I\xe2\x80\x99m allowed to carry <i>Grace</i>?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna laughed warmly. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course we are not going to be attacked. But if we are, it would help if you were already prepared. And besides, remember that you\xe2\x80\x99re going to use your weapon in some of the magical teachings.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna entered her study again and sat down at the desk once more, waiting for Twilight to get comfortable.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt took me a great deal of time to decide what branch of magic to start you out with,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna began. \xe2\x80\x9cI know you want to master each of them, but we can still only do one at a time. However, I recalled something that occurred the other day: You seem to be nervous about Necromancy. And so, that is what we are going to start with today.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight almost felt herself deflate a little at those words. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you sure, princess? I mean\xe2\x80\xa6 Necromancy should be reserved for unicorns with more practice with magic in general. I--I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99m ready.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cTrust me my faithful student, you are more than ready. I will still be here to guide you, and will help you if it actually turns out you require aid. But the sooner we get this out of the way, the sooner we can focus on other branches, branches that you don\xe2\x80\x99t naturally fear.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried to stop her voice from shaking. \xe2\x80\x9cWhere do we start?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou start by listening to me,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna responded with a twinkle in her eye. \xe2\x80\x9cNecromancy has the potential to be the most complex branch of magic you\xe2\x80\x99ll ever explore. There are a few rules and regulations that need to be followed at all times, which you will quickly discover on your own. Since hardly anypony actually studies this type of magic, and those who do are not allowed to talk about it, Necromancy is naturally steeped in superstitions. I can assure you right now, all of those superstitions you have heard are wholly incorrect.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight went wide eyed at this. \xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6?\xe2\x80\x9d She let the sentence trail off into a question.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnything you might have heard of Necromancy is likely to be wrong, Twilight Sparkle. When ponies do not understand something, they make up things. They create reasons, excuses as to why something is evil, or something is bad, because it is easier than simply not knowing at all.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\xa6 guess that makes sense.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight frowned dangerously. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I don\xe2\x80\x99t like making stuff up. I\xe2\x80\x99d rather learn about something, instead of just taking guesses at it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cVery good, Twilight, and that is what makes you different from a great deal of my ponies. Now, Necromancy is very hands on. There are no special incantations, like some of other branches of magic. There are only two majorly important things in Necromancy. The willpower of the summoner, and the soul of the summoned. Since you are just now taking your first steps into this magic, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be the one summoning the soul, so that you can see how it is done.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Despite herself, Twilight was curious. Right now it didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter if it was Necromancy or not. She was learning, and that was all that was important. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat happens then?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThen we will find out if a Link will be formed, or not.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA Link?\xe2\x80\x9d Now Twilight was just plain confused. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Link?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna only smiled mischievously. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll find out soon enough, my most faithful student. Now, watch me.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">And watch Twilight did. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn suddenly blazed to life, a sickly green tinged with black. As Twilight watched, Luna spoke some more. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is rather easy for me. I\xe2\x80\x99ve studied Necromancy for a long, long time, thus enabling me to summon any soul I wish, even the one I\xe2\x80\x99m not Linked to. What you are about to see will probably startle you, but I implore you to not freak out.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, transfixed by the display. Little motes of energy began falling from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn, faster and faster. The princess\xe2\x80\x99 face remained calm, collected. There was no visible strain on her face at all. Twilight marvelled at that fact. She had never seen anypony with so much control over their magic before. Quite soon, however, and Twilight was now preoccupied with something else. A dark mist began to form from thin air, taking on a vaguely pony shape. The mist began to solidify, and just was Twilight began to wonder at its purpose, the mist disappeared. In its place\xe2\x80\xa6 Was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s doppelganger. Twilight fought back a panicked scream. Her pupils dilated and her breathing began to come faster. It was taking all of her concentration to not just flip out.</p><p class="indented double">Despite her near hyperventilating state, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was doing what it did best: analyzing. The clone of Twilight Sparkle before her was the same, yet completely different. She was lighter, for starters, several shades lighter than Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s own coat and mane coloration. The lookalike also had overly bright eyes, almost shining like a lamp. The figure had started out almost insubstantial, like a ghost, but even as Twilight stared her twin seemed to further solidify, becoming more and more real every moment it stood there. But the thing that stood out the most was the fact that this clone of the original Twilight Sparkle had <i>wings</i>. They were perfectly serviceable, like any other pegasus--or Alicorn.</p><p class="indented double">Princess Luna finally spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cWell met, Twilight Starshard. I\xe2\x80\x99ve not seen you in a long time.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The twin turned, her face lighting up in an easy grin. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna! I thought that was <i>you</i> summoning me!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIndeed. I am teaching my newest apprentice the art of Necromancy.\xe2\x80\x9d The new Twilight turned to glance back at the old one. For the briefest of moments, something flitted across her face. It was like a look of longing. The same look Twilight had thought she saw in Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes as she entered the study. In the next instant however, Starshard was grinning again, eyes alight with wonder.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo <i>this</i> is the one meant to be Linked to me! I wondered when somepony would show up. Twilight Starshard, at your service.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUm\xe2\x80\xa6 Twilight Sparkle. Pleased to meet you.\xe2\x80\x9d Then, unable to help herself, a veritable flood of questions came pouring from her mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cWho exactly are you? Why do you look like me? Why do you have <i>wings</i>?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard and Luna shared a glance. There was amusement there, but also\xe2\x80\xa6 slight hesitation? Twilight Sparkle wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure. Reading other ponies was not her strong suit.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cFirstly, I\xe2\x80\x99m Twilight Starshard. As to who I actually am\xe2\x80\xa6 I guess you could call me a physical representation of you, Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA physical representation of me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes. The study of life and death is full of intricacies, and even the most learned Necromancers don\xe2\x80\x99t always pretend to know all of its secrets. Basically\xe2\x80\xa6 I\xe2\x80\x99m an Alicorn who died about a thousand years ago. When Princess Luna summoned me with the intent of Linking me to you, my appearance altered to match your physical makeup.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo then,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice became very soft. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re dead?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s shoulders slumped a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cI am. I have been for a great many years, now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 you\xe2\x80\x99re standing right there. You look so real!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">That got a warm chuckle from Starshard. \xe2\x80\x9cThat is because I <i>am</i> real. There is one part of the circle of life that is constant: Decision. When a pony dies, he or she has three choices: Rebirth, Revive, Restore. Some call them the three \xe2\x80\x98R\xe2\x80\x99s. Rebirth is a pony who does just that: The are Reborn into some form of undead. This choice is normally taken by ponies who still have unfinished business among the living. Ponies who choose to Revive are reborn into the world of the living from another womb. And ponies who choose Restore cross to the other side, to paradise. I am a pony who chose Rebirth. I came back to life as a Lich Queen, and even though my business within the living world has long been completed, once I became undead, there was no turning back.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was practically running at a thousand miles a minute. She absorbed just enough information to respond: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry that you are stuck where you are.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t mind it. I can still help out in the world of the living.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight already had another question. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Lich Queen?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA Lich Queen is an undead who controls other undead. Namely, zombies and skeletons. Those guys aren\xe2\x80\x99t usually very smart, so Lich Queens (or Kings) guide them and direct them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou mean\xe2\x80\xa6 some ponies are Rebirthed as a zombie? That sounds awful.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard shook her head. \xe2\x80\x9cMost sentient creatures rarely Rebirth into something so unpleasant. You see, those types of creatures are the result of a Necromancer breaking the number one rule of this branch of magic. There are two rules a Necromancer must always follow. The first, is that you must never, ever, <i>force</i> an undead being to follow your will. You ask us, and it will be up to the individual undead to decide whether or not to help you in your endeavors. If you try to bend us to your will, not only will we ignore the directive, the Necromancer will degrade into the living dead; what you just called a zombie. If a Necromancer cannot follow this rule, then they do not need to be seeking the aid of unliving. Thousands of years ago, Necromancers made this mistake in droves. They were cocky, overconfident, thinking that all of their vaunted power could not be beaten. They paid the price. But these days, there aren\xe2\x80\x99t so many. I\xe2\x80\x99m sure Princess Luna has something to do with that.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cIndeed I do. Even the staunchest of ponies can give in to the lure of power, so I try to keep them away from such a fate as much as I can.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were the size of dinner plates. She had never expected something this momentous \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s the second rule of Necromancy?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link. When its been formed, it cannot be broken for any reason. If a Necromancer tries to remove the Link, the sharing of souls, then they\xe2\x80\x99ll enter the Void. They\xe2\x80\x99ll just cease to exist. No paradise, no Rebirth, no second or third life. Just\xe2\x80\xa6 gone.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight snorted softly. \xe2\x80\x9cBut what exactly <i>is</i> this Link you both are talking about? You\xe2\x80\x99ve mentioned it countless times now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link is a bond shared between the Necromancer and a Soul. When a Necromacner first begins to summon, the first soul he or she summons will be one closest to their genetic makeup. Once that summoning is complete, the undead summoned and the Necromancer will have a choice: They can either form a Link, or they can continue their separate ways and the Necromancer will never try that magic again.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat does it do? Is it just for cosmetic purposes, or what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard was already shaking her head before the words even left Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cI cannot tell you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean, you can\xe2\x80\x99t tell me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUntil you make the decision for yourself, I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you. I\xe2\x80\x99m not really allowed to. But now that we are at this proverbial crossroads, I must ask, Friherrinna Twilena Star Sparkle av Twinkle: Do you wish to complete the Link? Do you wish to take the very first step in your training as a Necromancer of the Crown?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight was conflicted. On one hoof, this was everything she had feared about the subject laid bare before her. All of the superstitions she had heard were wrong. There was really nothing to be afraid of. But, now an undead Lich Queen was asking her to practically share her soul, if Twilight was hearing that correctly. Her life would never be the same if she accepted. Eventually, however, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s thirst for knowledge easily overpowered her fears of the unknown.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll accept,\xe2\x80\x9d she said proudly, struggling to keep her voice in check.</p><p class="indented double">Starshard, in turn, grinned slightly, like she knew Twilight was going to make this decision sooner or later. Rather than responding to the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s announcement, Starshard moved closer to Twilight. The suddenly nervous apprentice eyed the Lich Queen warily, but stood her ground. Whatever was going to happen next, Twilight was going to accept it proudly. Starshard stepped even closer, and the finally brought the length of her long, slender horn to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s smaller and stubbier one. The effect was immediate. Both let out loud gasps as a strange, unknown energy coursed through their bodies like an electric current. The power grew, and grew, swirling around the pair as they stood there, horns locked. Just as Twilight thought she would burst, the alien power suddenly changed direction--and flowed directly into <i>Grace</i>.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight nearly collapsed as the energy left her, Starshard supporting her gently. They were both panting like they had just ran a marathon. A distant part of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind noted that Starshard was rather warm, instead of the cold feeling she would have expected from an undead. As Twilight recovered, she felt an odd vibrating at her side. It was her glaive. The weapon slide out of its sheath and hovered right before Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, turning so that its owner could see the odd rune in the middle of the staff that had not been there previously.</p><p class="double"><img src="http://pvpgamer.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/necromancer.png" class="user_image" /></p><p class="indented double">Still partially staring at the rune in wonderment, Twilight turned to Luna, silently asking for an explanation.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIts a Necromancer Rune, Twilight. Its designed to enhance your spellcasting abilities with this branch of magic. Its why I had you obtain your weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo\xe2\x80\xa6 that\xe2\x80\x99s it? I\xe2\x80\x99m a Necromancer now?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double"><i>Well, yes and no.</i></p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cGah!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight yelped as she heard a familiar voice echoing around her mind. Luna was grinning. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat was that? Some form of telepathy?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard answered her. \xe2\x80\x9cIn a nutshell, yes. Its a part of the Link. Our minds are connected, allowing us to speak no matter how far apart we are. We also have a shared aether pool. Haven\xe2\x80\x99t you felt it yet?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Now that Starshard mentioned it, Twilight did feel\xe2\x80\xa6 Stronger. More alive. She could feel the power coursing just below her horn, ready to be unleashed. A small smile began to play across her lips. \xe2\x80\x9cSo in other words, I\xe2\x80\x99m more magically powerful?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou are,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied. \xe2\x80\x9cBut, I\xe2\x80\x99m afraid your studies in Necromancy are far from over, my faithful student. You have a Link now, that is true. But there is still a great deal to learn. Summoning and controlling lesser undead and a whole host of over things. For now, however, we may call it quits. It is far past lunchtime, and I\xe2\x80\x99m sure you\xe2\x80\x99d like to grab a bite to eat before continuing.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Now that Luna mentioned it, Twilight was feeling hungry. Ravenous, even. But there was something still bothering her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat about you, Starshard? I mean, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re here now, but what&#039;s going to happen from here?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard chuckled. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, now that I\xe2\x80\x99m Summoned and Linked, I\xe2\x80\x99ll stay in the world of the living for as long as I want, until my Summoner sends me back for whatever reason. Right now, however, I would like the opportunity to catch up to Luna.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nodded almost absently, her curiosity sated at the moment. With a small wave of her hoof, the lavender unicorn departed.</p><p class="indented double">Starshard waited until the door was closed and she could no longer hear Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoofsteps before turning to Princess Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you think she suspects anything? Or knows?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna was already shaking her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. She\xe2\x80\x99s still in the dark. But she won\xe2\x80\x99t be for long. Twilight is incredibly smart and resourceful. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never met another pony with her drive for knowledge. She even surpasses the last Valkyrie in that regard. She\xe2\x80\x99ll figure out the truth eventually. And by then, I hope that we will have prepared her as best we can.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cI sure do hope so. I almost couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep my expression clear when I first saw her. I\xe2\x80\x99ve missed her for a very long time.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna echoed Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s sigh. \xe2\x80\x9cI know, Starshard. I have too.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'values': ["//------------------------------//\n// Chapter 5 (*)// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\t\t\tTwilight was excited. Tonight was going to be the first real night of her apprenticeship. The young unicorn had barely returned to her own quarters after the outing with Shining before a page had arrived, telling her to meet Princess Luna in her private study. Hardly able to contain her glee, Twilight had hurriedly made herself presentable and took off back down the corridor. She wondered which branch of magic Luna would teach her first. Each and every branch was important, of course, but she was secretly hoping that Luna would start with Light. Everything about that branch fascinated the bookish mare, from the extremely useful healing spells down to the simplest lighting spell. Or maybe they would start with Nature first, the magic that caused things to grow. Twilight has always wanted a small garden of her own, and maybe Luna would  start with the magic that would make growing one easier. But a small part of her mind whispered that Luna would want to start with Discord magic, throwing a slight damper upon her enthusiasm.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure she would be able to handle that. A great many uneducated folk insisted that Discord-based magic was evil. Twilight scoffed at the idea, but it was true that Discord magic was\xe2\x80\xa6 well\xe2\x80\xa6 not very nice. Animosity, of course, was the opposite of Friendship. The most Twilight knew about it was that it focused on manipulating your foes, deceiving them and preventing them from becoming too attached to you. Animosity was a valued tool for unicorns in Equestria Intelligence, as it was perfect for making sure a spy kept their cover even if enemies knew they were there. Then came Destruction, a magic that took everything Light stood for and obliterated it. Destruction was probably the only branch of magic with so much raw, pure power. Then there was Chaos, a magic that focused on turning reality upside down, and Hatred, which turned your most personal feelings into a tangible weapon. Lastly\xe2\x80\xa6 there was Necromancy.\r\n\r\n\tTo be honest, this was the branch of Discord magic Twilight was afraid of the most. There was so little actually published on the subject. Very few unicorns ever practiced Necromancy, and the ones who did were always closely watched by Princess Luna. It was rumored that bringing the dead back to life was impossible, but if it was, Necromancy would not be able to exist. Twilight was so wrapped up in her own thoughts and worries that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t even notice she had passed the hallway leading to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s study. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until she ran smack into a suit of armor she didn\xe2\x80\x99t recall being there previously that she realized her mistake. The unicorn backtracked to the correct hallway and proceeded down it, struggling to calm her nerves. Princess Luna knew what she was doing. If she wanted to teach Twilight Necromancy, everything was going to be all right. Twilight knocked gently upon the door to the study.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cEnter,\xe2\x80\x9d came the call.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight nudged open the door with a hoof and walked into the spacious room. Princess Luna was seated at the table they had eaten at yesterday, smiling gently at her newest apprentice. For a brief moment, Twilight thought she saw something else in the princess' eyes. But just as quickly it was gone again, leaving Twilight unsure if she had seen it or not. Twilight bowed slightly to the princess.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, waiting for be acknowledged.\r\n\r\n\tThe princess was quick to do so, beckoning her student forward and gesturing to a chair opposite her. \xe2\x80\x9cCome, Twilight. We have much to start on. I trust that your morning with your brother was satisfactory?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight jumped a little, surprised at the question. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, eh, yes, it was.\xe2\x80\x9d She stammered. \xe2\x80\x9cHow did you know about that?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna smiled. \xe2\x80\x9cI know all about your yearly excursions to the graves of your parents. It is one of the things that helps keep you going.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight was quiet a moment, slightly saddened. \xe2\x80\x9cIt does. I only wish they could be here to see me now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna reached a hoof out to ruffle Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure they can see you now, wherever they are. And I know they would be proud of their only daughter, my faithful student.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight stared up at Luna, before smiling weakly. \xe2\x80\x9cThank you, princess. I\xe2\x80\x99m going to make sure I do my best. For them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cA wise choice. As you may have surmised, today we are going to properly start your training. However, I must warn you that you must also start learning to properly wield a weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight looked to her mentor, surprised. \xe2\x80\x9cA weapon? What does a weapon have to do with learning magic?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSeveral things, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna admonished. \xe2\x80\x9cUnfortunately, seeing as I do not want to spoil so many of your lessons, I can\xe2\x80\x99t really give you a whole lot of details. But you should know, every branch of magic requires the caster to have some form of weapon. It can be something as simple as a quarterstaff, or as elegant as a glaive. Most mages settle for something small, like a dagger or swortshord, as they only study one particular branch of magic. You are, of course, free to make your decision on what type of weapon you use., yet I would suggest something capable of holding your magic potential. Now, come. We head to my personal armory.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tMore than a little confused by Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words, the unsure unicorn followed her mentor right back out of the study. They set off down a corridor with a brief pacing, barely even glancing at the guards and servants they passed. Twilight, naturally, was lost in thought. She had never heard of any branch of magic requiring a weapon before. As far as she knew, you just said an incantation aloud (if there was one) and cast the spell. But apparently this was not the case. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t overly concerned about being subpar with weaponry, however. Growing up with a brother in the guard had meant that Twilight often sparred with him whenever he came to visit, and even sometimes by herself when she was really bored and even her books couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep her company. While she has by no means mastered any one weapon, Twilight felt confident she could at least hold her own no matter what she was using.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight hadn't even noticed that she had followed Luna right out of Canterlot castle and into the nearby training grounds, situated almost right smack in the middle of the giant courtyard. She was even more surprised when Shining Armor trotted up in his full guard armor, helmet tucked under one arm. He sketched a quick bow. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna, Twilight. How can I help you two today?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m actually here to pick up a weapon for my student here, Captain Armor. We will be heading to my armory, and I must request that we do not be interrupted.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\nShining Armor saluted smartly. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, my princess!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe stallion turned to resume his duties, and Luna led Twilight over to a nondescript building a small distance away. The princess tapped the door with her horn, and the door glowed for a moment before unlocking itself and permitting the two ponies to enter. As they did so, lights flared to life, supplementing the moonlight filtering in through the ajar door. The room itself was rather small, and looked to be more of an arena than anything else. Against the far wall rested a weapons rack that held a wide assortment of weapons. The center space was dominated by a roped off rectangle, while the west and east walls held practice dummies and weapon care utensils. Luna skirted the fighting ring and approached the weapons rack, Twilight following close behind.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThis is where I store my most powerful and magical weapons. A few of them I have crafted and imbued myself. Others, I have found in my travels throughout the world. I would like to see if any of these weapons suit you. If they do not, then we\xe2\x80\x99ll return to your brother and see about having a weapon custom made for you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight approached the wall in slight awe. She could feel the magic radiating off these artifacts. There were a handful of swords of all shapes and sizes. Some quite possibly entirely too big for her, others so small they could probably pass themselves off as knives. A twin pair of axes rested on the lower left corner, while a giant longbow took up the entire right side of the rack. However, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s vision was soon dominated by a weapon that ran through the center of the rack, in all of its beautiful and deadly glory: A glaive. It was easily as long as she was tall while standing on her rear hooves, about four feet. The pole was made of ash and colored lavender, and if one looked closely, they could see the strengthening and durability enchantments upon the wood. The blade was just as impressive, one and a half feet of gleaming Nightsteel, straight and deadly. Near the end of the pole, two scarlet phoenix feathers were attached.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight breathed. That right there was what caught Luna\xe2\x80\x99s attention. Her student was very impressed.\r\n\r\n\tLuna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop a half-smirk from forming upon her lips as she stepped closer to the majestic weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was the very first weapon I even came close to mastering. I was tired of my sparring partners whacking me repeatedly when we sparred, because I just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find a weapon I was comfortable with. So I had this forged. I enjoyed the feel of a spear, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t like having to stab. I liked the idea of the cutting prowess of a short sword, but it simply didn\xe2\x80\x99t have the reach I wanted. So, I combined the two and came up with\xe2\x80\xa6 Grace.\xe2\x80\x9d As Luna spoke the name, the glaive rose gently into the air and floated over to the alicorn. It came to a hover directly over Luna\xe2\x80\x99s flat raised right hoof and remained there.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight stepped closer, examining the glaive more closely. Even going by everything that Shining had taught her, Twilight could tell this was a beautiful weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is some very expert craftsmanship. Even the enchantments protecting and making it more powerful meld seamlessly with it.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cIts name is Grace. Is this the weapon you wish to start with?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe unicorn stared at the weapon longingly. For whatever strange reason, the weapon seemed to speak to her. The entire thing seemed to have been specifically tailored towards Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too big, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too small, and she was willing to bet it would be perfectly weighted. The pole was even the same color as he fur, for Luna\xe2\x80\x99s sake!\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYes,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight whispered. She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure if she could muster up a higher volume. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, please.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tMore than happy to oblige, Luna breathed a slight word to Grace. The glaive left her hoof and meandered over to a specially designed harness, where it fit itself snugly. Smiling slightly, Luna picked the harness up in a flare of obsidian. Grace\xe2\x80\x99s holster came to a rest on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s right side while straps wound themselves gently around her barrel, keeping the weapon and harness in place. It fit like a hoof glove, completely perfect. Twilight then turned to follow her mentor, who had already left the armory. Behind them, the door clicked shut and locked itself. Then right back up to the castle the pair went, and it was not until they were past the front guards did Twilight realize they had not asked her to relinquish her weapon.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Prin--Luna? Should I really be carrying a weapon inside the castle?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna glanced back at her student for the briefest of moments. \xe2\x80\x9cAs one of my apprentices, you will find that there are certain regulations that will no longer apply to you. Being armed while in my presence is one of them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 we\xe2\x80\x99re not going to be attacked out of nowhere, are we? Is that why I\xe2\x80\x99m allowed to carry Grace?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna laughed warmly. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course we are not going to be attacked. But if we are, it would help if you were already prepared. And besides, remember that you\xe2\x80\x99re going to use your weapon in some of the magical teachings.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna entered her study again and sat down at the desk once more, waiting for Twilight to get comfortable.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIt took me a great deal of time to decide what branch of magic to start you out with,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna began. \xe2\x80\x9cI know you want to master each of them, but we can still only do one at a time. However, I recalled something that occurred the other day: You seem to be nervous about Necromancy. And so, that is what we are going to start with today.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight almost felt herself deflate a little at those words. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you sure, princess? I mean\xe2\x80\xa6 Necromancy should be reserved for unicorns with more practice with magic in general. I--I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99m ready.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTrust me my faithful student, you are more than ready. I will still be here to guide you, and will help you if it actually turns out you require aid. But the sooner we get this out of the way, the sooner we can focus on other branches, branches that you don\xe2\x80\x99t naturally fear.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried to stop her voice from shaking. \xe2\x80\x9cWhere do we start?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou start by listening to me,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna responded with a twinkle in her eye. \xe2\x80\x9cNecromancy has the potential to be the most complex branch of magic you\xe2\x80\x99ll ever explore. There are a few rules and regulations that need to be followed at all times, which you will quickly discover on your own. Since hardly anypony actually studies this type of magic, and those who do are not allowed to talk about it, Necromancy is naturally steeped in superstitions. I can assure you right now, all of those superstitions you have heard are wholly incorrect.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight went wide eyed at this. \xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6?\xe2\x80\x9d She let the sentence trail off into a question.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAnything you might have heard of Necromancy is likely to be wrong, Twilight Sparkle. When ponies do not understand something, they make up things. They create reasons, excuses as to why something is evil, or something is bad, because it is easier than simply not knowing at all.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\xa6 guess that makes sense.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight frowned dangerously. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I don\xe2\x80\x99t like making stuff up. I\xe2\x80\x99d rather learn about something, instead of just taking guesses at it.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cVery good, Twilight, and that is what makes you different from a great deal of my ponies. Now, Necromancy is very hands on. There are no special incantations, like some of other branches of magic. There are only two majorly important things in Necromancy. The willpower of the summoner, and the soul of the summoned. Since you are just now taking your first steps into this magic, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be the one summoning the soul, so that you can see how it is done.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tDespite herself, Twilight was curious. Right now it didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter if it was Necromancy or not. She was learning, and that was all that was important. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat happens then?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThen we will find out if a Link will be formed, or not.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA Link?\xe2\x80\x9d Now Twilight was just plain confused. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Link?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna only smiled mischievously. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll find out soon enough, my most faithful student. Now, watch me.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tAnd watch Twilight did. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn suddenly blazed to life, a sickly green tinged with black. As Twilight watched, Luna spoke some more. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is rather easy for me. I\xe2\x80\x99ve studied Necromancy for a long, long time, thus enabling me to summon any soul I wish, even the one I\xe2\x80\x99m not Linked to. What you are about to see will probably startle you, but I implore you to not freak out.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, transfixed by the display. Little motes of energy began falling from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn, faster and faster. The princess\xe2\x80\x99 face remained calm, collected. There was no visible strain on her face at all. Twilight marvelled at that fact. She had never seen anypony with so much control over their magic before. Quite soon, however, and Twilight was now preoccupied with something else. A dark mist began to form from thin air, taking on a vaguely pony shape. The mist began to solidify, and just was Twilight began to wonder at its purpose, the mist disappeared. In its place\xe2\x80\xa6 Was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s doppelganger. Twilight fought back a panicked scream. Her pupils dilated and her breathing began to come faster. It was taking all of her concentration to not just flip out.\r\n\r\n\tDespite her near hyperventilating state, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was doing what it did best: analyzing. The clone of Twilight Sparkle before her was the same, yet completely different. She was lighter, for starters, several shades lighter than Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s own coat and mane coloration. The lookalike also had overly bright eyes, almost shining like a lamp. The figure had started out almost insubstantial, like a ghost, but even as Twilight stared her twin seemed to further solidify, becoming more and more real every moment it stood there. But the thing that stood out the most was the fact that this clone of the original Twilight Sparkle had wings. They were perfectly serviceable, like any other pegasus--or Alicorn.\r\n\r\n\tPrincess Luna finally spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cWell met, Twilight Starshard. I\xe2\x80\x99ve not seen you in a long time.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe twin turned, her face lighting up in an easy grin. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna! I thought that was you summoning me!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIndeed. I am teaching my newest apprentice the art of Necromancy.\xe2\x80\x9d The new Twilight turned to glance back at the old one. For the briefest of moments, something flitted across her face. It was like a look of longing. The same look Twilight had thought she saw in Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes as she entered the study. In the next instant however, Starshard was grinning again, eyes alight with wonder.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo this is the one meant to be Linked to me! I wondered when somepony would show up. Twilight Starshard, at your service.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUm\xe2\x80\xa6 Twilight Sparkle. Pleased to meet you.\xe2\x80\x9d Then, unable to help herself, a veritable flood of questions came pouring from her mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cWho exactly are you? Why do you look like me? Why do you have wings?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard and Luna shared a glance. There was amusement there, but also\xe2\x80\xa6 slight hesitation? Twilight Sparkle wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure. Reading other ponies was not her strong suit.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cFirstly, I\xe2\x80\x99m Twilight Starshard. As to who I actually am\xe2\x80\xa6 I guess you could call me a physical representation of you, Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA physical representation of me?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYes. The study of life and death is full of intricacies, and even the most learned Necromancers don\xe2\x80\x99t always pretend to know all of its secrets. Basically\xe2\x80\xa6 I\xe2\x80\x99m an Alicorn who died about a thousand years ago. When Princess Luna summoned me with the intent of Linking me to you, my appearance altered to match your physical makeup.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo then,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice became very soft. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re dead?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard\xe2\x80\x99s shoulders slumped a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cI am. I have been for a great many years, now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 you\xe2\x80\x99re standing right there. You look so real!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThat got a warm chuckle from Starshard. \xe2\x80\x9cThat is because I am real. There is one part of the circle of life that is constant: Decision. When a pony dies, he or she has three choices: Rebirth, Revive, Restore. Some call them the three \xe2\x80\x98R\xe2\x80\x99s. Rebirth is a pony who does just that: The are Reborn into some form of undead. This choice is normally taken by ponies who still have unfinished business among the living. Ponies who choose to Revive are reborn into the world of the living from another womb. And ponies who choose Restore cross to the other side, to paradise. I am a pony who chose Rebirth. I came back to life as a Lich Queen, and even though my business within the living world has long been completed, once I became undead, there was no turning back.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was practically running at a thousand miles a minute. She absorbed just enough information to respond: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry that you are stuck where you are.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t mind it. I can still help out in the world of the living.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight already had another question. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Lich Queen?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA Lich Queen is an undead who controls other undead. Namely, zombies and skeletons. Those guys aren\xe2\x80\x99t usually very smart, so Lich Queens (or Kings) guide them and direct them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou mean\xe2\x80\xa6 some ponies are Rebirthed as a zombie? That sounds awful.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard shook her head. \xe2\x80\x9cMost sentient creatures rarely Rebirth into something so unpleasant. You see, those types of creatures are the result of a Necromancer breaking the number one rule of this branch of magic. There are two rules a Necromancer must always follow. The first, is that you must never, ever, force an undead being to follow your will. You ask us, and it will be up to the individual undead to decide whether or not to help you in your endeavors. If you try to bend us to your will, not only will we ignore the directive, the Necromancer will degrade into the living dead; what you just called a zombie. If a Necromancer cannot follow this rule, then they do not need to be seeking the aid of unliving. Thousands of years ago, Necromancers made this mistake in droves. They were cocky, overconfident, thinking that all of their vaunted power could not be beaten. They paid the price. But these days, there aren\xe2\x80\x99t so many. I\xe2\x80\x99m sure Princess Luna has something to do with that.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cIndeed I do. Even the staunchest of ponies can give in to the lure of power, so I try to keep them away from such a fate as much as I can.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were the size of dinner plates. She had never expected something this momentous \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s the second rule of Necromancy?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link. When its been formed, it cannot be broken for any reason. If a Necromancer tries to remove the Link, the sharing of souls, then they\xe2\x80\x99ll enter the Void. They\xe2\x80\x99ll just cease to exist. No paradise, no Rebirth, no second or third life. Just\xe2\x80\xa6 gone.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight snorted softly. \xe2\x80\x9cBut what exactly is this Link you both are talking about? You\xe2\x80\x99ve mentioned it countless times now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link is a bond shared between the Necromancer and a Soul. When a Necromacner first begins to summon, the first soul he or she summons will be one closest to their genetic makeup. Once that summoning is complete, the undead summoned and the Necromancer will have a choice: They can either form a Link, or they can continue their separate ways and the Necromancer will never try that magic again.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat does it do? Is it just for cosmetic purposes, or what?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard was already shaking her head before the words even left Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cI cannot tell you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean, you can\xe2\x80\x99t tell me?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUntil you make the decision for yourself, I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you. I\xe2\x80\x99m not really allowed to. But now that we are at this proverbial crossroads, I must ask, Friherrinna Twilena Star Sparkle av Twinkle: Do you wish to complete the Link? Do you wish to take the very first step in your training as a Necromancer of the Crown?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight was conflicted. On one hoof, this was everything she had feared about the subject laid bare before her. All of the superstitions she had heard were wrong. There was really nothing to be afraid of. But, now an undead Lich Queen was asking her to practically share her soul, if Twilight was hearing that correctly. Her life would never be the same if she accepted. Eventually, however, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s thirst for knowledge easily overpowered her fears of the unknown.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll accept,\xe2\x80\x9d she said proudly, struggling to keep her voice in check.\r\n\r\n\tStarshard, in turn, grinned slightly, like she knew Twilight was going to make this decision sooner or later. Rather than responding to the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s announcement, Starshard moved closer to Twilight. The suddenly nervous apprentice eyed the Lich Queen warily, but stood her ground. Whatever was going to happen next, Twilight was going to accept it proudly. Starshard stepped even closer, and the finally brought the length of her long, slender horn to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s smaller and stubbier one. The effect was immediate. Both let out loud gasps as a strange, unknown energy coursed through their bodies like an electric current. The power grew, and grew, swirling around the pair as they stood there, horns locked. Just as Twilight thought she would burst, the alien power suddenly changed direction--and flowed directly into Grace.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight nearly collapsed as the energy left her, Starshard supporting her gently. They were both panting like they had just ran a marathon. A distant part of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind noted that Starshard was rather warm, instead of the cold feeling she would have expected from an undead. As Twilight recovered, she felt an odd vibrating at her side. It was her glaive. The weapon slide out of its sheath and hovered right before Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, turning so that its owner could see the odd rune in the middle of the staff that had not been there previously.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\tStill partially staring at the rune in wonderment, Twilight turned to Luna, silently asking for an explanation.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIts a Necromancer Rune, Twilight. Its designed to enhance your spellcasting abilities with this branch of magic. Its why I had you obtain your weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo\xe2\x80\xa6 that\xe2\x80\x99s it? I\xe2\x80\x99m a Necromancer now?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tWell, yes and no.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGah!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight yelped as she heard a familiar voice echoing around her mind. Luna was grinning. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat was that? Some form of telepathy?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard answered her. \xe2\x80\x9cIn a nutshell, yes. Its a part of the Link. Our minds are connected, allowing us to speak no matter how far apart we are. We also have a shared aether pool. Haven\xe2\x80\x99t you felt it yet?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tNow that Starshard mentioned it, Twilight did feel\xe2\x80\xa6 Stronger. More alive. She could feel the power coursing just below her horn, ready to be unleashed. A small smile began to play across her lips. \xe2\x80\x9cSo in other words, I\xe2\x80\x99m more magically powerful?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou are,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied. \xe2\x80\x9cBut, I\xe2\x80\x99m afraid your studies in Necromancy are far from over, my faithful student. You have a Link now, that is true. But there is still a great deal to learn. Summoning and controlling lesser undead and a whole host of over things. For now, however, we may call it quits. It is far past lunchtime, and I\xe2\x80\x99m sure you\xe2\x80\x99d like to grab a bite to eat before continuing.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tNow that Luna mentioned it, Twilight was feeling hungry. Ravenous, even. But there was something still bothering her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat about you, Starshard? I mean, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re here now, but what's going to happen from here?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard chuckled. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, now that I\xe2\x80\x99m Summoned and Linked, I\xe2\x80\x99ll stay in the world of the living for as long as I want, until my Summoner sends me back for whatever reason. Right now, however, I would like the opportunity to catch up to Luna.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nodded almost absently, her curiosity sated at the moment. With a small wave of her hoof, the lavender unicorn departed.\r\n\r\n\tStarshard waited until the door was closed and she could no longer hear Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoofsteps before turning to Princess Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you think she suspects anything? Or knows?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna was already shaking her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. She\xe2\x80\x99s still in the dark. But she won\xe2\x80\x99t be for long. Twilight is incredibly smart and resourceful. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never met another pony with her drive for knowledge. She even surpasses the last Valkyrie in that regard. She\xe2\x80\x99ll figure out the truth eventually. And by then, I hope that we will have prepared her as best we can.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cI sure do hope so. I almost couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep my expression clear when I first saw her. I\xe2\x80\x99ve missed her for a very long time.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna echoed Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s sigh. \xe2\x80\x9cI know, Starshard. I have too.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n", 5, 406273, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'5\'></a><h3>Chapter 5 (*)</h3>\n<p class=\'indented\'>\t\tTwilight was excited. Tonight was going to be the first real night of her apprenticeship. The young unicorn had barely returned to her own quarters after the outing with Shining before a page had arrived, telling her to meet Princess Luna in her private study. Hardly able to contain her glee, Twilight had hurriedly made herself presentable and took off back down the corridor. She wondered which branch of magic Luna would teach her first. Each and every branch was important, of course, but she was secretly hoping that Luna would start with Light. Everything about that branch fascinated the bookish mare, from the extremely useful healing spells down to the simplest lighting spell. Or maybe they would start with Nature first, the magic that caused things to grow. Twilight has always wanted a small garden of her own, and maybe Luna would&nbsp;&nbsp;start with the magic that would make growing one easier. But a small part of her mind whispered that Luna would want to start with Discord magic, throwing a slight damper upon her enthusiasm.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure she would be able to handle that. A great many uneducated folk insisted that Discord-based magic was evil. Twilight scoffed at the idea, but it was true that Discord magic was\xe2\x80\xa6 well\xe2\x80\xa6 not very nice. Animosity, of course, was the opposite of Friendship. The most Twilight knew about it was that it focused on manipulating your foes, deceiving them and preventing them from becoming too attached to you. Animosity was a valued tool for unicorns in Equestria Intelligence, as it was perfect for making sure a spy kept their cover even if enemies knew they were there. Then came Destruction, a magic that took everything Light stood for and obliterated it. Destruction was probably the only branch of magic with so much raw, pure power. Then there was Chaos, a magic that focused on turning reality upside down, and Hatred, which turned your most personal feelings into a tangible weapon. Lastly\xe2\x80\xa6 there was Necromancy.</p><p class="indented double">To be honest, this was the branch of Discord magic Twilight was afraid of the most. There was so little actually published on the subject. <i>Very</i> few unicorns ever practiced Necromancy, and the ones who did were always closely watched by Princess Luna. It was rumored that bringing the dead back to life was impossible, but if it was, Necromancy would not be able to exist. Twilight was so wrapped up in her own thoughts and worries that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t even notice she had passed the hallway leading to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s study. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until she ran smack into a suit of armor she didn\xe2\x80\x99t recall being there previously that she realized her mistake. The unicorn backtracked to the correct hallway and proceeded down it, struggling to calm her nerves. Princess Luna knew what she was doing. If she wanted to teach Twilight Necromancy, everything was going to be all right. Twilight knocked gently upon the door to the study.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cEnter,\xe2\x80\x9d came the call.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight nudged open the door with a hoof and walked into the spacious room. Princess Luna was seated at the table they had eaten at yesterday, smiling gently at her newest apprentice. For a brief moment, Twilight thought she saw something else in the princess&#039; eyes. But just as quickly it was gone again, leaving Twilight unsure if she had seen it or not. Twilight bowed slightly to the princess.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, waiting for be acknowledged.</p><p class="indented double">The princess was quick to do so, beckoning her student forward and gesturing to a chair opposite her. \xe2\x80\x9cCome, Twilight. We have much to start on. I trust that your morning with your brother was satisfactory?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight jumped a little, surprised at the question. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, eh, yes, it was.\xe2\x80\x9d She stammered. \xe2\x80\x9cHow did you know about that?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna smiled. \xe2\x80\x9cI know all about your yearly excursions to the graves of your parents. It is one of the things that helps keep you going.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight was quiet a moment, slightly saddened. \xe2\x80\x9cIt does. I only wish they could be here to see me now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna reached a hoof out to ruffle Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure they <i>can</i> see you now, wherever they are. And I know they would be proud of their only daughter, my faithful student.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight stared up at Luna, before smiling weakly. \xe2\x80\x9cThank you, princess. I\xe2\x80\x99m going to make sure I do my best. For them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cA wise choice. As you may have surmised, today we are going to properly start your training. However, I must warn you that you must also start learning to properly wield a weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight looked to her mentor, surprised. \xe2\x80\x9cA weapon? What does a weapon have to do with learning magic?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSeveral things, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna admonished. \xe2\x80\x9cUnfortunately, seeing as I do not want to spoil so many of your lessons, I can\xe2\x80\x99t really give you a whole lot of details. But you should know, every branch of magic requires the caster to have some form of weapon. It can be something as simple as a quarterstaff, or as elegant as a glaive. Most mages settle for something small, like a dagger or swortshord, as they only study one particular branch of magic. You are, of course, free to make your decision on <i>what</i> type of weapon you use., yet I would suggest something capable of holding your magic potential. Now, come. We head to my personal armory.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More than a little confused by Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words, the unsure unicorn followed her mentor right back out of the study. They set off down a corridor with a brief pacing, barely even glancing at the guards and servants they passed. Twilight, naturally, was lost in thought. She had never heard of any branch of magic <i>requiring</i> a weapon before. As far as she knew, you just said an incantation aloud (if there was one) and cast the spell. But apparently this was not the case. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t overly concerned about being subpar with weaponry, however. Growing up with a brother in the guard had meant that Twilight often sparred with him whenever he came to visit, and even sometimes by herself when she was really bored and even her books couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep her company. While she has by no means mastered any one weapon, Twilight felt confident she could at least hold her own no matter what she was using.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight hadn&#039;t even noticed that she had followed Luna right out of Canterlot castle and into the nearby training grounds, situated almost right smack in the middle of the giant courtyard.
