She was even more surprised when Shining Armor trotted up in his full guard armor, helmet tucked under one arm. He sketched a quick bow. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna, Twilight. How can I help you two today?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m actually here to pick up a weapon for my student here, Captain Armor. We will be heading to my armory, and I must request that we do not be interrupted.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Shining Armor saluted smartly. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, my princess!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The stallion turned to resume his duties, and Luna led Twilight over to a nondescript building a small distance away. The princess tapped the door with her horn, and the door glowed for a moment before unlocking itself and permitting the two ponies to enter. As they did so, lights flared to life, supplementing the moonlight filtering in through the ajar door. The room itself was rather small, and looked to be more of an arena than anything else. Against the far wall rested a weapons rack that held a wide assortment of weapons. The center space was dominated by a roped off rectangle, while the west and east walls held practice dummies and weapon care utensils. Luna skirted the fighting ring and approached the weapons rack, Twilight following close behind.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThis is where I store my most powerful and magical weapons. A few of them I have crafted and imbued myself. Others, I have found in my travels throughout the world. I would like to see if any of these weapons suit you. If they do not, then we\xe2\x80\x99ll return to your brother and see about having a weapon custom made for you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight approached the wall in slight awe. She could <i>feel</i> the magic radiating off these artifacts. There were a handful of swords of all shapes and sizes. Some quite possibly entirely too big for her, others so small they could probably pass themselves off as knives. A twin pair of axes rested on the lower left corner, while a giant longbow took up the entire right side of the rack. However, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s vision was soon dominated by a weapon that ran through the center of the rack, in all of its beautiful and deadly glory: A glaive. It was easily as long as she was tall while standing on her rear hooves, about four feet. The pole was made of ash and colored lavender, and if one looked closely, they could see the strengthening and durability enchantments upon the wood. The blade was just as impressive, one and a half feet of gleaming <i>Nightsteel</i>, straight and deadly. Near the end of the pole, two scarlet phoenix feathers were attached.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight breathed. That right there was what caught Luna\xe2\x80\x99s attention. Her student was very impressed.</p><p class="indented double">Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop a half-smirk from forming upon her lips as she stepped closer to the majestic weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was the very first weapon I even came close to mastering. I was tired of my sparring partners whacking me repeatedly when we sparred, because I just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find a weapon I was comfortable with. So I had this forged. I enjoyed the feel of a spear, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t like having to stab. I liked the idea of the cutting prowess of a short sword, but it simply didn\xe2\x80\x99t have the reach I wanted. So, I combined the two and came up with\xe2\x80\xa6 <i>Grace</i>.\xe2\x80\x9d As Luna spoke the name, the glaive rose gently into the air and floated over to the alicorn. It came to a hover directly over Luna\xe2\x80\x99s flat raised right hoof and remained there.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight stepped closer, examining the glaive more closely. Even going by everything that Shining had taught her, Twilight could tell this was a beautiful weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is some very expert craftsmanship. Even the enchantments protecting and making it more powerful meld seamlessly with it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cIts name is <i>Grace</i>. Is this the weapon you wish to start with?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The unicorn stared at the weapon longingly. For whatever strange reason, the weapon seemed to speak to her. The entire thing seemed to have been specifically tailored towards Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too big, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too small, and she was willing to bet it would be perfectly weighted. The pole was even the same color as he fur, for Luna\xe2\x80\x99s sake!</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight whispered. She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure if she could muster up a higher volume. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, please.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More than happy to oblige, Luna breathed a slight word to <i>Grace</i>. The glaive left her hoof and meandered over to a specially designed harness, where it fit itself snugly. Smiling slightly, Luna picked the harness up in a flare of obsidian. <i>Grace</i>\xe2\x80\x99s holster came to a rest on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s right side while straps wound themselves gently around her barrel, keeping the weapon and harness in place. It fit like a hoof glove, completely perfect. Twilight then turned to follow her mentor, who had already left the armory. Behind them, the door clicked shut and locked itself. Then right back up to the castle the pair went, and it was not until they were past the front guards did Twilight realize they had not asked her to relinquish her weapon.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Prin--Luna? Should I really be carrying a weapon inside the castle?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna glanced back at her student for the briefest of moments. \xe2\x80\x9cAs one of my apprentices, you will find that there are certain regulations that will no longer apply to you. Being armed while in my presence is one of them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 we\xe2\x80\x99re not going to be attacked out of nowhere, are we? Is that why I\xe2\x80\x99m allowed to carry <i>Grace</i>?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna laughed warmly. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course we are not going to be attacked. But if we are, it would help if you were already prepared. And besides, remember that you\xe2\x80\x99re going to use your weapon in some of the magical teachings.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna entered her study again and sat down at the desk once more, waiting for Twilight to get comfortable.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt took me a great deal of time to decide what branch of magic to start you out with,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna began. \xe2\x80\x9cI know you want to master each of them, but we can still only do one at a time. However, I recalled something that occurred the other day: You seem to be nervous about Necromancy. And so, that is what we are going to start with today.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight almost felt herself deflate a little at those words. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you sure, princess? I mean\xe2\x80\xa6 Necromancy should be reserved for unicorns with more practice with magic in general. I--I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99m ready.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cTrust me my faithful student, you are more than ready. I will still be here to guide you, and will help you if it actually turns out you require aid. But the sooner we get this out of the way, the sooner we can focus on other branches, branches that you don\xe2\x80\x99t naturally fear.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried to stop her voice from shaking. \xe2\x80\x9cWhere do we start?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou start by listening to me,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna responded with a twinkle in her eye. \xe2\x80\x9cNecromancy has the potential to be the most complex branch of magic you\xe2\x80\x99ll ever explore. There are a few rules and regulations that need to be followed at all times, which you will quickly discover on your own. Since hardly anypony actually studies this type of magic, and those who do are not allowed to talk about it, Necromancy is naturally steeped in superstitions. I can assure you right now, all of those superstitions you have heard are wholly incorrect.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight went wide eyed at this. \xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6?\xe2\x80\x9d She let the sentence trail off into a question.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnything you might have heard of Necromancy is likely to be wrong, Twilight Sparkle. When ponies do not understand something, they make up things. They create reasons, excuses as to why something is evil, or something is bad, because it is easier than simply not knowing at all.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\xa6 guess that makes sense.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight frowned dangerously. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I don\xe2\x80\x99t like making stuff up. I\xe2\x80\x99d rather learn about something, instead of just taking guesses at it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cVery good, Twilight, and that is what makes you different from a great deal of my ponies. Now, Necromancy is very hands on. There are no special incantations, like some of other branches of magic. There are only two majorly important things in Necromancy. The willpower of the summoner, and the soul of the summoned. Since you are just now taking your first steps into this magic, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be the one summoning the soul, so that you can see how it is done.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Despite herself, Twilight was curious. Right now it didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter if it was Necromancy or not. She was learning, and that was all that was important. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat happens then?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThen we will find out if a Link will be formed, or not.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA Link?\xe2\x80\x9d Now Twilight was just plain confused. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Link?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna only smiled mischievously. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll find out soon enough, my most faithful student. Now, watch me.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">And watch Twilight did. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn suddenly blazed to life, a sickly green tinged with black. As Twilight watched, Luna spoke some more. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is rather easy for me. I\xe2\x80\x99ve studied Necromancy for a long, long time, thus enabling me to summon any soul I wish, even the one I\xe2\x80\x99m not Linked to. What you are about to see will probably startle you, but I implore you to not freak out.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, transfixed by the display. Little motes of energy began falling from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn, faster and faster. The princess\xe2\x80\x99 face remained calm, collected. There was no visible strain on her face at all. Twilight marvelled at that fact. She had never seen anypony with so much control over their magic before. Quite soon, however, and Twilight was now preoccupied with something else. A dark mist began to form from thin air, taking on a vaguely pony shape. The mist began to solidify, and just was Twilight began to wonder at its purpose, the mist disappeared. In its place\xe2\x80\xa6 Was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s doppelganger. Twilight fought back a panicked scream. Her pupils dilated and her breathing began to come faster. It was taking all of her concentration to not just flip out.</p><p class="indented double">Despite her near hyperventilating state, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was doing what it did best: analyzing. The clone of Twilight Sparkle before her was the same, yet completely different. She was lighter, for starters, several shades lighter than Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s own coat and mane coloration. The lookalike also had overly bright eyes, almost shining like a lamp. The figure had started out almost insubstantial, like a ghost, but even as Twilight stared her twin seemed to further solidify, becoming more and more real every moment it stood there. But the thing that stood out the most was the fact that this clone of the original Twilight Sparkle had <i>wings</i>. They were perfectly serviceable, like any other pegasus--or Alicorn.</p><p class="indented double">Princess Luna finally spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cWell met, Twilight Starshard. I\xe2\x80\x99ve not seen you in a long time.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The twin turned, her face lighting up in an easy grin. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna! I thought that was <i>you</i> summoning me!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIndeed. I am teaching my newest apprentice the art of Necromancy.\xe2\x80\x9d The new Twilight turned to glance back at the old one. For the briefest of moments, something flitted across her face. It was like a look of longing. The same look Twilight had thought she saw in Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes as she entered the study. In the next instant however, Starshard was grinning again, eyes alight with wonder.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo <i>this</i> is the one meant to be Linked to me! I wondered when somepony would show up. Twilight Starshard, at your service.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUm\xe2\x80\xa6 Twilight Sparkle. Pleased to meet you.\xe2\x80\x9d Then, unable to help herself, a veritable flood of questions came pouring from her mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cWho exactly are you? Why do you look like me? Why do you have <i>wings</i>?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard and Luna shared a glance. There was amusement there, but also\xe2\x80\xa6 slight hesitation? Twilight Sparkle wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure. Reading other ponies was not her strong suit.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cFirstly, I\xe2\x80\x99m Twilight Starshard. As to who I actually am\xe2\x80\xa6 I guess you could call me a physical representation of you, Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA physical representation of me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes. The study of life and death is full of intricacies, and even the most learned Necromancers don\xe2\x80\x99t always pretend to know all of its secrets. Basically\xe2\x80\xa6 I\xe2\x80\x99m an Alicorn who died about a thousand years ago. When Princess Luna summoned me with the intent of Linking me to you, my appearance altered to match your physical makeup.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo then,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice became very soft. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re dead?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s shoulders slumped a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cI am. I have been for a great many years, now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 you\xe2\x80\x99re standing right there. You look so real!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">That got a warm chuckle from Starshard. \xe2\x80\x9cThat is because I <i>am</i> real. There is one part of the circle of life that is constant: Decision. When a pony dies, he or she has three choices: Rebirth, Revive, Restore. Some call them the three \xe2\x80\x98R\xe2\x80\x99s. Rebirth is a pony who does just that: The are Reborn into some form of undead. This choice is normally taken by ponies who still have unfinished business among the living. Ponies who choose to Revive are reborn into the world of the living from another womb. And ponies who choose Restore cross to the other side, to paradise. I am a pony who chose Rebirth. I came back to life as a Lich Queen, and even though my business within the living world has long been completed, once I became undead, there was no turning back.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was practically running at a thousand miles a minute. She absorbed just enough information to respond: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry that you are stuck where you are.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t mind it. I can still help out in the world of the living.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight already had another question. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Lich Queen?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cA Lich Queen is an undead who controls other undead. Namely, zombies and skeletons. Those guys aren\xe2\x80\x99t usually very smart, so Lich Queens (or Kings) guide them and direct them.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou mean\xe2\x80\xa6 some ponies are Rebirthed as a zombie? That sounds awful.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard shook her head. \xe2\x80\x9cMost sentient creatures rarely Rebirth into something so unpleasant. You see, those types of creatures are the result of a Necromancer breaking the number one rule of this branch of magic. There are two rules a Necromancer must always follow. The first, is that you must never, ever, <i>force</i> an undead being to follow your will. You ask us, and it will be up to the individual undead to decide whether or not to help you in your endeavors. If you try to bend us to your will, not only will we ignore the directive, the Necromancer will degrade into the living dead; what you just called a zombie. If a Necromancer cannot follow this rule, then they do not need to be seeking the aid of unliving. Thousands of years ago, Necromancers made this mistake in droves. They were cocky, overconfident, thinking that all of their vaunted power could not be beaten. They paid the price. But these days, there aren\xe2\x80\x99t so many. I\xe2\x80\x99m sure Princess Luna has something to do with that.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cIndeed I do. Even the staunchest of ponies can give in to the lure of power, so I try to keep them away from such a fate as much as I can.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were the size of dinner plates. She had never expected something this momentous \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s the second rule of Necromancy?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link. When its been formed, it cannot be broken for any reason. If a Necromancer tries to remove the Link, the sharing of souls, then they\xe2\x80\x99ll enter the Void. They\xe2\x80\x99ll just cease to exist. No paradise, no Rebirth, no second or third life. Just\xe2\x80\xa6 gone.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight snorted softly. \xe2\x80\x9cBut what exactly <i>is</i> this Link you both are talking about? You\xe2\x80\x99ve mentioned it countless times now.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link is a bond shared between the Necromancer and a Soul. When a Necromacner first begins to summon, the first soul he or she summons will be one closest to their genetic makeup. Once that summoning is complete, the undead summoned and the Necromancer will have a choice: They can either form a Link, or they can continue their separate ways and the Necromancer will never try that magic again.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat does it do? Is it just for cosmetic purposes, or what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard was already shaking her head before the words even left Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cI cannot tell you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean, you can\xe2\x80\x99t tell me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cUntil you make the decision for yourself, I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you. I\xe2\x80\x99m not really allowed to. But now that we are at this proverbial crossroads, I must ask, Friherrinna Twilena Star Sparkle av Twinkle: Do you wish to complete the Link? Do you wish to take the very first step in your training as a Necromancer of the Crown?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight was conflicted. On one hoof, this was everything she had feared about the subject laid bare before her. All of the superstitions she had heard were wrong. There was really nothing to be afraid of. But, now an undead Lich Queen was asking her to practically share her soul, if Twilight was hearing that correctly. Her life would never be the same if she accepted. Eventually, however, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s thirst for knowledge easily overpowered her fears of the unknown.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll accept,\xe2\x80\x9d she said proudly, struggling to keep her voice in check.</p><p class="indented double">Starshard, in turn, grinned slightly, like she knew Twilight was going to make this decision sooner or later. Rather than responding to the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s announcement, Starshard moved closer to Twilight. The suddenly nervous apprentice eyed the Lich Queen warily, but stood her ground. Whatever was going to happen next, Twilight was going to accept it proudly. Starshard stepped even closer, and the finally brought the length of her long, slender horn to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s smaller and stubbier one. The effect was immediate. Both let out loud gasps as a strange, unknown energy coursed through their bodies like an electric current. The power grew, and grew, swirling around the pair as they stood there, horns locked. Just as Twilight thought she would burst, the alien power suddenly changed direction--and flowed directly into <i>Grace</i>.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight nearly collapsed as the energy left her, Starshard supporting her gently. They were both panting like they had just ran a marathon. A distant part of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind noted that Starshard was rather warm, instead of the cold feeling she would have expected from an undead. As Twilight recovered, she felt an odd vibrating at her side. It was her glaive. The weapon slide out of its sheath and hovered right before Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, turning so that its owner could see the odd rune in the middle of the staff that had not been there previously.</p><p class="double"><img src="http://pvpgamer.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/necromancer.png" class="user_image" /></p><p class="indented double">Still partially staring at the rune in wonderment, Twilight turned to Luna, silently asking for an explanation.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIts a Necromancer Rune, Twilight. Its designed to enhance your spellcasting abilities with this branch of magic. Its why I had you obtain your weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSo\xe2\x80\xa6 that\xe2\x80\x99s it? I\xe2\x80\x99m a Necromancer now?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double"><i>Well, yes and no.</i></p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cGah!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight yelped as she heard a familiar voice echoing around her mind. Luna was grinning. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat was that? Some form of telepathy?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard answered her. \xe2\x80\x9cIn a nutshell, yes. Its a part of the Link. Our minds are connected, allowing us to speak no matter how far apart we are. We also have a shared aether pool. Haven\xe2\x80\x99t you felt it yet?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Now that Starshard mentioned it, Twilight did feel\xe2\x80\xa6 Stronger. More alive. She could feel the power coursing just below her horn, ready to be unleashed. A small smile began to play across her lips. \xe2\x80\x9cSo in other words, I\xe2\x80\x99m more magically powerful?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou are,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied. \xe2\x80\x9cBut, I\xe2\x80\x99m afraid your studies in Necromancy are far from over, my faithful student. You have a Link now, that is true. But there is still a great deal to learn. Summoning and controlling lesser undead and a whole host of over things. For now, however, we may call it quits. It is far past lunchtime, and I\xe2\x80\x99m sure you\xe2\x80\x99d like to grab a bite to eat before continuing.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Now that Luna mentioned it, Twilight was feeling hungry. Ravenous, even. But there was something still bothering her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat about you, Starshard? I mean, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re here now, but what&#039;s going to happen from here?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard chuckled. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, now that I\xe2\x80\x99m Summoned and Linked, I\xe2\x80\x99ll stay in the world of the living for as long as I want, until my Summoner sends me back for whatever reason. Right now, however, I would like the opportunity to catch up to Luna.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nodded almost absently, her curiosity sated at the moment. With a small wave of her hoof, the lavender unicorn departed.</p><p class="indented double">Starshard waited until the door was closed and she could no longer hear Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoofsteps before turning to Princess Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you think she suspects anything? Or knows?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna was already shaking her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. She\xe2\x80\x99s still in the dark. But she won\xe2\x80\x99t be for long. Twilight is incredibly smart and resourceful. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never met another pony with her drive for knowledge. She even surpasses the last Valkyrie in that regard. She\xe2\x80\x99ll figure out the truth eventually. And by then, I hope that we will have prepared her as best we can.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Starshard sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cI sure do hope so. I almost couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep my expression clear when I first saw her. I\xe2\x80\x99ve missed her for a very long time.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna echoed Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s sigh. \xe2\x80\x9cI know, Starshard. I have too.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 104188], 'parent_story_id': 104188, 'txt': "//------------------------------//\n// Chapter 5 (*)// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\t\t\tTwilight was excited. Tonight was going to be the first real night of her apprenticeship. The young unicorn had barely returned to her own quarters after the outing with Shining before a page had arrived, telling her to meet Princess Luna in her private study. Hardly able to contain her glee, Twilight had hurriedly made herself presentable and took off back down the corridor. She wondered which branch of magic Luna would teach her first. Each and every branch was important, of course, but she was secretly hoping that Luna would start with Light. Everything about that branch fascinated the bookish mare, from the extremely useful healing spells down to the simplest lighting spell. Or maybe they would start with Nature first, the magic that caused things to grow. Twilight has always wanted a small garden of her own, and maybe Luna would  start with the magic that would make growing one easier. But a small part of her mind whispered that Luna would want to start with Discord magic, throwing a slight damper upon her enthusiasm.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure she would be able to handle that. A great many uneducated folk insisted that Discord-based magic was evil. Twilight scoffed at the idea, but it was true that Discord magic was\xe2\x80\xa6 well\xe2\x80\xa6 not very nice. Animosity, of course, was the opposite of Friendship. The most Twilight knew about it was that it focused on manipulating your foes, deceiving them and preventing them from becoming too attached to you. Animosity was a valued tool for unicorns in Equestria Intelligence, as it was perfect for making sure a spy kept their cover even if enemies knew they were there. Then came Destruction, a magic that took everything Light stood for and obliterated it. Destruction was probably the only branch of magic with so much raw, pure power. Then there was Chaos, a magic that focused on turning reality upside down, and Hatred, which turned your most personal feelings into a tangible weapon. Lastly\xe2\x80\xa6 there was Necromancy.\r\n\r\n\tTo be honest, this was the branch of Discord magic Twilight was afraid of the most. There was so little actually published on the subject. Very few unicorns ever practiced Necromancy, and the ones who did were always closely watched by Princess Luna. It was rumored that bringing the dead back to life was impossible, but if it was, Necromancy would not be able to exist. Twilight was so wrapped up in her own thoughts and worries that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t even notice she had passed the hallway leading to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s study. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until she ran smack into a suit of armor she didn\xe2\x80\x99t recall being there previously that she realized her mistake. The unicorn backtracked to the correct hallway and proceeded down it, struggling to calm her nerves. Princess Luna knew what she was doing. If she wanted to teach Twilight Necromancy, everything was going to be all right. Twilight knocked gently upon the door to the study.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cEnter,\xe2\x80\x9d came the call.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight nudged open the door with a hoof and walked into the spacious room. Princess Luna was seated at the table they had eaten at yesterday, smiling gently at her newest apprentice. For a brief moment, Twilight thought she saw something else in the princess' eyes. But just as quickly it was gone again, leaving Twilight unsure if she had seen it or not. Twilight bowed slightly to the princess.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cLuna,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, waiting for be acknowledged.\r\n\r\n\tThe princess was quick to do so, beckoning her student forward and gesturing to a chair opposite her. \xe2\x80\x9cCome, Twilight. We have much to start on. I trust that your morning with your brother was satisfactory?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight jumped a little, surprised at the question. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, eh, yes, it was.\xe2\x80\x9d She stammered. \xe2\x80\x9cHow did you know about that?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna smiled. \xe2\x80\x9cI know all about your yearly excursions to the graves of your parents. It is one of the things that helps keep you going.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight was quiet a moment, slightly saddened. \xe2\x80\x9cIt does. I only wish they could be here to see me now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna reached a hoof out to ruffle Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mane. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure they can see you now, wherever they are. And I know they would be proud of their only daughter, my faithful student.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight stared up at Luna, before smiling weakly. \xe2\x80\x9cThank you, princess. I\xe2\x80\x99m going to make sure I do my best. For them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cA wise choice. As you may have surmised, today we are going to properly start your training. However, I must warn you that you must also start learning to properly wield a weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight looked to her mentor, surprised. \xe2\x80\x9cA weapon? What does a weapon have to do with learning magic?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSeveral things, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna admonished. \xe2\x80\x9cUnfortunately, seeing as I do not want to spoil so many of your lessons, I can\xe2\x80\x99t really give you a whole lot of details. But you should know, every branch of magic requires the caster to have some form of weapon. It can be something as simple as a quarterstaff, or as elegant as a glaive. Most mages settle for something small, like a dagger or swortshord, as they only study one particular branch of magic. You are, of course, free to make your decision on what type of weapon you use., yet I would suggest something capable of holding your magic potential. Now, come. We head to my personal armory.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tMore than a little confused by Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words, the unsure unicorn followed her mentor right back out of the study. They set off down a corridor with a brief pacing, barely even glancing at the guards and servants they passed. Twilight, naturally, was lost in thought. She had never heard of any branch of magic requiring a weapon before. As far as she knew, you just said an incantation aloud (if there was one) and cast the spell. But apparently this was not the case. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t overly concerned about being subpar with weaponry, however. Growing up with a brother in the guard had meant that Twilight often sparred with him whenever he came to visit, and even sometimes by herself when she was really bored and even her books couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep her company. While she has by no means mastered any one weapon, Twilight felt confident she could at least hold her own no matter what she was using.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight hadn't even noticed that she had followed Luna right out of Canterlot castle and into the nearby training grounds, situated almost right smack in the middle of the giant courtyard. She was even more surprised when Shining Armor trotted up in his full guard armor, helmet tucked under one arm. He sketched a quick bow. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna, Twilight. How can I help you two today?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m actually here to pick up a weapon for my student here, Captain Armor. We will be heading to my armory, and I must request that we do not be interrupted.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\nShining Armor saluted smartly. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, my princess!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe stallion turned to resume his duties, and Luna led Twilight over to a nondescript building a small distance away. The princess tapped the door with her horn, and the door glowed for a moment before unlocking itself and permitting the two ponies to enter. As they did so, lights flared to life, supplementing the moonlight filtering in through the ajar door. The room itself was rather small, and looked to be more of an arena than anything else. Against the far wall rested a weapons rack that held a wide assortment of weapons. The center space was dominated by a roped off rectangle, while the west and east walls held practice dummies and weapon care utensils. Luna skirted the fighting ring and approached the weapons rack, Twilight following close behind.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThis is where I store my most powerful and magical weapons. A few of them I have crafted and imbued myself. Others, I have found in my travels throughout the world. I would like to see if any of these weapons suit you. If they do not, then we\xe2\x80\x99ll return to your brother and see about having a weapon custom made for you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight approached the wall in slight awe. She could feel the magic radiating off these artifacts. There were a handful of swords of all shapes and sizes. Some quite possibly entirely too big for her, others so small they could probably pass themselves off as knives. A twin pair of axes rested on the lower left corner, while a giant longbow took up the entire right side of the rack. However, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s vision was soon dominated by a weapon that ran through the center of the rack, in all of its beautiful and deadly glory: A glaive. It was easily as long as she was tall while standing on her rear hooves, about four feet. The pole was made of ash and colored lavender, and if one looked closely, they could see the strengthening and durability enchantments upon the wood. The blade was just as impressive, one and a half feet of gleaming Nightsteel, straight and deadly. Near the end of the pole, two scarlet phoenix feathers were attached.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight breathed. That right there was what caught Luna\xe2\x80\x99s attention. Her student was very impressed.\r\n\r\n\tLuna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop a half-smirk from forming upon her lips as she stepped closer to the majestic weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was the very first weapon I even came close to mastering. I was tired of my sparring partners whacking me repeatedly when we sparred, because I just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find a weapon I was comfortable with. So I had this forged. I enjoyed the feel of a spear, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t like having to stab. I liked the idea of the cutting prowess of a short sword, but it simply didn\xe2\x80\x99t have the reach I wanted. So, I combined the two and came up with\xe2\x80\xa6 Grace.\xe2\x80\x9d As Luna spoke the name, the glaive rose gently into the air and floated over to the alicorn. It came to a hover directly over Luna\xe2\x80\x99s flat raised right hoof and remained there.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight stepped closer, examining the glaive more closely. Even going by everything that Shining had taught her, Twilight could tell this was a beautiful weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is some very expert craftsmanship. Even the enchantments protecting and making it more powerful meld seamlessly with it.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cIts name is Grace. Is this the weapon you wish to start with?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe unicorn stared at the weapon longingly. For whatever strange reason, the weapon seemed to speak to her. The entire thing seemed to have been specifically tailored towards Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too big, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too small, and she was willing to bet it would be perfectly weighted. The pole was even the same color as he fur, for Luna\xe2\x80\x99s sake!\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYes,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight whispered. She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure if she could muster up a higher volume. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, please.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tMore than happy to oblige, Luna breathed a slight word to Grace. The glaive left her hoof and meandered over to a specially designed harness, where it fit itself snugly. Smiling slightly, Luna picked the harness up in a flare of obsidian. Grace\xe2\x80\x99s holster came to a rest on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s right side while straps wound themselves gently around her barrel, keeping the weapon and harness in place. It fit like a hoof glove, completely perfect. Twilight then turned to follow her mentor, who had already left the armory. Behind them, the door clicked shut and locked itself. Then right back up to the castle the pair went, and it was not until they were past the front guards did Twilight realize they had not asked her to relinquish her weapon.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Prin--Luna? Should I really be carrying a weapon inside the castle?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna glanced back at her student for the briefest of moments. \xe2\x80\x9cAs one of my apprentices, you will find that there are certain regulations that will no longer apply to you. Being armed while in my presence is one of them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 we\xe2\x80\x99re not going to be attacked out of nowhere, are we? Is that why I\xe2\x80\x99m allowed to carry Grace?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna laughed warmly. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course we are not going to be attacked. But if we are, it would help if you were already prepared. And besides, remember that you\xe2\x80\x99re going to use your weapon in some of the magical teachings.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna entered her study again and sat down at the desk once more, waiting for Twilight to get comfortable.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIt took me a great deal of time to decide what branch of magic to start you out with,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna began. \xe2\x80\x9cI know you want to master each of them, but we can still only do one at a time. However, I recalled something that occurred the other day: You seem to be nervous about Necromancy. And so, that is what we are going to start with today.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight almost felt herself deflate a little at those words. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you sure, princess? I mean\xe2\x80\xa6 Necromancy should be reserved for unicorns with more practice with magic in general. I--I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99m ready.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTrust me my faithful student, you are more than ready. I will still be here to guide you, and will help you if it actually turns out you require aid. But the sooner we get this out of the way, the sooner we can focus on other branches, branches that you don\xe2\x80\x99t naturally fear.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried to stop her voice from shaking. \xe2\x80\x9cWhere do we start?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou start by listening to me,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna responded with a twinkle in her eye. \xe2\x80\x9cNecromancy has the potential to be the most complex branch of magic you\xe2\x80\x99ll ever explore. There are a few rules and regulations that need to be followed at all times, which you will quickly discover on your own. Since hardly anypony actually studies this type of magic, and those who do are not allowed to talk about it, Necromancy is naturally steeped in superstitions. I can assure you right now, all of those superstitions you have heard are wholly incorrect.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight went wide eyed at this. \xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6?\xe2\x80\x9d She let the sentence trail off into a question.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAnything you might have heard of Necromancy is likely to be wrong, Twilight Sparkle. When ponies do not understand something, they make up things. They create reasons, excuses as to why something is evil, or something is bad, because it is easier than simply not knowing at all.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\xa6 guess that makes sense.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight frowned dangerously. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I don\xe2\x80\x99t like making stuff up. I\xe2\x80\x99d rather learn about something, instead of just taking guesses at it.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cVery good, Twilight, and that is what makes you different from a great deal of my ponies. Now, Necromancy is very hands on. There are no special incantations, like some of other branches of magic. There are only two majorly important things in Necromancy. The willpower of the summoner, and the soul of the summoned. Since you are just now taking your first steps into this magic, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be the one summoning the soul, so that you can see how it is done.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tDespite herself, Twilight was curious. Right now it didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter if it was Necromancy or not. She was learning, and that was all that was important. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat happens then?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThen we will find out if a Link will be formed, or not.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA Link?\xe2\x80\x9d Now Twilight was just plain confused. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Link?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna only smiled mischievously. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll find out soon enough, my most faithful student. Now, watch me.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tAnd watch Twilight did. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn suddenly blazed to life, a sickly green tinged with black. As Twilight watched, Luna spoke some more. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is rather easy for me. I\xe2\x80\x99ve studied Necromancy for a long, long time, thus enabling me to summon any soul I wish, even the one I\xe2\x80\x99m not Linked to. What you are about to see will probably startle you, but I implore you to not freak out.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, transfixed by the display. Little motes of energy began falling from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s horn, faster and faster. The princess\xe2\x80\x99 face remained calm, collected. There was no visible strain on her face at all. Twilight marvelled at that fact. She had never seen anypony with so much control over their magic before. Quite soon, however, and Twilight was now preoccupied with something else. A dark mist began to form from thin air, taking on a vaguely pony shape. The mist began to solidify, and just was Twilight began to wonder at its purpose, the mist disappeared. In its place\xe2\x80\xa6 Was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s doppelganger. Twilight fought back a panicked scream. Her pupils dilated and her breathing began to come faster. It was taking all of her concentration to not just flip out.\r\n\r\n\tDespite her near hyperventilating state, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was doing what it did best: analyzing. The clone of Twilight Sparkle before her was the same, yet completely different. She was lighter, for starters, several shades lighter than Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s own coat and mane coloration. The lookalike also had overly bright eyes, almost shining like a lamp. The figure had started out almost insubstantial, like a ghost, but even as Twilight stared her twin seemed to further solidify, becoming more and more real every moment it stood there. But the thing that stood out the most was the fact that this clone of the original Twilight Sparkle had wings. They were perfectly serviceable, like any other pegasus--or Alicorn.\r\n\r\n\tPrincess Luna finally spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cWell met, Twilight Starshard. I\xe2\x80\x99ve not seen you in a long time.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe twin turned, her face lighting up in an easy grin. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna! I thought that was you summoning me!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIndeed. I am teaching my newest apprentice the art of Necromancy.\xe2\x80\x9d The new Twilight turned to glance back at the old one. For the briefest of moments, something flitted across her face. It was like a look of longing. The same look Twilight had thought she saw in Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes as she entered the study. In the next instant however, Starshard was grinning again, eyes alight with wonder.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo this is the one meant to be Linked to me! I wondered when somepony would show up. Twilight Starshard, at your service.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUm\xe2\x80\xa6 Twilight Sparkle. Pleased to meet you.\xe2\x80\x9d Then, unable to help herself, a veritable flood of questions came pouring from her mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cWho exactly are you? Why do you look like me? Why do you have wings?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard and Luna shared a glance. There was amusement there, but also\xe2\x80\xa6 slight hesitation? Twilight Sparkle wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure. Reading other ponies was not her strong suit.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cFirstly, I\xe2\x80\x99m Twilight Starshard. As to who I actually am\xe2\x80\xa6 I guess you could call me a physical representation of you, Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA physical representation of me?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYes. The study of life and death is full of intricacies, and even the most learned Necromancers don\xe2\x80\x99t always pretend to know all of its secrets. Basically\xe2\x80\xa6 I\xe2\x80\x99m an Alicorn who died about a thousand years ago. When Princess Luna summoned me with the intent of Linking me to you, my appearance altered to match your physical makeup.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo then,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice became very soft. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re dead?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard\xe2\x80\x99s shoulders slumped a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cI am. I have been for a great many years, now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut\xe2\x80\xa6 you\xe2\x80\x99re standing right there. You look so real!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThat got a warm chuckle from Starshard. \xe2\x80\x9cThat is because I am real. There is one part of the circle of life that is constant: Decision. When a pony dies, he or she has three choices: Rebirth, Revive, Restore. Some call them the three \xe2\x80\x98R\xe2\x80\x99s. Rebirth is a pony who does just that: The are Reborn into some form of undead. This choice is normally taken by ponies who still have unfinished business among the living. Ponies who choose to Revive are reborn into the world of the living from another womb. And ponies who choose Restore cross to the other side, to paradise. I am a pony who chose Rebirth. I came back to life as a Lich Queen, and even though my business within the living world has long been completed, once I became undead, there was no turning back.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind was practically running at a thousand miles a minute. She absorbed just enough information to respond: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry that you are stuck where you are.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t mind it. I can still help out in the world of the living.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight already had another question. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s a Lich Queen?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cA Lich Queen is an undead who controls other undead. Namely, zombies and skeletons. Those guys aren\xe2\x80\x99t usually very smart, so Lich Queens (or Kings) guide them and direct them.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou mean\xe2\x80\xa6 some ponies are Rebirthed as a zombie? That sounds awful.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard shook her head. \xe2\x80\x9cMost sentient creatures rarely Rebirth into something so unpleasant. You see, those types of creatures are the result of a Necromancer breaking the number one rule of this branch of magic. There are two rules a Necromancer must always follow. The first, is that you must never, ever, force an undead being to follow your will. You ask us, and it will be up to the individual undead to decide whether or not to help you in your endeavors. If you try to bend us to your will, not only will we ignore the directive, the Necromancer will degrade into the living dead; what you just called a zombie. If a Necromancer cannot follow this rule, then they do not need to be seeking the aid of unliving. Thousands of years ago, Necromancers made this mistake in droves. They were cocky, overconfident, thinking that all of their vaunted power could not be beaten. They paid the price. But these days, there aren\xe2\x80\x99t so many. I\xe2\x80\x99m sure Princess Luna has something to do with that.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cIndeed I do. Even the staunchest of ponies can give in to the lure of power, so I try to keep them away from such a fate as much as I can.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were the size of dinner plates. She had never expected something this momentous \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s the second rule of Necromancy?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link. When its been formed, it cannot be broken for any reason. If a Necromancer tries to remove the Link, the sharing of souls, then they\xe2\x80\x99ll enter the Void. They\xe2\x80\x99ll just cease to exist. No paradise, no Rebirth, no second or third life. Just\xe2\x80\xa6 gone.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight snorted softly. \xe2\x80\x9cBut what exactly is this Link you both are talking about? You\xe2\x80\x99ve mentioned it countless times now.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThe Link is a bond shared between the Necromancer and a Soul. When a Necromacner first begins to summon, the first soul he or she summons will be one closest to their genetic makeup. Once that summoning is complete, the undead summoned and the Necromancer will have a choice: They can either form a Link, or they can continue their separate ways and the Necromancer will never try that magic again.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat does it do? Is it just for cosmetic purposes, or what?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard was already shaking her head before the words even left Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth. \xe2\x80\x9cI cannot tell you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean, you can\xe2\x80\x99t tell me?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cUntil you make the decision for yourself, I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you. I\xe2\x80\x99m not really allowed to. But now that we are at this proverbial crossroads, I must ask, Friherrinna Twilena Star Sparkle av Twinkle: Do you wish to complete the Link? Do you wish to take the very first step in your training as a Necromancer of the Crown?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tTwilight was conflicted. On one hoof, this was everything she had feared about the subject laid bare before her. All of the superstitions she had heard were wrong. There was really nothing to be afraid of. But, now an undead Lich Queen was asking her to practically share her soul, if Twilight was hearing that correctly. Her life would never be the same if she accepted. Eventually, however, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s thirst for knowledge easily overpowered her fears of the unknown.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll accept,\xe2\x80\x9d she said proudly, struggling to keep her voice in check.\r\n\r\n\tStarshard, in turn, grinned slightly, like she knew Twilight was going to make this decision sooner or later. Rather than responding to the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s announcement, Starshard moved closer to Twilight. The suddenly nervous apprentice eyed the Lich Queen warily, but stood her ground. Whatever was going to happen next, Twilight was going to accept it proudly. Starshard stepped even closer, and the finally brought the length of her long, slender horn to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s smaller and stubbier one. The effect was immediate. Both let out loud gasps as a strange, unknown energy coursed through their bodies like an electric current. The power grew, and grew, swirling around the pair as they stood there, horns locked. Just as Twilight thought she would burst, the alien power suddenly changed direction--and flowed directly into Grace.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight nearly collapsed as the energy left her, Starshard supporting her gently. They were both panting like they had just ran a marathon. A distant part of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind noted that Starshard was rather warm, instead of the cold feeling she would have expected from an undead. As Twilight recovered, she felt an odd vibrating at her side. It was her glaive. The weapon slide out of its sheath and hovered right before Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, turning so that its owner could see the odd rune in the middle of the staff that had not been there previously.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\tStill partially staring at the rune in wonderment, Twilight turned to Luna, silently asking for an explanation.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIts a Necromancer Rune, Twilight. Its designed to enhance your spellcasting abilities with this branch of magic. Its why I had you obtain your weapon.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSo\xe2\x80\xa6 that\xe2\x80\x99s it? I\xe2\x80\x99m a Necromancer now?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tWell, yes and no.\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGah!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight yelped as she heard a familiar voice echoing around her mind. Luna was grinning. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat was that? Some form of telepathy?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard answered her. \xe2\x80\x9cIn a nutshell, yes. Its a part of the Link. Our minds are connected, allowing us to speak no matter how far apart we are. We also have a shared aether pool. Haven\xe2\x80\x99t you felt it yet?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tNow that Starshard mentioned it, Twilight did feel\xe2\x80\xa6 Stronger. More alive. She could feel the power coursing just below her horn, ready to be unleashed. A small smile began to play across her lips. \xe2\x80\x9cSo in other words, I\xe2\x80\x99m more magically powerful?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou are,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied. \xe2\x80\x9cBut, I\xe2\x80\x99m afraid your studies in Necromancy are far from over, my faithful student. You have a Link now, that is true. But there is still a great deal to learn. Summoning and controlling lesser undead and a whole host of over things. For now, however, we may call it quits. It is far past lunchtime, and I\xe2\x80\x99m sure you\xe2\x80\x99d like to grab a bite to eat before continuing.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tNow that Luna mentioned it, Twilight was feeling hungry. Ravenous, even. But there was something still bothering her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat about you, Starshard? I mean, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re here now, but what's going to happen from here?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard chuckled. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, now that I\xe2\x80\x99m Summoned and Linked, I\xe2\x80\x99ll stay in the world of the living for as long as I want, until my Summoner sends me back for whatever reason. Right now, however, I would like the opportunity to catch up to Luna.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight nodded almost absently, her curiosity sated at the moment. With a small wave of her hoof, the lavender unicorn departed.\r\n\r\n\tStarshard waited until the door was closed and she could no longer hear Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoofsteps before turning to Princess Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you think she suspects anything? Or knows?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna was already shaking her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. She\xe2\x80\x99s still in the dark. But she won\xe2\x80\x99t be for long. Twilight is incredibly smart and resourceful. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never met another pony with her drive for knowledge. She even surpasses the last Valkyrie in that regard. She\xe2\x80\x99ll figure out the truth eventually. And by then, I hope that we will have prepared her as best we can.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tStarshard sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cI sure do hope so. I almost couldn\xe2\x80\x99t keep my expression clear when I first saw her. I\xe2\x80\x99ve missed her for a very long time.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tLuna echoed Starshard\xe2\x80\x99s sigh. \xe2\x80\x9cI know, Starshard. I have too.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n", 'epub': None}

Some were subtle, others were not, but they were there. She could feel them boring into her form as she crossed the hall towards the heavily laden food carts. However, having great practice at ignoring things that bothered her, Twilight simply pushed this fact to the back of her mind and focused instead on getting something to eat. After all of the afternoon\xe2\x80\x99s excitement, Twilight was fully prepared to stuff her face until she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t move from her spot. Heaping her plate high with her favorite foods, her mind drifted back to a couple of nights ago, when she had been unable to eat. She\xe2\x80\x99d been so paralyzed with fear over something completely silly. And she knew it, too. Of course, just because she knew this now didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean that a tiny part of her hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been afraid of being overlooked. Twilight headed towards her usual table without thinking. But as she went to set down her heavily laden tray, Twilight became aware of a few of new additions to the table, not counting the four other orphans who normally sat there.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The first one, surprisingly, was Rarity. Why she was all of a suddenly joining the other four orphans after a year of avoiding them was beyond Twilight, but she did have a sneaking suspicion it had something to do with Princess Luna. The other two were both pegasi a little older than Rainbow Dash; judging by their quiet discipline, they were probably from the Wonderbolt Academy. Twilight also took careful notice of the weapons they had brought with them, leaning casually on the wall behind them. One was a large and simple broadsword, designed primarily for heavy combat, definitely sturdy. The other was a metal rod looking contraption Twilight quickly recognized as a lightning caster.Twilight took her spot in the center of the table, making sure her own weapon was going to be fine without having to take it off. Ever since Luna had said actually wearing a weapon was allowed, Twilight hadn\xe2\x80\x99t wanted to stray too far from Grace. For some absurd reason it made her feel safer. Finally, Twilight glanced up to be introduced to the newcomers.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Rainbow Dash, who\xe2\x80\x99d been waiting for her fellow orphan to situate herself, did just that. \xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, this is Lightning Dust\xe2\x80\x9d-- A teal coated Pegasus with a mustard yellow two toned mane-- \xe2\x80\x9cand Ditzy Doo.\xe2\x80\x9d The last was a grey pegasus with slightly off kilter eyes. Both nodded at Twilight, before Lightning Dust spoke.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cSo you\xe2\x80\x99re the famed Twilight Sparkle we\xe2\x80\x99ve been hearing about.\xe2\x80\x9d She extended a hoof to bump to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ve had the Academy in a bit of an uproar these past couple of nights.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight arched an eyebrow. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Lightning Dust shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cApparently you upset quite a few nobles when Princess Luna barely even glanced at their sons and daughters and immediately made for you. We\xe2\x80\x99ve been listening to cadets whine and complain that their siblings were ignored, haven\xe2\x80\x99t we, Ditz?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The grey pegasus nodded emphatically, proclaiming, \xe2\x80\x9cYup! Its kind of funny, really. Apparently they thought Twilight would be forgotten, with her parents dead and being the last of her line and all.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cDitzy!\xe2\x80\x9d Rarity exclaimed. \xe2\x80\x9cThat was a rather impolite thing to say.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cIts okay, Rarity,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was quick to interject, smiling at the bubbly pegasus. \xe2\x80\x9cTruthfully, anything that upsets the nobility is fine by me.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Rarity sighed, a bit dramatically. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m inclined to agree with you there, Darling. I guess I\xe2\x80\x99m rather fortunate that my foster family lets me come and go as I please. They weren\xe2\x80\x99t expecting me to become one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s students, but when I did they were quite pleased. Even so, they\xe2\x80\x99ve not really tried to use me as a means to climb up the social ladder.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Discussion from there dissolved into the rather pleasant banter that usually accompanied dinner. Twilight found that she was rather liking both Lightning Dust and Ditzy Doo. The former was almost like Dash in a way, outspoken and wanting to be the center of attention. It was actually kind of funny watching Dust and Pinkie compete to see who could gain everypony\xe2\x80\x99s attention better. As for Ditzy\xe2\x80\xa6 well, she was Ditzy. Twilight had heard talk of the pegasus before, but never would have associated the rumors with the cheerful mare across from her. The way the rumors had it, Ditzy was an insanely clumsy and unapproachable flier who\xe2\x80\x99d rather barbeque you with her lightning caster than look at you. Seeing the mare in the flesh\xe2\x80\xa6 it was hard for the unicorn to believe anything that talk said. But then she mentally scolded herself. What would Rarity say if she knew that Twilight was actually putting stock into mere rumors? The thought caused the unicorn to grin inwardly. Her amusement was cut short, however, as the three cadets at the table froze. They seemed to be staring at somepony behind Twilight. But before the unicorn could turn around, one of the newcomers spoke.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cSo, this is the table all the losers congregate at, huh?\xe2\x80\x9d The voice immediately made Twilight dislike the speaker. It was rough and barely cultured, and seemed to grate upon the ears longer than normal. Before anything else could be said, a second voice chimed in.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cHey, who said you guys are allowed to carry weapons inside the palace? Especially you, Plum. You don\xe2\x80\x99t even have yours leaning upon the wall. Somepony could get in trouble for that.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Dust and Dash looked like they were about tear into the mystery ponies behind them, but Twilight silenced them with a look. She then rose fluidly to her hooves, and in one smooth motion, turned to face the stallions. There were three of them, all brawn and obviously no brains. She cleared her throat a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cFirst of all, my name is Twilight Sparkle, not \xe2\x80\x98Plum\xe2\x80\x99. Secondly, you will find that as an apprentice of Princess Luna, I am perfectly within my rights to conduct my business while armed. Furthermore, seeing as both of those Cadets are accompanying me, I permit them to carry their weapons if they so see fit.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe pegasus before her, who seemed to be the leader of the trio, apparently didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear a word past her name. \xe2\x80\x9cSparkle? So you\xe2\x80\x99re the tramp Luna decided would make a better mage than the rest of my family!\xe2\x80\x9d The bully practically shouted his sentence to the entire hall to hear, and the area fell silent, eyes boring into the confrontation before them.\r\n\t\r\n\tWith barely a glimmer from her horn, Grace unsheathed itself and came to rest at Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s side. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat did you call me?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was so cold, everypony else at the table shivered a bit. The stallions before her either didn\xe2\x80\x99t see the danger approaching, or were just too stupid to recognize it.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cI called you a tramp. You\xe2\x80\x99re a no-good waste of space who somehow thinks she\xe2\x80\x99s better than one of the most powerful houses in Equestria.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The third one piped up, obviously wanting to get in his two bits. \xe2\x80\x9cYea! And what\xe2\x80\x99s that you\xe2\x80\x99re trying to threaten us with? A pig sticker? What, too weak to carry a real weapon?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight merely closed her eyes and sighed, a deep sound. She shifted her gaze to some point behind the bullies. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you think, Luna? How should I handle this rabble?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The three pegasi whirled on the spot, staring up in apprehension at Princess Luna, who had seemingly arrived out of nowhere. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s a good question, Twilight. Why don\xe2\x80\x99t you challenge them to a sparring match outside? Dumbbell, Hoops, and Calamity versus you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0One of the stallions snorted rudely. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you serious? Three well trained cadets against one little mare who\xe2\x80\x99s not even a real mage?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna surveyed the stallion before her, eyes seeming to pierce his soul. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m perfectly serious. If you win, I\xe2\x80\x99ll consider taking one of your siblings as my apprentice.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was shaking her head, smiling softly. \xe2\x80\x9cIs this one of your ways of testing me, Luna? If so\xe2\x80\xa6 Lets see if I can teach these bullies a lesson in humility they won't forget.\xe2\x80\x9d With that, the lavender mare sheathed her glaive and began to thread her way out of the hall and into the courtyard beyond. The other orphans and the two Wonderbolt Cadets followed her eagerly. The entire dining hall fell in step behind them, chatting excitedly. There were more than a fair share convinced that the three seasoned cadets were going to walk all over Twilight, but those who knew that Princess Luna chose her apprentices carefully weren\xe2\x80\x99t so sure. Very few had ever actually seen Twilight use her magic. The only thing anyone really knew about the mare was that she spent most of her time with her nose buried in a book.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was vaguely aware of the other orphans crowding around her, all talking at once. Twilight, however, turned off her ears; they were not important right now. There would be time later to talk to them, but right now, she had to focus. There was very little doubt in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind that this was a test. Luna had said she wanted to see how proficient Twilight was in actual physical combat. Why exactly Luna wanted to know if she could handle a weapon was beyond the apprentice; undoubtedly having runes emblazoned into an instrument helped, but to her knowledge, most mages didn\xe2\x80\x99t engage in melee combat. They stayed at range and rained down spells before an enemy could reach them. But, then again, Twilight very much doubted that Princess Luna was anything like other mages, or masters for that matter.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s hooves took her to the practice enclosure. It was automatic, as it was the same place her and Shining used to spar in the early early eveing before other ponies were awake to watch them. She strode purposefully to the other side of the square while a giant crowd of spectators came to a stop at the very edge. Word had apparently spread like wildfire, because it looked like every student in the city had come to watch the fight. The thought made Twilight a bit queasy, but once more the lavender unicorn pushed those emotions away. If she could spar against the captain of the guard and walk away relatively unscathed, she was sure she could survive this trial. Of course, her brother was only a single pony; here, she was facing three. Once more, Grace sang as she drew the glaive from its sheath. As she held it in her hooves for a brief moment, the familiar weight of the weapon helped to put her even more at ease. She continued to stare at her new weapon, and something within her mind clicked. She had fought with this weapon before. She knew how to best use it. With utmost precision, Twilight Sparkle reared back upon her rear hooves. Her right hoof came forward and her left foot inched back, and she automatically centered the rest of her body to keep herself balanced. At the same time, her left hoof stretched out slightly in front of her, while her right reached out behind her, Grace held diagonally with the blade thrust above her right shoulder. This further helped improve her balance.\r\n\t\r\n\tThere were more than a few murmurs of astonishment from the watching crowd. Most combative ponies used a combination of their front hooves and their mouths to swing their weapon, while keeping both rear hooves on the ground for stabilization. The three bullies before her on the opposite side of the square, however, merely laughed at her. Apparently they thought she looked rather funny. Twilight ignored their sneers and carefully studied the trio. Dumbbell held a monster of a greatsword. That would give him some impressive reach, but would also slow him down a bit. Hoops was equipped with a pair of small axes; fast attacks, short range, and two weapons to keep track of. Calamity carried the standard mace and shield combination. But then Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s attention was drawn to Princess Luna, who stepped into the center of the ring. She fixed Twilight with a sharp stare. \r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cNow, I want a nice, clean fight,\xe2\x80\x9d she began, before sweeping her gaze towards the stallions, \xe2\x80\x9cFrom all of you.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna then flapped her powerful wings and rose swiftly into the air, and Twilight took that as an invitation to continue. \r\n\t\r\n\tThe unicorn wasted no time in advancing. She bounded across the ring on her rear hooves, almost like a deer would. The three cadets split up, thinking to hit her from three directions: Front, right, and left. Twilight fell right into the trap, taking another step forward. They were on her in seconds, but instead of the quick victory they had assumed they\xe2\x80\x99d get, they got a faceful of Grace. Twilight moved the polearm easily, parrying the attack of Dumbbell with the blade, sending the massive greatsword screeching off to one side. Hoops then came in, whirling his axes in small circles. Twilight juked to one side, narrowly avoiding one weapon before bringing Grace parallel to stop the second. Calamity ended up backing away swiftly when faced with the butt end of the weapon. Twilight then spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cLesson number one: This \xe2\x80\x98pigsticker\xe2\x80\x99 allows me to parry multiple attacks without leaving my guard broken or my sight blinded.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe fight then began in earnest. The three bullies systematically attacked Twilight Sparkle over and over again. They seemed convinced that if they kept attacking long enough, eventually she would wear herself down. Grace was a blur as it danced in the mage\xe2\x80\x99s hooves, parrying attack after attack. Parry horizontal. Parry vertically. Catch the edge of that broadsword on the blade. Use the butt of Grace to fend off Calamity\xe2\x80\x99s shield slam. Twirl, two short jabs at offending shield. Twist to stop the broadsword from cleaving her in two. On and on and on, never ending always moving. Twilight felt as though she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in control of her body any more. She was nothing more than a passenger, watching her own hooves as they moved like she had been doing this her whole life.\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how long they\xe2\x80\x99d been going at it now. She was caked in sweat, her mane plastered to her forehead. She sported several shallow scratches and cuts, courtesy of not being able to dissipate all of the momentum behind a vicious attack. The three cadets might have been just as tired, but if they were, it was pure determination that still fueled them onwards. As Twilight moved to counterattack after a block, she slipped on a slick patch of grass. Then, all at once, her balance was lost. She fell forward, throwing out her forehooves to stop her downward movement. She landed with Grace beneath her and that dreaded broadsword arching down to meet her unprotected back.\r\n\t\r\n\tOnly to meet a hard mana shield. Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn flared brighter and the shield launched skyward, jerking the blade away from the unicorn. Twilight regained her hoofing, panting slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cLesson number two: You should remember that your foe is also a mage, and that magic is as deadly a weapon as a physical one.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe three cadets were about finished, now. Dumbbell had anticipating on striking the mare while she was down and ending it all right then and there. But that didn\xe2\x80\x99t happen, and the three cadets were now folding under the annoyed unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s assault. A hard mana shield slammed into Hoops, sweeping the stunned stallion off his hooves. He lay there on the hard-packed earth, the fight beaten out of him. Calamity took one look at the slowly approaching apprentice and fled, dropping his weapons and trying to shove his way out of the crowd of spectators. Dumbbell, however, lived up to his name in more ways than one. He charged at Twilight, rage driven and determined to end the lavender mare who\xe2\x80\x99d caused him so much embarrassment and pain. Twilight was waiting for him. She stabbed out with the blade of Grace and twisted the weapon at the same time, \xe2\x80\x98stinging\xe2\x80\x99 Dumbbell\xe2\x80\x99s hoof and causing him to drop his heavy weapon. Twilight was upon him in seconds, lifting the struggling stallion up with a burst from her horn. Twilight spoke softly and furiously.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cLesson three. You would do well to remember that so long as I still take breath into this body, House Twinkle lives. And the last time I checked, House Twinkle outranks yours.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tAnd with that, Twilight released the cowering cadet. She retrieved Grace and fit it back into its holster, and as she did so, she became aware of the tumult of noise around her. Stunned murmurs and the occasional cheer cut through the air as the weary unicorn turned to find Princess Luna. Her mentor nodded softly at her, indicating approval. Twilight could barely do much more than smile once in return before making her tired way back up to the Dining Hall. She had a dinner to finish, after all.\r\n\t\r\n\t<<((*))>>\r\n\t\r\n\tPrincess Luna sat up in her study when the knock resounded at the door. It was late and most ponies were already in bed, but Luna knew who this was. \xe2\x80\x9cEnter.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tIn walked a weary Twilight Sparkle. The young mare still sported the aftereffects of her little battle. She had been so focused on filling her belly with some sort of sustenance she had flat out refused to go to the hospital wing to get healed. Studying her student silently, Luna decided that it really made Twilight look the part. The Lunar Princess could almost believe that it was the Valkyrie standing there, having just returned from a successful defensive skirmish. Luna mentally shook that image away; there was still a ways to go yet before Twilight was ready for that title and its responsibilities. Luna was the first to speak, already guessing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s first question.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThat was your trial in combat, Twilight. I had told you I wanted to see how proficient you were, and the opportunity presented itself.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut against three opponents? Most others would have fallen.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut you did not, which shows you have far greater strength in you than others know.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI almost died, Luna!\xe2\x80\x9d The Lunar Monarch flinched slightly at the raised voice. So this was what was bothering her student. \xe2\x80\x9cIf not for my magic, I would have left this world for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna composed herself; she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t afford to show the raw emotion running through her at hearing Twilight so frightened. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd they will be punished accordingly. Dumbbell especially. They were only supposed to defeat you in honorable combat. I had not anticipated them to act so out of hand. It would appear that I made some nobles rather angry, in accepting you as my apprentice.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight huffed. \xe2\x80\x9cYou could say that again.\xe2\x80\x9d She was silent for a moment, before finally shifting slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cI also have a bit of a question.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe princess raised a brow. \xe2\x80\x9cOh?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhen I was out there fighting\xe2\x80\xa6 It felt as though I had lost control of my body. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never, ever fought like that before, even against Shining Armor. I knew what to do. How to fight like that. How to keep myself centered. I knew that my odd fighting style would be unpredictable to those unaccustomed to it. Why, Luna? Why do I suddenly have all of this knowledge?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna had to work to keep her face calm. Twilight was advancing along at an almost frightening pace. Her mind raced, scrambling for something, anything, to tell her student. Finally, she spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cLooks like I may have to have a word with Starshard about using the Link to influence you. You\xe2\x80\x99re not going to learn much on your own if she\xe2\x80\x99s helping you too much.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight breathed a slight sigh of relief. \xe2\x80\x9cI thought it was something a little more sinister. Tell her I\xe2\x80\x99d much rather learn things on my own. I\xe2\x80\x99m\xe2\x80\xa6 also sorry for raising my voice at you earlier.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna inclined her head. \xe2\x80\x9cI feel you were perfectly within your rights to shout at me, Twilight. But, I feel you also learned a valuable lesson tonight, and one that could be very important to your future studies: Never be afraid to involve magic in a fight, even if your opponents do not have any.
