Apparently they thought Twilight would be forgotten, with her parents dead and being the last of her line and all.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cDitzy!\xe2\x80\x9d Rarity exclaimed. \xe2\x80\x9cThat was a rather impolite thing to say.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cIts okay, Rarity,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was quick to interject, smiling at the bubbly pegasus. \xe2\x80\x9cTruthfully, anything that upsets the nobility is fine by me.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Rarity sighed, a bit dramatically. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m inclined to agree with you there, Darling. I guess I\xe2\x80\x99m rather fortunate that my foster family lets me come and go as I please. They weren\xe2\x80\x99t expecting me to become one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s students, but when I did they were quite pleased. Even so, they\xe2\x80\x99ve not really tried to use me as a means to climb up the social ladder.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Discussion from there dissolved into the rather pleasant banter that usually accompanied dinner. Twilight found that she was rather liking both Lightning Dust and Ditzy Doo. The former was almost like Dash in a way, outspoken and wanting to be the center of attention. It was actually kind of funny watching Dust and Pinkie compete to see who could gain everypony\xe2\x80\x99s attention better. As for Ditzy\xe2\x80\xa6 well, she was Ditzy. Twilight had heard talk of the pegasus before, but never would have associated the rumors with the cheerful mare across from her. The way the rumors had it, Ditzy was an insanely clumsy and unapproachable flier who\xe2\x80\x99d rather barbeque you with her lightning caster than look at you. Seeing the mare in the flesh\xe2\x80\xa6 it was hard for the unicorn to believe anything that talk said. But then she mentally scolded herself. What would Rarity say if she knew that Twilight was actually putting stock into mere rumors? The thought caused the unicorn to grin inwardly. Her amusement was cut short, however, as the three cadets at the table froze. They seemed to be staring at somepony behind Twilight. But before the unicorn could turn around, one of the newcomers spoke.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cSo, this is the table all the losers congregate at, huh?\xe2\x80\x9d The voice immediately made Twilight dislike the speaker. It was rough and barely cultured, and seemed to grate upon the ears longer than normal. Before anything else could be said, a second voice chimed in.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cHey, who said you guys are allowed to carry weapons inside the palace? Especially you, Plum. You don\xe2\x80\x99t even have yours leaning upon the wall. Somepony could get in trouble for that.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Dust and Dash looked like they were about tear into the mystery ponies behind them, but Twilight silenced them with a look. She then rose fluidly to her hooves, and in one smooth motion, turned to face the stallions. There were three of them, all brawn and obviously no brains. She cleared her throat a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cFirst of all, my name is Twilight Sparkle, not \xe2\x80\x98Plum\xe2\x80\x99. Secondly, you will find that as an apprentice of Princess Luna, I am perfectly within my rights to conduct my business while armed. Furthermore, seeing as both of those Cadets are accompanying me, I permit them to carry their weapons if they so see fit.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe pegasus before her, who seemed to be the leader of the trio, apparently didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear a word past her name. \xe2\x80\x9cSparkle? So you\xe2\x80\x99re the tramp Luna decided would make a better mage than the rest of my family!\xe2\x80\x9d The bully practically shouted his sentence to the entire hall to hear, and the area fell silent, eyes boring into the confrontation before them.\r\n\t\r\n\tWith barely a glimmer from her horn, Grace unsheathed itself and came to rest at Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s side. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat did you call me?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was so cold, everypony else at the table shivered a bit. The stallions before her either didn\xe2\x80\x99t see the danger approaching, or were just too stupid to recognize it.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cI called you a tramp. You\xe2\x80\x99re a no-good waste of space who somehow thinks she\xe2\x80\x99s better than one of the most powerful houses in Equestria.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The third one piped up, obviously wanting to get in his two bits. \xe2\x80\x9cYea! And what\xe2\x80\x99s that you\xe2\x80\x99re trying to threaten us with? A pig sticker? What, too weak to carry a real weapon?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight merely closed her eyes and sighed, a deep sound. She shifted her gaze to some point behind the bullies. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you think, Luna? How should I handle this rabble?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The three pegasi whirled on the spot, staring up in apprehension at Princess Luna, who had seemingly arrived out of nowhere. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s a good question, Twilight. Why don\xe2\x80\x99t you challenge them to a sparring match outside? Dumbbell, Hoops, and Calamity versus you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0One of the stallions snorted rudely. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you serious? Three well trained cadets against one little mare who\xe2\x80\x99s not even a real mage?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna surveyed the stallion before her, eyes seeming to pierce his soul. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m perfectly serious. If you win, I\xe2\x80\x99ll consider taking one of your siblings as my apprentice.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was shaking her head, smiling softly. \xe2\x80\x9cIs this one of your ways of testing me, Luna? If so\xe2\x80\xa6 Lets see if I can teach these bullies a lesson in humility they won't forget.\xe2\x80\x9d With that, the lavender mare sheathed her glaive and began to thread her way out of the hall and into the courtyard beyond. The other orphans and the two Wonderbolt Cadets followed her eagerly. The entire dining hall fell in step behind them, chatting excitedly. There were more than a fair share convinced that the three seasoned cadets were going to walk all over Twilight, but those who knew that Princess Luna chose her apprentices carefully weren\xe2\x80\x99t so sure. Very few had ever actually seen Twilight use her magic. The only thing anyone really knew about the mare was that she spent most of her time with her nose buried in a book.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was vaguely aware of the other orphans crowding around her, all talking at once. Twilight, however, turned off her ears; they were not important right now. There would be time later to talk to them, but right now, she had to focus. There was very little doubt in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind that this was a test. Luna had said she wanted to see how proficient Twilight was in actual physical combat. Why exactly Luna wanted to know if she could handle a weapon was beyond the apprentice; undoubtedly having runes emblazoned into an instrument helped, but to her knowledge, most mages didn\xe2\x80\x99t engage in melee combat. They stayed at range and rained down spells before an enemy could reach them. But, then again, Twilight very much doubted that Princess Luna was anything like other mages, or masters for that matter.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s hooves took her to the practice enclosure. It was automatic, as it was the same place her and Shining used to spar in the early early eveing before other ponies were awake to watch them. She strode purposefully to the other side of the square while a giant crowd of spectators came to a stop at the very edge. Word had apparently spread like wildfire, because it looked like every student in the city had come to watch the fight. The thought made Twilight a bit queasy, but once more the lavender unicorn pushed those emotions away. If she could spar against the captain of the guard and walk away relatively unscathed, she was sure she could survive this trial. Of course, her brother was only a single pony; here, she was facing three. Once more, Grace sang as she drew the glaive from its sheath. As she held it in her hooves for a brief moment, the familiar weight of the weapon helped to put her even more at ease. She continued to stare at her new weapon, and something within her mind clicked. She had fought with this weapon before. She knew how to best use it. With utmost precision, Twilight Sparkle reared back upon her rear hooves. Her right hoof came forward and her left foot inched back, and she automatically centered the rest of her body to keep herself balanced. At the same time, her left hoof stretched out slightly in front of her, while her right reached out behind her, Grace held diagonally with the blade thrust above her right shoulder. This further helped improve her balance.\r\n\t\r\n\tThere were more than a few murmurs of astonishment from the watching crowd. Most combative ponies used a combination of their front hooves and their mouths to swing their weapon, while keeping both rear hooves on the ground for stabilization. The three bullies before her on the opposite side of the square, however, merely laughed at her. Apparently they thought she looked rather funny. Twilight ignored their sneers and carefully studied the trio. Dumbbell held a monster of a greatsword. That would give him some impressive reach, but would also slow him down a bit. Hoops was equipped with a pair of small axes; fast attacks, short range, and two weapons to keep track of. Calamity carried the standard mace and shield combination. But then Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s attention was drawn to Princess Luna, who stepped into the center of the ring. She fixed Twilight with a sharp stare. \r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cNow, I want a nice, clean fight,\xe2\x80\x9d she began, before sweeping her gaze towards the stallions, \xe2\x80\x9cFrom all of you.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna then flapped her powerful wings and rose swiftly into the air, and Twilight took that as an invitation to continue. \r\n\t\r\n\tThe unicorn wasted no time in advancing. She bounded across the ring on her rear hooves, almost like a deer would. The three cadets split up, thinking to hit her from three directions: Front, right, and left. Twilight fell right into the trap, taking another step forward. They were on her in seconds, but instead of the quick victory they had assumed they\xe2\x80\x99d get, they got a faceful of Grace. Twilight moved the polearm easily, parrying the attack of Dumbbell with the blade, sending the massive greatsword screeching off to one side. Hoops then came in, whirling his axes in small circles. Twilight juked to one side, narrowly avoiding one weapon before bringing Grace parallel to stop the second. Calamity ended up backing away swiftly when faced with the butt end of the weapon. Twilight then spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cLesson number one: This \xe2\x80\x98pigsticker\xe2\x80\x99 allows me to parry multiple attacks without leaving my guard broken or my sight blinded.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe fight then began in earnest. The three bullies systematically attacked Twilight Sparkle over and over again. They seemed convinced that if they kept attacking long enough, eventually she would wear herself down. Grace was a blur as it danced in the mage\xe2\x80\x99s hooves, parrying attack after attack. Parry horizontal. Parry vertically. Catch the edge of that broadsword on the blade. Use the butt of Grace to fend off Calamity\xe2\x80\x99s shield slam. Twirl, two short jabs at offending shield. Twist to stop the broadsword from cleaving her in two. On and on and on, never ending always moving. Twilight felt as though she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in control of her body any more. She was nothing more than a passenger, watching her own hooves as they moved like she had been doing this her whole life.\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how long they\xe2\x80\x99d been going at it now. She was caked in sweat, her mane plastered to her forehead. She sported several shallow scratches and cuts, courtesy of not being able to dissipate all of the momentum behind a vicious attack. The three cadets might have been just as tired, but if they were, it was pure determination that still fueled them onwards. As Twilight moved to counterattack after a block, she slipped on a slick patch of grass. Then, all at once, her balance was lost. She fell forward, throwing out her forehooves to stop her downward movement. She landed with Grace beneath her and that dreaded broadsword arching down to meet her unprotected back.\r\n\t\r\n\tOnly to meet a hard mana shield. Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn flared brighter and the shield launched skyward, jerking the blade away from the unicorn. Twilight regained her hoofing, panting slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cLesson number two: You should remember that your foe is also a mage, and that magic is as deadly a weapon as a physical one.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe three cadets were about finished, now. Dumbbell had anticipating on striking the mare while she was down and ending it all right then and there. But that didn\xe2\x80\x99t happen, and the three cadets were now folding under the annoyed unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s assault. A hard mana shield slammed into Hoops, sweeping the stunned stallion off his hooves. He lay there on the hard-packed earth, the fight beaten out of him. Calamity took one look at the slowly approaching apprentice and fled, dropping his weapons and trying to shove his way out of the crowd of spectators. Dumbbell, however, lived up to his name in more ways than one. He charged at Twilight, rage driven and determined to end the lavender mare who\xe2\x80\x99d caused him so much embarrassment and pain. Twilight was waiting for him. She stabbed out with the blade of Grace and twisted the weapon at the same time, \xe2\x80\x98stinging\xe2\x80\x99 Dumbbell\xe2\x80\x99s hoof and causing him to drop his heavy weapon. Twilight was upon him in seconds, lifting the struggling stallion up with a burst from her horn. Twilight spoke softly and furiously.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cLesson three. You would do well to remember that so long as I still take breath into this body, House Twinkle lives. And the last time I checked, House Twinkle outranks yours.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tAnd with that, Twilight released the cowering cadet. She retrieved Grace and fit it back into its holster, and as she did so, she became aware of the tumult of noise around her. Stunned murmurs and the occasional cheer cut through the air as the weary unicorn turned to find Princess Luna. Her mentor nodded softly at her, indicating approval. Twilight could barely do much more than smile once in return before making her tired way back up to the Dining Hall. She had a dinner to finish, after all.\r\n\t\r\n\t<<((*))>>\r\n\t\r\n\tPrincess Luna sat up in her study when the knock resounded at the door. It was late and most ponies were already in bed, but Luna knew who this was. \xe2\x80\x9cEnter.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tIn walked a weary Twilight Sparkle. The young mare still sported the aftereffects of her little battle. She had been so focused on filling her belly with some sort of sustenance she had flat out refused to go to the hospital wing to get healed. Studying her student silently, Luna decided that it really made Twilight look the part. The Lunar Princess could almost believe that it was the Valkyrie standing there, having just returned from a successful defensive skirmish. Luna mentally shook that image away; there was still a ways to go yet before Twilight was ready for that title and its responsibilities. Luna was the first to speak, already guessing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s first question.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThat was your trial in combat, Twilight. I had told you I wanted to see how proficient you were, and the opportunity presented itself.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut against three opponents? Most others would have fallen.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut you did not, which shows you have far greater strength in you than others know.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI almost died, Luna!\xe2\x80\x9d The Lunar Monarch flinched slightly at the raised voice. So this was what was bothering her student. \xe2\x80\x9cIf not for my magic, I would have left this world for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna composed herself; she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t afford to show the raw emotion running through her at hearing Twilight so frightened. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd they will be punished accordingly. Dumbbell especially. They were only supposed to defeat you in honorable combat. I had not anticipated them to act so out of hand. It would appear that I made some nobles rather angry, in accepting you as my apprentice.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight huffed. \xe2\x80\x9cYou could say that again.\xe2\x80\x9d She was silent for a moment, before finally shifting slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cI also have a bit of a question.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe princess raised a brow. \xe2\x80\x9cOh?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhen I was out there fighting\xe2\x80\xa6 It felt as though I had lost control of my body. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never, ever fought like that before, even against Shining Armor. I knew what to do. How to fight like that. How to keep myself centered. I knew that my odd fighting style would be unpredictable to those unaccustomed to it. Why, Luna? Why do I suddenly have all of this knowledge?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna had to work to keep her face calm. Twilight was advancing along at an almost frightening pace. Her mind raced, scrambling for something, anything, to tell her student. Finally, she spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cLooks like I may have to have a word with Starshard about using the Link to influence you. You\xe2\x80\x99re not going to learn much on your own if she\xe2\x80\x99s helping you too much.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight breathed a slight sigh of relief. \xe2\x80\x9cI thought it was something a little more sinister. Tell her I\xe2\x80\x99d much rather learn things on my own. I\xe2\x80\x99m\xe2\x80\xa6 also sorry for raising my voice at you earlier.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna inclined her head. \xe2\x80\x9cI feel you were perfectly within your rights to shout at me, Twilight. But, I feel you also learned a valuable lesson tonight, and one that could be very important to your future studies: Never be afraid to involve magic in a fight, even if your opponents do not have any. As you saw tonight, it may save your life. Now. I want you to return to your quarters, and get some sleep. I know you are exhausted, and your training continues tomorrow. While your Link to Starshard was a huge step in your studies of Necromancy, it was also just the beginning. There is quite a bit more for you to learn before you are ready to move on to the next branch of magic.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight tilted her head. \xe2\x80\x9cWhere is Starshard, anyway? I didn\xe2\x80\x99t even see her at the fight.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI believe she has taken up residence in one of the many unused guest rooms this place has. As to why she did not personally appear, I imagine that her appearance would have been quite jarring-- first of all, because she is undead. Though she might mask some of her nature, there are a few who are bound to pick up on it. Secondly, she does look almost identical to you. That right there would cause even more of a stir. Now, off with you, my faithful student. I have yet to converse with my advisors before I may turn in for the night.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight bid her teacher goodnight and left. Mere moments after her departure, another knock sounded at the door, and in walked Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s oldest friends. The Princess smiled.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSpitfire,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna greeted warmly. The flaming pegasus flashed her trademark grin in response, before tossing herself carelessly into the chair Twilight had just vacated. \xe2\x80\x9cZecora. Always my eyes and ears, yes?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe zebra chuckled and answered, \xe2\x80\x9cThe eyes and ears of our Princess we are, EI has our spies wide and far.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cShimmer. The reason many of us are still here.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe pegasus blushed a little. \xe2\x80\x9cNonsense, Luna. All the Corps does is aid recovery.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhich is why we are all the more thankful to have you.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna turned to the last newcomer, regarding him with twinkling eyes. \xe2\x80\x9cHalt. Silver Bit got his nose up his ass again?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tHalter O\xe2\x80\x99Carrick stepped forward, struggling to hide his grin at his Princess\xe2\x80\x99 foul language. Halt never ever smiled. At least, not in all of the hundreds of years Luna has known him. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course he does. That stupid Sol thinks he\xe2\x80\x99s better than anyone else.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cRemind me as to why you\xe2\x80\x99ve not had him locked up, or banished him from Equestria yet?\xe2\x80\x9d Spitfire asked.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cHe\xe2\x80\x99s not really done anything wrong. I can\xe2\x80\x99t lock up a pony just because he wishes that Corona Flare had brought about neverending day.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tSpitfire snorted, which Luna decided to ignore. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, you know why I\xe2\x80\x99ve called you all here, so lets get this out of the way first, so that we might be able to enjoy a little bit of each other\xe2\x80\x99s company before we have to turn in for the night. Spitfire, you start.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tSpitfire seemed to mull over her next words a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cDash is, hands down, probably the best recruit the Wonderbolt Academy has seen since I graced its halls many many years ago.\xe2\x80\x9d Everypony in the room gave some sort of exclamation. This was high praise, coming from Spitfire. \xe2\x80\x9cThat pegasus does things with her wings I\xe2\x80\x99ve never seen any other pony accomplish. She does exceedingly well with pretty much everything--except her actual classes. While she does get good marks in them, they still bore her. Being such a natural flier means that most of the stuff the instructors are teaching her are nothing new to her. I might end up having to place her in advanced classes, like I was. I\xe2\x80\x99ll have to do it cautiously, to ensure she does not get too cocky, but I would hazard a guess she\xe2\x80\x99ll be a full blown Wonderbolt in a year and a half. Maybe less.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t the normal Wonderbolt training program a total of four years before becoming a full fledged member?\xe2\x80\x9d Shimmer asked.\r\n\t\r\n\tSpitfire nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cIt just goes to show how talented she is, if I think she\xe2\x80\x99ll become a Wonderbolt before I did.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna rubbed a hoof over her chin thoughtfully. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is interesting, but definitely a good thing. What about you, Shimmer? How is young Fluttershy coming along?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cDespite being extremely shy of even her own shadow, Fluttershy is already the top of this year\xe2\x80\x99s class. She takes to healing very naturally, and being a Whisperer gives her an even bigger edge. She\xe2\x80\x99s quite interesting to work with when she\xe2\x80\x99s really focused. The other night we had a pegasus come through with a broken wing. At the time, Fluttershy was the only medic in the vicinity, even if she\xe2\x80\x99s still only a trainee. When she beheld the injured pony, her entire demeanor changed. She went from being this timid little pony to being assertive, analyzing the situation and gathering information about the accident. She then proceeded to heal the wing faster, and probably better, than most of our senior medics. She\xe2\x80\x99ll be a useful asset to the team.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAnd Pinkie Pie?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna turned towards Zecora.\r\n\t\r\n\tThe zebra laughed. \xe2\x80\x9cMiss Pinkamena is a full blown agent in everything but attitude, but even that does not change her aptitude. She has a complete disregard for what is supposed to be impossible, and because of that, she\xe2\x80\x99ll be an agent who\xe2\x80\x99ll be unstoppable.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tSmiling slightly at the shaman\xe2\x80\x99s rhymes, Luna turned towards the last one. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd Applejack?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tHalt frowned slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99ll make a good Equestrian Ranger, no doubt about that. But she has a stubborn pride streak almost a mile long, one that even her brother can barely bring her out of. To be honest, that stubbornness could be a potential boon. It\xe2\x80\x99ll mean she\xe2\x80\x99ll be less likely to give up ground when on the losing side of a battle. However, she is quite honest and follows orders well. She\xe2\x80\x99s also quite strong, even stronger than her brother, and her brother seemed like he was born for this kind of work. I\xe2\x80\x99ve seen her buck a thick tree clean in two.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna let out a thoughtful whistle. \xe2\x80\x9cHmm. Well, it seems as though things are shaping up nicely. If we play our cards right, we just might be able to beat Corona Flare once and for all when she returns. On a slightly similar subject, we need to decide to do with those three cadets of yours, Spitfire.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBanish them, for all I care.\xe2\x80\x9d Spitfire retorted. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve suspected those three have been up to no good for a while-- bullying other cadets just because they\xe2\x80\x99re some spoiled nobility brats and are in their second year. But I\xe2\x80\x99ve never had any hard evidence before now. However, shortly after their tussle with Miss Sparkle, three other cadets approached me with concerns about their bullying: First Year Rainbow Dash, and Third Years Lightning Dust and Ditzy Doo. Apparently they decided almost killing your student was reason enough to finally report them for their acts at my Academy.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cPerhaps banishment is just what they need. Whether or not it will be permanent, I am not sure\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tSpitfire shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t matter to me. I also must say, I thought for a moment that your student belonged in the Wonderbolt Academy, and not learning under you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna smiled at that. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, I am quite proud of her.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tHalt shook his shaggy head. \xe2\x80\x9cYou always knew how to pick the strong ones, Luna. Does she know yet?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna was already shaking her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. And I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to tell her. Not yet. I will, when she is ready to bear the burden of our mistakes. When she is ready to finally call the other Orphans her friends. But for now, let us forget about the uncertainties of the future, and enjoy each other\xe2\x80\x99s company this night.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n", 6, 426070, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'6\'></a><h3>Chapter 6</h3>\n<p class=\'indented\'>The first thing Twilight noticed when she stepped into the palace\xe2\x80\x99s Dining Hall were the stares. Some were subtle, others were not, but they were there. She could feel them boring into her form as she crossed the hall towards the heavily laden food carts. However, having great practice at ignoring things that bothered her, Twilight simply pushed this fact to the back of her mind and focused instead on getting something to eat. After all of the afternoon\xe2\x80\x99s excitement, Twilight was fully prepared to stuff her face until she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t move from her spot. Heaping her plate high with her favorite foods, her mind drifted back to a couple of nights ago, when she had been unable to eat. She\xe2\x80\x99d been so paralyzed with fear over something completely silly. And she knew it, too. Of course, just because she knew this now didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean that a tiny part of her <i>hadn\xe2\x80\x99t</i> been afraid of being overlooked. Twilight headed towards her usual table without thinking. But as she went to set down her heavily laden tray, Twilight became aware of a few of new additions to the table, not counting the four other orphans who normally sat there.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The first one, surprisingly, was Rarity. Why she was all of a suddenly joining the other four orphans after a year of avoiding them was beyond Twilight, but she did have a sneaking suspicion it had something to do with Princess Luna. The other two were both pegasi a little older than Rainbow Dash; judging by their quiet discipline, they were probably from the Wonderbolt Academy. Twilight also took careful notice of the weapons they had brought with them, leaning casually on the wall behind them. One was a large and simple broadsword, designed primarily for heavy combat, definitely sturdy. The other was a metal rod looking contraption Twilight quickly recognized as a lightning caster.Twilight took her spot in the center of the table, making sure her own weapon was going to be fine without having to take it off. Ever since Luna had said actually wearing a weapon was allowed, Twilight hadn\xe2\x80\x99t wanted to stray too far from <i>Grace</i>. For some absurd reason it made her feel safer. Finally, Twilight glanced up to be introduced to the newcomers.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Rainbow Dash, who\xe2\x80\x99d been waiting for her fellow orphan to situate herself, did just that. \xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, this is Lightning Dust\xe2\x80\x9d-- A teal coated Pegasus with a mustard yellow two toned mane-- \xe2\x80\x9cand Ditzy Doo.\xe2\x80\x9d The last was a grey pegasus with slightly off kilter eyes. Both nodded at Twilight, before Lightning Dust spoke.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cSo <i>you\xe2\x80\x99re</i> the famed Twilight Sparkle we\xe2\x80\x99ve been hearing about.\xe2\x80\x9d She extended a hoof to bump to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ve had the Academy in a bit of an uproar these past couple of nights.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight arched an eyebrow. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Lightning Dust shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cApparently you upset quite a few nobles when Princess Luna barely even glanced at their sons and daughters and immediately made for you. We\xe2\x80\x99ve been listening to cadets whine and complain that their siblings were ignored, haven\xe2\x80\x99t we, Ditz?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The grey pegasus nodded emphatically, proclaiming, \xe2\x80\x9cYup! Its kind of funny, really. Apparently they thought Twilight would be forgotten, with her parents dead and being the last of her line and all.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cDitzy!\xe2\x80\x9d Rarity exclaimed. \xe2\x80\x9cThat was a rather impolite thing to say.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cIts okay, Rarity,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was quick to interject, smiling at the bubbly pegasus. \xe2\x80\x9cTruthfully, anything that upsets the nobility is fine by me.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Rarity sighed, a bit dramatically. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m inclined to agree with you there, Darling. I guess I\xe2\x80\x99m rather fortunate that my foster family lets me come and go as I please. They weren\xe2\x80\x99t expecting me to become one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s students, but when I did they were quite pleased. Even so, they\xe2\x80\x99ve not really tried to use me as a means to climb up the social ladder.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Discussion from there dissolved into the rather pleasant banter that usually accompanied dinner. Twilight found that she was rather liking both Lightning Dust and Ditzy Doo. The former was almost like Dash in a way, outspoken and wanting to be the center of attention. It was actually kind of funny watching Dust and Pinkie compete to see who could gain everypony\xe2\x80\x99s attention better. As for Ditzy\xe2\x80\xa6 well, she was Ditzy. Twilight had heard talk of the pegasus before, but never would have associated the rumors with the cheerful mare across from her. The way the rumors had it, Ditzy was an insanely clumsy and unapproachable flier who\xe2\x80\x99d rather barbeque you with her lightning caster than look at you. Seeing the mare in the flesh\xe2\x80\xa6 it was hard for the unicorn to believe anything that talk said. But then she mentally scolded herself. What would Rarity say if she knew that Twilight was actually putting stock into mere rumors? The thought caused the unicorn to grin inwardly. Her amusement was cut short, however, as the three cadets at the table froze. They seemed to be staring at somepony behind Twilight. But before the unicorn could turn around, one of the newcomers spoke.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cSo, <i>this</i> is the table all the losers congregate at, huh?\xe2\x80\x9d The voice immediately made Twilight dislike the speaker. It was rough and barely cultured, and seemed to grate upon the ears longer than normal. Before anything else could be said, a second voice chimed in.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cHey, who said you guys are allowed to carry weapons inside the palace? Especially you, Plum. You don\xe2\x80\x99t even have yours leaning upon the wall. Somepony could get in trouble for that.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Dust and Dash looked like they were about tear into the mystery ponies behind them, but Twilight silenced them with a look. She then rose fluidly to her hooves, and in one smooth motion, turned to face the stallions. There were three of them, all brawn and obviously no brains. She cleared her throat a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cFirst of all, my <i>name</i> is Twilight Sparkle, <i>not</i> \xe2\x80\x98Plum\xe2\x80\x99. Secondly, you will find that as an apprentice of Princess Luna, I am perfectly within my rights to conduct my business while armed. Furthermore, seeing as both of those Cadets are accompanying me, I permit them to carry their weapons if they so see fit.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The pegasus before her, who seemed to be the leader of the trio, apparently didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear a word past her name. \xe2\x80\x9cSparkle? So <i>you\xe2\x80\x99re</i> the tramp Luna decided would make a better mage than the rest of my family!\xe2\x80\x9d The bully practically shouted his sentence to the entire hall to hear, and the area fell silent, eyes boring into the confrontation before them.</p><p class="indented double">With barely a glimmer from her horn, <i>Grace</i> unsheathed itself and came to rest at Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s side. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat did you call me?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was so cold, everypony else at the table shivered a bit. The stallions before her either didn\xe2\x80\x99t see the danger approaching, or were just too stupid to recognize it.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cI <i>called</i> you a tramp. You\xe2\x80\x99re a no-good waste of space who somehow thinks she\xe2\x80\x99s better than one of the most powerful houses in Equestria.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The third one piped up, obviously wanting to get in his two bits. \xe2\x80\x9cYea! And what\xe2\x80\x99s that you\xe2\x80\x99re trying to threaten us with? A pig sticker? What, too weak to carry a real weapon?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight merely closed her eyes and sighed, a deep sound. She shifted her gaze to some point behind the bullies. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you think, Luna? How should I handle this rabble?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The three pegasi whirled on the spot, staring up in apprehension at Princess Luna, who had seemingly arrived out of nowhere. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s a good question, Twilight. Why don\xe2\x80\x99t you challenge them to a sparring match outside? Dumbbell, Hoops, and Calamity versus you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0One of the stallions snorted rudely. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you serious? Three well trained cadets against one little mare who\xe2\x80\x99s not even a real mage?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna surveyed the stallion before her, eyes seeming to pierce his soul. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m perfectly serious. If you win, I\xe2\x80\x99ll consider taking one of your siblings as my apprentice.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was shaking her head, smiling softly. \xe2\x80\x9cIs this one of your ways of testing me, Luna? If so\xe2\x80\xa6 Lets see if I can teach these bullies a lesson in humility they won&#039;t forget.\xe2\x80\x9d With that, the lavender mare sheathed her glaive and began to thread her way out of the hall and into the courtyard beyond. The other orphans and the two Wonderbolt Cadets followed her eagerly. The entire dining hall fell in step behind them, chatting excitedly. There were more than a fair share convinced that the three seasoned cadets were going to walk all over Twilight, but those who knew that Princess Luna chose her apprentices carefully weren\xe2\x80\x99t so sure. Very few had ever actually <i>seen</i> Twilight use her magic. The only thing anyone really knew about the mare was that she spent most of her time with her nose buried in a book.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was vaguely aware of the other orphans crowding around her, all talking at once. Twilight, however, turned off her ears; they were not important right now. There would be time later to talk to them, but right now, she had to focus. There was very little doubt in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind that this was a test. Luna had said she wanted to see how proficient Twilight was in actual physical combat. Why exactly Luna wanted to know if she could handle a weapon was beyond the apprentice; undoubtedly having runes emblazoned into an instrument helped, but to her knowledge, most mages didn\xe2\x80\x99t engage in melee combat. They stayed at range and rained down spells before an enemy could reach them. But, then again, Twilight very much doubted that Princess Luna was anything like other mages, or masters for that matter.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hooves took her to the practice enclosure. It was automatic, as it was the same place her and Shining used to spar in the early early eveing before other ponies were awake to watch them. She strode purposefully to the other side of the square while a giant crowd of spectators came to a stop at the very edge. Word had apparently spread like wildfire, because it looked like every student in the city had come to watch the fight. The thought made Twilight a bit queasy, but once more the lavender unicorn pushed those emotions away. If she could spar against the captain of the guard and walk away relatively unscathed, she was sure she could survive this trial. Of course, her brother was only a single pony; here, she was facing three. Once more, <i>Grace</i> sang as she drew the glaive from its sheath. As she held it in her hooves for a brief moment, the familiar weight of the weapon helped to put her even more at ease. She continued to stare at her new weapon, and something within her mind clicked. She had fought with this weapon before. She knew how to best use it. With utmost precision, Twilight Sparkle reared back upon her rear hooves. Her right hoof came forward and her left foot inched back, and she automatically centered the rest of her body to keep herself balanced. At the same time, her left hoof stretched out slightly in front of her, while her right reached out behind her, <i>Grace</i> held diagonally with the blade thrust above her right shoulder. This further helped improve her balance.</p><p class="indented double">There were more than a few murmurs of astonishment from the watching crowd. Most combative ponies used a combination of their front hooves and their mouths to swing their weapon, while keeping both rear hooves on the ground for stabilization. The three bullies before her on the opposite side of the square, however, merely laughed at her. Apparently they thought she looked rather funny. Twilight ignored their sneers and carefully studied the trio. Dumbbell held a monster of a greatsword. That would give him some impressive reach, but would also slow him down a bit. Hoops was equipped with a pair of small axes; fast attacks, short range, and two weapons to keep track of. Calamity carried the standard mace and shield combination. But then Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s attention was drawn to Princess Luna, who stepped into the center of the ring. She fixed Twilight with a sharp stare. </p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cNow, I want a nice, clean fight,\xe2\x80\x9d she began, before sweeping her gaze towards the stallions, \xe2\x80\x9cFrom all of you.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna then flapped her powerful wings and rose swiftly into the air, and Twilight took that as an invitation to continue. </p><p class="indented double">The unicorn wasted no time in advancing. She bounded across the ring on her rear hooves, almost like a deer would. The three cadets split up, thinking to hit her from three directions: Front, right, and left. Twilight fell right into the trap, taking another step forward. They were on her in seconds, but instead of the quick victory they had assumed they\xe2\x80\x99d get, they got a faceful of <i>Grace</i>. Twilight moved the polearm easily, parrying the attack of Dumbbell with the blade, sending the massive greatsword screeching off to one side. Hoops then came in, whirling his axes in small circles. Twilight juked to one side, narrowly avoiding one weapon before bringing <i>Grace</i> parallel to stop the second. Calamity ended up backing away swiftly when faced with the butt end of the weapon. Twilight then spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cLesson number one: This \xe2\x80\x98pigsticker\xe2\x80\x99 allows me to parry multiple attacks without leaving my guard broken or my sight blinded.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The fight then began in earnest. The three bullies systematically attacked Twilight Sparkle over and over again. They seemed convinced that if they kept attacking long enough, eventually she would wear herself down. <i>Grace</i> was a blur as it danced in the mage\xe2\x80\x99s hooves, parrying attack after attack. Parry horizontal. Parry vertically. Catch the edge of that broadsword on the blade. Use the butt of <i>Grace</i> to fend off Calamity\xe2\x80\x99s shield slam. Twirl, two short jabs at offending shield. Twist to stop the broadsword from cleaving her in two. On and on and on, never ending always moving. Twilight felt as though she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in control of her body any more. She was nothing more than a passenger, watching her own hooves as they moved like she had been doing this her whole life.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how long they\xe2\x80\x99d been going at it now. She was caked in sweat, her mane plastered to her forehead. She sported several shallow scratches and cuts, courtesy of not being able to dissipate all of the momentum behind a vicious attack. The three cadets might have been just as tired, but if they were, it was pure determination that still fueled them onwards. As Twilight moved to counterattack after a block, she slipped on a slick patch of grass. Then, all at once, her balance was lost. She fell forward, throwing out her forehooves to stop her downward movement. She landed with <i>Grace</i> beneath her and that dreaded broadsword arching down to meet her unprotected back.</p><p class="indented double">Only to meet a hard mana shield. Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn flared brighter and the shield launched skyward, jerking the blade away from the unicorn. Twilight regained her hoofing, panting slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cLesson number two: You should remember that your foe is also a mage, and that magic is as deadly a weapon as a physical one.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The three cadets were about finished, now. Dumbbell had anticipating on striking the mare while she was down and ending it all right then and there. But that didn\xe2\x80\x99t happen, and the three cadets were now folding under the annoyed unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s assault. A hard mana shield slammed into Hoops, sweeping the stunned stallion off his hooves. He lay there on the hard-packed earth, the fight beaten out of him. Calamity took one look at the slowly approaching apprentice and fled, dropping his weapons and trying to shove his way out of the crowd of spectators. Dumbbell, however, lived up to his name in more ways than one. He charged at Twilight, rage driven and determined to end the lavender mare who\xe2\x80\x99d caused him so much embarrassment and pain. Twilight was waiting for him. She stabbed out with the blade of <i>Grace</i> and twisted the weapon at the same time, \xe2\x80\x98stinging\xe2\x80\x99 Dumbbell\xe2\x80\x99s hoof and causing him to drop his heavy weapon. Twilight was upon him in seconds, lifting the struggling stallion up with a burst from her horn. Twilight spoke softly and furiously.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cLesson three. You would do well to remember that so long as I still take breath into this body, House Twinkle lives. And the last time I checked, House Twinkle outranks yours.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">And with that, Twilight released the cowering cadet. She retrieved <i>Grace</i> and fit it back into its holster, and as she did so, she became aware of the tumult of noise around her. Stunned murmurs and the occasional cheer cut through the air as the weary unicorn turned to find Princess Luna. Her mentor nodded softly at her, indicating approval. Twilight could barely do much more than smile once in return before making her tired way back up to the Dining Hall. She had a dinner to finish, after all.</p><p class="indented double"><center>&lt;&lt;((*))&gt;&gt;</center></p><p class="indented double">Princess Luna sat up in her study when the knock resounded at the door. It was late and most ponies were already in bed, but Luna knew who this was. \xe2\x80\x9cEnter.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">In walked a weary Twilight Sparkle. The young mare still sported the aftereffects of her little battle. She had been so focused on filling her belly with some sort of sustenance she had flat out refused to go to the hospital wing to get healed. Studying her student silently, Luna decided that it really made Twilight look the part. The Lunar Princess could almost believe that it was the Valkyrie standing there, having just returned from a successful defensive skirmish. Luna mentally shook that image away; there was still a ways to go yet before Twilight was ready for that title and its responsibilities. Luna was the first to speak, already guessing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s first question.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThat was your trial in combat, Twilight. I had told you I wanted to see how proficient you were, and the opportunity presented itself.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut against <i>three</i> opponents? Most others would have fallen.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut you did not, which shows you have far greater strength in you than others know.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI almost died, Luna!\xe2\x80\x9d The Lunar Monarch flinched slightly at the raised voice. So <i>this</i> was what was bothering her student. \xe2\x80\x9cIf not for my magic, I would have left this world for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna composed herself; she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t afford to show the raw emotion running through her at hearing Twilight so frightened. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd they will be punished accordingly. Dumbbell especially. They were only supposed to defeat you in honorable combat. I had not anticipated them to act so out of hand. It would appear that I made some nobles rather angry, in accepting you as my apprentice.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight huffed. \xe2\x80\x9cYou could say that again.\xe2\x80\x9d She was silent for a moment, before finally shifting slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cI also have a bit of a question.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The princess raised a brow. \xe2\x80\x9cOh?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhen I was out there fighting\xe2\x80\xa6 It felt as though I had lost control of my body. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never, ever fought like that before, even against Shining Armor. I knew what to do. How to fight like that. How to keep myself centered. I knew that my odd fighting style would be unpredictable to those unaccustomed to it. Why, Luna? Why do I suddenly have all of this knowledge?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna had to work to keep her face calm. Twilight was advancing along at an almost frightening pace. Her mind raced, scrambling for something, anything, to tell her student. Finally, she spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cLooks like I may have to have a word with Starshard about using the Link to influence you. You\xe2\x80\x99re not going to learn much on your own if she\xe2\x80\x99s helping you too much.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight breathed a slight sigh of relief. \xe2\x80\x9cI thought it was something a little more sinister. Tell her I\xe2\x80\x99d much rather learn things on my own. I\xe2\x80\x99m\xe2\x80\xa6 also sorry for raising my voice at you earlier.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna inclined her head. \xe2\x80\x9cI feel you were perfectly within your rights to shout at me, Twilight. But, I feel you also learned a valuable lesson tonight, and one that could be very important to your future studies: Never be afraid to involve magic in a fight, even if your opponents do not have any. As you saw tonight, it may save your life. Now. I want you to return to your quarters, and get some sleep. I know you are exhausted, and your training continues tomorrow. While your Link to Starshard was a huge step in your studies of Necromancy, it was also just the beginning. There is quite a bit more for you to learn before you are ready to move on to the next branch of magic.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight tilted her head. \xe2\x80\x9cWhere is Starshard, anyway? I didn\xe2\x80\x99t even see her at the fight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI believe she has taken up residence in one of the many unused guest rooms this place has. As to why she did not personally appear, I imagine that her appearance would have been quite jarring-- first of all, because she is undead. Though she might mask some of her nature, there are a few who are bound to pick up on it. Secondly, she does look almost identical to you. That right there would cause even more of a stir. Now, off with you, my faithful student. I have yet to converse with my advisors before I may turn in for the night.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight bid her teacher goodnight and left. Mere moments after her departure, another knock sounded at the door, and in walked Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s oldest friends. The Princess smiled.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSpitfire,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna greeted warmly. The flaming pegasus flashed her trademark grin in response, before tossing herself carelessly into the chair Twilight had just vacated. \xe2\x80\x9cZecora. Always my eyes and ears, yes?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The zebra chuckled and answered, \xe2\x80\x9cThe eyes and ears of our Princess we are, EI has our spies wide and far.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cShimmer. The reason many of us are still here.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The pegasus blushed a little. \xe2\x80\x9cNonsense, Luna. All the Corps does is aid recovery.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhich is why we are all the more thankful to have you.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna turned to the last newcomer, regarding him with twinkling eyes. \xe2\x80\x9cHalt. Silver Bit got his nose up his ass again?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Halter O\xe2\x80\x99Carrick stepped forward, struggling to hide his grin at his Princess\xe2\x80\x99 foul language. Halt never ever smiled. At least, not in all of the hundreds of years Luna has known him. \xe2\x80\x9cOf course he does. That stupid Sol thinks he\xe2\x80\x99s better than anyone else.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cRemind me as to why you\xe2\x80\x99ve not had him locked up, or banished him from Equestria yet?\xe2\x80\x9d Spitfire asked.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cHe\xe2\x80\x99s not really done anything wrong. I can\xe2\x80\x99t lock up a pony just because he wishes that Corona Flare had brought about neverending day.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Spitfire snorted, which Luna decided to ignore. \xe2\x80\x9cWell, you know why I\xe2\x80\x99ve called you all here, so lets get this out of the way first, so that we might be able to enjoy a little bit of each other\xe2\x80\x99s company before we have to turn in for the night. Spitfire, you start.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Spitfire seemed to mull over her next words a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cDash is, hands down, probably the best recruit the Wonderbolt Academy has seen since I graced its halls many many years ago.\xe2\x80\x9d Everypony in the room gave some sort of exclamation. This was high praise, coming from Spitfire. \xe2\x80\x9cThat pegasus does things with her wings I\xe2\x80\x99ve never seen any other pony accomplish. She does exceedingly well with pretty much everything--except her actual classes. While she does get good marks in them, they still bore her. Being such a natural flier means that most of the stuff the instructors are teaching her are nothing new to her. I might end up having to place her in advanced classes, like I was. I\xe2\x80\x99ll have to do it cautiously, to ensure she does not get too cocky, but I would hazard a guess she\xe2\x80\x99ll be a full blown Wonderbolt in a year and a half. Maybe less.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t the normal Wonderbolt training program a total of four years before becoming a full fledged member?\xe2\x80\x9d Shimmer asked.</p><p class="indented double">Spitfire nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cIt just goes to show how talented she is, if I think she\xe2\x80\x99ll become a Wonderbolt before I did.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna rubbed a hoof over her chin thoughtfully. \xe2\x80\x9cThis is interesting, but definitely a good thing. What about you, Shimmer? How is young Fluttershy coming along?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cDespite being extremely shy of even her own shadow, Fluttershy is already the top of this year\xe2\x80\x99s class. She takes to healing very naturally, and being a Whisperer gives her an even bigger edge. She\xe2\x80\x99s quite interesting to work with when she\xe2\x80\x99s really focused. The other night we had a pegasus come through with a broken wing. At the time, Fluttershy was the only medic in the vicinity, even if she\xe2\x80\x99s still only a trainee. When she beheld the injured pony, her entire demeanor changed. She went from being this timid little pony to being assertive, analyzing the situation and gathering information about the accident. She then proceeded to heal the wing faster, and probably better, than most of our senior medics. She\xe2\x80\x99ll be a useful asset to the team.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnd Pinkie Pie?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna turned towards Zecora.</p><p class="indented double">The zebra laughed. \xe2\x80\x9cMiss Pinkamena is a full blown agent in everything but attitude, but even that does not change her aptitude. She has a complete disregard for what is supposed to be impossible, and because of that, she\xe2\x80\x99ll be an agent who\xe2\x80\x99ll be unstoppable.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Smiling slightly at the shaman\xe2\x80\x99s rhymes, Luna turned towards the last one. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd Applejack?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Halt frowned slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99ll make a good Equestrian Ranger, no doubt about that. But she has a stubborn pride streak almost a mile long, one that even her brother can barely bring her out of. To be honest, that stubbornness could be a potential boon. It\xe2\x80\x99ll mean she\xe2\x80\x99ll be less likely to give up ground when on the losing side of a battle. However, she is quite honest and follows orders well. She\xe2\x80\x99s also quite strong, even stronger than her brother, and her brother seemed like he was born for this kind of work. I\xe2\x80\x99ve seen her buck a thick tree clean in two.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna let out a thoughtful whistle. \xe2\x80\x9cHmm. Well, it seems as though things are shaping up nicely. If we play our cards right, we just might be able to beat Corona Flare once and for all when she returns. On a slightly similar subject, we need to decide to do with those three cadets of yours, Spitfire.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBanish them, for all I care.\xe2\x80\x9d Spitfire retorted. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve suspected those three have been up to no good for a while-- bullying other cadets just because they\xe2\x80\x99re some spoiled nobility brats and are in their second year. But I\xe2\x80\x99ve never had any hard evidence before now. However, shortly after their tussle with Miss Sparkle, three other cadets approached me with concerns about their bullying: First Year Rainbow Dash, and Third Years Lightning Dust and Ditzy Doo. Apparently they decided almost killing your student was reason enough to finally report them for their acts at my Academy.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cPerhaps banishment is just what they need. Whether or not it will be permanent, I am not sure\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Spitfire shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t matter to me. I also must say, I thought for a moment that your student belonged in the Wonderbolt Academy, and not learning under you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna smiled at that. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, I am quite proud of her.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Halt shook his shaggy head. \xe2\x80\x9cYou always knew how to pick the strong ones, Luna. Does she know yet?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna was already shaking her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. And I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to tell her. Not yet. I will, when she is ready to bear the burden of our mistakes. When she is ready to finally call the other Orphans her friends. But for now, let us forget about the uncertainties of the future, and enjoy each other\xe2\x80\x99s company this night.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 104188], 'parent_story_id': 104188, 'txt': "//------------------------------//\n// Chapter 6// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\tThe first thing Twilight noticed when she stepped into the palace\xe2\x80\x99s Dining Hall were the stares. Some were subtle, others were not, but they were there. She could feel them boring into her form as she crossed the hall towards the heavily laden food carts. However, having great practice at ignoring things that bothered her, Twilight simply pushed this fact to the back of her mind and focused instead on getting something to eat. After all of the afternoon\xe2\x80\x99s excitement, Twilight was fully prepared to stuff her face until she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t move from her spot. Heaping her plate high with her favorite foods, her mind drifted back to a couple of nights ago, when she had been unable to eat. She\xe2\x80\x99d been so paralyzed with fear over something completely silly. And she knew it, too. Of course, just because she knew this now didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean that a tiny part of her hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been afraid of being overlooked. Twilight headed towards her usual table without thinking. But as she went to set down her heavily laden tray, Twilight became aware of a few of new additions to the table, not counting the four other orphans who normally sat there.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The first one, surprisingly, was Rarity. Why she was all of a suddenly joining the other four orphans after a year of avoiding them was beyond Twilight, but she did have a sneaking suspicion it had something to do with Princess Luna. The other two were both pegasi a little older than Rainbow Dash; judging by their quiet discipline, they were probably from the Wonderbolt Academy. Twilight also took careful notice of the weapons they had brought with them, leaning casually on the wall behind them. One was a large and simple broadsword, designed primarily for heavy combat, definitely sturdy. The other was a metal rod looking contraption Twilight quickly recognized as a lightning caster.Twilight took her spot in the center of the table, making sure her own weapon was going to be fine without having to take it off. Ever since Luna had said actually wearing a weapon was allowed, Twilight hadn\xe2\x80\x99t wanted to stray too far from Grace. For some absurd reason it made her feel safer. Finally, Twilight glanced up to be introduced to the newcomers.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Rainbow Dash, who\xe2\x80\x99d been waiting for her fellow orphan to situate herself, did just that. \xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, this is Lightning Dust\xe2\x80\x9d-- A teal coated Pegasus with a mustard yellow two toned mane-- \xe2\x80\x9cand Ditzy Doo.\xe2\x80\x9d The last was a grey pegasus with slightly off kilter eyes. Both nodded at Twilight, before Lightning Dust spoke.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cSo you\xe2\x80\x99re the famed Twilight Sparkle we\xe2\x80\x99ve been hearing about.\xe2\x80\x9d She extended a hoof to bump to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ve had the Academy in a bit of an uproar these past couple of nights.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight arched an eyebrow. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Lightning Dust shrugged. \xe2\x80\x9cApparently you upset quite a few nobles when Princess Luna barely even glanced at their sons and daughters and immediately made for you. We\xe2\x80\x99ve been listening to cadets whine and complain that their siblings were ignored, haven\xe2\x80\x99t we, Ditz?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The grey pegasus nodded emphatically, proclaiming, \xe2\x80\x9cYup! Its kind of funny, really. Apparently they thought Twilight would be forgotten, with her parents dead and being the last of her line and all.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cDitzy!\xe2\x80\x9d Rarity exclaimed. \xe2\x80\x9cThat was a rather impolite thing to say.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cIts okay, Rarity,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was quick to interject, smiling at the bubbly pegasus. \xe2\x80\x9cTruthfully, anything that upsets the nobility is fine by me.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Rarity sighed, a bit dramatically. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m inclined to agree with you there, Darling. I guess I\xe2\x80\x99m rather fortunate that my foster family lets me come and go as I please. They weren\xe2\x80\x99t expecting me to become one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s students, but when I did they were quite pleased. Even so, they\xe2\x80\x99ve not really tried to use me as a means to climb up the social ladder.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Discussion from there dissolved into the rather pleasant banter that usually accompanied dinner. Twilight found that she was rather liking both Lightning Dust and Ditzy Doo. The former was almost like Dash in a way, outspoken and wanting to be the center of attention. It was actually kind of funny watching Dust and Pinkie compete to see who could gain everypony\xe2\x80\x99s attention better. As for Ditzy\xe2\x80\xa6 well, she was Ditzy. Twilight had heard talk of the pegasus before, but never would have associated the rumors with the cheerful mare across from her. The way the rumors had it, Ditzy was an insanely clumsy and unapproachable flier who\xe2\x80\x99d rather barbeque you with her lightning caster than look at you. Seeing the mare in the flesh\xe2\x80\xa6 it was hard for the unicorn to believe anything that talk said. But then she mentally scolded herself. What would Rarity say if she knew that Twilight was actually putting stock into mere rumors? The thought caused the unicorn to grin inwardly. Her amusement was cut short, however, as the three cadets at the table froze. They seemed to be staring at somepony behind Twilight. But before the unicorn could turn around, one of the newcomers spoke.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cSo, this is the table all the losers congregate at, huh?\xe2\x80\x9d The voice immediately made Twilight dislike the speaker. It was rough and barely cultured, and seemed to grate upon the ears longer than normal. Before anything else could be said, a second voice chimed in.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cHey, who said you guys are allowed to carry weapons inside the palace? Especially you, Plum. You don\xe2\x80\x99t even have yours leaning upon the wall. Somepony could get in trouble for that.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Dust and Dash looked like they were about tear into the mystery ponies behind them, but Twilight silenced them with a look. She then rose fluidly to her hooves, and in one smooth motion, turned to face the stallions. There were three of them, all brawn and obviously no brains. She cleared her throat a bit. \xe2\x80\x9cFirst of all, my name is Twilight Sparkle, not \xe2\x80\x98Plum\xe2\x80\x99. Secondly, you will find that as an apprentice of Princess Luna, I am perfectly within my rights to conduct my business while armed. Furthermore, seeing as both of those Cadets are accompanying me, I permit them to carry their weapons if they so see fit.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\tThe pegasus before her, who seemed to be the leader of the trio, apparently didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear a word past her name. \xe2\x80\x9cSparkle? So you\xe2\x80\x99re the tramp Luna decided would make a better mage than the rest of my family!\xe2\x80\x9d The bully practically shouted his sentence to the entire hall to hear, and the area fell silent, eyes boring into the confrontation before them.\r\n\t\r\n\tWith barely a glimmer from her horn, Grace unsheathed itself and came to rest at Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s side. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat did you call me?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was so cold, everypony else at the table shivered a bit. The stallions before her either didn\xe2\x80\x99t see the danger approaching, or were just too stupid to recognize it.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cI called you a tramp. You\xe2\x80\x99re a no-good waste of space who somehow thinks she\xe2\x80\x99s better than one of the most powerful houses in Equestria.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The third one piped up, obviously wanting to get in his two bits. \xe2\x80\x9cYea! And what\xe2\x80\x99s that you\xe2\x80\x99re trying to threaten us with? A pig sticker? What, too weak to carry a real weapon?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight merely closed her eyes and sighed, a deep sound. She shifted her gaze to some point behind the bullies. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you think, Luna? How should I handle this rabble?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The three pegasi whirled on the spot, staring up in apprehension at Princess Luna, who had seemingly arrived out of nowhere. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s a good question, Twilight. Why don\xe2\x80\x99t you challenge them to a sparring match outside? Dumbbell, Hoops, and Calamity versus you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0One of the stallions snorted rudely. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you serious? Three well trained cadets against one little mare who\xe2\x80\x99s not even a real mage?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna surveyed the stallion before her, eyes seeming to pierce his soul. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m perfectly serious. If you win, I\xe2\x80\x99ll consider taking one of your siblings as my apprentice.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was shaking her head, smiling softly. \xe2\x80\x9cIs this one of your ways of testing me, Luna? If so\xe2\x80\xa6 Lets see if I can teach these bullies a lesson in humility they won't forget.\xe2\x80\x9d With that, the lavender mare sheathed her glaive and began to thread her way out of the hall and into the courtyard beyond. The other orphans and the two Wonderbolt Cadets followed her eagerly. The entire dining hall fell in step behind them, chatting excitedly. There were more than a fair share convinced that the three seasoned cadets were going to walk all over Twilight, but those who knew that Princess Luna chose her apprentices carefully weren\xe2\x80\x99t so sure. Very few had ever actually seen Twilight use her magic. The only thing anyone really knew about the mare was that she spent most of her time with her nose buried in a book.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight was vaguely aware of the other orphans crowding around her, all talking at once. Twilight, however, turned off her ears; they were not important right now. There would be time later to talk to them, but right now, she had to focus. There was very little doubt in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mind that this was a test. Luna had said she wanted to see how proficient Twilight was in actual physical combat. Why exactly Luna wanted to know if she could handle a weapon was beyond the apprentice; undoubtedly having runes emblazoned into an instrument helped, but to her knowledge, most mages didn\xe2\x80\x99t engage in melee combat. They stayed at range and rained down spells before an enemy could reach them. But, then again, Twilight very much doubted that Princess Luna was anything like other mages, or masters for that matter.\r\n\r\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s hooves took her to the practice enclosure. It was automatic, as it was the same place her and Shining used to spar in the early early eveing before other ponies were awake to watch them. She strode purposefully to the other side of the square while a giant crowd of spectators came to a stop at the very edge. Word had apparently spread like wildfire, because it looked like every student in the city had come to watch the fight. The thought made Twilight a bit queasy, but once more the lavender unicorn pushed those emotions away. If she could spar against the captain of the guard and walk away relatively unscathed, she was sure she could survive this trial. Of course, her brother was only a single pony; here, she was facing three. Once more, Grace sang as she drew the glaive from its sheath. As she held it in her hooves for a brief moment, the familiar weight of the weapon helped to put her even more at ease. She continued to stare at her new weapon, and something within her mind clicked. She had fought with this weapon before. She knew how to best use it. With utmost precision, Twilight Sparkle reared back upon her rear hooves. Her right hoof came forward and her left foot inched back, and she automatically centered the rest of her body to keep herself balanced. At the same time, her left hoof stretched out slightly in front of her, while her right reached out behind her, Grace held diagonally with the blade thrust above her right shoulder. This further helped improve her balance.\r\n\t\r\n\tThere were more than a few murmurs of astonishment from the watching crowd. Most combative ponies used a combination of their front hooves and their mouths to swing their weapon, while keeping both rear hooves on the ground for stabilization. The three bullies before her on the opposite side of the square, however, merely laughed at her. Apparently they thought she looked rather funny. Twilight ignored their sneers and carefully studied the trio. Dumbbell held a monster of a greatsword. That would give him some impressive reach, but would also slow him down a bit. Hoops was equipped with a pair of small axes; fast attacks, short range, and two weapons to keep track of. Calamity carried the standard mace and shield combination. But then Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s attention was drawn to Princess Luna, who stepped into the center of the ring. She fixed Twilight with a sharp stare. \r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cNow, I want a nice, clean fight,\xe2\x80\x9d she began, before sweeping her gaze towards the stallions, \xe2\x80\x9cFrom all of you.\xe2\x80\x9d Luna then flapped her powerful wings and rose swiftly into the air, and Twilight took that as an invitation to continue. \r\n\t\r\n\tThe unicorn wasted no time in advancing. She bounded across the ring on her rear hooves, almost like a deer would. The three cadets split up, thinking to hit her from three directions: Front, right, and left. Twilight fell right into the trap, taking another step forward. They were on her in seconds, but instead of the quick victory they had assumed they\xe2\x80\x99d get, they got a faceful of Grace. Twilight moved the polearm easily, parrying the attack of Dumbbell with the blade, sending the massive greatsword screeching off to one side. Hoops then came in, whirling his axes in small circles. Twilight juked to one side, narrowly avoiding one weapon before bringing Grace parallel to stop the second. Calamity ended up backing away swiftly when faced with the butt end of the weapon. Twilight then spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cLesson number one: This \xe2\x80\x98pigsticker\xe2\x80\x99 allows me to parry multiple attacks without leaving my guard broken or my sight blinded.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe fight then began in earnest. The three bullies systematically attacked Twilight Sparkle over and over again. They seemed convinced that if they kept attacking long enough, eventually she would wear herself down. Grace was a blur as it danced in the mage\xe2\x80\x99s hooves, parrying attack after attack. Parry horizontal. Parry vertically. Catch the edge of that broadsword on the blade. Use the butt of Grace to fend off Calamity\xe2\x80\x99s shield slam. Twirl, two short jabs at offending shield. Twist to stop the broadsword from cleaving her in two. On and on and on, never ending always moving. Twilight felt as though she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in control of her body any more. She was nothing more than a passenger, watching her own hooves as they moved like she had been doing this her whole life.\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how long they\xe2\x80\x99d been going at it now. She was caked in sweat, her mane plastered to her forehead. She sported several shallow scratches and cuts, courtesy of not being able to dissipate all of the momentum behind a vicious attack. The three cadets might have been just as tired, but if they were, it was pure determination that still fueled them onwards. As Twilight moved to counterattack after a block, she slipped on a slick patch of grass. Then, all at once, her balance was lost. She fell forward, throwing out her forehooves to stop her downward movement. She landed with Grace beneath her and that dreaded broadsword arching down to meet her unprotected back.\r\n\t\r\n\tOnly to meet a hard mana shield. Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn flared brighter and the shield launched skyward, jerking the blade away from the unicorn. Twilight regained her hoofing, panting slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cLesson number two: You should remember that your foe is also a mage, and that magic is as deadly a weapon as a physical one.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe three cadets were about finished, now. Dumbbell had anticipating on striking the mare while she was down and ending it all right then and there. But that didn\xe2\x80\x99t happen, and the three cadets were now folding under the annoyed unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s assault. A hard mana shield slammed into Hoops, sweeping the stunned stallion off his hooves. He lay there on the hard-packed earth, the fight beaten out of him. Calamity took one look at the slowly approaching apprentice and fled, dropping his weapons and trying to shove his way out of the crowd of spectators. Dumbbell, however, lived up to his name in more ways than one. He charged at Twilight, rage driven and determined to end the lavender mare who\xe2\x80\x99d caused him so much embarrassment and pain. Twilight was waiting for him. She stabbed out with the blade of Grace and twisted the weapon at the same time, \xe2\x80\x98stinging\xe2\x80\x99 Dumbbell\xe2\x80\x99s hoof and causing him to drop his heavy weapon.
