2015-02-23 12:03:20,325 - DEBUG - {'version': 1, 'chapter_number': 9, 'fields': ['chapter_text', 'chapter_number', 'parent_chapter_id', 'chapter_html', 'version', 'parent_story_id'], 'chapter_to_insert': {'chapter_text': "//------------------------------//\n// Chapter 9// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0A hazy fog of green magic permeated the room. It swirled and eddied gently in the small practice chamber, creating a perpetual gloom that would probably be fitting at a haunted house. In the center of it all stood a lavender unicorn, eyes clenched in concentration and horn awash with power. A rather adorable scowl accompanied her features as she maintained her casting. At her left side floated a glaive on a bed of magic, a green glyph glowing bright on the weapon. To the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s right stood an undead that could have been a twin of the practicing unicorn, if it weren't for the majestic wings resting folded upon her form. The undead\xe2\x80\x99s luminous gaze never wavered from her partner, as if willing the spell to take form. Slightly behind Starshard stood the powerful form of Princess Luna, staring at her student with an almost feverishly proud gaze. There was nothing said, no sounds uttered save the steady hum of magic at work.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Slowly, ever so slowly, a form began to appear. First a head, followed by a slender neck and shoulders. The figure grew sharply and then actually climbed up out of the ground, shaking its forehooves as it did so. The form then began to shake its entire body, as though shrugging off the last vestiges of death. The creature was definitely a mare, as seen by her slender form and roundish face. Her entire body seemed to be made of a dull white bone, little fragments knitted together to complete it. Her mane and tail resembled liquid mercury, hanging flat and limp around her form. Her eyes glowed a luminous yellow, though there were no iris or pupil, or even any hint of an eyeball at all. Then, as the magic completed itself, proud pair of wings sprouted from the creature\xe2\x80\x99s back, made from the same materials as her mane and tail.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0With a small echoing pop of discharging magic, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn ceased its bright glow. She released a pent up breath of exertion and finally opened her eyes. They immediately sought out the fruits of her labors, widening slightly as they did so. The creature before her cocked her head in an obviously intelligent and self aware gesture, but did not speak. The apprentice approached slowly, trotting a gentle circle around the object of her fascination. As far as she could tell, Twilight Sparkle had completed her spellcasting perfectly. Rather than second guess herself, the mare turned to her necromancy tutor expectantly.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard allowed a brief grin to flash upon her bold muzzle. \xe2\x80\x9cWell done, student. You\xe2\x80\x99ve successfully summoned your first elemental.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cDid I do it correctly? Did I miss anything?\xe2\x80\x9d The unicorn tried to keep the rising excitement from her tone, with mixed results.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard moved forward a few paces, studying the elemental. \xe2\x80\x9cOverall, your form was good, and strong. You took the incantation and immediately started casting with it, while others would have been rather stumped. You did take a little too long to summon her, but that\xe2\x80\x99s to be expected on your first try. You\xe2\x80\x99ll become faster and more comfortable the more you practice.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight glanced up. \xe2\x80\x9cSo what\xe2\x80\x99s she made out of?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cAn astute question. Elementals differ from caster to caster. No two are exactly the same, even elementals summoned from differing planes of magic by the same caster. In this case, your elemental consists of the ivory often found deep beneath the earth-- remnants of an age long past. Ivory is often used by necromancers to enhance their spells in certain ways, though I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever seen a necromancy elemental made from the stuff. Undoubtedly she could make a powerful ally in the future.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cHer mane and tail aren\xe2\x80\x99t really there at all, and are merely a projection of the elemental\xe2\x80\x99s will. This is the only part of the summoning process that the elemental can influence themselves; it's how they give themselves a personality. Seeing as hers has the appearance of liquid mercury, she\xe2\x80\x99s probably rather cool and level-headed most of the time-- just like her creator.\xe2\x80\x9d At these words, Twilight felt herself blushing slightly. She definitely was not used to praise.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cCan she speak?\xe2\x80\x9d The student asked quickly, willing her reddened cheeks to stop glowing.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cNo. While they are fully self aware and are every bit as alive as you or I, it is not possible for an elemental to replicate vocal cords. Nor can they hear. To instruct an elemental upon a task, the necromancer instead uses his or her will, just like a spell. Go on, give it a try.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Feeling slightly foolish for a brief moment, Twilight bent her will into the elemental, as if she were casting magic. To her slight amazement, the elemental immediately broke into a canter around the room before coming back to a rest in front of its master, butting the lavender unicorn upon her shoulder. Twilight glanced up to see Soulshard smiling slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cHow long will she last?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cWell, it depends on the caster. An elemental will stay summoned for an indefinite amount of time, unless severely wounded or otherwise incapacitated. Then they must return to the ether to recharge. To dismiss her, simply will her to do so.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight did as she was instructed, then watched as the necromancy elemental disappeared back into what appeared to be a hole in the ground, this time much more quickly than she had left it. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd it is possible to summon different elementals from different magical branches?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard nodded briefly, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cYes. Most casters can only maintain one at a time, but some exceptionally gifted can summon two. Very rarely can a caster summon three, and I don\xe2\x80\x99t recall a normal caster being able to summon four or more. Even having two active requires a very disciplined mind, as the caster has to continuously watch over both creatures. During future lessons, you will be expected to summon forth an elemental to aid you in your tasks. For now, however, we are done for the day. You\xe2\x80\x99ve made considerable progress in your studies so far, and I think you\xe2\x80\x99ve earned a bit of relaxation. Unless your mentor has any objection?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna shook her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNay, I do not. Go on, my apprentice. Enjoy the rest of the night, and sleep well. I shall call you on next evening, when it is time to resume your lessons.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Bowing once to her princess and nodding slightly to Soulshard, Twilight Sparkle found herself back in one of Canterlot\xe2\x80\x99s expansive halls. Despite the fact that she had been released from her duties as a student, the young unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s mind was still abuzz with everything she\xe2\x80\x99d learned in the past couple of days. Necromancy, as she was quickly starting to understand, was so much more than just summoning the dead to do your bidding. If anything, Necromancers were more of a\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x9cdark warlock\xe2\x80\x9d than anything else. In addition to being able to commune and ask the undead for aid, Necromancers could do a whole host of other things-- some that were even helpful. For example, her earliest lessons centered around creating curses to aid as well as harm. Most of them were rather simplistic-- minor blindness, aches and pains, spells designed to make their target quite uncomfortable. But other curses could heal small injuries, mend broken hearing, and even slow down the effects of poison. Twilight meandered on, not even really paying attention to where she was going. She barely realized that she had exited the palace, so wrapped up in her thoughts. \r\n\r\n\tToday, of course, detailed her first step into summoning an elemental. They were an extension of the caster\xe2\x80\x99s will. Exceedingly durable and easily re-summoned, an elemental was designed to be called upon when in need-- during the heat of battle, for instance. And naturally, the stronger the summoner\xe2\x80\x99s mind the stronger the elemental became. Some mages even used them as a page of sorts, sending elementals out to complete mundane tasks that their masters had no time for. Or, in the case of nobility, tasks they thought beneath them. Elementals could even be used to gauge a spellcaster\xe2\x80\x99s power. If the elemental looked healthier than most, or if a mage had more than one elemental active at a time, it was a sign of quite a bit of power and a willful mind. Twilight found herself wondering if she would be able to summon an elemental from each plane of magic and have them performing tasks at the same time. The thought was completely ludicrous, but it still caused a warm smile to blossom upon her muzzle.\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight found herself pausing in front of a gate. A very familiar gate, emblazoned with the mark of her house: a bright burgundy six pointed star, superimposed over another white six pointed star and five smaller white stars surrounding it. With slightly shaky magic, the unicorn nudged open the gate and stepped, for the first time in years, into the grounds of the Twinkle manor. Even after all this time, the place was immaculate, signalling that some dedicated servant or other had been here. The rolling grass hills were neatly trimmed. The main cobblestone walkway had been swept. Trees and glowing lamps still stood sentinel at the sides of each walkway, forming a sort of maze. And off in the distance, Twilight saw and heard a little splash from the pond as a fish jumped. The mare trotted up to the closed front door, her hooves clopping gently on stone. Closing her eyes briefly, Twilight inserted her magical signature into the proud double doors. There was a brief pause, before the sound of magical and physical locks unlocking rent the air. With barely a whisper, the giant doors swung open of their own accord, settling with a muted boom.\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight stepped gingerly into the giant entryway. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t really have very many memories of this place. But deep down in her very being, she could feel it. This was her home. No matter how comfortable her quarters in Canterlot was, the Twinkle manor was still her home. The unicorn mare threaded her way deeper into the building, lamps already alight and guiding her way. There was the main dining room to the right of the main hallway, with the kitchen just behind it. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t hard to imagine servants bustling to and fro, serving her family in happier times. Then there was the living room, complete with one of those new televisions and a couple of couches. Then came the bar, the game room, and the Star room-- complete with multiple telescopes. The second floor consisted of multiple bedrooms. Most were completely empty; even the master bedroom that had to have belonged to her parents. However, the last bedroom she wandered into had to have been her own. The walls matched the color of her coat, and against one wall resided a double sized bed with her House emblem on the blanket. Another wall held an assortment of books and stuff animals, and the north wall held a pretty little vanity mirror.\r\n\r\n\tWiping tears from her eyes, Twilight closed the door to her old room and proceeded up the stairs to the final floor of her old home. This floor, in its entirety, was a library. Shelves upon shelves of books stood guard over neat little isles. In the center of the room rested several bean bags and reading tables, and there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a speck of dust to be seen. Since there didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem to be any cleaning spells active, somepony had been in here to clean-- and recently, too. The unicorn prowled the area, slightly in awe at the sheer number of books. This library probably rivaled the Canterlot Archives, and Twilight would bet that there were books here that not even Canterlot held. With a final, longing glance around, Twilight descended towards the first floor. There would surely be time for reading later.\r\n\t\r\n\tAs Twilight came down the stairs, she noticed an open door off to the side with another staircase leading into what seemed to be a basement. Curious, she trotted down. Her eyes widened at what she saw. This\xe2\x80\xa6 This must have been the private armory of her parents. Weapons were everywhere she looked-- hanging from walls and displayed proudly from showcases. There were simply too many to take notice of at a casual glance. Mechanical training dummies dotted the room here and there, waiting for an operator to activate them. Off in one corner was a roped off fighting ring, very similar to the one she saw in Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s armory. As Twilight stepped further into the room, she also began to see entire suits of armor in addition to the weapons-- anything from full plate to half plate, leather and silk. If Twilight had to guess, there was a small fortune down here alone-- and far more instruments of war than she\xe2\x80\x99d seen anywhere else. Her parents had been Equestrian Intelligence agents, but this stuff looked as though it could supply a small army and then some.\r\n\t\r\n\tTwilight ascended back to the main entryway of her manor, glancing around as she did so. Yes, she could get used to living here again. But\xe2\x80\xa6 not alone. It was entirely too quiet here. While the bookish unicorn did love solitude on numerous occasions, a home this big was not meant to house just one pony. Maybe\xe2\x80\xa6 perhaps she could ask her other orphans if they would like to move in? Yes, that would work, if they accepted. Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t see why not, after all. It would beat living here without another living soul in sight. Decided upon a course of action and determined to carry it out, Twilight exited the manor with a spring in her step. As she locked the door and turned to leave, a thought also occurred to her. I should really find the ponies responsible for keeping this place maintained and thank them.\r\n\t\r\n\t<<((*))>>\r\n\t\r\n\tPrincess Luna stared at the object before her in horrified fascination. Her mouth struggled to find words, before she finally spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re sure that\xe2\x80\x99s where this\xe2\x80\xa6 thing came from?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYes, your Majesty, that is exactly where it came from, and it is exactly what you think.\xe2\x80\x9d Zecora\xe2\x80\x99s voice was solemn, and she was serious enough to use a formal title. \xe2\x80\x9cPinkamena Diane Pie found this and it so did thrum. Its discovery leads us ever closer to the brink.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna shook her head wearily. \xe2\x80\x9cIf she\xe2\x80\x99s already capable of sending her agents against us, we\xe2\x80\x99re drawing short on time indeed. We may not have enough time to prepare at this rate. You said the unicorn mare caught in the blaze was one of yours?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tZecora nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cVinyl Scratch is her real name, but DJ Pon3 when playing the music game.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99d like to see her. Maybe I can speed her recovery myself. If Flare\xe2\x80\x99s already mustered enough power to send a Suntouched, this Vinyl Scratch may have some valuable information regarding the changing world. Does Pinkamena know what this is?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The zebra shook her head, earrings jingling.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cGood. Try to ensure that she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t find out. At least not yet. None of them are ready to have this thrust upon them. If we move too quickly, things will be over before it's even begun.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n", 'chapter_number': 9, 'parent_chapter_id': 693233, 'chapter_html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'9\'></a><h3>Chapter 9</h3>\n<p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0A hazy fog of green magic permeated the room. Rather than second guess herself, the mare turned to her necromancy tutor expectantly.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard allowed a brief grin to flash upon her bold muzzle. \xe2\x80\x9cWell done, student. You\xe2\x80\x99ve successfully summoned your first elemental.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cDid I do it correctly? Did I miss anything?\xe2\x80\x9d The unicorn tried to keep the rising excitement from her tone, with mixed results.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard moved forward a few paces, studying the elemental. \xe2\x80\x9cOverall, your form was good, and strong. You took the incantation and immediately started casting with it, while others would have been rather stumped. You did take a little too long to summon her, but that\xe2\x80\x99s to be expected on your first try. You\xe2\x80\x99ll become faster and more comfortable the more you practice.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight glanced up. \xe2\x80\x9cSo what\xe2\x80\x99s she made out of?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cAn astute question. Elementals differ from caster to caster. No two are exactly the same, even elementals summoned from differing planes of magic by the same caster. In this case, your elemental consists of the ivory often found deep beneath the earth-- remnants of an age long past. Ivory is often used by necromancers to enhance their spells in certain ways, though I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever seen a necromancy elemental made from the stuff. Undoubtedly she could make a powerful ally in the future.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cHer mane and tail aren\xe2\x80\x99t really there at all, and are merely a projection of the elemental\xe2\x80\x99s will. This is the only part of the summoning process that the elemental can influence themselves; it&#039;s how they give themselves a personality. Seeing as hers has the appearance of liquid mercury, she\xe2\x80\x99s probably rather cool and level-headed most of the time-- just like her creator.\xe2\x80\x9d At these words, Twilight felt herself blushing slightly. She <i>definitely</i> was not used to praise.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cCan she speak?\xe2\x80\x9d The student asked quickly, willing her reddened cheeks to stop glowing.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cNo. While they are fully self aware and are every bit as alive as you or I, it is not possible for an elemental to replicate vocal cords. Nor can they hear. To instruct an elemental upon a task, the necromancer instead uses his or her will, just like a spell. Go on, give it a try.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Feeling slightly foolish for a brief moment, Twilight bent her will into the elemental, as if she were casting magic. To her slight amazement, the elemental immediately broke into a canter around the room before coming back to a rest in front of its master, butting the lavender unicorn upon her shoulder. Twilight glanced up to see Soulshard smiling slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cHow long will she last?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cWell, it depends on the caster. An elemental will stay summoned for an indefinite amount of time, unless severely wounded or otherwise incapacitated. Then they must return to the ether to recharge. To dismiss her, simply will her to do so.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight did as she was instructed, then watched as the necromancy elemental disappeared back into what appeared to be a hole in the ground, this time much more quickly than she had left it. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd it is possible to summon different elementals from different magical branches?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard nodded briefly, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cYes. Most casters can only maintain one at a time, but some exceptionally gifted can summon two. Very rarely can a caster summon three, and I don\xe2\x80\x99t recall a normal caster being able to summon four or more. Even having two active requires a <i>very</i> disciplined mind, as the caster has to continuously watch over both creatures. During future lessons, you will be expected to summon forth an elemental to aid you in your tasks. For now, however, we are done for the day. You\xe2\x80\x99ve made considerable progress in your studies so far, and I think you\xe2\x80\x99ve earned a bit of relaxation. Unless your mentor has any objection?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna shook her head. \xe2\x80\x9cNay, I do not. Go on, my apprentice. Enjoy the rest of the night, and sleep well. I shall call you on next evening, when it is time to resume your lessons.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Bowing once to her princess and nodding slightly to Soulshard, Twilight Sparkle found herself back in one of Canterlot\xe2\x80\x99s expansive halls. Despite the fact that she had been released from her duties as a student, the young unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s mind was still abuzz with everything she\xe2\x80\x99d learned in the past couple of days. Necromancy, as she was quickly starting to understand, was so much more than just summoning the dead to do your bidding. If anything, Necromancers were more of a\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x9cdark warlock\xe2\x80\x9d than anything else. In addition to being able to commune and ask the undead for aid, Necromancers could do a whole host of other things-- some that were even helpful. For example, her earliest lessons centered around creating curses to aid as well as harm. Most of them were rather simplistic-- minor blindness, aches and pains, spells designed to make their target quite uncomfortable. But other curses could heal small injuries, mend broken hearing, and even slow down the effects of poison. Twilight meandered on, not even really paying attention to where she was going. She barely realized that she had exited the palace, so wrapped up in her thoughts. </p><p class="indented double">Today, of course, detailed her first step into summoning an elemental. They were an extension of the caster\xe2\x80\x99s will. Exceedingly durable and easily re-summoned, an elemental was designed to be called upon when in need-- during the heat of battle, for instance. And naturally, the stronger the summoner\xe2\x80\x99s mind the stronger the elemental became. Some mages even used them as a page of sorts, sending elementals out to complete mundane tasks that their masters had no time for. Or, in the case of nobility, tasks they thought beneath them. Elementals could even be used to gauge a spellcaster\xe2\x80\x99s power. If the elemental looked healthier than most, or if a mage had more than one elemental active at a time, it was a sign of quite a bit of power and a willful mind. Twilight found herself wondering if she would be able to summon an elemental from each plane of magic and have them performing tasks at the same time. The thought was completely ludicrous, but it still caused a warm smile to blossom upon her muzzle.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight found herself pausing in front of a gate. A very familiar gate, emblazoned with the mark of her house: a bright burgundy six pointed star, superimposed over another white six pointed star and five smaller white stars surrounding it. With slightly shaky magic, the unicorn nudged open the gate and stepped, for the first time in years, into the grounds of the Twinkle manor. Even after all this time, the place was immaculate, signalling that some dedicated servant or other had been here. The rolling grass hills were neatly trimmed. The main cobblestone walkway had been swept. Trees and glowing lamps still stood sentinel at the sides of each walkway, forming a sort of maze. And off in the distance, Twilight saw and heard a little splash from the pond as a fish jumped. The mare trotted up to the closed front door, her hooves clopping gently on stone. Closing her eyes briefly, Twilight inserted her magical signature into the proud double doors. There was a brief pause, before the sound of magical and physical locks unlocking rent the air. With barely a whisper, the giant doors swung open of their own accord, settling with a muted boom.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight stepped gingerly into the giant entryway. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t really have very many memories of this place. But deep down in her very being, she could feel it. This was her <i>home</i>. No matter how comfortable her quarters in Canterlot was, the Twinkle manor was still her home. The unicorn mare threaded her way deeper into the building, lamps already alight and guiding her way. There was the main dining room to the right of the main hallway, with the kitchen just behind it. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t hard to imagine servants bustling to and fro, serving her family in happier times. Then there was the living room, complete with one of those new televisions and a couple of couches. Then came the bar, the game room, and the Star room-- complete with multiple telescopes. The second floor consisted of multiple bedrooms. Most were completely empty; even the master bedroom that had to have belonged to her parents. However, the last bedroom she wandered into had to have been her own. The walls matched the color of her coat, and against one wall resided a double sized bed with her House emblem on the blanket. Another wall held an assortment of books and stuff animals, and the north wall held a pretty little vanity mirror.</p><p class="indented double">Wiping tears from her eyes, Twilight closed the door to her old room and proceeded up the stairs to the final floor of her old home. This floor, in its entirety, was a library. Shelves upon shelves of books stood guard over neat little isles. In the center of the room rested several bean bags and reading tables, and there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a speck of dust to be seen. Since there didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem to be any cleaning spells active, somepony had been in here to clean-- and recently, too. The unicorn prowled the area, slightly in awe at the sheer number of books. This library probably rivaled the Canterlot Archives, and Twilight would bet that there were books here that not even Canterlot held. With a final, longing glance around, Twilight descended towards the first floor. There would surely be time for reading later.</p><p class="indented double">As Twilight came down the stairs, she noticed an open door off to the side with another staircase leading into what seemed to be a basement. Curious, she trotted down. Her eyes widened at what she saw. This\xe2\x80\xa6 This must have been the private armory of her parents. Weapons were everywhere she looked-- hanging from walls and displayed proudly from showcases. There were simply too many to take notice of at a casual glance. Mechanical training dummies dotted the room here and there, waiting for an operator to activate them. Off in one corner was a roped off fighting ring, very similar to the one she saw in Princess Luna\xe2\x80\x99s armory. As Twilight stepped further into the room, she also began to see entire suits of armor in addition to the weapons-- anything from full plate to half plate, leather and silk. If Twilight had to guess, there was a small fortune down here alone-- and far more instruments of war than she\xe2\x80\x99d seen anywhere else. Her parents had been Equestrian Intelligence agents, but this stuff looked as though it could supply a small army and then some.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight ascended back to the main entryway of her manor, glancing around as she did so. Yes, she could get used to living here again. But\xe2\x80\xa6 not alone. It was entirely too quiet here. While the bookish unicorn did love solitude on numerous occasions, a home this big was not meant to house just one pony. Maybe\xe2\x80\xa6 perhaps she could ask her other orphans if they would like to move in? Yes, that would work, if they accepted. Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t see why not, after all. It would beat living here without another living soul in sight. Decided upon a course of action and determined to carry it out, Twilight exited the manor with a spring in her step. As she locked the door and turned to leave, a thought also occurred to her. <i>I should really find the ponies responsible for keeping this place maintained and thank them.</i></p><p class="indented double"><center>&lt;&lt;((*))&gt;&gt;</center></p><p class="indented double">Princess Luna stared at the object before her in horrified fascination. Her mouth struggled to find words, before she finally spoke. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re sure that\xe2\x80\x99s where this\xe2\x80\xa6 <i>thing</i> came from?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, your Majesty, that is exactly where it came from, and it is exactly what you think.\xe2\x80\x9d Zecora\xe2\x80\x99s voice was solemn, and she was serious enough to use a formal title. \xe2\x80\x9cPinkamena Diane Pie found this and it so did thrum. Its discovery leads us ever closer to the brink.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna shook her head wearily. \xe2\x80\x9cIf she\xe2\x80\x99s already capable of sending her agents against us, we\xe2\x80\x99re drawing short on time indeed. We may not have enough time to prepare at this rate. You said the unicorn mare caught in the blaze was one of yours?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Zecora nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cVinyl Scratch is her real name, but DJ Pon3 when playing the music game.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99d like to see her. Maybe I can speed her recovery myself. If Flare\xe2\x80\x99s already mustered enough power to send a Suntouched, this Vinyl Scratch may have some valuable information regarding the changing world. Does Pinkamena know what this is?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The zebra shook her head, earrings jingling.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cGood. Try to ensure that she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t find out. At least not yet. None of them are ready to have this thrust upon them. If we move too quickly, things will be over before it&#039;s even begun.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'version': 1, 'parent_story_id': 104188}, 'chapter_id': 693233, 'cursor': <mysql.connector.cursor.MySQLCursor object at 0x02E3BD70>, 'connection': <mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection object at 0x02E01A70>, 'html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'9\'></a><h3>Chapter 9</h3>\n<p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0A hazy fog of green magic permeated the room. It swirled and eddied gently in the small practice chamber, creating a perpetual gloom that would probably be fitting at a haunted house. In the center of it all stood a lavender unicorn, eyes clenched in concentration and horn awash with power. A rather adorable scowl accompanied her features as she maintained her casting. At her left side floated a glaive on a bed of magic, a green glyph glowing bright on the weapon. To the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s right stood an undead that could have been a twin of the practicing unicorn, if it weren&#039;t for the majestic wings resting folded upon her form. The undead\xe2\x80\x99s luminous gaze never wavered from her partner, as if willing the spell to take form. Slightly behind Starshard stood the powerful form of Princess Luna, staring at her student with an almost feverishly proud gaze. There was nothing said, no sounds uttered save the steady hum of magic at work.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Slowly, ever so slowly, a form began to appear. First a head, followed by a slender neck and shoulders. The figure grew sharply and then actually climbed up out of the ground, shaking its forehooves as it did so. The form then began to shake its entire body, as though shrugging off the last vestiges of death. The creature was definitely a mare, as seen by her slender form and roundish face. Her entire body seemed to be made of a dull white bone, little fragments knitted together to complete it. Her mane and tail resembled liquid mercury, hanging flat and limp around her form. Her eyes glowed a luminous yellow, though there were no iris or pupil, or even any hint of an eyeball at all. Then, as the magic completed itself, proud pair of wings sprouted from the creature\xe2\x80\x99s back, made from the same materials as her mane and tail.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0With a small echoing pop of discharging magic, Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn ceased its bright glow. She released a pent up breath of exertion and finally opened her eyes. They immediately sought out the fruits of her labors, widening slightly as they did so. The creature before her cocked her head in an obviously intelligent and self aware gesture, but did not speak. The apprentice approached slowly, trotting a gentle circle around the object of her fascination. As far as she could tell, Twilight Sparkle had completed her spellcasting perfectly. Rather than second guess herself, the mare turned to her necromancy tutor expectantly.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard allowed a brief grin to flash upon her bold muzzle. \xe2\x80\x9cWell done, student. You\xe2\x80\x99ve successfully summoned your first elemental.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cDid I do it correctly? Did I miss anything?\xe2\x80\x9d The unicorn tried to keep the rising excitement from her tone, with mixed results.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard moved forward a few paces, studying the elemental. \xe2\x80\x9cOverall, your form was good, and strong. You took the incantation and immediately started casting with it, while others would have been rather stumped. You did take a little too long to summon her, but that\xe2\x80\x99s to be expected on your first try. You\xe2\x80\x99ll become faster and more comfortable the more you practice.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight glanced up. \xe2\x80\x9cSo what\xe2\x80\x99s she made out of?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cAn astute question. Elementals differ from caster to caster. No two are exactly the same, even elementals summoned from differing planes of magic by the same caster. In this case, your elemental consists of the ivory often found deep beneath the earth-- remnants of an age long past. Ivory is often used by necromancers to enhance their spells in certain ways, though I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever seen a necromancy elemental made from the stuff. Undoubtedly she could make a powerful ally in the future.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cHer mane and tail aren\xe2\x80\x99t really there at all, and are merely a projection of the elemental\xe2\x80\x99s will. She <i>definitely</i> was not used to praise.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cCan she speak?\xe2\x80\x9d The student asked quickly, willing her reddened cheeks to stop glowing.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cNo. While they are fully self aware and are every bit as alive as you or I, it is not possible for an elemental to replicate vocal cords. Nor can they hear. To instruct an elemental upon a task, the necromancer instead uses his or her will, just like a spell. Go on, give it a try.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Feeling slightly foolish for a brief moment, Twilight bent her will into the elemental, as if she were casting magic. Twilight glanced up to see Soulshard smiling slightly. \xe2\x80\x9cHow long will she last?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cWell, it depends on the caster. An elemental will stay summoned for an indefinite amount of time, unless severely wounded or otherwise incapacitated. Then they must return to the ether to recharge. To dismiss her, simply will her to do so.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Twilight did as she was instructed, then watched as the necromancy elemental disappeared back into what appeared to be a hole in the ground, this time much more quickly than she had left it. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd it is possible to summon different elementals from different magical branches?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Soulshard nodded briefly, pleased. \xe2\x80\x9cYes. Very rarely can a caster summon three, and I don\xe2\x80\x99t recall a normal caster being able to summon four or more.
