Your Corona Flare no longer stalks this world, and it\xe2\x80\x99ll only be a matter of time before you, too, fall.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tFor the first time, there seemed to be hesitation among the creatures arrayed before her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean? Mistress is completely fine! Merely resting after her fight with that damned Valkyrie of yours. I note that she\xe2\x80\x99s not here with you. Did she abandon you? Left you, tyrant?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tMore anger reared its head, followed by cold smugness. \xe2\x80\x9cMy wife took your damn Mistress with her. Have you not felt it yet? Your powers slowly diminishing, your every step weakened? It is because the catalyst for your magic is gone. Gone for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThere was a shivering beat of icy silence. \xe2\x80\x9cYou lie! Attack! Kill them! Kill them all!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe stallion who had stepped forward earlier led the charge, and the remaining Elements of Harmony moved to meet it head on. The first foe crashed directly into Halt, the stoic earth pony a solid wall of muscle and bristling steel. The Element of Honesty flared bright orange, encasing its owner in a faint glow. Spells fizzled against the protection not a single moment later, rebounding in random directions. Spitfire was next into the fray, leaping and diving above her grounded enemies. Loyalty offered its power to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s wings, turning the already formidable pegasus into a winged terror. Zecora found herself engaging two enemies at once, even as Laughter muddled their senses. And the medic Shimmer found her attention divided as she struggled to keep healing and energizing magic pumping into her allies. Watching the ponies she loved almost as much as her wife fighting for their continued freedom, something inside the dark princess snapped. Her willpower hardened, and then she charged into the battle herself even as more rebels charged up the corridor leading to the throne room.\r\n\t\r\n\tEven with the Elements of Harmony augmenting their abilities, the final defenders were still losing ground. Whatever fell magic Flare had used to enhance her best lieutenants was far more powerful than the splintered Elements. Without their full number the artifacts were quite a bit weaker, and with enemy reinforcements joining the fray it was only a matter of time at this point. Leaving the four monsters to her friends, Princess Luna immediately turned and met the newcomers at the doors. She lowered her head and ran one pony through with her horn, then turned and bucked another so hard Luna snapped the mare\xe2\x80\x99s neck. Another leapt onto the Alcorn\'s back, sword skating uselessly against the reinforced half armor there. Luna leapt straight backwards and crushed the stallion into the wall.\r\n\t\r\n\tSlowly but surely, the defenders were pressed backwards, right up against the Equestrian Thrones. The five of them stood before those seats of power, refusing to give another inch of ground. Shimmer\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were glowing with pink power, mouth transfixed into a permanent scowl as she struggled to pour as much healing magic as she could into her comrades. Scratches and other minor wounds knitted themselves as fast as they appeared. Spitfire was still airborne, trying to keep other flyers from taking out Shimmer while simultaneously creating small openings in the never ending tide. Halter had retrieved a two-handed hammer from a fallen foe and worked on making himself the biggest target possible in an effort to keep them away from his team. But the weakened Elements of Harmony were quickly tiring. Each of them knew it was only going to be a matter of time.\r\n\t\r\n\tPrincess Luna suddenly felt numerous magical signatures flaring at the same time; far too many to count. The next thing she knew, the throne room was suddenly filled with multiple flashes of light as teleports completed. The rebels found their attention divided as they were unexpectedly attacked on all sides by unicorns covered head to hoof in gleaming purple armor. Panicked cries were cut off as the purple armored ponies moved through the throne room, cutting down rebels with practiced ease. Those still alive and with their wits about them began to rapidly retreat, some even going so far as to drag their dead with them. The newcomers gave chase down the hall as even more teleports flared throughout the room. As Luna tried to catch her breath, she could only see one word emblazoned upon the armor: Magickaforce. The Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s elite commandos had arrived.\r\n\t\r\n\tOne of them approached the battered Elements of Harmony, one Luna recognized. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d she greeted, bowing her head. Though the visor set in her helmet hid her face, Luna knew the badges upon the armor.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYour timing was impeccable, Knight-commander Bright Spark. A few moments more and Equestria would have fallen for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWe came as soon as we could. When we discovered that the majority of Flare\xe2\x80\x99s forces were entrenched around Canterlot Palace, we knew what was going on.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m surprised you\xe2\x80\x99re here at all, to be perfectly honest. I had thought the Magickaforce had disappeared with their liege.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tBright Spark shook her helmeted head. \xe2\x80\x9cNot quite. However, we have been busy. Some of us were scouring the land, confirming without a doubt that she is gone. Others were in her laboratories, securing the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s inventions and research. And even more of us were busy erasing all traces of her from history, and hopefully from memory.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhatever for? What reasons do you have to do such a thing?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t decide what emotion she wanted to feel.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThose were her final orders to us. We were to make sure she was gone. We were to prevent others from finding her science, and claiming it as their own. And we were to make it appear like she had never existed in the first place. In a couple of years, Equestria will forget that there had been four Princesses ruling it, which is exactly what was planned. You will be hailed as the sole monarch, so that you may rebuild what was lost.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAnd where will you go? Are you just going to toss aside your oaths, and return to living as normal ponies?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe Knight-commander actually laughed at that. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. We will go across the vast sea. We will take all of the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s research. Most of her inventions, that we feel most of ponykind aren\xe2\x80\x99t ready for. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll forge a new life in new lands. We will thrive. We will grow. And when our Mistress returns to the mortal plane once more, the Magickaforce will be ready. We will be prepared, and we will help her deal with Corona Flare for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThere is no changing your mind, is there?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThere is not. It has already been decided, and while we do recognize you as a leader, Magickaforce only answers to one Princess, and one Princess only. Two if you count her sister. Right now, however, you need to tend to your comrades. Let us deal with the last of the insurgents. The least we can do is offer you a chance to start fresh.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tAs Princess Luna turned to check upon her fellow Elements of Harmony, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but reflect upon what the future would bring. She had been given a chance, a golden opportunity to remake Equestria into something even better than it had been. And she knew her deceased wife deserved that much. Whenever the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s spirit regained a mortal shell, Luna would be waiting. So would the Magickaforce. And so would Equestria.\r\n', 'chapter_number': 10, 'parent_chapter_id': 713022, 'chapter_html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'10\'></a><h3>Back to the Past 1</h3>\n<p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0A lone knock echoed around the spacious throne room. Princess Luna of Equestria tore her tear streaked gaze from the window and tried to compose herself.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cEnter.\xe2\x80\x9d Her voice, still laced with grief hours later, was barely above a whisper.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The ornate doors, depicting the four cutie marks of the Princesses of Equestria, opened slowly. A lone pony stepped through, one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Home Guard. The soldier carried something in his orange magic, objects that Luna recognized immediately. The once proud staff may have been splintered, the <i>Nightsteel</i> may have been tarnished from the rigors of war, but the glaive of the Valkyrie was still identifiable. \xe2\x80\x9cWe found this, Princess. Its the only other part of her we\xe2\x80\x99ve found, save her armor.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna\xe2\x80\x99s chest constricted painfully, and it was all she could do to prevent herself from falling into helpless sobs. \xe2\x80\x9cThen she\xe2\x80\x99s gone. She\xe2\x80\x99s truly gone\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard removed his helmet and bowed his head, echoing the sorrow of his liege. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, your highness. We did everything we could to find her and bring her back to you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna wiped her silently shed tears away almost angrily, then glanced up at the guard again. It was obvious that the Home Guard had seen some heavy, heavy fighting. Several cuts and bruises crisscrossed this one\xe2\x80\x99s face. His armor was dented and covered in a layer of grime. \xe2\x80\x9cYou should get out of here while you can. Get all of the remaining Home Guard out of Canterlot. Get away from this cursed place.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already shaking his head, lips set into a determined frown. \xe2\x80\x9cNo, princess. The Home Guard will stand with our charge, just like we have always done in ages past.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cThis is an order from your princess: Withdraw. I will not let your lives be measured against mine. Go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already moving back towards the door, helmet sliding back into place. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re not going anywhere, Luna. We will guard the throne room. We will hold as long as we can. When those bastards break through, I hope the Home Guard will have weakened them enough for you to mop up their ilk.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The doors closed behind the guard with booming finality. Luna stared after him for several moments, before she realized he had set the remains of the weapon right next to the portal. Tears threatened to overcome her barriers yet again. When things went to Tartarus, <i>she</i> was the one there to keep her steady. <i>She</i> was the one to keep things mostly under control, battlehardened far beyond the other three Alicorns, including her sister. And now, she was gone. Her wife. Her other half. Her heart. Gone. There was a slight movement from behind Princess Luna, and she turned slowly.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0There, standing proud as ever, were her four closest friends in the world. They were all making preparations, more than ready to stand with the last Princess of the Equestrian Crown. Captain Spitfire. Loyalty. Leader of the Wonderbolts fighting force and one of the most powerful pegasi to date. The physical embodiment of Loyalty hung about her neck, glinting blood red and shaped like her cutie mark. Zecora. Laughter. For being an unparalleled spymaster, the zebra had an astounding sense of humor and always took the opportunity to make others laugh. Sky blue graced her neck. Then came Shimmer. Kindness. The mare did everything in her power to aid those less fortunate, and still wore her medical coat with pride. Pink glimmered brightly. And finally, Halt. A pony so dependable and honest he would crawl through Tartarus and back for a friend. Orange gleamed cheerfully.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna completed the fifth Element of Harmony. She was Generosity incarnate. How could she not be, with how she treated her subjects? Always spending resources from her own House to improve the lives of the average citizen, and never asking for a single thing in return. Dark purple shined against her black coat, right below her torc. The only Element missing was Magic. And this Element was the reason Luna\xe2\x80\x99s kingdom was on the verge of collapsing around her. With great power comes great responsibility, and her poor sister Celestia simply couldn\xe2\x80\x99t handle the power.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;I thought I made it clear that you four should not be here.&quot; Luna&#039;s stern voice was slightly ruined with tears still glimmering in her eyes.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;And I thought I had made it clear that we weren&#039;t going to be leaving our friend.&quot; Spitfire retorted. &quot;Never mind the fact that she&#039;s a princess.&quot;</p><p class="indented double">&quot;What&#039;s with all of my military personnel ignoring my orders?&quot; The dark Alicorn demanded, exasperated.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;Because you&#039;re making bad calls.&quot; Shimmer snapped. This gave Luna pause. The medical pony never talked like that. However, she rallied quickly.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIs it a bad call to want to keep those I care about safe? Is it so wrong for me to wish for no more deaths at my hooves?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">&quot;Shimmer has a point.&quot; Halt added in his usual slow way. &quot;Even if we could get out of Canterlot, what then? We&#039;d be killed long before we could reach the border. And if by some miracle we&#039;re not, do you expect one of the other nations to harbor known &#039;terrorists&#039;? Nay. I say we test our mettle right here, standing in defiance against the evil that plagues us.&quot;</p><p class="indented double">Zecora didn&#039;t say anything, but then again she didn&#039;t have to. She was as ready for a fight as the rest of them. Luna stood there, mulling over their words. In hindsight, ordering them to abandon her and their home <i>was</i> a bit redundant. The sounds of fighting in the long hallway leading to the room suddenly reached her ears. She heard her Home Guard crying out in a single voice, shouting their fury to the world. Weapons clashed, magic cackled, and bodies slumped to the floor. The fighting was so very close now. Almost right on top of the closed doors. The captain of the Home Guard tried to rally his remaining ponies. His exclamation turned into a pained grunt, then cut off. Hooves beat a staccato upon marble as the sole survivor charged her enemies, shouting her patriotic fervor. For just a moment, this single pony held the line by herself. Luna was pretty sure she recognized this voice that snarled in the face of certain death. But even then, after a solid thirty seconds, she too fell, a whispered apology upon her last breath. Her body hit the wall and fell with a dull thud.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, too, Li li, so so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d The apology from the Princess of the Night only fell on deceased ears. The other four Elements of Harmony stepped parallel to the Alicorn, faces set into grim lines and weapons at the ready. Yet, all was silent. Seconds lingered far longer than they should have. Were they preparing themselves? Did they think now, after five years of bloodshed, that they\xe2\x80\x99re quest was finally finished? Or were they waiting for a pony to react, one that was no longer with them on the mortal plane? Was there any reason at all to their twisted logic?</p><p class="indented double">Finally, the doors blew open, blasted clear off their hinges and sent careening into the closest walls. As the dust slowly cleared, the attackers entered the room, approaching slowly. Luna closed her eyes in sorrow.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere they are.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve got you now, traitors.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">No attack came. She could feel the other Elements at her side, tensing, preparing for the inevitable fight.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cOpen your eyes! I want you to see the ponies that brought you to your knees, tyrant!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna ignored them. She calmed her turbulent thoughts and took deep, slow breaths.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSweet Corona Flare, look at her. Basking in the glory of her decadent deeds.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">A white hot flame burned within Luna\xe2\x80\x99s mind for the first time in days. She gulped down a shuddering breath and her eyes snapped open. There were only four of them. Flare\xe2\x80\x99s most trusted followers. Their gazes were hardened, stances battle ready. There were no traces of the decent ponies they once were. As Luna studied them, her anger rose sharply. Honestly, she did not feel sorry for these foals. As far as she was concerned, they were no longer her ponies. Just monsters.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou have no idea how much pain I am in right now. How much pain you\xe2\x80\x99ve caused me over the course of the last five years.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">One of them stepped forward. Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t know who he had once been. His armor obscured his coat and cutie mark and his full helm hid his face. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t try to hand us that pile of filth. Everyone knows how poorly you\xe2\x80\x99ve treated us Equestrians.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Another moved, a mare. \xe2\x80\x9cThose five years of fighting can be laid squarely at your hooves, tyrant. If you had cared all that much you would have given up the throne to our Mistress ages ago.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cEquestrian lives lost are all your fault.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">&quot;<i><b>BE SILENT, KNAVE!</i></b>&quot; The Alicorn of the Night shook the entire castle with her voice. \xe2\x80\x9c<i><b>You are no longer Equestrians! You forfeit all claims to that distinction when you joined that usurper and waged war upon my country!</i></b> And it was all for naught, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t it?! You\xe2\x80\x99ve lost, now. Your Corona Flare no longer stalks this world, and it\xe2\x80\x99ll only be a matter of time before you, too, fall.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">For the first time, there seemed to be hesitation among the creatures arrayed before her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean? Mistress is completely fine! Merely resting after her fight with that damned Valkyrie of yours. I note that she\xe2\x80\x99s not here with you. Did she abandon you? Left you, tyrant?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More anger reared its head, followed by cold smugness. \xe2\x80\x9cMy wife took your damn Mistress with her. Have you not felt it yet? Your powers slowly diminishing, your every step weakened? It is because the catalyst for your magic is gone. Gone for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">There was a shivering beat of icy silence. \xe2\x80\x9cYou lie! Attack! Kill them! Kill them all!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The stallion who had stepped forward earlier led the charge, and the remaining Elements of Harmony moved to meet it head on. The first foe crashed directly into Halt, the stoic earth pony a solid wall of muscle and bristling steel. The Element of Honesty flared bright orange, encasing its owner in a faint glow. Spells fizzled against the protection not a single moment later, rebounding in random directions. Spitfire was next into the fray, leaping and diving above her grounded enemies. Loyalty offered its power to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s wings, turning the already formidable pegasus into a winged terror. Zecora found herself engaging two enemies at once, even as Laughter muddled their senses. And the medic Shimmer found her attention divided as she struggled to keep healing and energizing magic pumping into her allies. Watching the ponies she loved almost as much as her wife fighting for their continued freedom, something inside the dark princess snapped. Her willpower hardened, and then she charged into the battle herself even as more rebels charged up the corridor leading to the throne room.</p><p class="indented double">Even with the Elements of Harmony augmenting their abilities, the final defenders were still losing ground. Whatever fell magic Flare had used to enhance her best lieutenants was far more powerful than the splintered Elements. Without their full number the artifacts were quite a bit weaker, and with enemy reinforcements joining the fray it was only a matter of time at this point. Leaving the four monsters to her friends, Princess Luna immediately turned and met the newcomers at the doors. She lowered her head and ran one pony through with her horn, then turned and bucked another so hard Luna snapped the mare\xe2\x80\x99s neck. Another leapt onto the Alcorn&#039;s back, sword skating uselessly against the reinforced half armor there. Luna leapt straight backwards and crushed the stallion into the wall.</p><p class="indented double">Slowly but surely, the defenders were pressed backwards, right up against the Equestrian Thrones. The five of them stood before those seats of power, refusing to give another inch of ground. Shimmer\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were glowing with pink power, mouth transfixed into a permanent scowl as she struggled to pour as much healing magic as she could into her comrades. Scratches and other minor wounds knitted themselves as fast as they appeared. Spitfire was still airborne, trying to keep other flyers from taking out Shimmer while simultaneously creating small openings in the never ending tide. Halter had retrieved a two-handed hammer from a fallen foe and worked on making himself the biggest target possible in an effort to keep them away from his team. But the weakened Elements of Harmony were quickly tiring. Each of them knew it was only going to be a matter of time.</p><p class="indented double">Princess Luna suddenly felt numerous magical signatures flaring at the same time; far too many to count. The next thing she knew, the throne room was suddenly filled with multiple flashes of light as teleports completed. The rebels found their attention divided as they were unexpectedly attacked on all sides by unicorns covered head to hoof in gleaming purple armor. Panicked cries were cut off as the purple armored ponies moved through the throne room, cutting down rebels with practiced ease. Those still alive and with their wits about them began to rapidly retreat, some even going so far as to drag their dead with them. The newcomers gave chase down the hall as even more teleports flared throughout the room. As Luna tried to catch her breath, she could only see one word emblazoned upon the armor: <i>Magickaforce</i>. The Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s elite commandos had arrived.</p><p class="indented double">One of them approached the battered Elements of Harmony, one Luna recognized. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d she greeted, bowing her head. Though the visor set in her helmet hid her face, Luna knew the badges upon the armor.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYour timing was impeccable, Knight-commander Bright Spark. A few moments more and Equestria would have fallen for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe came as soon as we could. When we discovered that the majority of Flare\xe2\x80\x99s forces were entrenched around Canterlot Palace, we knew what was going on.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m surprised you\xe2\x80\x99re here at all, to be perfectly honest. I had thought the <i>Magickaforce</i> had disappeared with their liege.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Bright Spark shook her helmeted head. \xe2\x80\x9cNot quite. However, we have been busy. Some of us were scouring the land, confirming without a doubt that she is gone. Others were in her laboratories, securing the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s inventions and research. And even more of us were busy erasing all traces of her from history, and hopefully from memory.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhatever for? What reasons do you have to do such a thing?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t decide what emotion she wanted to feel.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThose were her final orders to us. We were to make sure she was gone. We were to prevent others from finding her science, and claiming it as their own. And we were to make it appear like she had never existed in the first place. In a couple of years, Equestria will forget that there had been four Princesses ruling it, which is exactly what was planned. <i>You</i> will be hailed as the sole monarch, so that you may rebuild what was lost.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnd where will you go? Are you just going to toss aside your oaths, and return to living as normal ponies?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The Knight-commander actually laughed at that. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. We will go across the vast sea. We will take all of the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s research. Most of her inventions, that we feel most of ponykind aren\xe2\x80\x99t ready for. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll forge a new life in new lands. We will thrive. We will grow. And when our Mistress returns to the mortal plane once more, the <i>Magickaforce</i> will be ready. We will be prepared, and we will help her deal with Corona Flare for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere is no changing your mind, is there?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere is not. It has already been decided, and while we do recognize you as a leader, <i>Magickaforce</i> only answers to one Princess, and one Princess only. Two if you count her sister. Right now, however, you need to tend to your comrades. Let us deal with the last of the insurgents. The least we can do is offer you a chance to start fresh.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">As Princess Luna turned to check upon her fellow Elements of Harmony, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but reflect upon what the future would bring. She had been given a chance, a golden opportunity to remake Equestria into something even better than it had been. And she knew her deceased wife deserved that much. Whenever the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s spirit regained a mortal shell, Luna would be waiting. So would the <i>Magickaforce</i>. And so would Equestria.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'version': 1, 'parent_story_id': 104188}, 'chapter_id': 713022, 'cursor': <mysql.connector.cursor.MySQLCursor object at 0x02E3B6F0>, 'connection': <mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection object at 0x02E01A70>, 'html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'10\'></a><h3>Back to the Past 1</h3>\n<p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0A lone knock echoed around the spacious throne room. Princess Luna of Equestria tore her tear streaked gaze from the window and tried to compose herself.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cEnter.\xe2\x80\x9d Her voice, still laced with grief hours later, was barely above a whisper.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The ornate doors, depicting the four cutie marks of the Princesses of Equestria, opened slowly. A lone pony stepped through, one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Home Guard. The soldier carried something in his orange magic, objects that Luna recognized immediately. The once proud staff may have been splintered, the <i>Nightsteel</i> may have been tarnished from the rigors of war, but the glaive of the Valkyrie was still identifiable. \xe2\x80\x9cWe found this, Princess. Its the only other part of her we\xe2\x80\x99ve found, save her armor.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna\xe2\x80\x99s chest constricted painfully, and it was all she could do to prevent herself from falling into helpless sobs. \xe2\x80\x9cThen she\xe2\x80\x99s gone. She\xe2\x80\x99s truly gone\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard removed his helmet and bowed his head, echoing the sorrow of his liege. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, your highness. We did everything we could to find her and bring her back to you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna wiped her silently shed tears away almost angrily, then glanced up at the guard again. It was obvious that the Home Guard had seen some heavy, heavy fighting. Several cuts and bruises crisscrossed this one\xe2\x80\x99s face. His armor was dented and covered in a layer of grime. \xe2\x80\x9cYou should get out of here while you can. Get all of the remaining Home Guard out of Canterlot. Get away from this cursed place.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already shaking his head, lips set into a determined frown. \xe2\x80\x9cNo, princess. The Home Guard will stand with our charge, just like we have always done in ages past.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cThis is an order from your princess: Withdraw. I will not let your lives be measured against mine. Go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already moving back towards the door, helmet sliding back into place. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re not going anywhere, Luna. We will guard the throne room. We will hold as long as we can. When those bastards break through, I hope the Home Guard will have weakened them enough for you to mop up their ilk.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The doors closed behind the guard with booming finality. Luna stared after him for several moments, before she realized he had set the remains of the weapon right next to the portal. Tears threatened to overcome her barriers yet again. When things went to Tartarus, <i>she</i> was the one there to keep her steady. <i>She</i> was the one to keep things mostly under control, battlehardened far beyond the other three Alicorns, including her sister. And now, she was gone. Her wife. Her other half. Her heart. Gone. There was a slight movement from behind Princess Luna, and she turned slowly.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0There, standing proud as ever, were her four closest friends in the world. They were all making preparations, more than ready to stand with the last Princess of the Equestrian Crown. Captain Spitfire. Loyalty. Leader of the Wonderbolts fighting force and one of the most powerful pegasi to date. The physical embodiment of Loyalty hung about her neck, glinting blood red and shaped like her cutie mark. Zecora. Laughter. For being an unparalleled spymaster, the zebra had an astounding sense of humor and always took the opportunity to make others laugh. Sky blue graced her neck. Then came Shimmer. Kindness. The mare did everything in her power to aid those less fortunate, and still wore her medical coat with pride. Pink glimmered brightly. And finally, Halt. A pony so dependable and honest he would crawl through Tartarus and back for a friend. Orange gleamed cheerfully.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna completed the fifth Element of Harmony. She was Generosity incarnate. How could she not be, with how she treated her subjects? Always spending resources from her own House to improve the lives of the average citizen, and never asking for a single thing in return. Dark purple shined against her black coat, right below her torc. The only Element missing was Magic. And this Element was the reason Luna\xe2\x80\x99s kingdom was on the verge of collapsing around her. With great power comes great responsibility, and her poor sister Celestia simply couldn\xe2\x80\x99t handle the power.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;I thought I made it clear that you four should not be here.&quot; Luna&#039;s stern voice was slightly ruined with tears still glimmering in her eyes.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;And I thought I had made it clear that we weren&#039;t going to be leaving our friend.&quot; Spitfire retorted. &quot;Never mind the fact that she&#039;s a princess.&quot;</p><p class="indented double">&quot;What&#039;s with all of my military personnel ignoring my orders?&quot; The dark Alicorn demanded, exasperated.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;Because you&#039;re making bad calls.&quot; Shimmer snapped. This gave Luna pause. The medical pony never talked like that. However, she rallied quickly.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIs it a bad call to want to keep those I care about safe? Is it so wrong for me to wish for no more deaths at my hooves?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">&quot;Shimmer has a point.&quot; Halt added in his usual slow way. &quot;Even if we could get out of Canterlot, what then? We&#039;d be killed long before we could reach the border. And if by some miracle we&#039;re not, do you expect one of the other nations to harbor known &#039;terrorists&#039;? Nay. I say we test our mettle right here, standing in defiance against the evil that plagues us.&quot;</p><p class="indented double">Zecora didn&#039;t say anything, but then again she didn&#039;t have to. She was as ready for a fight as the rest of them. Luna stood there, mulling over their words. In hindsight, ordering them to abandon her and their home <i>was</i> a bit redundant. The sounds of fighting in the long hallway leading to the room suddenly reached her ears. She heard her Home Guard crying out in a single voice, shouting their fury to the world. Weapons clashed, magic cackled, and bodies slumped to the floor. The fighting was so very close now. Almost right on top of the closed doors. The captain of the Home Guard tried to rally his remaining ponies. His exclamation turned into a pained grunt, then cut off. Hooves beat a staccato upon marble as the sole survivor charged her enemies, shouting her patriotic fervor. For just a moment, this single pony held the line by herself. Luna was pretty sure she recognized this voice that snarled in the face of certain death. But even then, after a solid thirty seconds, she too fell, a whispered apology upon her last breath. Her body hit the wall and fell with a dull thud.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, too, Li li, so so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d The apology from the Princess of the Night only fell on deceased ears. The other four Elements of Harmony stepped parallel to the Alicorn, faces set into grim lines and weapons at the ready. Yet, all was silent. Seconds lingered far longer than they should have. Were they preparing themselves? Did they think now, after five years of bloodshed, that they\xe2\x80\x99re quest was finally finished? Or were they waiting for a pony to react, one that was no longer with them on the mortal plane? Was there any reason at all to their twisted logic?</p><p class="indented double">Finally, the doors blew open, blasted clear off their hinges and sent careening into the closest walls. As the dust slowly cleared, the attackers entered the room, approaching slowly. Luna closed her eyes in sorrow.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere they are.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve got you now, traitors.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">No attack came. She could feel the other Elements at her side, tensing, preparing for the inevitable fight.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cOpen your eyes! I want you to see the ponies that brought you to your knees, tyrant!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna ignored them. She calmed her turbulent thoughts and took deep, slow breaths.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSweet Corona Flare, look at her. Basking in the glory of her decadent deeds.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">A white hot flame burned within Luna\xe2\x80\x99s mind for the first time in days. She gulped down a shuddering breath and her eyes snapped open. There were only four of them. Flare\xe2\x80\x99s most trusted followers. Their gazes were hardened, stances battle ready. There were no traces of the decent ponies they once were. As Luna studied them, her anger rose sharply. Honestly, she did not feel sorry for these foals. As far as she was concerned, they were no longer her ponies. Just monsters.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou have no idea how much pain I am in right now. How much pain you\xe2\x80\x99ve caused me over the course of the last five years.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">One of them stepped forward. Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t know who he had once been. His armor obscured his coat and cutie mark and his full helm hid his face. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t try to hand us that pile of filth. Everyone knows how poorly you\xe2\x80\x99ve treated us Equestrians.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Another moved, a mare. \xe2\x80\x9cThose five years of fighting can be laid squarely at your hooves, tyrant. If you had cared all that much you would have given up the throne to our Mistress ages ago.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cEquestrian lives lost are all your fault.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">&quot;<i><b>BE SILENT, KNAVE!</i></b>&quot; The Alicorn of the Night shook the entire castle with her voice. \xe2\x80\x9c<i><b>You are no longer Equestrians! You forfeit all claims to that distinction when you joined that usurper and waged war upon my country!</i></b> And it was all for naught, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t it?! You\xe2\x80\x99ve lost, now. Your Corona Flare no longer stalks this world, and it\xe2\x80\x99ll only be a matter of time before you, too, fall.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">For the first time, there seemed to be hesitation among the creatures arrayed before her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean? Mistress is completely fine! Merely resting after her fight with that damned Valkyrie of yours. I note that she\xe2\x80\x99s not here with you. Did she abandon you? Left you, tyrant?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More anger reared its head, followed by cold smugness. \xe2\x80\x9cMy wife took your damn Mistress with her. Have you not felt it yet? Your powers slowly diminishing, your every step weakened? It is because the catalyst for your magic is gone. Gone for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">There was a shivering beat of icy silence. \xe2\x80\x9cYou lie! Attack! Kill them! Kill them all!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The stallion who had stepped forward earlier led the charge, and the remaining Elements of Harmony moved to meet it head on. The first foe crashed directly into Halt, the stoic earth pony a solid wall of muscle and bristling steel. The Element of Honesty flared bright orange, encasing its owner in a faint glow. Spells fizzled against the protection not a single moment later, rebounding in random directions. Spitfire was next into the fray, leaping and diving above her grounded enemies. Loyalty offered its power to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s wings, turning the already formidable pegasus into a winged terror. Zecora found herself engaging two enemies at once, even as Laughter muddled their senses. And the medic Shimmer found her attention divided as she struggled to keep healing and energizing magic pumping into her allies. Watching the ponies she loved almost as much as her wife fighting for their continued freedom, something inside the dark princess snapped. Her willpower hardened, and then she charged into the battle herself even as more rebels charged up the corridor leading to the throne room.</p><p class="indented double">Even with the Elements of Harmony augmenting their abilities, the final defenders were still losing ground. Whatever fell magic Flare had used to enhance her best lieutenants was far more powerful than the splintered Elements. Without their full number the artifacts were quite a bit weaker, and with enemy reinforcements joining the fray it was only a matter of time at this point. Leaving the four monsters to her friends, Princess Luna immediately turned and met the newcomers at the doors. She lowered her head and ran one pony through with her horn, then turned and bucked another so hard Luna snapped the mare\xe2\x80\x99s neck. Another leapt onto the Alcorn&#039;s back, sword skating uselessly against the reinforced half armor there. Luna leapt straight backwards and crushed the stallion into the wall.</p><p class="indented double">Slowly but surely, the defenders were pressed backwards, right up against the Equestrian Thrones. The five of them stood before those seats of power, refusing to give another inch of ground. Shimmer\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were glowing with pink power, mouth transfixed into a permanent scowl as she struggled to pour as much healing magic as she could into her comrades. Scratches and other minor wounds knitted themselves as fast as they appeared. Spitfire was still airborne, trying to keep other flyers from taking out Shimmer while simultaneously creating small openings in the never ending tide. Halter had retrieved a two-handed hammer from a fallen foe and worked on making himself the biggest target possible in an effort to keep them away from his team. But the weakened Elements of Harmony were quickly tiring. Each of them knew it was only going to be a matter of time.</p><p class="indented double">Princess Luna suddenly felt numerous magical signatures flaring at the same time; far too many to count. The next thing she knew, the throne room was suddenly filled with multiple flashes of light as teleports completed. The rebels found their attention divided as they were unexpectedly attacked on all sides by unicorns covered head to hoof in gleaming purple armor. Panicked cries were cut off as the purple armored ponies moved through the throne room, cutting down rebels with practiced ease. Those still alive and with their wits about them began to rapidly retreat, some even going so far as to drag their dead with them. The newcomers gave chase down the hall as even more teleports flared throughout the room. As Luna tried to catch her breath, she could only see one word emblazoned upon the armor: <i>Magickaforce</i>. The Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s elite commandos had arrived.</p><p class="indented double">One of them approached the battered Elements of Harmony, one Luna recognized. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d she greeted, bowing her head. Though the visor set in her helmet hid her face, Luna knew the badges upon the armor.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYour timing was impeccable, Knight-commander Bright Spark. A few moments more and Equestria would have fallen for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe came as soon as we could. When we discovered that the majority of Flare\xe2\x80\x99s forces were entrenched around Canterlot Palace, we knew what was going on.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m surprised you\xe2\x80\x99re here at all, to be perfectly honest. I had thought the <i>Magickaforce</i> had disappeared with their liege.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Bright Spark shook her helmeted head. \xe2\x80\x9cNot quite. However, we have been busy. Some of us were scouring the land, confirming without a doubt that she is gone. Others were in her laboratories, securing the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s inventions and research. And even more of us were busy erasing all traces of her from history, and hopefully from memory.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhatever for? What reasons do you have to do such a thing?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t decide what emotion she wanted to feel.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThose were her final orders to us. We were to make sure she was gone. We were to prevent others from finding her science, and claiming it as their own. And we were to make it appear like she had never existed in the first place. In a couple of years, Equestria will forget that there had been four Princesses ruling it, which is exactly what was planned. <i>You</i> will be hailed as the sole monarch, so that you may rebuild what was lost.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnd where will you go? Are you just going to toss aside your oaths, and return to living as normal ponies?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The Knight-commander actually laughed at that. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. We will go across the vast sea. We will take all of the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s research. Most of her inventions, that we feel most of ponykind aren\xe2\x80\x99t ready for. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll forge a new life in new lands. We will thrive. We will grow. And when our Mistress returns to the mortal plane once more, the <i>Magickaforce</i> will be ready. We will be prepared, and we will help her deal with Corona Flare for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere is no changing your mind, is there?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere is not. It has already been decided, and while we do recognize you as a leader, <i>Magickaforce</i> only answers to one Princess, and one Princess only. Two if you count her sister. Right now, however, you need to tend to your comrades. Let us deal with the last of the insurgents. The least we can do is offer you a chance to start fresh.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">As Princess Luna turned to check upon her fellow Elements of Harmony, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but reflect upon what the future would bring. She had been given a chance, a golden opportunity to remake Equestria into something even better than it had been. And she knew her deceased wife deserved that much. Whenever the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s spirit regained a mortal shell, Luna would be waiting. So would the <i>Magickaforce</i>. And so would Equestria.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'values': ['//------------------------------//\n// Back to the Past 1// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0A lone knock echoed around the spacious throne room. Princess Luna of Equestria tore her tear streaked gaze from the window and tried to compose herself.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cEnter.\xe2\x80\x9d Her voice, still laced with grief hours later, was barely above a whisper.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The ornate doors, depicting the four cutie marks of the Princesses of Equestria, opened slowly. A lone pony stepped through, one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Home Guard. The soldier carried something in his orange magic, objects that Luna recognized immediately. The once proud staff may have been splintered, the Nightsteel may have been tarnished from the rigors of war, but the glaive of the Valkyrie was still identifiable. \xe2\x80\x9cWe found this, Princess. Its the only other part of her we\xe2\x80\x99ve found, save her armor.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna\xe2\x80\x99s chest constricted painfully, and it was all she could do to prevent herself from falling into helpless sobs. \xe2\x80\x9cThen she\xe2\x80\x99s gone. She\xe2\x80\x99s truly gone\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard removed his helmet and bowed his head, echoing the sorrow of his liege. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, your highness. We did everything we could to find her and bring her back to you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna wiped her silently shed tears away almost angrily, then glanced up at the guard again. It was obvious that the Home Guard had seen some heavy, heavy fighting. Several cuts and bruises crisscrossed this one\xe2\x80\x99s face. His armor was dented and covered in a layer of grime. \xe2\x80\x9cYou should get out of here while you can. Get all of the remaining Home Guard out of Canterlot. Get away from this cursed place.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already shaking his head, lips set into a determined frown. \xe2\x80\x9cNo, princess. The Home Guard will stand with our charge, just like we have always done in ages past.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cThis is an order from your princess: Withdraw. I will not let your lives be measured against mine. Go.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already moving back towards the door, helmet sliding back into place. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re not going anywhere, Luna. We will guard the throne room. We will hold as long as we can. When those bastards break through, I hope the Home Guard will have weakened them enough for you to mop up their ilk.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The doors closed behind the guard with booming finality. Luna stared after him for several moments, before she realized he had set the remains of the weapon right next to the portal. Tears threatened to overcome her barriers yet again. When things went to Tartarus, she was the one there to keep her steady. She was the one to keep things mostly under control, battlehardened far beyond the other three Alicorns, including her sister. And now, she was gone. Her wife. Her other half. Her heart. Gone. Kindness. The mare did everything in her power to aid those less fortunate, and still wore her medical coat with pride. Pink glimmered brightly. And finally, Halt. A pony so dependable and honest he would crawl through Tartarus and back for a friend. Orange gleamed cheerfully.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna completed the fifth Element of Harmony. She was Generosity incarnate. How could she not be, with how she treated her subjects? Always spending resources from her own House to improve the lives of the average citizen, and never asking for a single thing in return. And this Element was the reason Luna\xe2\x80\x99s kingdom was on the verge of collapsing around her. With great power comes great responsibility, and her poor sister Celestia simply couldn\xe2\x80\x99t handle the power.\r\n\r\n\t"I thought I made it clear that you four should not be here." Luna\'s stern voice was slightly ruined with tears still glimmering in her eyes.\r\n\r\n\t"And I thought I had made it clear that we weren\'t going to be leaving our friend." Spitfire retorted. "Never mind the fact that she\'s a princess."\r\n\r\n\t"What\'s with all of my military personnel ignoring my orders?" The dark Alicorn demanded, exasperated.\r\n\r\n\t"Because you\'re making bad calls." Shimmer snapped. This gave Luna pause. The medical pony never talked like that. However, she rallied quickly.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIs it a bad call to want to keep those I care about safe? Is it so wrong for me to wish for no more deaths at my hooves?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t"Shimmer has a point." Halt added in his usual slow way. "Even if we could get out of Canterlot, what then? We\'d be killed long before we could reach the border. And if by some miracle we\'re not, do you expect one of the other nations to harbor known \'terrorists\'? Nay. I say we test our mettle right here, standing in defiance against the evil that plagues us."\r\n\r\n\tZecora didn\'t say anything, but then again she didn\'t have to. She was as ready for a fight as the rest of them. Luna stood there, mulling over their words. In hindsight, ordering them to abandon her and their home was a bit redundant. The sounds of fighting in the long hallway leading to the room suddenly reached her ears. She heard her Home Guard crying out in a single voice, shouting their fury to the world. Weapons clashed, magic cackled, and bodies slumped to the floor. The fighting was so very close now. Almost right on top of the closed doors. The captain of the Home Guard tried to rally his remaining ponies. His exclamation turned into a pained grunt, then cut off.
