Luna was pretty sure she recognized this voice that snarled in the face of certain death. But even then, after a solid thirty seconds, she too fell, a whispered apology upon her last breath. Her body hit the wall and fell with a dull thud.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, too, Li li, so so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d The apology from the Princess of the Night only fell on deceased ears. The other four Elements of Harmony stepped parallel to the Alicorn, faces set into grim lines and weapons at the ready. Yet, all was silent. Seconds lingered far longer than they should have. Were they preparing themselves? Did they think now, after five years of bloodshed, that they\xe2\x80\x99re quest was finally finished? Or were they waiting for a pony to react, one that was no longer with them on the mortal plane? Was there any reason at all to their twisted logic?\r\n\t\r\n\tFinally, the doors blew open, blasted clear off their hinges and sent careening into the closest walls. As the dust slowly cleared, the attackers entered the room, approaching slowly. Luna closed her eyes in sorrow.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThere they are.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve got you now, traitors.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tNo attack came. She could feel the other Elements at her side, tensing, preparing for the inevitable fight.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOpen your eyes! I want you to see the ponies that brought you to your knees, tyrant!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna ignored them. She calmed her turbulent thoughts and took deep, slow breaths.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSweet Corona Flare, look at her. Basking in the glory of her decadent deeds.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tA white hot flame burned within Luna\xe2\x80\x99s mind for the first time in days. She gulped down a shuddering breath and her eyes snapped open. There were only four of them. Flare\xe2\x80\x99s most trusted followers. Their gazes were hardened, stances battle ready. There were no traces of the decent ponies they once were. As Luna studied them, her anger rose sharply. Honestly, she did not feel sorry for these foals. As far as she was concerned, they were no longer her ponies. Just monsters.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou have no idea how much pain I am in right now. How much pain you\xe2\x80\x99ve caused me over the course of the last five years.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tOne of them stepped forward. Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t know who he had once been. His armor obscured his coat and cutie mark and his full helm hid his face. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t try to hand us that pile of filth. Everyone knows how poorly you\xe2\x80\x99ve treated us Equestrians.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tAnother moved, a mare. \xe2\x80\x9cThose five years of fighting can be laid squarely at your hooves, tyrant. If you had cared all that much you would have given up the throne to our Mistress ages ago.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cEquestrian lives lost are all your fault.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t"BE SILENT, KNAVE!" The Alicorn of the Night shook the entire castle with her voice. \xe2\x80\x9cYou are no longer Equestrians! You forfeit all claims to that distinction when you joined that usurper and waged war upon my country! And it was all for naught, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t it?! You\xe2\x80\x99ve lost, now. Your Corona Flare no longer stalks this world, and it\xe2\x80\x99ll only be a matter of time before you, too, fall.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tFor the first time, there seemed to be hesitation among the creatures arrayed before her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean? Mistress is completely fine! Merely resting after her fight with that damned Valkyrie of yours. I note that she\xe2\x80\x99s not here with you. Did she abandon you? Left you, tyrant?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tMore anger reared its head, followed by cold smugness. \xe2\x80\x9cMy wife took your damn Mistress with her. Have you not felt it yet? Your powers slowly diminishing, your every step weakened? It is because the catalyst for your magic is gone. Gone for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThere was a shivering beat of icy silence. \xe2\x80\x9cYou lie! Attack! Kill them! Kill them all!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe stallion who had stepped forward earlier led the charge, and the remaining Elements of Harmony moved to meet it head on. The first foe crashed directly into Halt, the stoic earth pony a solid wall of muscle and bristling steel. The Element of Honesty flared bright orange, encasing its owner in a faint glow. Spells fizzled against the protection not a single moment later, rebounding in random directions. Spitfire was next into the fray, leaping and diving above her grounded enemies. Loyalty offered its power to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s wings, turning the already formidable pegasus into a winged terror. Zecora found herself engaging two enemies at once, even as Laughter muddled their senses. And the medic Shimmer found her attention divided as she struggled to keep healing and energizing magic pumping into her allies. Watching the ponies she loved almost as much as her wife fighting for their continued freedom, something inside the dark princess snapped. Her willpower hardened, and then she charged into the battle herself even as more rebels charged up the corridor leading to the throne room.\r\n\t\r\n\tEven with the Elements of Harmony augmenting their abilities, the final defenders were still losing ground. Whatever fell magic Flare had used to enhance her best lieutenants was far more powerful than the splintered Elements. Without their full number the artifacts were quite a bit weaker, and with enemy reinforcements joining the fray it was only a matter of time at this point. Leaving the four monsters to her friends, Princess Luna immediately turned and met the newcomers at the doors. She lowered her head and ran one pony through with her horn, then turned and bucked another so hard Luna snapped the mare\xe2\x80\x99s neck. Another leapt onto the Alcorn\'s back, sword skating uselessly against the reinforced half armor there. Luna leapt straight backwards and crushed the stallion into the wall.\r\n\t\r\n\tSlowly but surely, the defenders were pressed backwards, right up against the Equestrian Thrones. The five of them stood before those seats of power, refusing to give another inch of ground. Shimmer\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were glowing with pink power, mouth transfixed into a permanent scowl as she struggled to pour as much healing magic as she could into her comrades. Scratches and other minor wounds knitted themselves as fast as they appeared. Spitfire was still airborne, trying to keep other flyers from taking out Shimmer while simultaneously creating small openings in the never ending tide. Halter had retrieved a two-handed hammer from a fallen foe and worked on making himself the biggest target possible in an effort to keep them away from his team. But the weakened Elements of Harmony were quickly tiring. Each of them knew it was only going to be a matter of time.\r\n\t\r\n\tPrincess Luna suddenly felt numerous magical signatures flaring at the same time; far too many to count. The next thing she knew, the throne room was suddenly filled with multiple flashes of light as teleports completed. The rebels found their attention divided as they were unexpectedly attacked on all sides by unicorns covered head to hoof in gleaming purple armor. Panicked cries were cut off as the purple armored ponies moved through the throne room, cutting down rebels with practiced ease. Those still alive and with their wits about them began to rapidly retreat, some even going so far as to drag their dead with them. The newcomers gave chase down the hall as even more teleports flared throughout the room. As Luna tried to catch her breath, she could only see one word emblazoned upon the armor: Magickaforce. The Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s elite commandos had arrived.\r\n\t\r\n\tOne of them approached the battered Elements of Harmony, one Luna recognized. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d she greeted, bowing her head. Though the visor set in her helmet hid her face, Luna knew the badges upon the armor.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYour timing was impeccable, Knight-commander Bright Spark. A few moments more and Equestria would have fallen for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWe came as soon as we could. When we discovered that the majority of Flare\xe2\x80\x99s forces were entrenched around Canterlot Palace, we knew what was going on.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m surprised you\xe2\x80\x99re here at all, to be perfectly honest. I had thought the Magickaforce had disappeared with their liege.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tBright Spark shook her helmeted head. \xe2\x80\x9cNot quite. However, we have been busy. Some of us were scouring the land, confirming without a doubt that she is gone. Others were in her laboratories, securing the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s inventions and research. And even more of us were busy erasing all traces of her from history, and hopefully from memory.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhatever for? What reasons do you have to do such a thing?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t decide what emotion she wanted to feel.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThose were her final orders to us. We were to make sure she was gone. We were to prevent others from finding her science, and claiming it as their own. And we were to make it appear like she had never existed in the first place. In a couple of years, Equestria will forget that there had been four Princesses ruling it, which is exactly what was planned. You will be hailed as the sole monarch, so that you may rebuild what was lost.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAnd where will you go? Are you just going to toss aside your oaths, and return to living as normal ponies?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe Knight-commander actually laughed at that. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. We will go across the vast sea. We will take all of the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s research. Most of her inventions, that we feel most of ponykind aren\xe2\x80\x99t ready for. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll forge a new life in new lands. We will thrive. We will grow. And when our Mistress returns to the mortal plane once more, the Magickaforce will be ready. We will be prepared, and we will help her deal with Corona Flare for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThere is no changing your mind, is there?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThere is not. It has already been decided, and while we do recognize you as a leader, Magickaforce only answers to one Princess, and one Princess only. Two if you count her sister. Right now, however, you need to tend to your comrades. Let us deal with the last of the insurgents. The least we can do is offer you a chance to start fresh.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tAs Princess Luna turned to check upon her fellow Elements of Harmony, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but reflect upon what the future would bring. She had been given a chance, a golden opportunity to remake Equestria into something even better than it had been. And she knew her deceased wife deserved that much. Whenever the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s spirit regained a mortal shell, Luna would be waiting. So would the Magickaforce. And so would Equestria.\r\n', 10, 713022, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/104188/valkyrie">Valkyrie</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Flicka+Ravenhide">Flicka Ravenhide</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'10\'></a><h3>Back to the Past 1</h3>\n<p>\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0A lone knock echoed around the spacious throne room. Princess Luna of Equestria tore her tear streaked gaze from the window and tried to compose herself.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cEnter.\xe2\x80\x9d Her voice, still laced with grief hours later, was barely above a whisper.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The ornate doors, depicting the four cutie marks of the Princesses of Equestria, opened slowly. A lone pony stepped through, one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Home Guard. The soldier carried something in his orange magic, objects that Luna recognized immediately. The once proud staff may have been splintered, the <i>Nightsteel</i> may have been tarnished from the rigors of war, but the glaive of the Valkyrie was still identifiable. \xe2\x80\x9cWe found this, Princess. Its the only other part of her we\xe2\x80\x99ve found, save her armor.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna\xe2\x80\x99s chest constricted painfully, and it was all she could do to prevent herself from falling into helpless sobs. \xe2\x80\x9cThen she\xe2\x80\x99s gone. She\xe2\x80\x99s truly gone\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard removed his helmet and bowed his head, echoing the sorrow of his liege. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, your highness. We did everything we could to find her and bring her back to you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna wiped her silently shed tears away almost angrily, then glanced up at the guard again. It was obvious that the Home Guard had seen some heavy, heavy fighting. Several cuts and bruises crisscrossed this one\xe2\x80\x99s face. His armor was dented and covered in a layer of grime. \xe2\x80\x9cYou should get out of here while you can. Get all of the remaining Home Guard out of Canterlot. Get away from this cursed place.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already shaking his head, lips set into a determined frown. \xe2\x80\x9cNo, princess. The Home Guard will stand with our charge, just like we have always done in ages past.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cThis is an order from your princess: Withdraw. I will not let your lives be measured against mine. Go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already moving back towards the door, helmet sliding back into place. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re not going anywhere, Luna. We will guard the throne room. We will hold as long as we can. When those bastards break through, I hope the Home Guard will have weakened them enough for you to mop up their ilk.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The doors closed behind the guard with booming finality. Luna stared after him for several moments, before she realized he had set the remains of the weapon right next to the portal. Tears threatened to overcome her barriers yet again. When things went to Tartarus, <i>she</i> was the one there to keep her steady. <i>She</i> was the one to keep things mostly under control, battlehardened far beyond the other three Alicorns, including her sister. And now, she was gone. Her wife. Her other half. Her heart. Gone. There was a slight movement from behind Princess Luna, and she turned slowly.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0There, standing proud as ever, were her four closest friends in the world. They were all making preparations, more than ready to stand with the last Princess of the Equestrian Crown. Captain Spitfire. Loyalty. Leader of the Wonderbolts fighting force and one of the most powerful pegasi to date. The physical embodiment of Loyalty hung about her neck, glinting blood red and shaped like her cutie mark. Zecora. Laughter. For being an unparalleled spymaster, the zebra had an astounding sense of humor and always took the opportunity to make others laugh. Sky blue graced her neck. Then came Shimmer. Kindness. The mare did everything in her power to aid those less fortunate, and still wore her medical coat with pride. Pink glimmered brightly. And finally, Halt. A pony so dependable and honest he would crawl through Tartarus and back for a friend. Orange gleamed cheerfully.</p><p class="double">\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna completed the fifth Element of Harmony. She was Generosity incarnate. How could she not be, with how she treated her subjects? Always spending resources from her own House to improve the lives of the average citizen, and never asking for a single thing in return. Dark purple shined against her black coat, right below her torc. The only Element missing was Magic. And this Element was the reason Luna\xe2\x80\x99s kingdom was on the verge of collapsing around her. With great power comes great responsibility, and her poor sister Celestia simply couldn\xe2\x80\x99t handle the power.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;I thought I made it clear that you four should not be here.&quot; Luna&#039;s stern voice was slightly ruined with tears still glimmering in her eyes.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;And I thought I had made it clear that we weren&#039;t going to be leaving our friend.&quot; Spitfire retorted. &quot;Never mind the fact that she&#039;s a princess.&quot;</p><p class="indented double">&quot;What&#039;s with all of my military personnel ignoring my orders?&quot; The dark Alicorn demanded, exasperated.</p><p class="indented double">&quot;Because you&#039;re making bad calls.&quot; Shimmer snapped. This gave Luna pause. The medical pony never talked like that. However, she rallied quickly.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIs it a bad call to want to keep those I care about safe? Is it so wrong for me to wish for no more deaths at my hooves?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">&quot;Shimmer has a point.&quot; Halt added in his usual slow way. &quot;Even if we could get out of Canterlot, what then? We&#039;d be killed long before we could reach the border. And if by some miracle we&#039;re not, do you expect one of the other nations to harbor known &#039;terrorists&#039;? Nay. I say we test our mettle right here, standing in defiance against the evil that plagues us.&quot;</p><p class="indented double">Zecora didn&#039;t say anything, but then again she didn&#039;t have to. She was as ready for a fight as the rest of them. Luna stood there, mulling over their words. In hindsight, ordering them to abandon her and their home <i>was</i> a bit redundant. The sounds of fighting in the long hallway leading to the room suddenly reached her ears. She heard her Home Guard crying out in a single voice, shouting their fury to the world. Weapons clashed, magic cackled, and bodies slumped to the floor. The fighting was so very close now. Almost right on top of the closed doors. The captain of the Home Guard tried to rally his remaining ponies. His exclamation turned into a pained grunt, then cut off. Hooves beat a staccato upon marble as the sole survivor charged her enemies, shouting her patriotic fervor. For just a moment, this single pony held the line by herself. Luna was pretty sure she recognized this voice that snarled in the face of certain death. But even then, after a solid thirty seconds, she too fell, a whispered apology upon her last breath. Her body hit the wall and fell with a dull thud.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, too, Li li, so so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d The apology from the Princess of the Night only fell on deceased ears. The other four Elements of Harmony stepped parallel to the Alicorn, faces set into grim lines and weapons at the ready. Yet, all was silent. Seconds lingered far longer than they should have. Were they preparing themselves? Did they think now, after five years of bloodshed, that they\xe2\x80\x99re quest was finally finished? Or were they waiting for a pony to react, one that was no longer with them on the mortal plane? Was there any reason at all to their twisted logic?</p><p class="indented double">Finally, the doors blew open, blasted clear off their hinges and sent careening into the closest walls. As the dust slowly cleared, the attackers entered the room, approaching slowly. Luna closed her eyes in sorrow.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere they are.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve got you now, traitors.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">No attack came. She could feel the other Elements at her side, tensing, preparing for the inevitable fight.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cOpen your eyes! I want you to see the ponies that brought you to your knees, tyrant!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Luna ignored them. She calmed her turbulent thoughts and took deep, slow breaths.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cSweet Corona Flare, look at her. Basking in the glory of her decadent deeds.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">A white hot flame burned within Luna\xe2\x80\x99s mind for the first time in days. She gulped down a shuddering breath and her eyes snapped open. There were only four of them. Flare\xe2\x80\x99s most trusted followers. Their gazes were hardened, stances battle ready. There were no traces of the decent ponies they once were. As Luna studied them, her anger rose sharply. Honestly, she did not feel sorry for these foals. As far as she was concerned, they were no longer her ponies. Just monsters.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou have no idea how much pain I am in right now. How much pain you\xe2\x80\x99ve caused me over the course of the last five years.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">One of them stepped forward. Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t know who he had once been. His armor obscured his coat and cutie mark and his full helm hid his face. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t try to hand us that pile of filth. Everyone knows how poorly you\xe2\x80\x99ve treated us Equestrians.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Another moved, a mare. \xe2\x80\x9cThose five years of fighting can be laid squarely at your hooves, tyrant. If you had cared all that much you would have given up the throne to our Mistress ages ago.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cEquestrian lives lost are all your fault.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">&quot;<i><b>BE SILENT, KNAVE!</i></b>&quot; The Alicorn of the Night shook the entire castle with her voice. \xe2\x80\x9c<i><b>You are no longer Equestrians! You forfeit all claims to that distinction when you joined that usurper and waged war upon my country!</i></b> And it was all for naught, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t it?! You\xe2\x80\x99ve lost, now. Your Corona Flare no longer stalks this world, and it\xe2\x80\x99ll only be a matter of time before you, too, fall.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">For the first time, there seemed to be hesitation among the creatures arrayed before her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean? Mistress is completely fine! Merely resting after her fight with that damned Valkyrie of yours. I note that she\xe2\x80\x99s not here with you. Did she abandon you? Left you, tyrant?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">More anger reared its head, followed by cold smugness. \xe2\x80\x9cMy wife took your damn Mistress with her. Have you not felt it yet? Your powers slowly diminishing, your every step weakened? It is because the catalyst for your magic is gone. Gone for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">There was a shivering beat of icy silence. \xe2\x80\x9cYou lie! Attack! Kill them! Kill them all!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The stallion who had stepped forward earlier led the charge, and the remaining Elements of Harmony moved to meet it head on. The first foe crashed directly into Halt, the stoic earth pony a solid wall of muscle and bristling steel. The Element of Honesty flared bright orange, encasing its owner in a faint glow. Spells fizzled against the protection not a single moment later, rebounding in random directions. Spitfire was next into the fray, leaping and diving above her grounded enemies. Loyalty offered its power to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s wings, turning the already formidable pegasus into a winged terror. Zecora found herself engaging two enemies at once, even as Laughter muddled their senses. And the medic Shimmer found her attention divided as she struggled to keep healing and energizing magic pumping into her allies. Watching the ponies she loved almost as much as her wife fighting for their continued freedom, something inside the dark princess snapped. Her willpower hardened, and then she charged into the battle herself even as more rebels charged up the corridor leading to the throne room.</p><p class="indented double">Even with the Elements of Harmony augmenting their abilities, the final defenders were still losing ground. Whatever fell magic Flare had used to enhance her best lieutenants was far more powerful than the splintered Elements. Without their full number the artifacts were quite a bit weaker, and with enemy reinforcements joining the fray it was only a matter of time at this point. Leaving the four monsters to her friends, Princess Luna immediately turned and met the newcomers at the doors. She lowered her head and ran one pony through with her horn, then turned and bucked another so hard Luna snapped the mare\xe2\x80\x99s neck. Another leapt onto the Alcorn&#039;s back, sword skating uselessly against the reinforced half armor there. Luna leapt straight backwards and crushed the stallion into the wall.</p><p class="indented double">Slowly but surely, the defenders were pressed backwards, right up against the Equestrian Thrones. The five of them stood before those seats of power, refusing to give another inch of ground. Shimmer\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were glowing with pink power, mouth transfixed into a permanent scowl as she struggled to pour as much healing magic as she could into her comrades. Scratches and other minor wounds knitted themselves as fast as they appeared. Spitfire was still airborne, trying to keep other flyers from taking out Shimmer while simultaneously creating small openings in the never ending tide. Halter had retrieved a two-handed hammer from a fallen foe and worked on making himself the biggest target possible in an effort to keep them away from his team. But the weakened Elements of Harmony were quickly tiring. Each of them knew it was only going to be a matter of time.</p><p class="indented double">Princess Luna suddenly felt numerous magical signatures flaring at the same time; far too many to count. The next thing she knew, the throne room was suddenly filled with multiple flashes of light as teleports completed. The rebels found their attention divided as they were unexpectedly attacked on all sides by unicorns covered head to hoof in gleaming purple armor. Panicked cries were cut off as the purple armored ponies moved through the throne room, cutting down rebels with practiced ease. Those still alive and with their wits about them began to rapidly retreat, some even going so far as to drag their dead with them. The newcomers gave chase down the hall as even more teleports flared throughout the room. As Luna tried to catch her breath, she could only see one word emblazoned upon the armor: <i>Magickaforce</i>. The Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s elite commandos had arrived.</p><p class="indented double">One of them approached the battered Elements of Harmony, one Luna recognized. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d she greeted, bowing her head. Though the visor set in her helmet hid her face, Luna knew the badges upon the armor.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cYour timing was impeccable, Knight-commander Bright Spark. A few moments more and Equestria would have fallen for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe came as soon as we could. When we discovered that the majority of Flare\xe2\x80\x99s forces were entrenched around Canterlot Palace, we knew what was going on.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m surprised you\xe2\x80\x99re here at all, to be perfectly honest. I had thought the <i>Magickaforce</i> had disappeared with their liege.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Bright Spark shook her helmeted head. \xe2\x80\x9cNot quite. However, we have been busy. Some of us were scouring the land, confirming without a doubt that she is gone. Others were in her laboratories, securing the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s inventions and research. And even more of us were busy erasing all traces of her from history, and hopefully from memory.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhatever for? What reasons do you have to do such a thing?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t decide what emotion she wanted to feel.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThose were her final orders to us. We were to make sure she was gone. We were to prevent others from finding her science, and claiming it as their own. And we were to make it appear like she had never existed in the first place. In a couple of years, Equestria will forget that there had been four Princesses ruling it, which is exactly what was planned. <i>You</i> will be hailed as the sole monarch, so that you may rebuild what was lost.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnd where will you go? Are you just going to toss aside your oaths, and return to living as normal ponies?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">The Knight-commander actually laughed at that. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. We will go across the vast sea. We will take all of the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s research. Most of her inventions, that we feel most of ponykind aren\xe2\x80\x99t ready for. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll forge a new life in new lands. We will thrive. We will grow. And when our Mistress returns to the mortal plane once more, the <i>Magickaforce</i> will be ready. We will be prepared, and we will help her deal with Corona Flare for good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere is no changing your mind, is there?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThere is not. It has already been decided, and while we do recognize you as a leader, <i>Magickaforce</i> only answers to one Princess, and one Princess only. Two if you count her sister. Right now, however, you need to tend to your comrades. Let us deal with the last of the insurgents. The least we can do is offer you a chance to start fresh.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">As Princess Luna turned to check upon her fellow Elements of Harmony, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but reflect upon what the future would bring. She had been given a chance, a golden opportunity to remake Equestria into something even better than it had been. And she knew her deceased wife deserved that much. Whenever the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s spirit regained a mortal shell, Luna would be waiting. So would the <i>Magickaforce</i>. And so would Equestria.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 104188], 'parent_story_id': 104188, 'txt': '//------------------------------//\n// Back to the Past 1// Story: Valkyrie// by Flicka Ravenhide//------------------------------//\n\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0A lone knock echoed around the spacious throne room. Princess Luna of Equestria tore her tear streaked gaze from the window and tried to compose herself.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cEnter.\xe2\x80\x9d Her voice, still laced with grief hours later, was barely above a whisper.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The ornate doors, depicting the four cutie marks of the Princesses of Equestria, opened slowly. A lone pony stepped through, one of Luna\xe2\x80\x99s Home Guard. The soldier carried something in his orange magic, objects that Luna recognized immediately. The once proud staff may have been splintered, the Nightsteel may have been tarnished from the rigors of war, but the glaive of the Valkyrie was still identifiable. \xe2\x80\x9cWe found this, Princess. Its the only other part of her we\xe2\x80\x99ve found, save her armor.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna\xe2\x80\x99s chest constricted painfully, and it was all she could do to prevent herself from falling into helpless sobs. \xe2\x80\x9cThen she\xe2\x80\x99s gone. She\xe2\x80\x99s truly gone\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard removed his helmet and bowed his head, echoing the sorrow of his liege. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, your highness. We did everything we could to find her and bring her back to you.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna wiped her silently shed tears away almost angrily, then glanced up at the guard again. It was obvious that the Home Guard had seen some heavy, heavy fighting. Several cuts and bruises crisscrossed this one\xe2\x80\x99s face. His armor was dented and covered in a layer of grime. \xe2\x80\x9cYou should get out of here while you can. Get all of the remaining Home Guard out of Canterlot. Get away from this cursed place.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already shaking his head, lips set into a determined frown. \xe2\x80\x9cNo, princess. The Home Guard will stand with our charge, just like we have always done in ages past.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cThis is an order from your princess: Withdraw. I will not let your lives be measured against mine. Go.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The guard was already moving back towards the door, helmet sliding back into place. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re not going anywhere, Luna. We will guard the throne room. We will hold as long as we can. When those bastards break through, I hope the Home Guard will have weakened them enough for you to mop up their ilk.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The doors closed behind the guard with booming finality. Luna stared after him for several moments, before she realized he had set the remains of the weapon right next to the portal. Tears threatened to overcome her barriers yet again. When things went to Tartarus, she was the one there to keep her steady. She was the one to keep things mostly under control, battlehardened far beyond the other three Alicorns, including her sister. And now, she was gone. Her wife. Her other half. Her heart. Gone. There was a slight movement from behind Princess Luna, and she turned slowly.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0There, standing proud as ever, were her four closest friends in the world. They were all making preparations, more than ready to stand with the last Princess of the Equestrian Crown. Captain Spitfire. Loyalty. Leader of the Wonderbolts fighting force and one of the most powerful pegasi to date. The physical embodiment of Loyalty hung about her neck, glinting blood red and shaped like her cutie mark. Zecora. Laughter. For being an unparalleled spymaster, the zebra had an astounding sense of humor and always took the opportunity to make others laugh. Sky blue graced her neck. Then came Shimmer. Kindness. The mare did everything in her power to aid those less fortunate, and still wore her medical coat with pride. Pink glimmered brightly. And finally, Halt. A pony so dependable and honest he would crawl through Tartarus and back for a friend. Orange gleamed cheerfully.\r\n\r\n\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Luna completed the fifth Element of Harmony. She was Generosity incarnate. How could she not be, with how she treated her subjects? Always spending resources from her own House to improve the lives of the average citizen, and never asking for a single thing in return. Dark purple shined against her black coat, right below her torc. The only Element missing was Magic. And this Element was the reason Luna\xe2\x80\x99s kingdom was on the verge of collapsing around her. With great power comes great responsibility, and her poor sister Celestia simply couldn\xe2\x80\x99t handle the power.\r\n\r\n\t"I thought I made it clear that you four should not be here." Luna\'s stern voice was slightly ruined with tears still glimmering in her eyes.\r\n\r\n\t"And I thought I had made it clear that we weren\'t going to be leaving our friend." Spitfire retorted. "Never mind the fact that she\'s a princess."\r\n\r\n\t"What\'s with all of my military personnel ignoring my orders?" The dark Alicorn demanded, exasperated.\r\n\r\n\t"Because you\'re making bad calls." Shimmer snapped. This gave Luna pause. The medical pony never talked like that. However, she rallied quickly.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIs it a bad call to want to keep those I care about safe? Is it so wrong for me to wish for no more deaths at my hooves?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\r\n\t"Shimmer has a point." Halt added in his usual slow way. "Even if we could get out of Canterlot, what then? We\'d be killed long before we could reach the border. And if by some miracle we\'re not, do you expect one of the other nations to harbor known \'terrorists\'? Nay. I say we test our mettle right here, standing in defiance against the evil that plagues us."\r\n\r\n\tZecora didn\'t say anything, but then again she didn\'t have to. She was as ready for a fight as the rest of them. Luna stood there, mulling over their words. In hindsight, ordering them to abandon her and their home was a bit redundant. The sounds of fighting in the long hallway leading to the room suddenly reached her ears. She heard her Home Guard crying out in a single voice, shouting their fury to the world. Weapons clashed, magic cackled, and bodies slumped to the floor. The fighting was so very close now. Almost right on top of the closed doors. The captain of the Home Guard tried to rally his remaining ponies. His exclamation turned into a pained grunt, then cut off. Hooves beat a staccato upon marble as the sole survivor charged her enemies, shouting her patriotic fervor. For just a moment, this single pony held the line by herself. Luna was pretty sure she recognized this voice that snarled in the face of certain death. But even then, after a solid thirty seconds, she too fell, a whispered apology upon her last breath. Her body hit the wall and fell with a dull thud.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, too, Li li, so so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d The apology from the Princess of the Night only fell on deceased ears. The other four Elements of Harmony stepped parallel to the Alicorn, faces set into grim lines and weapons at the ready. Yet, all was silent. Seconds lingered far longer than they should have. Were they preparing themselves? Did they think now, after five years of bloodshed, that they\xe2\x80\x99re quest was finally finished? Or were they waiting for a pony to react, one that was no longer with them on the mortal plane? Was there any reason at all to their twisted logic?\r\n\t\r\n\tFinally, the doors blew open, blasted clear off their hinges and sent careening into the closest walls. As the dust slowly cleared, the attackers entered the room, approaching slowly. Luna closed her eyes in sorrow.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThere they are.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve got you now, traitors.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tNo attack came. She could feel the other Elements at her side, tensing, preparing for the inevitable fight.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOpen your eyes! I want you to see the ponies that brought you to your knees, tyrant!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tLuna ignored them. She calmed her turbulent thoughts and took deep, slow breaths.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cSweet Corona Flare, look at her. Basking in the glory of her decadent deeds.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tA white hot flame burned within Luna\xe2\x80\x99s mind for the first time in days. She gulped down a shuddering breath and her eyes snapped open. There were only four of them. Flare\xe2\x80\x99s most trusted followers. Their gazes were hardened, stances battle ready. There were no traces of the decent ponies they once were. As Luna studied them, her anger rose sharply. Honestly, she did not feel sorry for these foals. As far as she was concerned, they were no longer her ponies. Just monsters.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou have no idea how much pain I am in right now. How much pain you\xe2\x80\x99ve caused me over the course of the last five years.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tOne of them stepped forward. Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t know who he had once been. His armor obscured his coat and cutie mark and his full helm hid his face. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t try to hand us that pile of filth. Everyone knows how poorly you\xe2\x80\x99ve treated us Equestrians.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tAnother moved, a mare. \xe2\x80\x9cThose five years of fighting can be laid squarely at your hooves, tyrant. If you had cared all that much you would have given up the throne to our Mistress ages ago.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cEquestrian lives lost are all your fault.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t"BE SILENT, KNAVE!" The Alicorn of the Night shook the entire castle with her voice. \xe2\x80\x9cYou are no longer Equestrians! You forfeit all claims to that distinction when you joined that usurper and waged war upon my country! And it was all for naught, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t it?! You\xe2\x80\x99ve lost, now. Your Corona Flare no longer stalks this world, and it\xe2\x80\x99ll only be a matter of time before you, too, fall.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tFor the first time, there seemed to be hesitation among the creatures arrayed before her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you mean? Mistress is completely fine! Merely resting after her fight with that damned Valkyrie of yours. I note that she\xe2\x80\x99s not here with you. Did she abandon you? Left you, tyrant?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tMore anger reared its head, followed by cold smugness. \xe2\x80\x9cMy wife took your damn Mistress with her. Have you not felt it yet? Your powers slowly diminishing, your every step weakened? It is because the catalyst for your magic is gone. Gone for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThere was a shivering beat of icy silence. \xe2\x80\x9cYou lie! Attack! Kill them! Kill them all!\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe stallion who had stepped forward earlier led the charge, and the remaining Elements of Harmony moved to meet it head on. The first foe crashed directly into Halt, the stoic earth pony a solid wall of muscle and bristling steel. The Element of Honesty flared bright orange, encasing its owner in a faint glow. Spells fizzled against the protection not a single moment later, rebounding in random directions. Spitfire was next into the fray, leaping and diving above her grounded enemies. Loyalty offered its power to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s wings, turning the already formidable pegasus into a winged terror. Zecora found herself engaging two enemies at once, even as Laughter muddled their senses. And the medic Shimmer found her attention divided as she struggled to keep healing and energizing magic pumping into her allies. Watching the ponies she loved almost as much as her wife fighting for their continued freedom, something inside the dark princess snapped. Her willpower hardened, and then she charged into the battle herself even as more rebels charged up the corridor leading to the throne room.\r\n\t\r\n\tEven with the Elements of Harmony augmenting their abilities, the final defenders were still losing ground. Whatever fell magic Flare had used to enhance her best lieutenants was far more powerful than the splintered Elements. Without their full number the artifacts were quite a bit weaker, and with enemy reinforcements joining the fray it was only a matter of time at this point. Leaving the four monsters to her friends, Princess Luna immediately turned and met the newcomers at the doors. She lowered her head and ran one pony through with her horn, then turned and bucked another so hard Luna snapped the mare\xe2\x80\x99s neck. Another leapt onto the Alcorn\'s back, sword skating uselessly against the reinforced half armor there. Luna leapt straight backwards and crushed the stallion into the wall.\r\n\t\r\n\tSlowly but surely, the defenders were pressed backwards, right up against the Equestrian Thrones. The five of them stood before those seats of power, refusing to give another inch of ground. Shimmer\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were glowing with pink power, mouth transfixed into a permanent scowl as she struggled to pour as much healing magic as she could into her comrades. Scratches and other minor wounds knitted themselves as fast as they appeared. Spitfire was still airborne, trying to keep other flyers from taking out Shimmer while simultaneously creating small openings in the never ending tide. Halter had retrieved a two-handed hammer from a fallen foe and worked on making himself the biggest target possible in an effort to keep them away from his team. But the weakened Elements of Harmony were quickly tiring. Each of them knew it was only going to be a matter of time.\r\n\t\r\n\tPrincess Luna suddenly felt numerous magical signatures flaring at the same time; far too many to count. The next thing she knew, the throne room was suddenly filled with multiple flashes of light as teleports completed. The rebels found their attention divided as they were unexpectedly attacked on all sides by unicorns covered head to hoof in gleaming purple armor. Panicked cries were cut off as the purple armored ponies moved through the throne room, cutting down rebels with practiced ease. Those still alive and with their wits about them began to rapidly retreat, some even going so far as to drag their dead with them. The newcomers gave chase down the hall as even more teleports flared throughout the room. As Luna tried to catch her breath, she could only see one word emblazoned upon the armor: Magickaforce. The Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s elite commandos had arrived.\r\n\t\r\n\tOne of them approached the battered Elements of Harmony, one Luna recognized. \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d she greeted, bowing her head. Though the visor set in her helmet hid her face, Luna knew the badges upon the armor.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYour timing was impeccable, Knight-commander Bright Spark. A few moments more and Equestria would have fallen for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWe came as soon as we could. When we discovered that the majority of Flare\xe2\x80\x99s forces were entrenched around Canterlot Palace, we knew what was going on.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m surprised you\xe2\x80\x99re here at all, to be perfectly honest. I had thought the Magickaforce had disappeared with their liege.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tBright Spark shook her helmeted head. \xe2\x80\x9cNot quite. However, we have been busy. Some of us were scouring the land, confirming without a doubt that she is gone. Others were in her laboratories, securing the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s inventions and research. And even more of us were busy erasing all traces of her from history, and hopefully from memory.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhatever for? What reasons do you have to do such a thing?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna couldn\xe2\x80\x99t decide what emotion she wanted to feel.\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThose were her final orders to us. We were to make sure she was gone. We were to prevent others from finding her science, and claiming it as their own. And we were to make it appear like she had never existed in the first place. In a couple of years, Equestria will forget that there had been four Princesses ruling it, which is exactly what was planned. You will be hailed as the sole monarch, so that you may rebuild what was lost.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAnd where will you go? Are you just going to toss aside your oaths, and return to living as normal ponies?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tThe Knight-commander actually laughed at that. \xe2\x80\x9cNo. We will go across the vast sea. We will take all of the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s research. Most of her inventions, that we feel most of ponykind aren\xe2\x80\x99t ready for. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll forge a new life in new lands. We will thrive. We will grow. And when our Mistress returns to the mortal plane once more, the Magickaforce will be ready. We will be prepared, and we will help her deal with Corona Flare for good.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThere is no changing your mind, is there?\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThere is not. It has already been decided, and while we do recognize you as a leader, Magickaforce only answers to one Princess, and one Princess only. Two if you count her sister. Right now, however, you need to tend to your comrades. Let us deal with the last of the insurgents. The least we can do is offer you a chance to start fresh.\xe2\x80\x9d\r\n\t\r\n\tAs Princess Luna turned to check upon her fellow Elements of Harmony, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but reflect upon what the future would bring. She had been given a chance, a golden opportunity to remake Equestria into something even better than it had been. And she knew her deceased wife deserved that much. Whenever the Valkyrie\xe2\x80\x99s spirit regained a mortal shell, Luna would be waiting. So would the Magickaforce. And so would Equestria.\r\n', 'epub': None}

2015-02-23 12:03:29,710 - DEBUG - {'version': 1, 'chapter_number': 1, 'fields': ['chapter_text', 'chapter_number', 'parent_chapter_id', 'chapter_html', 'version', 'parent_story_id'], 'chapter_to_insert': {'chapter_text': '//------------------------------//\n// Accolade// Story: Accolade// by Cereal Velocity//------------------------------//\n\nYour heart is my pi\xc3\xb1ata.\nChuck Palahniuk\n\t\t\nAsking for help was not something the Great and Powerful Trixie was used to doing. Well, that and brushing her mane in the morning. It was always in perfect condition, of course, but nopony believed her when she tried to tell them that.\n\nIt had been fun cavorting around Equestria for a few months, surely. She had had her fair share of fun, her fair share of adventure, and her fair share of pretty fillies claiming that they had never been so attracted to another mare in their life. She had performed for all manner of audiences; large and small, crowds of few and throngs of many. She had entertained entire cities and crowded bars, swarming parks and huge stadiums. She had done her dazzling magic for every type, from the most humble earth pony to powerful government officials and the greatest unicorn magicians- though, clearly, they were not as great as herself. She had truly seen it all in the eventful months since her failed show at Ponyville.\n\nAnd, yet, during her travels, something always nagged her from the back of her mind. Something that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t go away, no matter how many other mares she slept with or tricks she performed. It was something that she had never experienced in her life, and thought she never would. The problem was purple, had a star for a cutie mark, and had simply delicious lavender eyes.\n\nTrixie blinked at the stray thought. They were most certainly not delicious. How ridiculous.\n\nNevertheless, her encounter with Twilight had most definitely irked her. In her one, rare moment of weakness, she had been shown up. Unthinkable. \n\nAt first, she had been depressed about the whole affair. After that, she had tried to ignore it. When that didn\xe2\x80\x99t work, she tried to distract herself with her performances. She put on the most impressive shows she had ever come up with since she had become a performer- shows that would have impressed the god queen rulers of Equestria themselves- and yet despite her brilliance, there still remained that nagging doubt that refused to leave her alone. She had even, after a few too many drinks one particular night, though about having a child with the preposterously pretty pony. She still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure where that idea had come from, nor if it was even physically possible.\n\nIt was her insatiable desire to rid herself of this nuisance that had led Trixie to the very doors of the Canterlot Royal Castle. \n\nEverypony had heard about Nightmare Moon\xe2\x80\x99s defeat at the hooves of Twilight and the five ponies in her company. Trixie had been surprised that none of them had drawn the obvious conclusion about the encounter- that perhaps Luna wasn\xe2\x80\x99t so thrilled to have been brought down so easily. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t prove it, but it was all she had to go on.\n\nGetting past the perimeter guards to her castle hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been easy, nor had the trip up to Canterlot been trivial, but she knew that there was at least one pony that could help her, and that she lay inside these walls. She was her only hope- and Trixie hoped she could convince her to help.\n\nTaking a deep, dramatic breath, she knocked on the massive doors with a hoof.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nLuna tossed aside another crumpled piece of parchment into the growing pile next to her. Who would have thought getting revenge on your enemies could be so much work?\n\nAnd it was, of course, revenge that she wanted. Strangely, it had not occurred to her to begin planning such a thing during her imprisonment on the moon. It was only after she had returned to Equestria that she had begun to consider such things, and it was turning out to be far more difficult than she had anticipated. Perhaps, she thought, looking past her mountain of ill-formed plans at the moon outside, I shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have spent all that time dancing.\n\nTo tell the truth, the whole Nightmare Moon thing had been a last-minute effort. It had almost worked, too, except for that insufferable purple unicorn and her little gaggle ruining everything with their magic tricks. Just thinking about her made Luna\xe2\x80\x99s blood boil. That whole escapade had just been embarrassing. Only her quick thinking and fake tears when her sister had shown up had salvaged the situation and made her look like a victim instead of a laughingstock. \n\nLuna looked at the paper in front of her, entitled The Celestia-pult. She lidded her eyes. This was hopeless. Maybe it was time to turn her attention to getting rid of Celestia\xe2\x80\x99s prized student instead of her- go for a psychological blow instead of a physical one. Surely that would make things easier.\n\nAnd yet, still, nothing came to mind. For all Luna\xe2\x80\x99s taunting and all her posturing during her attempted takeover, the small unicorn she had fell to was indeed very powerful- and she had been tutored by her sister, no less. Even taking that into account, if it were discovered that Luna had been the one responsible for the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s untimely death, she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t just be banished to the moon this time. At the very least, she would end up with egg on her face again, and she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t afford that. Not again.\n\nShe would clearly need help to pull this off. The trouble was there was no one she could trust. A thousand years away from home tends to leave ones former acquaintances quite dead. That meant she would have to get social and buddy-buddy with somepony, and that was something she loathed to do- but she knew it would be a necessary chore. At the very least, they could end up slightly useful and absorb some magic before it hit her.\n\nThe only problem was who to choose to embark with her on this epic adventure.\n\nAt that moment, there came a small knock at the front door to her throne room.\n\nLuna looked up at the guards in front of the massive slabs of wood, nodding to them to indicate they should let whoever had knocked through. The guards silently complied, pulling the doors open. Standing in the moonlight of the garden outside was a small blue mare, wearing a purple cloak and hat studded with colorful star and moon patterns. Without waiting to be invited in, the mare entered the throne room with a purpose to her stride. The guards looked on at her warily, but did not stop her. As the stranger approached Luna, the god queen could see a fire and a drive in her eyes. The mare did not bow or prostrate herself before her when she was close enough, as Luna was used to. These things alone made Luna very interested in what she had to say before she had even begun to speak. And speak she did.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d the mare said loudly, her voice echoing in the nearly empty throne room. \xe2\x80\x9cI require your assistance and partnership in ridding Equestria of a thorn in her side.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna had an inkling as to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s identity, but her response was almost automatic. She lifted her head regally. \xe2\x80\x9cOne does not ask for a princesses\xe2\x80\x99 assistance in such a manner.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe blue mare sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cFor the love of- do you even know who I am?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna did her best to sound annoyed, though in truth she was delightfully amused at her frankness. \xe2\x80\x9cYou will address me properly, or I will have the guards escort you away.\xe2\x80\x9d The pegasus guards moved a step closer to the stranger at Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words.\n\nThe mare continued unperturbed in the same confident voice. \xe2\x80\x9cThat would be unwise, your majesty. I seek to help bring you the sweet taste of victory you have sought for so long.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna blinked. Could it be? \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you speak of? Who are you?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe blue mare donned a wide, manic grin, as if she had been waiting for that question. Her purple eyes glistened in the moonlight. \xe2\x80\x9cI am the Great and Powerful Trixie, and I want what you want- revenge on Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna smiled the tiniest of smiles. Her prayers had been answered.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nThe two unicorns retreated into the nearby library. Luna instructed all of the guards that had followed them to vacate the area, lest her sister become suspicious about a set of guards guarding a supposedly empty room. With the doors to the massive hall closed and securely locked, Luna could finally breathe easy. Her plan was going to come to fruition at last. She had feigned ignorance before, but she had recognized the small blue mare immediately. It was difficult not to hear of her escapades throughout Equestria, and she had been impressed more than once by a recounted tale of her performances. She had also heard of her show in Ponyville- and why this magician shared her hatred for Twilight. She glanced at the mare, who was poking around the books. She could not have found a more perfect partner to help her enact her revenge.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou have an impressive collection,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said to her from across the room. Her voice once again echoed in the empty chamber. Luna took one last look around to make sure they were alone, and then approached the small unicorn.\n\n \xe2\x80\x9cYou said you needed my help. So, start asking,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said. Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s eyes shifted from side to side, as if she were embarrassed about something.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou have to keep this a secret,\xe2\x80\x9d the smaller mare whispered.\n\nLuna brought a hoof to her face. \xe2\x80\x9cCross my heart, hope to f-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, yeah,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie interrupted. \xe2\x80\x9cThe truth is\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she trailed off for a moment, her face scrunching in disgust, seemingly at her own words. She swallowed and continued. \xe2\x80\x9cThe truth is that stupid unicorn is more\xe2\x80\xa6 technically proficient at magic than I am.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna nodded sagely at her pained admission. \xe2\x80\x9cThat doesn\xe2\x80\x99t surprise me. She is the personal prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9 of my sister, after all.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know what that word means, but I don\xe2\x80\x99t want to hear about any hot-for-teacher stuff,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said, giving Luna an odd look. \xe2\x80\x9cAll I know is her connection to your sister makes her very powerful. More powerful than myself. And it irks me greatly.\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie turned to look back at the shelves of books. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure you know the feeling.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna thought for a moment. \xe2\x80\x9cNo, can\xe2\x80\x99t say that I do.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHow was the moon?\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie asked, still facing the books. \xe2\x80\x9cCold?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna narrowed her eyes at the mare\xe2\x80\x99s back. \xe2\x80\x9cPoint taken.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cExactly,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said, levitating out a large book from the stacks and turning back around to face Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, you\xe2\x80\x99re going to teach me.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTeach you what, exactly?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.\n\nTrixie turned the cover of the book so it faced Luna. The gold embossed title read Really Advanced Magic: Part I of XXIV. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re going to teach me everything I need to know to get rid of Twilight Sparkle, of course.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna blinked. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s all you need? Magic lessons?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie cringed as if in pain from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s wording. \xe2\x80\x9cRight. You teach me everything she knows, and a little more, and I remove a pesky problem from your life. Sounds like a pretty good deal, doesn\xe2\x80\x99t it?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna pondered this idea for a moment. It did sound like a pretty good deal. She decided to make sure Trixie had the same plan she did, though, just in case. She started with an obvious question. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, if I\xe2\x80\x99m teaching you, what\xe2\x80\x99s to stop me from just going and taking care of her myself?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie just laughed. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, the Great and Powerful Princess Luna strolling casually down the streets of Ponyville. That\xe2\x80\x99s real subtle. There\xe2\x80\x99s absolutely no chance that\xe2\x80\x99ll backfire. Might as well stop by the sweets shop while you\xe2\x80\x99re down there, and pick up a case of you\xe2\x80\x99re stupid and so is that idea.\xe2\x80\x9d She finished the last part of her sentence with a completely deadpan expression.\n\nLuna furrowed her brow and pretended to look offended. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re not exactly low-key yourself.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t have both a horn and the wingspan of a dragon,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie countered. \xe2\x80\x9cSo unless you plan to kill her in her sleep- which isn\xe2\x80\x99t very sporting, if we\xe2\x80\x99re both honest- everypony will know it was you who killed the princesses\xe2\x80\x99 prized student.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna completed the conversational thread with the obvious bullet point. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd that would not bode well for my life expectancy.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie gave the princess a practiced, showboating grin. \xe2\x80\x9cDuh. Guess who\xe2\x80\x99s got four hooves and can solve that problem for you?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nGood, Luna thought. Trixie was on the same page she was- and even better, she thought she had come up with the idea entirely on her own. Her heart was racing with excitement. This had literally dropped into her lap, and it just might actually work. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t possibly screw this up. Once Twilight was out of the way, she could focus on her real goal: Celestia. \n\nFor the rest of the night, Luna shared a few choice things with the smaller mare, planning out Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s sleeping arrangements at the castle and her schedule of lessons over the next few days. When the sun was due to peak over the horizon, Luna led Trixie off to an unused room for her to get some sleep. \n\nWhat neither Trixie nor Luna had noticed was a white-furred alicorn, watching from one of the library balconies.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nIt was breakfast as usual in the royal castle. Fine dishes from all over Equestria were on the menu, dressed up with the most ornate of place settings and fine china. Steaming piles of bacon and freshly-baked bread covered the table, all freshly prepared that morning. Luna honestly just preferred toast.\n\nAs she arrived in the dining hall, Celestia was at the table already, cutting up a poached egg with a knife. As Luna sat down next to her sister, levitating her own knife to butter her simple breakfast fare, she discretely looked in the direction of her sibling. Celestia had the tiniest of smiles on her face as she chewed her food. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s fear got to her- she was instantly a little worried. Had she discovered anything? Luna wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to be the one to give anything away, though. She looked in the opposite direction and took a bite out of her toast, ignoring her sister.\n\nAfter a minute or so of silence, though, her resolve broke down, and she looked back. Celestia had stopped eating and was watching her little sister with the same tiny smile. \n\nLuna frowned. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cNothing,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia said in a sing-song voice.\n\nThe two sisters simply stared at each other, each daring the other to speak- Luna with a glare, and Celestia with her maddening smile. The only noise in the dining hall was the chirping of birds in the garden outside. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t so much a menacing silence than a continuation of the rivalry that any two immortal siblings would have, if one were secretly trying to dethrone the other. As it turns out, Celestia spoke first.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s cute,\xe2\x80\x9d she said in a whisper.\n\nLuna nearly choked. \xe2\x80\x9cExcuse me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYour friend; she\xe2\x80\x99s simply adorable,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia elaborated, letting her mischievous grin spread a little further.\n\nLuna was thoroughly confused. Was her sister playing a game with her? Did she actually know anything? Had she heard what happened last night? She swallowed. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you talking about?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nCelestia propped her head up with a hoof, putting her elbow on the table, smiling all the while. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be so shy about it, Luna- I approve. Don\xe2\x80\x99t worry about it!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s jaw dropped slightly. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t possibly be\xe2\x80\xa6 and yet, she looked completely serious. Luna was silent for several seconds, trying to process this. Celestia took it as her cue to continue, her voice taking on that familiar motherly tone that Luna hated.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLuna, you\xe2\x80\x99re my sister,\xe2\x80\x9d she started, reaching across the table to ruffle her mane. Luna sat completely still, her face still a mask of disbelief. Celestia kept going. \xe2\x80\x9cI just want you to be happy- you know that, right? You don\xe2\x80\x99t have to hide anything from me, and I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to judge you. If that\xe2\x80\x99s the path that you want to take, I fully support you.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nUnder any other circumstances, Luna would have been on the floor with hysterics. Now, though, she was at a complete loss for words. Celestia kept her genuine, happy smile as she waited for her sister to say something. \n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s response was to quietly stand up, push in her chair, and walk out of the dining room to her quarters.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nLuna spent the day asleep, as usual. When she awoke, she avoided her sister at the dining hall for dinner, instead requesting that her food be sent up to her quarters. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t want a repeat of that awkward conversation.\n\nOnce Celestia had retired to her own room, Luna emerged, delving deep into the castle corridors to gather Trixie from her room, grabbing a tray of pastries from the kitchen on her way over. When Luna reached the unmarked door, she knocked quietly with her hoof. There was a sudden rustling from inside and a smattering of muffled swearing. Luna felt a little guilty- she hoped she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t interrupted anything embarrassing. After a minute, Trixie mumbled, \xe2\x80\x9center!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna opened the door. Trixie was sitting up on the bed, the covers mostly over her, her face slightly flushed. Luna took a cursory glance around the room, but only found one alteration: a poster of one of the Wonderbolts on the wall. The name \xe2\x80\x98Spitfire\xe2\x80\x99 was written under the uniformed mare. Luna looked back at Trixie with a blank look.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhere did you get that?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.\n\nTrixie shifted her eyes. \xe2\x80\x9cI brought it with me,\xe2\x80\x9d she said quickly. She looked at the pastries. \xe2\x80\x9cAre those raspberry?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked, changing the subject. Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cThe Great and Powerful Trixie loves raspberries,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, almost sheepishly, grabbing one of the puffs off the plate.\n\nAfter a quick snack for the both of them, Luna led Trixie through the complicated castle corridors towards the library. Her paranoia guided her around the longest way around that she could find, though she doubted Trixie noticed. Once they reached the doors, Luna once again dismissed the guards and led her accomplice inside, instructing her to secure the door behind them.\n\nTrixie turned around and was about to comply when Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes met the sight she had been secretly dreading. Inside the library, on a far table, nestled between stacks of books and what looked like tiny pillows, was a large plate of sandwiches and a smattering of small chocolates. On top of the platter was a tiny sign stuck into the top sandwich that clearly bore the words, \xe2\x80\x9cHave fun, you two!\xe2\x80\x9d Underneath the words was a small red heart. \n\nLuna immediately turned around and started to walk out of the library. Trixie stared after her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhere are you going?!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie asked in a loud whisper.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSomewhere else,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied in a flat voice.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nThe two ended up practicing in Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s borrowed room that night. Three productive nights passed there without incident, but far from comforting Luna, this only served to fuel her latent paranoia. She still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure what Celestia knew- if she were actually concerned about whatever she was concerned about, or if she were merely toying with her while she warmed up the straight-to-the-moon spell. Or both. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been able to tell the difference a thousand years ago and she sure hadn\xe2\x80\x99t gotten any better at it in the meantime. \n\nShe didn\xe2\x80\x99t let that stop her, though. There was work to be done.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, so you know how to summon simple objects pretty well,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, beginning their third lesson for that night.\n\nTrixie, as if to prove a point, lit her horn and procured a perfectly smooth glass sphere into the air between them. It fell to the soft carpet. \xe2\x80\x9cYep,\xe2\x80\x9d she said.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAnd we\xe2\x80\x99ve covered how to materialize more complex objects,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna continued, prompting her this time.\n\nTrixie shut her eyes, her horn glowed once again, and after a few seconds, a brilliantly detailed gemstone came into existence. The light from her horn and the candles around them shined through the facets of the jewel, covering the room with radiance. Trixie opened her eyes and grinned devilishly.\n\nLuna let a tiny smile cross her face. \xe2\x80\x9cAll very good. Now, we\xe2\x80\x99re going to do something more difficult.\xe2\x80\x9d Using her own magic, she brought forth from the air a simple box. She levitated it in front of Trixie. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re going to teleport out the item in this box.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie scoffed. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s it?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna cocked an eyebrow. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat must one do to teleport an object?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie thought for a moment, and then her face fell, her grin disappearing. \xe2\x80\x9cYou have to know what the object is.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna nodded sagely. \xe2\x80\x9cPrecisely.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie frowned. \xe2\x80\x9cHow is this supposed to help me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou never know what skill might come in handy during a fight,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said off-handedly. Trixie looked like she was about to say something in response, but gave up, shutting her eyes and focusing her magic. Luna placed the box on the floor, watching Trixie with anticipation. This spell was tricky, but not overly complicated. The object she had put in the box wasn\xe2\x80\x99t hard to manipulate either, but the mare would need to master this spell before\xe2\x80\xa6\n\nBefore Luna could finish that thought, there appeared with a flash of light a book between the two unicorns- a book far larger than would have fit in the box. Trixie opened her eyes in confusion at the same time Luna read the title. It was Colts and Fillies, a book infamous for its\xe2\x80\xa6 racy content. It was often colloquially called, along with other reading materials like it, clop fiction. \n\nTrixie blinked in confusion and her jaw hung open. \xe2\x80\x9cUh\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she stammered.\n\nLuna simply turned and silently beat her head against the wall beside her.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nThe night of practicing was long and tedious, but fruitful. Trixie wasn\xe2\x80\x99t used to the powerful magic Luna was teaching her, but she was learning fast, which was exactly what Luna had been expecting. The two magicians stopped working around the time when Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s horn started to glow a weird color. \n\nLuna once again avoided Celestia at the breakfast table and had her food sent up to her room. When it arrived, though, it was the exact same plate of sandwiches and chocolates that she had seen in the library. Suddenly not hungry in the slightest, she frowned and pushed the plate away, crawling into bed. She was asleep as soon as her head hit the pillow. She vaguely remembered dreaming of the moon.\n\nAs she was accustomed to doing, she awoke at almost exactly dusk. She blinked a few times to get the sleep out of her eyes, and rolled over in her bed to get ready to raise Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s nocturnal satellite and her accompanying stars. To her surprise, she rolled over onto something warm and pony-shaped. \n\nYelping with surprise, Luna bolted upright and threw off the covers. Lying next to her in bed was a disrobed Trixie, who was looking back up at her with about as much surprise on her face as Luna felt. Neither said anything for a heartbeat, both of their jaws quite agape.\n\nLuna recovered first. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you doing in my bed?!\xe2\x80\x9d she squeaked.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you doing in my-\xe2\x80\x9c Trixie started, but stopped suddenly when she looked around the room and realized that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in her assigned quarters. Both ponies looked at each other again with a disbelieving silence. Trixie was blushing a deep red now that she realized what was going on.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou didn\xe2\x80\x99t come here on your own?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.\n\nTrixie took another look around the room, then down at herself, then back at Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cNo! Where are my robes? What\xe2\x80\x99s going on?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t quite awake, but she had a pretty good idea of what was going on. \xe2\x80\x9cSo you don\xe2\x80\x99t know how you got here?\xe2\x80\x9d she prodded.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cNO!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie repeated, quite forcefully. \n\nAnother moment of awkward silence. Trixie uncomfortably grabbed a hooffull of the sheets and covered herself up a bit.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLet\xe2\x80\x99s pretend this didn\xe2\x80\x99t happen,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, blinking.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAgreed,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie mumbled.\n\nEager to put the morning- technically evening- behind them, the two quickly left Luna\xe2\x80\x99s quarters. Now that Luna knew that Celestia knew where Trixie had been living in the castle, she made a mental note to find her a new room. In the meantime, though, they two would need a new practice space, and Luna thought she knew just the place. There was a balcony loft that she knew for a fact was unoccupied. It was a special room, usually reserved for when Celestia wanted to address her subjects in the most public manner possible, which wasn\xe2\x80\x99t often nowadays. Before Luna had been banished, she remembered it seeing frequent use. Times had indeed changed.\n\nStopping only to gather their spell books, the two made their way up the winding flights of stairs. Upon reaching the top, Luna opened the door to find the room exactly the way she had remembered it. Nice, quiet, and private.\n\nThe two unicorns got settled, as they were now used to doing. Luna levitated one of the books and flipped to a dog-eared page. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, we left off on barrier spells\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she began.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhen she\xe2\x80\x99s gone, what will you do?\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie interrupted.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCome again?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThat ridiculous unicorn,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie clarified. \xe2\x80\x9cOnce she\xe2\x80\x99s out of the picture, what\xe2\x80\x99s your plan?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna looked at the mare thoughtfully. At one point she might have hesitated in telling her this, but she had grown to trust her during her admittedly short visit. Plus, she was helping her- what harm could it do? \xe2\x80\x9cCelestia,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cCelestia is next. This kingdom will be mine again.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSounds pretty vengeful,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie noted lightly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSays the mare that\xe2\x80\x99s still focusing on one failed show,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna pointed out.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSays the princess who\xe2\x80\x99s focusing on something that happened a thousand years ago,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie countered.\n\nLuna was about to respond in kind when she realized Trixie had a point. They were both after something rather shallow and vain, weren\xe2\x80\x99t they? And yet neither of them had really stopped and considered the consequences of the actions they were about to take. Luna looked into the younger mare\xe2\x80\x99s eyes with a fresh understanding that she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t expected. Perhaps there was more they could both learn from the other.\n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s deep thoughts were interrupted by a knock at the door. Luna swore quietly and lightly hit her head on the wall beside her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cGirls?\xe2\x80\x9d a sing-song voice came from the other side of the door. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you in there?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia, I swear to-\xe2\x80\x9c Luna said, but the door opened before she could finish. Celestia popped her head into the room with a huge smile on her face.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, hello!\xe2\x80\x9d she said cheerily. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t mean to interrupt! Just wanted to see if I could get you girls anything,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, still smiling broadly. Luna gave her her best glare.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Luna mumbled.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cNow, don\xe2\x80\x99t be rude, Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia responded. \xe2\x80\x9cAsk your friend if she wants anything.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, more forcefully.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhatcha studying?\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia asked, peeking her head around to look at the books.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelly!\xe2\x80\x9d Luna shouted, shoving her sister back through the doorway with her head. Once she was outside the doorframe, Luna shut and locked the door.
