Only her quick thinking and fake tears when her sister had shown up had salvaged the situation and made her look like a victim instead of a laughingstock. </p><p class="double">Luna looked at the paper in front of her, entitled The Celestia-pult. She lidded her eyes. This was hopeless. Maybe it was time to turn her attention to getting rid of Celestia\xe2\x80\x99s prized student instead of her- go for a psychological blow instead of a physical one. Surely that would make things easier.</p><p class="double">And yet, still, nothing came to mind. For all Luna\xe2\x80\x99s taunting and all her posturing during her attempted takeover, the small unicorn she had fell to was indeed very powerful- and she had been tutored by her sister, no less. Even taking that into account, if it were discovered that Luna had been the one responsible for the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s untimely death, she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t just be banished to the moon this time. At the very least, she would end up with egg on her face again, and she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t afford that. Not again.</p><p class="double">She would clearly need help to pull this off. The trouble was there was no one she could trust. A thousand years away from home tends to leave ones former acquaintances quite dead. That meant she would have to get social and buddy-buddy with somepony, and that was something she loathed to do- but she knew it would be a necessary chore. At the very least, they could end up slightly useful and absorb some magic before it hit her.</p><p class="double">The only problem was who to choose to embark with her on this epic adventure.</p><p class="double">At that moment, there came a small knock at the front door to her throne room.</p><p class="double">Luna looked up at the guards in front of the massive slabs of wood, nodding to them to indicate they should let whoever had knocked through. The guards silently complied, pulling the doors open. Standing in the moonlight of the garden outside was a small blue mare, wearing a purple cloak and hat studded with colorful star and moon patterns. Without waiting to be invited in, the mare entered the throne room with a purpose to her stride. The guards looked on at her warily, but did not stop her. As the stranger approached Luna, the god queen could see a fire and a drive in her eyes. The mare did not bow or prostrate herself before her when she was close enough, as Luna was used to. These things alone made Luna very interested in what she had to say before she had even begun to speak. And speak she did.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d the mare said loudly, her voice echoing in the nearly empty throne room. \xe2\x80\x9cI require your assistance and partnership in ridding Equestria of a thorn in her side.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna had an inkling as to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s identity, but her response was almost automatic. She lifted her head regally. \xe2\x80\x9cOne does not ask for a princesses\xe2\x80\x99 assistance in such a manner.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The blue mare sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cFor the love of- do you even know who I am?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna did her best to sound annoyed, though in truth she was delightfully amused at her frankness. \xe2\x80\x9cYou will address me properly, or I will have the guards escort you away.\xe2\x80\x9d The pegasus guards moved a step closer to the stranger at Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words.</p><p class="double">The mare continued unperturbed in the same confident voice. \xe2\x80\x9cThat would be unwise, your majesty. I seek to help bring you the sweet taste of victory you have sought for so long.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna blinked. Could it be? \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you speak of? Who are you?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The blue mare donned a wide, manic grin, as if she had been waiting for that question. Her purple eyes glistened in the moonlight. \xe2\x80\x9cI am the Great and Powerful Trixie, and I want what you want- revenge on Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna smiled the tiniest of smiles. Her prayers had been answered.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">***</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">The two unicorns retreated into the nearby library. Luna instructed all of the guards that had followed them to vacate the area, lest her sister become suspicious about a set of guards guarding a supposedly empty room. With the doors to the massive hall closed and securely locked, Luna could finally breathe easy. Her plan was going to come to fruition at last. She had feigned ignorance before, but she had recognized the small blue mare immediately. It was difficult not to hear of her escapades throughout Equestria, and she had been impressed more than once by a recounted tale of her performances. She had also heard of her show in Ponyville- and why this magician shared her hatred for Twilight. She glanced at the mare, who was poking around the books. She could not have found a more perfect partner to help her enact her revenge.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou have an impressive collection,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said to her from across the room. Her voice once again echoed in the empty chamber. Luna took one last look around to make sure they were alone, and then approached the small unicorn.</p><p class="double"> \xe2\x80\x9cYou said you needed my help. So, start asking,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said. Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s eyes shifted from side to side, as if she were embarrassed about something.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou have to keep this a secret,\xe2\x80\x9d the smaller mare whispered.</p><p class="double">Luna brought a hoof to her face. \xe2\x80\x9cCross my heart, hope to f-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, yeah,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie interrupted. \xe2\x80\x9cThe truth is\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she trailed off for a moment, her face scrunching in disgust, seemingly at her own words. She swallowed and continued. \xe2\x80\x9cThe truth is that stupid unicorn is more\xe2\x80\xa6 technically proficient at magic than I am.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna nodded sagely at her pained admission. \xe2\x80\x9cThat doesn\xe2\x80\x99t surprise me. She is the personal prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9 of my sister, after all.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know what that word means, but I don\xe2\x80\x99t want to hear about any hot-for-teacher stuff,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said, giving Luna an odd look. \xe2\x80\x9cAll I know is her connection to your sister makes her very powerful. More powerful than myself. And it irks me greatly.\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie turned to look back at the shelves of books. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure you know the feeling.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna thought for a moment. \xe2\x80\x9cNo, can\xe2\x80\x99t say that I do.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHow was the moon?\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie asked, still facing the books. \xe2\x80\x9cCold?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna narrowed her eyes at the mare\xe2\x80\x99s back. \xe2\x80\x9cPoint taken.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cExactly,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said, levitating out a large book from the stacks and turning back around to face Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, you\xe2\x80\x99re going to teach me.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTeach you what, exactly?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.</p><p class="double">Trixie turned the cover of the book so it faced Luna. The gold embossed title read Really Advanced Magic: Part I of XXIV. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re going to teach me everything I need to know to get rid of Twilight Sparkle, of course.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna blinked. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s all you need? Magic lessons?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Trixie cringed as if in pain from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s wording. \xe2\x80\x9cRight. You teach me everything she knows, and a little more, and I remove a pesky problem from your life. Sounds like a pretty good deal, doesn\xe2\x80\x99t it?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna pondered this idea for a moment. It did sound like a pretty good deal. She decided to make sure Trixie had the same plan she did, though, just in case. She started with an obvious question. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, if I\xe2\x80\x99m teaching you, what\xe2\x80\x99s to stop me from just going and taking care of her myself?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Trixie just laughed. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, the Great and Powerful Princess Luna strolling casually down the streets of Ponyville. That\xe2\x80\x99s real subtle. There\xe2\x80\x99s absolutely no chance that\xe2\x80\x99ll backfire. Might as well stop by the sweets shop while you\xe2\x80\x99re down there, and pick up a case of you\xe2\x80\x99re stupid and so is that idea.\xe2\x80\x9d She finished the last part of her sentence with a completely deadpan expression.</p><p class="double">Luna furrowed her brow and pretended to look offended. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re not exactly low-key yourself.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t have both a horn and the wingspan of a dragon,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie countered. \xe2\x80\x9cSo unless you plan to kill her in her sleep- which isn\xe2\x80\x99t very sporting, if we\xe2\x80\x99re both honest- everypony will know it was you who killed the princesses\xe2\x80\x99 prized student.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna completed the conversational thread with the obvious bullet point. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd that would not bode well for my life expectancy.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Trixie gave the princess a practiced, showboating grin. \xe2\x80\x9cDuh. Guess who\xe2\x80\x99s got four hooves and can solve that problem for you?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Good, Luna thought. Trixie was on the same page she was- and even better, she thought she had come up with the idea entirely on her own. Her heart was racing with excitement. This had literally dropped into her lap, and it just might actually work. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t possibly screw this up. Once Twilight was out of the way, she could focus on her real goal: Celestia. </p><p class="double">For the rest of the night, Luna shared a few choice things with the smaller mare, planning out Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s sleeping arrangements at the castle and her schedule of lessons over the next few days. When the sun was due to peak over the horizon, Luna led Trixie off to an unused room for her to get some sleep. </p><p class="double">What neither Trixie nor Luna had noticed was a white-furred alicorn, watching from one of the library balconies.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">***</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">It was breakfast as usual in the royal castle. Fine dishes from all over Equestria were on the menu, dressed up with the most ornate of place settings and fine china. Steaming piles of bacon and freshly-baked bread covered the table, all freshly prepared that morning. Luna honestly just preferred toast.</p><p class="double">As she arrived in the dining hall, Celestia was at the table already, cutting up a poached egg with a knife. As Luna sat down next to her sister, levitating her own knife to butter her simple breakfast fare, she discretely looked in the direction of her sibling. Celestia had the tiniest of smiles on her face as she chewed her food. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s fear got to her- she was instantly a little worried. Had she discovered anything? Luna wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to be the one to give anything away, though. She looked in the opposite direction and took a bite out of her toast, ignoring her sister.</p><p class="double">After a minute or so of silence, though, her resolve broke down, and she looked back. Celestia had stopped eating and was watching her little sister with the same tiny smile. </p><p class="double">Luna frowned. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cNothing,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia said in a sing-song voice.</p><p class="double">The two sisters simply stared at each other, each daring the other to speak- Luna with a glare, and Celestia with her maddening smile. The only noise in the dining hall was the chirping of birds in the garden outside. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t so much a menacing silence than a continuation of the rivalry that any two immortal siblings would have, if one were secretly trying to dethrone the other. As it turns out, Celestia spoke first.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s cute,\xe2\x80\x9d she said in a whisper.</p><p class="double">Luna nearly choked. \xe2\x80\x9cExcuse me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYour friend; she\xe2\x80\x99s simply adorable,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia elaborated, letting her mischievous grin spread a little further.</p><p class="double">Luna was thoroughly confused. Was her sister playing a game with her? Did she actually know anything? Had she heard what happened last night? She swallowed. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you talking about?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Celestia propped her head up with a hoof, putting her elbow on the table, smiling all the while. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be so shy about it, Luna- I approve. Don\xe2\x80\x99t worry about it!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna\xe2\x80\x99s jaw dropped slightly. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t possibly be\xe2\x80\xa6 and yet, she looked completely serious. Luna was silent for several seconds, trying to process this. Celestia took it as her cue to continue, her voice taking on that familiar motherly tone that Luna hated.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLuna, you\xe2\x80\x99re my sister,\xe2\x80\x9d she started, reaching across the table to ruffle her mane. Luna sat completely still, her face still a mask of disbelief. Celestia kept going. \xe2\x80\x9cI just want you to be happy- you know that, right? You don\xe2\x80\x99t have to hide anything from me, and I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to judge you. If that\xe2\x80\x99s the path that you want to take, I fully support you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Under any other circumstances, Luna would have been on the floor with hysterics. Now, though, she was at a complete loss for words. Celestia kept her genuine, happy smile as she waited for her sister to say something. </p><p class="double">Luna\xe2\x80\x99s response was to quietly stand up, push in her chair, and walk out of the dining room to her quarters.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">***</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">Luna spent the day asleep, as usual. When she awoke, she avoided her sister at the dining hall for dinner, instead requesting that her food be sent up to her quarters. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t want a repeat of that awkward conversation.</p><p class="double">Once Celestia had retired to her own room, Luna emerged, delving deep into the castle corridors to gather Trixie from her room, grabbing a tray of pastries from the kitchen on her way over. When Luna reached the unmarked door, she knocked quietly with her hoof. There was a sudden rustling from inside and a smattering of muffled swearing. Luna felt a little guilty- she hoped she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t interrupted anything embarrassing. After a minute, Trixie mumbled, \xe2\x80\x9center!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna opened the door. Trixie was sitting up on the bed, the covers mostly over her, her face slightly flushed. Luna took a cursory glance around the room, but only found one alteration: a poster of one of the Wonderbolts on the wall. The name \xe2\x80\x98Spitfire\xe2\x80\x99 was written under the uniformed mare. Luna looked back at Trixie with a blank look.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhere did you get that?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.</p><p class="double">Trixie shifted her eyes. \xe2\x80\x9cI brought it with me,\xe2\x80\x9d she said quickly. She looked at the pastries. \xe2\x80\x9cAre those raspberry?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked, changing the subject. Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cThe Great and Powerful Trixie loves raspberries,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, almost sheepishly, grabbing one of the puffs off the plate.</p><p class="double">After a quick snack for the both of them, Luna led Trixie through the complicated castle corridors towards the library. Her paranoia guided her around the longest way around that she could find, though she doubted Trixie noticed. Once they reached the doors, Luna once again dismissed the guards and led her accomplice inside, instructing her to secure the door behind them.</p><p class="double">Trixie turned around and was about to comply when Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes met the sight she had been secretly dreading. Inside the library, on a far table, nestled between stacks of books and what looked like tiny pillows, was a large plate of sandwiches and a smattering of small chocolates. On top of the platter was a tiny sign stuck into the top sandwich that clearly bore the words, \xe2\x80\x9cHave fun, you two!\xe2\x80\x9d Underneath the words was a small red heart. </p><p class="double">Luna immediately turned around and started to walk out of the library. Trixie stared after her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhere are you going?!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie asked in a loud whisper.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSomewhere else,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied in a flat voice.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">***</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">The two ended up practicing in Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s borrowed room that night. Three productive nights passed there without incident, but far from comforting Luna, this only served to fuel her latent paranoia. She still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure what Celestia knew- if she were actually concerned about whatever she was concerned about, or if she were merely toying with her while she warmed up the straight-to-the-moon spell. Or both. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been able to tell the difference a thousand years ago and she sure hadn\xe2\x80\x99t gotten any better at it in the meantime. </p><p class="double">She didn\xe2\x80\x99t let that stop her, though. There was work to be done.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, so you know how to summon simple objects pretty well,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, beginning their third lesson for that night.</p><p class="double">Trixie, as if to prove a point, lit her horn and procured a perfectly smooth glass sphere into the air between them. It fell to the soft carpet. \xe2\x80\x9cYep,\xe2\x80\x9d she said.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnd we\xe2\x80\x99ve covered how to materialize more complex objects,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna continued, prompting her this time.</p><p class="double">Trixie shut her eyes, her horn glowed once again, and after a few seconds, a brilliantly detailed gemstone came into existence. The light from her horn and the candles around them shined through the facets of the jewel, covering the room with radiance. Trixie opened her eyes and grinned devilishly.</p><p class="double">Luna let a tiny smile cross her face. \xe2\x80\x9cAll very good. Now, we\xe2\x80\x99re going to do something more difficult.\xe2\x80\x9d Using her own magic, she brought forth from the air a simple box. She levitated it in front of Trixie. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re going to teleport out the item in this box.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Trixie scoffed. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s it?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna cocked an eyebrow. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat must one do to teleport an object?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Trixie thought for a moment, and then her face fell, her grin disappearing. \xe2\x80\x9cYou have to know what the object is.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna nodded sagely. \xe2\x80\x9cPrecisely.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Trixie frowned. \xe2\x80\x9cHow is this supposed to help me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou never know what skill might come in handy during a fight,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said off-handedly. Trixie looked like she was about to say something in response, but gave up, shutting her eyes and focusing her magic. Luna placed the box on the floor, watching Trixie with anticipation. This spell was tricky, but not overly complicated. The object she had put in the box wasn\xe2\x80\x99t hard to manipulate either, but the mare would need to master this spell before\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">Before Luna could finish that thought, there appeared with a flash of light a book between the two unicorns- a book far larger than would have fit in the box. Trixie opened her eyes in confusion at the same time Luna read the title. It was Colts and Fillies, a book infamous for its\xe2\x80\xa6 racy content. It was often colloquially called, along with other reading materials like it, clop fiction. </p><p class="double">Trixie blinked in confusion and her jaw hung open. \xe2\x80\x9cUh\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she stammered.</p><p class="double">Luna simply turned and silently beat her head against the wall beside her.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">***</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">The night of practicing was long and tedious, but fruitful. Trixie wasn\xe2\x80\x99t used to the powerful magic Luna was teaching her, but she was learning fast, which was exactly what Luna had been expecting. The two magicians stopped working around the time when Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s horn started to glow a weird color. </p><p class="double">Luna once again avoided Celestia at the breakfast table and had her food sent up to her room. When it arrived, though, it was the exact same plate of sandwiches and chocolates that she had seen in the library. Suddenly not hungry in the slightest, she frowned and pushed the plate away, crawling into bed. She was asleep as soon as her head hit the pillow. She vaguely remembered dreaming of the moon.</p><p class="double">As she was accustomed to doing, she awoke at almost exactly dusk. She blinked a few times to get the sleep out of her eyes, and rolled over in her bed to get ready to raise Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s nocturnal satellite and her accompanying stars. To her surprise, she rolled over onto something warm and pony-shaped. </p><p class="double">Yelping with surprise, Luna bolted upright and threw off the covers. Lying next to her in bed was a disrobed Trixie, who was looking back up at her with about as much surprise on her face as Luna felt. Neither said anything for a heartbeat, both of their jaws quite agape.</p><p class="double">Luna recovered first. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you doing in my bed?!\xe2\x80\x9d she squeaked.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you doing in my-\xe2\x80\x9c Trixie started, but stopped suddenly when she looked around the room and realized that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in her assigned quarters. Both ponies looked at each other again with a disbelieving silence. Trixie was blushing a deep red now that she realized what was going on.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou didn\xe2\x80\x99t come here on your own?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.</p><p class="double">Trixie took another look around the room, then down at herself, then back at Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cNo! Where are my robes? What\xe2\x80\x99s going on?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t quite awake, but she had a pretty good idea of what was going on. \xe2\x80\x9cSo you don\xe2\x80\x99t know how you got here?\xe2\x80\x9d she prodded.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cNO!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie repeated, quite forcefully. </p><p class="double">Another moment of awkward silence. Trixie uncomfortably grabbed a hooffull of the sheets and covered herself up a bit.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLet\xe2\x80\x99s pretend this didn\xe2\x80\x99t happen,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, blinking.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAgreed,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie mumbled.</p><p class="double">Eager to put the morning- technically evening- behind them, the two quickly left Luna\xe2\x80\x99s quarters. Now that Luna knew that Celestia knew where Trixie had been living in the castle, she made a mental note to find her a new room. In the meantime, though, they two would need a new practice space, and Luna thought she knew just the place. There was a balcony loft that she knew for a fact was unoccupied. It was a special room, usually reserved for when Celestia wanted to address her subjects in the most public manner possible, which wasn\xe2\x80\x99t often nowadays. Before Luna had been banished, she remembered it seeing frequent use. Times had indeed changed.</p><p class="double">Stopping only to gather their spell books, the two made their way up the winding flights of stairs. Upon reaching the top, Luna opened the door to find the room exactly the way she had remembered it. Nice, quiet, and private.</p><p class="double">The two unicorns got settled, as they were now used to doing. Luna levitated one of the books and flipped to a dog-eared page. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, we left off on barrier spells\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she began.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhen she\xe2\x80\x99s gone, what will you do?\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie interrupted.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cCome again?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThat ridiculous unicorn,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie clarified. \xe2\x80\x9cOnce she\xe2\x80\x99s out of the picture, what\xe2\x80\x99s your plan?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna looked at the mare thoughtfully. At one point she might have hesitated in telling her this, but she had grown to trust her during her admittedly short visit. Plus, she was helping her- what harm could it do? \xe2\x80\x9cCelestia,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cCelestia is next. This kingdom will be mine again.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSounds pretty vengeful,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie noted lightly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSays the mare that\xe2\x80\x99s still focusing on one failed show,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna pointed out.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSays the princess who\xe2\x80\x99s focusing on something that happened a thousand years ago,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie countered.</p><p class="double">Luna was about to respond in kind when she realized Trixie had a point. They were both after something rather shallow and vain, weren\xe2\x80\x99t they? And yet neither of them had really stopped and considered the consequences of the actions they were about to take. Luna looked into the younger mare\xe2\x80\x99s eyes with a fresh understanding that she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t expected. Perhaps there was more they could both learn from the other.</p><p class="double">Luna\xe2\x80\x99s deep thoughts were interrupted by a knock at the door. Luna swore quietly and lightly hit her head on the wall beside her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cGirls?\xe2\x80\x9d a sing-song voice came from the other side of the door. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you in there?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia, I swear to-\xe2\x80\x9c Luna said, but the door opened before she could finish. Celestia popped her head into the room with a huge smile on her face.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, hello!\xe2\x80\x9d she said cheerily. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t mean to interrupt! Just wanted to see if I could get you girls anything,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, still smiling broadly. Luna gave her her best glare.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Luna mumbled.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cNow, don\xe2\x80\x99t be rude, Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia responded. \xe2\x80\x9cAsk your friend if she wants anything.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, more forcefully.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhatcha studying?\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia asked, peeking her head around to look at the books.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cCelly!\xe2\x80\x9d Luna shouted, shoving her sister back through the doorway with her head. Once she was outside the doorframe, Luna shut and locked the door. She took a few deep breaths and then turned back to Trixie with a deadpan look on her face.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cPoint taken,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said quietly.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">***</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">Luna, exhausted from the night\xe2\x80\x99s work, once again prepared to bed down for the duration of the day. She opened the large window that dominated one side of her quarters to let the fresh dawn air fill the room. She took a deep breath and savored it- the balcony loft had gotten quite stuffy after so many diligent hours. Trixie was absorbing her lessons almost as fast as she could think of them. They had perhaps one more night of studies before Luna felt the unicorn was ready to perform her mission. One more night, she thought, turning away from the window and approaching her bed. She could surely keep her sister out of the way for one more night.</p><p class="double">Seemingly in response to that thought, Luna heard a rustling behind her, on the other side of her room. It sounded almost as if somepony had come through her window. Luna sighed and closed her eyes as she felt a headache coming on.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat, Celestia?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked, turning around. Celestia was indeed perched on her open windowsill.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cNow, now, Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia cooed. \xe2\x80\x9cNo need to be grumpy with me.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy are you doing this?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked, narrowing her eyes.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m just looking out for my little sister!\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia said, climbing down from the windowsill. \xe2\x80\x9cIs that such a crime?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna gave Celestia her best glare, but said nothing. The white alicorn trotted cheerily to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s bed, flopping down on it with a soft flump. She looked back up at Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s something to be said about being a good host, you know,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, playing with the sheets with a hoof. \xe2\x80\x9cThough, it was nice of you to give her her own room and all. Shows respect for her privacy.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna continued her silent glare. Celestia continued, oblivious.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou could certainly have asked me to procure a better room, certainly- but I understand! You\xe2\x80\x99re taking this gently. Slowly. I can appreciate that. Give her the old razzle dazzle. It works, sometimes. Sometimes it doesn\xe2\x80\x99t- who knows with these performer types?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna thought she knew where her sister was going with this, but kept her glare up. Celestia took a tiny pause in her diatribe and levitated a sandwich from the tray that Luna had left untouched near her bedside. She took a bite and spoke around the food.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThough, dear, you might not want to leave her waiting too long. That\xe2\x80\x99s rude.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna\xe2\x80\x99s glare dropped to a flat expression. \xe2\x80\x9cCelly, we\xe2\x80\x99re not-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, don\xe2\x80\x99t give me that,\xe2\x80\x9d the alicorn countered lightly. \xe2\x80\x9cYou can\xe2\x80\x99t hide anything from me, dear.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna resisted the urge to sigh. There was no way she was getting out of the conversation. She decided to take the easy way out. \xe2\x80\x9cObviously not,\xe2\x80\x9d the alicorn grumbled.</p><p class="double">Celestia gave her sister a beaming grin, her point made. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s the spirit,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, getting up off the bed and magically opening the door out of the bedroom. Just as she was about to leave, she turned and looked back at Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cBe gentle with her. She\xe2\x80\x99s kind of temperamental,\xe2\x80\x9d she said slyly. With that, Celestia walked past the threshold, the door closing behind her</p><p>.</p><p>Luna hit her head on the closest wall.</p><p class="double">***</p><p class="double">This was it- the final night. Luna had picked a room as far away from her previous choices as she possibly could, to hopefully throw Celestia off. Luna looked on expectantly at Trixie as she closed her eyes and tried to perform the last spell for the night. If the performer could do it, then she had learned all that Luna could teach her- all that she needed to know to kill Twilight. It had been over a week of nonstop practicing and drilling and planning, and it was all coming to fruition right before Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.</p><p class="double">Trixie started to take on a peculiar glow as she focused her magic. Her horn positively lit up the room, it was becoming so bright. The blue unicorn mumbled something under her breath that Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear. Without warning, the mare disappeared in a flash of light. Luna smiled at the space that she had previously occupied, now covered in wisps of smoke. She- they- had done it.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI did it!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie shouted from where she had successfully teleported - the other side of the room, near the balcony window. Luna turned around to see Trixie on her hooves, looking around in awe at her achievement. With the moonlight highlighting her form against the blackened sky, Trixie almost looked the same as she had the night she had broken into the castle grounds- but much happier.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnd thus endeth the lesson for tonight,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said contentedly.</p><p class="double">Trixie stamped a hoof on the ground in approval and whinnied. \xe2\x80\x9cDamn straight! There\xe2\x80\x99s nothing that little unicorn can do to stop me now!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna gave the blue mare a wide smile. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s one last thing we need to discuss,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xc2\xa0All that remained now was to fill Trixie in on the exact details of how she would carry out her assignment. Luna had been obscuring the details of this intentionally up until now, just in case, despite Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s protests. Now that their lessons were over\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">Luna\xe2\x80\x99s heart skipped a beat when Trixie moved away from the window. Past the balcony railing, she saw the unmistakable silhouette of a horned, winged figure with a long, flowing mane, just out of sight. Celestia was here, watching them. </p><p class="double">Luna tried to keep her face impassive, but inside she was panicking. Not now. Not now, when she was so close. Her mind raced. She needed to get her sister away from that window for ten minutes. Ten minutes was all she needed. She knew her sibling, and she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to be able to chase her off again; she\xe2\x80\x99d just come back. Celestia needed to leave on her own. </p><p class="double">Luna swallowed, and her heart fell into her stomach. She knew exactly what her sister was waiting for the two of them to do. She looked at Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s advancing form, hoping against hope that her hastily-constructed idea would be enough. Trixie was not going to like this. Here goes nothing.</p><p class="double">As Trixie walked the final steps towards Luna, the elder mare indicated silently that she should sit, which she did. Once Trixie was close enough, Luna put her snout gently against the blue unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s ear and gently nuzzled it.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia is in the window,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna whispered softly.</p><p class="double">Trixie, taken aback by both the unexpected gesture and the news, almost pulled away from Luna, but the alicorn lightly grabbed her ear with her teeth to stop her. Trixie took only a second to absorb the news, and then pulled her head back, seemingly understanding the gravity of the situation. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do we do, then?\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie whispered back nervously.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe need to get her to leave,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied softly. Trixie paused, unsure of what to do. \xe2\x80\x9cJust pretend I\xe2\x80\x99m Spitfire for a minute,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna elaborated. To Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s credit, as corny as Luna\xe2\x80\x99s encouragement had seemed to her, the blue mare took the hint without much hesitation and relaxed her posture. Her face had taken on a slight shade of red.</p><p class="double">Luna faltered, though. She was so out of practice that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure she could make this look convincing. Plus, Trixie was a mare. Luna would have to fake this like she\xe2\x80\x99d never faked before. Just take it slow, she encouraged herself. </p><p class="double">Luna continued her nuzzling motion under and around Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s ear, massaging the side of her head with her snout. She alternated between rubbing that spot and kneading the underside of Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s neck. Every few moments she would nip a little at Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s ear, which, after a few rounds, began to elicit soft moans from the blue mare. To her surprise, Luna could feel Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s face getting redder and redder. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t expected that. She felt a little guilty for doing this to her, but she was sure the unicorn understood what was at stake. Though Luna wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t admit it, her guilt was alleviated slightly by the sheer virtue of the fact that she was either apparently doing a decent job or that Trixie was a remarkably good faker.</p><p class="double">Luna stole a quick glance towards the window. She still saw the shadow of her sister watching them. It dawned on her that this would get awkward quickly if Celestia had no plans to leave, but Luna liked to think her sister had some sense of dignity. Time to continue.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to kiss you,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna whispered quietly, mostly as a forewarning. Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s eyebrows shot up even as her eyes remained closed, as if she had been awoken from a trance. All Luna got in response was a soft hum and a nod from the blue mare.</p><p class="double">The alicorn stopped her nuzzling and brought her lips experimentally to Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s. Their height difference made the movement a little awkward at first, which Luna solved by backing up a bit from her student. The heat coming from the performer\xe2\x80\x99s face was very apparent now. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been sure what to expect Trixie to taste like, but Luna thought she tasted a tiny hint of blueberries. Trixie didn\xe2\x80\x99t reciprocate the kiss at first, but slowly, gradually began to push back on Luna\xe2\x80\x99s lips with her own. The princess had no idea if she was doing her part correctly, but Trixie seemed to be enjoying it just fine. Luna kept it up for the better part of a minute before Trixie offered her tongue. Luna was surprised by the gesture, but accepted it. Their makeout session intensified. After another minute, Luna broke the kiss.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat was that about?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked quietly, taking another glance at the window. Celestia was still there. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAuthenticity,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie cooed, nuzzling Luna\xe2\x80\x99s neck as the alicorn had done previously.</p><p class="double">Luna resisted the urge to shrug. Her sister was being very persistent- it was probably time to look a little more serious about what they were doing. She looked down at her student. Her face was now bright red. She looked further up, and eyed Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s horn warily. This she did have some experience in, but it had been so long since she had practiced it that, in this case, she was even more unsure of how to proceed. Here goes some more nothing.</p><p class="double">Luna gently brushed Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s horn with her snout, which caused the mare to tense her body slightly. Luna repeated the action a few times until Trixie seemed used to it, then gave the appendage a light lick. Trixie sighed with pleasure, and involuntarily ducked her head a little. Luna took that as her signal to proceed. She gave the shaft another lick, stronger this time. Trixie almost shivered. \xc2\xa0Luna looked up for just a moment to the window, and saw the sight she had been hoping for- the figure was turning away from the balcony! Just a few more seconds\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWait,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said suddenly, forcefully. \xe2\x80\x9cWait a second.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna\xe2\x80\x99s heart skipped a beat as the figure in the window paused, and turned back to the castle. No! Not now! I\xe2\x80\x99m so close! \xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna hissed. </p><p class="double">The blue mare had already stood up before Luna could stop her. Her eyes were focused oddly, her breathing was irregular, and she looked angry. Her blush had spread across her entire face. \xe2\x80\x9cI see what\xe2\x80\x99s going on here!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTrixie, sit down!\xe2\x80\x9d Luna whispered loudly, hoping to salvage the situation, but already instinctively knew that her plan had just fallen through the floor. At the very last second. Amazing.</p><p class="double">The mare narrowed her gaze dangerously, her tone absolutely furious as she unsuccessfully tried to wipe her horn clean with a hoof. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ve been planning this all along! You and your sister have set this all up so you can get me into bed!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna\xe2\x80\x99s face dropped into utter disbelief. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDo you think the Great and Powerful Trixie is stupid?!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie continued. \xe2\x80\x9cYou don\xe2\x80\x99t care about getting revenge on Twilight! You don\xe2\x80\x99t care about teaching me magic! All you wanted was Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s Great and Powerful bits!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna blinked in confusion. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy would I want your mone-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie started, but her face scrunched up with anger before she could finish. \xe2\x80\x9cInsulted!\xe2\x80\x9d she managed. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was a mistake coming here!\xe2\x80\x9d With that, the blue magician turned away from Luna and lit her still-moist horn with magic. \xe2\x80\x9cI expect my things to be mailed by morning!\xe2\x80\x9d she screeched. With that, Trixie disappeared in the flash of magical light that Luna had just taught her, leaving small contrails of smoke where she had stood just a moment ago. </p><p class="double">Luna was left staring blankly at the spot, wondering how her until-then perfect plan had fallen apart in thirty seconds. She blinked. Yep, Trixie was gone. That had just happened. She was too surprised to be angry. She was too surprised to be upset. She was just confused.</p><p class="double">From behind her, Luna heard soft hoofbeats as Celestia approached. Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t turn to face her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry, Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia said in a voice that contained no sorrow whatsoever. \xe2\x80\x9cSometimes things happen. She really wasn\xe2\x80\x99t your type, anyway.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Luna let her head hit the floor.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 10], 'parent_story_id': 10, 'txt': '//------------------------------//\n// Accolade// Story: Accolade// by Cereal Velocity//------------------------------//\n\nYour heart is my pi\xc3\xb1ata.\nChuck Palahniuk\n\t\t\nAsking for help was not something the Great and Powerful Trixie was used to doing. Well, that and brushing her mane in the morning. It was always in perfect condition, of course, but nopony believed her when she tried to tell them that.\n\nIt had been fun cavorting around Equestria for a few months, surely. She had had her fair share of fun, her fair share of adventure, and her fair share of pretty fillies claiming that they had never been so attracted to another mare in their life. She had performed for all manner of audiences; large and small, crowds of few and throngs of many. She had entertained entire cities and crowded bars, swarming parks and huge stadiums. She had done her dazzling magic for every type, from the most humble earth pony to powerful government officials and the greatest unicorn magicians- though, clearly, they were not as great as herself. She had truly seen it all in the eventful months since her failed show at Ponyville.\n\nAnd, yet, during her travels, something always nagged her from the back of her mind. Something that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t go away, no matter how many other mares she slept with or tricks she performed. It was something that she had never experienced in her life, and thought she never would. The problem was purple, had a star for a cutie mark, and had simply delicious lavender eyes.\n\nTrixie blinked at the stray thought. They were most certainly not delicious. How ridiculous.\n\nNevertheless, her encounter with Twilight had most definitely irked her. In her one, rare moment of weakness, she had been shown up. Unthinkable. \n\nAt first, she had been depressed about the whole affair. After that, she had tried to ignore it. When that didn\xe2\x80\x99t work, she tried to distract herself with her performances. She put on the most impressive shows she had ever come up with since she had become a performer- shows that would have impressed the god queen rulers of Equestria themselves- and yet despite her brilliance, there still remained that nagging doubt that refused to leave her alone. She had even, after a few too many drinks one particular night, though about having a child with the preposterously pretty pony. She still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure where that idea had come from, nor if it was even physically possible.\n\nIt was her insatiable desire to rid herself of this nuisance that had led Trixie to the very doors of the Canterlot Royal Castle. \n\nEverypony had heard about Nightmare Moon\xe2\x80\x99s defeat at the hooves of Twilight and the five ponies in her company. Trixie had been surprised that none of them had drawn the obvious conclusion about the encounter- that perhaps Luna wasn\xe2\x80\x99t so thrilled to have been brought down so easily. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t prove it, but it was all she had to go on.\n\nGetting past the perimeter guards to her castle hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been easy, nor had the trip up to Canterlot been trivial, but she knew that there was at least one pony that could help her, and that she lay inside these walls. She was her only hope- and Trixie hoped she could convince her to help.\n\nTaking a deep, dramatic breath, she knocked on the massive doors with a hoof.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nLuna tossed aside another crumpled piece of parchment into the growing pile next to her. Who would have thought getting revenge on your enemies could be so much work?\n\nAnd it was, of course, revenge that she wanted. Strangely, it had not occurred to her to begin planning such a thing during her imprisonment on the moon. It was only after she had returned to Equestria that she had begun to consider such things, and it was turning out to be far more difficult than she had anticipated. Perhaps, she thought, looking past her mountain of ill-formed plans at the moon outside, I shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have spent all that time dancing.\n\nTo tell the truth, the whole Nightmare Moon thing had been a last-minute effort. It had almost worked, too, except for that insufferable purple unicorn and her little gaggle ruining everything with their magic tricks. Just thinking about her made Luna\xe2\x80\x99s blood boil. That whole escapade had just been embarrassing. Only her quick thinking and fake tears when her sister had shown up had salvaged the situation and made her look like a victim instead of a laughingstock. \n\nLuna looked at the paper in front of her, entitled The Celestia-pult. She lidded her eyes. This was hopeless. Maybe it was time to turn her attention to getting rid of Celestia\xe2\x80\x99s prized student instead of her- go for a psychological blow instead of a physical one. Surely that would make things easier.\n\nAnd yet, still, nothing came to mind. For all Luna\xe2\x80\x99s taunting and all her posturing during her attempted takeover, the small unicorn she had fell to was indeed very powerful- and she had been tutored by her sister, no less. Even taking that into account, if it were discovered that Luna had been the one responsible for the unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s untimely death, she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t just be banished to the moon this time. At the very least, she would end up with egg on her face again, and she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t afford that. Not again.\n\nShe would clearly need help to pull this off. The trouble was there was no one she could trust. A thousand years away from home tends to leave ones former acquaintances quite dead. That meant she would have to get social and buddy-buddy with somepony, and that was something she loathed to do- but she knew it would be a necessary chore. At the very least, they could end up slightly useful and absorb some magic before it hit her.\n\nThe only problem was who to choose to embark with her on this epic adventure.\n\nAt that moment, there came a small knock at the front door to her throne room.\n\nLuna looked up at the guards in front of the massive slabs of wood, nodding to them to indicate they should let whoever had knocked through. The guards silently complied, pulling the doors open. Standing in the moonlight of the garden outside was a small blue mare, wearing a purple cloak and hat studded with colorful star and moon patterns. Without waiting to be invited in, the mare entered the throne room with a purpose to her stride. The guards looked on at her warily, but did not stop her. As the stranger approached Luna, the god queen could see a fire and a drive in her eyes. The mare did not bow or prostrate herself before her when she was close enough, as Luna was used to. These things alone made Luna very interested in what she had to say before she had even begun to speak. And speak she did.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cPrincess Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d the mare said loudly, her voice echoing in the nearly empty throne room. \xe2\x80\x9cI require your assistance and partnership in ridding Equestria of a thorn in her side.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna had an inkling as to the mare\xe2\x80\x99s identity, but her response was almost automatic. She lifted her head regally. \xe2\x80\x9cOne does not ask for a princesses\xe2\x80\x99 assistance in such a manner.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe blue mare sighed. \xe2\x80\x9cFor the love of- do you even know who I am?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna did her best to sound annoyed, though in truth she was delightfully amused at her frankness. \xe2\x80\x9cYou will address me properly, or I will have the guards escort you away.\xe2\x80\x9d The pegasus guards moved a step closer to the stranger at Luna\xe2\x80\x99s words.\n\nThe mare continued unperturbed in the same confident voice. \xe2\x80\x9cThat would be unwise, your majesty. I seek to help bring you the sweet taste of victory you have sought for so long.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna blinked. Could it be? \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do you speak of? Who are you?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe blue mare donned a wide, manic grin, as if she had been waiting for that question. Her purple eyes glistened in the moonlight. \xe2\x80\x9cI am the Great and Powerful Trixie, and I want what you want- revenge on Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna smiled the tiniest of smiles. Her prayers had been answered.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nThe two unicorns retreated into the nearby library. Luna instructed all of the guards that had followed them to vacate the area, lest her sister become suspicious about a set of guards guarding a supposedly empty room. With the doors to the massive hall closed and securely locked, Luna could finally breathe easy. Her plan was going to come to fruition at last. She had feigned ignorance before, but she had recognized the small blue mare immediately. It was difficult not to hear of her escapades throughout Equestria, and she had been impressed more than once by a recounted tale of her performances. She had also heard of her show in Ponyville- and why this magician shared her hatred for Twilight. She glanced at the mare, who was poking around the books. She could not have found a more perfect partner to help her enact her revenge.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou have an impressive collection,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said to her from across the room. Her voice once again echoed in the empty chamber. Luna took one last look around to make sure they were alone, and then approached the small unicorn.\n\n \xe2\x80\x9cYou said you needed my help. So, start asking,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said. Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s eyes shifted from side to side, as if she were embarrassed about something.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou have to keep this a secret,\xe2\x80\x9d the smaller mare whispered.\n\nLuna brought a hoof to her face. \xe2\x80\x9cCross my heart, hope to f-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, yeah,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie interrupted. \xe2\x80\x9cThe truth is\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she trailed off for a moment, her face scrunching in disgust, seemingly at her own words. She swallowed and continued. \xe2\x80\x9cThe truth is that stupid unicorn is more\xe2\x80\xa6 technically proficient at magic than I am.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna nodded sagely at her pained admission. \xe2\x80\x9cThat doesn\xe2\x80\x99t surprise me. She is the personal prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9 of my sister, after all.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know what that word means, but I don\xe2\x80\x99t want to hear about any hot-for-teacher stuff,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said, giving Luna an odd look. \xe2\x80\x9cAll I know is her connection to your sister makes her very powerful. More powerful than myself. And it irks me greatly.\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie turned to look back at the shelves of books. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sure you know the feeling.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna thought for a moment. \xe2\x80\x9cNo, can\xe2\x80\x99t say that I do.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHow was the moon?\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie asked, still facing the books. \xe2\x80\x9cCold?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna narrowed her eyes at the mare\xe2\x80\x99s back. \xe2\x80\x9cPoint taken.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cExactly,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said, levitating out a large book from the stacks and turning back around to face Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, you\xe2\x80\x99re going to teach me.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTeach you what, exactly?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.\n\nTrixie turned the cover of the book so it faced Luna. The gold embossed title read Really Advanced Magic: Part I of XXIV. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re going to teach me everything I need to know to get rid of Twilight Sparkle, of course.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna blinked. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s all you need? Magic lessons?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie cringed as if in pain from Luna\xe2\x80\x99s wording. \xe2\x80\x9cRight. You teach me everything she knows, and a little more, and I remove a pesky problem from your life. Sounds like a pretty good deal, doesn\xe2\x80\x99t it?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna pondered this idea for a moment. It did sound like a pretty good deal. She decided to make sure Trixie had the same plan she did, though, just in case. She started with an obvious question. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, if I\xe2\x80\x99m teaching you, what\xe2\x80\x99s to stop me from just going and taking care of her myself?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie just laughed. \xe2\x80\x9cYes, the Great and Powerful Princess Luna strolling casually down the streets of Ponyville. That\xe2\x80\x99s real subtle. There\xe2\x80\x99s absolutely no chance that\xe2\x80\x99ll backfire. Might as well stop by the sweets shop while you\xe2\x80\x99re down there, and pick up a case of you\xe2\x80\x99re stupid and so is that idea.\xe2\x80\x9d She finished the last part of her sentence with a completely deadpan expression.\n\nLuna furrowed her brow and pretended to look offended. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re not exactly low-key yourself.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t have both a horn and the wingspan of a dragon,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie countered. \xe2\x80\x9cSo unless you plan to kill her in her sleep- which isn\xe2\x80\x99t very sporting, if we\xe2\x80\x99re both honest- everypony will know it was you who killed the princesses\xe2\x80\x99 prized student.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna completed the conversational thread with the obvious bullet point. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd that would not bode well for my life expectancy.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie gave the princess a practiced, showboating grin. \xe2\x80\x9cDuh. Guess who\xe2\x80\x99s got four hooves and can solve that problem for you?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nGood, Luna thought. Trixie was on the same page she was- and even better, she thought she had come up with the idea entirely on her own. Her heart was racing with excitement. This had literally dropped into her lap, and it just might actually work. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t possibly screw this up. Once Twilight was out of the way, she could focus on her real goal: Celestia. \n\nFor the rest of the night, Luna shared a few choice things with the smaller mare, planning out Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s sleeping arrangements at the castle and her schedule of lessons over the next few days. When the sun was due to peak over the horizon, Luna led Trixie off to an unused room for her to get some sleep. \n\nWhat neither Trixie nor Luna had noticed was a white-furred alicorn, watching from one of the library balconies.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nIt was breakfast as usual in the royal castle. Fine dishes from all over Equestria were on the menu, dressed up with the most ornate of place settings and fine china. Steaming piles of bacon and freshly-baked bread covered the table, all freshly prepared that morning. Luna honestly just preferred toast.\n\nAs she arrived in the dining hall, Celestia was at the table already, cutting up a poached egg with a knife. As Luna sat down next to her sister, levitating her own knife to butter her simple breakfast fare, she discretely looked in the direction of her sibling. Celestia had the tiniest of smiles on her face as she chewed her food. Luna\xe2\x80\x99s fear got to her- she was instantly a little worried. Had she discovered anything? Luna wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to be the one to give anything away, though. She looked in the opposite direction and took a bite out of her toast, ignoring her sister.\n\nAfter a minute or so of silence, though, her resolve broke down, and she looked back. Celestia had stopped eating and was watching her little sister with the same tiny smile. \n\nLuna frowned. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cNothing,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia said in a sing-song voice.\n\nThe two sisters simply stared at each other, each daring the other to speak- Luna with a glare, and Celestia with her maddening smile. The only noise in the dining hall was the chirping of birds in the garden outside. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t so much a menacing silence than a continuation of the rivalry that any two immortal siblings would have, if one were secretly trying to dethrone the other. As it turns out, Celestia spoke first.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s cute,\xe2\x80\x9d she said in a whisper.\n\nLuna nearly choked. \xe2\x80\x9cExcuse me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYour friend; she\xe2\x80\x99s simply adorable,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia elaborated, letting her mischievous grin spread a little further.\n\nLuna was thoroughly confused. Was her sister playing a game with her? Did she actually know anything? Had she heard what happened last night? She swallowed. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you talking about?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nCelestia propped her head up with a hoof, putting her elbow on the table, smiling all the while. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be so shy about it, Luna- I approve. Don\xe2\x80\x99t worry about it!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s jaw dropped slightly. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t possibly be\xe2\x80\xa6 and yet, she looked completely serious. Luna was silent for several seconds, trying to process this. Celestia took it as her cue to continue, her voice taking on that familiar motherly tone that Luna hated.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLuna, you\xe2\x80\x99re my sister,\xe2\x80\x9d she started, reaching across the table to ruffle her mane. Luna sat completely still, her face still a mask of disbelief. Celestia kept going. \xe2\x80\x9cI just want you to be happy- you know that, right? You don\xe2\x80\x99t have to hide anything from me, and I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to judge you. If that\xe2\x80\x99s the path that you want to take, I fully support you.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nUnder any other circumstances, Luna would have been on the floor with hysterics. Now, though, she was at a complete loss for words. Celestia kept her genuine, happy smile as she waited for her sister to say something. \n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s response was to quietly stand up, push in her chair, and walk out of the dining room to her quarters.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nLuna spent the day asleep, as usual. When she awoke, she avoided her sister at the dining hall for dinner, instead requesting that her food be sent up to her quarters. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t want a repeat of that awkward conversation.\n\nOnce Celestia had retired to her own room, Luna emerged, delving deep into the castle corridors to gather Trixie from her room, grabbing a tray of pastries from the kitchen on her way over. When Luna reached the unmarked door, she knocked quietly with her hoof. There was a sudden rustling from inside and a smattering of muffled swearing. Luna felt a little guilty- she hoped she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t interrupted anything embarrassing. After a minute, Trixie mumbled, \xe2\x80\x9center!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna opened the door. Trixie was sitting up on the bed, the covers mostly over her, her face slightly flushed. Luna took a cursory glance around the room, but only found one alteration: a poster of one of the Wonderbolts on the wall. The name \xe2\x80\x98Spitfire\xe2\x80\x99 was written under the uniformed mare. Luna looked back at Trixie with a blank look.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhere did you get that?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.\n\nTrixie shifted her eyes. \xe2\x80\x9cI brought it with me,\xe2\x80\x9d she said quickly. She looked at the pastries. \xe2\x80\x9cAre those raspberry?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked, changing the subject. Luna nodded. \xe2\x80\x9cThe Great and Powerful Trixie loves raspberries,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, almost sheepishly, grabbing one of the puffs off the plate.\n\nAfter a quick snack for the both of them, Luna led Trixie through the complicated castle corridors towards the library. Her paranoia guided her around the longest way around that she could find, though she doubted Trixie noticed. Once they reached the doors, Luna once again dismissed the guards and led her accomplice inside, instructing her to secure the door behind them.\n\nTrixie turned around and was about to comply when Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes met the sight she had been secretly dreading. Inside the library, on a far table, nestled between stacks of books and what looked like tiny pillows, was a large plate of sandwiches and a smattering of small chocolates. On top of the platter was a tiny sign stuck into the top sandwich that clearly bore the words, \xe2\x80\x9cHave fun, you two!\xe2\x80\x9d Underneath the words was a small red heart. \n\nLuna immediately turned around and started to walk out of the library. Trixie stared after her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhere are you going?!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie asked in a loud whisper.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSomewhere else,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied in a flat voice.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nThe two ended up practicing in Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s borrowed room that night. Three productive nights passed there without incident, but far from comforting Luna, this only served to fuel her latent paranoia. She still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure what Celestia knew- if she were actually concerned about whatever she was concerned about, or if she were merely toying with her while she warmed up the straight-to-the-moon spell. Or both. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been able to tell the difference a thousand years ago and she sure hadn\xe2\x80\x99t gotten any better at it in the meantime. \n\nShe didn\xe2\x80\x99t let that stop her, though. There was work to be done.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, so you know how to summon simple objects pretty well,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, beginning their third lesson for that night.\n\nTrixie, as if to prove a point, lit her horn and procured a perfectly smooth glass sphere into the air between them. It fell to the soft carpet. \xe2\x80\x9cYep,\xe2\x80\x9d she said.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAnd we\xe2\x80\x99ve covered how to materialize more complex objects,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna continued, prompting her this time.\n\nTrixie shut her eyes, her horn glowed once again, and after a few seconds, a brilliantly detailed gemstone came into existence. The light from her horn and the candles around them shined through the facets of the jewel, covering the room with radiance. Trixie opened her eyes and grinned devilishly.\n\nLuna let a tiny smile cross her face. \xe2\x80\x9cAll very good. Now, we\xe2\x80\x99re going to do something more difficult.\xe2\x80\x9d Using her own magic, she brought forth from the air a simple box. She levitated it in front of Trixie. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re going to teleport out the item in this box.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie scoffed. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s it?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna cocked an eyebrow. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat must one do to teleport an object?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie thought for a moment, and then her face fell, her grin disappearing. \xe2\x80\x9cYou have to know what the object is.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna nodded sagely. \xe2\x80\x9cPrecisely.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTrixie frowned. \xe2\x80\x9cHow is this supposed to help me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou never know what skill might come in handy during a fight,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said off-handedly. Trixie looked like she was about to say something in response, but gave up, shutting her eyes and focusing her magic. Luna placed the box on the floor, watching Trixie with anticipation. This spell was tricky, but not overly complicated. The object she had put in the box wasn\xe2\x80\x99t hard to manipulate either, but the mare would need to master this spell before\xe2\x80\xa6\n\nBefore Luna could finish that thought, there appeared with a flash of light a book between the two unicorns- a book far larger than would have fit in the box. Trixie opened her eyes in confusion at the same time Luna read the title. It was Colts and Fillies, a book infamous for its\xe2\x80\xa6 racy content. It was often colloquially called, along with other reading materials like it, clop fiction. \n\nTrixie blinked in confusion and her jaw hung open. \xe2\x80\x9cUh\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she stammered.\n\nLuna simply turned and silently beat her head against the wall beside her.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nThe night of practicing was long and tedious, but fruitful. Trixie wasn\xe2\x80\x99t used to the powerful magic Luna was teaching her, but she was learning fast, which was exactly what Luna had been expecting. The two magicians stopped working around the time when Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s horn started to glow a weird color. \n\nLuna once again avoided Celestia at the breakfast table and had her food sent up to her room. When it arrived, though, it was the exact same plate of sandwiches and chocolates that she had seen in the library. Suddenly not hungry in the slightest, she frowned and pushed the plate away, crawling into bed. She was asleep as soon as her head hit the pillow. She vaguely remembered dreaming of the moon.\n\nAs she was accustomed to doing, she awoke at almost exactly dusk. She blinked a few times to get the sleep out of her eyes, and rolled over in her bed to get ready to raise Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s nocturnal satellite and her accompanying stars. To her surprise, she rolled over onto something warm and pony-shaped. \n\nYelping with surprise, Luna bolted upright and threw off the covers. Lying next to her in bed was a disrobed Trixie, who was looking back up at her with about as much surprise on her face as Luna felt. Neither said anything for a heartbeat, both of their jaws quite agape.\n\nLuna recovered first. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you doing in my bed?!\xe2\x80\x9d she squeaked.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat are you doing in my-\xe2\x80\x9c Trixie started, but stopped suddenly when she looked around the room and realized that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in her assigned quarters. Both ponies looked at each other again with a disbelieving silence. Trixie was blushing a deep red now that she realized what was going on.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou didn\xe2\x80\x99t come here on your own?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.\n\nTrixie took another look around the room, then down at herself, then back at Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cNo! Where are my robes? What\xe2\x80\x99s going on?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t quite awake, but she had a pretty good idea of what was going on. \xe2\x80\x9cSo you don\xe2\x80\x99t know how you got here?\xe2\x80\x9d she prodded.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cNO!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie repeated, quite forcefully. \n\nAnother moment of awkward silence. Trixie uncomfortably grabbed a hooffull of the sheets and covered herself up a bit.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLet\xe2\x80\x99s pretend this didn\xe2\x80\x99t happen,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, blinking.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAgreed,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie mumbled.\n\nEager to put the morning- technically evening- behind them, the two quickly left Luna\xe2\x80\x99s quarters. Now that Luna knew that Celestia knew where Trixie had been living in the castle, she made a mental note to find her a new room. In the meantime, though, they two would need a new practice space, and Luna thought she knew just the place. There was a balcony loft that she knew for a fact was unoccupied. It was a special room, usually reserved for when Celestia wanted to address her subjects in the most public manner possible, which wasn\xe2\x80\x99t often nowadays. Before Luna had been banished, she remembered it seeing frequent use. Times had indeed changed.\n\nStopping only to gather their spell books, the two made their way up the winding flights of stairs. Upon reaching the top, Luna opened the door to find the room exactly the way she had remembered it. Nice, quiet, and private.\n\nThe two unicorns got settled, as they were now used to doing. Luna levitated one of the books and flipped to a dog-eared page. \xe2\x80\x9cSo, we left off on barrier spells\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d she began.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhen she\xe2\x80\x99s gone, what will you do?\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie interrupted.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCome again?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThat ridiculous unicorn,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie clarified. \xe2\x80\x9cOnce she\xe2\x80\x99s out of the picture, what\xe2\x80\x99s your plan?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna looked at the mare thoughtfully. At one point she might have hesitated in telling her this, but she had grown to trust her during her admittedly short visit. Plus, she was helping her- what harm could it do? \xe2\x80\x9cCelestia,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cCelestia is next. This kingdom will be mine again.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSounds pretty vengeful,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie noted lightly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSays the mare that\xe2\x80\x99s still focusing on one failed show,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna pointed out.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSays the princess who\xe2\x80\x99s focusing on something that happened a thousand years ago,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie countered.\n\nLuna was about to respond in kind when she realized Trixie had a point. They were both after something rather shallow and vain, weren\xe2\x80\x99t they? And yet neither of them had really stopped and considered the consequences of the actions they were about to take. Luna looked into the younger mare\xe2\x80\x99s eyes with a fresh understanding that she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t expected. Perhaps there was more they could both learn from the other.\n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s deep thoughts were interrupted by a knock at the door. Luna swore quietly and lightly hit her head on the wall beside her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cGirls?\xe2\x80\x9d a sing-song voice came from the other side of the door. \xe2\x80\x9cAre you in there?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia, I swear to-\xe2\x80\x9c Luna said, but the door opened before she could finish. Celestia popped her head into the room with a huge smile on her face.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, hello!\xe2\x80\x9d she said cheerily. \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t mean to interrupt! Just wanted to see if I could get you girls anything,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, still smiling broadly. Luna gave her her best glare.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Luna mumbled.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cNow, don\xe2\x80\x99t be rude, Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia responded. \xe2\x80\x9cAsk your friend if she wants anything.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said, more forcefully.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhatcha studying?\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia asked, peeking her head around to look at the books.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelly!\xe2\x80\x9d Luna shouted, shoving her sister back through the doorway with her head. Once she was outside the doorframe, Luna shut and locked the door. She took a few deep breaths and then turned back to Trixie with a deadpan look on her face.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cPoint taken,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said quietly.\n\n\n\n***\n\n\n\nLuna, exhausted from the night\xe2\x80\x99s work, once again prepared to bed down for the duration of the day. She opened the large window that dominated one side of her quarters to let the fresh dawn air fill the room. She took a deep breath and savored it- the balcony loft had gotten quite stuffy after so many diligent hours. Trixie was absorbing her lessons almost as fast as she could think of them. They had perhaps one more night of studies before Luna felt the unicorn was ready to perform her mission. One more night, she thought, turning away from the window and approaching her bed. She could surely keep her sister out of the way for one more night.\n\nSeemingly in response to that thought, Luna heard a rustling behind her, on the other side of her room. It sounded almost as if somepony had come through her window. Luna sighed and closed her eyes as she felt a headache coming on.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat, Celestia?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked, turning around. Celestia was indeed perched on her open windowsill.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cNow, now, Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia cooed. \xe2\x80\x9cNo need to be grumpy with me.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy are you doing this?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna asked, narrowing her eyes.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m just looking out for my little sister!\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia said, climbing down from the windowsill. \xe2\x80\x9cIs that such a crime?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna gave Celestia her best glare, but said nothing. The white alicorn trotted cheerily to Luna\xe2\x80\x99s bed, flopping down on it with a soft flump. She looked back up at Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s something to be said about being a good host, you know,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, playing with the sheets with a hoof. \xe2\x80\x9cThough, it was nice of you to give her her own room and all. Shows respect for her privacy.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna continued her silent glare. Celestia continued, oblivious.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou could certainly have asked me to procure a better room, certainly- but I understand! You\xe2\x80\x99re taking this gently. Slowly. I can appreciate that. Give her the old razzle dazzle. It works, sometimes. Sometimes it doesn\xe2\x80\x99t- who knows with these performer types?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna thought she knew where her sister was going with this, but kept her glare up. Celestia took a tiny pause in her diatribe and levitated a sandwich from the tray that Luna had left untouched near her bedside. She took a bite and spoke around the food.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThough, dear, you might not want to leave her waiting too long. That\xe2\x80\x99s rude.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s glare dropped to a flat expression. \xe2\x80\x9cCelly, we\xe2\x80\x99re not-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, don\xe2\x80\x99t give me that,\xe2\x80\x9d the alicorn countered lightly. \xe2\x80\x9cYou can\xe2\x80\x99t hide anything from me, dear.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna resisted the urge to sigh. There was no way she was getting out of the conversation. She decided to take the easy way out. \xe2\x80\x9cObviously not,\xe2\x80\x9d the alicorn grumbled.\n \nCelestia gave her sister a beaming grin, her point made. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s the spirit,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, getting up off the bed and magically opening the door out of the bedroom. Just as she was about to leave, she turned and looked back at Luna. \xe2\x80\x9cBe gentle with her. She\xe2\x80\x99s kind of temperamental,\xe2\x80\x9d she said slyly. With that, Celestia walked past the threshold, the door closing behind her\n.\nLuna hit her head on the closest wall.\n\n***\n\nThis was it- the final night. Luna had picked a room as far away from her previous choices as she possibly could, to hopefully throw Celestia off. Luna looked on expectantly at Trixie as she closed her eyes and tried to perform the last spell for the night. If the performer could do it, then she had learned all that Luna could teach her- all that she needed to know to kill Twilight. It had been over a week of nonstop practicing and drilling and planning, and it was all coming to fruition right before Luna\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.\n\nTrixie started to take on a peculiar glow as she focused her magic. Her horn positively lit up the room, it was becoming so bright. The blue unicorn mumbled something under her breath that Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear. Without warning, the mare disappeared in a flash of light. Luna smiled at the space that she had previously occupied, now covered in wisps of smoke. She- they- had done it.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI did it!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie shouted from where she had successfully teleported - the other side of the room, near the balcony window. Luna turned around to see Trixie on her hooves, looking around in awe at her achievement. With the moonlight highlighting her form against the blackened sky, Trixie almost looked the same as she had the night she had broken into the castle grounds- but much happier.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAnd thus endeth the lesson for tonight,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna said contentedly.\n\nTrixie stamped a hoof on the ground in approval and whinnied. \xe2\x80\x9cDamn straight! There\xe2\x80\x99s nothing that little unicorn can do to stop me now!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna gave the blue mare a wide smile. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s one last thing we need to discuss,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xc2\xa0All that remained now was to fill Trixie in on the exact details of how she would carry out her assignment. Luna had been obscuring the details of this intentionally up until now, just in case, despite Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s protests. Now that their lessons were over\xe2\x80\xa6\n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s heart skipped a beat when Trixie moved away from the window. Past the balcony railing, she saw the unmistakable silhouette of a horned, winged figure with a long, flowing mane, just out of sight. Celestia was here, watching them. \n\nLuna tried to keep her face impassive, but inside she was panicking. Not now. Not now, when she was so close. Her mind raced. She needed to get her sister away from that window for ten minutes. Ten minutes was all she needed. She knew her sibling, and she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to be able to chase her off again; she\xe2\x80\x99d just come back. Celestia needed to leave on her own. \n\nLuna swallowed, and her heart fell into her stomach. She knew exactly what her sister was waiting for the two of them to do. She looked at Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s advancing form, hoping against hope that her hastily-constructed idea would be enough. Trixie was not going to like this. Here goes nothing.\n\nAs Trixie walked the final steps towards Luna, the elder mare indicated silently that she should sit, which she did.
