Once Trixie was close enough, Luna put her snout gently against the blue unicorn\xe2\x80\x99s ear and gently nuzzled it.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCelestia is in the window,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna whispered softly.\n\nTrixie, taken aback by both the unexpected gesture and the news, almost pulled away from Luna, but the alicorn lightly grabbed her ear with her teeth to stop her. Trixie took only a second to absorb the news, and then pulled her head back, seemingly understanding the gravity of the situation. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat do we do, then?\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie whispered back nervously.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWe need to get her to leave,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna replied softly. Trixie paused, unsure of what to do. \xe2\x80\x9cJust pretend I\xe2\x80\x99m Spitfire for a minute,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna elaborated. To Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s credit, as corny as Luna\xe2\x80\x99s encouragement had seemed to her, the blue mare took the hint without much hesitation and relaxed her posture. Her face had taken on a slight shade of red.\n\nLuna faltered, though. She was so out of practice that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure she could make this look convincing. Plus, Trixie was a mare. Luna would have to fake this like she\xe2\x80\x99d never faked before. Just take it slow, she encouraged herself. \n\nLuna continued her nuzzling motion under and around Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s ear, massaging the side of her head with her snout. She alternated between rubbing that spot and kneading the underside of Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s neck. Every few moments she would nip a little at Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s ear, which, after a few rounds, began to elicit soft moans from the blue mare. To her surprise, Luna could feel Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s face getting redder and redder. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t expected that. She felt a little guilty for doing this to her, but she was sure the unicorn understood what was at stake. Though Luna wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t admit it, her guilt was alleviated slightly by the sheer virtue of the fact that she was either apparently doing a decent job or that Trixie was a remarkably good faker.\n\nLuna stole a quick glance towards the window. She still saw the shadow of her sister watching them. It dawned on her that this would get awkward quickly if Celestia had no plans to leave, but Luna liked to think her sister had some sense of dignity. Time to continue.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to kiss you,\xe2\x80\x9d Luna whispered quietly, mostly as a forewarning. Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s eyebrows shot up even as her eyes remained closed, as if she had been awoken from a trance. All Luna got in response was a soft hum and a nod from the blue mare.\n\nThe alicorn stopped her nuzzling and brought her lips experimentally to Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s. Their height difference made the movement a little awkward at first, which Luna solved by backing up a bit from her student. The heat coming from the performer\xe2\x80\x99s face was very apparent now. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been sure what to expect Trixie to taste like, but Luna thought she tasted a tiny hint of blueberries. Trixie didn\xe2\x80\x99t reciprocate the kiss at first, but slowly, gradually began to push back on Luna\xe2\x80\x99s lips with her own. The princess had no idea if she was doing her part correctly, but Trixie seemed to be enjoying it just fine. Luna kept it up for the better part of a minute before Trixie offered her tongue. Luna was surprised by the gesture, but accepted it. Their makeout session intensified. After another minute, Luna broke the kiss.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat was that about?\xe2\x80\x9d she asked quietly, taking another glance at the window. Celestia was still there. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAuthenticity,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie cooed, nuzzling Luna\xe2\x80\x99s neck as the alicorn had done previously.\n\nLuna resisted the urge to shrug. Her sister was being very persistent- it was probably time to look a little more serious about what they were doing. She looked down at her student. Her face was now bright red. She looked further up, and eyed Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s horn warily. This she did have some experience in, but it had been so long since she had practiced it that, in this case, she was even more unsure of how to proceed. Here goes some more nothing.\n\nLuna gently brushed Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s horn with her snout, which caused the mare to tense her body slightly. Luna repeated the action a few times until Trixie seemed used to it, then gave the appendage a light lick. Trixie sighed with pleasure, and involuntarily ducked her head a little. Luna took that as her signal to proceed. She gave the shaft another lick, stronger this time. Trixie almost shivered. \xc2\xa0Luna looked up for just a moment to the window, and saw the sight she had been hoping for- the figure was turning away from the balcony! Just a few more seconds\xe2\x80\xa6\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWait,\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie said suddenly, forcefully. \xe2\x80\x9cWait a second.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s heart skipped a beat as the figure in the window paused, and turned back to the castle. No! Not now! I\xe2\x80\x99m so close! \xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d Luna hissed. \n\nThe blue mare had already stood up before Luna could stop her. Her eyes were focused oddly, her breathing was irregular, and she looked angry. Her blush had spread across her entire face. \xe2\x80\x9cI see what\xe2\x80\x99s going on here!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTrixie, sit down!\xe2\x80\x9d Luna whispered loudly, hoping to salvage the situation, but already instinctively knew that her plan had just fallen through the floor. At the very last second. Amazing.\n\nThe mare narrowed her gaze dangerously, her tone absolutely furious as she unsuccessfully tried to wipe her horn clean with a hoof. \xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ve been planning this all along! You and your sister have set this all up so you can get me into bed!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna\xe2\x80\x99s face dropped into utter disbelief. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDo you think the Great and Powerful Trixie is stupid?!\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie continued. \xe2\x80\x9cYou don\xe2\x80\x99t care about getting revenge on Twilight! You don\xe2\x80\x99t care about teaching me magic! All you wanted was Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s Great and Powerful bits!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna blinked in confusion. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy would I want your mone-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Trixie started, but her face scrunched up with anger before she could finish. \xe2\x80\x9cInsulted!\xe2\x80\x9d she managed. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was a mistake coming here!\xe2\x80\x9d With that, the blue magician turned away from Luna and lit her still-moist horn with magic. \xe2\x80\x9cI expect my things to be mailed by morning!\xe2\x80\x9d she screeched. With that, Trixie disappeared in the flash of magical light that Luna had just taught her, leaving small contrails of smoke where she had stood just a moment ago. \n\nLuna was left staring blankly at the spot, wondering how her until-then perfect plan had fallen apart in thirty seconds. She blinked. Yep, Trixie was gone. That had just happened. She was too surprised to be angry. She was too surprised to be upset. She was just confused.\n\nFrom behind her, Luna heard soft hoofbeats as Celestia approached. Luna didn\xe2\x80\x99t turn to face her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry, Luna,\xe2\x80\x9d Celestia said in a voice that contained no sorrow whatsoever. \xe2\x80\x9cSometimes things happen. She really wasn\xe2\x80\x99t your type, anyway.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nLuna let her head hit the floor.\n', 'epub': None}

2015-02-23 12:03:37,880 - DEBUG - {'version': 1, 'chapter_number': 3, 'fields': ['chapter_text', 'chapter_number', 'parent_chapter_id', 'chapter_html', 'version', 'parent_story_id'], 'chapter_to_insert': {'chapter_text': '//------------------------------//\n// rgwegrerg// Story: My Little Dashie\'s// by knighty//------------------------------//\n\n\t"Oh, I\'m so glad you managed to visit our quiet little town, Coco," Rarity sang, her vibrant voice reverberating through the market square. "I\'m sure it\'s a perfect place for taking a little break from a busy life of a city as glamorous as Manehattan. Though, I frankly don\'t understand how a pony could get tired of it." She winked.\r\n\r\n\tCoco studied the cobble path underneath her hooves, her face graced with a faint smile. "Believe me, Miss Rarity, I needed this break more than you could imagine."\'\r\n\t\r\n"Why do you insist on calling me miss?" \r\nRarity pouted, her lip quivering.\r\n "Am I that much older than you?" \r\nA mirror produced out of thin air sailed in front of the unicorn\'s face. \r\n"Have wrinkles already appeared on my face? \r\nBecause every time you call me miss I have a \r\ndistinct feeling of another one popping right out." \r\nShe looked deep in Coco\'s eyes. \r\n"Do you want me to feel old?"\r\n\t\r\n\t"Of course not... Rarity," Coco chuckled.\r\n\t\r\n\tThe fashionista clapped her hooves. "Excellent! Now, be a dear and tell me what you think of the prototype line I showed you, hm?" She narrowed her eyes slightly. "But remember, I want to hear an honest opinion."\r\n\tefwefwefwef\r\n\twegfwefwegweg\r\n\r\nwgwegwegweg\r\n\r\n"Fit for a princess." Coco exhaled. "You couldn\'t have chosen a more fitting name. Where do you get those amazing fabrics and ideas from?"\r\n\r\nRarity smiled, her eyes brimming with pride. "Why, thank you. I do hope you won\'t hold my desire not to reveal my trade secrets against me."\r\n\r\nThe earth pony smiled. "Of course not. I understand it perfectly, especially considering the Polomare incident."\r\n\r\n"Speaking of my former competitor..." Rarity\'s brow furrowed marginally despite her best effort not to show it. "How is she faring in the big city?"\r\n\r\n"Frankly \xe2\x80\x93" Coco drew a sigh of relief "\xe2\x80\x93 I don\'t know. And have no desire to find out."\r\n\r\nThe corners of Rarity\'s lips traveled upwards by a degree most ponies wouldn\'t even notice. "A wise decision, if you don\'t mind me saying that. She worked very hard to deserve ponies\' ostracism. I wonder whether she is happy now that she\'s finally earned it."\r\n\r\nCoco didn\'t answer, nor did she drag the topic on any longer. Suri Polomare was, like any other unwanted bygone, best left alone.\r\n\r\n"You, on the other hoof, seem to be taking the city by storm." Rarity nudged the earth pony\'s side with a hoof, a sly smile forming on her face. The blush on Coco\'s face only encouraged her to go on with the teasing. "Oh, don\'t be so modest, darling. The word about your partnership with that lovely zebra potion master have already left Manehattan and traveled within the upper classes of Canterlot. Who would have thought it would be perfumes?"\r\n\r\nCoco studied the patterns of cobble beneath her hooves as her cheeks threatened to burn the coat off her skin. "Well, the mares of my family have been known for their keen sense of smell for generations," she said, "but before I met Zaree, I have never expected I could use mine to test the aroma of perfumes."\r\n\r\n"Just think of the possibilities." Rarity waved her hoof at the sky, her eyes glimmering. "In a few years from now, every mare in Canterlot, Baltimare, Manehattan, and Fillydelphia shall be wearing my dresses and freshen herself up with your perfumes."\r\n\r\n"I don\'t know about every mare," Coco chuckled. She stopped and looked Rarity in the eyes. "But if they do, I will owe it all to you. If it weren\'t for you, Rarity, I would probably still be sewing buttons for Suri."\r\n\r\n"Nonsense, darling." Rarity shook her head. "I gave you but the tiniest of pushes, everything else is your own merit."\r\n\r\n"Sometimes, the tiniest of pushes moves that one small pebble which starts an avalanche, though." Coco smiled.\r\n\r\n"And what an avalanche it will be." Rarity\'s eyes glittered with tiny stars. "The Coco-Zaree perfumes will cause a stir, I\'m sure of it."\r\n\r\nThe earth pony rubbed the back of her head. "I don\'t think Zaree would want her name to appear on a perfume label. Zebras are very protective of their given name, you know. They consider sharing it a great honor, given only to those they trust and respect."\r\n\r\n"Imagine that, I had no idea." Rarity slowed down her trot, noticing Coco had stopped before the fountain. "Ponyville does have its own zebra herbal expert. She calls herself Zecora, but after what you\'ve told me, we have no way of knowing whether it\'s her real name."\r\n\r\nCoco scratched her chin. "It certainly sounds zebrish... But Zaree once mentioned zebra names are built of two parts, separated by an apostrophe. Most probably Miss Zecora only revealed half of her name to you, just like Zaree did to me."\r\n\r\n"Why would anypony\xe2\x80\x94or a zebra, for that matter\xe2\x80\x94do that?" Rarity stopped to look in Coco\'s eyes, her brow furrowed in shock and disbelief. "I would love to have my own name known and recognized. To think that somepony would intentionally hide it..."\r\n\r\n"Well, Zaree once told me full name is everything zebra shamans need to put a curse on someone. Perhaps that\'s the reason for their secrecy?" She shrugged. "I can\'t say I believe in any of that, but I\'m surely not going to challenge her beliefs."\r\n\r\n"Celestia forbid." Rarity shook her head. "This raises an interesting question, though. How do other ponies address her?"\r\n\r\n"When she introduces herself, she prefers to use the direct translation of her name in our language: Spirit Channel."\r\n\r\n"It does sound a tad more pony, I\'ll give her that." Rarity\'s face burst in a radiant smile as she turned to her friend. "Well then, I guess they will be Coco-Channel perfumes taking on Equestria then."\r\n\r\nCoco smiled to herself, containing a blush that crept on her cheeks.\r\n\r\nRarity motioned at the earth pony, leaning secretly towards her. "Before they do, however, I\'m positive you should think of appropriate names for them. Something that smells as divine as that little bottle you gave me, deserves a more fitting name than a simple \'No. 5\', wouldn\'t you agree?"\r\n\r\nCoco offered a sheepish smile. "It\'s only a prototype mixture, our fifth sample so far\xe2\x80\x94hence the name."\r\n\r\nRarity put her hoof on Coco\'s shoulder. "You should never underestimate the value of a catchy and creative name, my dear," she said, looking into Coco\'s eyes. "It can make a difference between life and death of your creation in other ponies\' mouths. And sometimes, word of mouth is an advertisement which brings the most customers."\r\n\r\nCoco nodded. She wasn\'t going to argue with a pony who clearly had more marketing experience than her.\r\n\r\nThey trotted alongside in silence, Coco taking in the rural architecture of Ponyville, until they stopped before a small, inconspicuous building.\r\n\r\n"And here we are," Rarity announced, pointing at the building. "The beauty center of Ponyville, the wellness pride of our little town, a perfect place to raise a pony\'s spirit and freshen her body..." she said, her face oozing with pride. The blush on Coco&#039;s face only encouraged her to go on with the teasing. &quot;Oh, don&#039;t be so modest, darling. The word about your partnership with that lovely zebra potion master have already left Manehattan and traveled within the upper classes of Canterlot. Who would have thought it would be perfumes?&quot;</p><p class="double">Coco studied the patterns of cobble beneath her hooves as her cheeks threatened to burn the coat off her skin. &quot;Well, the mares of my family have been known for their keen sense of smell for generations,&quot; she said, &quot;but before I met Zaree, I have never expected I could use mine to test the aroma of perfumes.&quot;</p><p class="double">&quot;Just think of the possibilities.&quot; Rarity waved her hoof at the sky, her eyes glimmering. &quot;In a few years from now, every mare in Canterlot, Baltimare, Manehattan, and Fillydelphia shall be wearing my dresses and freshen herself up with your perfumes.&quot;</p><p class="double">&quot;I don&#039;t know about every mare,&quot; Coco chuckled. She stopped and looked Rarity in the eyes. &quot;But if they do, I will owe it all to you. If it weren&#039;t for you, Rarity, I would probably still be sewing buttons for Suri.&quot;</p><p class="double">&quot;Nonsense, darling.&quot; Rarity shook her head. &quot;I gave you but the tiniest of pushes, everything else is your own merit.&quot;</p><p class="double">&quot;Sometimes, the tiniest of pushes moves that one small pebble which starts an avalanche, though.&quot; Coco smiled.</p><p class="double">&quot;And what an avalanche it will be.&quot; Rarity&#039;s eyes glittered with tiny stars. &quot;The Coco-Zaree perfumes will cause a stir, I&#039;m sure of it.&quot;</p><p class="double">The earth pony rubbed the back of her head. &quot;I don&#039;t think Zaree would want her name to appear on a perfume label. Zebras are very protective of their given name, you know. They consider sharing it a great honor, given only to those they trust and respect.&quot;</p><p class="double"><b>&quot;Imagine that, I had no idea.&quot; Rarity slowed down her trot, noticing Coco had stopped before the fountain. &quot;Ponyville does have its own zebra herbal expert. She calls herself Zecora, but after what you&#039;ve told me, we have no way of knowing whether it&#039;s her real name.&quot;</p><p class="double">Coco scratched her chin. &quot;It certainly sounds zebrish... But Zaree once mentioned zebra names are built of two parts, separated by an apostrophe. Most probably Miss Zecora only revealed half of her name to you, just like Zaree did to me.&quot;</p><p class="double">&quot;Why would anypony\xe2\x80\x94or a zebra, for that matter\xe2\x80\x94do that?&quot; Rarity stopped to look in Coco&#039;s eyes, her brow furrowed in shock and disbelief. &quot;I would love to have my own name known and recognized. To think that somepony would intentionally hide it...&quot;</b></p><p class="double">&quot;Well, Zaree once told me full name is everything zebra shamans need to put a curse on someone. Perhaps that&#039;s the reason for their secrecy?&quot; She shrugged. &quot;I can&#039;t say I believe in any of that, but I&#039;m surely not going to challenge her beliefs.&quot;</p><p class="double">&quot;Celestia forbid.&quot; Rarity shook her head. &quot;This raises an interesting question, though. How do other ponies address her?&quot;</p><p class="double">&quot;When she introduces herself, she prefers to use the direct translation of her name in our language: Spirit Channel.&quot;</p><p class="double">&quot;It does sound a tad more pony, I&#039;ll give her that.&quot; Rarity&#039;s face burst in a radiant smile as she turned to her friend. &quot;Well then, I guess they will be Coco-Channel perfumes taking on Equestria then.&quot;</p><p class="double">Coco smiled to herself, containing a blush that crept on her cheeks.</p><p class="double">Rarity motioned at the earth pony, leaning secretly towards her. &quot;Before they do, however, I&#039;m positive you should think of appropriate names for them. Something that smells as divine as that little bottle you gave me, deserves a more fitting name than a simple &#039;No. 5&#039;, wouldn&#039;t you agree?&quot;</p><p class="double">Coco offered a sheepish smile. &quot;It&#039;s only a prototype mixture, our fifth sample so far\xe2\x80\x94hence the name.&quot;</p><p class="double">Rarity put her hoof on Coco&#039;s shoulder. &quot;You should never underestimate the value of a catchy and creative name, my dear,&quot; she said, looking into Coco&#039;s eyes. &quot;It can make a difference between life and death of your creation in other ponies&#039; mouths. And sometimes, word of mouth is an advertisement which brings the most customers.&quot;</p><p class="double">Coco nodded. She wasn&#039;t going to argue with a pony who clearly had more marketing experience than her.</p><p class="double">They trotted alongside in silence, Coco taking in the rural architecture of Ponyville, until they stopped before a small, inconspicuous building.</p><p class="double">&quot;And here we are,&quot; Rarity announced, pointing at the building. &quot;The beauty center of Ponyville, the wellness pride of our little town, a perfect place to raise a pony&#039;s spirit and freshen her body...&quot; she said, her face oozing with pride. &quot;Let me introduce: the Day Spa.&quot;</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'values': ['//------------------------------//\n// rgwegrerg// Story: My Little Dashie\'s// by knighty//------------------------------//\n\n\t"Oh, I\'m so glad you managed to visit our quiet little town, Coco," Rarity sang, her vibrant voice reverberating through the market square. "I\'m sure it\'s a perfect place for taking a little break from a busy life of a city as glamorous as Manehattan. Though, I frankly don\'t understand how a pony could get tired of it." She winked.\r\n\r\n\tCoco studied the cobble path underneath her hooves, her face graced with a faint smile. "Believe me, Miss Rarity, I needed this break more than you could imagine."\'\r\n\t\r\n"Why do you insist on calling me miss?" \r\nRarity pouted, her lip quivering.\r\n "Am I that much older than you?" \r\nA mirror produced out of thin air sailed in front of the unicorn\'s face. \r\n"Have wrinkles already appeared on my face? \r\nBecause every time you call me miss I have a \r\ndistinct feeling of another one popping right out." \r\nShe looked deep in Coco\'s eyes. \r\n"Do you want me to feel old?"\r\n\t\r\n\t"Of course not... Rarity," Coco chuckled.\r\n\t\r\n\tThe fashionista clapped her hooves. "Excellent! Now, be a dear and tell me what you think of the prototype line I showed you, hm?" She narrowed her eyes slightly. "But remember, I want to hear an honest opinion."\r\n\tefwefwefwef\r\n\twegfwefwegweg\r\n\r\nwgwegwegweg\r\n\r\n"Fit for a princess." Coco exhaled. "You couldn\'t have chosen a more fitting name. Where do you get those amazing fabrics and ideas from?"\r\n\r\nRarity smiled, her eyes brimming with pride. "Why, thank you. I do hope you won\'t hold my desire not to reveal my trade secrets against me."\r\n\r\nThe earth pony smiled. "Of course not. I understand it perfectly, especially considering the Polomare incident."\r\n\r\n"Speaking of my former competitor..." Rarity\'s brow furrowed marginally despite her best effort not to show it. "How is she faring in the big city?"\r\n\r\n"Frankly \xe2\x80\x93" Coco drew a sigh of relief "\xe2\x80\x93 I don\'t know. And have no desire to find out."\r\n\r\nThe corners of Rarity\'s lips traveled upwards by a degree most ponies wouldn\'t even notice. "A wise decision, if you don\'t mind me saying that. She worked very hard to deserve ponies\' ostracism. I wonder whether she is happy now that she\'s finally earned it."\r\n\r\nCoco didn\'t answer, nor did she drag the topic on any longer. Suri Polomare was, like any other unwanted bygone, best left alone.\r\n\r\n"You, on the other hoof, seem to be taking the city by storm." Rarity nudged the earth pony\'s side with a hoof, a sly smile forming on her face. The blush on Coco\'s face only encouraged her to go on with the teasing. "Oh, don\'t be so modest, darling. The word about your partnership with that lovely zebra potion master have already left Manehattan and traveled within the upper classes of Canterlot. Who would have thought it would be perfumes?"\r\n\r\nCoco studied the patterns of cobble beneath her hooves as her cheeks threatened to burn the coat off her skin. "Well, the mares of my family have been known for their keen sense of smell for generations," she said, "but before I met Zaree, I have never expected I could use mine to test the aroma of perfumes."\r\n\r\n"Just think of the possibilities." Rarity waved her hoof at the sky, her eyes glimmering. "In a few years from now, every mare in Canterlot, Baltimare, Manehattan, and Fillydelphia shall be wearing my dresses and freshen herself up with your perfumes."\r\n\r\n"I don\'t know about every mare," Coco chuckled. She stopped and looked Rarity in the eyes. "But if they do, I will owe it all to you. If it weren\'t for you, Rarity, I would probably still be sewing buttons for Suri."\r\n\r\n"Nonsense, darling." Rarity shook her head. "I gave you but the tiniest of pushes, everything else is your own merit."\r\n\r\n"Sometimes, the tiniest of pushes moves that one small pebble which starts an avalanche, though." Coco smiled.\r\n\r\n"And what an avalanche it will be." Rarity\'s eyes glittered with tiny stars. "The Coco-Zaree perfumes will cause a stir, I\'m sure of it."\r\n\r\nThe earth pony rubbed the back of her head. "I don\'t think Zaree would want her name to appear on a perfume label. Zebras are very protective of their given name, you know. They consider sharing it a great honor, given only to those they trust and respect."\r\n\r\n"Imagine that, I had no idea." Rarity slowed down her trot, noticing Coco had stopped before the fountain. "Ponyville does have its own zebra herbal expert. She calls herself Zecora, but after what you\'ve told me, we have no way of knowing whether it\'s her real name."\r\n\r\nCoco scratched her chin. "It certainly sounds zebrish... But Zaree once mentioned zebra names are built of two parts, separated by an apostrophe. Most probably Miss Zecora only revealed half of her name to you, just like Zaree did to me."\r\n\r\n"Why would anypony\xe2\x80\x94or a zebra, for that matter\xe2\x80\x94do that?" Rarity stopped to look in Coco\'s eyes, her brow furrowed in shock and disbelief. "I would love to have my own name known and recognized. To think that somepony would intentionally hide it..."\r\n\r\n"Well, Zaree once told me full name is everything zebra shamans need to put a curse on someone. Perhaps that\'s the reason for their secrecy?" She shrugged. "I can\'t say I believe in any of that, but I\'m surely not going to challenge her beliefs."\r\n\r\n"Celestia forbid." Rarity shook her head. "This raises an interesting question, though. How do other ponies address her?"\r\n\r\n"When she introduces herself, she prefers to use the direct translation of her name in our language: Spirit Channel."\r\n\r\n"It does sound a tad more pony, I\'ll give her that." Rarity\'s face burst in a radiant smile as she turned to her friend. "Well then, I guess they will be Coco-Channel perfumes taking on Equestria then."\r\n\r\nCoco smiled to herself, containing a blush that crept on her cheeks.\r\n\r\nRarity motioned at the earth pony, leaning secretly towards her. "Before they do, however, I\'m positive you should think of appropriate names for them. Something that smells as divine as that little bottle you gave me, deserves a more fitting name than a simple \'No. 5\', wouldn\'t you agree?"\r\n\r\nCoco offered a sheepish smile. "It\'s only a prototype mixture, our fifth sample so far\xe2\x80\x94hence the name."\r\n\r\nRarity put her hoof on Coco\'s shoulder. "You should never underestimate the value of a catchy and creative name, my dear," she said, looking into Coco\'s eyes. "It can make a difference between life and death of your creation in other ponies\' mouths. And sometimes, word of mouth is an advertisement which brings the most customers."\r\n\r\nCoco nodded. She wasn\'t going to argue with a pony who clearly had more marketing experience than her.\r\n\r\nThey trotted alongside in silence, Coco taking in the rural architecture of Ponyville, until they stopped before a small, inconspicuous building.\r\n\r\n"And here we are," Rarity announced, pointing at the building. "The beauty center of Ponyville, the wellness pride of our little town, a perfect place to raise a pony\'s spirit and freshen her body..." she said, her face oozing with pride. "Let me introduce: the Day Spa."\r\n', 3, 660699, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/14/my-little-dashies">My Little Dashie&#039;s</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/knighty">knighty</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'3\'></a><h3>rgwegrerg</h3>\n<p class=\'indented\'>&quot;Oh, I&#039;m so glad you managed to visit our quiet little town, Coco,&quot; Rarity sang, her vibrant voice reverberating through the market square. &quot;I&#039;m sure it&#039;s a perfect place for taking a little break from a busy life of a city as glamorous as Manehattan. "I\'m sure it\'s a perfect place for taking a little break from a busy life of a city as glamorous as Manehattan. Though, I frankly don\'t understand how a pony could get tired of it." She winked.\r\n\r\n\tCoco studied the cobble path underneath her hooves, her face graced with a faint smile. "Believe me, Miss Rarity, I needed this break more than you could imagine."\'\r\n\t\r\n"Why do you insist on calling me miss?" \r\nRarity pouted, her lip quivering.\r\n "Am I that much older than you?" \r\nA mirror produced out of thin air sailed in front of the unicorn\'s face. \r\n"Have wrinkles already appeared on my face? \r\nBecause every time you call me miss I have a \r\ndistinct feeling of another one popping right out." \r\nShe looked deep in Coco\'s eyes. \r\n"Do you want me to feel old?"\r\n\t\r\n\t"Of course not... Rarity," Coco chuckled.\r\n\t\r\n\tThe fashionista clapped her hooves. "Excellent! Now, be a dear and tell me what you think of the prototype line I showed you, hm?" She narrowed her eyes slightly. "But remember, I want to hear an honest opinion."\r\n\tefwefwefwef\r\n\twegfwefwegweg\r\n\r\nwgwegwegweg\r\n\r\n"Fit for a princess." Coco exhaled. "You couldn\'t have chosen a more fitting name. Where do you get those amazing fabrics and ideas from?"\r\n\r\nRarity smiled, her eyes brimming with pride. "Why, thank you. I do hope you won\'t hold my desire not to reveal my trade secrets against me."\r\n\r\nThe earth pony smiled. "Of course not. I understand it perfectly, especially considering the Polomare incident."\r\n\r\n"Speaking of my former competitor..." Rarity\'s brow furrowed marginally despite her best effort not to show it. "How is she faring in the big city?"\r\n\r\n"Frankly \xe2\x80\x93" Coco drew a sigh of relief "\xe2\x80\x93 I don\'t know. And have no desire to find out."\r\n\r\nThe corners of Rarity\'s lips traveled upwards by a degree most ponies wouldn\'t even notice. "A wise decision, if you don\'t mind me saying that. She worked very hard to deserve ponies\' ostracism. I wonder whether she is happy now that she\'s finally earned it."\r\n\r\nCoco didn\'t answer, nor did she drag the topic on any longer. Suri Polomare was, like any other unwanted bygone, best left alone.\r\n\r\n"You, on the other hoof, seem to be taking the city by storm." Rarity nudged the earth pony\'s side with a hoof, a sly smile forming on her face. The blush on Coco\'s face only encouraged her to go on with the teasing. "Oh, don\'t be so modest, darling. The word about your partnership with that lovely zebra potion master have already left Manehattan and traveled within the upper classes of Canterlot. Who would have thought it would be perfumes?"\r\n\r\nCoco studied the patterns of cobble beneath her hooves as her cheeks threatened to burn the coat off her skin. "Well, the mares of my family have been known for their keen sense of smell for generations," she said, "but before I met Zaree, I have never expected I could use mine to test the aroma of perfumes."\r\n\r\n"Just think of the possibilities." Rarity waved her hoof at the sky, her eyes glimmering. "In a few years from now, every mare in Canterlot, Baltimare, Manehattan, and Fillydelphia shall be wearing my dresses and freshen herself up with your perfumes."\r\n\r\n"I don\'t know about every mare," Coco chuckled. She stopped and looked Rarity in the eyes. "But if they do, I will owe it all to you. If it weren\'t for you, Rarity, I would probably still be sewing buttons for Suri."\r\n\r\n"Nonsense, darling." Rarity shook her head. "I gave you but the tiniest of pushes, everything else is your own merit."\r\n\r\n"Sometimes, the tiniest of pushes moves that one small pebble which starts an avalanche, though." Coco smiled.\r\n\r\n"And what an avalanche it will be." Rarity\'s eyes glittered with tiny stars. "The Coco-Zaree perfumes will cause a stir, I\'m sure of it."\r\n\r\nThe earth pony rubbed the back of her head. "I don\'t think Zaree would want her name to appear on a perfume label. Zebras are very protective of their given name, you know. They consider sharing it a great honor, given only to those they trust and respect."\r\n\r\n"Imagine that, I had no idea." Rarity slowed down her trot, noticing Coco had stopped before the fountain. "Ponyville does have its own zebra herbal expert. She calls herself Zecora, but after what you\'ve told me, we have no way of knowing whether it\'s her real name."\r\n\r\nCoco scratched her chin. "It certainly sounds zebrish... But Zaree once mentioned zebra names are built of two parts, separated by an apostrophe. Most probably Miss Zecora only revealed half of her name to you, just like Zaree did to me."\r\n\r\n"Why would anypony\xe2\x80\x94or a zebra, for that matter\xe2\x80\x94do that?" Rarity stopped to look in Coco\'s eyes, her brow furrowed in shock and disbelief. "I would love to have my own name known and recognized. To think that somepony would intentionally hide it..."\r\n\r\n"Well, Zaree once told me full name is everything zebra shamans need to put a curse on someone. Perhaps that\'s the reason for their secrecy?" She shrugged. "I can\'t say I believe in any of that, but I\'m surely not going to challenge her beliefs."\r\n\r\n"Celestia forbid." Rarity shook her head. "This raises an interesting question, though. How do other ponies address her?"\r\n\r\n"When she introduces herself, she prefers to use the direct translation of her name in our language: Spirit Channel."\r\n\r\n"It does sound a tad more pony, I\'ll give her that." Rarity\'s face burst in a radiant smile as she turned to her friend. "Well then, I guess they will be Coco-Channel perfumes taking on Equestria then."\r\n\r\nCoco smiled to herself, containing a blush that crept on her cheeks.\r\n\r\nRarity motioned at the earth pony, leaning secretly towards her. "Before they do, however, I\'m positive you should think of appropriate names for them. Something that smells as divine as that little bottle you gave me, deserves a more fitting name than a simple \'No. 5\', wouldn\'t you agree?"\r\n\r\nCoco offered a sheepish smile. "It\'s only a prototype mixture, our fifth sample so far\xe2\x80\x94hence the name."\r\n\r\nRarity put her hoof on Coco\'s shoulder. "You should never underestimate the value of a catchy and creative name, my dear," she said, looking into Coco\'s eyes. "It can make a difference between life and death of your creation in other ponies\' mouths. And sometimes, word of mouth is an advertisement which brings the most customers."\r\n\r\nCoco nodded. She wasn\'t going to argue with a pony who clearly had more marketing experience than her.\r\n\r\nThey trotted alongside in silence, Coco taking in the rural architecture of Ponyville, until they stopped before a small, inconspicuous building.\r\n\r\n"And here we are," Rarity announced, pointing at the building. "The beauty center of Ponyville, the wellness pride of our little town, a perfect place to raise a pony\'s spirit and freshen her body..." she said, her face oozing with pride. "Let me introduce: the Day Spa."\r\n', 'epub': None}

In fact, this was probably the furthest Twilight had seen Rainbow Dash walk, well, ever.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I hate to say it, but you don\xe2\x80\x99t look just \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99. I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, but you look terrible.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow shot Twilight an evil look, but it looked pained, half-hearted.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLook; you have a massive gash in your forehead, you\xe2\x80\x99ve lost a lot of blood, you\xe2\x80\x99re staggering along, you look like you\xe2\x80\x99re going to be on the floor, if you don\xe2\x80\x99t get at least some rest, and yet you\xe2\x80\x99re still insisting that you\xe2\x80\x99re \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99? Is that what you want?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSomething seemed to catch Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eye, as she looked away from Twilight once more, instead gazing in the general direction of Sugarcube Corner.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twilight, do you see that?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x98Ah, so she completely ignored me.\xe2\x80\x99 Twilight noted.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSee what?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t that Pinkie Pie?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow waved her hoof in the direction of Sugarcube Corner. Twilight could see a pink-tinged shadow, walking away from the cake parlour, slowly, subtly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy, I do believe it is.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight tried to sound un-interested, as she was still annoyed with Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s dismissal of her worries; but it was intriguing, none the less. Where would Pinkie be going at this time of night?\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, that Pinkie Pie can be so random, huh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but to be honest, Rainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still more worried about you than what Pinkie could be doing at all. Don\xe2\x80\x99t think because you changed the subject and started talking cocky again that I\xe2\x80\x99ll just give up.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLook, Twi\xe2\x80\x99 just leave it, okay? I\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThere was silence once more.\nTwilight actually still felt pity for the cocky pegasus pony, but not for the pain. She really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let down her \xe2\x80\x98cool\xe2\x80\x99 exterior.\nThey walked, in the dead stillness, and Twilight thought to herself that it was always quite funny when pathetic fallacy applied to the real world. Then she kicked herself once more for becoming to analytical of her own life.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, this is me, then.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight and Rainbow were stood outside of the Library which acted as Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s surrogate home.\n\nShe looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still worried about you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked up into the sky, eyes darting away from Twilight.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, please?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just leave it.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nShe sounded exasperated, but in a quite, morose tone.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBut-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99ll it take to shut you up?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight was quiet for a second, as ideas formed in her head.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cStay the night here?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked back down at Twilight, but stared at her, not making eye contact.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou know, sleep at my house.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, yes, I know what you meant, but why?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t it obvious?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow stared at Twilight obliviously.\nObviously not, Twilight thought.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, you\xe2\x80\x99re not well, anypony can see that. If you stayed here, I could just\n keep an eye on you, in case you take a turn for the worse. I could get \nyou cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re covered in blood.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash, please? Just for me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t just tell me you\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cFine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight chuckled at her turn of phrase, but Rainbow obviously didn\xe2\x80\x99t get the humour in it.\n\nShe ushered Rainbow inside, before she could change her mind.\n", 'chapter_number': 1, 'parent_chapter_id': 18, 'chapter_html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'1\'></a><h3>Chapter 1</h3>\n<p><i>The party loving pink pony; Pinkie Pie, extinguished the last light within Sugarcube Corner, and with that, she was gone.</i></p><p class="double">***</p><p class="double">Rainbow Dash looked up into the flashing strobe and immersed herself. She blinked, and the outline of the resident pony DJ was obvious, nevertheless, when she blinked again, DJ Pon-3 was gone. Strobe lights were funny like that, and Rainbow Dash pondered whether that it was due </p><p>to the fact that ponies wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have had strobes in the wild. However, at this point she decided that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t really care, as she was out at a club, and that there probably wasn\xe2\x80\x99t enough alcohol in her bloodstream if she could think that coherently.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow! You dragged me out here, and now you\xe2\x80\x99re just ignoring me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">It was Twilight Sparkle.</p><p>Well, Rainbow had been told to call her Twilight, but she was unsure what she\xe2\x80\x99d done to warrant such a close friendship.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, you know when you just look into the lights, and then you go all trance-y? What\xe2\x80\x99s all that about?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Well, she had to think of something to say, and the \xe2\x80\x98lights thing\xe2\x80\x99 was already in her head\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUhhh, on second thoughts, never mind.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>\xe2\x80\x98Damn\xe2\x80\x99, Rainbow thought to herself. \xe2\x80\x98Why\xe2\x80\x99d I mention the lights, It was a stupid idea. Moving swiftly on\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, can I get you a drink?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99d be splendid, Rainbow.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cWell, it\xe2\x80\x99d help to know what you want.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, do you mind if I tell you something?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Huh, she always has to beat around the bush, but if I told her that, she\xe2\x80\x99d probably just laugh at me for using such a clich\xc3\xa9.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIs it what you want to drink?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, sort of.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cGo on then\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou may be surprised, but\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight goes off into an inaudible whisper.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll have to speak up, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight moved towards Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s ear and whispered;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve never drunk before.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Red spread across the purple pony\xe2\x80\x99s cheeks.</p><p>Rainbow stifled a laugh, but Twilight missed it, in her embarrassment.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t they have booze in Canterlot?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll just get you what I\xe2\x80\x99m having, shall I?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">In a small voice, Rainbow heard;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99d be nice.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBe back in ten seconds, flat.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow turned and clopped towards the bar. Maybe she\xe2\x80\x99d been a bit mean on the poor filly, but she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but think that at somepony had to be a bit mean on the new pony. Well, maybe the not so new pony. Twilight had been living in Ponyville for quite some time now. Anyway, Rainbow had invited her out, so that was something.</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cFour double Fillykicks please\xe2\x80\x9d She mumbled, nonchalantly.</p><p>Best to get a couple of rounds in, she thought; saves coming back for more so quickly.</p><p class="double">***</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash, What in Equestria are you doing?!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cJust having a bit of fun, Twilight, lighten up.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, okay, fine, just get off of the table!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight Sparkle was overwhelmed with the drunken version of Rainbow Dash, she </p><p>was even more of a loose cannon than she was normally.Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t even think that was possible.</p><p>\xe2\x80\x98She\xe2\x80\x99s ruining all order in the club!\xe2\x80\x99, Twilight thought; her obsessiveness rife within her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cGeez, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, stop being such a killjoy!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Despite the uncooperative speech, Rainbow still got off of the table, but she still insisted on flying down. And now she\xe2\x80\x99d started shortening her name to \xe2\x80\x98Twi\xe2\x80\x99. She\xe2\x80\x99d asked her to call her Twilight, not Twi\xe2\x80\x99, but Twilight had learnt not to argue with a drunk Rainbow Dash, as that was the reason she\xe2\x80\x99d ended up on the table in the first place.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twi\xe2\x80\x99, you wanna dance?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cFine, but only if you don\xe2\x80\x99t draw attention to us like that again.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLike what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow ought to know perfectly what she meant, eyes were only just being averted from them now, and there were quite a lot of ponies they were sharing the table with, who\xe2\x80\x99d put drinks down on said table.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, let\xe2\x80\x99s just go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Probably best to move along, before we\xe2\x80\x99re hoofed with the bill for the ponies who\xe2\x80\x99d put drinks down on said table.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I love this song!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how Rainbow could tell the difference, the thumping bass just sounded the same as the previous song, but she supposed that maybe the alcohol within her own bloodstream was beginning to take its toll on her senses.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not bad, I suppose.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLouder, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I can\xe2\x80\x99t hear you!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not bad, I said\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The two ponies were on a rather cramped dance floor, below the bar area, </p><p>crammed full of other rather drunk ponies, all doing some sort of </p><p>drunken dancing/stumbling about type affair.</p><p class="double">Suddenly, Rainbow fell forwards, jolted by a few over-enthusiastic colts, into Twilight, sending them both into a heap on the dance floor.</p><p class="double">As her senses came back to her, she could only hear an incredibly irate Rainbow Dash, screaming at the top of her lungs.</p><p>The music had stopped.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6F YOU HADN&#039;T BEEN BEING A BUNCH OF IDIOTS, WE\xe2\x80\x99D STILL ALL BE HAVING A\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was quiet.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c...NICE NIGHT OUT, BUT NO, YOU HAD TO\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried her best to be louder.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6GO AND- Twi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re awake!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight could feel pain across her forehead, spattered with a sort of wet feeling.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, can you open your eyes for me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She tried to open her eyes.</p><p>Vision came through, dappled by red.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, say something, please?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She pulled her head off of the floor, mostly ignoring the wetness, and looked up. There was a mostly red faced filly looking down at her, but she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t quite make out the face it\xe2\x80\x99s self.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, where are you?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still quiet.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUhhh\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The red filly waved a hoof at her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m right here, Twi\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut, what? Rainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re all red.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, blood is red, ya\xe2\x80\x99 know.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s sight had mostly come back to her by now, at least as far as she could tell, and Rainbow was right. Her face was largely red, caked in blood, with what looked like it was a rather deep gash on her forehead.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBy Celestia, Rainbow Dash! What happened?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked pale, in-between the spatters of blood.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook; I\xe2\x80\x99m fine, but I think we need to get out of here. Can you stand?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight pushed against the sticky floor with her fore legs, trying to ignore the pain in her left leg, followed by her putting her hind legs firmly out.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d live; it was probably just a couple of large bruises, she thought. Twilight looked around; the two of them really had brought the club to a standstill. There were mostly concerned faces, looking towards them, but slightly backed off. Twilight put this down to how irately Rainbow had been shouting at everyone. She also noticed a couple still going at it, dancing like a couple of mental ponies; she chuckled, and wished she had not a care like they did.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cC\xe2\x80\x99mon, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, let\xe2\x80\x99s go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow was impatiently beckoning her to the door, At least from the side, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all red. </p><p>The two fillies stepped out into the cold.</p><p class="double">Twilight could see her breath, during the silence after the club. Rainbow hadn\xe2\x80\x99t said anything since, so she\xe2\x80\x99d merely entranced herself staring at the patterns and the swirls in the low light of the night. However, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help think about convection currents, and how water vapour condenses when cold. Twilight smiled bitterly to herself, why couldn\xe2\x80\x99t she just enjoy things? She always had to over analyse everything.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re being awfully quiet.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAre you really sure you\xe2\x80\x99re okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m fine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">For somepony who was so concerned about her earlier on, Twilight was surprised that she was being so blunt when it came to concerns regarding herself. Maybe Rainbow just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let go of her cool exterior, like Twilight herself couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but analyse everything that came before her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou look awfully pale\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI said I was fine, Okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight could tell that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t.</p><p>Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s once powerful, confident stride had diminished into a stumbling, slow stagger, although it seemed as though she was trying to cover it up. Anyway, Twilight had a sneaking suspicion that Rainbow was quite hurt, as would be flying along side her, if she could. In fact, this was probably the furthest Twilight had seen Rainbow Dash walk, well, ever.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I hate to say it, but you don\xe2\x80\x99t look just \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99. I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, but you look terrible.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow shot Twilight an evil look, but it looked pained, half-hearted.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook; you have a massive gash in your forehead, you\xe2\x80\x99ve lost a lot of blood, you\xe2\x80\x99re staggering along, you look like you\xe2\x80\x99re going to be on the floor, if you don\xe2\x80\x99t get at least some rest, and yet you\xe2\x80\x99re still insisting that you\xe2\x80\x99re \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99? I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what your definition of \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99 is, but it\xe2\x80\x99s definitely wrong!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, she just let out a dissatisfied huff, and looked away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m just trying to be a friend, and you\xe2\x80\x99re just pushing me away. Is that what you want?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Something seemed to catch Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eye, as she looked away from Twilight once more, instead gazing in the general direction of Sugarcube Corner.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twilight, do you see that?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98Ah, so she completely ignored me.\xe2\x80\x99 Twilight noted.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSee what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t that Pinkie Pie?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow waved her hoof in the direction of Sugarcube Corner. Twilight could see a pink-tinged shadow, walking away from the cake parlour, slowly, subtly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy, I do believe it is.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight tried to sound un-interested, as she was still annoyed with Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s dismissal of her worries; but it was intriguing, none the less. Where would Pinkie be going at this time of night?</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, that Pinkie Pie can be so random, huh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but to be honest, Rainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still more worried about you than what Pinkie could be doing at all. Don\xe2\x80\x99t think because you changed the subject and started talking cocky again that I\xe2\x80\x99ll just give up.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook, Twi\xe2\x80\x99 just leave it, okay? I\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">There was silence once more.</p><p>Twilight actually still felt pity for the cocky pegasus pony, but not for the pain. She really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let down her \xe2\x80\x98cool\xe2\x80\x99 exterior.</p><p>They walked, in the dead stillness, and Twilight thought to herself that it was always quite funny when pathetic fallacy applied to the real world. Then she kicked herself once more for becoming to analytical of her own life.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, this is me, then.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight and Rainbow were stood outside of the Library which acted as Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s surrogate home.</p><p class="double">She looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still worried about you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked up into the sky, eyes darting away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, please?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just leave it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She sounded exasperated, but in a quite, morose tone.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99ll it take to shut you up?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight was quiet for a second, as ideas formed in her head.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cStay the night here?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked back down at Twilight, but stared at her, not making eye contact.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou know, sleep at my house.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, yes, I know what you meant, but why?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t it obvious?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow stared at Twilight obliviously.</p><p>Obviously not, Twilight thought.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, you\xe2\x80\x99re not well, anypony can see that. If you stayed here, I could just</p><p> keep an eye on you, in case you take a turn for the worse. I could get </p><p>you cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re covered in blood.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash, please? Just for me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t just tell me you\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cFine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight chuckled at her turn of phrase, but Rainbow obviously didn\xe2\x80\x99t get the humour in it.</p><p class="double">She ushered Rainbow inside, before she could change her mind.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'version': 1, 'parent_story_id': 15}, 'chapter_id': 18, 'cursor': <mysql.connector.cursor.MySQLCursor object at 0x02E4D3F0>, 'connection': <mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection object at 0x02E01A70>, 'html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'1\'></a><h3>Chapter 1</h3>\n<p><i>The party loving pink pony; Pinkie Pie, extinguished the last light within Sugarcube Corner, and with that, she was gone.</i></p><p class="double">***</p><p class="double">Rainbow Dash looked up into the flashing strobe and immersed herself. She blinked, and the outline of the resident pony DJ was obvious, nevertheless, when she blinked again, DJ Pon-3 was gone. Strobe lights were funny like that, and Rainbow Dash pondered whether that it was due </p><p>to the fact that ponies wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have had strobes in the wild. However, at this point she decided that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t really care, as she was out at a club, and that there probably wasn\xe2\x80\x99t enough alcohol in her bloodstream if she could think that coherently.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow! You dragged me out here, and now you\xe2\x80\x99re just ignoring me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">It was Twilight Sparkle.</p><p>Well, Rainbow had been told to call her Twilight, but she was unsure what she\xe2\x80\x99d done to warrant such a close friendship.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, you know when you just look into the lights, and then you go all trance-y? What\xe2\x80\x99s all that about?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Well, she had to think of something to say, and the \xe2\x80\x98lights thing\xe2\x80\x99 was already in her head\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUhhh, on second thoughts, never mind.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>\xe2\x80\x98Damn\xe2\x80\x99, Rainbow thought to herself. \xe2\x80\x98Why\xe2\x80\x99d I mention the lights, It was a stupid idea. Moving swiftly on\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, can I get you a drink?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99d be splendid, Rainbow.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cWell, it\xe2\x80\x99d help to know what you want.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, do you mind if I tell you something?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Huh, she always has to beat around the bush, but if I told her that, she\xe2\x80\x99d probably just laugh at me for using such a clich\xc3\xa9.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIs it what you want to drink?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, sort of.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cGo on then\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou may be surprised, but\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight goes off into an inaudible whisper.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll have to speak up, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight moved towards Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s ear and whispered;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve never drunk before.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Red spread across the purple pony\xe2\x80\x99s cheeks.</p><p>Rainbow stifled a laugh, but Twilight missed it, in her embarrassment.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t they have booze in Canterlot?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll just get you what I\xe2\x80\x99m having, shall I?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">In a small voice, Rainbow heard;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99d be nice.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBe back in ten seconds, flat.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow turned and clopped towards the bar. Maybe she\xe2\x80\x99d been a bit mean on the poor filly, but she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but think that at somepony had to be a bit mean on the new pony. Well, maybe the not so new pony. Twilight had been living in Ponyville for quite some time now. Anyway, Rainbow had invited her out, so that was something.</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cFour double Fillykicks please\xe2\x80\x9d She mumbled, nonchalantly.</p><p>Best to get a couple of rounds in, she thought; saves coming back for more so quickly.</p><p class="double">***</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash, What in Equestria are you doing?!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cJust having a bit of fun, Twilight, lighten up.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, okay, fine, just get off of the table!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight Sparkle was overwhelmed with the drunken version of Rainbow Dash, she </p><p>was even more of a loose cannon than she was normally.Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t even think that was possible.</p><p>\xe2\x80\x98She\xe2\x80\x99s ruining all order in the club!\xe2\x80\x99, Twilight thought; her obsessiveness rife within her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cGeez, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, stop being such a killjoy!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Despite the uncooperative speech, Rainbow still got off of the table, but she still insisted on flying down. And now she\xe2\x80\x99d started shortening her name to \xe2\x80\x98Twi\xe2\x80\x99. She\xe2\x80\x99d asked her to call her Twilight, not Twi\xe2\x80\x99, but Twilight had learnt not to argue with a drunk Rainbow Dash, as that was the reason she\xe2\x80\x99d ended up on the table in the first place.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twi\xe2\x80\x99, you wanna dance?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cFine, but only if you don\xe2\x80\x99t draw attention to us like that again.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLike what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow ought to know perfectly what she meant, eyes were only just being averted from them now, and there were quite a lot of ponies they were sharing the table with, who\xe2\x80\x99d put drinks down on said table.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, let\xe2\x80\x99s just go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Probably best to move along, before we\xe2\x80\x99re hoofed with the bill for the ponies who\xe2\x80\x99d put drinks down on said table.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I love this song!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how Rainbow could tell the difference, the thumping bass just sounded the same as the previous song, but she supposed that maybe the alcohol within her own bloodstream was beginning to take its toll on her senses.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not bad, I suppose.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLouder, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I can\xe2\x80\x99t hear you!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not bad, I said\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The two ponies were on a rather cramped dance floor, below the bar area, </p><p>crammed full of other rather drunk ponies, all doing some sort of </p><p>drunken dancing/stumbling about type affair.</p><p class="double">Suddenly, Rainbow fell forwards, jolted by a few over-enthusiastic colts, into Twilight, sending them both into a heap on the dance floor.</p><p class="double">As her senses came back to her, she could only hear an incredibly irate Rainbow Dash, screaming at the top of her lungs.</p><p>The music had stopped.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6F YOU HADN&#039;T BEEN BEING A BUNCH OF IDIOTS, WE\xe2\x80\x99D STILL ALL BE HAVING A\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was quiet.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c...NICE NIGHT OUT, BUT NO, YOU HAD TO\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried her best to be louder.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6GO AND- Twi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re awake!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight could feel pain across her forehead, spattered with a sort of wet feeling.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, can you open your eyes for me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She tried to open her eyes.</p><p>Vision came through, dappled by red.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, say something, please?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She pulled her head off of the floor, mostly ignoring the wetness, and looked up. There was a mostly red faced filly looking down at her, but she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t quite make out the face it\xe2\x80\x99s self.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, where are you?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still quiet.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUhhh\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The red filly waved a hoof at her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m right here, Twi\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut, what? Rainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re all red.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, blood is red, ya\xe2\x80\x99 know.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s sight had mostly come back to her by now, at least as far as she could tell, and Rainbow was right. Her face was largely red, caked in blood, with what looked like it was a rather deep gash on her forehead.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBy Celestia, Rainbow Dash! What happened?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked pale, in-between the spatters of blood.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook; I\xe2\x80\x99m fine, but I think we need to get out of here. Can you stand?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight pushed against the sticky floor with her fore legs, trying to ignore the pain in her left leg, followed by her putting her hind legs firmly out.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d live; it was probably just a couple of large bruises, she thought. Twilight looked around; the two of them really had brought the club to a standstill. There were mostly concerned faces, looking towards them, but slightly backed off. Twilight put this down to how irately Rainbow had been shouting at everyone. She also noticed a couple still going at it, dancing like a couple of mental ponies; she chuckled, and wished she had not a care like they did.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cC\xe2\x80\x99mon, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, let\xe2\x80\x99s go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow was impatiently beckoning her to the door, At least from the side, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all red. </p><p>The two fillies stepped out into the cold.</p><p class="double">Twilight could see her breath, during the silence after the club. Rainbow hadn\xe2\x80\x99t said anything since, so she\xe2\x80\x99d merely entranced herself staring at the patterns and the swirls in the low light of the night. However, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help think about convection currents, and how water vapour condenses when cold. Twilight smiled bitterly to herself, why couldn\xe2\x80\x99t she just enjoy things? She always had to over analyse everything.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re being awfully quiet.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAre you really sure you\xe2\x80\x99re okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m fine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">For somepony who was so concerned about her earlier on, Twilight was surprised that she was being so blunt when it came to concerns regarding herself. Maybe Rainbow just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let go of her cool exterior, like Twilight herself couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but analyse everything that came before her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou look awfully pale\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI said I was fine, Okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight could tell that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t.</p><p>Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s once powerful, confident stride had diminished into a stumbling, slow stagger, although it seemed as though she was trying to cover it up. Anyway, Twilight had a sneaking suspicion that Rainbow was quite hurt, as would be flying along side her, if she could. In fact, this was probably the furthest Twilight had seen Rainbow Dash walk, well, ever.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I hate to say it, but you don\xe2\x80\x99t look just \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99. I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, but you look terrible.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow shot Twilight an evil look, but it looked pained, half-hearted.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook; you have a massive gash in your forehead, you\xe2\x80\x99ve lost a lot of blood, you\xe2\x80\x99re staggering along, you look like you\xe2\x80\x99re going to be on the floor, if you don\xe2\x80\x99t get at least some rest, and yet you\xe2\x80\x99re still insisting that you\xe2\x80\x99re \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99? I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what your definition of \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99 is, but it\xe2\x80\x99s definitely wrong!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, she just let out a dissatisfied huff, and looked away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m just trying to be a friend, and you\xe2\x80\x99re just pushing me away. Is that what you want?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Something seemed to catch Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eye, as she looked away from Twilight once more, instead gazing in the general direction of Sugarcube Corner.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twilight, do you see that?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98Ah, so she completely ignored me.\xe2\x80\x99 Twilight noted.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSee what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t that Pinkie Pie?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow waved her hoof in the direction of Sugarcube Corner. Twilight could see a pink-tinged shadow, walking away from the cake parlour, slowly, subtly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy, I do believe it is.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight tried to sound un-interested, as she was still annoyed with Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s dismissal of her worries; but it was intriguing, none the less. Where would Pinkie be going at this time of night?</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, that Pinkie Pie can be so random, huh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but to be honest, Rainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still more worried about you than what Pinkie could be doing at all. Don\xe2\x80\x99t think because you changed the subject and started talking cocky again that I\xe2\x80\x99ll just give up.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook, Twi\xe2\x80\x99 just leave it, okay? I\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">There was silence once more.</p><p>Twilight actually still felt pity for the cocky pegasus pony, but not for the pain. She really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let down her \xe2\x80\x98cool\xe2\x80\x99 exterior.</p><p>They walked, in the dead stillness, and Twilight thought to herself that it was always quite funny when pathetic fallacy applied to the real world. Then she kicked herself once more for becoming to analytical of her own life.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, this is me, then.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight and Rainbow were stood outside of the Library which acted as Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s surrogate home.</p><p class="double">She looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still worried about you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked up into the sky, eyes darting away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, please?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just leave it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She sounded exasperated, but in a quite, morose tone.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99ll it take to shut you up?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight was quiet for a second, as ideas formed in her head.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cStay the night here?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked back down at Twilight, but stared at her, not making eye contact.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou know, sleep at my house.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, yes, I know what you meant, but why?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t it obvious?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow stared at Twilight obliviously.</p><p>Obviously not, Twilight thought.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, you\xe2\x80\x99re not well, anypony can see that. If you stayed here, I could just</p><p> keep an eye on you, in case you take a turn for the worse. I could get </p><p>you cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re covered in blood.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash, please? Just for me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t just tell me you\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cFine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight chuckled at her turn of phrase, but Rainbow obviously didn\xe2\x80\x99t get the humour in it.</p><p class="double">She ushered Rainbow inside, before she could change her mind.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'values': ["//------------------------------//\n// Chapter 1// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\nThe party loving pink pony; Pinkie Pie, extinguished the last light within Sugarcube Corner, and with that, she was gone.\n\n***\n\nRainbow Dash looked up into the flashing strobe and immersed herself.
