You dragged me out here, and now you\xe2\x80\x99re just ignoring me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIt was Twilight Sparkle.\nWell, Rainbow had been told to call her Twilight, but she was unsure what she\xe2\x80\x99d done to warrant such a close friendship.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, you know when you just look into the lights, and then you go all trance-y? What\xe2\x80\x99s all that about?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nWell, she had to think of something to say, and the \xe2\x80\x98lights thing\xe2\x80\x99 was already in her head\xe2\x80\xa6\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cUhhh, on second thoughts, never mind.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\xe2\x80\x98Damn\xe2\x80\x99, Rainbow thought to herself. \xe2\x80\x98Why\xe2\x80\x99d I mention the lights, It was a stupid idea. Moving swiftly on\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, can I get you a drink?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99d be splendid, Rainbow.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\xe2\x80\xa6\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, it\xe2\x80\x99d help to know what you want.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, do you mind if I tell you something?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nHuh, she always has to beat around the bush, but if I told her that, she\xe2\x80\x99d probably just laugh at me for using such a clich\xc3\xa9.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIs it what you want to drink?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, sort of.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\xe2\x80\xa6\n\xe2\x80\x9cGo on then\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou may be surprised, but\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight goes off into an inaudible whisper.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99ll have to speak up, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight moved towards Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s ear and whispered;\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve never drunk before.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRed spread across the purple pony\xe2\x80\x99s cheeks.\nRainbow stifled a laugh, but Twilight missed it, in her embarrassment.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t they have booze in Canterlot?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll just get you what I\xe2\x80\x99m having, shall I?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIn a small voice, Rainbow heard;\n\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99d be nice.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBe back in ten seconds, flat.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow turned and clopped towards the bar. Maybe she\xe2\x80\x99d been a bit mean on the poor filly, but she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but think that at somepony had to be a bit mean on the new pony. Well, maybe the not so new pony. Twilight had been living in Ponyville for quite some time now. Anyway, Rainbow had invited her out, so that was something.\n\xe2\x80\x9cFour double Fillykicks please\xe2\x80\x9d She mumbled, nonchalantly.\nBest to get a couple of rounds in, she thought; saves coming back for more so quickly.\n\n***\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash, What in Equestria are you doing?!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cJust having a bit of fun, Twilight, lighten up.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, okay, fine, just get off of the table!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight Sparkle was overwhelmed with the drunken version of Rainbow Dash, she \nwas even more of a loose cannon than she was normally.Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t even think that was possible.\n\xe2\x80\x98She\xe2\x80\x99s ruining all order in the club!\xe2\x80\x99, Twilight thought; her obsessiveness rife within her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cGeez, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, stop being such a killjoy!\xe2\x80\x9d\nDespite the uncooperative speech, Rainbow still got off of the table, but she still insisted on flying down. And now she\xe2\x80\x99d started shortening her name to \xe2\x80\x98Twi\xe2\x80\x99. She\xe2\x80\x99d asked her to call her Twilight, not Twi\xe2\x80\x99, but Twilight had learnt not to argue with a drunk Rainbow Dash, as that was the reason she\xe2\x80\x99d ended up on the table in the first place.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twi\xe2\x80\x99, you wanna dance?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cFine, but only if you don\xe2\x80\x99t draw attention to us like that again.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLike what?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow ought to know perfectly what she meant, eyes were only just being averted from them now, and there were quite a lot of ponies they were sharing the table with, who\xe2\x80\x99d put drinks down on said table.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, let\xe2\x80\x99s just go.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nProbably best to move along, before we\xe2\x80\x99re hoofed with the bill for the ponies who\xe2\x80\x99d put drinks down on said table.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I love this song!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how Rainbow could tell the difference, the thumping bass just sounded the same as the previous song, but she supposed that maybe the alcohol within her own bloodstream was beginning to take its toll on her senses.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not bad, I suppose.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLouder, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I can\xe2\x80\x99t hear you!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not bad, I said\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe two ponies were on a rather cramped dance floor, below the bar area, \ncrammed full of other rather drunk ponies, all doing some sort of \ndrunken dancing/stumbling about type affair.\n\nSuddenly, Rainbow fell forwards, jolted by a few over-enthusiastic colts, into Twilight, sending them both into a heap on the dance floor.\n\nAs her senses came back to her, she could only hear an incredibly irate Rainbow Dash, screaming at the top of her lungs.\nThe music had stopped.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6F YOU HADN'T BEEN BEING A BUNCH OF IDIOTS, WE\xe2\x80\x99D STILL ALL BE HAVING A\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was quiet.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9c...NICE NIGHT OUT, BUT NO, YOU HAD TO\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried her best to be louder.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6GO AND- Twi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re awake!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight could feel pain across her forehead, spattered with a sort of wet feeling.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, can you open your eyes for me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nShe tried to open her eyes.\nVision came through, dappled by red.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, say something, please?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nShe pulled her head off of the floor, mostly ignoring the wetness, and looked up. There was a mostly red faced filly looking down at her, but she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t quite make out the face it\xe2\x80\x99s self.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, where are you?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still quiet.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cUhhh\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe red filly waved a hoof at her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m right here, Twi\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBut, what? Rainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re all red.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, blood is red, ya\xe2\x80\x99 know.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s sight had mostly come back to her by now, at least as far as she could tell, and Rainbow was right. Her face was largely red, caked in blood, with what looked like it was a rather deep gash on her forehead.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBy Celestia, Rainbow Dash! What happened?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked pale, in-between the spatters of blood.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLook; I\xe2\x80\x99m fine, but I think we need to get out of here. Can you stand?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight pushed against the sticky floor with her fore legs, trying to ignore the pain in her left leg, followed by her putting her hind legs firmly out.  \nShe\xe2\x80\x99d live; it was probably just a couple of large bruises, she thought. Twilight looked around; the two of them really had brought the club to a standstill. There were mostly concerned faces, looking towards them, but slightly backed off. Twilight put this down to how irately Rainbow had been shouting at everyone. She also noticed a couple still going at it, dancing like a couple of mental ponies; she chuckled, and wished she had not a care like they did.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cC\xe2\x80\x99mon, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, let\xe2\x80\x99s go.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow was impatiently beckoning her to the door, At least from the side, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all red. \nThe two fillies stepped out into the cold.\n\nTwilight could see her breath, during the silence after the club. Rainbow hadn\xe2\x80\x99t said anything since, so she\xe2\x80\x99d merely entranced herself staring at the patterns and the swirls in the low light of the night. However, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help think about convection currents, and how water vapour condenses when cold. Twilight smiled bitterly to herself, why couldn\xe2\x80\x99t she just enjoy things? She always had to over analyse everything.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re being awfully quiet.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAre you really sure you\xe2\x80\x99re okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m fine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nFor somepony who was so concerned about her earlier on, Twilight was surprised that she was being so blunt when it came to concerns regarding herself. Maybe Rainbow just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let go of her cool exterior, like Twilight herself couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but analyse everything that came before her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou look awfully pale\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI said I was fine, Okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight could tell that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t.\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s once powerful, confident stride had diminished into a stumbling, slow stagger, although it seemed as though she was trying to cover it up. Anyway, Twilight had a sneaking suspicion that Rainbow was quite hurt, as would be flying along side her, if she could. In fact, this was probably the furthest Twilight had seen Rainbow Dash walk, well, ever.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I hate to say it, but you don\xe2\x80\x99t look just \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99. I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, but you look terrible.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow shot Twilight an evil look, but it looked pained, half-hearted.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLook; you have a massive gash in your forehead, you\xe2\x80\x99ve lost a lot of blood, you\xe2\x80\x99re staggering along, you look like you\xe2\x80\x99re going to be on the floor, if you don\xe2\x80\x99t get at least some rest, and yet you\xe2\x80\x99re still insisting that you\xe2\x80\x99re \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99? I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what your definition of \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99 is, but it\xe2\x80\x99s definitely wrong!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, she just let out a dissatisfied huff, and looked away from Twilight.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m just trying to be a friend, and you\xe2\x80\x99re just pushing me away. Is that what you want?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSomething seemed to catch Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eye, as she looked away from Twilight once more, instead gazing in the general direction of Sugarcube Corner.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twilight, do you see that?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x98Ah, so she completely ignored me.\xe2\x80\x99 Twilight noted.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSee what?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t that Pinkie Pie?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow waved her hoof in the direction of Sugarcube Corner. Twilight could see a pink-tinged shadow, walking away from the cake parlour, slowly, subtly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy, I do believe it is.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight tried to sound un-interested, as she was still annoyed with Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s dismissal of her worries; but it was intriguing, none the less. Where would Pinkie be going at this time of night?\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, that Pinkie Pie can be so random, huh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but to be honest, Rainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still more worried about you than what Pinkie could be doing at all. Don\xe2\x80\x99t think because you changed the subject and started talking cocky again that I\xe2\x80\x99ll just give up.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLook, Twi\xe2\x80\x99 just leave it, okay? I\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThere was silence once more.\nTwilight actually still felt pity for the cocky pegasus pony, but not for the pain. She really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let down her \xe2\x80\x98cool\xe2\x80\x99 exterior.\nThey walked, in the dead stillness, and Twilight thought to herself that it was always quite funny when pathetic fallacy applied to the real world. Then she kicked herself once more for becoming to analytical of her own life.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, this is me, then.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight and Rainbow were stood outside of the Library which acted as Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s surrogate home.\n\nShe looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still worried about you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked up into the sky, eyes darting away from Twilight.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, please?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just leave it.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nShe sounded exasperated, but in a quite, morose tone.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBut-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99ll it take to shut you up?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight was quiet for a second, as ideas formed in her head.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cStay the night here?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked back down at Twilight, but stared at her, not making eye contact.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou know, sleep at my house.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, yes, I know what you meant, but why?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t it obvious?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow stared at Twilight obliviously.\nObviously not, Twilight thought.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, you\xe2\x80\x99re not well, anypony can see that. If you stayed here, I could just\n keep an eye on you, in case you take a turn for the worse. I could get \nyou cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re covered in blood.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash, please? Just for me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t just tell me you\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cFine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight chuckled at her turn of phrase, but Rainbow obviously didn\xe2\x80\x99t get the humour in it.\n\nShe ushered Rainbow inside, before she could change her mind.\n", 1, 18, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'1\'></a><h3>Chapter 1</h3>\n<p><i>The party loving pink pony; Pinkie Pie, extinguished the last light within Sugarcube Corner, and with that, she was gone.</i></p><p class="double">***</p><p class="double">Rainbow Dash looked up into the flashing strobe and immersed herself. She\xe2\x80\x99d asked her to call her Twilight, not Twi\xe2\x80\x99, but Twilight had learnt not to argue with a drunk Rainbow Dash, as that was the reason she\xe2\x80\x99d ended up on the table in the first place.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twi\xe2\x80\x99, you wanna dance?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cFine, but only if you don\xe2\x80\x99t draw attention to us like that again.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLike what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow ought to know perfectly what she meant, eyes were only just being averted from them now, and there were quite a lot of ponies they were sharing the table with, who\xe2\x80\x99d put drinks down on said table.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, let\xe2\x80\x99s just go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Probably best to move along, before we\xe2\x80\x99re hoofed with the bill for the ponies who\xe2\x80\x99d put drinks down on said table.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I love this song!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how Rainbow could tell the difference, the thumping bass just sounded the same as the previous song, but she supposed that maybe the alcohol within her own bloodstream was beginning to take its toll on her senses.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not bad, I suppose.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLouder, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I can\xe2\x80\x99t hear you!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not bad, I said\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The two ponies were on a rather cramped dance floor, below the bar area, </p><p>crammed full of other rather drunk ponies, all doing some sort of </p><p>drunken dancing/stumbling about type affair.</p><p class="double">Suddenly, Rainbow fell forwards, jolted by a few over-enthusiastic colts, into Twilight, sending them both into a heap on the dance floor.</p><p class="double">As her senses came back to her, she could only hear an incredibly irate Rainbow Dash, screaming at the top of her lungs.</p><p>The music had stopped.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6F YOU HADN&#039;T BEEN BEING A BUNCH OF IDIOTS, WE\xe2\x80\x99D STILL ALL BE HAVING A\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was quiet.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c...NICE NIGHT OUT, BUT NO, YOU HAD TO\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight tried her best to be louder.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6GO AND- Twi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re awake!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight could feel pain across her forehead, spattered with a sort of wet feeling.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, can you open your eyes for me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She tried to open her eyes.</p><p>Vision came through, dappled by red.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, say something, please?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She pulled her head off of the floor, mostly ignoring the wetness, and looked up. There was a mostly red faced filly looking down at her, but she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t quite make out the face it\xe2\x80\x99s self.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, where are you?\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still quiet.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUhhh\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The red filly waved a hoof at her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m right here, Twi\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut, what? Rainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re all red.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, blood is red, ya\xe2\x80\x99 know.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s sight had mostly come back to her by now, at least as far as she could tell, and Rainbow was right. Her face was largely red, caked in blood, with what looked like it was a rather deep gash on her forehead.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBy Celestia, Rainbow Dash! What happened?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked pale, in-between the spatters of blood.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook; I\xe2\x80\x99m fine, but I think we need to get out of here. Can you stand?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight pushed against the sticky floor with her fore legs, trying to ignore the pain in her left leg, followed by her putting her hind legs firmly out.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d live; it was probably just a couple of large bruises, she thought. Twilight looked around; the two of them really had brought the club to a standstill. There were mostly concerned faces, looking towards them, but slightly backed off. Twilight put this down to how irately Rainbow had been shouting at everyone. She also noticed a couple still going at it, dancing like a couple of mental ponies; she chuckled, and wished she had not a care like they did.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cC\xe2\x80\x99mon, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, let\xe2\x80\x99s go.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow was impatiently beckoning her to the door, At least from the side, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all red. </p><p>The two fillies stepped out into the cold.</p><p class="double">Twilight could see her breath, during the silence after the club. Rainbow hadn\xe2\x80\x99t said anything since, so she\xe2\x80\x99d merely entranced herself staring at the patterns and the swirls in the low light of the night. However, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help think about convection currents, and how water vapour condenses when cold. Twilight smiled bitterly to herself, why couldn\xe2\x80\x99t she just enjoy things? She always had to over analyse everything.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re being awfully quiet.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAre you really sure you\xe2\x80\x99re okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m fine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">For somepony who was so concerned about her earlier on, Twilight was surprised that she was being so blunt when it came to concerns regarding herself. Maybe Rainbow just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let go of her cool exterior, like Twilight herself couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but analyse everything that came before her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou look awfully pale\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI said I was fine, Okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight could tell that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t.</p><p>Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s once powerful, confident stride had diminished into a stumbling, slow stagger, although it seemed as though she was trying to cover it up. Anyway, Twilight had a sneaking suspicion that Rainbow was quite hurt, as would be flying along side her, if she could. In fact, this was probably the furthest Twilight had seen Rainbow Dash walk, well, ever.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I hate to say it, but you don\xe2\x80\x99t look just \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99. I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, but you look terrible.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow shot Twilight an evil look, but it looked pained, half-hearted.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook; you have a massive gash in your forehead, you\xe2\x80\x99ve lost a lot of blood, you\xe2\x80\x99re staggering along, you look like you\xe2\x80\x99re going to be on the floor, if you don\xe2\x80\x99t get at least some rest, and yet you\xe2\x80\x99re still insisting that you\xe2\x80\x99re \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99? I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what your definition of \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99 is, but it\xe2\x80\x99s definitely wrong!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, she just let out a dissatisfied huff, and looked away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m just trying to be a friend, and you\xe2\x80\x99re just pushing me away. Is that what you want?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Something seemed to catch Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eye, as she looked away from Twilight once more, instead gazing in the general direction of Sugarcube Corner.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twilight, do you see that?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98Ah, so she completely ignored me.\xe2\x80\x99 Twilight noted.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSee what?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t that Pinkie Pie?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow waved her hoof in the direction of Sugarcube Corner. Twilight could see a pink-tinged shadow, walking away from the cake parlour, slowly, subtly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy, I do believe it is.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight tried to sound un-interested, as she was still annoyed with Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s dismissal of her worries; but it was intriguing, none the less. Where would Pinkie be going at this time of night?</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, that Pinkie Pie can be so random, huh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but to be honest, Rainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still more worried about you than what Pinkie could be doing at all. Don\xe2\x80\x99t think because you changed the subject and started talking cocky again that I\xe2\x80\x99ll just give up.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLook, Twi\xe2\x80\x99 just leave it, okay? I\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">There was silence once more.</p><p>Twilight actually still felt pity for the cocky pegasus pony, but not for the pain. She really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let down her \xe2\x80\x98cool\xe2\x80\x99 exterior.</p><p>They walked, in the dead stillness, and Twilight thought to herself that it was always quite funny when pathetic fallacy applied to the real world. Then she kicked herself once more for becoming to analytical of her own life.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, this is me, then.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight and Rainbow were stood outside of the Library which acted as Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s surrogate home.</p><p class="double">She looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still worried about you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked up into the sky, eyes darting away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, please?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just leave it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She sounded exasperated, but in a quite, morose tone.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99ll it take to shut you up?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight was quiet for a second, as ideas formed in her head.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cStay the night here?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow looked back down at Twilight, but stared at her, not making eye contact.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou know, sleep at my house.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, yes, I know what you meant, but why?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t it obvious?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow stared at Twilight obliviously.</p><p>Obviously not, Twilight thought.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, you\xe2\x80\x99re not well, anypony can see that. Her face was largely red, caked in blood, with what looked like it was a rather deep gash on her forehead.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBy Celestia, Rainbow Dash! Can you stand?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight pushed against the sticky floor with her fore legs, trying to ignore the pain in her left leg, followed by her putting her hind legs firmly out.  \nShe\xe2\x80\x99d live; it was probably just a couple of large bruises, she thought. Twilight looked around; the two of them really had brought the club to a standstill. There were mostly concerned faces, looking towards them, but slightly backed off. Twilight put this down to how irately Rainbow had been shouting at everyone. She also noticed a couple still going at it, dancing like a couple of mental ponies; she chuckled, and wished she had not a care like they did.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cC\xe2\x80\x99mon, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, let\xe2\x80\x99s go.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow was impatiently beckoning her to the door, At least from the side, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all red. \nThe two fillies stepped out into the cold.\n\nTwilight could see her breath, during the silence after the club. Rainbow hadn\xe2\x80\x99t said anything since, so she\xe2\x80\x99d merely entranced herself staring at the patterns and the swirls in the low light of the night. However, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help think about convection currents, and how water vapour condenses when cold. Twilight smiled bitterly to herself, why couldn\xe2\x80\x99t she just enjoy things? She always had to over analyse everything.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re being awfully quiet.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAre you really sure you\xe2\x80\x99re okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m fine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nFor somepony who was so concerned about her earlier on, Twilight was surprised that she was being so blunt when it came to concerns regarding herself. Maybe Rainbow just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let go of her cool exterior, like Twilight herself couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but analyse everything that came before her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou look awfully pale\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI said I was fine, Okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight could tell that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t.\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s once powerful, confident stride had diminished into a stumbling, slow stagger, although it seemed as though she was trying to cover it up. Anyway, Twilight had a sneaking suspicion that Rainbow was quite hurt, as would be flying along side her, if she could. In fact, this was probably the furthest Twilight had seen Rainbow Dash walk, well, ever.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I hate to say it, but you don\xe2\x80\x99t look just \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99. I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, but you look terrible.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow shot Twilight an evil look, but it looked pained, half-hearted.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLook; you have a massive gash in your forehead, you\xe2\x80\x99ve lost a lot of blood, you\xe2\x80\x99re staggering along, you look like you\xe2\x80\x99re going to be on the floor, if you don\xe2\x80\x99t get at least some rest, and yet you\xe2\x80\x99re still insisting that you\xe2\x80\x99re \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99? I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what your definition of \xe2\x80\x98fine\xe2\x80\x99 is, but it\xe2\x80\x99s definitely wrong!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond, she just let out a dissatisfied huff, and looked away from Twilight.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m just trying to be a friend, and you\xe2\x80\x99re just pushing me away. Is that what you want?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSomething seemed to catch Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eye, as she looked away from Twilight once more, instead gazing in the general direction of Sugarcube Corner.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHey Twilight, do you see that?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x98Ah, so she completely ignored me.\xe2\x80\x99 Twilight noted.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSee what?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t that Pinkie Pie?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow waved her hoof in the direction of Sugarcube Corner. Twilight could see a pink-tinged shadow, walking away from the cake parlour, slowly, subtly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy, I do believe it is.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight tried to sound un-interested, as she was still annoyed with Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s dismissal of her worries; but it was intriguing, none the less. Where would Pinkie be going at this time of night?\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, that Pinkie Pie can be so random, huh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but to be honest, Rainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still more worried about you than what Pinkie could be doing at all. Don\xe2\x80\x99t think because you changed the subject and started talking cocky again that I\xe2\x80\x99ll just give up.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLook, Twi\xe2\x80\x99 just leave it, okay? I\xe2\x80\x99ll be fine.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThere was silence once more.\nTwilight actually still felt pity for the cocky pegasus pony, but not for the pain. She really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let down her \xe2\x80\x98cool\xe2\x80\x99 exterior.\nThey walked, in the dead stillness, and Twilight thought to herself that it was always quite funny when pathetic fallacy applied to the real world. Then she kicked herself once more for becoming to analytical of her own life.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, this is me, then.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight and Rainbow were stood outside of the Library which acted as Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s surrogate home.\n\nShe looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I\xe2\x80\x99m still worried about you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked up into the sky, eyes darting away from Twilight.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, please?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just leave it.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nShe sounded exasperated, but in a quite, morose tone.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBut-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99ll it take to shut you up?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight was quiet for a second, as ideas formed in her head.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cStay the night here?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow looked back down at Twilight, but stared at her, not making eye contact.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou know, sleep at my house.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, yes, I know what you meant, but why?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIsn\xe2\x80\x99t it obvious?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow stared at Twilight obliviously.\nObviously not, Twilight thought.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, you\xe2\x80\x99re not well, anypony can see that. Of course it\xe2\x80\x99s still going to hurt!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight was being far too chirpy for Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tired, pained head, and so she chose to remain quiet.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, we ought to get you cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re absolutely caked in blood!\xe2\x80\x9d\nIt was true; she could feel its dryness clinging to her face, stiffening her mane, beginning to itch.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to run you a nice, warm bath! At least it was functional, she \nthought to herself. Some of the newer designer bathroom suites had \nstupid twiddly, nonsensical handles on the faucets. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have time to put up with such gimmicks! As alcohol consumption \nincreases, reactions will become even more sluggish and delays in physical and mental coordination will become far more pronounced.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n was pleased with herself; she\xe2\x80\x99d remembered the quote with such ease, \nalthough she was a bit disappointed that she\xe2\x80\x99d turned to \xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 \nbefore the acclaimed yet controversial thesis; \xe2\x80\x9cAlcohol: The bane or \nfather of Equestria?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n sat down on the cold, tiled floor of the bathroom, and brought her hoof\n over her fringe. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure why it was so odd for Rainbow in \nparticular; it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel quite right.\n\nMaybe it was because she was too cool to bleed?\nTwilight\n knew this was complete nonsense, the moment she thought it, but she \nentertained the thought, if only momentarily, just out of mild humour. \nAnyway, the cocky pony would probably insist that she was too cool for \nbleeding, regardless of the facts.\n\nCondensation\n began to form on the tiled floor. Twilight slid her hoof \nhalf-heartedly, causing a light, traced line to form across a few tiles.\n The line, however, was only definite for a couple of seconds, as \ncondensation began to incur upon the divide she\xe2\x80\x99d drawn.\nTwilight\n didn\xe2\x80\x99t like this lack of certainty; it was as if as soon as she\xe2\x80\x99d \ncreated the definite, perfect line, the boundaries were blurred. It was \nas if the condensation was disobeying her rules, trying to overwhelm the\n change, trying to remain the same.\n\nHowever,\n Twilight still felt a sense of victory over the constantly condensing \ntiles: Even if it covered up the lines she\xe2\x80\x99d created, there was still \npresence. If you looked, ever so closely, you could see that there was \nindeed a line there before;\nIt\xe2\x80\x99d merely just\xe2\x80\xa6 changed.\n\nTwilight thought back to the events of the evening, and realised that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually know why\n Rainbow was bleeding so much. Well, she knew that it had some relevance\n to a collision between them, but nothing like a straight up collision \ncould have caused such a deep gash as the one Rainbow had acquired upon \nher head. To do something like that, somepony would have to use \nsomething sharp, something piercing.\n\nA\n wave of realisation overwhelmed Twilight, and she leapt to her feet, \nleaving wet hoofprints upon the floor, soon to be consumed by the \ncondensation. She staggered over to the sink, snagging a towel en route.\n However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the sink Twilight was after, but the mirror above \nit.\n She slowly brought the towel up to the \nonce reflective mirror.  Shaking, Twilight slid the flannelly material \nacross the surface, and she was presented with a fleeting look at her \nown face.\nIt may well have only been distinct for a couple of seconds, but she saw it. Her horn was red.\nHowever, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a sort of jolly red, not the kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with whimsical, happy things.\n\nNo.\n\nIt was a horrible red. A dark, accusatory crimson.\nEven\n though the outline was no longer visible, it was still there. Twilight \ncould see the marks on the mirror, from where the condensation hadn\xe2\x80\x99t \nquite healed over properly, and within that, she saw herself.\nShe was only a smudge, when viewed through the veil of the condensated mirror.\nShe was a Purple smudge; Indefinite.\nDashed with crimson.', 'chapter_number': 2, 'parent_chapter_id': 25, 'chapter_html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'2\'></a><h3>Everything Goes My Way</h3>\n<p>The library seemed vast, shrouded in darkness.</p><p> The cavernous room was eerie, and the motley assortment of books formed</p><p> cold, unnatural shapes, juxtaposing the soft, gradual shapes of the </p><p>clouds Rainbow Dash was so used to coming home to. Long shadows of cast </p><p>aside books littered the floor, making the library seem somewhat even </p><p>more surreal. At least the shadows weren\xe2\x80\x99t definite anymore; they </p><p>petered out into grey, slowly morphing back into the warm, flickering </p><p>yellows of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s candlelight. It was more like the clouds of her </p><p>home, which settled Rainbow, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t like the incessant </p><p>flickering, it seemed far too uncertain, almost ethereal.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, do you want to sit down?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She jumped, retracting away from what had seemed to be a bellowing noise, against the ambience.</p><p>Twilight may have noticed, but Rainbow tried her best to shrug it off, with a non-committal huff.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, why not.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> slumped down onto the sofa that Twilight was gesturing to, and shut out</p><p> the confusing half-light of the library. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let the strange </p><p>shapes and shrouds faze her, she was supposed to be strong.</p><p>No, she was strong!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, could I get a glass of water?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cCertainly, Rainbow.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> turned around, rump facing Rainbow, wiggling as she slowly moved </p><p>towards the basin, just out of the main library area. Just before </p><p>Twilight moved out of earshot, Rainbow heard her mumble to herself.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, and a please wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t go amiss, Miss \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99m too full of myself to be polite-\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> went on, but Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t care much, at least she was getting what </p><p>she wanted; her body was crying out for hydration, and she knew Twilight</p><p> was good enough natured to comply with her meagre demands.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cMiss</p><p> Dash, here\xe2\x80\x99s the water that you so eagerly await!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was</p><p> a cusp above sarcastic. \xe2\x80\x9cI brought some painkillers as well, madam. </p><p>That gash upon one\xe2\x80\x99s forehead must be a touch painful.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> chose to ignore the mock-royal treatment, and knocked back the small </p><p>white caplets, gulping them down, with most of the water Twilight had </p><p>brought for her. Even so, the clinical bitterness of the pills was </p><p>persisting on her tongue.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThanks, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> looked into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and did her best to smile, but it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t</p><p> come through. She wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t tell Twilight this, but she was putting all </p><p>her effort into not letting the tears inside her well up from the gash </p><p>on her forehead pulsing pain. She brought her hoof up to the wound, and </p><p>brushed across it. Rainbow let out an audible gasp, her head was still </p><p>tender.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be a silly pony, Rainbow! Of course it\xe2\x80\x99s still going to hurt!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight was being far too chirpy for Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tired, pained head, and so she chose to remain quiet.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, we ought to get you cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re absolutely caked in blood!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>It was true; she could feel its dryness clinging to her face, stiffening her mane, beginning to itch.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to run you a nice, warm bath! You just take it easy, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThanks, Twi\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really in the mood to talk; she\xe2\x80\x99d rather be at home now, </p><p>sleeping. Still, she was sure this was the only way to keep Twilight </p><p>quiet, and it had worked; to an extent.</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> Sparkle turned around once more, this time heading towards the </p><p>bathroom. She was once again wiggling her rump, swishing her tail side </p><p>to side, almost as if she was trying to entice Rainbow.</p><p>She</p><p> didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to admit it, but Rainbow was enjoying it. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t meant </p><p>to look, but the flick of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s tail had caught her eye, and then </p><p>that was it. She was thinking of Twilight in other ways.</p><p> She was cute, Rainbow would give her that. It was the lilac colour; </p><p>that hue painted Twilight in intense innocence, yet upon a rump so fine,</p><p> Rainbow was wondering how she\xe2\x80\x99d never seen through such an innocent </p><p>veil.</p><p class="double">Maybe it was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s personality. She\xe2\x80\x99d spent so much time thinking that, well, Twilight was quite frankly boring. Yeah, she was a good friend, and not bad to be around, but books? Seriously?</p><p>It\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> not like Rainbow was a stranger to the occasional book, she\xe2\x80\x99d been to </p><p>flight school, and there was no escaping the textbooks there. Of course,</p><p> she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know that when she\xe2\x80\x99d signed up, but that was beside the </p><p>point.</p><p class="double">It was then that Rainbow realised what she was doing.</p><p>She was slumped upon a sofa, in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s library, fantasising about her, whilst staring at her rump.</p><p class="double">Thinking of another filly like that?! Rainbow, have you gone mad?!</p><p>She</p><p> checked her wings; they were up in the air too, along with her </p><p>thoughts. Rainbow hated that about herself, the one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>control. To be so excited that her wings manifest a life of their own. </p><p>It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.</p><p>Rainbow</p><p> could feel her face burning up, but she decided it was probably just </p><p>due to the wound on her head; it definitely wasn\xe2\x80\x99t anything to do with </p><p>her\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98feelings.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p>Besides,</p><p> if she was going to be with another filly, it would be with somepony </p><p>else. Somepony she\xe2\x80\x99d already shared her feelings with. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t like </p><p>to think about it, though. That a pony like her; \xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash; The fastest flier in all of Equestria!\xe2\x80\x9d would do such things</p><p> with another filly. It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>keep the two fillies out of her head. Twilight Sparkle, who was </p><p>currently running a bath for her, and Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s other, already </p><p>established, albeit secret\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98Friend.\xe2\x80\x99&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p class="double">Just</p><p> thinking of the situation made Rainbow burn up, so much so that she </p><p>couldn\xe2\x80\x99t even bare to name the other damn pony. If she\xe2\x80\x99d known that it </p><p>was going to turn out this way, well, she might have changed things. </p><p>Just a bit, at least.</p><p>Rainbow Dash realised that her wings were up, yet again.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDamn things!\xe2\x80\x9d She uttered.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> folded her wings away, and laid down upon her back. That ought to keep </p><p>them in control, she thought, as another wave of heat cascaded over her </p><p>face.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy won\xe2\x80\x99t my wound just stop burning me up? It\xe2\x80\x99s just so\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Rainbow exhaled a long breath, wavering.</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d</p><p> beaten her self into a corner, and she knew it. So what if she was </p><p>embarrassed? It was probably just the alcohol taking its toll on her, </p><p>she thought, although she knew that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it. Rainbow </p><p>wavered yet again.</p><p class="double">So there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t control, Rainbow thought, to her annoyance. Maybe that\xe2\x80\x99s just how it works.</p><p>Of course, she still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to tell Twilight that.</p><p class="double">It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.</p><p class="double"></p><p>***</p><p class="double"></p><p>Twilight slowly swayed towards the bathroom, watching her hooves blur before her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, it\xe2\x80\x99s like I\xe2\x80\x99ve got, like- I don\xe2\x80\x99t even know how many hooves!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Then Twilight then realised what she\xe2\x80\x99d done; she\xe2\x80\x99d used \xe2\x80\x98like\xe2\x80\x99 in a sentence, and twice at that!&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>She trotted into the bathroom, still \xe2\x80\x98tutting\xe2\x80\x99 at her literary disregard; she was beginning to sound too common for her liking.</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> cranked the faucet on the bath over to hot, and watched the water flow </p><p>out of the old, chunky library pipes. At least it was functional, she </p><p>thought to herself. Some of the newer designer bathroom suites had </p><p>stupid twiddly, nonsensical handles on the faucets. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have time to put up with such gimmicks! Well, she was a busy pony, what with all the studying and all.</p><p>Twilight winced, as she realised she\xe2\x80\x99d blatantly disregarded the English language again! That didn\xe2\x80\x99t even make sense!</p><p class="double">Maybe</p><p> it was down to the alcoholic intoxication, she thought. She\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>definitely read books about it; there was a section in her copy of </p><p>\xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 labelled \xe2\x80\x98Adult\xe2\x80\x99, which touched on Alcohol, amongst other </p><p>things, but that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the kind of book she was thinking about. </p><p>Twilight needed something more academic, really.</p><p>All of a sudden, the quote she was searching for surfaced within her brain:</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe first few beverages will</p><p> affect judgement, reaction time and brain activity, regardless of a </p><p>Pony\xe2\x80\x99s metabolism, tolerance to alcohol or BMI. As alcohol consumption </p><p>increases, reactions will become even more sluggish and delays in physical and mental coordination will become far more pronounced.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> was pleased with herself; she\xe2\x80\x99d remembered the quote with such ease, </p><p>although she was a bit disappointed that she\xe2\x80\x99d turned to \xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 </p><p>before the acclaimed yet controversial thesis; \xe2\x80\x9cAlcohol: The bane or </p><p>father of Equestria?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> sat down on the cold, tiled floor of the bathroom, and brought her hoof</p><p> over her fringe. It felt matted, rough to the touch. It was odd, she </p><p>thought, having another pony\xe2\x80\x99s blood upon one\xe2\x80\x99s self, especially that of</p><p> Rainbow Dash. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure why it was so odd for Rainbow in </p><p>particular; it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel quite right.</p><p class="double">Maybe it was because she was too cool to bleed?</p><p>Twilight</p><p> knew this was complete nonsense, the moment she thought it, but she </p><p>entertained the thought, if only momentarily, just out of mild humour. </p><p>Anyway, the cocky pony would probably insist that she was too cool for </p><p>bleeding, regardless of the facts.</p><p class="double">Condensation</p><p> began to form on the tiled floor. Twilight slid her hoof </p><p>half-heartedly, causing a light, traced line to form across a few tiles.</p><p> The line, however, was only definite for a couple of seconds, as </p><p>condensation began to incur upon the divide she\xe2\x80\x99d drawn.</p><p>Twilight</p><p> didn\xe2\x80\x99t like this lack of certainty; it was as if as soon as she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>created the definite, perfect line, the boundaries were blurred. It was </p><p>as if the condensation was disobeying her rules, trying to overwhelm the</p><p> change, trying to remain the same.</p><p class="double">However,</p><p> Twilight still felt a sense of victory over the constantly condensing </p><p>tiles: Even if it covered up the lines she\xe2\x80\x99d created, there was still </p><p>presence. If you looked, ever so closely, you could see that there was </p><p>indeed a line there before;</p><p>It\xe2\x80\x99d merely just\xe2\x80\xa6 changed.</p><p class="double">Twilight thought back to the events of the evening, and realised that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually know why</p><p> Rainbow was bleeding so much. Well, she knew that it had some relevance</p><p> to a collision between them, but nothing like a straight up collision </p><p>could have caused such a deep gash as the one Rainbow had acquired upon </p><p>her head. To do something like that, somepony would have to use </p><p>something sharp, something piercing.</p><p class="double">A</p><p> wave of realisation overwhelmed Twilight, and she leapt to her feet, </p><p>leaving wet hoofprints upon the floor, soon to be consumed by the </p><p>condensation. She staggered over to the sink, snagging a towel en route.</p><p> However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the sink Twilight was after, but the mirror above </p><p>it.</p><p> She slowly brought the towel up to the </p><p>once reflective mirror.&nbsp;&nbsp;Shaking, Twilight slid the flannelly material </p><p>across the surface, and she was presented with a fleeting look at her </p><p>own face.</p><p>It may well have only been distinct for a couple of seconds, but she saw it. Her horn was red.</p><p>However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a sort of jolly red, not the kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with whimsical, happy things.</p><p class="double">No.</p><p class="double">It was a horrible red. A dark, accusatory crimson.</p><p>Even</p><p> though the outline was no longer visible, it was still there. Twilight </p><p>could see the marks on the mirror, from where the condensation hadn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>quite healed over properly, and within that, she saw herself.</p><p>She was only a smudge, when viewed through the veil of the condensated mirror.</p><p>She was a Purple smudge; Indefinite.</p><p>Dashed with crimson.</b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'version': 1, 'parent_story_id': 15}, 'chapter_id': 25, 'cursor': <mysql.connector.cursor.MySQLCursor object at 0x02E4D830>, 'connection': <mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection object at 0x02E01A70>, 'html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'2\'></a><h3>Everything Goes My Way</h3>\n<p>The library seemed vast, shrouded in darkness.</p><p> The cavernous room was eerie, and the motley assortment of books formed</p><p> cold, unnatural shapes, juxtaposing the soft, gradual shapes of the </p><p>clouds Rainbow Dash was so used to coming home to. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t like it.</p><p>Well,</p><p> Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t like spending much time in the library anyway, it seemed</p><p> as though it was lacking in energy; lacking in life.</p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> addition of light wasn\xe2\x80\x99t much better, either. She was once again wiggling her rump, swishing her tail side </p><p>to side, almost as if she was trying to entice Rainbow.</p><p>She</p><p> didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to admit it, but Rainbow was enjoying it.
