If she\xe2\x80\x99d known that it </p><p>was going to turn out this way, well, she might have changed things. </p><p>Just a bit, at least.</p><p>Rainbow Dash realised that her wings were up, yet again.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDamn things!\xe2\x80\x9d She uttered.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> folded her wings away, and laid down upon her back. That ought to keep </p><p>them in control, she thought, as another wave of heat cascaded over her </p><p>face.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy won\xe2\x80\x99t my wound just stop burning me up? It\xe2\x80\x99s just so\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Rainbow exhaled a long breath, wavering.</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d</p><p> beaten her self into a corner, and she knew it. So what if she was </p><p>embarrassed? It was probably just the alcohol taking its toll on her, </p><p>she thought, although she knew that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it. Rainbow </p><p>wavered yet again.</p><p class="double">So there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t control, Rainbow thought, to her annoyance. Maybe that\xe2\x80\x99s just how it works.</p><p>Of course, she still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to tell Twilight that.</p><p class="double">It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.</p><p class="double"></p><p>***</p><p class="double"></p><p>Twilight slowly swayed towards the bathroom, watching her hooves blur before her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, it\xe2\x80\x99s like I\xe2\x80\x99ve got, like- I don\xe2\x80\x99t even know how many hooves!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Then Twilight then realised what she\xe2\x80\x99d done; she\xe2\x80\x99d used \xe2\x80\x98like\xe2\x80\x99 in a sentence, and twice at that!&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>She trotted into the bathroom, still \xe2\x80\x98tutting\xe2\x80\x99 at her literary disregard; she was beginning to sound too common for her liking.</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> cranked the faucet on the bath over to hot, and watched the water flow </p><p>out of the old, chunky library pipes. At least it was functional, she </p><p>thought to herself. Some of the newer designer bathroom suites had </p><p>stupid twiddly, nonsensical handles on the faucets. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have time to put up with such gimmicks! Well, she was a busy pony, what with all the studying and all.</p><p>Twilight winced, as she realised she\xe2\x80\x99d blatantly disregarded the English language again! That didn\xe2\x80\x99t even make sense!</p><p class="double">Maybe</p><p> it was down to the alcoholic intoxication, she thought. She\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>definitely read books about it; there was a section in her copy of </p><p>\xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 labelled \xe2\x80\x98Adult\xe2\x80\x99, which touched on Alcohol, amongst other </p><p>things, but that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the kind of book she was thinking about. </p><p>Twilight needed something more academic, really.</p><p>All of a sudden, the quote she was searching for surfaced within her brain:</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe first few beverages will</p><p> affect judgement, reaction time and brain activity, regardless of a </p><p>Pony\xe2\x80\x99s metabolism, tolerance to alcohol or BMI. As alcohol consumption </p><p>increases, reactions will become even more sluggish and delays in physical and mental coordination will become far more pronounced.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> was pleased with herself; she\xe2\x80\x99d remembered the quote with such ease, </p><p>although she was a bit disappointed that she\xe2\x80\x99d turned to \xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 </p><p>before the acclaimed yet controversial thesis; \xe2\x80\x9cAlcohol: The bane or </p><p>father of Equestria?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> sat down on the cold, tiled floor of the bathroom, and brought her hoof</p><p> over her fringe. It felt matted, rough to the touch. It was odd, she </p><p>thought, having another pony\xe2\x80\x99s blood upon one\xe2\x80\x99s self, especially that of</p><p> Rainbow Dash. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure why it was so odd for Rainbow in </p><p>particular; it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel quite right.</p><p class="double">Maybe it was because she was too cool to bleed?</p><p>Twilight</p><p> knew this was complete nonsense, the moment she thought it, but she </p><p>entertained the thought, if only momentarily, just out of mild humour. </p><p>Anyway, the cocky pony would probably insist that she was too cool for </p><p>bleeding, regardless of the facts.</p><p class="double">Condensation</p><p> began to form on the tiled floor. Twilight slid her hoof </p><p>half-heartedly, causing a light, traced line to form across a few tiles.</p><p> The line, however, was only definite for a couple of seconds, as </p><p>condensation began to incur upon the divide she\xe2\x80\x99d drawn.</p><p>Twilight</p><p> didn\xe2\x80\x99t like this lack of certainty; it was as if as soon as she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>created the definite, perfect line, the boundaries were blurred. It was </p><p>as if the condensation was disobeying her rules, trying to overwhelm the</p><p> change, trying to remain the same.</p><p class="double">However,</p><p> Twilight still felt a sense of victory over the constantly condensing </p><p>tiles: Even if it covered up the lines she\xe2\x80\x99d created, there was still </p><p>presence. If you looked, ever so closely, you could see that there was </p><p>indeed a line there before;</p><p>It\xe2\x80\x99d merely just\xe2\x80\xa6 changed.</p><p class="double">Twilight thought back to the events of the evening, and realised that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually know why</p><p> Rainbow was bleeding so much. Well, she knew that it had some relevance</p><p> to a collision between them, but nothing like a straight up collision </p><p>could have caused such a deep gash as the one Rainbow had acquired upon </p><p>her head. To do something like that, somepony would have to use </p><p>something sharp, something piercing.</p><p class="double">A</p><p> wave of realisation overwhelmed Twilight, and she leapt to her feet, </p><p>leaving wet hoofprints upon the floor, soon to be consumed by the </p><p>condensation. She staggered over to the sink, snagging a towel en route.</p><p> However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the sink Twilight was after, but the mirror above </p><p>it.</p><p> She slowly brought the towel up to the </p><p>once reflective mirror.&nbsp;&nbsp;Shaking, Twilight slid the flannelly material </p><p>across the surface, and she was presented with a fleeting look at her </p><p>own face.</p><p>It may well have only been distinct for a couple of seconds, but she saw it. Her horn was red.</p><p>However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a sort of jolly red, not the kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with whimsical, happy things.</p><p class="double">No.</p><p class="double">It was a horrible red. A dark, accusatory crimson.</p><p>Even</p><p> though the outline was no longer visible, it was still there. Twilight </p><p>could see the marks on the mirror, from where the condensation hadn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>quite healed over properly, and within that, she saw herself.</p><p>She was only a smudge, when viewed through the veil of the condensated mirror.</p><p>She was a Purple smudge; Indefinite.</p><p>Dashed with crimson.</b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'values': ['//------------------------------//\n// Everything Goes My Way// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\nThe library seemed vast, shrouded in darkness.\n The cavernous room was eerie, and the motley assortment of books formed\n cold, unnatural shapes, juxtaposing the soft, gradual shapes of the \nclouds Rainbow Dash was so used to coming home to. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t like it.\nWell,\n Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t like spending much time in the library anyway, it seemed\n as though it was lacking in energy; lacking in life.\nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s\n addition of light wasn\xe2\x80\x99t much better, either. Long shadows of cast \naside books littered the floor, making the library seem somewhat even \nmore surreal. At least the shadows weren\xe2\x80\x99t definite anymore; they \npetered out into grey, slowly morphing back into the warm, flickering \nyellows of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s candlelight. It was more like the clouds of her \nhome, which settled Rainbow, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t like the incessant \nflickering, it seemed far too uncertain, almost ethereal.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, do you want to sit down?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nShe jumped, retracting away from what had seemed to be a bellowing noise, against the ambience.\nTwilight may have noticed, but Rainbow tried her best to shrug it off, with a non-committal huff.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, why not.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n slumped down onto the sofa that Twilight was gesturing to, and shut out\n the confusing half-light of the library. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let the strange \nshapes and shrouds faze her, she was supposed to be strong.\nNo, she was strong!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, could I get a glass of water?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCertainly, Rainbow.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n turned around, rump facing Rainbow, wiggling as she slowly moved \ntowards the basin, just out of the main library area. Just before \nTwilight moved out of earshot, Rainbow heard her mumble to herself.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, and a please wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t go amiss, Miss \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99m too full of myself to be polite-\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n went on, but Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t care much, at least she was getting what \nshe wanted; her body was crying out for hydration, and she knew Twilight\n was good enough natured to comply with her meagre demands.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cMiss\n Dash, here\xe2\x80\x99s the water that you so eagerly await!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was\n a cusp above sarcastic. \xe2\x80\x9cI brought some painkillers as well, madam. \nThat gash upon one\xe2\x80\x99s forehead must be a touch painful.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n chose to ignore the mock-royal treatment, and knocked back the small \nwhite caplets, gulping them down, with most of the water Twilight had \nbrought for her. Even so, the clinical bitterness of the pills was \npersisting on her tongue.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThanks, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n looked into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and did her best to smile, but it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t\n come through. She wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t tell Twilight this, but she was putting all \nher effort into not letting the tears inside her well up from the gash \non her forehead pulsing pain. She brought her hoof up to the wound, and \nbrushed across it. Rainbow let out an audible gasp, her head was still \ntender.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be a silly pony, Rainbow! Of course it\xe2\x80\x99s still going to hurt!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight was being far too chirpy for Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tired, pained head, and so she chose to remain quiet.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, we ought to get you cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re absolutely caked in blood!\xe2\x80\x9d\nIt was true; she could feel its dryness clinging to her face, stiffening her mane, beginning to itch.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to run you a nice, warm bath! You just take it easy, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThanks, Twi\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really in the mood to talk; she\xe2\x80\x99d rather be at home now, \nsleeping. Still, she was sure this was the only way to keep Twilight \nquiet, and it had worked; to an extent.\n\nTwilight\n Sparkle turned around once more, this time heading towards the \nbathroom. She was once again wiggling her rump, swishing her tail side \nto side, almost as if she was trying to entice Rainbow.\nShe\n didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to admit it, but Rainbow was enjoying it. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t meant \nto look, but the flick of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s tail had caught her eye, and then \nthat was it. She was thinking of Twilight in other ways.\n She was cute, Rainbow would give her that. It was the lilac colour; \nthat hue painted Twilight in intense innocence, yet upon a rump so fine,\n Rainbow was wondering how she\xe2\x80\x99d never seen through such an innocent \nveil.\n\nMaybe it was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s personality. She\xe2\x80\x99d spent so much time thinking that, well, Twilight was quite frankly boring. Yeah, she was a good friend, and not bad to be around, but books? Seriously?\nIt\xe2\x80\x99s\n not like Rainbow was a stranger to the occasional book, she\xe2\x80\x99d been to \nflight school, and there was no escaping the textbooks there. Of course,\n she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know that when she\xe2\x80\x99d signed up, but that was beside the \npoint.\n\nIt was then that Rainbow realised what she was doing.\nShe was slumped upon a sofa, in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s library, fantasising about her, whilst staring at her rump.\n\nThinking of another filly like that?! Rainbow, have you gone mad?!\nShe\n checked her wings; they were up in the air too, along with her \nthoughts. Rainbow hated that about herself, the one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t \ncontrol. To be so excited that her wings manifest a life of their own. \nIt just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.\nRainbow\n could feel her face burning up, but she decided it was probably just \ndue to the wound on her head; it definitely wasn\xe2\x80\x99t anything to do with \nher\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98feelings.\xe2\x80\x99\nBesides,\n if she was going to be with another filly, it would be with somepony \nelse. Somepony she\xe2\x80\x99d already shared her feelings with. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t like \nto think about it, though. That a pony like her; \xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash; The fastest flier in all of Equestria!\xe2\x80\x9d would do such things\n with another filly. It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.  However, Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t \nkeep the two fillies out of her head. Twilight Sparkle, who was \ncurrently running a bath for her, and Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s other, already \nestablished, albeit secret\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98Friend.\xe2\x80\x99  \n\nJust\n thinking of the situation made Rainbow burn up, so much so that she \ncouldn\xe2\x80\x99t even bare to name the other damn pony. If she\xe2\x80\x99d known that it \nwas going to turn out this way, well, she might have changed things. \nJust a bit, at least.\nRainbow Dash realised that her wings were up, yet again.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDamn things!\xe2\x80\x9d She uttered.\n\nRainbow\n folded her wings away, and laid down upon her back. That ought to keep \nthem in control, she thought, as another wave of heat cascaded over her \nface.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy won\xe2\x80\x99t my wound just stop burning me up? It\xe2\x80\x99s just so\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\nRainbow exhaled a long breath, wavering.\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d\n beaten her self into a corner, and she knew it. So what if she was \nembarrassed? It was probably just the alcohol taking its toll on her, \nshe thought, although she knew that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it. Rainbow \nwavered yet again.\n\nSo there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t control, Rainbow thought, to her annoyance. Maybe that\xe2\x80\x99s just how it works.\nOf course, she still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to tell Twilight that.\n\nIt just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.\n\n\n***\n\n\nTwilight slowly swayed towards the bathroom, watching her hooves blur before her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, it\xe2\x80\x99s like I\xe2\x80\x99ve got, like- I don\xe2\x80\x99t even know how many hooves!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThen Twilight then realised what she\xe2\x80\x99d done; she\xe2\x80\x99d used \xe2\x80\x98like\xe2\x80\x99 in a sentence, and twice at that!  \nShe trotted into the bathroom, still \xe2\x80\x98tutting\xe2\x80\x99 at her literary disregard; she was beginning to sound too common for her liking.\n\nTwilight\n cranked the faucet on the bath over to hot, and watched the water flow \nout of the old, chunky library pipes. At least it was functional, she \nthought to herself. Some of the newer designer bathroom suites had \nstupid twiddly, nonsensical handles on the faucets. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have time to put up with such gimmicks! Well, she was a busy pony, what with all the studying and all.\nTwilight winced, as she realised she\xe2\x80\x99d blatantly disregarded the English language again! That didn\xe2\x80\x99t even make sense!\n\nMaybe\n it was down to the alcoholic intoxication, she thought. She\xe2\x80\x99d \ndefinitely read books about it; there was a section in her copy of \n\xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 labelled \xe2\x80\x98Adult\xe2\x80\x99, which touched on Alcohol, amongst other \nthings, but that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the kind of book she was thinking about. \nTwilight needed something more academic, really.\nAll of a sudden, the quote she was searching for surfaced within her brain:\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThe first few beverages will\n affect judgement, reaction time and brain activity, regardless of a \nPony\xe2\x80\x99s metabolism, tolerance to alcohol or BMI. As alcohol consumption \nincreases, reactions will become even more sluggish and delays in physical and mental coordination will become far more pronounced.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n was pleased with herself; she\xe2\x80\x99d remembered the quote with such ease, \nalthough she was a bit disappointed that she\xe2\x80\x99d turned to \xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 \nbefore the acclaimed yet controversial thesis; \xe2\x80\x9cAlcohol: The bane or \nfather of Equestria?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n sat down on the cold, tiled floor of the bathroom, and brought her hoof\n over her fringe. It felt matted, rough to the touch. It was odd, she \nthought, having another pony\xe2\x80\x99s blood upon one\xe2\x80\x99s self, especially that of\n Rainbow Dash. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure why it was so odd for Rainbow in \nparticular; it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel quite right.\n\nMaybe it was because she was too cool to bleed?\nTwilight\n knew this was complete nonsense, the moment she thought it, but she \nentertained the thought, if only momentarily, just out of mild humour. \nAnyway, the cocky pony would probably insist that she was too cool for \nbleeding, regardless of the facts.\n\nCondensation\n began to form on the tiled floor. Twilight slid her hoof \nhalf-heartedly, causing a light, traced line to form across a few tiles.\n The line, however, was only definite for a couple of seconds, as \ncondensation began to incur upon the divide she\xe2\x80\x99d drawn.\nTwilight\n didn\xe2\x80\x99t like this lack of certainty; it was as if as soon as she\xe2\x80\x99d \ncreated the definite, perfect line, the boundaries were blurred. It was \nas if the condensation was disobeying her rules, trying to overwhelm the\n change, trying to remain the same.\n\nHowever,\n Twilight still felt a sense of victory over the constantly condensing \ntiles: Even if it covered up the lines she\xe2\x80\x99d created, there was still \npresence. If you looked, ever so closely, you could see that there was \nindeed a line there before;\nIt\xe2\x80\x99d merely just\xe2\x80\xa6 changed.\n\nTwilight thought back to the events of the evening, and realised that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually know why\n Rainbow was bleeding so much. Well, she knew that it had some relevance\n to a collision between them, but nothing like a straight up collision \ncould have caused such a deep gash as the one Rainbow had acquired upon \nher head. To do something like that, somepony would have to use \nsomething sharp, something piercing.\n\nA\n wave of realisation overwhelmed Twilight, and she leapt to her feet, \nleaving wet hoofprints upon the floor, soon to be consumed by the \ncondensation. She staggered over to the sink, snagging a towel en route.\n However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the sink Twilight was after, but the mirror above \nit.\n She slowly brought the towel up to the \nonce reflective mirror.  Shaking, Twilight slid the flannelly material \nacross the surface, and she was presented with a fleeting look at her \nown face.\nIt may well have only been distinct for a couple of seconds, but she saw it. Her horn was red.\nHowever, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a sort of jolly red, not the kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with whimsical, happy things.\n\nNo.\n\nIt was a horrible red. A dark, accusatory crimson.\nEven\n though the outline was no longer visible, it was still there. Twilight \ncould see the marks on the mirror, from where the condensation hadn\xe2\x80\x99t \nquite healed over properly, and within that, she saw herself.\nShe was only a smudge, when viewed through the veil of the condensated mirror.\nShe was a Purple smudge; Indefinite.\nDashed with crimson.', 2, 25, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'2\'></a><h3>Everything Goes My Way</h3>\n<p>The library seemed vast, shrouded in darkness.</p><p> The cavernous room was eerie, and the motley assortment of books formed</p><p> cold, unnatural shapes, juxtaposing the soft, gradual shapes of the </p><p>clouds Rainbow Dash was so used to coming home to. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t like it.</p><p>Well,</p><p> Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t like spending much time in the library anyway, it seemed</p><p> as though it was lacking in energy; lacking in life.</p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> addition of light wasn\xe2\x80\x99t much better, either. Long shadows of cast </p><p>aside books littered the floor, making the library seem somewhat even </p><p>more surreal. At least the shadows weren\xe2\x80\x99t definite anymore; they </p><p>petered out into grey, slowly morphing back into the warm, flickering </p><p>yellows of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s candlelight. It was more like the clouds of her </p><p>home, which settled Rainbow, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t like the incessant </p><p>flickering, it seemed far too uncertain, almost ethereal.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, do you want to sit down?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">She jumped, retracting away from what had seemed to be a bellowing noise, against the ambience.</p><p>Twilight may have noticed, but Rainbow tried her best to shrug it off, with a non-committal huff.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, why not.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> slumped down onto the sofa that Twilight was gesturing to, and shut out</p><p> the confusing half-light of the library. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let the strange </p><p>shapes and shrouds faze her, she was supposed to be strong.</p><p>No, she was strong!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, could I get a glass of water?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cCertainly, Rainbow.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> turned around, rump facing Rainbow, wiggling as she slowly moved </p><p>towards the basin, just out of the main library area. Just before </p><p>Twilight moved out of earshot, Rainbow heard her mumble to herself.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, and a please wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t go amiss, Miss \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99m too full of myself to be polite-\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> went on, but Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t care much, at least she was getting what </p><p>she wanted; her body was crying out for hydration, and she knew Twilight</p><p> was good enough natured to comply with her meagre demands.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cMiss</p><p> Dash, here\xe2\x80\x99s the water that you so eagerly await!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was</p><p> a cusp above sarcastic. \xe2\x80\x9cI brought some painkillers as well, madam. </p><p>That gash upon one\xe2\x80\x99s forehead must be a touch painful.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> chose to ignore the mock-royal treatment, and knocked back the small </p><p>white caplets, gulping them down, with most of the water Twilight had </p><p>brought for her. Even so, the clinical bitterness of the pills was </p><p>persisting on her tongue.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThanks, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> looked into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and did her best to smile, but it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t</p><p> come through. She wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t tell Twilight this, but she was putting all </p><p>her effort into not letting the tears inside her well up from the gash </p><p>on her forehead pulsing pain. She brought her hoof up to the wound, and </p><p>brushed across it. Rainbow let out an audible gasp, her head was still </p><p>tender.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be a silly pony, Rainbow! Of course it\xe2\x80\x99s still going to hurt!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight was being far too chirpy for Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tired, pained head, and so she chose to remain quiet.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, we ought to get you cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re absolutely caked in blood!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>It was true; she could feel its dryness clinging to her face, stiffening her mane, beginning to itch.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to run you a nice, warm bath! You just take it easy, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThanks, Twi\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really in the mood to talk; she\xe2\x80\x99d rather be at home now, </p><p>sleeping. Still, she was sure this was the only way to keep Twilight </p><p>quiet, and it had worked; to an extent.</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> Sparkle turned around once more, this time heading towards the </p><p>bathroom. She was once again wiggling her rump, swishing her tail side </p><p>to side, almost as if she was trying to entice Rainbow.</p><p>She</p><p> didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to admit it, but Rainbow was enjoying it. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t meant </p><p>to look, but the flick of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s tail had caught her eye, and then </p><p>that was it. She was thinking of Twilight in other ways.</p><p> She was cute, Rainbow would give her that. It was the lilac colour; </p><p>that hue painted Twilight in intense innocence, yet upon a rump so fine,</p><p> Rainbow was wondering how she\xe2\x80\x99d never seen through such an innocent </p><p>veil.</p><p class="double">Maybe it was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s personality. She\xe2\x80\x99d spent so much time thinking that, well, Twilight was quite frankly boring. Yeah, she was a good friend, and not bad to be around, but books? Seriously?</p><p>It\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> not like Rainbow was a stranger to the occasional book, she\xe2\x80\x99d been to </p><p>flight school, and there was no escaping the textbooks there. Of course,</p><p> she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know that when she\xe2\x80\x99d signed up, but that was beside the </p><p>point.</p><p class="double">It was then that Rainbow realised what she was doing.</p><p>She was slumped upon a sofa, in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s library, fantasising about her, whilst staring at her rump.</p><p class="double">Thinking of another filly like that?! Rainbow, have you gone mad?!</p><p>She</p><p> checked her wings; they were up in the air too, along with her </p><p>thoughts. Rainbow hated that about herself, the one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>control. To be so excited that her wings manifest a life of their own. </p><p>It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.</p><p>Rainbow</p><p> could feel her face burning up, but she decided it was probably just </p><p>due to the wound on her head; it definitely wasn\xe2\x80\x99t anything to do with </p><p>her\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98feelings.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p>Besides,</p><p> if she was going to be with another filly, it would be with somepony </p><p>else. Somepony she\xe2\x80\x99d already shared her feelings with. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t like </p><p>to think about it, though. That a pony like her; \xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash; The fastest flier in all of Equestria!\xe2\x80\x9d would do such things</p><p> with another filly. It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>keep the two fillies out of her head. Twilight Sparkle, who was </p><p>currently running a bath for her, and Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s other, already </p><p>established, albeit secret\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98Friend.\xe2\x80\x99&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p class="double">Just</p><p> thinking of the situation made Rainbow burn up, so much so that she </p><p>couldn\xe2\x80\x99t even bare to name the other damn pony. If she\xe2\x80\x99d known that it </p><p>was going to turn out this way, well, she might have changed things. </p><p>Just a bit, at least.</p><p>Rainbow Dash realised that her wings were up, yet again.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDamn things!\xe2\x80\x9d She uttered.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> folded her wings away, and laid down upon her back. That ought to keep </p><p>them in control, she thought, as another wave of heat cascaded over her </p><p>face.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy won\xe2\x80\x99t my wound just stop burning me up? It\xe2\x80\x99s just so\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Rainbow exhaled a long breath, wavering.</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d</p><p> beaten her self into a corner, and she knew it. So what if she was </p><p>embarrassed? It was probably just the alcohol taking its toll on her, </p><p>she thought, although she knew that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it. Rainbow </p><p>wavered yet again.</p><p class="double">So there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t control, Rainbow thought, to her annoyance. Maybe that\xe2\x80\x99s just how it works.</p><p>Of course, she still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to tell Twilight that.</p><p class="double">It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.</p><p class="double"></p><p>***</p><p class="double"></p><p>Twilight slowly swayed towards the bathroom, watching her hooves blur before her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, it\xe2\x80\x99s like I\xe2\x80\x99ve got, like- I don\xe2\x80\x99t even know how many hooves!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Then Twilight then realised what she\xe2\x80\x99d done; she\xe2\x80\x99d used \xe2\x80\x98like\xe2\x80\x99 in a sentence, and twice at that!&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>She trotted into the bathroom, still \xe2\x80\x98tutting\xe2\x80\x99 at her literary disregard; she was beginning to sound too common for her liking.</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> cranked the faucet on the bath over to hot, and watched the water flow </p><p>out of the old, chunky library pipes. At least it was functional, she </p><p>thought to herself. Some of the newer designer bathroom suites had </p><p>stupid twiddly, nonsensical handles on the faucets. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have time to put up with such gimmicks! Well, she was a busy pony, what with all the studying and all.</p><p>Twilight winced, as she realised she\xe2\x80\x99d blatantly disregarded the English language again! That didn\xe2\x80\x99t even make sense!</p><p class="double">Maybe</p><p> it was down to the alcoholic intoxication, she thought. She\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>definitely read books about it; there was a section in her copy of </p><p>\xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 labelled \xe2\x80\x98Adult\xe2\x80\x99, which touched on Alcohol, amongst other </p><p>things, but that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the kind of book she was thinking about. </p><p>Twilight needed something more academic, really.</p><p>All of a sudden, the quote she was searching for surfaced within her brain:</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThe first few beverages will</p><p> affect judgement, reaction time and brain activity, regardless of a </p><p>Pony\xe2\x80\x99s metabolism, tolerance to alcohol or BMI. As alcohol consumption </p><p>increases, reactions will become even more sluggish and delays in physical and mental coordination will become far more pronounced.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> was pleased with herself; she\xe2\x80\x99d remembered the quote with such ease, </p><p>although she was a bit disappointed that she\xe2\x80\x99d turned to \xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 </p><p>before the acclaimed yet controversial thesis; \xe2\x80\x9cAlcohol: The bane or </p><p>father of Equestria?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> sat down on the cold, tiled floor of the bathroom, and brought her hoof</p><p> over her fringe. It felt matted, rough to the touch. It was odd, she </p><p>thought, having another pony\xe2\x80\x99s blood upon one\xe2\x80\x99s self, especially that of</p><p> Rainbow Dash. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure why it was so odd for Rainbow in </p><p>particular; it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel quite right.</p><p class="double">Maybe it was because she was too cool to bleed?</p><p>Twilight</p><p> knew this was complete nonsense, the moment she thought it, but she </p><p>entertained the thought, if only momentarily, just out of mild humour. </p><p>Anyway, the cocky pony would probably insist that she was too cool for </p><p>bleeding, regardless of the facts.</p><p class="double">Condensation</p><p> began to form on the tiled floor. Twilight slid her hoof </p><p>half-heartedly, causing a light, traced line to form across a few tiles.</p><p> The line, however, was only definite for a couple of seconds, as </p><p>condensation began to incur upon the divide she\xe2\x80\x99d drawn.</p><p>Twilight</p><p> didn\xe2\x80\x99t like this lack of certainty; it was as if as soon as she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>created the definite, perfect line, the boundaries were blurred. It was </p><p>as if the condensation was disobeying her rules, trying to overwhelm the</p><p> change, trying to remain the same.</p><p class="double">However,</p><p> Twilight still felt a sense of victory over the constantly condensing </p><p>tiles: Even if it covered up the lines she\xe2\x80\x99d created, there was still </p><p>presence. If you looked, ever so closely, you could see that there was </p><p>indeed a line there before;</p><p>It\xe2\x80\x99d merely just\xe2\x80\xa6 changed.</p><p class="double">Twilight thought back to the events of the evening, and realised that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually know why</p><p> Rainbow was bleeding so much. Well, she knew that it had some relevance</p><p> to a collision between them, but nothing like a straight up collision </p><p>could have caused such a deep gash as the one Rainbow had acquired upon </p><p>her head. To do something like that, somepony would have to use </p><p>something sharp, something piercing.</p><p class="double">A</p><p> wave of realisation overwhelmed Twilight, and she leapt to her feet, </p><p>leaving wet hoofprints upon the floor, soon to be consumed by the </p><p>condensation. She staggered over to the sink, snagging a towel en route.</p><p> However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the sink Twilight was after, but the mirror above </p><p>it.</p><p> She slowly brought the towel up to the </p><p>once reflective mirror.&nbsp;&nbsp;Shaking, Twilight slid the flannelly material </p><p>across the surface, and she was presented with a fleeting look at her </p><p>own face.</p><p>It may well have only been distinct for a couple of seconds, but she saw it. Her horn was red.</p><p>However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a sort of jolly red, not the kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with whimsical, happy things.</p><p class="double">No.</p><p class="double">It was a horrible red. A dark, accusatory crimson.</p><p>Even</p><p> though the outline was no longer visible, it was still there. Twilight </p><p>could see the marks on the mirror, from where the condensation hadn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>quite healed over properly, and within that, she saw herself.</p><p>She was only a smudge, when viewed through the veil of the condensated mirror.</p><p>She was a Purple smudge; Indefinite.</p><p>Dashed with crimson.</b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 15], 'parent_story_id': 15, 'txt': '//------------------------------//\n// Everything Goes My Way// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\nThe library seemed vast, shrouded in darkness.\n The cavernous room was eerie, and the motley assortment of books formed\n cold, unnatural shapes, juxtaposing the soft, gradual shapes of the \nclouds Rainbow Dash was so used to coming home to. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t like it.\nWell,\n Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t like spending much time in the library anyway, it seemed\n as though it was lacking in energy; lacking in life.\nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s\n addition of light wasn\xe2\x80\x99t much better, either. Long shadows of cast \naside books littered the floor, making the library seem somewhat even \nmore surreal. At least the shadows weren\xe2\x80\x99t definite anymore; they \npetered out into grey, slowly morphing back into the warm, flickering \nyellows of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s candlelight. It was more like the clouds of her \nhome, which settled Rainbow, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t like the incessant \nflickering, it seemed far too uncertain, almost ethereal.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, do you want to sit down?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nShe jumped, retracting away from what had seemed to be a bellowing noise, against the ambience.\nTwilight may have noticed, but Rainbow tried her best to shrug it off, with a non-committal huff.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, why not.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n slumped down onto the sofa that Twilight was gesturing to, and shut out\n the confusing half-light of the library. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let the strange \nshapes and shrouds faze her, she was supposed to be strong.\nNo, she was strong!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, could I get a glass of water?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCertainly, Rainbow.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n turned around, rump facing Rainbow, wiggling as she slowly moved \ntowards the basin, just out of the main library area. Just before \nTwilight moved out of earshot, Rainbow heard her mumble to herself.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, and a please wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t go amiss, Miss \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99m too full of myself to be polite-\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n went on, but Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t care much, at least she was getting what \nshe wanted; her body was crying out for hydration, and she knew Twilight\n was good enough natured to comply with her meagre demands.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cMiss\n Dash, here\xe2\x80\x99s the water that you so eagerly await!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was\n a cusp above sarcastic. \xe2\x80\x9cI brought some painkillers as well, madam. \nThat gash upon one\xe2\x80\x99s forehead must be a touch painful.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n chose to ignore the mock-royal treatment, and knocked back the small \nwhite caplets, gulping them down, with most of the water Twilight had \nbrought for her. Even so, the clinical bitterness of the pills was \npersisting on her tongue.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThanks, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n looked into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and did her best to smile, but it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t\n come through. She wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t tell Twilight this, but she was putting all \nher effort into not letting the tears inside her well up from the gash \non her forehead pulsing pain. She brought her hoof up to the wound, and \nbrushed across it. Rainbow let out an audible gasp, her head was still \ntender.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be a silly pony, Rainbow! Of course it\xe2\x80\x99s still going to hurt!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight was being far too chirpy for Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tired, pained head, and so she chose to remain quiet.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, we ought to get you cleaned up, you\xe2\x80\x99re absolutely caked in blood!\xe2\x80\x9d\nIt was true; she could feel its dryness clinging to her face, stiffening her mane, beginning to itch.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to run you a nice, warm bath! You just take it easy, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThanks, Twi\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really in the mood to talk; she\xe2\x80\x99d rather be at home now, \nsleeping. Still, she was sure this was the only way to keep Twilight \nquiet, and it had worked; to an extent.\n\nTwilight\n Sparkle turned around once more, this time heading towards the \nbathroom. She was once again wiggling her rump, swishing her tail side \nto side, almost as if she was trying to entice Rainbow.\nShe\n didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to admit it, but Rainbow was enjoying it. She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t meant \nto look, but the flick of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s tail had caught her eye, and then \nthat was it. She was thinking of Twilight in other ways.\n She was cute, Rainbow would give her that. It was the lilac colour; \nthat hue painted Twilight in intense innocence, yet upon a rump so fine,\n Rainbow was wondering how she\xe2\x80\x99d never seen through such an innocent \nveil.\n\nMaybe it was Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s personality. She\xe2\x80\x99d spent so much time thinking that, well, Twilight was quite frankly boring. Yeah, she was a good friend, and not bad to be around, but books? Seriously?\nIt\xe2\x80\x99s\n not like Rainbow was a stranger to the occasional book, she\xe2\x80\x99d been to \nflight school, and there was no escaping the textbooks there. Of course,\n she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know that when she\xe2\x80\x99d signed up, but that was beside the \npoint.\n\nIt was then that Rainbow realised what she was doing.\nShe was slumped upon a sofa, in Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s library, fantasising about her, whilst staring at her rump.\n\nThinking of another filly like that?! Rainbow, have you gone mad?!\nShe\n checked her wings; they were up in the air too, along with her \nthoughts. Rainbow hated that about herself, the one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t \ncontrol. To be so excited that her wings manifest a life of their own. \nIt just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.\nRainbow\n could feel her face burning up, but she decided it was probably just \ndue to the wound on her head; it definitely wasn\xe2\x80\x99t anything to do with \nher\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98feelings.\xe2\x80\x99\nBesides,\n if she was going to be with another filly, it would be with somepony \nelse. Somepony she\xe2\x80\x99d already shared her feelings with. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t like \nto think about it, though. That a pony like her; \xe2\x80\x9cRainbow Dash; The fastest flier in all of Equestria!\xe2\x80\x9d would do such things\n with another filly. It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.  However, Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t \nkeep the two fillies out of her head. Twilight Sparkle, who was \ncurrently running a bath for her, and Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s other, already \nestablished, albeit secret\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98Friend.\xe2\x80\x99  \n\nJust\n thinking of the situation made Rainbow burn up, so much so that she \ncouldn\xe2\x80\x99t even bare to name the other damn pony. If she\xe2\x80\x99d known that it \nwas going to turn out this way, well, she might have changed things. \nJust a bit, at least.\nRainbow Dash realised that her wings were up, yet again.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDamn things!\xe2\x80\x9d She uttered.\n\nRainbow\n folded her wings away, and laid down upon her back. That ought to keep \nthem in control, she thought, as another wave of heat cascaded over her \nface.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy won\xe2\x80\x99t my wound just stop burning me up? It\xe2\x80\x99s just so\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\nRainbow exhaled a long breath, wavering.\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d\n beaten her self into a corner, and she knew it. So what if she was \nembarrassed? It was probably just the alcohol taking its toll on her, \nshe thought, although she knew that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it. Rainbow \nwavered yet again.\n\nSo there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just one thing she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t control, Rainbow thought, to her annoyance. Maybe that\xe2\x80\x99s just how it works.\nOf course, she still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to tell Twilight that.\n\nIt just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.\n\n\n***\n\n\nTwilight slowly swayed towards the bathroom, watching her hooves blur before her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHeh, it\xe2\x80\x99s like I\xe2\x80\x99ve got, like- I don\xe2\x80\x99t even know how many hooves!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThen Twilight then realised what she\xe2\x80\x99d done; she\xe2\x80\x99d used \xe2\x80\x98like\xe2\x80\x99 in a sentence, and twice at that!  \nShe trotted into the bathroom, still \xe2\x80\x98tutting\xe2\x80\x99 at her literary disregard; she was beginning to sound too common for her liking.\n\nTwilight\n cranked the faucet on the bath over to hot, and watched the water flow \nout of the old, chunky library pipes. At least it was functional, she \nthought to herself. Some of the newer designer bathroom suites had \nstupid twiddly, nonsensical handles on the faucets. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t have time to put up with such gimmicks! Well, she was a busy pony, what with all the studying and all.\nTwilight winced, as she realised she\xe2\x80\x99d blatantly disregarded the English language again! That didn\xe2\x80\x99t even make sense!\n\nMaybe\n it was down to the alcoholic intoxication, she thought. She\xe2\x80\x99d \ndefinitely read books about it; there was a section in her copy of \n\xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 labelled \xe2\x80\x98Adult\xe2\x80\x99, which touched on Alcohol, amongst other \nthings, but that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the kind of book she was thinking about. \nTwilight needed something more academic, really.\nAll of a sudden, the quote she was searching for surfaced within her brain:\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThe first few beverages will\n affect judgement, reaction time and brain activity, regardless of a \nPony\xe2\x80\x99s metabolism, tolerance to alcohol or BMI. As alcohol consumption \nincreases, reactions will become even more sluggish and delays in physical and mental coordination will become far more pronounced.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n was pleased with herself; she\xe2\x80\x99d remembered the quote with such ease, \nalthough she was a bit disappointed that she\xe2\x80\x99d turned to \xe2\x80\x98Slumber 101\xe2\x80\x99 \nbefore the acclaimed yet controversial thesis; \xe2\x80\x9cAlcohol: The bane or \nfather of Equestria?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n sat down on the cold, tiled floor of the bathroom, and brought her hoof\n over her fringe. It felt matted, rough to the touch. It was odd, she \nthought, having another pony\xe2\x80\x99s blood upon one\xe2\x80\x99s self, especially that of\n Rainbow Dash. Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure why it was so odd for Rainbow in \nparticular; it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel quite right.\n\nMaybe it was because she was too cool to bleed?\nTwilight\n knew this was complete nonsense, the moment she thought it, but she \nentertained the thought, if only momentarily, just out of mild humour. \nAnyway, the cocky pony would probably insist that she was too cool for \nbleeding, regardless of the facts.\n\nCondensation\n began to form on the tiled floor. Twilight slid her hoof \nhalf-heartedly, causing a light, traced line to form across a few tiles.\n The line, however, was only definite for a couple of seconds, as \ncondensation began to incur upon the divide she\xe2\x80\x99d drawn.\nTwilight\n didn\xe2\x80\x99t like this lack of certainty; it was as if as soon as she\xe2\x80\x99d \ncreated the definite, perfect line, the boundaries were blurred. It was \nas if the condensation was disobeying her rules, trying to overwhelm the\n change, trying to remain the same.\n\nHowever,\n Twilight still felt a sense of victory over the constantly condensing \ntiles: Even if it covered up the lines she\xe2\x80\x99d created, there was still \npresence. If you looked, ever so closely, you could see that there was \nindeed a line there before;\nIt\xe2\x80\x99d merely just\xe2\x80\xa6 changed.\n\nTwilight thought back to the events of the evening, and realised that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually know why\n Rainbow was bleeding so much. Well, she knew that it had some relevance\n to a collision between them, but nothing like a straight up collision \ncould have caused such a deep gash as the one Rainbow had acquired upon \nher head. To do something like that, somepony would have to use \nsomething sharp, something piercing.\n\nA\n wave of realisation overwhelmed Twilight, and she leapt to her feet, \nleaving wet hoofprints upon the floor, soon to be consumed by the \ncondensation. She staggered over to the sink, snagging a towel en route.\n However, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the sink Twilight was after, but the mirror above \nit.\n She slowly brought the towel up to the \nonce reflective mirror.  Shaking, Twilight slid the flannelly material \nacross the surface, and she was presented with a fleeting look at her \nown face.\nIt may well have only been distinct for a couple of seconds, but she saw it. Her horn was red.\nHowever, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a sort of jolly red, not the kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with whimsical, happy things.\n\nNo.\n\nIt was a horrible red. A dark, accusatory crimson.\nEven\n though the outline was no longer visible, it was still there. Twilight \ncould see the marks on the mirror, from where the condensation hadn\xe2\x80\x99t \nquite healed over properly, and within that, she saw herself.\nShe was only a smudge, when viewed through the veil of the condensated mirror.\nShe was a Purple smudge; Indefinite.\nDashed with crimson.', 'epub': None}

She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stand silence, it made her jumpy. Not that her friends would know that.\nHowever, that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t completely correct, really. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the absence of audio that made her jumpy. It was what lies within silence.\nAnyway, Rainbow was fine, for now. The sound of the trickling water was tiding her over.\n\nIf Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t talk?\n\xe2\x80\x98Well, that\xe2\x80\x99d be troubling,\xe2\x80\x99 Rainbow thought; although she\xe2\x80\x99d weighed up the \nsilence with the presence of a friend, and all of a sudden, well, it \njust didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem as bad.\n\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d experienced it once before, on that cold, stormy night.\n\n A massive clap of thunder had caught her off guard, in the ambient \nsoundscape that had surrounded her, and she\xe2\x80\x99d dropped to the ground, \nfearful.\nThen that filly had rescued her, taken her in, and just sat with her. Neither of the ponies said anything, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t needed.\nJust to be together.\nTwo ponies as one.\nOnly somepony special could make her feel safe like that.\n\nOf course, Rainbow had still told her not to tell anypony about the fear she\xe2\x80\x99d experienced that night.\nIt just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.\n\nRainbow could feel another \xe2\x80\x98wave\xe2\x80\x99 of warmth gearing to flush across her face, \nso, to distract herself, she decided to see what Twilight was up to; \nShe\xe2\x80\x99d been taking her time, after all.\nAs soon as she rolled over to stand, Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings eased back out into an arc. She\n chose to ignore them, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t really care. Yet still, Rainbow felt \nembarrassed, as her thoughts turned to Twilight once more.\n\nAs Rainbow clopped sluggishly through the library, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t fazed at all\n by the once sinister manufactured shapes of the books. Much more so was\n Rainbow worried about a sound, coming from the bathroom. A sound other \nthan the flow of water; the sound of a quietly crying filly, morose.\nShe hadn\xe2\x80\x99t heard the sobs at first, but as Rainbow neared the door, each \nsob became more pronounced, a spike of noise amongst the listlessness of\n the library.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh Rainbow\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow Dash froze, a mane\xe2\x80\x99s breadth from the door separating Twilight and herself.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t believe I\xe2\x80\x99d do such a thing\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight sounded pained, it was layered within every word of her voice. Not even\n the barrier of the door could take the chilling edge off of the words, \nfor Rainbow. She felt each word hit her ears, laden with despair.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI just-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\nTwilight broke into tears.\n\nRainbow was finding it hard to cope with Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s emotions. Each sob was worse than the last, making Rainbow feel uneasy.\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d not heard much of what Twilight had been lamenting about, but it was clear that she was the source.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIt was too much. Rainbow had to go in. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear hearing her friend like this.\n\nRainbow brought her hoof up to the door, and tapped it, quietly, yet firmly. \nRegardless, the taps echoed around the library, accentuating their \npresence.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, I\xe2\x80\x99m coming in.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow sounded uncertain.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWait, Rainbow. Her purple, starkly against\n the black of the tiles made for a powerful contrast.\n\nIt was almost as Twilight was alone.\n\nThe tiles were streaked with indefinite misty lines, once drawn in by hoof and tear.\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow tried to remain sounding calm, yet her concern for Twilight wavered through into her voice.\n\nTwilight looked down, shielding her face from Rainbow with her hoof.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cY-yeah?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was as quiet and as light as the vapour that hung in the air, but without the stifling heat.\n\nRainbow slowly clopped around Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s place on the floor, making a move \ntowards the seemingly hap-hazard plumbing leading to the large, old \nbathtub of the library.\nShe cranked the faucet closed, with a screeching creak that sliced through \nthe mist, breaking the tension, whilst simultaneously reinforcing it\xe2\x80\x99s \nintensity.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou alright?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nAt least she sounded more confident this time, Rainbow thought to her self, albeit a tad quizzical.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, I\xe2\x80\x99m just a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight exhaled, but her huff was interjected by a spike of sorrow. \xe2\x80\x9cYou know?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow faced Twilight once more, although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t return the gesture.\n\nRainbow thought, for a moment. She thought about how Twilight was definitely not just a bit \xe2\x80\x98You know,\xe2\x80\x99 and how Twilight had cried to herself, for some reason regarding herself.\nIf only she could remember what it was that had made Twilight feel so morose.\nRainbow knew it was to do with her, or something she\xe2\x80\x99d done.\nHowever, that somehow made it worse, as it had clearly rubbed off onto Twilight,\n but she herself, well, she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t the foggiest idea as to what she\xe2\x80\x99d \ndone.\n\nIt didn\xe2\x80\x99t help that Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t terribly well versed within the art of emotions. It\n was probably down to the fact that she\xe2\x80\x99d never experienced anything \nlike this before; she\xe2\x80\x99d been far too busy racing around to think about \nsuch embarrassing things.\n\nNevertheless, Rainbow was sure she could fix this; after all, she was the best young \nflier, so she could be the best at emotions, too, surely?\nThis should be easy.\n\nRainbow picked her hoof up and eased it silently towards Twilight, reaching \nthrough the vapour. She brought her hoof up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin, and \nbrought her eyes up to her own.\nTwilight snapped her eyes shut, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t resist Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s soft, reassuring touch.\n\nRainbow noticed the red streaks upon Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn, jolting her memory. This \nwas probably what had her down; she must have been feeling guilty. Guilty for something Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even worried about.\nIt was just a small gash, nothing more.\nTwilight was overreacting, probably partially due to the alcohol she\xe2\x80\x99d consumed,\n but also probably partly to do with her obsessive, delicate \npersonality. She\xe2\x80\x99d been known to snap when under tension before.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight\xe2\x80\xa6, Open your eyes.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\nTwilight slowly brought her eyelids apart.\nOnly by a crack, at first, but then widening, looking up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tentative, attemptedly reassuring smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re feeling a bit shaken\xe2\x80\xa6, but let\xe2\x80\x99s not get all tearful, eh?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight continued to study Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face, moving on from her smile.\nShe was a pretty pony, really, but Rainbow would probably deny the notion. \nThen again, if she\xe2\x80\x99d tried to make an effort on fabricating any sort of \xe2\x80\x98look\xe2\x80\x99, then it would probably fall down.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIt was just the way she hung herself so nonchalantly, without a care in the world.\nEven with her wound\xe2\x80\xa6\nTwilight felt sadness well up inside her.\nEven with that unsightly gash upon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, she looked good. In \nfact, it somewhat enhanced her tomboyish beauty. But she\xe2\x80\x99d just shrug it\n off, she\xe2\x80\x99d say; \xe2\x80\x98Oh that? I can\xe2\x80\x99t just usurp you of that pleasure, I\xe2\x80\x99d feel bad\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow smiled, more certainly than the last time.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re too kind. It made Twilight smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat, get in the bath? Together?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings started to rise, slowly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, why not? Just give me a-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Rainbow pushed the door open, regardless. A plume of vapour hit her, filling </p><p>her lungs with warm, moist air, and clouding her vision.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSecond,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight finished.</p><p class="double">Twilight was slumped upon the floor, head in hooves. Her purple, starkly against</p><p> the black of the tiles made for a powerful contrast.</p><p class="double">It was almost as Twilight was alone.</p><p class="double">The tiles were streaked with indefinite misty lines, once drawn in by hoof and tear.</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow tried to remain sounding calm, yet her concern for Twilight wavered through into her voice.</p><p class="double">Twilight looked down, shielding her face from Rainbow with her hoof.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cY-yeah?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was as quiet and as light as the vapour that hung in the air, but without the stifling heat.</p><p class="double">Rainbow slowly clopped around Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s place on the floor, making a move </p><p>towards the seemingly hap-hazard plumbing leading to the large, old </p><p>bathtub of the library.</p><p>She cranked the faucet closed, with a screeching creak that sliced through </p><p>the mist, breaking the tension, whilst simultaneously reinforcing it\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>intensity.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou alright?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">At least she sounded more confident this time, Rainbow thought to her self, albeit a tad quizzical.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, I\xe2\x80\x99m just a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight exhaled, but her huff was interjected by a spike of sorrow. \xe2\x80\x9cYou know?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow faced Twilight once more, although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t return the gesture.</p><p class="double">Rainbow thought, for a moment. She thought about how Twilight was definitely not just a bit \xe2\x80\x98You know,\xe2\x80\x99 and how Twilight had cried to herself, for some reason regarding herself.</p><p>If only she could remember what it was that had made Twilight feel so morose.</p><p>Rainbow knew it was to do with her, or something she\xe2\x80\x99d done.</p><p>However, that somehow made it worse, as it had clearly rubbed off onto Twilight,</p><p> but she herself, well, she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t the foggiest idea as to what she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>done.</p><p class="double">It didn\xe2\x80\x99t help that Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t terribly well versed within the art of emotions. It</p><p> was probably down to the fact that she\xe2\x80\x99d never experienced anything </p><p>like this before; she\xe2\x80\x99d been far too busy racing around to think about </p><p>such embarrassing things.</p><p class="double">Nevertheless, Rainbow was sure she could fix this; after all, she was the best young </p><p>flier, so she could be the best at emotions, too, surely?</p><p>This should be easy.</p><p class="double">Rainbow picked her hoof up and eased it silently towards Twilight, reaching </p><p>through the vapour. She brought her hoof up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin, and </p><p>brought her eyes up to her own.</p><p>Twilight snapped her eyes shut, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t resist Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s soft, reassuring touch.</p><p class="double">Rainbow noticed the red streaks upon Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn, jolting her memory. This </p><p>was probably what had her down; she must have been feeling guilty. Guilty for something Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even worried about.</p><p>It was just a small gash, nothing more.</p><p>Twilight was overreacting, probably partially due to the alcohol she\xe2\x80\x99d consumed,</p><p> but also probably partly to do with her obsessive, delicate </p><p>personality. She\xe2\x80\x99d been known to snap when under tension before.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight\xe2\x80\xa6, Open your eyes.\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">Twilight slowly brought her eyelids apart.</p><p>Only by a crack, at first, but then widening, looking up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tentative, attemptedly reassuring smile.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re feeling a bit shaken\xe2\x80\xa6, but let\xe2\x80\x99s not get all tearful, eh?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight continued to study Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face, moving on from her smile.</p><p>She was a pretty pony, really, but Rainbow would probably deny the notion. </p><p>Then again, if she\xe2\x80\x99d tried to make an effort on fabricating any sort of \xe2\x80\x98look\xe2\x80\x99, then it would probably fall down.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">It was just the way she hung herself so nonchalantly, without a care in the world.</p><p>Even with her wound\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p>Twilight felt sadness well up inside her.</p><p>Even with that unsightly gash upon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, she looked good. In </p><p>fact, it somewhat enhanced her tomboyish beauty. But she\xe2\x80\x99d just shrug it</p><p> off, she\xe2\x80\x99d say; \xe2\x80\x98Oh that? It\xe2\x80\x99s just a scratch, no big deal!\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">Oh, but Rainbow, it is a big deal, Twilight thought. You need to think about yourself, too, instead of trying to please everyone.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, maybe you should get in the bath, to-\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow faltered, momentarily. \xe2\x80\x9c-To calm down, you seem a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight nodded her head, but still managed to make it look morose, albeit </p><p>unintentionally and slowly raised herself off the tiles.</p><p class="double">She left uncertain hoofprints upon the floor, fading away, barely there.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut Rainbow, I ran the bath for you. I can\xe2\x80\x99t just usurp you of that pleasure, I\xe2\x80\x99d feel bad\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow smiled, more certainly than the last time.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re too kind. But you need this more than me, I think.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The last couple of words seemed to peter out, back to uncertainty. </p><p> Twilight thought it odd, hearing Rainbow Dash so tentative. She was </p><p>usually so brash, so cocky. To hear her like this\xe2\x80\xa6 It didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem right.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, why don\xe2\x80\x99t we share?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face flushed out in red.</p><p class="double">But not like that dark, accusatory crimson upon her forehead.</p><p>A jolly red, pale.</p><p>The kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with friends, and happiness. It made Twilight smile.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat, get in the bath? Together?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings started to rise, slowly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, why not? It\xe2\x80\x99s big enough, and it would be practical; we wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have </p><p>to run another, once one of us had finished, and well, I\xe2\x80\x99d like to help </p><p>clean up your wound\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight liked this idea, it\xe2\x80\x99d be quality time with Rainbow. She could use it to</p><p> get to know her better, after all, they were friends, but the more </p><p>Twilight thought about it, the more she realised how little she knew </p><p>about Rainbow Dash: The fastest flier in all of Equestria!</p><p>She ought to have a couple of interesting stories to tell her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, if you\xe2\x80\x99re sure...\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow sounded very flustered, all of a sudden. What\xe2\x80\x99d got into her? Maybe it </p><p>was just the alcohol, warping her emotions slightly.</p><p class="double">Twilight clopped towards the bathtub, hauled herself into the warm water, and </p><p>melted in bliss. She let out a calming sigh, and stretched her legs, </p><p>relieving tension.</p><p class="double">Twilight looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and then to her forehead, to the wound.</p><p class="double">Against the blush of Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s cheeks, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look quite as bad anymore.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cCome on Rainbow, get in!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow halted for a moment, and then put her fore-hooves on the side of the </p><p>bath. She looked into the water; although blurred, she could see </p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s legs.</p><p class="double">This wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a good idea, Rainbow thought to herself. She should just have </p><p>said no, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to put Twilight down. She\xe2\x80\x99d only just come </p><p>up, as well, she\xe2\x80\x99d be delicate, and Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to shatter her </p><p>again. I mean, look what Twilight\xe2\x80\x99d done just by sitting on the floor by</p><p> herself.</p><p class="double">But Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but have inappropriate thoughts. Thoughts like that.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Rainbow, you should probably close your wings first?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Damn things, always popping up uninvited. She was trying to be a friend. Twilight was vulnerable, melancholic, and yet Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s body had other ideas. She just wanted to help!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I already got it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow tested the water with her hoof, it was an amiable temperature. The kind</p><p> of warmth you\xe2\x80\x99d get that makes you just want to sleep, forever.</p><p class="double">Rainbow faltered once more, looking down at the seemingly impenetrable water\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>surface, even thought her hoof was touching it, not even ten seconds </p><p>ago.</p><p class="double">She would try to be a good friend, even if she had to hang her own feelings.</p><p class="double">No, Rainbow wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t try.</p><p class="double">She\xe2\x80\x99d be the best friend there could be.</p><p class="double">Forcing herself, she took the plunge.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'version': 1, 'parent_story_id': 15}, 'chapter_id': 28, 'cursor': <mysql.connector.cursor.MySQLCursor object at 0x02E56E50>, 'connection': <mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection object at 0x02E01A70>, 'html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'3\'></a><h3>Young Tender Hearts Beat Fast</h3>\n<p>Rainbow was dozing, her mind drifting through the library\xe2\x80\x99s musky essence.</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d been laid there for a while now, waiting on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s call, but she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>heard a distinct lack of sound from her friend, just the constant of the</p><p> distant flow of water was audible.</p><p class="double">Even though Twilight was a quiet pony, at times, especially when in the </p><p>library, Rainbow had to admit it was odd that she\xe2\x80\x99d said nothing to her or even made a noise since leaving.</p><p>Maybe she was a quiet drunk?</p><p>Hopefully not, Rainbow thought. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stand silence, it made her jumpy. Not that her friends would know that.</p><p>However, that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t completely correct, really. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the absence of audio that made her jumpy. It was what lies within silence.</p><p>Anyway, Rainbow was fine, for now. The sound of the trickling water was tiding her over.</p><p class="double">If Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t talk?</p><p>\xe2\x80\x98Well, that\xe2\x80\x99d be troubling,\xe2\x80\x99 Rainbow thought; although she\xe2\x80\x99d weighed up the </p><p>silence with the presence of a friend, and all of a sudden, well, it </p><p>just didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem as bad.</p><p class="double">She\xe2\x80\x99d experienced it once before, on that cold, stormy night.</p><p class="double"> A massive clap of thunder had caught her off guard, in the ambient </p><p>soundscape that had surrounded her, and she\xe2\x80\x99d dropped to the ground, </p><p>fearful.</p><p>Then that filly had rescued her, taken her in, and just sat with her. Neither of the ponies said anything, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t needed.</p><p>Just to be together.</p><p>Two ponies as one.</p><p>Only somepony special could make her feel safe like that.</p><p class="double">Of course, Rainbow had still told her not to tell anypony about the fear she\xe2\x80\x99d experienced that night.</p><p>It just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.</p><p class="double">Rainbow could feel another \xe2\x80\x98wave\xe2\x80\x99 of warmth gearing to flush across her face, </p><p>so, to distract herself, she decided to see what Twilight was up to; </p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d been taking her time, after all.</p><p>As soon as she rolled over to stand, Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings eased back out into an arc. She</p><p> chose to ignore them, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t really care. Yet still, Rainbow felt </p><p>embarrassed, as her thoughts turned to Twilight once more.</p><p class="double">As Rainbow clopped sluggishly through the library, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t fazed at all</p><p> by the once sinister manufactured shapes of the books. Much more so was</p><p> Rainbow worried about a sound, coming from the bathroom. A sound other </p><p>than the flow of water; the sound of a quietly crying filly, morose.</p><p>She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t heard the sobs at first, but as Rainbow neared the door, each </p><p>sob became more pronounced, a spike of noise amongst the listlessness of</p><p> the library.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh Rainbow\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow Dash froze, a mane\xe2\x80\x99s breadth from the door separating Twilight and herself.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t believe I\xe2\x80\x99d do such a thing\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight sounded pained, it was layered within every word of her voice. Not even</p><p> the barrier of the door could take the chilling edge off of the words, </p><p>for Rainbow. She felt each word hit her ears, laden with despair.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI just-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Twilight broke into tears.</p><p class="double">Rainbow was finding it hard to cope with Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s emotions. Each sob was worse than the last, making Rainbow feel uneasy.</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d not heard much of what Twilight had been lamenting about, but it was clear that she was the source.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">It was too much. Rainbow had to go in. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear hearing her friend like this.</p><p class="double">Rainbow brought her hoof up to the door, and tapped it, quietly, yet firmly. </p><p>Regardless, the taps echoed around the library, accentuating their </p><p>presence.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, I\xe2\x80\x99m coming in.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow sounded uncertain.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWait, Rainbow. Just give me a-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Rainbow pushed the door open, regardless.
