She could use it to</p><p> get to know her better, after all, they were friends, but the more </p><p>Twilight thought about it, the more she realised how little she knew </p><p>about Rainbow Dash: The fastest flier in all of Equestria!</p><p>She ought to have a couple of interesting stories to tell her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, if you\xe2\x80\x99re sure...\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow sounded very flustered, all of a sudden. What\xe2\x80\x99d got into her? Maybe it </p><p>was just the alcohol, warping her emotions slightly.</p><p class="double">Twilight clopped towards the bathtub, hauled herself into the warm water, and </p><p>melted in bliss. She let out a calming sigh, and stretched her legs, </p><p>relieving tension.</p><p class="double">Twilight looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and then to her forehead, to the wound.</p><p class="double">Against the blush of Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s cheeks, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look quite as bad anymore.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cCome on Rainbow, get in!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow halted for a moment, and then put her fore-hooves on the side of the </p><p>bath. She looked into the water; although blurred, she could see </p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s legs.</p><p class="double">This wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a good idea, Rainbow thought to herself. She should just have </p><p>said no, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to put Twilight down. She\xe2\x80\x99d only just come </p><p>up, as well, she\xe2\x80\x99d be delicate, and Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to shatter her </p><p>again. I mean, look what Twilight\xe2\x80\x99d done just by sitting on the floor by</p><p> herself.</p><p class="double">But Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but have inappropriate thoughts. Thoughts like that.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Rainbow, you should probably close your wings first?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Damn things, always popping up uninvited. She was trying to be a friend. Twilight was vulnerable, melancholic, and yet Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s body had other ideas. She just wanted to help!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I already got it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow tested the water with her hoof, it was an amiable temperature. The kind</p><p> of warmth you\xe2\x80\x99d get that makes you just want to sleep, forever.</p><p class="double">Rainbow faltered once more, looking down at the seemingly impenetrable water\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>surface, even thought her hoof was touching it, not even ten seconds </p><p>ago.</p><p class="double">She would try to be a good friend, even if she had to hang her own feelings.</p><p class="double">No, Rainbow wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t try.</p><p class="double">She\xe2\x80\x99d be the best friend there could be.</p><p class="double">Forcing herself, she took the plunge.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'values': ['//------------------------------//\n// Young Tender Hearts Beat Fast// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\nRainbow was dozing, her mind drifting through the library\xe2\x80\x99s musky essence.\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d been laid there for a while now, waiting on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s call, but she\xe2\x80\x99d \nheard a distinct lack of sound from her friend, just the constant of the\n distant flow of water was audible.\n\nEven though Twilight was a quiet pony, at times, especially when in the \nlibrary, Rainbow had to admit it was odd that she\xe2\x80\x99d said nothing to her or even made a noise since leaving.\nMaybe she was a quiet drunk?\nHopefully not, Rainbow thought. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stand silence, it made her jumpy. Not that her friends would know that.\nHowever, that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t completely correct, really. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the absence of audio that made her jumpy. It was what lies within silence.\nAnyway, Rainbow was fine, for now. The sound of the trickling water was tiding her over.\n\nIf Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t talk?\n\xe2\x80\x98Well, that\xe2\x80\x99d be troubling,\xe2\x80\x99 Rainbow thought; although she\xe2\x80\x99d weighed up the \nsilence with the presence of a friend, and all of a sudden, well, it \njust didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem as bad.\n\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d experienced it once before, on that cold, stormy night.\n\n A massive clap of thunder had caught her off guard, in the ambient \nsoundscape that had surrounded her, and she\xe2\x80\x99d dropped to the ground, \nfearful.\nThen that filly had rescued her, taken her in, and just sat with her. Neither of the ponies said anything, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t needed.\nJust to be together.\nTwo ponies as one.\nOnly somepony special could make her feel safe like that.\n\nOf course, Rainbow had still told her not to tell anypony about the fear she\xe2\x80\x99d experienced that night.\nIt just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.\n\nRainbow could feel another \xe2\x80\x98wave\xe2\x80\x99 of warmth gearing to flush across her face, \nso, to distract herself, she decided to see what Twilight was up to; \nShe\xe2\x80\x99d been taking her time, after all.\nAs soon as she rolled over to stand, Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings eased back out into an arc. She\n chose to ignore them, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t really care. Yet still, Rainbow felt \nembarrassed, as her thoughts turned to Twilight once more.\n\nAs Rainbow clopped sluggishly through the library, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t fazed at all\n by the once sinister manufactured shapes of the books. Much more so was\n Rainbow worried about a sound, coming from the bathroom. A sound other \nthan the flow of water; the sound of a quietly crying filly, morose.\nShe hadn\xe2\x80\x99t heard the sobs at first, but as Rainbow neared the door, each \nsob became more pronounced, a spike of noise amongst the listlessness of\n the library.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh Rainbow\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow Dash froze, a mane\xe2\x80\x99s breadth from the door separating Twilight and herself.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t believe I\xe2\x80\x99d do such a thing\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight sounded pained, it was layered within every word of her voice. Not even\n the barrier of the door could take the chilling edge off of the words, \nfor Rainbow. She felt each word hit her ears, laden with despair.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI just-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\nTwilight broke into tears.\n\nRainbow was finding it hard to cope with Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s emotions. Each sob was worse than the last, making Rainbow feel uneasy.\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d not heard much of what Twilight had been lamenting about, but it was clear that she was the source.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIt was too much. Rainbow had to go in. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear hearing her friend like this.\n\nRainbow brought her hoof up to the door, and tapped it, quietly, yet firmly. \nRegardless, the taps echoed around the library, accentuating their \npresence.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, I\xe2\x80\x99m coming in.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow sounded uncertain.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWait, Rainbow. Just give me a-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\nRainbow pushed the door open, regardless. A plume of vapour hit her, filling \nher lungs with warm, moist air, and clouding her vision.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSecond,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight finished.\n\nTwilight was slumped upon the floor, head in hooves. Her purple, starkly against\n the black of the tiles made for a powerful contrast.\n\nIt was almost as Twilight was alone.\n\nThe tiles were streaked with indefinite misty lines, once drawn in by hoof and tear.\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow tried to remain sounding calm, yet her concern for Twilight wavered through into her voice.\n\nTwilight looked down, shielding her face from Rainbow with her hoof.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cY-yeah?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was as quiet and as light as the vapour that hung in the air, but without the stifling heat.\n\nRainbow slowly clopped around Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s place on the floor, making a move \ntowards the seemingly hap-hazard plumbing leading to the large, old \nbathtub of the library.\nShe cranked the faucet closed, with a screeching creak that sliced through \nthe mist, breaking the tension, whilst simultaneously reinforcing it\xe2\x80\x99s \nintensity.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou alright?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nAt least she sounded more confident this time, Rainbow thought to her self, albeit a tad quizzical.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, I\xe2\x80\x99m just a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight exhaled, but her huff was interjected by a spike of sorrow. \xe2\x80\x9cYou know?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow faced Twilight once more, although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t return the gesture.\n\nRainbow thought, for a moment. She thought about how Twilight was definitely not just a bit \xe2\x80\x98You know,\xe2\x80\x99 and how Twilight had cried to herself, for some reason regarding herself.\nIf only she could remember what it was that had made Twilight feel so morose.\nRainbow knew it was to do with her, or something she\xe2\x80\x99d done.\nHowever, that somehow made it worse, as it had clearly rubbed off onto Twilight,\n but she herself, well, she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t the foggiest idea as to what she\xe2\x80\x99d \ndone.\n\nIt didn\xe2\x80\x99t help that Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t terribly well versed within the art of emotions. It\n was probably down to the fact that she\xe2\x80\x99d never experienced anything \nlike this before; she\xe2\x80\x99d been far too busy racing around to think about \nsuch embarrassing things.\n\nNevertheless, Rainbow was sure she could fix this; after all, she was the best young \nflier, so she could be the best at emotions, too, surely?\nThis should be easy.\n\nRainbow picked her hoof up and eased it silently towards Twilight, reaching \nthrough the vapour. She brought her hoof up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin, and \nbrought her eyes up to her own.\nTwilight snapped her eyes shut, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t resist Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s soft, reassuring touch.\n\nRainbow noticed the red streaks upon Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn, jolting her memory. This \nwas probably what had her down; she must have been feeling guilty. Guilty for something Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even worried about.\nIt was just a small gash, nothing more.\nTwilight was overreacting, probably partially due to the alcohol she\xe2\x80\x99d consumed,\n but also probably partly to do with her obsessive, delicate \npersonality. She\xe2\x80\x99d been known to snap when under tension before.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight\xe2\x80\xa6, Open your eyes.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\nTwilight slowly brought her eyelids apart.\nOnly by a crack, at first, but then widening, looking up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tentative, attemptedly reassuring smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re feeling a bit shaken\xe2\x80\xa6, but let\xe2\x80\x99s not get all tearful, eh?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight continued to study Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face, moving on from her smile.\nShe was a pretty pony, really, but Rainbow would probably deny the notion. \nThen again, if she\xe2\x80\x99d tried to make an effort on fabricating any sort of \xe2\x80\x98look\xe2\x80\x99, then it would probably fall down.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIt was just the way she hung herself so nonchalantly, without a care in the world.\nEven with her wound\xe2\x80\xa6\nTwilight felt sadness well up inside her.\nEven with that unsightly gash upon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, she looked good. In \nfact, it somewhat enhanced her tomboyish beauty. But she\xe2\x80\x99d just shrug it\n off, she\xe2\x80\x99d say; \xe2\x80\x98Oh that? It\xe2\x80\x99s just a scratch, no big deal!\xe2\x80\x99\n\nOh, but Rainbow, it is a big deal, Twilight thought. You need to think about yourself, too, instead of trying to please everyone.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, maybe you should get in the bath, to-\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow faltered, momentarily. \xe2\x80\x9c-To calm down, you seem a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight nodded her head, but still managed to make it look morose, albeit \nunintentionally and slowly raised herself off the tiles.\n\nShe left uncertain hoofprints upon the floor, fading away, barely there.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBut Rainbow, I ran the bath for you. I can\xe2\x80\x99t just usurp you of that pleasure, I\xe2\x80\x99d feel bad\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow smiled, more certainly than the last time.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re too kind. But you need this more than me, I think.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe last couple of words seemed to peter out, back to uncertainty. \n Twilight thought it odd, hearing Rainbow Dash so tentative. She was \nusually so brash, so cocky. To hear her like this\xe2\x80\xa6 It didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem right.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, why don\xe2\x80\x99t we share?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face flushed out in red.\n\nBut not like that dark, accusatory crimson upon her forehead.\nA jolly red, pale.\nThe kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with friends, and happiness. It made Twilight smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat, get in the bath? Together?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings started to rise, slowly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, why not? It\xe2\x80\x99s big enough, and it would be practical; we wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have \nto run another, once one of us had finished, and well, I\xe2\x80\x99d like to help \nclean up your wound\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight liked this idea, it\xe2\x80\x99d be quality time with Rainbow. She could use it to\n get to know her better, after all, they were friends, but the more \nTwilight thought about it, the more she realised how little she knew \nabout Rainbow Dash: The fastest flier in all of Equestria!\nShe ought to have a couple of interesting stories to tell her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, if you\xe2\x80\x99re sure...\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow sounded very flustered, all of a sudden. What\xe2\x80\x99d got into her? Maybe it \nwas just the alcohol, warping her emotions slightly.\n\nTwilight clopped towards the bathtub, hauled herself into the warm water, and \nmelted in bliss. She let out a calming sigh, and stretched her legs, \nrelieving tension.\n\nTwilight looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and then to her forehead, to the wound.\n\nAgainst the blush of Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s cheeks, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look quite as bad anymore.\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCome on Rainbow, get in!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow halted for a moment, and then put her fore-hooves on the side of the \nbath. She looked into the water; although blurred, she could see \nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s legs.\n\nThis wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a good idea, Rainbow thought to herself. She should just have \nsaid no, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to put Twilight down. She\xe2\x80\x99d only just come \nup, as well, she\xe2\x80\x99d be delicate, and Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to shatter her \nagain. I mean, look what Twilight\xe2\x80\x99d done just by sitting on the floor by\n herself.\n\nBut Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but have inappropriate thoughts. Thoughts like that.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Rainbow, you should probably close your wings first?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nDamn things, always popping up uninvited. She was trying to be a friend. Twilight was vulnerable, melancholic, and yet Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s body had other ideas. She just wanted to help!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I already got it.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow tested the water with her hoof, it was an amiable temperature. The kind\n of warmth you\xe2\x80\x99d get that makes you just want to sleep, forever.\n\nRainbow faltered once more, looking down at the seemingly impenetrable water\xe2\x80\x99s \nsurface, even thought her hoof was touching it, not even ten seconds \nago.\n\nShe would try to be a good friend, even if she had to hang her own feelings.\n\nNo, Rainbow wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t try.\n\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d be the best friend there could be.\n\nForcing herself, she took the plunge.\n', 3, 28, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'3\'></a><h3>Young Tender Hearts Beat Fast</h3>\n<p>Rainbow was dozing, her mind drifting through the library\xe2\x80\x99s musky essence.</p><p>She\xe2\x80\x99d been laid there for a while now, waiting on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s call, but she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>heard a distinct lack of sound from her friend, just the constant of the</p><p> distant flow of water was audible.</p><p class="double">Even though Twilight was a quiet pony, at times, especially when in the </p><p>library, Rainbow had to admit it was odd that she\xe2\x80\x99d said nothing to her or even made a noise since leaving.</p><p>Maybe she was a quiet drunk?</p><p>Hopefully not, Rainbow thought. A plume of vapour hit her, filling </p><p>her lungs with warm, moist air, and clouding her vision.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSecond,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight finished.</p><p class="double">Twilight was slumped upon the floor, head in hooves. Her purple, starkly against</p><p> the black of the tiles made for a powerful contrast.</p><p class="double">It was almost as Twilight was alone.</p><p class="double">The tiles were streaked with indefinite misty lines, once drawn in by hoof and tear.</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow tried to remain sounding calm, yet her concern for Twilight wavered through into her voice.</p><p class="double">Twilight looked down, shielding her face from Rainbow with her hoof.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cY-yeah?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was as quiet and as light as the vapour that hung in the air, but without the stifling heat.</p><p class="double">Rainbow slowly clopped around Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s place on the floor, making a move </p><p>towards the seemingly hap-hazard plumbing leading to the large, old </p><p>bathtub of the library.</p><p>She cranked the faucet closed, with a screeching creak that sliced through </p><p>the mist, breaking the tension, whilst simultaneously reinforcing it\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>intensity.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou alright?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">At least she sounded more confident this time, Rainbow thought to her self, albeit a tad quizzical.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, I\xe2\x80\x99m just a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight exhaled, but her huff was interjected by a spike of sorrow. \xe2\x80\x9cYou know?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow faced Twilight once more, although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t return the gesture.</p><p class="double">Rainbow thought, for a moment. She thought about how Twilight was definitely not just a bit \xe2\x80\x98You know,\xe2\x80\x99 and how Twilight had cried to herself, for some reason regarding herself.</p><p>If only she could remember what it was that had made Twilight feel so morose.</p><p>Rainbow knew it was to do with her, or something she\xe2\x80\x99d done.</p><p>However, that somehow made it worse, as it had clearly rubbed off onto Twilight,</p><p> but she herself, well, she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t the foggiest idea as to what she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>done.</p><p class="double">It didn\xe2\x80\x99t help that Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t terribly well versed within the art of emotions. It</p><p> was probably down to the fact that she\xe2\x80\x99d never experienced anything </p><p>like this before; she\xe2\x80\x99d been far too busy racing around to think about </p><p>such embarrassing things.</p><p class="double">Nevertheless, Rainbow was sure she could fix this; after all, she was the best young </p><p>flier, so she could be the best at emotions, too, surely?</p><p>This should be easy.</p><p class="double">Rainbow picked her hoof up and eased it silently towards Twilight, reaching </p><p>through the vapour. She brought her hoof up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin, and </p><p>brought her eyes up to her own.</p><p>Twilight snapped her eyes shut, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t resist Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s soft, reassuring touch.</p><p class="double">Rainbow noticed the red streaks upon Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn, jolting her memory. This </p><p>was probably what had her down; she must have been feeling guilty. Guilty for something Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even worried about.</p><p>It was just a small gash, nothing more.</p><p>Twilight was overreacting, probably partially due to the alcohol she\xe2\x80\x99d consumed,</p><p> but also probably partly to do with her obsessive, delicate </p><p>personality. She\xe2\x80\x99d been known to snap when under tension before.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight\xe2\x80\xa6, Open your eyes.\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">Twilight slowly brought her eyelids apart.</p><p>Only by a crack, at first, but then widening, looking up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tentative, attemptedly reassuring smile.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re feeling a bit shaken\xe2\x80\xa6, but let\xe2\x80\x99s not get all tearful, eh?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight continued to study Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face, moving on from her smile.</p><p>She was a pretty pony, really, but Rainbow would probably deny the notion. </p><p>Then again, if she\xe2\x80\x99d tried to make an effort on fabricating any sort of \xe2\x80\x98look\xe2\x80\x99, then it would probably fall down.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">It was just the way she hung herself so nonchalantly, without a care in the world.</p><p>Even with her wound\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p>Twilight felt sadness well up inside her.</p><p>Even with that unsightly gash upon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, she looked good. In </p><p>fact, it somewhat enhanced her tomboyish beauty. But she\xe2\x80\x99d just shrug it</p><p> off, she\xe2\x80\x99d say; \xe2\x80\x98Oh that? It\xe2\x80\x99s just a scratch, no big deal!\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">Oh, but Rainbow, it is a big deal, Twilight thought. You need to think about yourself, too, instead of trying to please everyone.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, maybe you should get in the bath, to-\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow faltered, momentarily. \xe2\x80\x9c-To calm down, you seem a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight nodded her head, but still managed to make it look morose, albeit </p><p>unintentionally and slowly raised herself off the tiles.</p><p class="double">She left uncertain hoofprints upon the floor, fading away, barely there.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut Rainbow, I ran the bath for you. I can\xe2\x80\x99t just usurp you of that pleasure, I\xe2\x80\x99d feel bad\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow smiled, more certainly than the last time.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re too kind. But you need this more than me, I think.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The last couple of words seemed to peter out, back to uncertainty. </p><p> Twilight thought it odd, hearing Rainbow Dash so tentative. She was </p><p>usually so brash, so cocky. To hear her like this\xe2\x80\xa6 It didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem right.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWell, why don\xe2\x80\x99t we share?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face flushed out in red.</p><p class="double">But not like that dark, accusatory crimson upon her forehead.</p><p>A jolly red, pale.</p><p>The kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with friends, and happiness. It made Twilight smile.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat, get in the bath? Together?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings started to rise, slowly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, why not? It\xe2\x80\x99s big enough, and it would be practical; we wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have </p><p>to run another, once one of us had finished, and well, I\xe2\x80\x99d like to help </p><p>clean up your wound\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight liked this idea, it\xe2\x80\x99d be quality time with Rainbow. She could use it to</p><p> get to know her better, after all, they were friends, but the more </p><p>Twilight thought about it, the more she realised how little she knew </p><p>about Rainbow Dash: The fastest flier in all of Equestria!</p><p>She ought to have a couple of interesting stories to tell her.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, if you\xe2\x80\x99re sure...\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow sounded very flustered, all of a sudden. What\xe2\x80\x99d got into her? Maybe it </p><p>was just the alcohol, warping her emotions slightly.</p><p class="double">Twilight clopped towards the bathtub, hauled herself into the warm water, and </p><p>melted in bliss. She let out a calming sigh, and stretched her legs, </p><p>relieving tension.</p><p class="double">Twilight looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and then to her forehead, to the wound.</p><p class="double">Against the blush of Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s cheeks, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look quite as bad anymore.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cCome on Rainbow, get in!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow halted for a moment, and then put her fore-hooves on the side of the </p><p>bath. She looked into the water; although blurred, she could see </p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s legs.</p><p class="double">This wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a good idea, Rainbow thought to herself. The kind</p><p> of warmth you\xe2\x80\x99d get that makes you just want to sleep, forever.</p><p class="double">Rainbow faltered once more, looking down at the seemingly impenetrable water\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>surface, even thought her hoof was touching it, not even ten seconds </p><p>ago.</p><p class="double">She would try to be a good friend, even if she had to hang her own feelings.</p><p class="double">No, Rainbow wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t try.</p><p class="double">She\xe2\x80\x99d be the best friend there could be.</p><p class="double">Forcing herself, she took the plunge.</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 15], 'parent_story_id': 15, 'txt': '//------------------------------//\n// Young Tender Hearts Beat Fast// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\nRainbow was dozing, her mind drifting through the library\xe2\x80\x99s musky essence.\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d been laid there for a while now, waiting on Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s call, but she\xe2\x80\x99d \nheard a distinct lack of sound from her friend, just the constant of the\n distant flow of water was audible.\n\nEven though Twilight was a quiet pony, at times, especially when in the \nlibrary, Rainbow had to admit it was odd that she\xe2\x80\x99d said nothing to her or even made a noise since leaving.\nMaybe she was a quiet drunk?\nHopefully not, Rainbow thought. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stand silence, it made her jumpy. Not that her friends would know that.\nHowever, that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t completely correct, really. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the absence of audio that made her jumpy. It was what lies within silence.\nAnyway, Rainbow was fine, for now. The sound of the trickling water was tiding her over.\n\nIf Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t talk?\n\xe2\x80\x98Well, that\xe2\x80\x99d be troubling,\xe2\x80\x99 Rainbow thought; although she\xe2\x80\x99d weighed up the \nsilence with the presence of a friend, and all of a sudden, well, it \njust didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem as bad.\n\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d experienced it once before, on that cold, stormy night.\n\n A massive clap of thunder had caught her off guard, in the ambient \nsoundscape that had surrounded her, and she\xe2\x80\x99d dropped to the ground, \nfearful.\nThen that filly had rescued her, taken her in, and just sat with her. Neither of the ponies said anything, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t needed.\nJust to be together.\nTwo ponies as one.\nOnly somepony special could make her feel safe like that.\n\nOf course, Rainbow had still told her not to tell anypony about the fear she\xe2\x80\x99d experienced that night.\nIt just wasn\xe2\x80\x99t cool.\n\nRainbow could feel another \xe2\x80\x98wave\xe2\x80\x99 of warmth gearing to flush across her face, \nso, to distract herself, she decided to see what Twilight was up to; \nShe\xe2\x80\x99d been taking her time, after all.\nAs soon as she rolled over to stand, Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings eased back out into an arc. She\n chose to ignore them, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t really care. Yet still, Rainbow felt \nembarrassed, as her thoughts turned to Twilight once more.\n\nAs Rainbow clopped sluggishly through the library, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t fazed at all\n by the once sinister manufactured shapes of the books. Much more so was\n Rainbow worried about a sound, coming from the bathroom. A sound other \nthan the flow of water; the sound of a quietly crying filly, morose.\nShe hadn\xe2\x80\x99t heard the sobs at first, but as Rainbow neared the door, each \nsob became more pronounced, a spike of noise amongst the listlessness of\n the library.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh Rainbow\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow Dash froze, a mane\xe2\x80\x99s breadth from the door separating Twilight and herself.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t believe I\xe2\x80\x99d do such a thing\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight sounded pained, it was layered within every word of her voice. Not even\n the barrier of the door could take the chilling edge off of the words, \nfor Rainbow. She felt each word hit her ears, laden with despair.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI just-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\nTwilight broke into tears.\n\nRainbow was finding it hard to cope with Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s emotions. Each sob was worse than the last, making Rainbow feel uneasy.\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d not heard much of what Twilight had been lamenting about, but it was clear that she was the source.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIt was too much. Rainbow had to go in. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear hearing her friend like this.\n\nRainbow brought her hoof up to the door, and tapped it, quietly, yet firmly. \nRegardless, the taps echoed around the library, accentuating their \npresence.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, I\xe2\x80\x99m coming in.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow sounded uncertain.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWait, Rainbow. Just give me a-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\nRainbow pushed the door open, regardless. A plume of vapour hit her, filling \nher lungs with warm, moist air, and clouding her vision.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSecond,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight finished.\n\nTwilight was slumped upon the floor, head in hooves. Her purple, starkly against\n the black of the tiles made for a powerful contrast.\n\nIt was almost as Twilight was alone.\n\nThe tiles were streaked with indefinite misty lines, once drawn in by hoof and tear.\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow tried to remain sounding calm, yet her concern for Twilight wavered through into her voice.\n\nTwilight looked down, shielding her face from Rainbow with her hoof.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cY-yeah?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was as quiet and as light as the vapour that hung in the air, but without the stifling heat.\n\nRainbow slowly clopped around Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s place on the floor, making a move \ntowards the seemingly hap-hazard plumbing leading to the large, old \nbathtub of the library.\nShe cranked the faucet closed, with a screeching creak that sliced through \nthe mist, breaking the tension, whilst simultaneously reinforcing it\xe2\x80\x99s \nintensity.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou alright?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nAt least she sounded more confident this time, Rainbow thought to her self, albeit a tad quizzical.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, I\xe2\x80\x99m just a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight exhaled, but her huff was interjected by a spike of sorrow. \xe2\x80\x9cYou know?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow faced Twilight once more, although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t return the gesture.\n\nRainbow thought, for a moment. She thought about how Twilight was definitely not just a bit \xe2\x80\x98You know,\xe2\x80\x99 and how Twilight had cried to herself, for some reason regarding herself.\nIf only she could remember what it was that had made Twilight feel so morose.\nRainbow knew it was to do with her, or something she\xe2\x80\x99d done.\nHowever, that somehow made it worse, as it had clearly rubbed off onto Twilight,\n but she herself, well, she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t the foggiest idea as to what she\xe2\x80\x99d \ndone.\n\nIt didn\xe2\x80\x99t help that Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t terribly well versed within the art of emotions. It\n was probably down to the fact that she\xe2\x80\x99d never experienced anything \nlike this before; she\xe2\x80\x99d been far too busy racing around to think about \nsuch embarrassing things.\n\nNevertheless, Rainbow was sure she could fix this; after all, she was the best young \nflier, so she could be the best at emotions, too, surely?\nThis should be easy.\n\nRainbow picked her hoof up and eased it silently towards Twilight, reaching \nthrough the vapour. She brought her hoof up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin, and \nbrought her eyes up to her own.\nTwilight snapped her eyes shut, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t resist Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s soft, reassuring touch.\n\nRainbow noticed the red streaks upon Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s horn, jolting her memory. This \nwas probably what had her down; she must have been feeling guilty. Guilty for something Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even worried about.\nIt was just a small gash, nothing more.\nTwilight was overreacting, probably partially due to the alcohol she\xe2\x80\x99d consumed,\n but also probably partly to do with her obsessive, delicate \npersonality. She\xe2\x80\x99d been known to snap when under tension before.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight\xe2\x80\xa6, Open your eyes.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\nTwilight slowly brought her eyelids apart.\nOnly by a crack, at first, but then widening, looking up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s tentative, attemptedly reassuring smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, I know you\xe2\x80\x99re feeling a bit shaken\xe2\x80\xa6, but let\xe2\x80\x99s not get all tearful, eh?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight continued to study Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face, moving on from her smile.\nShe was a pretty pony, really, but Rainbow would probably deny the notion. \nThen again, if she\xe2\x80\x99d tried to make an effort on fabricating any sort of \xe2\x80\x98look\xe2\x80\x99, then it would probably fall down.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIt was just the way she hung herself so nonchalantly, without a care in the world.\nEven with her wound\xe2\x80\xa6\nTwilight felt sadness well up inside her.\nEven with that unsightly gash upon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, she looked good. In \nfact, it somewhat enhanced her tomboyish beauty. But she\xe2\x80\x99d just shrug it\n off, she\xe2\x80\x99d say; \xe2\x80\x98Oh that? It\xe2\x80\x99s just a scratch, no big deal!\xe2\x80\x99\n\nOh, but Rainbow, it is a big deal, Twilight thought. You need to think about yourself, too, instead of trying to please everyone.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, maybe you should get in the bath, to-\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow faltered, momentarily. \xe2\x80\x9c-To calm down, you seem a bit\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight nodded her head, but still managed to make it look morose, albeit \nunintentionally and slowly raised herself off the tiles.\n\nShe left uncertain hoofprints upon the floor, fading away, barely there.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBut Rainbow, I ran the bath for you. I can\xe2\x80\x99t just usurp you of that pleasure, I\xe2\x80\x99d feel bad\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow smiled, more certainly than the last time.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, you\xe2\x80\x99re too kind. But you need this more than me, I think.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe last couple of words seemed to peter out, back to uncertainty. \n Twilight thought it odd, hearing Rainbow Dash so tentative. She was \nusually so brash, so cocky. To hear her like this\xe2\x80\xa6 It didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem right.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWell, why don\xe2\x80\x99t we share?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s face flushed out in red.\n\nBut not like that dark, accusatory crimson upon her forehead.\nA jolly red, pale.\nThe kind of red you\xe2\x80\x99d associate with friends, and happiness. It made Twilight smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat, get in the bath? Together?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s wings started to rise, slowly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, why not? It\xe2\x80\x99s big enough, and it would be practical; we wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have \nto run another, once one of us had finished, and well, I\xe2\x80\x99d like to help \nclean up your wound\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight liked this idea, it\xe2\x80\x99d be quality time with Rainbow. She could use it to\n get to know her better, after all, they were friends, but the more \nTwilight thought about it, the more she realised how little she knew \nabout Rainbow Dash: The fastest flier in all of Equestria!\nShe ought to have a couple of interesting stories to tell her.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, if you\xe2\x80\x99re sure...\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow sounded very flustered, all of a sudden. What\xe2\x80\x99d got into her? Maybe it \nwas just the alcohol, warping her emotions slightly.\n\nTwilight clopped towards the bathtub, hauled herself into the warm water, and \nmelted in bliss. She let out a calming sigh, and stretched her legs, \nrelieving tension.\n\nTwilight looked into Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, and then to her forehead, to the wound.\n\nAgainst the blush of Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s cheeks, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look quite as bad anymore.\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cCome on Rainbow, get in!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow halted for a moment, and then put her fore-hooves on the side of the \nbath. She looked into the water; although blurred, she could see \nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s legs.\n\nThis wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a good idea, Rainbow thought to herself. She should just have \nsaid no, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to put Twilight down. She\xe2\x80\x99d only just come \nup, as well, she\xe2\x80\x99d be delicate, and Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to shatter her \nagain. I mean, look what Twilight\xe2\x80\x99d done just by sitting on the floor by\n herself.\n\nBut Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but have inappropriate thoughts. Thoughts like that.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cUh, Rainbow, you should probably close your wings first?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nDamn things, always popping up uninvited. She was trying to be a friend. Twilight was vulnerable, melancholic, and yet Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s body had other ideas. She just wanted to help!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, Twi\xe2\x80\x99, I already got it.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow tested the water with her hoof, it was an amiable temperature. The kind\n of warmth you\xe2\x80\x99d get that makes you just want to sleep, forever.\n\nRainbow faltered once more, looking down at the seemingly impenetrable water\xe2\x80\x99s \nsurface, even thought her hoof was touching it, not even ten seconds \nago.\n\nShe would try to be a good friend, even if she had to hang her own feelings.\n\nNo, Rainbow wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t try.\n\nShe\xe2\x80\x99d be the best friend there could be.\n\nForcing herself, she took the plunge.\n', 'epub': None}

Play it cool.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">With her newly devised internal mantra, Rainbow tentatively shifted backwards, the film of the water ever-clinging to her body.</p><p class="double">Her</p><p> back made contact with Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s belly, its warmth sending shivers </p><p>down Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s spine. It was odd, warmth giving her the shivers, but she</p><p> was more shocked at how Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s warmth differed from that of regular warmth.</p><p>The warmth of a living, loving pony.</p><p>Not the warmth of a cold, inanimate object.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> laid back into Twilight, overcome with emotions, deciding that focusing</p><p> on her mantra was more important than keeping bodily composure.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh, good. Rainbow, you don\xe2\x80\x99t mind if I touch your forehead, do you?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Yes, right, that\xe2\x80\x99s why she was here, so Twilight could help her clean up.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cN-no, it should be fine, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98Great, I\xe2\x80\x99ve stuttered,\xe2\x80\x99 Thought Rainbow, \xe2\x80\x98and on top of that, I accentuated her name a bit too much\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, just tell me if it hurts, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> juddered her head, ever so slightly, to show the affirmative. It was </p><p>the reaction that used the least amount of concentration; she needed it,</p><p> after all. She needed it to keep on top of her mantra. She needed it to</p><p> keep her wings down.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAre you still going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party tomorrow?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> spoke nonchalantly, as if this was no different to a regular </p><p>conversation. As if there was nothing that hung in the air; only </p><p>vapours.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cY-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> began to answer, but Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s manoeuvres caught her off guard. </p><p>Twilight leant forwards, pushing into Rainbow, their bodies locking </p><p>together, in an unintentional embrace, becoming one.</p><p> Rainbow felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoof; tracing along her shoulder, moving </p><p>towards her face, carefully brushing her mane away, to reveal her tender</p><p> wound.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cPardon, Rainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Wow, Twilight really was clueless. It was clear from her voice; there were no quiet, husky whispers, just stark, everyday voices.</p><p>This made Rainbow feel a bit more at ease.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, Twilight, I should make it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> was glad she\xe2\x80\x99d managed to get the words out this time, she\xe2\x80\x99d show </p><p>Twilight just how confident Rainbow Dash; Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s best young flier </p><p>could be!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cGood, I shall look forward to seeing you there.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still normal. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to clean your wound now, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> brought her leg up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, with flannel in hoof. She </p><p>brushed across the cut, slowly, tentatively. It hurt, but Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t</p><p> mind; she could feel the affection Twilight was putting into her care, </p><p>and it was like anaesthesia.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> closed her eyes, to divert her feelings; both the pain and the blush </p><p>threatening to coarse their way across her forehead. She thought about </p><p>Twilight and herself; how had they ended up in this situation?</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, your head is all cleaned up!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> opened her eyes, and looked down. The water was contaminated with red. </p><p>Red, watered down from her blood, but it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look sinister, it was </p><p>more reminiscent of love.</p><p>Hah;</p><p> Twilight, if only you knew, my head is far from clean, inside. It\xe2\x80\x99s as </p><p>convoluted as the pink, swirling around in the empty, clear water. But </p><p>you won\xe2\x80\x99t know; you\xe2\x80\x99ll never know.</p><p>I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you, it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be cool.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThank you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">At least she was still confident in her speech, if not in mind.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnything to help out a friend!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s body relent for a second, a cool rush of air in place </p><p>of where their pelts pressed together. Rainbow sighed for a second, </p><p>relieved, but then she felt Twilight once more, her fore-legs snaking </p><p>under her own, almost caressing her body, closing around her front, </p><p>pulling their bodies together once more. Twilight softly laid her head </p><p>upon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s shoulder, and brought her mouth up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s ear.</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s heart was pounding; this was what it was like, that time before, with that other filly, before she\xe2\x80\x99d confessed to her. That was like her, to do something as brash as that- but not like Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t like Twilight at all.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh,</p><p> Rainbow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was quiet, husky, whispery. It was just how </p><p>Rainbow had imagined, not only moments ago. It sunk into her, like her </p><p>stomach had been sinking; twisting and turning with each of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>seemingly blas\xc3\xa9 touches.&nbsp;&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow felt warmth on her shoulder, but not like the warmth of life, or</p><p> the warmth of something inanimate. It felt cold. The cold of sorrowful,</p><p> regretful tears. This wasn\xe2\x80\x99t what she\xe2\x80\x99d imagined at all. Intimacy like </p><p>this was supposed to be joyful, that\xe2\x80\x99s what she\xe2\x80\x99d learnt, anyway.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow could feel her compassionate sadness, against Twilight, as one, reverberating with each tear, each miniscule movement. Their bodies jolting, juddering, with each wave of emotion.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI just\xe2\x80\xa6 I j-j-just didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to hurt you s-s-s-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98I have to calm her down.\xe2\x80\x99 Rainbow thought, \xe2\x80\x98I can\xe2\x80\x99t bear to hear her like this, to feel her like this.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, It\xe2\x80\x99s fine.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow put her most affirmative voice on. \xe2\x80\x9cDidn\xe2\x80\x99t I tell you it was fine?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow could still hear Twilight in her ear, snorting, choking on sorrow, ungainly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so s-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow was lost for words, not sure how to comfort Twilight.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> picked her legs up, from her sides, and moved her hooves to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s,</p><p> still clinging to her. Rainbow prised them apart, exhaling slightly, </p><p>and moved slightly forward, away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">She felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s head leave its place on her own shoulder, and Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hooves leave her own, withdrawing.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> dipped her forelegs back into the water, and using them to steady </p><p>herself; she twisted around, as fast as the ever-clinging water would </p><p>let her, to face Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cJust\xe2\x80\xa6 don\xe2\x80\x99t be so hard on yourself,\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> sliced through the water\xe2\x80\x99s resistance with her right foreleg, to </p><p>connect with Twilight; hoof to hoof. Rainbow saw their hooves meet, </p><p>tentatively yet firm, within the swirling translucent red of the water.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> was studying Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s face, she had a delicate air about her, her </p><p>lavender somewhat contrasted by the blood red Rainbow had left upon her.</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> was looking down into the water, dejected. Rainbow picked her left hoof</p><p> out of the water, dripping. Rainbow could see that the thin purple</p><p> irises were not as definite as they could be, blurred by tears and a </p><p>red bloodshot presence. This didn\xe2\x80\x99t stop them from being pretty, yes, </p><p>the melancholy shimmered through, but that somewhat made her eyes seem </p><p>all the more vivid, all the more real.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re</p><p> a fantastic pony, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s confidence had left her, and in </p><p>its place, there was careful heartfelt speech. \xe2\x80\x9cNo; you\xe2\x80\x99re a fantastic friend. \xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> looked very pretty; there was no two ways about it. Though she didn\xe2\x80\x99t care, she was beyond that now, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t really matter what was cool or not. Rainbow could feel a flood of </p><p>emotions, emotions she\xe2\x80\x99d never felt before, emotions that belonged to Twilight.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> broke the ring she\xe2\x80\x99d formed around Twilight with her legs, in favour of</p><p> expressing her self further. Although it was beautiful, it was just so\xe2\x80\xa6 Intense. She\xe2\x80\x99d only experienced emotions like that once before, during her times with that filly.</p><p class="double">With that filly\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">A wave of guilt came over Rainbow, overcoming the new, intense emotions.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> pulled away from Twilight, prising her tongue from its lustful dance, </p><p>bringing her hooves back in check, breaking Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s embrace, and </p><p>finally, prolonged by Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eager leaning forwards; Rainbow broke </p><p>the kiss.</p><p class="double">For</p><p> a moment, a thin, delicate string of saliva connected the two fillies, </p><p>glistening, only to be shattered by Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s drive to look down, into </p><p>the void filled by reddened water, where they once connected so </p><p>tenderly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m, so sorry,</p><p> Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow spoke to the water, in a tiny voice. And I\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be the element of Loyalty\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>The</p><p> bath water had long since become frigid, yet Twilight still remained in</p><p> the reddened mixture, beginning to wrinkle, but still in the same </p><p>position that Rainbow had left her in. However, Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t care </p><p>that she was cold and wrinkling, or rather, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t notice.</p><p>She</p><p> was too busy desperately trying to piece together what\xe2\x80\x99d just happened.</p><p> There had to be a reason, she knew it; things didn\xe2\x80\x99t just happen.</p><p> There was always cause and effect, as science would have her know. </p><p>Also, if she looked into her magic studies, she knew that Rainbow would </p><p>never leave like that, not if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have good reason to, she was the Element of Loyalty, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t she?</p><p>Even so, Twilight would have liked to have had an explanation for the whole thing.</p><p> She\xe2\x80\x99d been enjoying her time with Rainbow, even if it was unexpected, </p><p>she\xe2\x80\x99d thought they were just sharing a bath out of necessity, like </p><p>Twilight used to when she was small. She\xe2\x80\x99d been taken aback, but it </p><p>seemed like the right thing to do, after all, she was here to learn </p><p>about the magic of friendship.</p><p>Twilight</p><p> sighed to her self, and stood up on all fours, mirroring Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>image, and levitated the same towel that she\xe2\x80\x99d used to clear the mirror </p><p>to her. With a sinking feeling within her stomach, Twilight thought to </p><p>herself;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cWhy does friendship have to be so\xe2\x80\xa6 Complicated?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Tears came back to Twilight, involuntarily, delicately, leaving sorrow behind, slowly diluting the reddened water.</p><p class="double"></p><p>*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>Rainbow</p><p> was tired, even after just ten minutes of flying, but she attributed </p><p>this to the mach speed at which her brain was whirring at; not how the </p><p>evening had taken its toll on her athletic body.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be loyal; I\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be loyal.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">As she landed, Rainbow felt a small pang of bittersweet satisfaction; she\xe2\x80\x99d made it this far.</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were dimming, now, out of exhaustion, but she could still focus on what she\xe2\x80\x99d come for.</p><p class="double">She hesitantly crept forwards, towards the window she\xe2\x80\x99d come for. It was open a crack, like a small glimmer of hope.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> brought her hoof up to the window, and pushed it open, the pane of </p><p>glass sliding silently into the dark stillness of the room. She timidly </p><p>hauled herself over the windowsill, landing in the room with a silent </p><p>clop.</p><p class="double">There were shadows, all of unnatural, unnerving shapes, carved by moonlight, not dissimilar to that of Twili- Of the library\xe2\x80\x99s shadows.</p><p> Nevertheless, Rainbow did her best to ignore them, and honed in on a </p><p>more toned, natural looking shadow, laid on top of what seemed to be a </p><p>bed.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI need to talk to you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s voice was ghostly, diminished in the dead of the bedroom.</p><p class="double">She</p><p> sighed, with a tint of frustration; she\xe2\x80\x99d have to be louder. Rainbow </p><p>brought her voice up to a loud, firm, important tone, and with a hint of</p><p> apprehension, announced:</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI need to talk to you; Applejack.\xe2\x80\x9d</b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'version': 1, 'parent_story_id': 15}, 'chapter_id': 30, 'cursor': <mysql.connector.cursor.MySQLCursor object at 0x02E5F6D0>, 'connection': <mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection object at 0x02E01A70>, 'html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'4\'></a><h3>Wanting</h3>\n<p>The warmth of the water engulfed Rainbow, she could feel its swirling </p><p>encapsulate her; capture her, even more so than the vapour did.</p><p>Now?</p><p> The once warm, oppressive vapour was now like fresh air, for Rainbow. </p><p>Now it was the water that was clingy, effortlessly smothering her body, </p><p>she was in its grip.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re looking awfully stiff!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was stating the obvious for her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy don\xe2\x80\x99t you lean back and relax?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Yeah, relax. Right.</p><p>If only she could stop thinking about the current situation. Twilight and herself, in a bath, together.</p><p>It was all far too exciting.</p><p>Rainbow sighed, melancholically; she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let Twilight know that she was even remotely</p><p> into fillies. Plus, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t like Rainbow lusted after each and every </p><p>filly; it was just the select couple: Twilight, and that other filly, but somehow, that made it worse.</p><p class="double">Still, she had to make it look otherwise, after all, there were reasons Rainbow hadn\xe2\x80\x99t told anypony about these feelings.</p><p>She had to play it cool.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, if you lean up against me, I can clean up your-\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice panged with a twinge of guilt. \xe2\x80\x9cInjury.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">There goes that innocence again. Does Twilight not see the intimacy in that position?</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98Play it cool, Dash. Play it cool.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">With her newly devised internal mantra, Rainbow tentatively shifted backwards, the film of the water ever-clinging to her body.</p><p class="double">Her</p><p> back made contact with Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s belly, its warmth sending shivers </p><p>down Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s spine. It was odd, warmth giving her the shivers, but she</p><p> was more shocked at how Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s warmth differed from that of regular warmth.</p><p>The warmth of a living, loving pony.</p><p>Not the warmth of a cold, inanimate object.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> laid back into Twilight, overcome with emotions, deciding that focusing</p><p> on her mantra was more important than keeping bodily composure.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh, good. Rainbow, you don\xe2\x80\x99t mind if I touch your forehead, do you?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Yes, right, that\xe2\x80\x99s why she was here, so Twilight could help her clean up.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cN-no, it should be fine, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98Great, I\xe2\x80\x99ve stuttered,\xe2\x80\x99 Thought Rainbow, \xe2\x80\x98and on top of that, I accentuated her name a bit too much\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, just tell me if it hurts, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> juddered her head, ever so slightly, to show the affirmative. It was </p><p>the reaction that used the least amount of concentration; she needed it,</p><p> after all. She needed it to keep on top of her mantra. She needed it to</p><p> keep her wings down.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAre you still going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party tomorrow?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> spoke nonchalantly, as if this was no different to a regular </p><p>conversation. As if there was nothing that hung in the air; only </p><p>vapours.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cY-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> began to answer, but Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s manoeuvres caught her off guard. </p><p>Twilight leant forwards, pushing into Rainbow, their bodies locking </p><p>together, in an unintentional embrace, becoming one.</p><p> Rainbow felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoof; tracing along her shoulder, moving </p><p>towards her face, carefully brushing her mane away, to reveal her tender</p><p> wound.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cPardon, Rainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Wow, Twilight really was clueless. It was clear from her voice; there were no quiet, husky whispers, just stark, everyday voices.</p><p>This made Rainbow feel a bit more at ease.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, Twilight, I should make it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> was glad she\xe2\x80\x99d managed to get the words out this time, she\xe2\x80\x99d show </p><p>Twilight just how confident Rainbow Dash; Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s best young flier </p><p>could be!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cGood, I shall look forward to seeing you there.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still normal. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to clean your wound now, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> brought her leg up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, with flannel in hoof. She </p><p>brushed across the cut, slowly, tentatively. It hurt, but Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t</p><p> mind; she could feel the affection Twilight was putting into her care, </p><p>and it was like anaesthesia.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> closed her eyes, to divert her feelings; both the pain and the blush </p><p>threatening to coarse their way across her forehead. She thought about </p><p>Twilight and herself; how had they ended up in this situation?</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, your head is all cleaned up!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> opened her eyes, and looked down. The water was contaminated with red. </p><p>Red, watered down from her blood, but it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look sinister, it was </p><p>more reminiscent of love.</p><p>Hah;</p><p> Twilight, if only you knew, my head is far from clean, inside. It\xe2\x80\x99s as </p><p>convoluted as the pink, swirling around in the empty, clear water. But </p><p>you won\xe2\x80\x99t know; you\xe2\x80\x99ll never know.</p><p>I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you, it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be cool.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThank you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">At least she was still confident in her speech, if not in mind.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnything to help out a friend!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s body relent for a second, a cool rush of air in place </p><p>of where their pelts pressed together. Rainbow sighed for a second, </p><p>relieved, but then she felt Twilight once more, her fore-legs snaking </p><p>under her own, almost caressing her body, closing around her front, </p><p>pulling their bodies together once more. Twilight softly laid her head </p><p>upon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s shoulder, and brought her mouth up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s ear.</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s heart was pounding; this was what it was like, that time before, with that other filly, before she\xe2\x80\x99d confessed to her. That was like her, to do something as brash as that- but not like Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t like Twilight at all.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh,</p><p> Rainbow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was quiet, husky, whispery. It was just how </p><p>Rainbow had imagined, not only moments ago. It sunk into her, like her </p><p>stomach had been sinking; twisting and turning with each of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>seemingly blas\xc3\xa9 touches.&nbsp;&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow felt warmth on her shoulder, but not like the warmth of life, or</p><p> the warmth of something inanimate. It felt cold. The cold of sorrowful,</p><p> regretful tears. This wasn\xe2\x80\x99t what she\xe2\x80\x99d imagined at all. Intimacy like </p><p>this was supposed to be joyful, that\xe2\x80\x99s what she\xe2\x80\x99d learnt, anyway.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow could feel her compassionate sadness, against Twilight, as one, reverberating with each tear, each miniscule movement. Their bodies jolting, juddering, with each wave of emotion.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI just\xe2\x80\xa6 I j-j-just didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to hurt you s-s-s-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98I have to calm her down.\xe2\x80\x99 Rainbow thought, \xe2\x80\x98I can\xe2\x80\x99t bear to hear her like this, to feel her like this.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, It\xe2\x80\x99s fine.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow put her most affirmative voice on. \xe2\x80\x9cDidn\xe2\x80\x99t I tell you it was fine?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow could still hear Twilight in her ear, snorting, choking on sorrow, ungainly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so s-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow was lost for words, not sure how to comfort Twilight.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> picked her legs up, from her sides, and moved her hooves to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s,</p><p> still clinging to her. Rainbow prised them apart, exhaling slightly, </p><p>and moved slightly forward, away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">She felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s head leave its place on her own shoulder, and Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hooves leave her own, withdrawing.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> dipped her forelegs back into the water, and using them to steady </p><p>herself; she twisted around, as fast as the ever-clinging water would </p><p>let her, to face Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cJust\xe2\x80\xa6 don\xe2\x80\x99t be so hard on yourself,\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> sliced through the water\xe2\x80\x99s resistance with her right foreleg, to </p><p>connect with Twilight; hoof to hoof. Rainbow saw their hooves meet, </p><p>tentatively yet firm, within the swirling translucent red of the water.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> was studying Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s face, she had a delicate air about her, her </p><p>lavender somewhat contrasted by the blood red Rainbow had left upon her.</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> was looking down into the water, dejected. Rainbow picked her left hoof</p><p> out of the water, dripping. She brought it up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin, and </p><p>slowly, ever so slightly, brought Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s gaze up to her own.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The edges of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s frown faltered, twitching into the faintest of smiles. Delicate.</p><p>Subtle.</p><p class="double">But definitely there.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still quiet, still incurred upon with undertones of moroseness, but with a hint of affirmation.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> stroked her hoof up from Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin to her cheek, slightly </p><p>ruffling the thin, downy pelt that coated her. Rainbow looked into her </p><p>eyes; they were coy, yet forlorn. Rainbow could see that the thin purple</p><p> irises were not as definite as they could be, blurred by tears and a </p><p>red bloodshot presence. This didn\xe2\x80\x99t stop them from being pretty, yes, </p><p>the melancholy shimmered through, but that somewhat made her eyes seem </p><p>all the more vivid, all the more real.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re</p><p> a fantastic pony, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s confidence had left her, and in </p><p>its place, there was careful heartfelt speech. \xe2\x80\x9cNo; you\xe2\x80\x99re a fantastic friend. \xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> looked very pretty; there was no two ways about it. Rainbow studied her</p><p> face a bit closer, leaning in. No, wait, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find Twilight that pretty; she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t into fillies. It was just something about her, something alluring.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98Well, whatever,\xe2\x80\x99 Thought Rainbow \xe2\x80\x98I suppose Twilight can be cool sometimes too.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> felt her hind legs bump against Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, leaning in closer. Rainbow </p><p>weaved her legs over Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, the water now putting up little </p><p>resistance,&nbsp;&nbsp;pulling their bodies closer, chest to chest, haunches </p><p>brushing together, then resting upon one another, diffidently.</p><p class="double">All</p><p> the time, Rainbow was peering upon Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s face, examining every </p><p>last detail; how the edges of her mouth slowly petered out into a smile,</p><p> how her endearingly innocent dolefully joyful eyes darted around, as if</p><p> looking for an answer, where her pink streak of mane slowly faded out, </p><p>into deep purple.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> took her hooves back from Twilight, and placed them around her back, </p><p>pulling them the last couple of intimate inches together; closing the </p><p>indefinite gap of vapour between them, becoming one, once more.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s arms join around her own back, brushing just above her </p><p>wings. With this touch, Rainbow realised that her wings were doing that \xe2\x80\x98thing\xe2\x80\x99 again. Though she didn\xe2\x80\x99t care, she was beyond that now, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t really matter what was cool or not. Not with Twilight, anyway.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> slowly moved her face towards Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, now seeing every detail upon </p><p>her. She could see each hair, each impurity, every part of her intricate</p><p> prettiness. Well, Twilight could never be just pretty, could she? She\xe2\x80\x99d even have to make that complex too, wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t she?</p><p class="double">However,</p><p> instead of continuing to move face to face, Rainbow drifted her head </p><p>over to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s side, making a move for her ear. Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s mouth was </p><p>closing in, almost touching; when she adopted the huskiest tender voice </p><p>she could;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, you deserve so much more\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> slowly retracted her head back, brushing her lips across Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>cheek, for a bit longer than what could be described as a fleeting </p><p>accident. Rainbow regained eye contact with Twilight, which was </p><p>accompanied by another flush of warmth across her own face. This was </p><p>fine though, she just knew Twilight would be feeling the same way.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh\xe2\x80\xa6 Uhm\xe2\x80\xa6 Rainbow, I, I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what to say\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> was cut short, by Rainbow, leaning forwards the last couple of </p><p>millimetres and bridging the gap between them, in a clumsy, ineloquent </p><p>kiss. She closed her eyes once more, and moved in the short </p><p>distance between herself and Twilight.</p><p class="double">Again,</p><p> they made contact clumsily, Rainbow missing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth by a </p><p>fraction. She righted her mistake, (albeit enjoyable), and brought their</p><p> mouths together. At first, their kiss was only skin-deep, lips to lips,</p><p> but Rainbow pushed forwards, opening up, deepening.</p><p class="double">Rainbow thought, as she explored with Twilight, it was as if they were closer, not only in body, but in minds.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> slowly eased her tongue forwards, in a tentative sway, dancing across </p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s teeth, and then onwards, coercing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s tongue to join </p><p>the dance, to share the ecstasy.</p><p class="double">Within</p><p> their intimacy, it was really as they truly were together, not just in </p><p>mere physicality, but within minds. Rainbow could feel a flood of </p><p>emotions, emotions she\xe2\x80\x99d never felt before, emotions that belonged to Twilight.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> broke the ring she\xe2\x80\x99d formed around Twilight with her legs, in favour of</p><p> expressing her self further. She brought her left hoof up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> mane, tracing its way up her back, as she went, stroking.</p><p class="double">The rush of emotions was hard, for Rainbow. Although it was beautiful, it was just so\xe2\x80\xa6 Intense. She\xe2\x80\x99d only experienced emotions like that once before, during her times with that filly.</p><p class="double">With that filly\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">A wave of guilt came over Rainbow, overcoming the new, intense emotions.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> pulled away from Twilight, prising her tongue from its lustful dance, </p><p>bringing her hooves back in check, breaking Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s embrace, and </p><p>finally, prolonged by Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eager leaning forwards; Rainbow broke </p><p>the kiss.</p><p class="double">For</p><p> a moment, a thin, delicate string of saliva connected the two fillies, </p><p>glistening, only to be shattered by Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s drive to look down, into </p><p>the void filled by reddened water, where they once connected so </p><p>tenderly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m, so sorry,</p><p> Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow spoke to the water, in a tiny voice. Her words were </p><p>absorbed, without a reply. In an even tinier, almost inaudible tone, she</p><p> continued; \xe2\x80\x9cbut I have to go\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> got to all fours, and dripping blood-tinged water back into the bath, </p><p>she flapped her already-erect wings, and flew out the door; spraying red</p><p> back into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s bemused, disconcerted eyes.</p><p class="double">She</p><p> found the library front door easily, and threw in open, but in her </p><p>frantic haste, Rainbow neglected the idea of closing it behind her.</p><p class="double">As</p><p> the cold night air whipped past her in the sky, chilling her sopping </p><p>wet pelt; Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t care less, she just repeated the same </p><p>hysterical thoughts around in her head:</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia; I\xe2\x80\x99ve betrayed them both, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been disloyal. And I\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be the element of Loyalty\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>The</p><p> bath water had long since become frigid, yet Twilight still remained in</p><p> the reddened mixture, beginning to wrinkle, but still in the same </p><p>position that Rainbow had left her in. However, Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t care </p><p>that she was cold and wrinkling, or rather, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t notice.</p><p>She</p><p> was too busy desperately trying to piece together what\xe2\x80\x99d just happened.</p><p> There had to be a reason, she knew it; things didn\xe2\x80\x99t just happen.</p><p> There was always cause and effect, as science would have her know. </p><p>Also, if she looked into her magic studies, she knew that Rainbow would </p><p>never leave like that, not if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have good reason to, she was the Element of Loyalty, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t she?</p><p>Even so, Twilight would have liked to have had an explanation for the whole thing.</p><p> She\xe2\x80\x99d been enjoying her time with Rainbow, even if it was unexpected, </p><p>she\xe2\x80\x99d thought they were just sharing a bath out of necessity, like </p><p>Twilight used to when she was small. She\xe2\x80\x99d been taken aback, but it </p><p>seemed like the right thing to do, after all, she was here to learn </p><p>about the magic of friendship.</p><p>Twilight</p><p> sighed to her self, and stood up on all fours, mirroring Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>image, and levitated the same towel that she\xe2\x80\x99d used to clear the mirror </p><p>to her. With a sinking feeling within her stomach, Twilight thought to </p><p>herself;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cWhy does friendship have to be so\xe2\x80\xa6 Complicated?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Tears came back to Twilight, involuntarily, delicately, leaving sorrow behind, slowly diluting the reddened water.</p><p class="double"></p><p>*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>Rainbow</p><p> was tired, even after just ten minutes of flying, but she attributed </p><p>this to the mach speed at which her brain was whirring at; not how the </p><p>evening had taken its toll on her athletic body.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be loyal; I\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be loyal.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">As she landed, Rainbow felt a small pang of bittersweet satisfaction; she\xe2\x80\x99d made it this far.</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were dimming, now, out of exhaustion, but she could still focus on what she\xe2\x80\x99d come for.</p><p class="double">She hesitantly crept forwards, towards the window she\xe2\x80\x99d come for. It was open a crack, like a small glimmer of hope.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> brought her hoof up to the window, and pushed it open, the pane of </p><p>glass sliding silently into the dark stillness of the room. She timidly </p><p>hauled herself over the windowsill, landing in the room with a silent </p><p>clop.</p><p class="double">There were shadows, all of unnatural, unnerving shapes, carved by moonlight, not dissimilar to that of Twili- Of the library\xe2\x80\x99s shadows.</p><p> Nevertheless, Rainbow did her best to ignore them, and honed in on a </p><p>more toned, natural looking shadow, laid on top of what seemed to be a </p><p>bed.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI need to talk to you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s voice was ghostly, diminished in the dead of the bedroom.</p><p class="double">She</p><p> sighed, with a tint of frustration; she\xe2\x80\x99d have to be louder. Rainbow </p><p>brought her voice up to a loud, firm, important tone, and with a hint of</p><p> apprehension, announced:</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI need to talk to you; Applejack.\xe2\x80\x9d</b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'values': ['//------------------------------//\n// Wanting// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\nThe warmth of the water engulfed Rainbow, she could feel its swirling \nencapsulate her; capture her, even more so than the vapour did.\nNow?\n The once warm, oppressive vapour was now like fresh air, for Rainbow. \nNow it was the water that was clingy, effortlessly smothering her body, \nshe was in its grip.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re looking awfully stiff!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was stating the obvious for her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy don\xe2\x80\x99t you lean back and relax?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nYeah, relax.
