Twilight and herself, in a bath, together.\nIt was all far too exciting.\nRainbow sighed, melancholically; she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let Twilight know that she was even remotely\n into fillies. Plus, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t like Rainbow lusted after each and every \nfilly; it was just the select couple: Twilight, and that other filly, but somehow, that made it worse.\n\nStill, she had to make it look otherwise, after all, there were reasons Rainbow hadn\xe2\x80\x99t told anypony about these feelings.\nShe had to play it cool.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, if you lean up against me, I can clean up your-\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice panged with a twinge of guilt. \xe2\x80\x9cInjury.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThere goes that innocence again. Does Twilight not see the intimacy in that position?\n\n\xe2\x80\x98Play it cool, Dash. Play it cool.\xe2\x80\x99\n\nWith her newly devised internal mantra, Rainbow tentatively shifted backwards, the film of the water ever-clinging to her body.\n\nHer\n back made contact with Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s belly, its warmth sending shivers \ndown Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s spine. It was odd, warmth giving her the shivers, but she\n was more shocked at how Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s warmth differed from that of regular warmth.\nThe warmth of a living, loving pony.\nNot the warmth of a cold, inanimate object.\n\nRainbow\n laid back into Twilight, overcome with emotions, deciding that focusing\n on her mantra was more important than keeping bodily composure.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAh, good. Rainbow, you don\xe2\x80\x99t mind if I touch your forehead, do you?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nYes, right, that\xe2\x80\x99s why she was here, so Twilight could help her clean up.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cN-no, it should be fine, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x98Great, I\xe2\x80\x99ve stuttered,\xe2\x80\x99 Thought Rainbow, \xe2\x80\x98and on top of that, I accentuated her name a bit too much\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, just tell me if it hurts, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n juddered her head, ever so slightly, to show the affirmative. It was \nthe reaction that used the least amount of concentration; she needed it,\n after all. She needed it to keep on top of her mantra. She needed it to\n keep her wings down.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAre you still going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party tomorrow?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n spoke nonchalantly, as if this was no different to a regular \nconversation. As if there was nothing that hung in the air; only \nvapours.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cY-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\nRainbow\n began to answer, but Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s manoeuvres caught her off guard. \nTwilight leant forwards, pushing into Rainbow, their bodies locking \ntogether, in an unintentional embrace, becoming one.\n Rainbow felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoof; tracing along her shoulder, moving \ntowards her face, carefully brushing her mane away, to reveal her tender\n wound.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cPardon, Rainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nWow, Twilight really was clueless. It was clear from her voice; there were no quiet, husky whispers, just stark, everyday voices.\nThis made Rainbow feel a bit more at ease.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, Twilight, I should make it.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n was glad she\xe2\x80\x99d managed to get the words out this time, she\xe2\x80\x99d show \nTwilight just how confident Rainbow Dash; Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s best young flier \ncould be!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cGood, I shall look forward to seeing you there.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still normal. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to clean your wound now, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n brought her leg up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, with flannel in hoof. She \nbrushed across the cut, slowly, tentatively. It hurt, but Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t\n mind; she could feel the affection Twilight was putting into her care, \nand it was like anaesthesia.\n\nRainbow\n closed her eyes, to divert her feelings; both the pain and the blush \nthreatening to coarse their way across her forehead. She thought about \nTwilight and herself; how had they ended up in this situation?\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, your head is all cleaned up!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n opened her eyes, and looked down. The water was contaminated with red. \nRed, watered down from her blood, but it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look sinister, it was \nmore reminiscent of love.\nHah;\n Twilight, if only you knew, my head is far from clean, inside. It\xe2\x80\x99s as \nconvoluted as the pink, swirling around in the empty, clear water. But \nyou won\xe2\x80\x99t know; you\xe2\x80\x99ll never know.\nI can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you, it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be cool.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThank you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nAt least she was still confident in her speech, if not in mind.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAnything to help out a friend!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s body relent for a second, a cool rush of air in place \nof where their pelts pressed together. Rainbow sighed for a second, \nrelieved, but then she felt Twilight once more, her fore-legs snaking \nunder her own, almost caressing her body, closing around her front, \npulling their bodies together once more. Twilight softly laid her head \nupon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s shoulder, and brought her mouth up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s ear.\n\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s heart was pounding; this was what it was like, that time before, with that other filly, before she\xe2\x80\x99d confessed to her. That was like her, to do something as brash as that- but not like Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t like Twilight at all.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh,\n Rainbow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was quiet, husky, whispery. It was just how \nRainbow had imagined, not only moments ago. It sunk into her, like her \nstomach had been sinking; twisting and turning with each of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s \nseemingly blas\xc3\xa9 touches.  \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow felt warmth on her shoulder, but not like the warmth of life, or\n the warmth of something inanimate. It felt cold. The cold of sorrowful,\n regretful tears. This wasn\xe2\x80\x99t what she\xe2\x80\x99d imagined at all. Intimacy like \nthis was supposed to be joyful, that\xe2\x80\x99s what she\xe2\x80\x99d learnt, anyway.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow could feel her compassionate sadness, against Twilight, as one, reverberating with each tear, each miniscule movement. Their bodies jolting, juddering, with each wave of emotion.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI just\xe2\x80\xa6 I j-j-just didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to hurt you s-s-s-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x98I have to calm her down.\xe2\x80\x99 Rainbow thought, \xe2\x80\x98I can\xe2\x80\x99t bear to hear her like this, to feel her like this.\xe2\x80\x99\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, It\xe2\x80\x99s fine.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow put her most affirmative voice on. \xe2\x80\x9cDidn\xe2\x80\x99t I tell you it was fine?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow could still hear Twilight in her ear, snorting, choking on sorrow, ungainly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so s-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow was lost for words, not sure how to comfort Twilight.\n\nRainbow\n picked her legs up, from her sides, and moved her hooves to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s,\n still clinging to her. Rainbow prised them apart, exhaling slightly, \nand moved slightly forward, away from Twilight.\n\nShe felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s head leave its place on her own shoulder, and Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hooves leave her own, withdrawing.\n\nRainbow\n dipped her forelegs back into the water, and using them to steady \nherself; she twisted around, as fast as the ever-clinging water would \nlet her, to face Twilight.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cJust\xe2\x80\xa6 don\xe2\x80\x99t be so hard on yourself,\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n sliced through the water\xe2\x80\x99s resistance with her right foreleg, to \nconnect with Twilight; hoof to hoof. Rainbow saw their hooves meet, \ntentatively yet firm, within the swirling translucent red of the water.\n\nRainbow\n was studying Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s face, she had a delicate air about her, her \nlavender somewhat contrasted by the blood red Rainbow had left upon her.\n\nTwilight\n was looking down into the water, dejected. Rainbow picked her left hoof\n out of the water, dripping. She brought it up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin, and \nslowly, ever so slightly, brought Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s gaze up to her own.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe edges of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s frown faltered, twitching into the faintest of smiles. Delicate.\nSubtle.\n\nBut definitely there.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still quiet, still incurred upon with undertones of moroseness, but with a hint of affirmation.\n\nRainbow\n stroked her hoof up from Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin to her cheek, slightly \nruffling the thin, downy pelt that coated her. Rainbow looked into her \neyes; they were coy, yet forlorn. Rainbow could see that the thin purple\n irises were not as definite as they could be, blurred by tears and a \nred bloodshot presence. This didn\xe2\x80\x99t stop them from being pretty, yes, \nthe melancholy shimmered through, but that somewhat made her eyes seem \nall the more vivid, all the more real.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re\n a fantastic pony, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s confidence had left her, and in \nits place, there was careful heartfelt speech. \xe2\x80\x9cNo; you\xe2\x80\x99re a fantastic friend. \xe2\x80\x9c\n\nTwilight\n looked very pretty; there was no two ways about it. Rainbow studied her\n face a bit closer, leaning in. No, wait, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find Twilight that pretty; she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t into fillies. It was just something about her, something alluring.\n\n\xe2\x80\x98Well, whatever,\xe2\x80\x99 Thought Rainbow \xe2\x80\x98I suppose Twilight can be cool sometimes too.\xe2\x80\x99\n\nRainbow\n felt her hind legs bump against Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, leaning in closer. Rainbow \nweaved her legs over Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, the water now putting up little \nresistance,  pulling their bodies closer, chest to chest, haunches \nbrushing together, then resting upon one another, diffidently.\n\nAll\n the time, Rainbow was peering upon Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s face, examining every \nlast detail; how the edges of her mouth slowly petered out into a smile,\n how her endearingly innocent dolefully joyful eyes darted around, as if\n looking for an answer, where her pink streak of mane slowly faded out, \ninto deep purple.\n\nRainbow\n took her hooves back from Twilight, and placed them around her back, \npulling them the last couple of intimate inches together; closing the \nindefinite gap of vapour between them, becoming one, once more.\n\nRainbow\n felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s arms join around her own back, brushing just above her \nwings. With this touch, Rainbow realised that her wings were doing that \xe2\x80\x98thing\xe2\x80\x99 again. Though she didn\xe2\x80\x99t care, she was beyond that now, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t really matter what was cool or not. Not with Twilight, anyway.\n\nRainbow\n slowly moved her face towards Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, now seeing every detail upon \nher. She could see each hair, each impurity, every part of her intricate\n prettiness. Well, Twilight could never be just pretty, could she? She\xe2\x80\x99d even have to make that complex too, wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t she?\n\nHowever,\n instead of continuing to move face to face, Rainbow drifted her head \nover to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s side, making a move for her ear. Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s mouth was \nclosing in, almost touching; when she adopted the huskiest tender voice \nshe could;\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, you deserve so much more\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n slowly retracted her head back, brushing her lips across Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s \ncheek, for a bit longer than what could be described as a fleeting \naccident. Rainbow regained eye contact with Twilight, which was \naccompanied by another flush of warmth across her own face. This was \nfine though, she just knew Twilight would be feeling the same way.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAh\xe2\x80\xa6 Uhm\xe2\x80\xa6 Rainbow, I, I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what to say\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n was cut short, by Rainbow, leaning forwards the last couple of \nmillimetres and bridging the gap between them, in a clumsy, ineloquent \nkiss. She bashed her teeth into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind, \nsomething that trivial couldn\xe2\x80\x99t ruin the sweet couple of seconds they\xe2\x80\x99d spent connected.\n\nRainbow\n pulled away, just by a fraction, parting from Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s lips, but \nstill almost touching. As Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes opened, they gave way to a \nlook of confusion, which quickly subsided into longing.\n\nThe\n gaze was all the confirmation Rainbow needed; she was sure that words \nweren\xe2\x80\x99t necessary at this moment in time, which was what she\xe2\x80\x99d heard in \nstories, anyway. She closed her eyes once more, and moved in the short \ndistance between herself and Twilight.\n\nAgain,\n they made contact clumsily, Rainbow missing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth by a \nfraction. She righted her mistake, (albeit enjoyable), and brought their\n mouths together. At first, their kiss was only skin-deep, lips to lips,\n but Rainbow pushed forwards, opening up, deepening.\n\nRainbow thought, as she explored with Twilight, it was as if they were closer, not only in body, but in minds.\n\nRainbow\n slowly eased her tongue forwards, in a tentative sway, dancing across \nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s teeth, and then onwards, coercing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s tongue to join \nthe dance, to share the ecstasy.\n\nWithin\n their intimacy, it was really as they truly were together, not just in \nmere physicality, but within minds. Rainbow could feel a flood of \nemotions, emotions she\xe2\x80\x99d never felt before, emotions that belonged to Twilight.\n\nRainbow\n broke the ring she\xe2\x80\x99d formed around Twilight with her legs, in favour of\n expressing her self further. She brought her left hoof up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s\n mane, tracing its way up her back, as she went, stroking.\n\nThe rush of emotions was hard, for Rainbow. Although it was beautiful, it was just so\xe2\x80\xa6 Intense. She\xe2\x80\x99d only experienced emotions like that once before, during her times with that filly.\n\nWith that filly\xe2\x80\xa6\n\nA wave of guilt came over Rainbow, overcoming the new, intense emotions.\n\nRainbow\n pulled away from Twilight, prising her tongue from its lustful dance, \nbringing her hooves back in check, breaking Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s embrace, and \nfinally, prolonged by Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eager leaning forwards; Rainbow broke \nthe kiss.\n\nFor\n a moment, a thin, delicate string of saliva connected the two fillies, \nglistening, only to be shattered by Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s drive to look down, into \nthe void filled by reddened water, where they once connected so \ntenderly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m, so sorry,\n Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow spoke to the water, in a tiny voice. Her words were \nabsorbed, without a reply. In an even tinier, almost inaudible tone, she\n continued; \xe2\x80\x9cbut I have to go\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n got to all fours, and dripping blood-tinged water back into the bath, \nshe flapped her already-erect wings, and flew out the door; spraying red\n back into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s bemused, disconcerted eyes.\n\nShe\n found the library front door easily, and threw in open, but in her \nfrantic haste, Rainbow neglected the idea of closing it behind her.\n\nAs\n the cold night air whipped past her in the sky, chilling her sopping \nwet pelt; Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t care less, she just repeated the same \nhysterical thoughts around in her head:\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia; I\xe2\x80\x99ve betrayed them both, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been disloyal. And I\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be the element of Loyalty\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n*****\n\n\nThe\n bath water had long since become frigid, yet Twilight still remained in\n the reddened mixture, beginning to wrinkle, but still in the same \nposition that Rainbow had left her in. However, Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t care \nthat she was cold and wrinkling, or rather, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t notice.\nShe\n was too busy desperately trying to piece together what\xe2\x80\x99d just happened.\n There had to be a reason, she knew it; things didn\xe2\x80\x99t just happen.\n There was always cause and effect, as science would have her know. \nAlso, if she looked into her magic studies, she knew that Rainbow would \nnever leave like that, not if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have good reason to, she was the Element of Loyalty, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t she?\nEven so, Twilight would have liked to have had an explanation for the whole thing.\n She\xe2\x80\x99d been enjoying her time with Rainbow, even if it was unexpected, \nshe\xe2\x80\x99d thought they were just sharing a bath out of necessity, like \nTwilight used to when she was small. She\xe2\x80\x99d been taken aback, but it \nseemed like the right thing to do, after all, she was here to learn \nabout the magic of friendship.\nTwilight\n sighed to her self, and stood up on all fours, mirroring Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s \nimage, and levitated the same towel that she\xe2\x80\x99d used to clear the mirror \nto her. With a sinking feeling within her stomach, Twilight thought to \nherself;\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy does friendship have to be so\xe2\x80\xa6 Complicated?\xe2\x80\x9d\nTears came back to Twilight, involuntarily, delicately, leaving sorrow behind, slowly diluting the reddened water.\n\n\n*****\n\n\nRainbow\n was tired, even after just ten minutes of flying, but she attributed \nthis to the mach speed at which her brain was whirring at; not how the \nevening had taken its toll on her athletic body.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be loyal; I\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be loyal.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nAs she landed, Rainbow felt a small pang of bittersweet satisfaction; she\xe2\x80\x99d made it this far.\n\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were dimming, now, out of exhaustion, but she could still focus on what she\xe2\x80\x99d come for.\n\nShe hesitantly crept forwards, towards the window she\xe2\x80\x99d come for. It was open a crack, like a small glimmer of hope.\n\nRainbow\n brought her hoof up to the window, and pushed it open, the pane of \nglass sliding silently into the dark stillness of the room. She timidly \nhauled herself over the windowsill, landing in the room with a silent \nclop.\n\nThere were shadows, all of unnatural, unnerving shapes, carved by moonlight, not dissimilar to that of Twili- Of the library\xe2\x80\x99s shadows.\n Nevertheless, Rainbow did her best to ignore them, and honed in on a \nmore toned, natural looking shadow, laid on top of what seemed to be a \nbed.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI need to talk to you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\nRainbow\xe2\x80\x99s voice was ghostly, diminished in the dead of the bedroom.\n\nShe\n sighed, with a tint of frustration; she\xe2\x80\x99d have to be louder. Rainbow \nbrought her voice up to a loud, firm, important tone, and with a hint of\n apprehension, announced:\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI need to talk to you; Applejack.\xe2\x80\x9d', 4, 30, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'4\'></a><h3>Wanting</h3>\n<p>The warmth of the water engulfed Rainbow, she could feel its swirling </p><p>encapsulate her; capture her, even more so than the vapour did.</p><p>Now?</p><p> The once warm, oppressive vapour was now like fresh air, for Rainbow. </p><p>Now it was the water that was clingy, effortlessly smothering her body, </p><p>she was in its grip.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re looking awfully stiff!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was stating the obvious for her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy don\xe2\x80\x99t you lean back and relax?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Yeah, relax. It was </p><p>the reaction that used the least amount of concentration; she needed it,</p><p> after all. She needed it to keep on top of her mantra. She needed it to</p><p> keep her wings down.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAre you still going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party tomorrow?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> spoke nonchalantly, as if this was no different to a regular </p><p>conversation. As if there was nothing that hung in the air; only </p><p>vapours.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cY-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> began to answer, but Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s manoeuvres caught her off guard. </p><p>Twilight leant forwards, pushing into Rainbow, their bodies locking </p><p>together, in an unintentional embrace, becoming one.</p><p> Rainbow felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hoof; tracing along her shoulder, moving </p><p>towards her face, carefully brushing her mane away, to reveal her tender</p><p> wound.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cPardon, Rainbow?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Wow, Twilight really was clueless. It was clear from her voice; there were no quiet, husky whispers, just stark, everyday voices.</p><p>This made Rainbow feel a bit more at ease.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, Twilight, I should make it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> was glad she\xe2\x80\x99d managed to get the words out this time, she\xe2\x80\x99d show </p><p>Twilight just how confident Rainbow Dash; Equestria\xe2\x80\x99s best young flier </p><p>could be!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cGood, I shall look forward to seeing you there.\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still normal. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m going to clean your wound now, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> brought her leg up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s forehead, with flannel in hoof. She </p><p>brushed across the cut, slowly, tentatively. It hurt, but Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t</p><p> mind; she could feel the affection Twilight was putting into her care, </p><p>and it was like anaesthesia.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> closed her eyes, to divert her feelings; both the pain and the blush </p><p>threatening to coarse their way across her forehead. She thought about </p><p>Twilight and herself; how had they ended up in this situation?</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, your head is all cleaned up!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> opened her eyes, and looked down. The water was contaminated with red. </p><p>Red, watered down from her blood, but it didn\xe2\x80\x99t look sinister, it was </p><p>more reminiscent of love.</p><p>Hah;</p><p> Twilight, if only you knew, my head is far from clean, inside. It\xe2\x80\x99s as </p><p>convoluted as the pink, swirling around in the empty, clear water. But </p><p>you won\xe2\x80\x99t know; you\xe2\x80\x99ll never know.</p><p>I can\xe2\x80\x99t tell you, it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be cool.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThank you, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">At least she was still confident in her speech, if not in mind.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAnything to help out a friend!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s body relent for a second, a cool rush of air in place </p><p>of where their pelts pressed together. Rainbow sighed for a second, </p><p>relieved, but then she felt Twilight once more, her fore-legs snaking </p><p>under her own, almost caressing her body, closing around her front, </p><p>pulling their bodies together once more. Twilight softly laid her head </p><p>upon Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s shoulder, and brought her mouth up to Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s ear.</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s heart was pounding; this was what it was like, that time before, with that other filly, before she\xe2\x80\x99d confessed to her. That was like her, to do something as brash as that- but not like Twilight. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t like Twilight at all.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh,</p><p> Rainbow,\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was quiet, husky, whispery. It was just how </p><p>Rainbow had imagined, not only moments ago. It sunk into her, like her </p><p>stomach had been sinking; twisting and turning with each of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>seemingly blas\xc3\xa9 touches.&nbsp;&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow felt warmth on her shoulder, but not like the warmth of life, or</p><p> the warmth of something inanimate. It felt cold. The cold of sorrowful,</p><p> regretful tears. This wasn\xe2\x80\x99t what she\xe2\x80\x99d imagined at all. Intimacy like </p><p>this was supposed to be joyful, that\xe2\x80\x99s what she\xe2\x80\x99d learnt, anyway.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow could feel her compassionate sadness, against Twilight, as one, reverberating with each tear, each miniscule movement. Their bodies jolting, juddering, with each wave of emotion.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI just\xe2\x80\xa6 I j-j-just didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to hurt you s-s-s-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98I have to calm her down.\xe2\x80\x99 Rainbow thought, \xe2\x80\x98I can\xe2\x80\x99t bear to hear her like this, to feel her like this.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwi\xe2\x80\x99, It\xe2\x80\x99s fine.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow put her most affirmative voice on. \xe2\x80\x9cDidn\xe2\x80\x99t I tell you it was fine?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow could still hear Twilight in her ear, snorting, choking on sorrow, ungainly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so s-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, just\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow was lost for words, not sure how to comfort Twilight.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> picked her legs up, from her sides, and moved her hooves to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s,</p><p> still clinging to her. Rainbow prised them apart, exhaling slightly, </p><p>and moved slightly forward, away from Twilight.</p><p class="double">She felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s head leave its place on her own shoulder, and Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s hooves leave her own, withdrawing.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> dipped her forelegs back into the water, and using them to steady </p><p>herself; she twisted around, as fast as the ever-clinging water would </p><p>let her, to face Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cJust\xe2\x80\xa6 don\xe2\x80\x99t be so hard on yourself,\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> sliced through the water\xe2\x80\x99s resistance with her right foreleg, to </p><p>connect with Twilight; hoof to hoof. Rainbow saw their hooves meet, </p><p>tentatively yet firm, within the swirling translucent red of the water.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> was studying Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s face, she had a delicate air about her, her </p><p>lavender somewhat contrasted by the blood red Rainbow had left upon her.</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> was looking down into the water, dejected. Rainbow picked her left hoof</p><p> out of the water, dripping. She brought it up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin, and </p><p>slowly, ever so slightly, brought Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s gaze up to her own.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOkay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The edges of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s frown faltered, twitching into the faintest of smiles. Delicate.</p><p>Subtle.</p><p class="double">But definitely there.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice was still quiet, still incurred upon with undertones of moroseness, but with a hint of affirmation.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> stroked her hoof up from Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s chin to her cheek, slightly </p><p>ruffling the thin, downy pelt that coated her. Rainbow looked into her </p><p>eyes; they were coy, yet forlorn. Rainbow could see that the thin purple</p><p> irises were not as definite as they could be, blurred by tears and a </p><p>red bloodshot presence. This didn\xe2\x80\x99t stop them from being pretty, yes, </p><p>the melancholy shimmered through, but that somewhat made her eyes seem </p><p>all the more vivid, all the more real.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re</p><p> a fantastic pony, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s confidence had left her, and in </p><p>its place, there was careful heartfelt speech. \xe2\x80\x9cNo; you\xe2\x80\x99re a fantastic friend. \xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> looked very pretty; there was no two ways about it. Rainbow studied her</p><p> face a bit closer, leaning in. No, wait, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t find Twilight that pretty; she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t into fillies. It was just something about her, something alluring.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98Well, whatever,\xe2\x80\x99 Thought Rainbow \xe2\x80\x98I suppose Twilight can be cool sometimes too.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> felt her hind legs bump against Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, leaning in closer. Rainbow </p><p>weaved her legs over Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, the water now putting up little </p><p>resistance,&nbsp;&nbsp;pulling their bodies closer, chest to chest, haunches </p><p>brushing together, then resting upon one another, diffidently.</p><p class="double">All</p><p> the time, Rainbow was peering upon Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s face, examining every </p><p>last detail; how the edges of her mouth slowly petered out into a smile,</p><p> how her endearingly innocent dolefully joyful eyes darted around, as if</p><p> looking for an answer, where her pink streak of mane slowly faded out, </p><p>into deep purple.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> took her hooves back from Twilight, and placed them around her back, </p><p>pulling them the last couple of intimate inches together; closing the </p><p>indefinite gap of vapour between them, becoming one, once more.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> felt Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s arms join around her own back, brushing just above her </p><p>wings. With this touch, Rainbow realised that her wings were doing that \xe2\x80\x98thing\xe2\x80\x99 again. Though she didn\xe2\x80\x99t care, she was beyond that now, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t really matter what was cool or not. Not with Twilight, anyway.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> slowly moved her face towards Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, now seeing every detail upon </p><p>her. She could see each hair, each impurity, every part of her intricate</p><p> prettiness. Well, Twilight could never be just pretty, could she? She\xe2\x80\x99d even have to make that complex too, wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t she?</p><p class="double">However,</p><p> instead of continuing to move face to face, Rainbow drifted her head </p><p>over to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s side, making a move for her ear. Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s mouth was </p><p>closing in, almost touching; when she adopted the huskiest tender voice </p><p>she could;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, you deserve so much more\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> slowly retracted her head back, brushing her lips across Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>cheek, for a bit longer than what could be described as a fleeting </p><p>accident. Rainbow regained eye contact with Twilight, which was </p><p>accompanied by another flush of warmth across her own face. This was </p><p>fine though, she just knew Twilight would be feeling the same way.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh\xe2\x80\xa6 Uhm\xe2\x80\xa6 Rainbow, I, I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what to say\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> was cut short, by Rainbow, leaning forwards the last couple of </p><p>millimetres and bridging the gap between them, in a clumsy, ineloquent </p><p>kiss. She bashed her teeth into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s, but she didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind, </p><p>something that trivial couldn\xe2\x80\x99t ruin the sweet couple of seconds they\xe2\x80\x99d spent connected.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> pulled away, just by a fraction, parting from Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s lips, but </p><p>still almost touching. As Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes opened, they gave way to a </p><p>look of confusion, which quickly subsided into longing.</p><p class="double">The</p><p> gaze was all the confirmation Rainbow needed; she was sure that words </p><p>weren\xe2\x80\x99t necessary at this moment in time, which was what she\xe2\x80\x99d heard in </p><p>stories, anyway. She closed her eyes once more, and moved in the short </p><p>distance between herself and Twilight.</p><p class="double">Again,</p><p> they made contact clumsily, Rainbow missing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s mouth by a </p><p>fraction. She righted her mistake, (albeit enjoyable), and brought their</p><p> mouths together. At first, their kiss was only skin-deep, lips to lips,</p><p> but Rainbow pushed forwards, opening up, deepening.</p><p class="double">Rainbow thought, as she explored with Twilight, it was as if they were closer, not only in body, but in minds.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> slowly eased her tongue forwards, in a tentative sway, dancing across </p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s teeth, and then onwards, coercing Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s tongue to join </p><p>the dance, to share the ecstasy.</p><p class="double">Within</p><p> their intimacy, it was really as they truly were together, not just in </p><p>mere physicality, but within minds. Rainbow could feel a flood of </p><p>emotions, emotions she\xe2\x80\x99d never felt before, emotions that belonged to Twilight.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> broke the ring she\xe2\x80\x99d formed around Twilight with her legs, in favour of</p><p> expressing her self further. She brought her left hoof up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> mane, tracing its way up her back, as she went, stroking.</p><p class="double">The rush of emotions was hard, for Rainbow. Although it was beautiful, it was just so\xe2\x80\xa6 Intense. She\xe2\x80\x99d only experienced emotions like that once before, during her times with that filly.</p><p class="double">With that filly\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">A wave of guilt came over Rainbow, overcoming the new, intense emotions.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> pulled away from Twilight, prising her tongue from its lustful dance, </p><p>bringing her hooves back in check, breaking Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s embrace, and </p><p>finally, prolonged by Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eager leaning forwards; Rainbow broke </p><p>the kiss.</p><p class="double">For</p><p> a moment, a thin, delicate string of saliva connected the two fillies, </p><p>glistening, only to be shattered by Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s drive to look down, into </p><p>the void filled by reddened water, where they once connected so </p><p>tenderly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m, so sorry,</p><p> Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow spoke to the water, in a tiny voice. Her words were </p><p>absorbed, without a reply. In an even tinier, almost inaudible tone, she</p><p> continued; \xe2\x80\x9cbut I have to go\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> got to all fours, and dripping blood-tinged water back into the bath, </p><p>she flapped her already-erect wings, and flew out the door; spraying red</p><p> back into Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s bemused, disconcerted eyes.</p><p class="double">She</p><p> found the library front door easily, and threw in open, but in her </p><p>frantic haste, Rainbow neglected the idea of closing it behind her.</p><p class="double">As</p><p> the cold night air whipped past her in the sky, chilling her sopping </p><p>wet pelt; Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t care less, she just repeated the same </p><p>hysterical thoughts around in her head:</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia; I\xe2\x80\x99ve betrayed them both, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been disloyal. And I\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be the element of Loyalty\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>The</p><p> bath water had long since become frigid, yet Twilight still remained in</p><p> the reddened mixture, beginning to wrinkle, but still in the same </p><p>position that Rainbow had left her in. However, Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t care </p><p>that she was cold and wrinkling, or rather, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t notice.</p><p>She</p><p> was too busy desperately trying to piece together what\xe2\x80\x99d just happened.</p><p> There had to be a reason, she knew it; things didn\xe2\x80\x99t just happen.</p><p> There was always cause and effect, as science would have her know. </p><p>Also, if she looked into her magic studies, she knew that Rainbow would </p><p>never leave like that, not if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have good reason to, she was the Element of Loyalty, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t she?</p><p>Even so, Twilight would have liked to have had an explanation for the whole thing.</p><p> She\xe2\x80\x99d been enjoying her time with Rainbow, even if it was unexpected, </p><p>she\xe2\x80\x99d thought they were just sharing a bath out of necessity, like </p><p>Twilight used to when she was small. She\xe2\x80\x99d been taken aback, but it </p><p>seemed like the right thing to do, after all, she was here to learn </p><p>about the magic of friendship.</p><p>Twilight</p><p> sighed to her self, and stood up on all fours, mirroring Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>image, and levitated the same towel that she\xe2\x80\x99d used to clear the mirror </p><p>to her. With a sinking feeling within her stomach, Twilight thought to </p><p>herself;</p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cWhy does friendship have to be so\xe2\x80\xa6 Complicated?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Tears came back to Twilight, involuntarily, delicately, leaving sorrow behind, slowly diluting the reddened water.</p><p class="double"></p><p>*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>Rainbow</p><p> was tired, even after just ten minutes of flying, but she attributed </p><p>this to the mach speed at which her brain was whirring at; not how the </p><p>evening had taken its toll on her athletic body.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be loyal; I\xe2\x80\x99m supposed to be loyal.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">As she landed, Rainbow felt a small pang of bittersweet satisfaction; she\xe2\x80\x99d made it this far.</p><p class="double">Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s eyes were dimming, now, out of exhaustion, but she could still focus on what she\xe2\x80\x99d come for.</p><p class="double">She hesitantly crept forwards, towards the window she\xe2\x80\x99d come for. It was open a crack, like a small glimmer of hope.</p><p class="double">Rainbow</p><p> brought her hoof up to the window, and pushed it open, the pane of </p><p>glass sliding silently into the dark stillness of the room. She timidly </p><p>hauled herself over the windowsill, landing in the room with a silent </p><p>clop.</p><p class="double">There were shadows, all of unnatural, unnerving shapes, carved by moonlight, not dissimilar to that of Twili- Of the library\xe2\x80\x99s shadows.</p><p> Nevertheless, Rainbow did her best to ignore them, and honed in on a </p><p>more toned, natural looking shadow, laid on top of what seemed to be a </p><p>bed.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI need to talk to you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p>Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s voice was ghostly, diminished in the dead of the bedroom.</p><p class="double">She</p><p> sighed, with a tint of frustration; she\xe2\x80\x99d have to be louder. Rainbow </p><p>brought her voice up to a loud, firm, important tone, and with a hint of</p><p> apprehension, announced:</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI need to talk to you; Applejack.\xe2\x80\x9d</b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 15], 'parent_story_id': 15, 'txt': '//------------------------------//\n// Wanting// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\nThe warmth of the water engulfed Rainbow, she could feel its swirling \nencapsulate her; capture her, even more so than the vapour did.\nNow?\n The once warm, oppressive vapour was now like fresh air, for Rainbow. \nNow it was the water that was clingy, effortlessly smothering her body, \nshe was in its grip.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, you\xe2\x80\x99re looking awfully stiff!\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight was stating the obvious for her. \xe2\x80\x9cWhy don\xe2\x80\x99t you lean back and relax?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nYeah, relax. Right.\nIf only she could stop thinking about the current situation. Twilight and herself, in a bath, together.\nIt was all far too exciting.\nRainbow sighed, melancholically; she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t let Twilight know that she was even remotely\n into fillies. Plus, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t like Rainbow lusted after each and every \nfilly; it was just the select couple: Twilight, and that other filly, but somehow, that made it worse.\n\nStill, she had to make it look otherwise, after all, there were reasons Rainbow hadn\xe2\x80\x99t told anypony about these feelings.\nShe had to play it cool.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, if you lean up against me, I can clean up your-\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s voice panged with a twinge of guilt. \xe2\x80\x9cInjury.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThere goes that innocence again. Does Twilight not see the intimacy in that position?\n\n\xe2\x80\x98Play it cool, Dash. Play it cool.\xe2\x80\x99\n\nWith her newly devised internal mantra, Rainbow tentatively shifted backwards, the film of the water ever-clinging to her body.\n\nHer\n back made contact with Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s belly, its warmth sending shivers \ndown Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s spine. It was odd, warmth giving her the shivers, but she\n was more shocked at how Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s warmth differed from that of regular warmth.\nThe warmth of a living, loving pony.\nNot the warmth of a cold, inanimate object.\n\nRainbow\n laid back into Twilight, overcome with emotions, deciding that focusing\n on her mantra was more important than keeping bodily composure.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAh, good. Rainbow, you don\xe2\x80\x99t mind if I touch your forehead, do you?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nYes, right, that\xe2\x80\x99s why she was here, so Twilight could help her clean up.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cN-no, it should be fine, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x98Great, I\xe2\x80\x99ve stuttered,\xe2\x80\x99 Thought Rainbow, \xe2\x80\x98and on top of that, I accentuated her name a bit too much\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOkay, just tell me if it hurts, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nRainbow\n juddered her head, ever so slightly, to show the affirmative. It was \nthe reaction that used the least amount of concentration; she needed it,\n after all. She needed it to keep on top of her mantra. She needed it to\n keep her wings down.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAre you still going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party tomorrow?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n spoke nonchalantly, as if this was no different to a regular \nconversation. Not an \xe2\x80\x98It\xe2\x80\x99s 3AM, \nI\xe2\x80\x99m really drunk and decided to break into Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s bedroom\xe2\x80\x99 talk.\nI\xe2\x80\x99ll be out applebucking; I\xe2\x80\x99m on a tight schedule, but come and talk to me. I can always take time out to see you.\n\nYou really did say do some interesting things last night. \n\n-That \xe2\x80\x98Other\xe2\x80\x99 Filly\n\n(Thanks for the new nickname, by the way\xe2\x80\xa6) \n\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIf there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t such a cooling breeze, Rainbow would\xe2\x80\x99ve probably burned up and melted, right on the spot.\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6light?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nOn the uncouth awakening of having her own name shouted in her ear, it was\n obvious Twilight was going to be unhappy, but surprisingly, that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t\n what had garnered the most of her early-morning contempt. What had been\n bestowed with that award was, in fact, the overall wet, ice-cold \nfeeling that surrounded her body. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, why were you sleeping in the bathtub?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nWithout opening her eyes, Twilight responded, groggily.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be silly, Spike, I\xe2\x80\x99m just a bit cold, that\xe2\x80\x99s all. Now, if you just pass me my blanket, I\xe2\x80\x99m going to go back to sleep\xe2\x80\xa6 I don\xe2\x80\x99t feel too good.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cUhh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99? Don\xe2\x80\x99t go all \xe2\x80\x98Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99 on me; you\xe2\x80\x99re definitely in the bathtub.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight opened her eyes, and was met with a slightly pink-stained white, taking up her peripheries. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAh.\xe2\x80\x9d \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYou see, Twilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight was most definitely in the bathtub, she knew that much. However, \nfurther from that, she knew nothing. She remembered walking home, after a\n night out with Rainbow Dash, and then\xe2\x80\xa6\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh...\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, are you okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThe pony braced herself, and then put what seemed like far, far\n too much effort into lifting her body out of the chilled, pink-y \nconcoction. Although despising the effort put into the task of standing \nup, Twilight still took it upon herself to shake the blood infused water\n across the bathroom, and across her assistant, Spike.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cUgh, Twilight! You\xe2\x80\x99ve been soaking in that! I don\xe2\x80\x99t want it on me!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nNevertheless, Twilight, now dry, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really fussed about her assistant\xe2\x80\x99s wellbeing. She had other things on her mind, other fillies\xe2\x80\xa6\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Rainbow\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, you mean Spike, right?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight felt a light blush across herself; she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t said that out loud, had she?\n\n \xe2\x80\x9cYes, Spike.\xe2\x80\x9d\n Twilight tried to speak with an air of authority, but her voice was \nfailing, under assault from the memories from the previous night. Well, \nthe ones she could still remember.\n\nTwilight stepped out of the bathtub, onto the well-streaked tiles of the floor. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSpike, you know how you\xe2\x80\x99re my number one assistant?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike groaned; he knew what was coming next.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, yeah, I\xe2\x80\x99ll clean the bathroom for you.\xe2\x80\x9d \n\nTwilight could hear the dejectedness in Spike\xe2\x80\x99s voice, but she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too \nfussed, she knew he\xe2\x80\x99d bounce back. After all, he really was a fantastic \nassistant.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cThanks Spike!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight spun around on the spot, turning to face the doorway. As she lifted her\n hooves, she left pale red marks upon the tiles, adding colour to the \nonce labyrinthine lines traced, the night before. \n\nTwilight could think clearly, now. There was colour to her thoughts, and colour on her mind.\n\nAs she walked out into the library, everything looked a little brighter. \nThe shelves, once imposing, stifling the library with their books, no \nlonger seemed to oppress, to demand silence. Now, they stood for \npossibilities, for opportunities, each one different. However, none of \nthe hundreds of possibilities that surrounded Twilight could have been \nanywhere near negative. \nLife was just too fantastic.\n\nAs a breeze swept in, through an open window, Twilight thought to herself; about friends, about friendship, about Rainbow Dash. \n\nShe wondered, \xe2\x80\x98All this time, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been studying friendship, and nothing has ever felt quite this fantastic. Is this true friendship?\xe2\x80\x99 \n\nEven though Rainbow had left her during the night, Twilight was sure she\xe2\x80\x99d \nhad an important reason, after all, she was the most loyal pony in all \nof Equestria, and more importantly; she was her friend, and Twilight believed in her.\n\n \xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I just can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see you; we have so much to talk about\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\nThe view across the apple orchard was beautiful, from on top of Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s\n old hill. It was good for thinking, and for reminiscing, after all, it \nheld a lot of memories, for Applejack, at least.\n\nLost in the scent of freshly bucked trees, and their bruised bark, \nApplejack\xe2\x80\x99s mind began to drift, to the thoughts that lay within her. \nThey\xe2\x80\x99d happened so long ago, and yet, they seemed so vivid; almost \npelt-deep.\n\nEven though Granny Smith had told her otherwise, so many times, she\xe2\x80\x99d taken \nshelter under Bloomberg, during a sudden thunderstorm. It was odd; \ngetting caught in such rainstorms was commonplace, for somepony that \nworks on a farm, but for some reason, Applejack felt bothered by it.\n\nShe still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure why, despite the amount of times she\xe2\x80\x99d been through \nthe events in her head. In the end, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t really matter, these \nthings weren\xe2\x80\x99t really the reason Applejack constantly replayed these \nmemories.\n\nIt was: when a dripping wet rainbow fell from the skies, streaked with tears, shaking, sobbing.\n\n\n Applejack had said nothing to the poor filly; they just sat, in a \ntrembling, yet compassionate embrace, nuzzling, tears soaking into her \nback. It was Dash who\xe2\x80\x99d done the talking, but it was nothing like Dash\xe2\x80\x99s\n usual, cocky speech. It was so very real.\n\nReal problems, real thoughts, real feelings.\n\nApplejack had been fine, up until that point. She liked that Dash could trust \nher, depend on her, after all the years of their banter-esqe \nrelationship. She\xe2\x80\x99d finally opened up,\n and Applejack was glad for that. Of all ponies, Applejack knew better \nthan to handle things by herself, but there was no telling Dash that. It\n was a good thing she\xe2\x80\x99d come to that conclusion herself.\n\nStill, as strong as Applejack tried to be for Dash, the next thing she said had caught her off guard. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nEven looking back on it, Applejack felt embarrassed. However, that feeling was always overwhelmed by another, every time. \n \n\xe2\x80\x9cI think\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nOverwhelmed by confusion.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI think I l\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nConfusion, tinged with sadness.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cLove you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nApplejack felt the trio of emotions inundate her, as if she was reliving the memory, of that rainy eve, on Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy\xe2\x80\x99d yew have ta go and puzzle me so, Dash? You toying with me or something?\xe2\x80\x9d \n\nApplejack frowned through her sad, embarrassed confusion. One minute Dash was \nfighting with her, over even the most trivial things, the next? Dash \nwould be on top of her, crying into her arms once more, as if they never\n argued, as if all Applejack were was just a friendly face in the dark, somewhere to dump her emotions.\n\nApplejack sighed, and thought to herself. \xe2\x80\x98I guess that\xe2\x80\x99s what y\xe2\x80\x99all get for being the most dependable pony in Ponyville, huh?\xe2\x80\x99\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\nRainbow Dash didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel like flying. Her heart wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in it. \n\nIt was elsewhere, occupied, gone.\n Rainbow Dash slowly trotted up in-between the rows of carefully planted\n apple trees, towards where she thought it lay; in the hooves of that other filly, at the top of Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill.\n\nRainbow shook her head, a desperate attempt to try to understand what was \nhappening. Everything she had, everything she\xe2\x80\x99d made, albeit \naccidentally, was falling apart. \n\nIt\xe2\x80\x99d been fantastic, even if it had only been a choice few evenings, shrouded in rain, teary-eyed.\n\nIf only she had another reason to spend time like that with her. Nopony else could know, after all, Dash had to be cool.\n\nRainbow gulped, and continued her slow, pained walk, up to Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill, two thoughts reverberating around her mind.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhat have I done?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWhy do I have to be cool?\xe2\x80\x9d\n', 'chapter_number': 5, 'parent_chapter_id': 41, 'chapter_html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'5\'></a><h3>Mechanisms</h3>\n<p>Rainbow felt pain, coursing through her body. Only aching within her legs and </p><p>wings, it was mainly concentrated upon her head. It was as if somepony </p><p>had tried to dig into her brain. Even if it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t so; it still felt </p><p>that way.</p><p class="double">As much as Rainbow tried to shut it out, she could see the warm light </p><p>through her eyelids; there was no way she could pretend it was still </p><p>night. As much as she respected Princess Celestia, Rainbow wished she </p><p>hadn\xe2\x80\x99t brought the day about so soon.</p><p class="double">Rainbow hauled her eyelids open, tentatively, easing her eyes into the bright </p><p>morning light.&nbsp;&nbsp;She looked over at the open window, and watched the </p><p>piercing sunlight, reflecting off of flecks of dust, swirling around, </p><p>forming dappled, complex patterns, seemingly restless. </p><p class="double">The ground was hard against Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s hindquarters, as she sat up, trying </p><p>to shrug the aches off of her back. She stretched her back out, fore </p><p>hooves reaching up to the clouds. Or rather, the ceiling.</p><p class="double">Rainbow felt dizzy, for a moment, her vision slowly, but only partially leaving her for a second. Her home was made of clouds, not ceilings, windows and hard, wooden floors\xe2\x80\xa6 Where was she?</p><p class="double">She looked around slowly, being kind to her over-sensitive eyes. The </p><p>floorboards looked rough, untreated. Rainbow swept her hoof across them;</p><p> they felt rough, yet worn; devoid of splinters. </p><p class="double">The walls were also wooden, but seemed more reassuringly smooth, but </p><p>Rainbow supposed that it could have just been to do with the fact that </p><p>the walls were just further away than the floor, but she decided to stop thinking of further complexities; it was the morning, after all. </p><p class="double">Rainbow stretched her forelegs out once more, and decided to brave standing up.</p><p> She grudgingly lifted her body off of the ground, and whilst arching </p><p>her back, she spread her wings out, extending from tip to tip, cutting </p><p>through the dust-laden air. Slowly, wings folding away, she clopped </p><p>towards the window, the window with apple-print curtains. </p><p>Rainbow realised where she was, moments before the view of the Sweet Apple </p><p>Acres\xe2\x80\x99 apple orchard came into view.&nbsp;&nbsp;She\xe2\x80\x99d spent the night at Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow groaned, \xe2\x80\x9cWhat did you do last night, Dash?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow stood there, for a while, letting the tiniest of breezes wash over her,</p><p> airing her stale, matted mane. Rainbow was clearing her thoughts, or </p><p>attempting to, at least. She let a groan out into the quiet voice of the</p><p> wind.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98I think I just need to go\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99</p><p> Rainbow thought. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t an easy decision to make, after all, things </p><p>with Applejack were tenuous at best, and whatever had happened last </p><p>night, well, it probably didn\xe2\x80\x99t help their relations all that much at all. Although she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t admit it, Rainbow knew all too well what she was like after a few drinks\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">Things would probably be better after she\xe2\x80\x99d mulled them over a bit, and Rainbow really didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to drum up any awkward conversation between herself and Applejack; she had problem enough thinking about that sort of stuff, let alone talking. </p><p class="double">Rainbow pushed against the window\xe2\x80\x99s frame, exposing herself to the fullness of </p><p>the farm\xe2\x80\x99s calm breeze. It came with a slight fragrance of apple, </p><p>reminiscent of days long past, napping in trees, casual chats about </p><p>nothing with Applejack, thinking to the future. It\xe2\x80\x99d been a while since </p><p>one of those chats; they\xe2\x80\x99d stopped as soon as Rainbow had deemed them \xe2\x80\x98Too embarrassing\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d And yet, what\xe2\x80\x99d they replaced these times with? </p><p>Stunted, difficult words, exchanged in fleeted meetings. Just because of one night. </p><p class="double">Maybe that was one other thing Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t control: Friendship.</p><p class="double">Rainbow moved her fore hooves up onto the windowsill, ready to take off, out of</p><p> the window, but the papery feel beneath her right hoof made her think </p><p>otherwise. She looked down at the paper, and lifted her hoof up. Folded,</p><p> it was adorned with \xe2\x80\x98Dash\xe2\x80\x99, in scruffy, yet attemptedly careful </p><p>writing.</p><p class="double">Rainbow felt her stomach twist, she knew whose hoofwriting this was, and with </p><p>what premise it was probably written after, yet still, she unfolded the </p><p>letter as quickly as possible. After all, Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear to not </p><p>know.</p><p class="double"><i>Dash,</p><p class="double">I knew you\xe2\x80\x99d try to climb out the window, and pretend like nothing </p><p>happened, but I\xe2\x80\x99m hoping a loyal pony like yourself would realise that </p><p>their friend needs them, and change their mind?</p><p>We really need to talk, but y\xe2\x80\x99know, like a proper talk. Not an \xe2\x80\x98It\xe2\x80\x99s 3AM, </p><p>I\xe2\x80\x99m really drunk and decided to break into Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s bedroom\xe2\x80\x99 talk.</p><p>I\xe2\x80\x99ll be out applebucking; I\xe2\x80\x99m on a tight schedule, but come and talk to me. I can always take time out to see you.</p><p class="double">You really did say do some interesting things last night. </p><p class="double">-That \xe2\x80\x98Other\xe2\x80\x99 Filly</p><p class="double">(Thanks for the new nickname, by the way\xe2\x80\xa6) </i></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">If there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t such a cooling breeze, Rainbow would\xe2\x80\x99ve probably burned up and melted, right on the spot.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6light?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">On the uncouth awakening of having her own name shouted in her ear, it was</p><p> obvious Twilight was going to be unhappy, but surprisingly, that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t</p><p> what had garnered the most of her early-morning contempt. Is this true friendship?\xe2\x80\x99 </p><p class="double">Even though Rainbow had left her during the night, Twilight was sure she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>had an important reason, after all, she was the most loyal pony in all </p><p>of Equestria, and more importantly; she was her friend, and Twilight believed in her.</p><p class="double"> \xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I just can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see you; we have so much to talk about\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>The view across the apple orchard was beautiful, from on top of Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> old hill. It was Dash who\xe2\x80\x99d done the talking, but it was nothing like Dash\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> usual, cocky speech. It was so very real.</p><p class="double">Real problems, real thoughts, real feelings.</p><p class="double">Applejack had been fine, up until that point. She liked that Dash could trust </p><p>her, depend on her, after all the years of their banter-esqe </p><p>relationship. She\xe2\x80\x99d finally opened up,</p><p> and Applejack was glad for that. Of all ponies, Applejack knew better </p><p>than to handle things by herself, but there was no telling Dash that. It</p><p> was a good thing she\xe2\x80\x99d come to that conclusion herself.</p><p class="double">Still, as strong as Applejack tried to be for Dash, the next thing she said had caught her off guard. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Even looking back on it, Applejack felt embarrassed. However, that feeling was always overwhelmed by another, every time. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI think\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Overwhelmed by confusion.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI think I l\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Confusion, tinged with sadness.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLove you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Applejack felt the trio of emotions inundate her, as if she was reliving the memory, of that rainy eve, on Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy\xe2\x80\x99d yew have ta go and puzzle me so, Dash? You toying with me or something?\xe2\x80\x9d </p><p class="double">Applejack frowned through her sad, embarrassed confusion. One minute Dash was </p><p>fighting with her, over even the most trivial things, the next? Dash </p><p>would be on top of her, crying into her arms once more, as if they never</p><p> argued, as if all Applejack were was just a friendly face in the dark, somewhere to dump her emotions.</p><p class="double">Applejack sighed, and thought to herself. \xe2\x80\x98I guess that\xe2\x80\x99s what y\xe2\x80\x99all get for being the most dependable pony in Ponyville, huh?\xe2\x80\x99</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>Rainbow Dash didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel like flying. Her heart wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in it. </p><p class="double">It was elsewhere, occupied, gone.</p><p> Rainbow Dash slowly trotted up in-between the rows of carefully planted</p><p> apple trees, towards where she thought it lay; in the hooves of that other filly, at the top of Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill.</p><p class="double">Rainbow shook her head, a desperate attempt to try to understand what was </p><p>happening. Everything she had, everything she\xe2\x80\x99d made, albeit </p><p>accidentally, was falling apart. </p><p class="double">It\xe2\x80\x99d been fantastic, even if it had only been a choice few evenings, shrouded in rain, teary-eyed.</p><p class="double">If only she had another reason to spend time like that with her. Nopony else could know, after all, Dash had to be cool.</p><p class="double">Rainbow gulped, and continued her slow, pained walk, up to Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill, two thoughts reverberating around her mind.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat have I done?\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy do I have to be cool?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'version': 1, 'parent_story_id': 15}, 'chapter_id': 41, 'cursor': <mysql.connector.cursor.MySQLCursor object at 0x02E5FB30>, 'connection': <mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection object at 0x02E01A70>, 'html': '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'5\'></a><h3>Mechanisms</h3>\n<p>Rainbow felt pain, coursing through her body. Only aching within her legs and </p><p>wings, it was mainly concentrated upon her head. It was as if somepony </p><p>had tried to dig into her brain. Even if it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t so; it still felt </p><p>that way.</p><p class="double">As much as Rainbow tried to shut it out, she could see the warm light </p><p>through her eyelids; there was no way she could pretend it was still </p><p>night. As much as she respected Princess Celestia, Rainbow wished she </p><p>hadn\xe2\x80\x99t brought the day about so soon.</p><p class="double">Rainbow hauled her eyelids open, tentatively, easing her eyes into the bright </p><p>morning light.&nbsp;&nbsp;She looked over at the open window, and watched the </p><p>piercing sunlight, reflecting off of flecks of dust, swirling around, </p><p>forming dappled, complex patterns, seemingly restless. </p><p class="double">The ground was hard against Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s hindquarters, as she sat up, trying </p><p>to shrug the aches off of her back. She stretched her back out, fore </p><p>hooves reaching up to the clouds. Or rather, the ceiling.</p><p class="double">Rainbow felt dizzy, for a moment, her vision slowly, but only partially leaving her for a second. Her home was made of clouds, not ceilings, windows and hard, wooden floors\xe2\x80\xa6 Where was she?</p><p class="double">She looked around slowly, being kind to her over-sensitive eyes. The </p><p>floorboards looked rough, untreated. Rainbow swept her hoof across them;</p><p> they felt rough, yet worn; devoid of splinters. </p><p class="double">The walls were also wooden, but seemed more reassuringly smooth, but </p><p>Rainbow supposed that it could have just been to do with the fact that </p><p>the walls were just further away than the floor, but she decided to stop thinking of further complexities; it was the morning, after all. </p><p class="double">Rainbow stretched her forelegs out once more, and decided to brave standing up.</p><p> She grudgingly lifted her body off of the ground, and whilst arching </p><p>her back, she spread her wings out, extending from tip to tip, cutting </p><p>through the dust-laden air. Slowly, wings folding away, she clopped </p><p>towards the window, the window with apple-print curtains. </p><p>Rainbow realised where she was, moments before the view of the Sweet Apple </p><p>Acres\xe2\x80\x99 apple orchard came into view.&nbsp;&nbsp;She\xe2\x80\x99d spent the night at Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Rainbow groaned, \xe2\x80\x9cWhat did you do last night, Dash?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Rainbow stood there, for a while, letting the tiniest of breezes wash over her,</p><p> airing her stale, matted mane. Rainbow was clearing her thoughts, or </p><p>attempting to, at least. She let a groan out into the quiet voice of the</p><p> wind.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x98I think I just need to go\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x99</p><p> Rainbow thought. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t an easy decision to make, after all, things </p><p>with Applejack were tenuous at best, and whatever had happened last </p><p>night, well, it probably didn\xe2\x80\x99t help their relations all that much at all. Although she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t admit it, Rainbow knew all too well what she was like after a few drinks\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">Things would probably be better after she\xe2\x80\x99d mulled them over a bit, and Rainbow really didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to drum up any awkward conversation between herself and Applejack; she had problem enough thinking about that sort of stuff, let alone talking. </p><p class="double">Rainbow pushed against the window\xe2\x80\x99s frame, exposing herself to the fullness of </p><p>the farm\xe2\x80\x99s calm breeze. It came with a slight fragrance of apple, </p><p>reminiscent of days long past, napping in trees, casual chats about </p><p>nothing with Applejack, thinking to the future. It\xe2\x80\x99d been a while since </p><p>one of those chats; they\xe2\x80\x99d stopped as soon as Rainbow had deemed them \xe2\x80\x98Too embarrassing\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d And yet, what\xe2\x80\x99d they replaced these times with? </p><p>Stunted, difficult words, exchanged in fleeted meetings. Just because of one night. </p><p class="double">Maybe that was one other thing Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t control: Friendship.</p><p class="double">Rainbow moved her fore hooves up onto the windowsill, ready to take off, out of</p><p> the window, but the papery feel beneath her right hoof made her think </p><p>otherwise. She looked down at the paper, and lifted her hoof up. Folded,</p><p> it was adorned with \xe2\x80\x98Dash\xe2\x80\x99, in scruffy, yet attemptedly careful </p><p>writing.</p><p class="double">Rainbow felt her stomach twist, she knew whose hoofwriting this was, and with </p><p>what premise it was probably written after, yet still, she unfolded the </p><p>letter as quickly as possible. After all, Rainbow couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear to not </p><p>know.</p><p class="double"><i>Dash,</p><p class="double">I knew you\xe2\x80\x99d try to climb out the window, and pretend like nothing </p><p>happened, but I\xe2\x80\x99m hoping a loyal pony like yourself would realise that </p><p>their friend needs them, and change their mind?</p><p>We really need to talk, but y\xe2\x80\x99know, like a proper talk. Not an \xe2\x80\x98It\xe2\x80\x99s 3AM, </p><p>I\xe2\x80\x99m really drunk and decided to break into Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s bedroom\xe2\x80\x99 talk.</p><p>I\xe2\x80\x99ll be out applebucking; I\xe2\x80\x99m on a tight schedule, but come and talk to me. I can always take time out to see you.</p><p class="double">You really did say do some interesting things last night. </p><p class="double">-That \xe2\x80\x98Other\xe2\x80\x99 Filly</p><p class="double">(Thanks for the new nickname, by the way\xe2\x80\xa6) </i></p><p class="double"></p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">If there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t such a cooling breeze, Rainbow would\xe2\x80\x99ve probably burned up and melted, right on the spot.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xa6light?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">On the uncouth awakening of having her own name shouted in her ear, it was</p><p> obvious Twilight was going to be unhappy, but surprisingly, that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t</p><p> what had garnered the most of her early-morning contempt. What had been</p><p> bestowed with that award was, in fact, the overall wet, ice-cold </p><p>feeling that surrounded her body. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, why were you sleeping in the bathtub?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Without opening her eyes, Twilight responded, groggily.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t be silly, Spike, I\xe2\x80\x99m just a bit cold, that\xe2\x80\x99s all. Now, if you just pass me my blanket, I\xe2\x80\x99m going to go back to sleep\xe2\x80\xa6 I don\xe2\x80\x99t feel too good.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUhh, Twi\xe2\x80\x99? Don\xe2\x80\x99t go all \xe2\x80\x98Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99 on me; you\xe2\x80\x99re definitely in the bathtub.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight opened her eyes, and was met with a slightly pink-stained white, taking up her peripheries. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh.\xe2\x80\x9d </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYou see, Twilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight was most definitely in the bathtub, she knew that much. However, </p><p>further from that, she knew nothing. She remembered walking home, after a</p><p> night out with Rainbow Dash, and then\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh...\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, are you okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">The pony braced herself, and then put what seemed like far, far</p><p> too much effort into lifting her body out of the chilled, pink-y </p><p>concoction. Although despising the effort put into the task of standing </p><p>up, Twilight still took it upon herself to shake the blood infused water</p><p> across the bathroom, and across her assistant, Spike.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cUgh, Twilight! You\xe2\x80\x99ve been soaking in that! I don\xe2\x80\x99t want it on me!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Nevertheless, Twilight, now dry, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really fussed about her assistant\xe2\x80\x99s wellbeing. She had other things on her mind, other fillies\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Rainbow\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, you mean Spike, right?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight felt a light blush across herself; she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t said that out loud, had she?</p><p class="double"> \xe2\x80\x9cYes, Spike.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p> Twilight tried to speak with an air of authority, but her voice was </p><p>failing, under assault from the memories from the previous night. Well, </p><p>the ones she could still remember.</p><p class="double">Twilight stepped out of the bathtub, onto the well-streaked tiles of the floor. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSpike, you know how you\xe2\x80\x99re my number one assistant?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike groaned; he knew what was coming next.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYeah, yeah, I\xe2\x80\x99ll clean the bathroom for you.\xe2\x80\x9d </p><p class="double">Twilight could hear the dejectedness in Spike\xe2\x80\x99s voice, but she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too </p><p>fussed, she knew he\xe2\x80\x99d bounce back. After all, he really was a fantastic </p><p>assistant.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cThanks Spike!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight spun around on the spot, turning to face the doorway. As she lifted her</p><p> hooves, she left pale red marks upon the tiles, adding colour to the </p><p>once labyrinthine lines traced, the night before. </p><p class="double">Twilight could think clearly, now. There was colour to her thoughts, and colour on her mind.</p><p class="double">As she walked out into the library, everything looked a little brighter. </p><p>The shelves, once imposing, stifling the library with their books, no </p><p>longer seemed to oppress, to demand silence. Now, they stood for </p><p>possibilities, for opportunities, each one different. However, none of </p><p>the hundreds of possibilities that surrounded Twilight could have been </p><p>anywhere near negative. </p><p>Life was just too fantastic.</p><p class="double">As a breeze swept in, through an open window, Twilight thought to herself; about friends, about friendship, about Rainbow Dash. </p><p class="double">She wondered, \xe2\x80\x98All this time, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been studying friendship, and nothing has ever felt quite this fantastic. Is this true friendship?\xe2\x80\x99 </p><p class="double">Even though Rainbow had left her during the night, Twilight was sure she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>had an important reason, after all, she was the most loyal pony in all </p><p>of Equestria, and more importantly; she was her friend, and Twilight believed in her.</p><p class="double"> \xe2\x80\x9cRainbow, I just can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see you; we have so much to talk about\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>The view across the apple orchard was beautiful, from on top of Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> old hill. It was good for thinking, and for reminiscing, after all, it </p><p>held a lot of memories, for Applejack, at least.</p><p class="double">Lost in the scent of freshly bucked trees, and their bruised bark, </p><p>Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s mind began to drift, to the thoughts that lay within her. </p><p>They\xe2\x80\x99d happened so long ago, and yet, they seemed so vivid; almost </p><p>pelt-deep.</p><p class="double">Even though Granny Smith had told her otherwise, so many times, she\xe2\x80\x99d taken </p><p>shelter under Bloomberg, during a sudden thunderstorm. It was odd; </p><p>getting caught in such rainstorms was commonplace, for somepony that </p><p>works on a farm, but for some reason, Applejack felt bothered by it.</p><p class="double">She still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure why, despite the amount of times she\xe2\x80\x99d been through </p><p>the events in her head. In the end, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t really matter, these </p><p>things weren\xe2\x80\x99t really the reason Applejack constantly replayed these </p><p>memories.</p><p class="double">It was: when a dripping wet rainbow fell from the skies, streaked with tears, shaking, sobbing.</p><p class="double"></p><p> Applejack had said nothing to the poor filly; they just sat, in a </p><p>trembling, yet compassionate embrace, nuzzling, tears soaking into her </p><p>back. It was Dash who\xe2\x80\x99d done the talking, but it was nothing like Dash\xe2\x80\x99s</p><p> usual, cocky speech. It was so very real.</p><p class="double">Real problems, real thoughts, real feelings.</p><p class="double">Applejack had been fine, up until that point. She liked that Dash could trust </p><p>her, depend on her, after all the years of their banter-esqe </p><p>relationship. She\xe2\x80\x99d finally opened up,</p><p> and Applejack was glad for that. Of all ponies, Applejack knew better </p><p>than to handle things by herself, but there was no telling Dash that. It</p><p> was a good thing she\xe2\x80\x99d come to that conclusion herself.</p><p class="double">Still, as strong as Applejack tried to be for Dash, the next thing she said had caught her off guard. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Even looking back on it, Applejack felt embarrassed. However, that feeling was always overwhelmed by another, every time. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI think\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Overwhelmed by confusion.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI think I l\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Confusion, tinged with sadness.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cLove you\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Applejack felt the trio of emotions inundate her, as if she was reliving the memory, of that rainy eve, on Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhy\xe2\x80\x99d yew have ta go and puzzle me so, Dash? You toying with me or something?\xe2\x80\x9d </p><p class="double">Applejack frowned through her sad, embarrassed confusion. One minute Dash was </p><p>fighting with her, over even the most trivial things, the next? Dash </p><p>would be on top of her, crying into her arms once more, as if they never</p><p> argued, as if all Applejack were was just a friendly face in the dark, somewhere to dump her emotions.</p><p class="double">Applejack sighed, and thought to herself. \xe2\x80\x98I guess that\xe2\x80\x99s what y\xe2\x80\x99all get for being the most dependable pony in Ponyville, huh?\xe2\x80\x99</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>Rainbow Dash didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel like flying.
