This was because, due to her eagerness to leave, and</p><p> her exceptional organisational skills, she was once again, ready far </p><p>too early.</p><p>She looked up, back towards the literary forest behind her, and called out to her assistant; Spike.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSpike!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight heard the soft padding of Spike\xe2\x80\x99s steps, ricocheting delicately off of </p><p>the bounds of information, upon the shelves of the library. Twilight </p><p>liked how the library\xe2\x80\x99s cavernous nature accentuated such sounds. It was</p><p> as if the books were helping her further than anypony thought they </p><p>actually could, relaying real world sounds to her. </p><p>Nevertheless, even though the sounds of his steps were all too obvious to Twilight, </p><p>Spike refrained from vocalising his movement.</p><p>However, Twilight was kind of expecting this. She suspected that Spike was still</p><p> rather annoyed from having to clean up behind her, and thus, would </p><p>probably try to make a point, and not speak to her for as long as he </p><p>could.</p><p>But, Twilight knew he wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t hold out too long\xe2\x80\xa6 After all, he had to speak to her, Spike was her assistant!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, Twilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight could see that Spike was trying to sound as dejected as he could, but </p><p>looking at the floor whilst doing so. She was sure that if she could </p><p>make eye contact with her assistant, he\xe2\x80\x99d probably snap out of his act.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWould you like to come to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party with me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike\xe2\x80\x99s eyes shot up, brightly, away from the forced melancholic stare at the </p><p>ground, apparently forgetting all disdain for having to clean up behind </p><p>Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh boy, I\xe2\x80\x99d love to, Twi\xe2\x80\x99!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight grinned, and instead of replying, she just waited for Spike\xe2\x80\x99s next inevitable question.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWill Rarity be there?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Even though she knew she\xe2\x80\x99d have this question asked of her, Twilight was </p><p>hoping Spike wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t ask it, as then, she\xe2\x80\x99d have to be the bringer of </p><p>bad news, and twice in one day, at that! First the horrors of cleaning, </p><p>and now this!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, Spike, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t I already tell you?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike looked blankly at Twilight, Obviously she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t done so. Or perhaps he forgot?</p><p>No, Twilight thought to herself; Spike wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t forget anything about Rarity.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSpike, Rarity won\xe2\x80\x99t be there\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike exhaled loudly, disappointedly, and brought his gaze back down to the floor.</p><p>However, Twilight, used to his behaviour, carried on.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s away with Fluttershy, on a spa weekend break, I recall her mentioning it last week.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight took a couple of hoofsteps towards Spike, and gave him a quick tap on </p><p>the shoulder, and attempted to act more like the mother figure, instead </p><p>of her normal role.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, Spike\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike looked back up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, with a sad smile.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s okay, Twilight, I\xe2\x80\x99ll just stay here, I\xe2\x80\x99ve still got some cleaning to do.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight let out a quiet chuckle to herself. Even if Spike didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to, he always put a grin on her face.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, but Spike, Rainbow Dash\xe2\x80\x99ll be there too!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight immersed herself in thoughts of Rainbow, reminiscing just from the </p><p>combination of her name rolling off of her own tongue, mingling with her</p><p> left over scent, still lingering from the night before.</p><p>Twilight just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see Rainbow, even if Pinkie Pie and Applejack were to be at the party too, Twilight was sure she could have Rainbow to herself, for the most part, anyway. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, why do you keep mentioning Rainbow Dash? Other ponies will be there too, you know?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight felt a tad embarrassed, again, but managed to hold out on any blush, </p><p>this time. How had she managed to let Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s name slip out twice!? </p><p>Not that Twilight thought that she ought to hide what she thought the two </p><p>fillies had together. No, she wanted to run around Ponyville, declaring </p><p>her love for Rainbow. Twilight wanted everypony to know.</p><p class="double">However, Twilight knew two things, both drawn from her time reading romance </p><p>novels. The first was that, in these novels, it was apparent that most </p><p>of the couples would wait to announce their relationship together, and </p><p>Twilight wanted to be gracious, and give Rainbow that opportunity.</p><p>The second was that, had Twilight done so, the whole thing would\xe2\x80\x99ve been horribly clich\xc3\xa9.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Spike, look at the time! I\xe2\x80\x99d best be off!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight knew she still had a few more minutes until she was actually scheduled&nbsp;&nbsp;to leave, but she\xe2\x80\x99d decided that it\xe2\x80\x99d probably be the best to leave early, after all, it meant she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have to figure out how to vocalise all these thoughts in her head, and then find a way to convey it so Spike would understand it.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>Due to instinct, Rainbow Dash had headed straight home. </p><p>Yet,</p><p> as she lay, sprawled upon her cloud sofa, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but feel </p><p>that her relaxation was merely synthesised. Although, at heart, Rainbow </p><p>wanted nothing other than to be able to exist, to have it easy, she knew</p><p> that she was far from able to do such a thing. </p><p>The fillies that were running around within her brain were making sure of that.</p><p class="double">Of course, Rainbow knew that there weren\xe2\x80\x99t actually tiny</p><p> little ponies running around her head, but it sure felt like it to her.</p><p> Not only due to the bizarre concoction of affection and animosity the </p><p>two conflicting fillies managed to somehow create within Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>brain, but because it felt like they were trying to dig their way out of her skull.</p><p>Still, Rainbow was aware that that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t actually the case, although the </p><p>wound upon her forehead had been conceived with one of the two ponies, </p><p>Rainbow was adamant that such a scenario would never occur.</p><p>That\xe2\x80\x99d be crazy on a level higher than Pinkie Pie.</p><p class="double">Thinking of Pinkie Pie, Rainbow had already made the decision that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>going to attend her party. Not because of Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s craziness, no, that </p><p>was somewhat of a draw for Rainbow; it was fun, for a while, anyway.</p><p>No, the reasons behind her want for being alone were, yet again, Twilight Sparkle and Applejack.</p><p class="double">Asmuch as Rainbow would\xe2\x80\x99ve liked to meet up with Applejack, and make </p><p>amends, or to as much as an extent as she could, Rainbow knew that </p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s presence would hinder that; and possibly even damage </p><p>Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s and her own relation ship beyond repair. </p><p>But even if Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t go, would Twilight and Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s encounter without her harbour even more problems?</p><p>Without her there, Twilight might stumble into problems with Applejack.</p><p class="double">Yes, Twilight was a clever pony, but even she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t learned of the relationship between Applejack and Rainbow Dash, and, with this in mind, she could potentially ruin everything. </p><p>Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t an idiot, and she knew Twilight. She knew that Twilight would be</p><p> itching to tell everypony about their newly formed bonds. Not because Twilight liked to brag, or because she wanted to gossip, but merely because Twilight would be happy. </p><p class="double">Twilight wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t want to hide her happiness. Instead, she\xe2\x80\x99d want to spread the </p><p>reason for her happiness, so everypony could feel it, too, and without </p><p>knowledge of Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s relationship with Rainbow Dash, there\xe2\x80\x99d be no </p><p>reason for her to hide it.</p><p class="double">Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t know how much Applejack knew of her night with Twilight, </p><p>nevertheless, Rainbow knew that after their imminent meeting, she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>probably know everything.</p><p>Well, perhaps not everything. Rainbow hoped that Twilight would at least be a bit prudish with some of the details. Even though Twilight was smart, her naiveties within love could lead to revelations of more intimate scenes. However, Rainbow Dash supposed that not even Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s naivety stretched to describing such\xe2\x80\xa6 Scenes.</p><p class="double">Anyway, even though the whole situation seemed incredibly daunting for Rainbow, without any certainties to rely on, she knew one thing.</p><p class="double">She still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">Applejack could still feel the cool breeze, carried down from Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill, </p><p>yet it didn\xe2\x80\x99t ruffle her mane as much as it could\xe2\x80\x99ve done, as she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>pulled her Stetson down tightly, in an attempt to cover her face. Or </p><p>rather, her eyes.</p><p class="double"> Applejack knew it was silly, if she was upset, that was all there was </p><p>to it, why bother hiding it? Yet, it had seemed the right thing to do, </p><p>to cover up her red, puffy eyes. She looked down at the floor, moving </p><p>below her, as she absent mindedly, slowly clopped her way over to </p><p>Sugarcube Corner.</p><p>She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t really wanted to go, in fact, if she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t stopped crying, Applejack probably</p><p> wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have left Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill at all. However, Applejack knew </p><p>that she had to go; after all, there was at least a small chance that Dash would be there, and Applejack desperately needed to see her.</p><p class="double">When Dash had left her upon the hill, Applejack hadn\xe2\x80\x99t returned to help her </p><p>brother, like she\xe2\x80\x99d said she would. Instead, she\xe2\x80\x99d just remained, </p><p>pondering. Wondering why Dash had continued to be like she was, always </p><p>trying to look cool, all the time.</p><p>Yet, to Applejack, it was apparent that this \xe2\x80\x98keeping up\xe2\x80\x99 of appearances seemed to only apply to the relationship surrounding Dash and herself. </p><p class="double">Not that Applejack would\xe2\x80\x99ve realised this, had Dash not told her herself. </p><p class="double">Applejack played back the groggy scenes from the night before, in her head: Dash </p><p>was nuzzling her, burying her tearful eyes into the orange of her own </p><p>neck, warming. Yet again, like their times before, Applejack had just </p><p>listened, absorbing Dash\xe2\x80\x99s melancholy, desperate to make the pony she </p><p>loved feel \xe2\x80\x98right\xe2\x80\x99 again. </p><p>However, try as she might, Applejack couldn\xe2\x80\x99t forgive Dash for her actions, not </p><p>yet, anyway. Despite Dash\xe2\x80\x99s forlorn upset, and despite Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>dependability, her forgiveness, it would take a while for Dash to get the catharsis she so desperately desired.</p><p class="double">Even though Dash was full of apologies, none of them were quite spectacular </p><p>enough to compensate for what she\xe2\x80\x99d broken in to confess to Applejack.</p><p class="double">Although the fact that Dash was willing to make an effort to confess showed that</p><p> she still had feelings for Applejack, and she knew where she\xe2\x80\x99d gone </p><p>wrong, it still didn\xe2\x80\x99t fix what she\xe2\x80\x99d done wrong, but only showed that </p><p>she wanted to try.</p><p>The last variable was what pained Applejack. The variable that Dash may not</p><p> have even meant to come and confess to her at all; it may well have </p><p>been just the alcohol in her bloodstream that had taken over.</p><p class="double">Applejack stole a glance upwards, and realised that she was nearing her </p><p>destination, Sugarcube Corner, as was another pony, from the opposite </p><p>direction. A purple filly.</p><p class="double">As Applejack gazed forwards at Twilight Sparkle, trotting gently towards </p><p>her, she remembered, once more, the words that Rainbow Dash had passed </p><p>on to her the night before, the words that had clouded Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>thoughts ever since she\xe2\x80\x99d heard them; repeating, constantly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack, I\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry. I really am, but\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut I think I\xe2\x80\x99m in love\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWith Twilight\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p></p><br /><p><p class="double"></p><p>Twilight Sparkle couldn\xe2\x80\x99t contain her joy; it was only moments from her arrival at the party, she\xe2\x80\x99d be able to see Rainbow again!</p><p class="double">Escaping from her runaway scenarios in her head, Twilight began to focus back </p><p>onto the real world, after all, she was nearly at Sugarcube Corner, and </p><p>needed to pay attention to walking, if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to trot into </p><p>anything.</p><p class="double">As Twilight looked towards the entrance of the store, she could not only </p><p>see the ornate cakey exterior of Sugarcube Corner, but the contrasting </p><p>orange of Applejack, waiting by the door, looking to the ground.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight called out loudly, yet she got no response. Applejack just kept gazing </p><p>into the ground, seemingly unaware of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s presence. Perhaps </p><p>Applejack just didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear her, Twilight thought. It was rather blustery, and that could\xe2\x80\x99ve just overwhelmed her voice, despite how loud she called out.</p><p class="double">Reaching the entrance of Sugarcube Corner, Twilight sidled up to Applejack, with a smile.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">At first, Twilight thought Applejack was just ignoring her, yet, as a </p><p>couple of seconds went by, it was clear that she was just being a bit </p><p>slow, pre-occupied.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh. Hi, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d </p><p class="double">Applejack sounded rather dejected, to Twilight. Initially, Twilight would\xe2\x80\x99ve just</p><p> put the tone of voice down to an accidental slip in Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>southern drawl, yet after reading her gait, Twilight couldn\xe2\x80\x99t have </p><p>mistaken Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s apparent emotions.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack, are you okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight nuzzled up to Applejack, she was clearly in a state of upset, and </p><p>Twilight wanted to fix that; Applejack was her friend, and she hated to </p><p>see any of her friends in such a state.</p><p>However, something then happened that Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t expecting; whilst she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>thought that nuzzling Applejack would help her to feel at least a bit </p><p>better, instead of returning the embrace, Applejack shrugged her off, </p><p>and pulled away.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh\xe2\x80\x99m fine, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">There was that tone again, Applejack certainly was not okay. Her voice was layered with trembles, immersed in despondency.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> stepped towards Applejack once again, attempting to embrace her, yet, </p><p>before she could even make contact, Applejack pulled away, mimicking her</p><p> own earlier actions. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cJust leave it, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s voice was hurt, but irritable. However, this time, tone wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all </p><p>Twilight had to go on, as Applejack looked up to her, making eye </p><p>contact, with a pleading gaze, through clouded irises.</p><p>Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t like it, but if Applejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to talk about it, there </p><p>was little she could do, Applejack was her friend, and she wanted to </p><p>respect her wishes.</p><p>She could have responded, but Twilight thought it was best to leave it at </p><p>that, with an affirmative silence in place of an answer.</p><p class="double">Trying to move on from her friend\xe2\x80\x99s melancholy, Twilight decided to move </p><p>towards the front door of Sugarcube Corner, ready to brave what was </p><p>undoubtedly going to be a rather over the top welcome from Pinkie Pie. </p><p>As Twilight reached forwards to push open the door, she noticed that the sign on the door read \xe2\x80\x98closed.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p>This seemed slightly odd, but Twilight assumed that the sign didn\xe2\x80\x99t really </p><p>apply to them, and was probably there due to the party they were </p><p>attending.</p><p class="double">When the door swung open, despite what it\xe2\x80\x99s label tried to profess, Twilight</p><p> was met with an all to familiar sight; streamers, balloons, confetti, </p><p>banners and all. It was a trademark Pinkie Pie party. However, something</p><p> didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem quite right.</p><p class="double">Twilight stood in the doorway for a moment, with Applejack reluctantly in tow, </p><p>until she could put her hoof on what was feeling amiss.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia! Mrs Cake! Are you alright?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Mrs Cake was laid on the floor, among the party detritus, below a banner that read \xe2\x80\x9cPinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s Pony-fabulous Party!\xe2\x80\x9d&nbsp;&nbsp;She clung to a piece of paper, pouring her tears into it.</p><p class="double">Stuttering through tears, Mrs Cake mumbled into the paper, inaudible to Twilight. </p><p>Moving closer, Twilight lowered herself down on the floor, levelling </p><p>herself with the morose pony.</p><p>Attempting to give Mrs Cake a comforting pat, Twilight brought her fore-hoof down </p><p>on her shoulder, and did her best to make friendly eye contact with the </p><p>tear-stricken pink of Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, but they remained fixated upon </p><p>the content of the paper in front of her.</p><p>In a softened, consoling tone of voice, Twilight continued.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry Mrs Cake; I didn\xe2\x80\x99t quite hear you\xe2\x80\xa6 What\xe2\x80\x99s wrong?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">In-between sobs, Twilight, caught the reason for Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s sorrow, escaping in </p><p>almost silent whispers, like she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear to pass the words from </p><p>her lips.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s Pinkie\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><br /><br /><p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><p><p class="double"></p><p>\xe2\x80\x9cGone.\xe2\x80\x9d</b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 'values': ['//------------------------------//\n// Gone// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\nTwilight hauled her saddlebag on, yet lingered by the door of the library, \ninstead of leaving. This was because, due to her eagerness to leave, and\n her exceptional organisational skills, she was once again, ready far \ntoo early.\nShe looked up, back towards the literary forest behind her, and called out to her assistant; Spike.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSpike!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight heard the soft padding of Spike\xe2\x80\x99s steps, ricocheting delicately off of \nthe bounds of information, upon the shelves of the library. Twilight \nliked how the library\xe2\x80\x99s cavernous nature accentuated such sounds. It was\n as if the books were helping her further than anypony thought they \nactually could, relaying real world sounds to her. \nNevertheless, even though the sounds of his steps were all too obvious to Twilight, \nSpike refrained from vocalising his movement.\nHowever, Twilight was kind of expecting this. She suspected that Spike was still\n rather annoyed from having to clean up behind her, and thus, would \nprobably try to make a point, and not speak to her for as long as he \ncould.\nBut, Twilight knew he wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t hold out too long\xe2\x80\xa6 After all, he had to speak to her, Spike was her assistant!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, Twilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight could see that Spike was trying to sound as dejected as he could, but \nlooking at the floor whilst doing so. She was sure that if she could \nmake eye contact with her assistant, he\xe2\x80\x99d probably snap out of his act.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWould you like to come to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party with me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike\xe2\x80\x99s eyes shot up, brightly, away from the forced melancholic stare at the \nground, apparently forgetting all disdain for having to clean up behind \nTwilight.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh boy, I\xe2\x80\x99d love to, Twi\xe2\x80\x99!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight grinned, and instead of replying, she just waited for Spike\xe2\x80\x99s next inevitable question.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWill Rarity be there?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nEven though she knew she\xe2\x80\x99d have this question asked of her, Twilight was \nhoping Spike wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t ask it, as then, she\xe2\x80\x99d have to be the bringer of \nbad news, and twice in one day, at that! First the horrors of cleaning, \nand now this!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, Spike, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t I already tell you?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike looked blankly at Twilight, Obviously she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t done so. Or perhaps he forgot?\nNo, Twilight thought to herself; Spike wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t forget anything about Rarity.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSpike, Rarity won\xe2\x80\x99t be there\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike exhaled loudly, disappointedly, and brought his gaze back down to the floor.\nHowever, Twilight, used to his behaviour, carried on.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s away with Fluttershy, on a spa weekend break, I recall her mentioning it last week.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight took a couple of hoofsteps towards Spike, and gave him a quick tap on \nthe shoulder, and attempted to act more like the mother figure, instead \nof her normal role.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, Spike\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike looked back up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, with a sad smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s okay, Twilight, I\xe2\x80\x99ll just stay here, I\xe2\x80\x99ve still got some cleaning to do.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight let out a quiet chuckle to herself. Even if Spike didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to, he always put a grin on her face.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, but Spike, Rainbow Dash\xe2\x80\x99ll be there too!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight immersed herself in thoughts of Rainbow, reminiscing just from the \ncombination of her name rolling off of her own tongue, mingling with her\n left over scent, still lingering from the night before.\nTwilight just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see Rainbow, even if Pinkie Pie and Applejack were to be at the party too, Twilight was sure she could have Rainbow to herself, for the most part, anyway. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, why do you keep mentioning Rainbow Dash? Other ponies will be there too, you know?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight felt a tad embarrassed, again, but managed to hold out on any blush, \nthis time. How had she managed to let Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s name slip out twice!? \nNot that Twilight thought that she ought to hide what she thought the two \nfillies had together. No, she wanted to run around Ponyville, declaring \nher love for Rainbow. Twilight wanted everypony to know.\n\nHowever, Twilight knew two things, both drawn from her time reading romance \nnovels. The first was that, in these novels, it was apparent that most \nof the couples would wait to announce their relationship together, and \nTwilight wanted to be gracious, and give Rainbow that opportunity.\nThe second was that, had Twilight done so, the whole thing would\xe2\x80\x99ve been horribly clich\xc3\xa9.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Spike, look at the time! I\xe2\x80\x99d best be off!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight knew she still had a few more minutes until she was actually scheduled  to leave, but she\xe2\x80\x99d decided that it\xe2\x80\x99d probably be the best to leave early, after all, it meant she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have to figure out how to vocalise all these thoughts in her head, and then find a way to convey it so Spike would understand it.\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\nDue to instinct, Rainbow Dash had headed straight home. \nYet,\n as she lay, sprawled upon her cloud sofa, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but feel \nthat her relaxation was merely synthesised. Although, at heart, Rainbow \nwanted nothing other than to be able to exist, to have it easy, she knew\n that she was far from able to do such a thing. \nThe fillies that were running around within her brain were making sure of that.\n\nOf course, Rainbow knew that there weren\xe2\x80\x99t actually tiny\n little ponies running around her head, but it sure felt like it to her.\n Not only due to the bizarre concoction of affection and animosity the \ntwo conflicting fillies managed to somehow create within Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s \nbrain, but because it felt like they were trying to dig their way out of her skull.\nStill, Rainbow was aware that that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t actually the case, although the \nwound upon her forehead had been conceived with one of the two ponies, \nRainbow was adamant that such a scenario would never occur.\nThat\xe2\x80\x99d be crazy on a level higher than Pinkie Pie.\n\nThinking of Pinkie Pie, Rainbow had already made the decision that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t \ngoing to attend her party. Not because of Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s craziness, no, that \nwas somewhat of a draw for Rainbow; it was fun, for a while, anyway.\nNo, the reasons behind her want for being alone were, yet again, Twilight Sparkle and Applejack.\n\nAsmuch as Rainbow would\xe2\x80\x99ve liked to meet up with Applejack, and make \namends, or to as much as an extent as she could, Rainbow knew that \nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s presence would hinder that; and possibly even damage \nApplejack\xe2\x80\x99s and her own relation ship beyond repair. \nBut even if Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t go, would Twilight and Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s encounter without her harbour even more problems?\nWithout her there, Twilight might stumble into problems with Applejack.\n\nYes, Twilight was a clever pony, but even she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t learned of the relationship between Applejack and Rainbow Dash, and, with this in mind, she could potentially ruin everything. \nRainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t an idiot, and she knew Twilight. She knew that Twilight would be\n itching to tell everypony about their newly formed bonds. Not because Twilight liked to brag, or because she wanted to gossip, but merely because Twilight would be happy. \n\nTwilight wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t want to hide her happiness. Instead, she\xe2\x80\x99d want to spread the \nreason for her happiness, so everypony could feel it, too, and without \nknowledge of Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s relationship with Rainbow Dash, there\xe2\x80\x99d be no \nreason for her to hide it.\n\nRainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t know how much Applejack knew of her night with Twilight, \nnevertheless, Rainbow knew that after their imminent meeting, she\xe2\x80\x99d \nprobably know everything.\nWell, perhaps not everything. Rainbow hoped that Twilight would at least be a bit prudish with some of the details. Even though Twilight was smart, her naiveties within love could lead to revelations of more intimate scenes. However, Rainbow Dash supposed that not even Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s naivety stretched to describing such\xe2\x80\xa6 Scenes.\n\nAnyway, even though the whole situation seemed incredibly daunting for Rainbow, without any certainties to rely on, she knew one thing.\n\nShe still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party.\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\nApplejack could still feel the cool breeze, carried down from Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill, \nyet it didn\xe2\x80\x99t ruffle her mane as much as it could\xe2\x80\x99ve done, as she\xe2\x80\x99d \npulled her Stetson down tightly, in an attempt to cover her face. Or \nrather, her eyes.\n\n Applejack knew it was silly, if she was upset, that was all there was \nto it, why bother hiding it? Yet, it had seemed the right thing to do, \nto cover up her red, puffy eyes. She looked down at the floor, moving \nbelow her, as she absent mindedly, slowly clopped her way over to \nSugarcube Corner.\nShe hadn\xe2\x80\x99t really wanted to go, in fact, if she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t stopped crying, Applejack probably\n wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have left Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill at all. However, Applejack knew \nthat she had to go; after all, there was at least a small chance that Dash would be there, and Applejack desperately needed to see her.\n\nWhen Dash had left her upon the hill, Applejack hadn\xe2\x80\x99t returned to help her \nbrother, like she\xe2\x80\x99d said she would. Instead, she\xe2\x80\x99d just remained, \npondering. Wondering why Dash had continued to be like she was, always \ntrying to look cool, all the time.\nYet, to Applejack, it was apparent that this \xe2\x80\x98keeping up\xe2\x80\x99 of appearances seemed to only apply to the relationship surrounding Dash and herself. \n\nNot that Applejack would\xe2\x80\x99ve realised this, had Dash not told her herself. \n\nApplejack played back the groggy scenes from the night before, in her head: Dash \nwas nuzzling her, burying her tearful eyes into the orange of her own \nneck, warming. Yet again, like their times before, Applejack had just \nlistened, absorbing Dash\xe2\x80\x99s melancholy, desperate to make the pony she \nloved feel \xe2\x80\x98right\xe2\x80\x99 again. \nHowever, try as she might, Applejack couldn\xe2\x80\x99t forgive Dash for her actions, not \nyet, anyway. Despite Dash\xe2\x80\x99s forlorn upset, and despite Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s \ndependability, her forgiveness, it would take a while for Dash to get the catharsis she so desperately desired.\n\nEven though Dash was full of apologies, none of them were quite spectacular \nenough to compensate for what she\xe2\x80\x99d broken in to confess to Applejack.\n\nAlthough the fact that Dash was willing to make an effort to confess showed that\n she still had feelings for Applejack, and she knew where she\xe2\x80\x99d gone \nwrong, it still didn\xe2\x80\x99t fix what she\xe2\x80\x99d done wrong, but only showed that \nshe wanted to try.\nThe last variable was what pained Applejack. The variable that Dash may not\n have even meant to come and confess to her at all; it may well have \nbeen just the alcohol in her bloodstream that had taken over.\n\nApplejack stole a glance upwards, and realised that she was nearing her \ndestination, Sugarcube Corner, as was another pony, from the opposite \ndirection. A purple filly.\n\nAs Applejack gazed forwards at Twilight Sparkle, trotting gently towards \nher, she remembered, once more, the words that Rainbow Dash had passed \non to her the night before, the words that had clouded Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s \nthoughts ever since she\xe2\x80\x99d heard them; repeating, constantly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack, I\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry. I really am, but\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBut I think I\xe2\x80\x99m in love\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWith Twilight\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\n\nTwilight Sparkle couldn\xe2\x80\x99t contain her joy; it was only moments from her arrival at the party, she\xe2\x80\x99d be able to see Rainbow again!\n\nEscaping from her runaway scenarios in her head, Twilight began to focus back \nonto the real world, after all, she was nearly at Sugarcube Corner, and \nneeded to pay attention to walking, if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to trot into \nanything.\n\nAs Twilight looked towards the entrance of the store, she could not only \nsee the ornate cakey exterior of Sugarcube Corner, but the contrasting \norange of Applejack, waiting by the door, looking to the ground.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight called out loudly, yet she got no response. Applejack just kept gazing \ninto the ground, seemingly unaware of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s presence. Perhaps \nApplejack just didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear her, Twilight thought. It was rather blustery, and that could\xe2\x80\x99ve just overwhelmed her voice, despite how loud she called out.\n\nReaching the entrance of Sugarcube Corner, Twilight sidled up to Applejack, with a smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nAt first, Twilight thought Applejack was just ignoring her, yet, as a \ncouple of seconds went by, it was clear that she was just being a bit \nslow, pre-occupied.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh. Hi, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d \n\nApplejack sounded rather dejected, to Twilight. Initially, Twilight would\xe2\x80\x99ve just\n put the tone of voice down to an accidental slip in Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s \nsouthern drawl, yet after reading her gait, Twilight couldn\xe2\x80\x99t have \nmistaken Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s apparent emotions.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack, are you okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight nuzzled up to Applejack, she was clearly in a state of upset, and \nTwilight wanted to fix that; Applejack was her friend, and she hated to \nsee any of her friends in such a state.\nHowever, something then happened that Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t expecting; whilst she\xe2\x80\x99d \nthought that nuzzling Applejack would help her to feel at least a bit \nbetter, instead of returning the embrace, Applejack shrugged her off, \nand pulled away.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAh\xe2\x80\x99m fine, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nThere was that tone again, Applejack certainly was not okay. Her voice was layered with trembles, immersed in despondency.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n stepped towards Applejack once again, attempting to embrace her, yet, \nbefore she could even make contact, Applejack pulled away, mimicking her\n own earlier actions. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cJust leave it, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nApplejack\xe2\x80\x99s voice was hurt, but irritable. However, this time, tone wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all \nTwilight had to go on, as Applejack looked up to her, making eye \ncontact, with a pleading gaze, through clouded irises.\nTwilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t like it, but if Applejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to talk about it, there \nwas little she could do, Applejack was her friend, and she wanted to \nrespect her wishes.\nShe could have responded, but Twilight thought it was best to leave it at \nthat, with an affirmative silence in place of an answer.\n\nTrying to move on from her friend\xe2\x80\x99s melancholy, Twilight decided to move \ntowards the front door of Sugarcube Corner, ready to brave what was \nundoubtedly going to be a rather over the top welcome from Pinkie Pie. \nAs Twilight reached forwards to push open the door, she noticed that the sign on the door read \xe2\x80\x98closed.\xe2\x80\x99\nThis seemed slightly odd, but Twilight assumed that the sign didn\xe2\x80\x99t really \napply to them, and was probably there due to the party they were \nattending.\n\nWhen the door swung open, despite what it\xe2\x80\x99s label tried to profess, Twilight\n was met with an all to familiar sight; streamers, balloons, confetti, \nbanners and all. It was a trademark Pinkie Pie party. However, something\n didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem quite right.\n\nTwilight stood in the doorway for a moment, with Applejack reluctantly in tow, \nuntil she could put her hoof on what was feeling amiss.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Celestia! Mrs Cake! Are you alright?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nMrs Cake was laid on the floor, among the party detritus, below a banner that read \xe2\x80\x9cPinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s Pony-fabulous Party!\xe2\x80\x9d  She clung to a piece of paper, pouring her tears into it.\n\nStuttering through tears, Mrs Cake mumbled into the paper, inaudible to Twilight. \nMoving closer, Twilight lowered herself down on the floor, levelling \nherself with the morose pony.\nAttempting to give Mrs Cake a comforting pat, Twilight brought her fore-hoof down \non her shoulder, and did her best to make friendly eye contact with the \ntear-stricken pink of Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, but they remained fixated upon \nthe content of the paper in front of her.\nIn a softened, consoling tone of voice, Twilight continued.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry Mrs Cake; I didn\xe2\x80\x99t quite hear you\xe2\x80\xa6 What\xe2\x80\x99s wrong?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nIn-between sobs, Twilight, caught the reason for Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s sorrow, escaping in \nalmost silent whispers, like she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear to pass the words from \nher lips.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s Pinkie\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cGone.\xe2\x80\x9d', 8, 63, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'8\'></a><h3>Gone</h3>\n<p>Twilight hauled her saddlebag on, yet lingered by the door of the library, </p><p>instead of leaving. This was because, due to her eagerness to leave, and</p><p> her exceptional organisational skills, she was once again, ready far </p><p>too early.</p><p>She looked up, back towards the literary forest behind her, and called out to her assistant; Spike.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSpike!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight heard the soft padding of Spike\xe2\x80\x99s steps, ricocheting delicately off of </p><p>the bounds of information, upon the shelves of the library. Twilight </p><p>liked how the library\xe2\x80\x99s cavernous nature accentuated such sounds. It was</p><p> as if the books were helping her further than anypony thought they </p><p>actually could, relaying real world sounds to her. </p><p>Nevertheless, even though the sounds of his steps were all too obvious to Twilight, </p><p>Spike refrained from vocalising his movement.</p><p>However, Twilight was kind of expecting this. She suspected that Spike was still</p><p> rather annoyed from having to clean up behind her, and thus, would </p><p>probably try to make a point, and not speak to her for as long as he </p><p>could.</p><p>But, Twilight knew he wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t hold out too long\xe2\x80\xa6 After all, he had to speak to her, Spike was her assistant!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cYes, Twilight?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight could see that Spike was trying to sound as dejected as he could, but </p><p>looking at the floor whilst doing so. She was sure that if she could </p><p>make eye contact with her assistant, he\xe2\x80\x99d probably snap out of his act.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWould you like to come to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party with me?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike\xe2\x80\x99s eyes shot up, brightly, away from the forced melancholic stare at the </p><p>ground, apparently forgetting all disdain for having to clean up behind </p><p>Twilight.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh boy, I\xe2\x80\x99d love to, Twi\xe2\x80\x99!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight grinned, and instead of replying, she just waited for Spike\xe2\x80\x99s next inevitable question.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWill Rarity be there?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Even though she knew she\xe2\x80\x99d have this question asked of her, Twilight was </p><p>hoping Spike wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t ask it, as then, she\xe2\x80\x99d have to be the bringer of </p><p>bad news, and twice in one day, at that! First the horrors of cleaning, </p><p>and now this!</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, Spike, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t I already tell you?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike looked blankly at Twilight, Obviously she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t done so. Or perhaps he forgot?</p><p>No, Twilight thought to herself; Spike wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t forget anything about Rarity.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cSpike, Rarity won\xe2\x80\x99t be there\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike exhaled loudly, disappointedly, and brought his gaze back down to the floor.</p><p>However, Twilight, used to his behaviour, carried on.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s away with Fluttershy, on a spa weekend break, I recall her mentioning it last week.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight took a couple of hoofsteps towards Spike, and gave him a quick tap on </p><p>the shoulder, and attempted to act more like the mother figure, instead </p><p>of her normal role.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, Spike\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Spike looked back up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, with a sad smile.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s okay, Twilight, I\xe2\x80\x99ll just stay here, I\xe2\x80\x99ve still got some cleaning to do.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight let out a quiet chuckle to herself. Even if Spike didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to, he always put a grin on her face.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, but Spike, Rainbow Dash\xe2\x80\x99ll be there too!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight immersed herself in thoughts of Rainbow, reminiscing just from the </p><p>combination of her name rolling off of her own tongue, mingling with her</p><p> left over scent, still lingering from the night before.</p><p>Twilight just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see Rainbow, even if Pinkie Pie and Applejack were to be at the party too, Twilight was sure she could have Rainbow to herself, for the most part, anyway. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, why do you keep mentioning Rainbow Dash? Other ponies will be there too, you know?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight felt a tad embarrassed, again, but managed to hold out on any blush, </p><p>this time. How had she managed to let Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s name slip out twice!? </p><p>Not that Twilight thought that she ought to hide what she thought the two </p><p>fillies had together. No, she wanted to run around Ponyville, declaring </p><p>her love for Rainbow. Twilight wanted everypony to know.</p><p class="double">However, Twilight knew two things, both drawn from her time reading romance </p><p>novels. The first was that, in these novels, it was apparent that most </p><p>of the couples would wait to announce their relationship together, and </p><p>Twilight wanted to be gracious, and give Rainbow that opportunity.</p><p>The second was that, had Twilight done so, the whole thing would\xe2\x80\x99ve been horribly clich\xc3\xa9.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Spike, look at the time! I\xe2\x80\x99d best be off!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight knew she still had a few more minutes until she was actually scheduled&nbsp;&nbsp;to leave, but she\xe2\x80\x99d decided that it\xe2\x80\x99d probably be the best to leave early, after all, it meant she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have to figure out how to vocalise all these thoughts in her head, and then find a way to convey it so Spike would understand it.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p><p class="double"></p><p>Due to instinct, Rainbow Dash had headed straight home. </p><p>Yet,</p><p> as she lay, sprawled upon her cloud sofa, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but feel </p><p>that her relaxation was merely synthesised. Although, at heart, Rainbow </p><p>wanted nothing other than to be able to exist, to have it easy, she knew</p><p> that she was far from able to do such a thing. </p><p>The fillies that were running around within her brain were making sure of that.</p><p class="double">Of course, Rainbow knew that there weren\xe2\x80\x99t actually tiny</p><p> little ponies running around her head, but it sure felt like it to her.</p><p> Not only due to the bizarre concoction of affection and animosity the </p><p>two conflicting fillies managed to somehow create within Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>brain, but because it felt like they were trying to dig their way out of her skull.</p><p>Still, Rainbow was aware that that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t actually the case, although the </p><p>wound upon her forehead had been conceived with one of the two ponies, </p><p>Rainbow was adamant that such a scenario would never occur.</p><p>That\xe2\x80\x99d be crazy on a level higher than Pinkie Pie.</p><p class="double">Thinking of Pinkie Pie, Rainbow had already made the decision that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t </p><p>going to attend her party. Not because of Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s craziness, no, that </p><p>was somewhat of a draw for Rainbow; it was fun, for a while, anyway.</p><p>No, the reasons behind her want for being alone were, yet again, Twilight Sparkle and Applejack.</p><p class="double">Asmuch as Rainbow would\xe2\x80\x99ve liked to meet up with Applejack, and make </p><p>amends, or to as much as an extent as she could, Rainbow knew that </p><p>Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s presence would hinder that; and possibly even damage </p><p>Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s and her own relation ship beyond repair. </p><p>But even if Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t go, would Twilight and Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s encounter without her harbour even more problems?</p><p>Without her there, Twilight might stumble into problems with Applejack.</p><p class="double">Yes, Twilight was a clever pony, but even she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t learned of the relationship between Applejack and Rainbow Dash, and, with this in mind, she could potentially ruin everything. </p><p>Rainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t an idiot, and she knew Twilight. She knew that Twilight would be</p><p> itching to tell everypony about their newly formed bonds. Not because Twilight liked to brag, or because she wanted to gossip, but merely because Twilight would be happy. </p><p class="double">Twilight wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t want to hide her happiness. Instead, she\xe2\x80\x99d want to spread the </p><p>reason for her happiness, so everypony could feel it, too, and without </p><p>knowledge of Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s relationship with Rainbow Dash, there\xe2\x80\x99d be no </p><p>reason for her to hide it.</p><p class="double">Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t know how much Applejack knew of her night with Twilight, </p><p>nevertheless, Rainbow knew that after their imminent meeting, she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>probably know everything.</p><p>Well, perhaps not everything. Rainbow hoped that Twilight would at least be a bit prudish with some of the details. Even though Twilight was smart, her naiveties within love could lead to revelations of more intimate scenes. However, Rainbow Dash supposed that not even Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s naivety stretched to describing such\xe2\x80\xa6 Scenes.</p><p class="double">Anyway, even though the whole situation seemed incredibly daunting for Rainbow, without any certainties to rely on, she knew one thing.</p><p class="double">She still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party.</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">Applejack could still feel the cool breeze, carried down from Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill, </p><p>yet it didn\xe2\x80\x99t ruffle her mane as much as it could\xe2\x80\x99ve done, as she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>pulled her Stetson down tightly, in an attempt to cover her face. Or </p><p>rather, her eyes.</p><p class="double"> Applejack knew it was silly, if she was upset, that was all there was </p><p>to it, why bother hiding it? Yet, it had seemed the right thing to do, </p><p>to cover up her red, puffy eyes. She looked down at the floor, moving </p><p>below her, as she absent mindedly, slowly clopped her way over to </p><p>Sugarcube Corner.</p><p>She hadn\xe2\x80\x99t really wanted to go, in fact, if she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t stopped crying, Applejack probably</p><p> wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have left Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill at all. However, Applejack knew </p><p>that she had to go; after all, there was at least a small chance that Dash would be there, and Applejack desperately needed to see her.</p><p class="double">When Dash had left her upon the hill, Applejack hadn\xe2\x80\x99t returned to help her </p><p>brother, like she\xe2\x80\x99d said she would. Instead, she\xe2\x80\x99d just remained, </p><p>pondering. Wondering why Dash had continued to be like she was, always </p><p>trying to look cool, all the time.</p><p>Yet, to Applejack, it was apparent that this \xe2\x80\x98keeping up\xe2\x80\x99 of appearances seemed to only apply to the relationship surrounding Dash and herself. </p><p class="double">Not that Applejack would\xe2\x80\x99ve realised this, had Dash not told her herself. </p><p class="double">Applejack played back the groggy scenes from the night before, in her head: Dash </p><p>was nuzzling her, burying her tearful eyes into the orange of her own </p><p>neck, warming. Yet again, like their times before, Applejack had just </p><p>listened, absorbing Dash\xe2\x80\x99s melancholy, desperate to make the pony she </p><p>loved feel \xe2\x80\x98right\xe2\x80\x99 again. </p><p>However, try as she might, Applejack couldn\xe2\x80\x99t forgive Dash for her actions, not </p><p>yet, anyway. Despite Dash\xe2\x80\x99s forlorn upset, and despite Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>dependability, her forgiveness, it would take a while for Dash to get the catharsis she so desperately desired.</p><p class="double">Even though Dash was full of apologies, none of them were quite spectacular </p><p>enough to compensate for what she\xe2\x80\x99d broken in to confess to Applejack.</p><p class="double">Although the fact that Dash was willing to make an effort to confess showed that</p><p> she still had feelings for Applejack, and she knew where she\xe2\x80\x99d gone </p><p>wrong, it still didn\xe2\x80\x99t fix what she\xe2\x80\x99d done wrong, but only showed that </p><p>she wanted to try.</p><p>The last variable was what pained Applejack. The variable that Dash may not</p><p> have even meant to come and confess to her at all; it may well have </p><p>been just the alcohol in her bloodstream that had taken over.</p><p class="double">Applejack stole a glance upwards, and realised that she was nearing her </p><p>destination, Sugarcube Corner, as was another pony, from the opposite </p><p>direction. A purple filly.</p><p class="double">As Applejack gazed forwards at Twilight Sparkle, trotting gently towards </p><p>her, she remembered, once more, the words that Rainbow Dash had passed </p><p>on to her the night before, the words that had clouded Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>thoughts ever since she\xe2\x80\x99d heard them; repeating, constantly.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack, I\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry. I really am, but\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut I think I\xe2\x80\x99m in love\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cWith Twilight\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p></p><br /><p><p class="double">*****</p></p><br /><p><p class="double"></p><p>Twilight Sparkle couldn\xe2\x80\x99t contain her joy; it was only moments from her arrival at the party, she\xe2\x80\x99d be able to see Rainbow again!</p><p class="double">Escaping from her runaway scenarios in her head, Twilight began to focus back </p><p>onto the real world, after all, she was nearly at Sugarcube Corner, and </p><p>needed to pay attention to walking, if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to trot into </p><p>anything.</p><p class="double">As Twilight looked towards the entrance of the store, she could not only </p><p>see the ornate cakey exterior of Sugarcube Corner, but the contrasting </p><p>orange of Applejack, waiting by the door, looking to the ground.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight called out loudly, yet she got no response. Applejack just kept gazing </p><p>into the ground, seemingly unaware of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s presence. Perhaps </p><p>Applejack just didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear her, Twilight thought. It was rather blustery, and that could\xe2\x80\x99ve just overwhelmed her voice, despite how loud she called out.</p><p class="double">Reaching the entrance of Sugarcube Corner, Twilight sidled up to Applejack, with a smile.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">At first, Twilight thought Applejack was just ignoring her, yet, as a </p><p>couple of seconds went by, it was clear that she was just being a bit </p><p>slow, pre-occupied.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cOh. Hi, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d </p><p class="double">Applejack sounded rather dejected, to Twilight. Initially, Twilight would\xe2\x80\x99ve just</p><p> put the tone of voice down to an accidental slip in Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s </p><p>southern drawl, yet after reading her gait, Twilight couldn\xe2\x80\x99t have </p><p>mistaken Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s apparent emotions.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack, are you okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight nuzzled up to Applejack, she was clearly in a state of upset, and </p><p>Twilight wanted to fix that; Applejack was her friend, and she hated to </p><p>see any of her friends in such a state.</p><p>However, something then happened that Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t expecting; whilst she\xe2\x80\x99d </p><p>thought that nuzzling Applejack would help her to feel at least a bit </p><p>better, instead of returning the embrace, Applejack shrugged her off, </p><p>and pulled away.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh\xe2\x80\x99m fine, Twilight.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">There was that tone again, Applejack certainly was not okay. Her voice was layered with trembles, immersed in despondency.</p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Twilight</p><p> stepped towards Applejack once again, attempting to embrace her, yet, </p><p>before she could even make contact, Applejack pulled away, mimicking her</p><p> own earlier actions. </p><p class="double">\xe2\x80\x9cJust leave it, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="double">Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s voice was hurt, but irritable. However, this time, tone wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all </p><p>Twilight had to go on, as Applejack looked up to her, making eye </p><p>contact, with a pleading gaze, through clouded irises.</p><p>Twilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t like it, but if Applejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to talk about it, there </p><p>was little she could do, Applejack was her friend, and she wanted to </p><p>respect her wishes.</p><p>She could have responded, but Twilight thought it was best to leave it at </p><p>that, with an affirmative silence in place of an answer.</p><p class="double">Trying to move on from her friend\xe2\x80\x99s melancholy, Twilight decided to move </p><p>towards the front door of Sugarcube Corner, ready to brave what was </p><p>undoubtedly going to be a rather over the top welcome from Pinkie Pie. </p><p>As Twilight reached forwards to push open the door, she noticed that the sign on the door read \xe2\x80\x98closed.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p>This seemed slightly odd, but Twilight assumed that the sign didn\xe2\x80\x99t really </p><p>apply to them, and was probably there due to the party they were </p><p>attending.</p><p class="double">When the door swung open, despite what it\xe2\x80\x99s label tried to profess, Twilight</p><p> was met with an all to familiar sight; streamers, balloons, confetti, </p><p>banners and all. It was a trademark Pinkie Pie party. This was because, due to her eagerness to leave, and\n her exceptional organisational skills, she was once again, ready far \ntoo early.\nShe looked up, back towards the literary forest behind her, and called out to her assistant; Spike.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSpike!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight heard the soft padding of Spike\xe2\x80\x99s steps, ricocheting delicately off of \nthe bounds of information, upon the shelves of the library. Twilight \nliked how the library\xe2\x80\x99s cavernous nature accentuated such sounds. It was\n as if the books were helping her further than anypony thought they \nactually could, relaying real world sounds to her. \nNevertheless, even though the sounds of his steps were all too obvious to Twilight, \nSpike refrained from vocalising his movement.\nHowever, Twilight was kind of expecting this. She suspected that Spike was still\n rather annoyed from having to clean up behind her, and thus, would \nprobably try to make a point, and not speak to her for as long as he \ncould.\nBut, Twilight knew he wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t hold out too long\xe2\x80\xa6 After all, he had to speak to her, Spike was her assistant!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cYes, Twilight?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight could see that Spike was trying to sound as dejected as he could, but \nlooking at the floor whilst doing so. She was sure that if she could \nmake eye contact with her assistant, he\xe2\x80\x99d probably snap out of his act.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWould you like to come to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party with me?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike\xe2\x80\x99s eyes shot up, brightly, away from the forced melancholic stare at the \nground, apparently forgetting all disdain for having to clean up behind \nTwilight.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh boy, I\xe2\x80\x99d love to, Twi\xe2\x80\x99!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight grinned, and instead of replying, she just waited for Spike\xe2\x80\x99s next inevitable question.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWill Rarity be there?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nEven though she knew she\xe2\x80\x99d have this question asked of her, Twilight was \nhoping Spike wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t ask it, as then, she\xe2\x80\x99d have to be the bringer of \nbad news, and twice in one day, at that! First the horrors of cleaning, \nand now this!\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, Spike, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t I already tell you?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike looked blankly at Twilight, Obviously she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t done so. Or perhaps he forgot?\nNo, Twilight thought to herself; Spike wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t forget anything about Rarity.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cSpike, Rarity won\xe2\x80\x99t be there\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike exhaled loudly, disappointedly, and brought his gaze back down to the floor.\nHowever, Twilight, used to his behaviour, carried on.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s away with Fluttershy, on a spa weekend break, I recall her mentioning it last week.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight took a couple of hoofsteps towards Spike, and gave him a quick tap on \nthe shoulder, and attempted to act more like the mother figure, instead \nof her normal role.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sorry, Spike\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nSpike looked back up to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, with a sad smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s okay, Twilight, I\xe2\x80\x99ll just stay here, I\xe2\x80\x99ve still got some cleaning to do.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight let out a quiet chuckle to herself. Even if Spike didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to, he always put a grin on her face.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, but Spike, Rainbow Dash\xe2\x80\x99ll be there too!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight immersed herself in thoughts of Rainbow, reminiscing just from the \ncombination of her name rolling off of her own tongue, mingling with her\n left over scent, still lingering from the night before.\nTwilight just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see Rainbow, even if Pinkie Pie and Applejack were to be at the party too, Twilight was sure she could have Rainbow to herself, for the most part, anyway. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, why do you keep mentioning Rainbow Dash? Other ponies will be there too, you know?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight felt a tad embarrassed, again, but managed to hold out on any blush, \nthis time. How had she managed to let Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s name slip out twice!? \nNot that Twilight thought that she ought to hide what she thought the two \nfillies had together. No, she wanted to run around Ponyville, declaring \nher love for Rainbow. Twilight wanted everypony to know.\n\nHowever, Twilight knew two things, both drawn from her time reading romance \nnovels. The first was that, in these novels, it was apparent that most \nof the couples would wait to announce their relationship together, and \nTwilight wanted to be gracious, and give Rainbow that opportunity.\nThe second was that, had Twilight done so, the whole thing would\xe2\x80\x99ve been horribly clich\xc3\xa9.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh, Spike, look at the time! I\xe2\x80\x99d best be off!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight knew she still had a few more minutes until she was actually scheduled  to leave, but she\xe2\x80\x99d decided that it\xe2\x80\x99d probably be the best to leave early, after all, it meant she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have to figure out how to vocalise all these thoughts in her head, and then find a way to convey it so Spike would understand it.\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\nDue to instinct, Rainbow Dash had headed straight home. \nYet,\n as she lay, sprawled upon her cloud sofa, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but feel \nthat her relaxation was merely synthesised. Although, at heart, Rainbow \nwanted nothing other than to be able to exist, to have it easy, she knew\n that she was far from able to do such a thing. \nThe fillies that were running around within her brain were making sure of that.\n\nOf course, Rainbow knew that there weren\xe2\x80\x99t actually tiny\n little ponies running around her head, but it sure felt like it to her.\n Not only due to the bizarre concoction of affection and animosity the \ntwo conflicting fillies managed to somehow create within Rainbow\xe2\x80\x99s \nbrain, but because it felt like they were trying to dig their way out of her skull.\nStill, Rainbow was aware that that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t actually the case, although the \nwound upon her forehead had been conceived with one of the two ponies, \nRainbow was adamant that such a scenario would never occur.\nThat\xe2\x80\x99d be crazy on a level higher than Pinkie Pie.\n\nThinking of Pinkie Pie, Rainbow had already made the decision that she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t \ngoing to attend her party. Not because of Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s craziness, no, that \nwas somewhat of a draw for Rainbow; it was fun, for a while, anyway.\nNo, the reasons behind her want for being alone were, yet again, Twilight Sparkle and Applejack.\n\nAsmuch as Rainbow would\xe2\x80\x99ve liked to meet up with Applejack, and make \namends, or to as much as an extent as she could, Rainbow knew that \nTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s presence would hinder that; and possibly even damage \nApplejack\xe2\x80\x99s and her own relation ship beyond repair. \nBut even if Rainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t go, would Twilight and Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s encounter without her harbour even more problems?\nWithout her there, Twilight might stumble into problems with Applejack.\n\nYes, Twilight was a clever pony, but even she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t learned of the relationship between Applejack and Rainbow Dash, and, with this in mind, she could potentially ruin everything. \nRainbow wasn\xe2\x80\x99t an idiot, and she knew Twilight. She knew that Twilight would be\n itching to tell everypony about their newly formed bonds. Not because Twilight liked to brag, or because she wanted to gossip, but merely because Twilight would be happy. \n\nTwilight wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t want to hide her happiness. Instead, she\xe2\x80\x99d want to spread the \nreason for her happiness, so everypony could feel it, too, and without \nknowledge of Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s relationship with Rainbow Dash, there\xe2\x80\x99d be no \nreason for her to hide it.\n\nRainbow didn\xe2\x80\x99t know how much Applejack knew of her night with Twilight, \nnevertheless, Rainbow knew that after their imminent meeting, she\xe2\x80\x99d \nprobably know everything.\nWell, perhaps not everything. Rainbow hoped that Twilight would at least be a bit prudish with some of the details. Even though Twilight was smart, her naiveties within love could lead to revelations of more intimate scenes. However, Rainbow Dash supposed that not even Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s naivety stretched to describing such\xe2\x80\xa6 Scenes.\n\nAnyway, even though the whole situation seemed incredibly daunting for Rainbow, without any certainties to rely on, she knew one thing.\n\nShe still wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going to Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s party.\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\nApplejack could still feel the cool breeze, carried down from Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill, \nyet it didn\xe2\x80\x99t ruffle her mane as much as it could\xe2\x80\x99ve done, as she\xe2\x80\x99d \npulled her Stetson down tightly, in an attempt to cover her face. Or \nrather, her eyes.\n\n Applejack knew it was silly, if she was upset, that was all there was \nto it, why bother hiding it? Yet, it had seemed the right thing to do, \nto cover up her red, puffy eyes. She looked down at the floor, moving \nbelow her, as she absent mindedly, slowly clopped her way over to \nSugarcube Corner.\nShe hadn\xe2\x80\x99t really wanted to go, in fact, if she hadn\xe2\x80\x99t stopped crying, Applejack probably\n wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have left Bloomberg\xe2\x80\x99s hill at all. However, Applejack knew \nthat she had to go; after all, there was at least a small chance that Dash would be there, and Applejack desperately needed to see her.\n\nWhen Dash had left her upon the hill, Applejack hadn\xe2\x80\x99t returned to help her \nbrother, like she\xe2\x80\x99d said she would. Instead, she\xe2\x80\x99d just remained, \npondering. Wondering why Dash had continued to be like she was, always \ntrying to look cool, all the time.\nYet, to Applejack, it was apparent that this \xe2\x80\x98keeping up\xe2\x80\x99 of appearances seemed to only apply to the relationship surrounding Dash and herself. \n\nNot that Applejack would\xe2\x80\x99ve realised this, had Dash not told her herself. \n\nApplejack played back the groggy scenes from the night before, in her head: Dash \nwas nuzzling her, burying her tearful eyes into the orange of her own \nneck, warming. Yet again, like their times before, Applejack had just \nlistened, absorbing Dash\xe2\x80\x99s melancholy, desperate to make the pony she \nloved feel \xe2\x80\x98right\xe2\x80\x99 again. \nHowever, try as she might, Applejack couldn\xe2\x80\x99t forgive Dash for her actions, not \nyet, anyway. Despite Dash\xe2\x80\x99s forlorn upset, and despite Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s \ndependability, her forgiveness, it would take a while for Dash to get the catharsis she so desperately desired.\n\nEven though Dash was full of apologies, none of them were quite spectacular \nenough to compensate for what she\xe2\x80\x99d broken in to confess to Applejack.\n\nAlthough the fact that Dash was willing to make an effort to confess showed that\n she still had feelings for Applejack, and she knew where she\xe2\x80\x99d gone \nwrong, it still didn\xe2\x80\x99t fix what she\xe2\x80\x99d done wrong, but only showed that \nshe wanted to try.\nThe last variable was what pained Applejack. The variable that Dash may not\n have even meant to come and confess to her at all; it may well have \nbeen just the alcohol in her bloodstream that had taken over.\n\nApplejack stole a glance upwards, and realised that she was nearing her \ndestination, Sugarcube Corner, as was another pony, from the opposite \ndirection. A purple filly.\n\nAs Applejack gazed forwards at Twilight Sparkle, trotting gently towards \nher, she remembered, once more, the words that Rainbow Dash had passed \non to her the night before, the words that had clouded Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s \nthoughts ever since she\xe2\x80\x99d heard them; repeating, constantly.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack, I\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry. I really am, but\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBut I think I\xe2\x80\x99m in love\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWith Twilight\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\n\n\n*****\n\n\n\n\nTwilight Sparkle couldn\xe2\x80\x99t contain her joy; it was only moments from her arrival at the party, she\xe2\x80\x99d be able to see Rainbow again!\n\nEscaping from her runaway scenarios in her head, Twilight began to focus back \nonto the real world, after all, she was nearly at Sugarcube Corner, and \nneeded to pay attention to walking, if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to trot into \nanything.\n\nAs Twilight looked towards the entrance of the store, she could not only \nsee the ornate cakey exterior of Sugarcube Corner, but the contrasting \norange of Applejack, waiting by the door, looking to the ground.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight called out loudly, yet she got no response. Applejack just kept gazing \ninto the ground, seemingly unaware of Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s presence. Perhaps \nApplejack just didn\xe2\x80\x99t hear her, Twilight thought. It was rather blustery, and that could\xe2\x80\x99ve just overwhelmed her voice, despite how loud she called out.\n\nReaching the entrance of Sugarcube Corner, Twilight sidled up to Applejack, with a smile.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nAt first, Twilight thought Applejack was just ignoring her, yet, as a \ncouple of seconds went by, it was clear that she was just being a bit \nslow, pre-occupied.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cOh. Hi, Twi\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d \n\nApplejack sounded rather dejected, to Twilight. Her voice was layered with trembles, immersed in despondency.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cApplejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nTwilight\n stepped towards Applejack once again, attempting to embrace her, yet, \nbefore she could even make contact, Applejack pulled away, mimicking her\n own earlier actions. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cJust leave it, okay?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nApplejack\xe2\x80\x99s voice was hurt, but irritable. However, this time, tone wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all \nTwilight had to go on, as Applejack looked up to her, making eye \ncontact, with a pleading gaze, through clouded irises.\nTwilight didn\xe2\x80\x99t like it, but if Applejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to talk about it, there \nwas little she could do, Applejack was her friend, and she wanted to \nrespect her wishes.\nShe could have responded, but Twilight thought it was best to leave it at \nthat, with an affirmative silence in place of an answer.\n\nTrying to move on from her friend\xe2\x80\x99s melancholy, Twilight decided to move \ntowards the front door of Sugarcube Corner, ready to brave what was \nundoubtedly going to be a rather over the top welcome from Pinkie Pie. \nAs Twilight reached forwards to push open the door, she noticed that the sign on the door read \xe2\x80\x98closed.\xe2\x80\x99\nThis seemed slightly odd, but Twilight assumed that the sign didn\xe2\x80\x99t really \napply to them, and was probably there due to the party they were \nattending.\n\nWhen the door swung open, despite what it\xe2\x80\x99s label tried to profess, Twilight\n was met with an all to familiar sight; streamers, balloons, confetti, \nbanners and all. It was a trademark Pinkie Pie party. However, she\xe2\x80\x99d not read a word on the letter for ages, she was staring into it, past the words, to try and find what Pinkie really meant\xe2\x80\xa6\n\t\n\tTwilight knew Pinkie, she was her friend. She could hear Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s heavy breathing from beside her, no doubt caused by Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s words.\n\t\n\tTwilight sighed, unhappily. It may well have heightened the awkwardness of Sugarcube Corner\xe2\x80\x99s silence, but Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really fussed. Although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know the scientific basis behind it, she knew that a sigh could normally alleviate any of her grief.\n\t\n\tShe\xe2\x80\x99d hoped that this would\xe2\x80\x99ve been true in this situation too, but, her efforts seemed in vain.\n\t\n\tIn fact, to Twilight, it seemed that the thought of a sigh dealing with such important, sensitive things such as Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s disappearance made the bitter sinking sensation within her a thousand-fold worse.\n\t\n\tTwilight looked across to Mrs Cake, through her slowly clouding eyes, to meet with already cloud-burst ones. Even though the movement of eyes should only take a tiny amount of effort; to Twilight, if felt as if she\xe2\x80\x99d never performed a task more arduous: to meet Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s eye\xe2\x80\x99s in honesty.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cMrs Cake\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tMrs Cake looked on to Twilight, saying nothing, her forlorn expression speaking in place of words, tears dropping down in place of tone.\n\t\n\tTwilight rifled through her own brain, searching for the perfect words to say \xe2\x80\x93 How do you avoid upsetting somepony in this situation?\n\t\n\tUnable to think, Twilight looked away from Mrs Cake, to Applejack, for support. Yet, even the dependable, honest pony Applejack was was unable to reassure Twilight; her eyes were glazed over, fazed out, staring at the floor. Raw, yet still tentatively.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI didn\xe2\x80\x99t realise Pinkie Pie felt this way\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight gulped, she knew what she was saying was probably incredibly clich\xc3\xa9, and far from eloquent. No thought was deemed too small, nor too pointless to tell her.\n\t\n\tHowever, despite Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s happiness that she could be there for Dash, and to listen to her, this was also, unfortunately one of the things that made Applejack begin to question the relationship between them.\n\t\n\tIt was the way Dash told her these things.
