She could hear Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s heavy breathing from beside her, no doubt caused by Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s words.\n\t\n\tTwilight sighed, unhappily. It may well have heightened the awkwardness of Sugarcube Corner\xe2\x80\x99s silence, but Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really fussed. Although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know the scientific basis behind it, she knew that a sigh could normally alleviate any of her grief.\n\t\n\tShe\xe2\x80\x99d hoped that this would\xe2\x80\x99ve been true in this situation too, but, her efforts seemed in vain.\n\t\n\tIn fact, to Twilight, it seemed that the thought of a sigh dealing with such important, sensitive things such as Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s disappearance made the bitter sinking sensation within her a thousand-fold worse.\n\t\n\tTwilight looked across to Mrs Cake, through her slowly clouding eyes, to meet with already cloud-burst ones. Even though the movement of eyes should only take a tiny amount of effort; to Twilight, if felt as if she\xe2\x80\x99d never performed a task more arduous: to meet Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s eye\xe2\x80\x99s in honesty.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cMrs Cake\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tMrs Cake looked on to Twilight, saying nothing, her forlorn expression speaking in place of words, tears dropping down in place of tone.\n\t\n\tTwilight rifled through her own brain, searching for the perfect words to say \xe2\x80\x93 How do you avoid upsetting somepony in this situation?\n\t\n\tUnable to think, Twilight looked away from Mrs Cake, to Applejack, for support. Yet, even the dependable, honest pony Applejack was was unable to reassure Twilight; her eyes were glazed over, fazed out, staring at the floor. Joining Applejack, regaining her gaze down at the floor, Twilight resigned herself to the fact that in the time she needed to, she\xe2\x80\x99d never be able to truly find words that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t hurt, and so, Twilight decided to speak her mind. Raw, yet still tentatively.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI didn\xe2\x80\x99t realise Pinkie Pie felt this way\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight gulped, she knew what she was saying was probably incredibly clich\xc3\xa9, and far from eloquent. Holding back tears, Twilight continued, \xe2\x80\x9cBut if she did, why didn\xe2\x80\x99t she say so?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tTwilight still looked to the floor, somewhat guiltily, away from Mrs Cake. Even so, she still heard her sigh, tinged with sadness, but overwhelmed with what sounded like disappointment\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cPinkie always told me you were the clever one, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tUpon mention of her name, Twilight looked back up, reflexively, towards Mrs Cake. She was no longer tear stricken, but her eyes were dulled, her snout pulled back, ever so slightly, in a look of disappointment. Perhaps even anger.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cHowever, I\xe2\x80\x99m beginning to seriously doubt what she said.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tTwilight answered in silence, fearing that what she\xe2\x80\x99d said had worsened the situation.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIf you really were smart, Twilight, you\xe2\x80\x99d have noticed that Pinkie Pie really hasn\xe2\x80\x99t been that \xe2\x80\x98Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99 for a long while now\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tUnable to find speech once again, Twilight was relieved to be rescued by a choice few words of Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s southern drawl, even if they did sound slightly wavering.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cBut Mrs Cake, Pinkie was happy. Wasn\xe2\x80\x99t she?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tOnce again, Mrs Cake sighed, remorsefully.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s just it, isn\xe2\x80\x99t it?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tTwilight and Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s confused expressions must have made their thoughts clear to Cup Cake, as she continued on, explaining further.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTo you, and everypony around her, Pinkie Pie was the \xe2\x80\x98happy pony,\xe2\x80\x99 wasn\xe2\x80\x99t she? This was good, for Pinkie. She could spend her days spreading the happiness she loved to surround herself, and then when she had an \xe2\x80\x98off\xe2\x80\x99 day, she felt no guilt in taking time away, to rest. She felt no guilt in being unhappy, when she had to be.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tMrs Cake looked on, seemingly nostalgic, to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s perceptions, towards the window, into the distance.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cHowever, after the Summer Sun Celebration, after she gained the element of Laughter, after she met you, Twilight, she started feeling guilt.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s stomach sank, further than it\xe2\x80\x99d already sunk, with the horrible realisation of what was going to come next.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAfter she had her element bestowed to her, spreading laugher and happiness were no longer just an enjoyment. To Pinkie, she felt that it was her duty to do so. This was fine, for a time, but then I realised that she was having less and less unhappy days. To begin with, I thought this was good, I thought she was just becoming an even happier pony than she already was. It was when the off days became so scarce that they petered away into nothing; that I started to worry.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tMrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s nostalgic look had left her face, once again to be replaced by the grief stricken look she\xe2\x80\x99d worn earlier, tears once more tumbling to the ground, sobs beginning to punctuate her speech.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhen I confronted her, Pinkie said that I should stop being so silly. She shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t question what her element bestowed upon her. If she could\xe2\x80\x99ve done, Twilight would\xe2\x80\x99ve said so. After all, Twilight was not only one of the smartest ponies in Ponyville, but one of her very best friends\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tAlthough it may not have been so, but to Twilight, it seemed as though within her upset, Mrs Cake had delivered the last few words with venom.\n\t\n\tEven if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to say her words like that, they still took their toll on Twilight, seeping deep into her, as she realised how devastating her negligence had been to Pinkie.\n\t\n\tShe\xe2\x80\x99d been suffering, yet she was too worried to tell anypony.\n\t\n\tAfter all, Pinkie Pie, the party loving pink pony, the spirit of the element of laughter, wanted anything but to bring about unhappiness\xe2\x80\xa6\n\t\n\tAll Twilight would\xe2\x80\x99ve had to do was say a few words, and then Pinkie Pie would never have gone\xe2\x80\xa6\n\t\n\tGulping down, forgetting the delicacy of the situation and remembering the urgency, Twilight began to speak quickly, her organisational skills coming into play.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cMrs Cake, we need to find Pinkie Pie. Before she does anything\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight paused for a moment, searching for the right word. \xe2\x80\x9cSilly\xe2\x80\xa6 Where would she go when she was feeling \xe2\x80\x98off?\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tMrs Cake sighed, again.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, if you really were Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s friend, you\xe2\x80\x99d-\xe2\x80\x9c\n\t\n\tTwilight butted in, still headstrong from her sense of urgency.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIf you really want to, we can discuss to what lengths my friendship with Pinkie extends to, but right now, if you really cared, you\xe2\x80\x99d help me find her.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tTwilight looked dead into Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, unwavering.\n\t\n\tFor the first time in a while, Sugarcube Corner felt a bit happier, warmed by the faintest of smiles. Even if Cup Cake was still looking down to the floor, tears still seeping out, it was still there.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cOn the days when Pinkie wasn\xe2\x80\x99t feeling so \xe2\x80\x98Pinkie,\xe2\x80\x99 she used to climb the mountain trail above Ponyville.\xe2\x80\x9d Cup Cake\xe2\x80\x99s smile tinged with sadness again, \xe2\x80\x9cIf she hasn\xe2\x80\x99t left completely, she\xe2\x80\x99ll be there, I\xe2\x80\x99m sure of it.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tTwilight began to pour concentration into her horn, focusing on Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s supposed location, yet she still had concentration for a few choice words.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cThank you.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAll I did was tell you where she was, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tTwilight shook her head, smiling happily.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cNo, thank you for believing in the magic of friendship again\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tJust before Twilight blinked away, she caught the glimpse of one of the happiest, teary eyed faces she\xe2\x80\x99d ever seen\xe2\x80\xa6\n\t\n\t*****\n\t\n\tApplejack jumped, gasping suddenly.\n\t\n\tEven though she\xe2\x80\x99d gotten mostly used to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s magic, whenever she disappeared like that, well, it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem natural.\n\t\n\tApplejack turned away from Mrs Cake, slowly trotting towards the door, but feeling guilt with every hoofstep. How could they just not notice Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s unhappiness?\n\t\n\tAs she reached the doorway, Applejack faltered, hoof waiting in the air to push at the door. As much as she wanted to just leave the resonating tension of Sugarcube Corner, she knew that she ought to say something before she did so, just to try and patch things up.\n\t\n\tLooking over her shoulder, glancing towards Mrs Cake, Applejack spoke, huskily, tentatively.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cMrs Cake, we\xe2\x80\x99ll find Pinkie Pie.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tApplejack tried desperately to convey her voice in its normal, reassuring affirmative manner, but it just wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t come through. In the end, she settled once again for tentative huskiness.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re her friends, after all.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tNot wanting to let the melancholy linger, and wanting to leave on an optimistic note, Applejack finally outstretched her forehoof, nudging the door forward, emptying her lungs of the bitterly sickly sweet air, and breathing deeply, replacing it with the cold fresh air of outside.\n\t\n\tAs the door behind her slammed shut, sending a light breeze through Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s Stetson topped mane, she began to slowly trot, absentmindedly, deep within thought, in no particular direction.\n\t\n\tHowever, Applejack knew she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going anywhere in particular; it was a conscious decision to just wander around, as what was a pony supposed to do on receiving such news?\n\t\n\tApplejack\xe2\x80\x99s mouth moved to form an \xe2\x80\x98o,\xe2\x80\x99 as she realised what she had to do, and where she had to go. She had to let Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s other friends know what was happening.\n\t\n\tFluttershy and Rarity were away, far out of town, which left Applejack with one main choice. She had to go and see Rainbow Dash.\n\t\n\tRegaining control over her hooves\xe2\x80\x99 direction, Applejack pointed herself at the floating mass of clouds and rainbows at the edge of Ponyville, and trotted on.\n\t\n\tAbsentmindedly staring at Dash\xe2\x80\x99s cloud-house, trudging onwards, Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s mind became overcome with worry, not just as Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s words sank in, more and more so, but also over the prospect of meeting Dash. Not because of the relationship between them, Applejack wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a stupid pony, she knew there were more important things to confront than the growing distance between them, but even so, Applejack couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but let constant worries about what Dash was actually thinking about her.\n\t\n\tApplejack knew that Dash wasn\xe2\x80\x99t at all the most emotionally mature pony, and so, she knew that Dash would probably react somewhat badly to Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s letter. Load that on top of how Dash was reacting over the relationship between herself and Applejack, and well\xe2\x80\xa6\n\t\n\tIn truth, not even Applejack, the pony who was pretty much closest to Dash, the pony who\xe2\x80\x99d stayed up on stormy nights, listening to Dash, listening to her every thought, could know how she would react.\n\t\n\tDespite her not knowing, Applejack liked that about their relationship, the idea that Dash didn\xe2\x80\x99t hide anything from her, she trusted in Applejack enough to confide in her all of her secrets, however, she still felt the need to tell Applejack all the little things too. The tiny, inconsequential things that amount to nothing. No thought was deemed too small, nor too pointless to tell her.\n\t\n\tHowever, despite Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s happiness that she could be there for Dash, and to listen to her, this was also, unfortunately one of the things that made Applejack begin to question the relationship between them.\n\t\n\tIt was the way Dash told her these things. Always in secret, during nights, reminiscent of their first night spent together.\n\t\n\tWhy couldn\xe2\x80\x99t they meet during the day? What was wrong with meeting how ponies in a relationship normally would?\n\t\n\tBut, the meeting places weren\xe2\x80\x99t the only problem for Applejack.\n\t\n\tThe way these thoughts were told to her; they felt cold.\n\t\n\tCold, passed on thoughtlessly, dumped onto Applejack. Not once had Dash ever asked if Applejack was okay, or if there was anything she wanted to talk about.\n\t\n\tSure, Applejack knew Dash was loyal. She was the most loyal pony Applejack had ever known. She would always come to see Applejack, if she called for her, without hesitation, and despite Dash\xe2\x80\x99s lack of asking after Applejack, would always tell her that she loved her.\n\t\n\tUntil now, that was true.\n\t\n\tNow, Applejack felt Dash\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty wavering, unhinging with her far from mature emotions.\n\t\n\tApplejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t doubt Dash\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty one bit, however.\n\t\n\tShe just suspected that Dash\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty was beginning to shift to somepony else.\n\t\n\tAs Applejack reached the base of Dash\xe2\x80\x99s cloud-house, she scuffed the ground with her hooves, kicking up dust, trying to delay what she knew was going to be a difficult conversation.\n\t\n\tShe would\xe2\x80\x99ve liked to think otherwise, but with the element of honesty within her, Applejack found it hard to even lie to herself.\n\t\n\tWith her still wavering southern accent, Applejack began to call out\xe2\x80\xa6\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cDash, I need to talk to you.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tAs much as she\xe2\x80\x99d been building it up to look bad, Applejack was still very much looking forward to speaking with Dash.\n\t\n\tSounding more eager than stern, Applejack yelled, loudly.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cDash, haul yer flank out here RIGHT NOW!\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\t\n\t*****\n\t\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash smiled, sadly.\n\t\n\tShe knew Applejack was going to turn up at her house, sooner rather than later, but even so; she still couldn\xe2\x80\x99t think of anything that she could say which would help her out of her predicament.\n\t\n\tShe had contemplated flying off. To fly off and not talk to Applejack at all.\n\t\n\tBut Rainbow Dash wasn\xe2\x80\x99t that stupid. She may have been stupid enough to drop herself into the mess she\xe2\x80\x99d gotten herself into, but she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t about to abandon all of her friends over something like this.\n\t\n\tShe was the spirit of the element of loyalty, after all.\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash trotted towards her door, and, in the presence of Applejack, the only pony who could really make her feel uneasy; sheepishly poked her head out, nervously grinning.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash sighed; she could see the look on Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s face, her serious, determined look, and with that, she knew that it was pointless to resist Applejack. Of course, that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop Rainbow Dash from trying.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI said git down here now, Dash.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash still stayed behind her door, head poking out.\n\t\n\tHowever, instead of dancing about the issue, she decided to come out and just be truthful; she felt as if too many lies had passed between the two of them.\n\t\n\tWell, Rainbow Dash wanted to think that they were between the two of them, but really, they were just her own lies.\n\t\n\tShe spoke, subdued.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\xa6 Don\xe2\x80\x99t know if I\xe2\x80\x99m quite ready for this talk yet, Applejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tAs embarrassed as Rainbow Dash was about actually admitting such a thing, she still looked down to Applejack, continuing to meet her gaze. It was as if they were together on one of their nights; she just didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind Applejack being there, and knowing more than Rainbow Dash might ever let on to just anypony.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cQuite rightly, Sugarcube, I don\xe2\x80\x99t think I\xe2\x80\x99m all that ready for \xe2\x80\x98that\xe2\x80\x99 talk mahself, either\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s voice was no longer as harsh. It\xe2\x80\x99d calmed, somewhat, softened. This was the voice that Rainbow Dash was used to, on cold, dark nights. This was the voice that Rainbow Dash especially loved. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I\xe2\x80\x99m not here for \xe2\x80\x98that\xe2\x80\x99 talk.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash arched an eyebrow, questioning.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAh need to talk to you about something else, Dash.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash was still somewhat confused, what could Applejack want to talk about that was more important than their relations?\n\t\n\tEven without her somewhat egotistical tendencies, Rainbow Dash struggled to see what could possibly need to be more imminently addressed than that.\n\t\n\tHowever, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t complain; it gave her more time to think of what she could actually say to Applejack that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t ruin everything.\n\t\n\tYet, the fact that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know what to say wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the only reason that Rainbow Dash was stalling. It was also that she\xe2\x80\x99d never really stopped to think about what she was going to say before.\n\t\n\tYet now? It seemed like she was doing so all the time; especially with Applejack.\n\t\n\tSlowly, spreading her wings, Rainbow Dash descended from her cloud-house, not flying down, but floating down.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash touched down in front of Applejack, face to face, trying to still seem confident by still meeting her eyes.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cAh ain\xe2\x80\x99t gonna beat around the bush, Dash. This is something you need to know, sooner rather than later.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tEven though Rainbow Dash knew that they weren\xe2\x80\x99t talking about the relationship between the two of them, she still couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but let her mind run away, applying everything Applejack was saying to the two of them, regardless.\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash heard Applejack inhale, loudly, and then begin to speak, in a pained, upset tone.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s Pinkie Pie; she\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tApplejack silenced for a moment, her look turning thoughtful.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGone.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash blinked, confused.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGone?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tFor what felt like the thousandth time in the day, Rainbow Dash didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually know what to say.\n\t\n\tPinkie Pie, gone? Why would she leave? Why would she leave without saying goodbye?\n\t\n\tWas she not important enough to Pinkie Pie to at least tell her she was going?\n\t\n\tPerhaps she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t gone, Rainbow Dash supposed, but she\xe2\x80\x99d merely gone away, for a day or two. That was what she wanted to believe. However, from the look she\xe2\x80\x99d got from Applejack; the concerned, serious, matter-of-fact look, Rainbow Dash was sure that that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the case.\n\t\n\tStill, that didn\xe2\x80\x99t stop Rainbow Dash from hoping. Hoping that Pinkie Pie had, in fact, gone away, on an unplanned holiday, just for fun; anything but just \xe2\x80\x98gone.\xe2\x80\x99\n\t\n\tAfter all, Pinkie Pie did unplanned things like that, didn\xe2\x80\x99t she?\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGone where?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tAgain, Rainbow Dash heard Applejack sigh, unhappily, whilst scuffing her hooves against the ground, looking down.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWe don\xe2\x80\x99t really know, for sure.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash felt her insides turn over, her worst fears seemingly confirmed.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s gone to look for her, where Mrs Cake thought she could be.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash suddenly felt a tiny bit better, her ears pricking up at Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s words of possible redemption.\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash began to speak quickly, suddenly eager.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhere? Where did Twilight go?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\t\n\t*****\n\t\n\t\n\tApplejack turned around, looking towards the mountain beyond Ponyville, away from Dash.\n\t\n\tShe wanted to draw out this moment, even if it was just for a few seconds more, because, Applejack knew, as soon as she told Dash where Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s supposed location was, she\xe2\x80\x99d be gone.\n\t\n\tApplejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t blame her for this; she knew that Dash was loyal, and that even the few seconds Applejack was keeping her from Pinkie were probably tearing her apart.\n\t\n\tEven so, Applejack still wanted Dash close to her; after all, she was hurting too.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s gone to the mountain trail, the one above Ponyville.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tPretty much as soon as the final word had left Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s tongue; she heard the predictable sound of wings flapping, frantically, quickly, and then, as Dash shot past her, she felt wind shoot along with her, washing through her hair. Her Stetson trembled in the wind, unsteady.\n\t\n\tShe couldn\xe2\x80\x99t fault Dash for having wings, after all, without them; she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be the Dash that Applejack knew.\n\t\n\tSometimes, she just wished Dash would slow down a bit, to wait. Perhaps even to think.\n\t\n\tApplejack sighed, sadly. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t normally mind being left behind by her friends; she was proud to be an earth pony.\n\t\n\tBut right now, there was nothing more that Applejack wanted then to be up to speed, with them.\n\t\n\tAs the final gust formed by Dash\xe2\x80\x99s flight whipped past Applejack, it loosened the Stetson\xe2\x80\x99s trembling perch, stealing it away, flying gracefully in the wind, sweeping down to the ground.\n\t\n\tFalling.\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t', 9, 2302, '<html>\n\t<head>\n\t\t<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/></head>\n\t</head>\n\t<body>\n\t\t<h1><a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/story/15/with-a-heavy-heart">With a Heavy Heart</a></h1>\n\t\t<h2>by <a href="http://www.fimfiction.net/user/Krypqe">Krypqe</a></h2>\n\n\t\t<hr />\n\n\t\t<a name=\'9\'></a><h3>The Ocean Between You and Me</h3>\n<br /><p class="indented"><i></p><p class="indented">\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re wasting my time, Pinkie.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">A lot of ponies tell me this.</p><p class="indented double">I don\xe2\x80\x99t think they mean for it to be as mean as it comes across, but the feelings are still there.</p><p class="indented double">For a time, I just endured this. Somehow, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t hurt much when said by ponies I didn\xe2\x80\x99t really know.</p><p class="indented double">Then, my friends started saying it.</p><p class="indented double">It hurt.</p><p class="indented double">Did they not trust me? Did they not believe in me?</p><p class="indented double">Did they not love me for who I am?</p><p class="indented double">If I stopped acting as I did, I\xe2\x80\x99d no longer be Pinkie Pie. I\xe2\x80\x99d no longer be the pony you continue to hurt for being who she is.</p><p class="indented double">Do you know what\xe2\x80\x99s worst about it?</p><p class="indented double">My friends; Rarity, Fluttershy, Rainbow Dash, Applejack, Twilight Sparkle, they haven\xe2\x80\x99t even noticed that they\xe2\x80\x99re hurting me.</p><p class="indented double">Is it because my feelings are so unimportant to them?</p><p class="indented double">I thought they might\xe2\x80\x99ve noticed, and tried to help, but seemingly, the magic of friendship isn\xe2\x80\x99t really as strong as it once appeared to be.</p><p class="indented double">Mrs Cake Cup Cake, don\xe2\x80\x99t for a second believe that this is your fault, because, if you do, you couldn\xe2\x80\x99t be further from the truth.</p><p class="indented double">Your company has been the best thing that\xe2\x80\x99s ever happened to me, and you\xe2\x80\x99re the reason I\xe2\x80\x99ve been here as long as I have.</p><p class="indented double">Without you, I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have lasted as long as I\xe2\x80\x99ve done so.</p><p class="indented double">But, despite that, this is goodbye.</p><p class="indented double">Even though I always feel your love, it\xe2\x80\x99s no longer enough to counter a life in a town that seems to think my time is worth nothing.</p><p class="indented double">If I\xe2\x80\x99m gone, then I\xe2\x80\x99ll no longer be able to waste everypony\xe2\x80\x99s time.</p><p class="indented double">Don\xe2\x80\x99t bother to tell my friends the others about this.</p><p class="indented double">I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t want to waste their time.</p><p class="indented double">-Pinkie</i></p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented double">*****</p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented">Twilight stared at the letter for what could\xe2\x80\x99ve been hours. However, she\xe2\x80\x99d not read a word on the letter for ages, she was staring into it, past the words, to try and find what Pinkie really meant\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="indented double">Twilight knew Pinkie, she was her friend. Surely the Pinkie she knew wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have done\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98that\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="indented double">But Twilight began to wonder, staring into the paper, whether the Pinkie Pie she\xe2\x80\x99d known was Pinkie Pie at all\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="indented double">It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t just the not knowing that Pinkie had been hurting that upset Twilight, it was the fact that she had been hurting because of her friends, and they hadn\xe2\x80\x99t even noticed.</p><p class="indented double">That, and the friendliest pony she\xe2\x80\x99d ever met; Pinkie Pie, was telling her that \xe2\x80\x98the magic of friendship wasn\xe2\x80\x99t as strong as it once appeared to be.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="indented double">Finally, Twilight looked up, from the crumpled, tear smeared words she\xe2\x80\x99d been reading, and upon doing so, realised that she was no longer standing firm like she\xe2\x80\x99d been when she began reading, but collapsed on the floor, curled up in front of Mrs Cake. She could hear Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s heavy breathing from beside her, no doubt caused by Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s words.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight sighed, unhappily. It may well have heightened the awkwardness of Sugarcube Corner\xe2\x80\x99s silence, but Twilight wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really fussed. Although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know the scientific basis behind it, she knew that a sigh could normally alleviate any of her grief.</p><p class="indented double">She\xe2\x80\x99d hoped that this would\xe2\x80\x99ve been true in this situation too, but, her efforts seemed in vain.</p><p class="indented double">In fact, to Twilight, it seemed that the thought of a sigh dealing with such important, sensitive things such as Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s disappearance made the bitter sinking sensation within her a thousand-fold worse.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight looked across to Mrs Cake, through her slowly clouding eyes, to meet with already cloud-burst ones. Even though the movement of eyes should only take a tiny amount of effort; to Twilight, if felt as if she\xe2\x80\x99d never performed a task more arduous: to meet Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s eye\xe2\x80\x99s in honesty.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cMrs Cake\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Mrs Cake looked on to Twilight, saying nothing, her forlorn expression speaking in place of words, tears dropping down in place of tone.</p><p class="indented double">Twilight rifled through her own brain, searching for the perfect words to say \xe2\x80\x93 How do you avoid upsetting somepony in this situation?</p><p class="indented double">Unable to think, Twilight looked away from Mrs Cake, to Applejack, for support. Yet, even the dependable, honest pony Applejack was was unable to reassure Twilight; her eyes were glazed over, fazed out, staring at the floor. Joining Applejack, regaining her gaze down at the floor, Twilight resigned herself to the fact that in the time she needed to, she\xe2\x80\x99d never be able to truly find words that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t hurt, and so, Twilight decided to speak her mind. Raw, yet still tentatively.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI didn\xe2\x80\x99t realise Pinkie Pie felt this way\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight gulped, she knew what she was saying was probably incredibly clich\xc3\xa9, and far from eloquent. Holding back tears, Twilight continued, \xe2\x80\x9cBut if she did, why didn\xe2\x80\x99t she say so?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight still looked to the floor, somewhat guiltily, away from Mrs Cake. Even so, she still heard her sigh, tinged with sadness, but overwhelmed with what sounded like disappointment</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cPinkie always told me you were the clever one, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Upon mention of her name, Twilight looked back up, reflexively, towards Mrs Cake. She was no longer tear stricken, but her eyes were dulled, her snout pulled back, ever so slightly, in a look of disappointment. Perhaps even anger.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cHowever, I\xe2\x80\x99m beginning to seriously doubt what she said.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight answered in silence, fearing that what she\xe2\x80\x99d said had worsened the situation.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIf you really were smart, Twilight, you\xe2\x80\x99d have noticed that Pinkie Pie really hasn\xe2\x80\x99t been that \xe2\x80\x98Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99 for a long while now\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Unable to find speech once again, Twilight was relieved to be rescued by a choice few words of Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s southern drawl, even if they did sound slightly wavering.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cBut Mrs Cake, Pinkie was happy. Wasn\xe2\x80\x99t she?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Once again, Mrs Cake sighed, remorsefully.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s just it, isn\xe2\x80\x99t it?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight and Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s confused expressions must have made their thoughts clear to Cup Cake, as she continued on, explaining further.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cTo you, and everypony around her, Pinkie Pie was the \xe2\x80\x98happy pony,\xe2\x80\x99 wasn\xe2\x80\x99t she? This was good, for Pinkie. She could spend her days spreading the happiness she loved to surround herself, and then when she had an \xe2\x80\x98off\xe2\x80\x99 day, she felt no guilt in taking time away, to rest. She felt no guilt in being unhappy, when she had to be.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Mrs Cake looked on, seemingly nostalgic, to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s perceptions, towards the window, into the distance.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cHowever, after the Summer Sun Celebration, after she gained the element of Laughter, after she met you, Twilight, she started feeling guilt.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s stomach sank, further than it\xe2\x80\x99d already sunk, with the horrible realisation of what was going to come next.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAfter she had her element bestowed to her, spreading laugher and happiness were no longer just an enjoyment. To Pinkie, she felt that it was her duty to do so. This was fine, for a time, but then I realised that she was having less and less unhappy days. To begin with, I thought this was good, I thought she was just becoming an even happier pony than she already was. It was when the off days became so scarce that they petered away into nothing; that I started to worry.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s nostalgic look had left her face, once again to be replaced by the grief stricken look she\xe2\x80\x99d worn earlier, tears once more tumbling to the ground, sobs beginning to punctuate her speech.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhen I confronted her, Pinkie said that I should stop being so silly. She shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t question what her element bestowed upon her. If she could\xe2\x80\x99ve done, Twilight would\xe2\x80\x99ve said so. After all, Twilight was not only one of the smartest ponies in Ponyville, but one of her very best friends\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Although it may not have been so, but to Twilight, it seemed as though within her upset, Mrs Cake had delivered the last few words with venom.</p><p class="indented double">Even if she didn\xe2\x80\x99t mean to say her words like that, they still took their toll on Twilight, seeping deep into her, as she realised how devastating her negligence had been to Pinkie.</p><p class="indented double">She\xe2\x80\x99d been suffering, yet she was too worried to tell anypony.</p><p class="indented double">After all, Pinkie Pie, the party loving pink pony, the spirit of the element of laughter, wanted anything but to bring about unhappiness\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="indented double">All Twilight would\xe2\x80\x99ve had to do was say a few words, and then Pinkie Pie would never have gone\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="indented double">Gulping down, forgetting the delicacy of the situation and remembering the urgency, Twilight began to speak quickly, her organisational skills coming into play.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cMrs Cake, we need to find Pinkie Pie. Before she does anything\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Twilight paused for a moment, searching for the right word. \xe2\x80\x9cSilly\xe2\x80\xa6 Where would she go when she was feeling \xe2\x80\x98off?\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Mrs Cake sighed, again.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight, if you really were Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s friend, you\xe2\x80\x99d-\xe2\x80\x9c</p><p class="indented double">Twilight butted in, still headstrong from her sense of urgency.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIf you really want to, we can discuss to what lengths my friendship with Pinkie extends to, but right now, if you really cared, you\xe2\x80\x99d help me find her.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight looked dead into Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s eyes, unwavering.</p><p class="indented double">For the first time in a while, Sugarcube Corner felt a bit happier, warmed by the faintest of smiles. Even if Cup Cake was still looking down to the floor, tears still seeping out, it was still there.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cOn the days when Pinkie wasn\xe2\x80\x99t feeling so \xe2\x80\x98Pinkie,\xe2\x80\x99 she used to climb the mountain trail above Ponyville.\xe2\x80\x9d Cup Cake\xe2\x80\x99s smile tinged with sadness again, \xe2\x80\x9cIf she hasn\xe2\x80\x99t left completely, she\xe2\x80\x99ll be there, I\xe2\x80\x99m sure of it.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight began to pour concentration into her horn, focusing on Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s supposed location, yet she still had concentration for a few choice words.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cThank you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAll I did was tell you where she was, Twilight Sparkle.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Twilight shook her head, smiling happily.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cNo, thank you for believing in the magic of friendship again\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Just before Twilight blinked away, she caught the glimpse of one of the happiest, teary eyed faces she\xe2\x80\x99d ever seen\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="indented double">*****</p><p class="indented double">Applejack jumped, gasping suddenly.</p><p class="indented double">Even though she\xe2\x80\x99d gotten mostly used to Twilight\xe2\x80\x99s magic, whenever she disappeared like that, well, it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem natural.</p><p class="indented double">Applejack turned away from Mrs Cake, slowly trotting towards the door, but feeling guilt with every hoofstep. How could they just not notice Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s unhappiness?</p><p class="indented double">As she reached the doorway, Applejack faltered, hoof waiting in the air to push at the door. As much as she wanted to just leave the resonating tension of Sugarcube Corner, she knew that she ought to say something before she did so, just to try and patch things up.</p><p class="indented double">Looking over her shoulder, glancing towards Mrs Cake, Applejack spoke, huskily, tentatively.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cMrs Cake, we\xe2\x80\x99ll find Pinkie Pie.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Applejack tried desperately to convey her voice in its normal, reassuring affirmative manner, but it just wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t come through. In the end, she settled once again for tentative huskiness.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re her friends, after all.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Not wanting to let the melancholy linger, and wanting to leave on an optimistic note, Applejack finally outstretched her forehoof, nudging the door forward, emptying her lungs of the bitterly sickly sweet air, and breathing deeply, replacing it with the cold fresh air of outside.</p><p class="indented double">As the door behind her slammed shut, sending a light breeze through Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s Stetson topped mane, she began to slowly trot, absentmindedly, deep within thought, in no particular direction.</p><p class="indented double">However, Applejack knew she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t going anywhere in particular; it was a conscious decision to just wander around, as what was a pony supposed to do on receiving such news?</p><p class="indented double">Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s mouth moved to form an \xe2\x80\x98o,\xe2\x80\x99 as she realised what she had to do, and where she had to go. She had to let Pinkie Pie\xe2\x80\x99s other friends know what was happening.</p><p class="indented double">Fluttershy and Rarity were away, far out of town, which left Applejack with one main choice. She had to go and see Rainbow Dash.</p><p class="indented double">Regaining control over her hooves\xe2\x80\x99 direction, Applejack pointed herself at the floating mass of clouds and rainbows at the edge of Ponyville, and trotted on.</p><p class="indented double">Absentmindedly staring at Dash\xe2\x80\x99s cloud-house, trudging onwards, Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s mind became overcome with worry, not just as Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s words sank in, more and more so, but also over the prospect of meeting Dash. Not because of the relationship between them, Applejack wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a stupid pony, she knew there were more important things to confront than the growing distance between them, but even so, Applejack couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but let constant worries about what Dash was actually thinking about her.</p><p class="indented double">Applejack knew that Dash wasn\xe2\x80\x99t at all the most emotionally mature pony, and so, she knew that Dash would probably react somewhat badly to Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s letter. Load that on top of how Dash was reacting over the relationship between herself and Applejack, and well\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="indented double">In truth, not even Applejack, the pony who was pretty much closest to Dash, the pony who\xe2\x80\x99d stayed up on stormy nights, listening to Dash, listening to her every thought, could know how she would react.</p><p class="indented double">Despite her not knowing, Applejack liked that about their relationship, the idea that Dash didn\xe2\x80\x99t hide anything from her, she trusted in Applejack enough to confide in her all of her secrets, however, she still felt the need to tell Applejack all the little things too. The tiny, inconsequential things that amount to nothing. No thought was deemed too small, nor too pointless to tell her.</p><p class="indented double">However, despite Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s happiness that she could be there for Dash, and to listen to her, this was also, unfortunately one of the things that made Applejack begin to question the relationship between them.</p><p class="indented double">It was the way Dash told her these things. Always in secret, during nights, reminiscent of their first night spent together.</p><p class="indented double">Why couldn\xe2\x80\x99t they meet during the day? What was wrong with meeting how ponies in a relationship normally would?</p><p class="indented double">But, the meeting places weren\xe2\x80\x99t the only problem for Applejack.</p><p class="indented double">The way these thoughts were told to her; they felt cold.</p><p class="indented double">Cold, passed on thoughtlessly, dumped onto Applejack. Not once had Dash ever asked if Applejack was okay, or if there was anything she wanted to talk about.</p><p class="indented double">Sure, Applejack knew Dash was loyal. She was the most loyal pony Applejack had ever known. She would always come to see Applejack, if she called for her, without hesitation, and despite Dash\xe2\x80\x99s lack of asking after Applejack, would always tell her that she loved her.</p><p class="indented double">Until now, that was true.</p><p class="indented double">Now, Applejack felt Dash\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty wavering, unhinging with her far from mature emotions.</p><p class="indented double">Applejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t doubt Dash\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty one bit, however.</p><p class="indented double">She just suspected that Dash\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty was beginning to shift to somepony else.</p><p class="indented double">As Applejack reached the base of Dash\xe2\x80\x99s cloud-house, she scuffed the ground with her hooves, kicking up dust, trying to delay what she knew was going to be a difficult conversation.</p><p class="indented double">She would\xe2\x80\x99ve liked to think otherwise, but with the element of honesty within her, Applejack found it hard to even lie to herself.</p><p class="indented double">With her still wavering southern accent, Applejack began to call out\xe2\x80\xa6</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cDash, I need to talk to you.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">As much as she\xe2\x80\x99d been building it up to look bad, Applejack was still very much looking forward to speaking with Dash.</p><p class="indented double">Sounding more eager than stern, Applejack yelled, loudly.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cDash, haul yer flank out here RIGHT NOW!\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented">*****</p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented">Rainbow Dash smiled, sadly.</p><p class="indented double">She knew Applejack was going to turn up at her house, sooner rather than later, but even so; she still couldn\xe2\x80\x99t think of anything that she could say which would help her out of her predicament.</p><p class="indented double">She had contemplated flying off. To fly off and not talk to Applejack at all.</p><p class="indented double">But Rainbow Dash wasn\xe2\x80\x99t that stupid. She may have been stupid enough to drop herself into the mess she\xe2\x80\x99d gotten herself into, but she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t about to abandon all of her friends over something like this.</p><p class="indented double">She was the spirit of the element of loyalty, after all.</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash trotted towards her door, and, in the presence of Applejack, the only pony who could really make her feel uneasy; sheepishly poked her head out, nervously grinning.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cHey, Applejack.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash sighed; she could see the look on Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s face, her serious, determined look, and with that, she knew that it was pointless to resist Applejack. Of course, that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop Rainbow Dash from trying.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI said git down here now, Dash.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash still stayed behind her door, head poking out.</p><p class="indented double">However, instead of dancing about the issue, she decided to come out and just be truthful; she felt as if too many lies had passed between the two of them.</p><p class="indented double">Well, Rainbow Dash wanted to think that they were between the two of them, but really, they were just her own lies.</p><p class="indented double">She spoke, subdued.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\xa6 Don\xe2\x80\x99t know if I\xe2\x80\x99m quite ready for this talk yet, Applejack\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">As embarrassed as Rainbow Dash was about actually admitting such a thing, she still looked down to Applejack, continuing to meet her gaze. It was as if they were together on one of their nights; she just didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind Applejack being there, and knowing more than Rainbow Dash might ever let on to just anypony.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cQuite rightly, Sugarcube, I don\xe2\x80\x99t think I\xe2\x80\x99m all that ready for \xe2\x80\x98that\xe2\x80\x99 talk mahself, either\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s voice was no longer as harsh. It\xe2\x80\x99d calmed, somewhat, softened. This was the voice that Rainbow Dash was used to, on cold, dark nights. This was the voice that Rainbow Dash especially loved. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I\xe2\x80\x99m not here for \xe2\x80\x98that\xe2\x80\x99 talk.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash arched an eyebrow, questioning.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh need to talk to you about something else, Dash.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash was still somewhat confused, what could Applejack want to talk about that was more important than their relations?</p><p class="indented double">Even without her somewhat egotistical tendencies, Rainbow Dash struggled to see what could possibly need to be more imminently addressed than that.</p><p class="indented double">However, she didn\xe2\x80\x99t complain; it gave her more time to think of what she could actually say to Applejack that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t ruin everything.</p><p class="indented double">Yet, the fact that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know what to say wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the only reason that Rainbow Dash was stalling. It was also that she\xe2\x80\x99d never really stopped to think about what she was going to say before.</p><p class="indented double">Yet now? It seemed like she was doing so all the time; especially with Applejack.</p><p class="indented double">Slowly, spreading her wings, Rainbow Dash descended from her cloud-house, not flying down, but floating down.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash touched down in front of Applejack, face to face, trying to still seem confident by still meeting her eyes.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cAh ain\xe2\x80\x99t gonna beat around the bush, Dash. This is something you need to know, sooner rather than later.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Even though Rainbow Dash knew that they weren\xe2\x80\x99t talking about the relationship between the two of them, she still couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but let her mind run away, applying everything Applejack was saying to the two of them, regardless.</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash heard Applejack inhale, loudly, and then begin to speak, in a pained, upset tone.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s Pinkie Pie; she\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Applejack silenced for a moment, her look turning thoughtful.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cGone.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash blinked, confused.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cGone?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">For what felt like the thousandth time in the day, Rainbow Dash didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually know what to say.</p><p class="indented double">Pinkie Pie, gone? Why would she leave? Why would she leave without saying goodbye?</p><p class="indented double">Was she not important enough to Pinkie Pie to at least tell her she was going?</p><p class="indented double">Perhaps she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t gone, Rainbow Dash supposed, but she\xe2\x80\x99d merely gone away, for a day or two. That was what she wanted to believe. However, from the look she\xe2\x80\x99d got from Applejack; the concerned, serious, matter-of-fact look, Rainbow Dash was sure that that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the case.</p><p class="indented double">Still, that didn\xe2\x80\x99t stop Rainbow Dash from hoping. Hoping that Pinkie Pie had, in fact, gone away, on an unplanned holiday, just for fun; anything but just \xe2\x80\x98gone.\xe2\x80\x99</p><p class="indented double">After all, Pinkie Pie did unplanned things like that, didn\xe2\x80\x99t she?</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cGone where?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Again, Rainbow Dash heard Applejack sigh, unhappily, whilst scuffing her hooves against the ground, looking down.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWe don\xe2\x80\x99t really know, for sure.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash felt her insides turn over, her worst fears seemingly confirmed.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s gone to look for her, where Mrs Cake thought she could be.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash suddenly felt a tiny bit better, her ears pricking up at Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s words of possible redemption.</p><p class="indented double">Rainbow Dash began to speak quickly, suddenly eager.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cWhere? Where did Twilight go?\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented">*****</p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented">Applejack turned around, looking towards the mountain beyond Ponyville, away from Dash.</p><p class="indented double">She wanted to draw out this moment, even if it was just for a few seconds more, because, Applejack knew, as soon as she told Dash where Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s supposed location was, she\xe2\x80\x99d be gone.</p><p class="indented double">Applejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t blame her for this; she knew that Dash was loyal, and that even the few seconds Applejack was keeping her from Pinkie were probably tearing her apart.</p><p class="indented double">Even so, Applejack still wanted Dash close to her; after all, she was hurting too.</p><p class="indented double">\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s gone to the mountain trail, the one above Ponyville.\xe2\x80\x9d</p><p class="indented double">Pretty much as soon as the final word had left Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s tongue; she heard the predictable sound of wings flapping, frantically, quickly, and then, as Dash shot past her, she felt wind shoot along with her, washing through her hair. Her Stetson trembled in the wind, unsteady.</p><p class="indented double">She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t fault Dash for having wings, after all, without them; she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be the Dash that Applejack knew.</p><p class="indented double">Sometimes, she just wished Dash would slow down a bit, to wait. Perhaps even to think.</p><p class="indented double">Applejack sighed, sadly. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t normally mind being left behind by her friends; she was proud to be an earth pony.</p><p class="indented double">But right now, there was nothing more that Applejack wanted then to be up to speed, with them.</p><p class="indented double">As the final gust formed by Dash\xe2\x80\x99s flight whipped past Applejack, it loosened the Stetson\xe2\x80\x99s trembling perch, stealing it away, flying gracefully in the wind, sweeping down to the ground.</p><p class="indented double">Falling.</p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented double"></p><p class="indented double"></b></u></i></span></center></blockquote></p>\t</body>\n</html>', 1, 15], 'parent_story_id': 15, 'txt': '//------------------------------//\n// The Ocean Between You and Me// Story: With a Heavy Heart// by Krypqe//------------------------------//\n\n\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cYou\xe2\x80\x99re wasting my time, Pinkie.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tA lot of ponies tell me this.\n\t\n\tI don\xe2\x80\x99t think they mean for it to be as mean as it comes across, but the feelings are still there.\n\t\n\tFor a time, I just endured this. Somehow, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t hurt much when said by ponies I didn\xe2\x80\x99t really know.\n\t\n\tThen, my friends started saying it.\n\t\n\tIt hurt.\n\t\n\tDid they not trust me? Did they not believe in me?\n\t\n\tDid they not love me for who I am?\n\t\n\tIf I stopped acting as I did, I\xe2\x80\x99d no longer be Pinkie Pie. I\xe2\x80\x99d no longer be the pony you continue to hurt for being who she is.\n\t\n\tDo you know what\xe2\x80\x99s worst about it?\n\t\n\tMy friends; Rarity, Fluttershy, Rainbow Dash, Applejack, Twilight Sparkle, they haven\xe2\x80\x99t even noticed that they\xe2\x80\x99re hurting me.\n\t\n\tIs it because my feelings are so unimportant to them?\n\t\n\tI thought they might\xe2\x80\x99ve noticed, and tried to help, but seemingly, the magic of friendship isn\xe2\x80\x99t really as strong as it once appeared to be.\n\t\n\tMrs Cake Cup Cake, don\xe2\x80\x99t for a second believe that this is your fault, because, if you do, you couldn\xe2\x80\x99t be further from the truth.\n\t\n\tYour company has been the best thing that\xe2\x80\x99s ever happened to me, and you\xe2\x80\x99re the reason I\xe2\x80\x99ve been here as long as I have.\n\t\n\tWithout you, I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have lasted as long as I\xe2\x80\x99ve done so.\n\t\n\tBut, despite that, this is goodbye.\n\t\n\tEven though I always feel your love, it\xe2\x80\x99s no longer enough to counter a life in a town that seems to think my time is worth nothing.\n\t\n\tIf I\xe2\x80\x99m gone, then I\xe2\x80\x99ll no longer be able to waste everypony\xe2\x80\x99s time.\n\t\n\tDon\xe2\x80\x99t bother to tell my friends the others about this.\n\t\n\tI wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t want to waste their time.\n\t\n\t-Pinkie\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t*****\n\t\n\t\n\tTwilight stared at the letter for what could\xe2\x80\x99ve been hours. However, she\xe2\x80\x99d not read a word on the letter for ages, she was staring into it, past the words, to try and find what Pinkie really meant\xe2\x80\xa6\n\t\n\tTwilight knew Pinkie, she was her friend. Although she didn\xe2\x80\x99t know the scientific basis behind it, she knew that a sigh could normally alleviate any of her grief.\n\t\n\tShe\xe2\x80\x99d hoped that this would\xe2\x80\x99ve been true in this situation too, but, her efforts seemed in vain.\n\t\n\tIn fact, to Twilight, it seemed that the thought of a sigh dealing with such important, sensitive things such as Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s disappearance made the bitter sinking sensation within her a thousand-fold worse.\n\t\n\tTwilight looked across to Mrs Cake, through her slowly clouding eyes, to meet with already cloud-burst ones. Even though the movement of eyes should only take a tiny amount of effort; to Twilight, if felt as if she\xe2\x80\x99d never performed a task more arduous: to meet Mrs Cake\xe2\x80\x99s eye\xe2\x80\x99s in honesty.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cMrs Cake\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tMrs Cake looked on to Twilight, saying nothing, her forlorn expression speaking in place of words, tears dropping down in place of tone.\n\t\n\tTwilight rifled through her own brain, searching for the perfect words to say \xe2\x80\x93 How do you avoid upsetting somepony in this situation?\n\t\n\tUnable to think, Twilight looked away from Mrs Cake, to Applejack, for support. However, from the look she\xe2\x80\x99d got from Applejack; the concerned, serious, matter-of-fact look, Rainbow Dash was sure that that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the case.\n\t\n\tStill, that didn\xe2\x80\x99t stop Rainbow Dash from hoping. Hoping that Pinkie Pie had, in fact, gone away, on an unplanned holiday, just for fun; anything but just \xe2\x80\x98gone.\xe2\x80\x99\n\t\n\tAfter all, Pinkie Pie did unplanned things like that, didn\xe2\x80\x99t she?\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cGone where?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tAgain, Rainbow Dash heard Applejack sigh, unhappily, whilst scuffing her hooves against the ground, looking down.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWe don\xe2\x80\x99t really know, for sure.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash felt her insides turn over, her worst fears seemingly confirmed.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cTwilight\xe2\x80\x99s gone to look for her, where Mrs Cake thought she could be.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash suddenly felt a tiny bit better, her ears pricking up at Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s words of possible redemption.\n\t\n\tRainbow Dash began to speak quickly, suddenly eager.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cWhere? Where did Twilight go?\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\t\n\t*****\n\t\n\t\n\tApplejack turned around, looking towards the mountain beyond Ponyville, away from Dash.\n\t\n\tShe wanted to draw out this moment, even if it was just for a few seconds more, because, Applejack knew, as soon as she told Dash where Pinkie\xe2\x80\x99s supposed location was, she\xe2\x80\x99d be gone.\n\t\n\tApplejack didn\xe2\x80\x99t blame her for this; she knew that Dash was loyal, and that even the few seconds Applejack was keeping her from Pinkie were probably tearing her apart.\n\t\n\tEven so, Applejack still wanted Dash close to her; after all, she was hurting too.\n\t\n\t\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s gone to the mountain trail, the one above Ponyville.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\t\n\tPretty much as soon as the final word had left Applejack\xe2\x80\x99s tongue; she heard the predictable sound of wings flapping, frantically, quickly, and then, as Dash shot past her, she felt wind shoot along with her, washing through her hair. Her Stetson trembled in the wind, unsteady.\n\t\n\tShe couldn\xe2\x80\x99t fault Dash for having wings, after all, without them; she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be the Dash that Applejack knew.\n\t\n\tSometimes, she just wished Dash would slow down a bit, to wait. Perhaps even to think.\n\t\n\tApplejack sighed, sadly. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t normally mind being left behind by her friends; she was proud to be an earth pony.\n\t\n\tBut right now, there was nothing more that Applejack wanted then to be up to speed, with them.\n\t\n\tAs the final gust formed by Dash\xe2\x80\x99s flight whipped past Applejack, it loosened the Stetson\xe2\x80\x99s trembling perch, stealing it away, flying gracefully in the wind, sweeping down to the ground.\n\t\n\tFalling.\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t\n\t', 'epub': None}
